Reviews.Title: “Seven nights of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Candice W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental April 14th through the 21st. It by far exceeded my expectations. The doormen are wonderful, the desk staff is friendly enough but operate somewhat on "island time", housekeeping is perfect, and the outdoor and restaurant employees are great as well. There are a few touch ups that could have been made in our room, mainly in the restrooms, but they were spotlessly clean and as a person that has a phobia of hotel beds, I can honestly say I slept well every night. The beds were clean and extremely comfortable. We had a city view on the 8th floor and the view was lovely. I couldn't see spending so much more on an ocean view and I was pleasently surprised when I saw our small balcony (which everyone has) and the city view and beautiful hills in the background. The food is expensive but outstanding in taste and portion sizes. My favorite was Ciao, the beachside grill where you could sit, eat, and enjoy the ocean with your toes in the sand. Mi Casita is right across the street. It has authentic Puerto Rican food, but not huge portions. I would recommend turning right out of the hotel and walking about 5 minutes to Piu Bello, it has great food, low prices, and good portions. Also take advantage of the tour service at the hotel. We did the horse back ride, the tour of El Yunke (sp?), and a day of snorkeling. If you had to chose one I'd chose the snorkeling. It was AMAZING and only $99 a person and that includes a 9 hour day and a buffet lunch on the boat. Oh, and the jet ski rental is extremely fun as well. And lastly the chairs on the beach are padded and extremely comfortable, perfect for napping and tanning. There is so much more I could say but this hotel was wonderful. Just plan on spending money....it IS a vacation after all! :)

Reviews.Title: “first time to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Shelleyre
Reviews.Content: Quick arrval and departure to airport. Safe area. Good food & drinks. Room especially bathroom could use some sprucing up.

Reviews.Title: “Fhfoxcatcher”
Reviews.Author: foxcatcher
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel!! Wife and I had a tremendous vacation stay at this hotel. Service inside and outside -pool and ocean- were superb. Stay 4 days prior to a southern Caribbean cruise. Rooms were small BUT were clean and durable. Can not beat the beach scene! Look forward to returning to San Juan and the Intercontinental Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: AlyKat2011
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I did not have high hopes for our one night (pre-cruise) stay. I was more than pleasantly surprised with the entire experience...Check in was fast and cordial...upgraded to a beautiful ocean facing room w/king bed...Room was clean and more importantly QUIET...never heard a peep...Great dinner at the attached Ruth's Chris Steakhouse avoiding the hassle of leaving the premises..Next morning we had enough time before our cruise to stroll around the grounds, pool looked fabulous..wish we had a liitle extra time to take advantage of the swim up bar... easy and secure access to the beach as well...Did a quick check of the two other restaurants inside the hotel and they looked great as well...will definitely be planning a 3 night stay in the near future..such an easy trip from Boston via Jet Blue direct...

Reviews.Title: “Dated, unloved and painfully expensive”
Reviews.Author: SwissFella
Reviews.Content: I think many who stay here are determined to have a good time. That they will have, thanks to the charm and exuberance of the Puerto Ricans, the climate and the terrific tourism infrastructure: And in spite of this sad relic of a resort hotel. Really, the property looks sad and dated, and inside it gets better only if you pay well for the privilege or you are perceived as a VIP. The costs additional to the room price are outrageous: service is slow and not always friendly, although there is the odd spark of enthusiasm which shines through the dross. There must be better value on this beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: Tygargabo
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in 2 rooms on high floors overlooking the city. Watching the airplanes land was fun - could not hear the city noise once the door was closed. The elevators on the other hand kept my husband awake at night. Try to stay away from them. The rooms were clean, not large, but nice - beds were comfortable. The pool area was very nice and lush, and the beach/waves were fun for body surfing. Hotel restaurants were expensive (as you would expect), but as others mentioned, there are many options for other food very close by. This hotel was fine for the 2 nights we were there but not sure I could spend a week here.

Reviews.Title: “Always Great!”
Reviews.Author: Len H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times, great loactaion, we enjoy the Sushi Bar off the lobby and of course the pool. Great access to the beach, service is always good! We will Return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Choice!”
Reviews.Author: USRMOM123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. We arrived in the morning and requested an early check-in. Rather than put us in a noisy room next to the elevator, the hotel clerk had housekeeping clean a quiet end room that someone had just checked out of. The concierge, Nestor Colon, met with us several times and showed us menus of restaurants he thought we would enjoy. He even went as far as stopping by a new restaurant on his way home from work to pick up a menu that was not yet available online. He recommended four fabulous restaurants for dinner. The spa was gorgeous and we had wonderful massages. There was also a sauna and steam room that was complimentary. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Dated”
Reviews.Author: CaliforoniaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to begin. The hotel is waaaay past old and dated. IF the name InterContinental was not on the building, I don't think people would pay more then $70 to stay. Our room looked like the housekeeper took the day off. There was hair in the ice bucket, toe nails on the carpet, stained mirror, not enough towels, the bed made some very loud noises just when sitting, debris in the pool and hot tub. The air condition was so week I was sweating in the bed trying to fall asleep. The beach was OK at best, again no obvious work went into making the beach presentable. I'm not familiar with other options in the area but trust me don't stay here or you will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if on a budget...”
Reviews.Author: Kristin L
Reviews.Content: We just got back from The InterContinental San Juan Resort & Casino two days ago. We had a great time. The hotel is very beautiful and conveniently located as well. There are a few things to know though. First, the hotel is a little outdated. For example, the balconies looked really cheesy along with the logo. Also, if you do not pay for a room upgrade, you will get a balcony overlooking the top of the walkway which is not a pretty sight. I believe they call the non-upgraded room the "Garden View." Other than that, the hotel was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. When you check in, they will ask you to put a $500 deposit for incidentals on your credit card. If you are using a debit card, you won't see this money again for at least 3 days. Also, everything in the hotel is SOOOOO expensive. A bagel is like $6.00 so just be prepared. The pool in the hotel is open 24 hrs which is amazing. One night, we spent time outside by the pool with a bottle of Bacardi and were undisturbed by the staff. This is a great hotel for the price. If you have the money, I would recommend El San Juan which is gorgeous and right next door, however, if you want to save a little cash, it's easy just to walk next door. I would definitely stay there again if in Puerto Rico. Also, if you want to be in contact with a GREAT tour guide, this guy is AMAZING. He won't rip you off and is packed with knowledge. Seriously, I was a bit hesitant but he is the greatest. If you're interested, shoot me an email at kristin.lagg@gmail.com and I can put you in touch with him.

Reviews.Title: “Think 1970's luxury! But..... overall, decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkArtteacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at IC in San Juan last week. The location is bizarre- next to some rusty highrise apartments. The hotel staff was courteous enough. Food really overpriced- we ate at all restaurants except the Japanes and Ruths Criss...the Italian was excellent- if you eat indoors, wear a sweater- chilly AC. It rained a lot while we were there. We were told that the rainforest was saturated and it kept generating more rain for our area. Once you get over the location, and the view from the beach, it's not a bad stay. Next time, we will stay at the Courtyard down the street and rent a car. If you do stay here, definately take the catamaran excusion (99.00). TOtally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: dreimer043
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on points . The resort is beautiful and there are many stores and restaurants within walking distance so need to rent a car. The room however was dark and had a funny smell to it. We arrived after midnight and were happy to see they offer room service 24 hours a day.. great if you have a late flight like we did, and it was delicious too! The beach wasn't as nice as the stretch in front of Marriott Courtyard farther down the strip. They don't rake the beach and it was also a lot more crowded than farther down too. Get the rainbow ice from the man who sells them for 3.00 from his cart. It tasted so great on a very hot day!

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay with Highlights”
Reviews.Author: Worldsbig
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one week with my husband and two children. The room itself was nice. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was very small and very outdated. They are in need of major renovations here. The staff were helpful and nice. In particular, William and James (two men who worked as parking assistants) were wonderful. They were full of helpful knowledge and recommendations. The gym is rather packed with equipment, but it was above average. The hot tub was broken for four of the seven days that we were there. This was a bummer as we wanted to simply relax, but could not. The food was expensive, as others have noted. We walked across the street to Mi Casita for $5-$8 breakfast items several times. Yes, the extra charges (resort fees and parking fees) are pricey, but you will pay this at similar resorts on the island too. The beach was nice. The waves were strong and fun to body surf in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect San Juan Pit-Stop”
Reviews.Author: auroraof5
Reviews.Content: Our family of four took a cruise out of Puerto Rico, so we needed a hotel for a single evening. This property was booked on Hotwire and we received a fabulous deal on the room. It is perfectly located-about 15 minutes away from both the airport and the Port. The property is looking a bit dated, but was very clean. We found all the hotel staff to be exceptionally friendly and helpful. This was our second trip to Puerto Rico and in general, I find the price of food high relative to the quality and this hotel was no exception. There is a sushi restaurant on the property ( which we did not try) and Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. The hotel is right on the beach so you have your choice of poolside or ocean. I am not sure I would choose this property for a lengthy stay, but pre or post cruise or long weekend, it is a good choice. The hotel seemed to cater well to all age demographics.l

Reviews.Title: “Nice San Juan property, great for pre- or post-cruise (with caveats)”
Reviews.Author: WJR-041
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days and nights before our cruise in March. The exterior property (pools, bars and beach) were very nice and well maintained. Gym is good but crowded and restaurants are good quality but like everything in San Juan, priced above average. The concierge Nestor was a fountain of knowledge and the coffee house/bar of the main lobby made great lattes and croissants (but again, pricey). The drawback to this property is its age ... the rooms are a tad tired and elevator service is awfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “NICE, BUT NOT FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: sandtravel
Reviews.Content: Wanted a quick weekend getaway somewhere warm and relaxing. Spend 3 nights at this hotel, March 16 through the 19th. Lobby is pretty, grounds are very nice too. The beach is nice powder and the water was nicer than I had experienced in Jamaica in Montego Bay. Not as great as Grace Bay in Turks--but pretty turquoise. I chose this resort because it is literally 10 to 15 minutes from the airport. We ate at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse once (very pricey, but good. All the "well to do" locals were there on a Saturday night.) And ate at the Italian restaurant twice: was as good of Italian as I have had anywhere; but hardly anyone attended this restaurant. A shame really!!! I did not want to have to taxi anywhere; just wanted a nice pool, beach, and good food close by; Which we accomplished! But would not do for an entire week. Even my daughter said she would be very disappointed to come to this location for a whole week. Casino here is dead. Next door at the San Juan Hotel, it was jumping. Active bar and casino. I read the rooms are not nice there though. Our room was on the 4th floor-overlooking the pool area. I heard the "city side" rooms are noisy. It was clean, very nice beds!!! I was concerned about the amount of security hovering around the beach/pool area. Which leads me to believe they have to keep on top of the locals from intruding on the guests. Had a nasty front desk employee who first greeted us, but lead congierge was very nice. Servers in the restaurant were very good too.

Reviews.Title: “My choice for the area!”
Reviews.Author: DCF75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our second trip to Puerto Rico at the Intercontinental and I will be the first to say I had my doubts after having a great stay at the El San Juan previously! Now, our next trips to Puerto Rico in this area will definitely be booked at the Intercontinental! We got in to PR at 10am and though a room wasn't ready, we were able to check our bags and get our wristbands to use the facilities. The pool was pristine and beautiful, the beach was clean and not crowded, and we were immediately asked if we wanted towels or beach chairs? The hotel reception called our cell once the room was ready and because they pre-registered us, we just got our keycards and went right to the room to unpack. I'm not sure how we got so lucky, but we were given room 1508.... amazing! Oceanside beautiful view! From the valets to housekeeping, from the bartenders to the towel folks, all I said all week was how nice everyone was! I still love the El San Juan, but there was something about this hotel that just made me feel so relaxed, so comfortable, and luxurious. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet at Alfredo's and the drinks at the pool bar and Ciao on the beach. Word to the wise: drinks are dollars cheaper at Ciao than at the pool bar (something we didn't realize until our next to last day. I'm giving the Intercontinental excellents in all but sleep quality and that is ONLY because you have to like a soft bed. My husband doesn't so, to be fair, his opinion should count too. Now, we often read reviews but we don't always take them for what they really say. Sometimes we see bad reviews and don't understand how some of the things they say are even possible but we realize it is all about the author and what they expect and what their tastes are. Read unto this what you will, but I assure you, I expected less and got more, much more. Cannot wait to go back, so sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappoint,Ment”
Reviews.Author: lb121
Reviews.Content: I would suggest not staying here. Does not hold up to the reputation that the brand used to have. Good location, nice staff but everything else fails. There is no hot water just warm they told us to let the water run for 15 min and it will get hotter,seriously what a waste of water. We were hassled when we checked in with a voucher from Amex that our booking included blast they told us it didn't finally the manager agreed to honor the voucher. Almost everything abt the hotel is old and needs to be redone. When we made a comment to the staff they laughed. The beach is very nice and the pool too bad the mgt company does see the value in updating the property

Reviews.Title: “This InterContinental is not like the others.”
Reviews.Author: marcushall
Reviews.Content: At the InterContinental de la Ville in Rome, breakfast contained delicacies such as fine pastry and Scottish salmon. At the InterContinental Carlton Cannes, there was langoustine and oysters on the buffet. At the InterContinental Sydney, breakfast included Tasmanian salmon. At one of the InterContinental San Francisco hotels, I ate at a restaurant that (deservedly) earned a star in the Michelin Guide. At the InterContinental San Juan, an elderly woman told me that I shouldn't miss the Cream of Wheat. What a pity I did not take her advice. Another guest ordered food at the pool bar at the same time I did. When he took one bite, he paid and left without taking another. I ordered some mofongo that were tasty, local and good value for money. However, the other meals at this hotel were disappointing. As my wife, daughter and I checked out, one of the bellmen offered to load our luggage into our rental car so that we could drive to the airport. This was quite helpful. Once we arrived at the airport and returned the car, we discovered that the largest suitcase was not in the trunk. When we called the hotel, no one at the front desk knew where our large, red suitcase had gone. We had to prevail upon the rental car manager to take my wife back to the InterContinental to retrieve the suitcase, which was sitting in the lobby. Needless to say, this was quite unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach hotel if you need to be near San Juan”
Reviews.Author: kjgwspagirll11
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to San Juan over the past 15 years with my husband on business. This is the second time I have stayed at the Intercontinental. They have done a very good job over the past 5 years in making this a comfortable upscale hotel. We had rooms 612 and 614 which overlooked the pool and had ocean views. 614 has a king bed and pull out sofa. I really liked the layout of this room. Very comfortable bed. We did not use the pull out so I can speak to its comfort. The pool area was clean and nice as well. Beach chairs could have been more comfortable though. Go to the beach side bar for lunch or drinks even if you do not stay here. The lobby bar is nice as too. Breakfast came with our package and the staff always remembered what we had to drink the day before. They were very friendly and helpful. I would rate this hotel as a close second behind the El San Juan (main tower) although I have not stayed there since they changed the room decor and I am not sure that I will like the newer modern look. If you stay at the Intercontinental, go next door to the El San Juan lobby bar for a drink at the very least. It is a beautiful place to hang out. I am not sure if they still have entertainment Thursday-Saturday but if they do, go check that out too. You can walk up the beach to the Water hotel (to your left as you look at the water-tall white-lit up in blue lights at night) Have appetizers and drinks on the roof top restaurant. We like to walk over to the Ritz for lunch. Walk out on the beach and turn right. You have to turn right on the road where the beach ends then find the access path to the next beach about 3 buildings down on your left. When you reach the beach, you will see the Ritz on your right. If you are on a budget, there is a large grocery store within walking distance - 3 blocks? toward the highway away from the beach. This is a huge store and they sell alcohol, etc.. Ask for directions from the concierge. Puerto Rico has very good upscale restaurants. My favorite is Augusto. The salmon is amazing-my husband likes the steak. Pickayu at the Conrad is also excellent. You need to take a cab to these restaurants. I have heard from friends that Bottles is good as well but I believe that it is farther away. Take a cab to Old San Juan. Visit El Morro Castle, or just walk by to take a look at the kids flying kites on the super green lawn. Stay away from the la perla "slum" on the water between the fort and the castle. This is the most dangerous place in Puerto Rico! El Convento hotel, which was once a convent, is a great place to get a bite to eat or have a drink in the courtyard. Don't be fooled by the fact that it used to be run by nuns. It is now a luxury hotel. Thursday nights are really busy and fun although when we went by on Saturday evening, it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “All in All Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: RR2008
Reviews.Content: Visited the San Juan Intercontinental during March, 2012. Very nice ocean front hotel with lovely pool area with 2 bars (one with full kitchen). Pretty lobby with adjacent small casino. Having never been to San Juan I wasn't sure what to expect. I liked the hotel - very clean and well maintained. The lobby was spacious and decorated with good taste. The beds were very comfortable; room had a good bathroom, with a separate counter and seat for makeup or hair drying - a nice touch. Room had a coffee maker (always a plus). Our 12th floor room had a "city" view - overlooking the street and various commercial rooftops with a bridge in the distance. Not terrible, but try to get an ocean front room. The hotel staff was very courteous and eager to help. Beach and pool chairs were comfortable and ample; gym was well equipped; restaurants and bar drinks were a bit pricey but expected. We took the 75 cent bus to Old San Juan which took about 45 minutes; cab ride back was $20.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Oceanfront Location with Incredible Pool/Play Area”
Reviews.Author: EarlyBuyer
Reviews.Content: We found all of the employees we interacted with all to be most courteous and service oriented, starting at check-in and desk agent Jose. Many oceanfront hotels are placed on their site in a perpendicular orientation to the water (no doubt due to the value/availability of ocean fronting property). This is not the case with the Intercontinental which has a parallel orientation to the water giving many more rooms direct and panoramic ocean views, as well as the resort itself controlling more beach frontage. The Intercontinentalâ€™s beach was in my opinion the best maintained on the stretch. Food and beverage pricing was high (as others have mentioned): Tropical drinks ranged from $12.00 to $18.00, Nacho's were $14.00, etc. However beer was fairly priced considering the environment it was being served in, with pricing running from $4.00 to $6.00. There are numerous chain and non-chain restaurant choices located close off-property and across the street from the hotel for those travelers looking for other (and lower priced) options. We did enjoy the swim-up bar at the hotel and splurged on a couple rounds of $18.00 (HUGE) tropical drinks because the ambiance of the pool and bar area was so nice/relaxing. The hotel has a fantastically designed and maintained/landscaped pool area; among the best I've seen anywhere. We would definitely re-book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Swolfe48
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean view room and I think it made the trip. The view and breeze from our balcony were fantastic. It was awesome walking outside the hotel to free towels and beach chairs. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and the restaurants onsite and close-by were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View Rooms are totally worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: iheartipad2
Reviews.Content: I LOVED This hotel!! The rooms are kind of small for the price but the ocean view rooms really make up for it!! There is so much to do in the area too & the Concierges are very helpful in planning excursions for you!! 'El Yunque' was an absolute treat - though bring your hiking shoes!! Also, if you have the time - go to 'Culebra'. The sand is so white and the water is unbelievably blue!!! The hotel has some great amenities when you're not out exploring though. The swimming pool is very nice and is right next to the beach too. Great restaurants here too: the japanese steakhouse was quite a surprising delight!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: luvsgolf71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location and size. The ocean view rooms provide a panoramic ocean view. The swimming pool is large with several section, a swim up bar and waterfalls. Steps away is the beautiful beach. The beach is large and it is easy to walk a good distance. There is a bar and restaurant right on the beach. You can walk to shopping and restaurants. We recommend the El San Juan, right next door for night life and the casino at the Ritz. Sat night at EsJ had a live band and DJ. It was a hot spot for locals (all dressed up) and dancing. Very entertaining. We loved our trip to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Week Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: wcl91
Reviews.Content: I spent last week in San Juan at the Intercontinental. It couldn't have been better. The hotel was fantastic, we had an ocean view room that overlooked the water and the hotel grounds. Most of our time at the hotel was spent at the pool, complete with waterfall, hottub, umbrellas and plenty of chairs, or on the beach lounging in the sun. Make sure to eat at Ciao, one of the hotels restaurants-everything on the menu is good. The hotel itself was great. Clean, comfortable, and relaxing. Our group didn't have any problems with the staff. They were warm and friendly, always offering towels, lounge chairs, or something to drink. Even the security guard didn't seem to mind helping when we got locked out of our room late one morning. I didn't have problems with noisy neighbors but I can't add or subtract points for something that's out of the hotel's control. If you're looking for more than the beach Puerto Rico has plenty to offer. We spent our days exploring old San Juan, surfing on the west coast, hiking in El Yunque (the rainforest), relaxing on the beach, tasting the local cuisine and enjoying the nightlife. The hotel helped us book some of these outings including night kayaking in a bioluminescent bay. Get out there and see PR, you won't be disappointed. Great weather, great atmosphere, great time. I will definitely be returning to both Puerto Rico and the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property, HORRIBLE room.”
Reviews.Author: jabjcb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for one night after our cruise. We did get there earlier then the 4pm check in time. We checked in about 11am. We were told that our room was not ready and they would call my cell when it was. We went straight to the pool, had some lunch and drinks. At 3pm they called us to tell us our room was ready. When we got to our room at first all we saw was the view. We had a semi ocean view. Then we looked around the room and it was disgusting. There was blood, yes blood all over the bathroom floor. The curtains in the room were full of something not sure what. We did not touch them.... The floor had stains and yes I did not expect perfect however, i did not expect GROSS. The nightstands next to the bed still had food stuck on them. I did call the front desk and their answer was we do not have any where else to move you to seeing that you booked thru priceline. WHAT?? There is a however in here... the grounds of this hotel were very nice. The pool and hot tub open 24 hours was a plus. The restaurant on the lower level was excellent for breakfast in the morning. The bartenders at the Splash bar were extra nice. The bar/restaurant at the beach was really good as well. We did tour around the El San Juan hotel and this would be the place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: cort43202
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise for one night and it was ok for that purpose but I wouldn't stay here longer. We had a city view which was fine but the room was small and needed some maintenance and upkeep. The vanity in the bathroom had been broken and instead of replacing it, they had repaired it with a filler compound. The light in the bathroom was cracked, there were wall outlets under the desk that had the covers off. The best part of this resort is the pool and beach area. We ate in the bar for lunch while we waited for our room and I had the fried chicken strip and it was terrible. My wife had mofongo for the first time and she said it was ok but she'd never had it before. The hotel charges a resort fee. I think ours was $17. Work out room was nice, Two ellipticals, two bikes, and four treadmills in addition to weight machines and dumbells.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: omardlc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights one prior to our cruise and once more after our cruise. Hotel is old looks like they remodeled but still gives an old feel. On our last stay our bathroom towels had mold. The bathroom was rusty and bathroom door was patched up. Our hotel bedroom door had a huge gap at the bottom and being so close to the elevators we could hear everything in the hallway. I accidentally left my phone on the bed and right after checking out asked to go back in the room to retrieve it. It took a good 30 min to wait for security to escort me to room Only to find the phone gone. Security radio housekeeping and no one responded. Finally head housekeeper went for lady who had been in our room and recovered it. Avoid this hotel if you can. Too pricey and not that great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: LM77WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort in March of 2012. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area is awesome. The beach in front of the Intercontinental is the best in Isla Verde. My hotel room was on the 6th floor facing the pool and it was very nice - just what you'd expect of a high end hotel. My view was primarily of trees, however, you can see the ocean and beach off to the sides, in the distance. Unlike some of the other reviews, I didn't think the rooms looked dated, at all. They weren't modern/chic but they weren't trying to be. The balconies cannot accommodate a chair or table. The airplane noise, which I was concerned about when booking this hotel, was not an issue at all. The drinks at the bar were overpriced, weak and expensive. Our room came with the continental breakfast buffet which we found out later did not include the full buffet. There's no way to know what is and isn't included since there's only one buffet and no signage distinguishing the two options. Nor does the waitstaff explain this to you. As a result we ate things that were not in the continental breakfast buffet ($19 vs. $27 for the full buffet) and were charged extra when we received our (check out) bill. After much hassle and negotiation, they agreed to credit us. Since they charge you for the breakfast and then take it off the final bill (that they did explain to us), we didn't realize our mistake until we checked out - 4 days later. Another thing that bothered me is that they charge you a resort fee that doesn't include the beach umbrella rental ($10). It does, however, include the beach chaise lounges. That seemed unreasonable and petty. Armed with this knowledge, you should be well prepared at this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this property with Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: cricri7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline at least 6 months in advance. I was going on a cruise with a friend of mine (2 women in our 40's) and got a great rate through Priceline. Since I booked so many months in advance, I emailed the hotel a couple of days before leaving and got an email confirmation for our reservations. Guess what happened? We got to the hotel at 7 PM, after having flown all day since we are from Montreal, to have them tell us that they were bumping us to another hotel since they had no room for us! I almost flipped, maybe I should have, but they relocated us to a hotel called La Verdanza. We had no choice. I argued with them that we were women traveling on our own and would not go to a property that we had not researched beforehand. They tried to make it look like they were really working for us but I am pretty sure that the cards were dealt in advance. They were telling us that we were being reimbursed so we had nothing to argue about. I book with Priceline because I watch my budget when I travel but I don't mind splurging either. Getting reiumbursed was the least of my problems!! We ended up going to La Verdanza. We had a great meal at their wine and tapas restaurant but the room was another thing. My friend's room would not lock, it was not clean, the shower had mold and so on. We went back to the Intercontinental the next day since they were offering us breakfast and the use of their facilities. Are you guessing how it went down? We were being asked everywhere our room's number. I kept making the joke that we were homeless so they had to call and ask for permission. We were promised things that we had to argue for. I ended up crying with a spa employee since I was so tired from all the hassle! It bares down badly on the Intercontinental chain and Priceline even though Priceline had nothing to do with it. They had overbooked by 14 rooms and singled out Priceline clients even though I had reserved 6 months in advance. One staff member tried to tell me that I reserved too near my departure date. He looked incompetent when I told him that I had an email confirmation 3 days before my departure date!!! Priceline should drop this hotel from their roster and Intercontinental should give them hell for making them look so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: aks120LasVegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days and got upgraded to an King Club IC Pool Suite due to be a Gold Ambassador with Priority Club. The room was beautiful - and the bed was huge! The beach and pool area was brilliant - there was enough sun loungers in both areas without having to hunt one down. The pool was a little chilly but nice enough - with a pool bar too which was great. The best restaurant was Ciao Mediterranean - right on the beach and the best cocktails. Alfredo was a disappointment for dinner although the buffet breakfast was nice. The lounge bar was a bit dark but fine - although it took them 30 mins to bring out a plate of fries and they were cold! The manager dealt with the situation well though but at a hotel of this standing you would not expect that. My room came with Club Access - I paid extra for this and wish I hadn't. The evening reception was very poor - the nibbles were never out for the full 2 hours and the wine was not even opened - very DIY! Having stayed at other ICs where the evening reception could be enough for dinner, this was very lacking. I certainly would not pay the extra again for this upgrade. I would stay here agin for the location on the beach and the pool facilities, but I would not pay for the more expensive room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain!”
Reviews.Author: PadreGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in March Intercontinental San Juan and can't complain at all - we didn't have the best view (Laguna view - main attraction was a Church's Fried Chicken) - but then who stays in their room in PR?? We were just there to sleep. The staff was very friendly - I have never been asked if they could help so often. The bed was very comfortable - and we didn't hear any noise from the street or other rooms with the a/c on. The pool area and the beach were beautiful. There were lounge chairs available on the beach and lots of them in the pool area. The casino made excellent Pina Colada's (as long as you were playing) - They even have a rental car agency in the hotel - that was cheaper than the company we were planning to use out of the airport, saving us a 2 way cab ride (and fare) to the airport to rent a car for the one day we wanted it while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Shameful customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sofi T
Reviews.Content: My stay at the InterContinental San Juan will prevent me from ever staying in San Juan or at a InterContinental Hotel ever again! Rooms facing the street are loud and depressing. The constant noise of city traffic, car horns, police sirens, aircraft taking off from the airport, and even gun shots throught the paper thin walls will drive you nuts. Thursday-Sunday it goes all night long! The staff is under the impression that they are doing you the favor of serving you. Front desk personel need lessons in customer service. Their "Puerto Rican" attitudes are not what paying guest deserve. Even the managers will look down on you. Speaking spanish will help to get stuff done. Seems like the staff is a bit biased. I will never recommend this hotel chain because of the experience I went through this week.

Reviews.Title: “A wanderlusting trip in beautiful San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: MaraMichaelson
Reviews.Content: I had the most incredible trip at the Intercontinental. The staff are extremely friendly (make sure you say hello to Jose by the ocean/beach). The facilities are spotless. The view is priceless. Waking up every morning to the view of the ocean provides a sense of calm that you cannot find anywhere else. The view, coupled with the staff and the facilities makes for a phenomenal experience. My favorite part of the hotel are the outdoor facilities. The pool is stunning, there is a pool bar, and a restaurant right next to the pool. Then, the beach is right out from the pool. We would often start our days at the beach and then come back to the pool for some shade. The hotel itself is in close proximity to other hotels, restaurants, and the most popular tourist attractions in San Juan. This is the perfect hotel for fun, the beach, excellent facilitates and a reprieve from a busy schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: lsrice0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 5-10 min of the airport an easy taxi ride ($14) and is located on a beautiful beach. One side of the hotel rooms overlook the city and for an extra fee the others overlook the ocean-a beautiful view! The staff at the pool, bars, security, food service, audiovisual and housekeepers were exceptionally friendly and welcoming. Any time we called the front desk they responded to our needs very quickly and efficiently (TV problems, stuck safe, door key wouldn't work). I was there with a conference and the food they served for every meal was WONDERFUL! The pool complete with a swim up bar and waterfalls were surrounded by plenty of chairs, umbrellas and palm trees which made for a wonderful escape. I spent most of my free time on the beach and enjoyed the ability to be able to take long walks on it. I also used the exercise facility every day and it met my needs. I found the room to be comfortable and felt this was a great place to stay and relax!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, facilities, and beach”
Reviews.Author: Michael F
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is truly well run. The staff is friendly and welcoming, the pool relaxing and fun (with waterfalls, a tanning spot,, and pool bar - nothing better than cooling off inside a pool with a pina colada), and the beach is magnificent. Their is access to great food from Ciao (great lamb sandwich) to the poolside restaurant that has great local food. Even more, the room was really nice and the bed so comfortable. I just sank in. I truly recommend that you stay at this hotel. You will not find better service or value in town. They must have a great general manager.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CliveTMexico
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at a number of ICH properties around the world and in fact are at the Platinum level of the Ambassador point program for ICH. We found this hotel a bit dated and a little noisy in the rooms as you can hear the next door occupants snoring and talking. Being Ambassador members we were supposed to receive water and fruit awaiting our arrival but that did not happen. When we enquired we were told that it was not the Hotels policy for the first day,only on the second and thereafter as the "fruit may spoil and make someone sick". We pointed out to the front desk supervisor that the web site showed the policy as we had requested and showed her the copy of the web page but she didn't budge from her stand. If you are an Ambassador member you should be aware of this apparent "exception" to the Ambassador's policy at this Hotel. The pool area is very pleasant and the bar staff and concierge staff very helpful. I will not be returning to this Hotel in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle n' dimes - Hotwire'rers beware”
Reviews.Author: FlyinBee
Reviews.Content: Let me start this on a positive note: All the employees we were in contact with were corteous and serviceminded, the location fine - both considering proximity to the airport and also the beach. But these positive aspects were completely overshadowed by the feeling of being dooped: When booking through Hotwire one is informed about the facilities one might expect at a certain hotel, and it is then mighty surprising to be presented with an additional "resort fee" upon departure. So keep in mind when booking through Hotwire that you are paying for a room, nothing else, and the facilities they advertise are all extras. I paid 200 dollars per night for a double with a city view PLUS the 50 dollar resort fee per night. Sooo not worth it. And they were asking for 75 dollars extra to keep the room 3 hours longer - which is steep, but not unheard of, and which we paid - to freshen up before our cruise. But the truly annoying aspect was that the cheap people added a resort fee as well on top of the 75 dollars - even though we had retired from the pool by this point to use our room, as I said, to freshen up and relax. Never again... And the dust bunnies under the bed didn't help, either.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a litte work”
Reviews.Author: LocusPointBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights prior to a cruise. The rooms/baths need freshening but, overall the hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, smaller rooms”
Reviews.Author: G-Money-TX
Reviews.Content: Compared to other Intercontinentals, this one is older. The rooms are small. The One bedroom suite was a bit dark, and small. The bathrooms were small (although the fact that there were two of them made up for the size). The beach was good, but not great. The lobby was bland, and the food was average. There are other hotels very close on the same stretch of beach that have more fun lobby bars. We actually spent every night at the lobby bar and club next door

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel, but you'll pay A LOT for extras”
Reviews.Author: Mikonika
Reviews.Content: If you can manage to get a good room rate (under $150), this is a solid selection. The pool area is nice and the ambiance on the deck by the beach in the evening is fantastic. I have no major complaints other than the outrageous price for breakfast. The lack of an airportair shuttle was also annoying. For me the interesting area of San Juan is the old historic area and unfortunately this hotel is nowhere close but if you want the beach and have a car, this is a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: goof87
Reviews.Content: Stayed last night in San Juan at this property because room rate of 260 literally half of the Ritz where I usually stay. Overall very pleased and did not have any of the problems that previous reviewers noted. Check in was friendly and efficient. Room was typical size and set up of older hotels with smaller bathroom. Room not any smaller than Ritz room I had a few nights earlier. Room was clean and recently remodeled. Bed comfortable. TV was an old tube version as noted on some reviews. Pool area and beach grill very cool. Gives a great feel for the local beach with comfort of knowing you are getting fresh, quality food. Servers at pool were great. We were there on a Monday so pool not crowded, but I can see how chairs would get scarce on a weekend. Overall quite pleased and will be back if Ritz doesn't get more realistic with room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Resort”
Reviews.Author: Will S
Reviews.Content: I extended a business trip by staying here a couple of days. Location is excellent as there is a good beach but it's also close to downtown San Juan. The beach is crowded but I think that's to be expected in the location. The rooms were nice and the service was professional. The only real downside is the drink prices seemed outrageous, so I couldn't enjoy my drink overlooking the ocean. I enjoyed my stay but would not make a trip out of it.

Reviews.Title: “5 star staff, great rooms, outstanding food...”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: You expect the best from the Intercontinental brand and here you'll get it. Buffet restaurant (Alfredo's) is excellent. The pool is gorgeous and the staff there as well as beachside are friendly and attentive. I was at an event for Sales & Marketing Executives of Puerto Rico, so I also experienced the catering plus meeting rooms. Food quality was great. Rooms were well-lit, sound systems worked well and the views were spectacular, everywhere. I met Willie Chin, the hotel's Director of Sales & Marketing, at their Wednesday corporate cocktail hour and found out the busy property was running at 100% occupancy. So he obviously has a strong team in place, selling rooms and services. It is no surpise. MOST HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Fall in Love”
Reviews.Author: jujuscorner
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Juan-- probably our last. :( We prefer calm, quiet, beautiful island locations- San Juan seemed anything but. Weather was perfect, however! :) Seemed WAY crowded- building to building and people everywhere. Do have to allow room for the peak season, but the Intercontinental Beach was wall to wall with drunken people and cigarette butts everywhere. Not my idea of fun. Beach seemed stinky and dirty, water rough. Hotel rooms a bit dated, but acceptable. Beds were however, WONDERFUL!!! I was disappointed in this property because after staying at a once Scottsdale, AZ Intercontinental, I was expecting the best of the best-- not so here. Lobby however very nice, front desk staff very accommodating. Pool very family oriented for the most part, very nice waterfall/rock formations and beautiful landscaping. Food/drinks $$$$$! Spent $25 for 2 drinks while we waited for our rooms. Breakfast buffet $27-- YIKES! Now, we don't mind paying for a great breakfast, but this buffet wasn't worth it. E for effort, but hard, dry pancakes and nothing extra special. I love to visit hotels of all types- we walked next door to check out the ESJ Resort-- much more sophisticated/adult pool area if that is what you're looking for. The Intercontinental location is great- a few minutes from the airport, and a few minute walk to restaurants, and shops in neighboring hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to give it a better rating”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBender
Reviews.Content: So I admit that this review may be totally biased as I arrived post Midnight after working all day; however it was a mix of good and bad. No one offered to help w/our bags after the taxi dropped us off ( at that point we could have used it ) ; however we were upgraded to adjoining rooms w/Ocean View ( thank you ) I guess as I was there only one night my biggest disappointment was w/the room and breakfast. The rooms need to be updated and yes I should have pointed out certain things but was too tired. Now Breakfast was a whole different matter- I decided between this and The Ritz-Carlton for our one lay-over on to Vieques and in the end although the rooms were less, well, that did show, and the breakfast was 100$ for 4. Now yes, it was our first Breakfast but even w/guidance by our waiter it was really expensive. So not a 4 but a 3 for a one night experience

Reviews.Title: “Good Precruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sadiecruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights before getting on the Adventure of the Seas. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite. Very comfortable room but it was a bit noisy at night, our room faced the road. We had to have maintenance come up and work on our safe - they arrived very quickly and were very professional. The beach bar has a delicious pizza that they prepare right there. We were set up with two beach chairs and spent most of the day relaxing on the beach. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful get-a-way and resort”
Reviews.Author: ngamtn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Intercontinental last night. The hotel exceeded our expectations. It was much nicer than their website portrays. We had a mini-fridge in the room and a grocery store about 1/2 mile away that we could get some water, beer, snacks, etc. The restaurant "Ciao" on the beach was also great. The food at the hotel was overpriced, but that's the case anywhere you travel. Every staff member from housekeeping, to bell boys, to concierge, and front desk were very helpful and kind. Also, it was only a 3 mile taxi ride from the airport so it was incredibly convenient. The weather was perfect. I hope to come back...maybe even this weekend- ha!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely visit”
Reviews.Author: hopeFairhopeAL
Reviews.Content: We used a tip from a trip advisor review and requested a room above 8th or 9th floor with a view of the ocean. When we arrived we were given a 12th floor room and the view was just beautiful. It was our 5th or 6th stay in San Juan and this was the best view by far for the money. It was also the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in and we travel constantly around US and some to Europe. The pool area was superb in our opinion. Lots of different places to relax, lay out, read etc...if shade was your desire they had comfortable spots to stake out for the day and simply enjoy the beautiful weather and ocean. Another up side was that even though we've never paid that much for a room (about $477 including their resort tax and the $59 a day "service" fee.??...) it was about half of what the properly next door wanted (El San Juan where we have stayed in off season) and the room was almost as nice. Our only complaint was that every evening in the middle of the night a humming started, ran 15-20 seconds then stopped then started again. It was enough to wake you up each time it happened and it happened repeatedly throughout the nights. It was not noticeable during the day but we were out most of the day. It was secondary to the air conditioning hum which was soft and actually seemed to help to go to sleep. We mentioned it upon check out and were given a blank stare by the staff member who helped us. In all fairness we did not mention it during the stay until check out. One other item was that we suggest checking the bil as always when youstravel as the rate charged for our last day, which was a Monday was erroneously listed at the same rate as a week end rate. The check out desk fixed it right away. We particulary enjoyed Alfredo's and the young man who served us. Although the food could not come close to the New Orleans food we have every other week end, it was fine for island food. An excellent tip is on Fri and Sat evening about 8:30 a great event takes place next door at the El San Juan in the lobby...where a live salsa band cranks up and locals come to dance. There is no charge and no cover and it is really one of our favorite things to do there. We we came back to our hotel there was also similar music at the entrace of the casino but not nearly as lively as listening or watching the dancers next door. Only once when we stayed next door was there a spring break event where the hotel had music suitable for early 20's which to us was loud and "disturbed the peace" for us. They said it was a one time week end special for the spring breakers. Finally there is a Pueblo grocery 2 blocks away toward the airport area. We stop in there for our cheese, yogart, wine and incidentals for the room. Very easy.

Reviews.Title: “priceline 4 star, great deal”
Reviews.Author: chicritic
Reviews.Content: nice pools, beach, felt safe. close to airport, dining, short drive downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not Intercontinental-worthy”
Reviews.Author: rakhstar
Reviews.Content: Positives: Staff at Alfredo's restaurant, Tour Desk and at towel station/pool were attentive and friendly. Location was good- could even ride the bus into Old San Juan if desired. Pool and beach were well-kept and beautiful. Negatives: There would be 3-4 bellhops in front of the hotel chit chatting and most of the time did not greet us or open the doors for us. Upon arrival, our room had peanuts on the floor, a broken lamp, and a clogged bathtub. When we called management and spoke with Irene Perez (Manager of Guest Relations), she was rude, abrasive, and unfriendly. Television reception was horrible- at least half the channels came in fuzzy. Ms. Perez justified that this as an issue of being on an island, relying on reception from the main USA. However, all lobby tvs had clear and perfect reception. Alfredo's breakfasts are way overpriced- $60 for two for a buffet where bread is hard and flies are roaming around the fruit, cheese and cold cuts. The jacuzzi was out of service and when they fixed it on the third day of our stage, water was cold. All of these issues and we still had to pay $25 resort fee per day. Overall, not the experience we'd expect from a 4 or 5 star hotel. We will never return or recommend this property. It is by no means a "high end" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway, well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: NancyM311
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday, February 25, 2012. Stayed Mon - Fri. 6 minutes. From airport, $13 cab fare. From moment we stepped out of cab staff so helpful. Opened doors, offered room upgrades. Pool with swim up bar wonderful, pool/beach side cafe had decent menu, good food with minimal pool and beach side service. Lounge chairs somewhat hard to find, but not as bad as other places I've been. Umbrellas available for shade lovers, also can rent for beach and pool. Cabana rentals available as well. Besides cafe 3 other restaurants on site, only ate at 2, Japanese and steak house, both great, steak house not cheap but best meal EVER. Location is great, short Cab ride to Old San Juan, walk to supermarket and several Walgreens, and city strip. Many visible police do felt safe but still must be careful esp. At night. Walked to a few local places, Metropol restaurant ( local PR food), Lupis Mexican bar & grill, La Toquito (?) local street side bar, very local feel, fun and friendly. Would definitely return. Room nice, clean with city view. Had frigd so able to go to market and have stuff on hand. Direct beach access was wonderful with staff checking issued wrist bands for hotel guests. Myhusband and I went but very family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Qualis_Rex
Reviews.Content: San Juan is just an expensive place these days, so it's hard to find a bargain or real value for your money. My room wasn't cheap, but it was extremely comfortable (especially considering the one I had just been to). While some travelers may mistake the Puerto Rican attitude with being rude, I know this is not the case with the staff (they simply do not kowtow or grovel like you will find in other Latin American countries). They are slow, but it is a slow-moving society. And you may have to talk them through things they are not familiar with (like why parking charges should have been billed to a corporate account vs my private room etc). On the other hand, there was a potential safety issue that occured and the staff & security were on it and resolved it very quickly. The location is good as it is right on the beach, so all in all, a good resort setting within walkng distances to bars, beach, restaurants and walgreens if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ADMarshall
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister, brother-in-law and I stayed at the InterContinental in February of 2012. We booked this hotel through Hotwire and we only stayed for one night prior to our cruise. We took a cab from the airport and it was $11 for the four of us, plus $1 for each bag. When our cab pulled up the bell hops took our luggage and loaded it on a cart. I checked in and we went to our room and our luggage followed within minutes. The room was a nice size, had nice dÃ©cor, and a small balcony that looked out on the street below. We went down to the pool/beach area to look around. They guys ordered beers from the bar (around $6 each) and us girls had some bottled water ($3 each). We were hungry so we walked to Chiliâ€™s which was fairly close. After dinner we walked in the other direction so we could get some bottled water at Walgreenâ€™s. There were many eating and shopping places within walking distance of the hotel and the area felt very safe. The room had double beds, so it was not very comfortable for two adults in one double bed. It was a little too small. The bathroom was decent; the shower tub filled up quite quickly as you were showering, so they probably need to clean out the drain. The lighting in the bathroom/foyer area could have been better, too. My sister and I walked around the pool area the next morning to take some pictures and it was very nice. I wish we would have had time to swim because it looked really inviting! We also walked to the beach which seemed nice â€“ wide and clean. We walked to a nearby restaurant called Mi Casita for breakfast because we had read that the hotel breakfast was around $25 per person and we did not want to spend that much. After breakfast we checked out and took a cab to the cruise port which was $19 for the four of us, plus $1 for each bag. Overall it was a decent hotel and I would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff - Crappy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ely g
Reviews.Content: I disagree with posts that say the staff was rude. Everyone we met (other than management discussed below) were extremely nice. Bell men struck up pleasant conversations. Everyone says hello and asks how you are enjoying your stay. Room service is very acommodating. No issues there. But: 1. We had a suite. The bathroom was tiny. The shower was dingy with paint peeling off the ceiling. 2. We had electrical problems and the outlets in the desk or the desk lamp would not work. We had to call maintenance. 3. Old style tube TVs with bad reception. What kind of hotel doesn't have a flat screen these days? Even the ESJ Tower time share building down the block has them. 4. No mini bar and a fridge that I probably had in my college room 25 years ago. 5. I think, but I can't prove, that I got bites from bed bugs. 6. And this really offended me - my parents were staying in a hotel a few buildings down. I wanted them to come over to the pool area and watch our 3 kids so that I can take a swim or get 30 minutes of rest. Management told me I had to pay $80 a day for my parents to visit the pool areal. According to them, new management from an operating company in St. Marten now requires all guests to register for "liability purposes" (an explanation that makes no sense) and registration costs $80. Putting aside that hotels owe a greater duty of care to paying guests than people who wander on their property (which is why the explanation makes no sense) why do they need to charge me? The idea of having to pay to allow my parents into the pool area is insane! Look, I don't mind getting nickeled and dimed on vacation. I can overlook the $60 room "upgrade" charge, the $22 crappy wi-fi fee, the $20 bucks to rent an umbrella at the beach, per day, and the $10 bucks that you have to tip the umbrella digger guy, the $13 pina colada and the $5.00 cup of iced tea for the kids, and all the other charges but this is my line in the sand. I tried to speak with the manager but she was so obtuse that I just stopped in mid-sentence and walked away in disgust. 7. The Alfredo breakfast buffet - don't get me started. $30 bucks a person (plus or minus) for absolute crap. 2 years ago they had smoked salmon. Not nova or anything that one could get in NYC but passable. They got rid of it. Now it's eggs, pancakes and an assortment of lame cold cuts and cheese. . . . oh and some small pastries. Complete rip off. The PIU restaurant down the block has an awesome Puerto Rican breakfast. You get a good glimpse of the cockfighting rink across the street. 8. Beach was full of seaweed on Sunday and Monday. May have been because it was a federal holiday. I am told that they normally clean it up daily. 9. Don't believe the kids club hype - there isn't one. All kids activities like face painting and 3:00 p.m. movie time that existed 2 years ago are now gone. The kids club, a building called Planet Trekkers, is a small room with a WII, Playstation and some board games. The building is locked and you have to ask one of the bar guys to open it. Then you have to stay with your kids the entire time. That being said; 10. The bar area downstairs is great and they have an awesome $9.99 carib menu. Only draw back is that it took them about an hour to serve us but the manager voluntarily took 25% off the bill. 11. In the interest of objectivity, I am disclosing that I told the checkout guy how I felt. He have me 2 days of free internet. Big deal! 12. Kids loved pool area. Then again, kids love pool at Sesame Place too. 13. The staff (not management) were awesome. All in all, I don't think I'll ever go back there. In fact, if you have kids and love PR (which I actually do) renting a 2 bedroom for $1,300 a week is probably the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach front”
Reviews.Author: mean1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great property on the beach however the rooms need updating. the potential is there

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at this property.”
Reviews.Author: stmalcolm
Reviews.Content: We received this hotel on Priceline at Â£120 per night including taxes. Beware of additional resort tax, $17 (weekday) - $38 (weekend) - ouch ! $17 taxi fare from airport. We asked for a high room in advance, and was placed in a high room as we requested. Tried to blag a beach view, Priceline doesn't get you a beach view ! We were offered an upgrade ($40 per night) but I declined. Airport "Garden View" view is good, looks over a parking lot which is much nicer than looking into another hotel window ! Can see the planes coming into land, but no airport noise at all.We had a problem with the (free) in room safe. This was fixed with in 10 minutes by a senior security staff member, who didn't even wait for a tip. Excellent service. Staff are very friendly, helpful and polite. I suspect the value of your stay is determined by how much you pay for your room we paid arround $190, the room is quoted at $255. Decor is OK, TV is old style tube with poor reception on some channels, free tea/coffee in room, free empty fridge means you can go to Pueblo supermarket (next to Enbassy Suites) and get provisions is you like a simple sandwich lunch and real milk for your coffee. A/C is excellent in the room and hotel generally. Facilities (bar, food, wifi) are expensive. Pool area is attractive, landscaped and well laid out, free loungers and towels. Free heated hot tub. Pool bar food excellent, Alfredo Italian Alfredo is excellent but pricey (we paid $130 for a meal for two with wine) good shop, casino is small if you are into gambling (go next door to El San Juan Casino, which has Starbucks too). We use the hotel Avis,probably a bit more expensive that prebooking, but car i delivered to the hotel lobby. Beach outside hotel is clean and pleasant. Parking is $21.40 a night. Tip: you get 24 hours so leave on day one, park overnight and pay the fee; day two leave at 11am and pay the fee, park overnight and leave at 10am day three, and you get a free night with the receipt from day two because parking is for 24 hours. I am not sure if there is a good location to stay in San Juan, as the attractions are all out of the city. But I am sure that Carolina Beach is probably as good as any for food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: syonk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental President's weekend. It was very busy, but you never felt overwhelmed with crowds. We had an ocean view room (14th floor) which was updated with a great view. The hotel is older, but clean and well taken care of. The beach is nice, we walked it every day. The pool is cold, but both my teens swam daily. The gym is fine, I also ran outside, left out of the hotel and within 5 minutes you are on a nice trail that runs along the beach. Perfect. The hotel is in the city limits so you never get that fabulous resort feeling, as it is in a strip of hotels all close by with fast food and markets around. It certainly is easy to get to, a good location for day trips, and a nice spot for a quick get away. It is expensive to eat at the hotel, but we went to La Playita (great!), Los Platos (sweet mojito's), and an asian place that were all relatively inexpensive, within walking distance, and great atmospheres. The bar right on the beach is also very good with decent prices. Also, don't miss Marmalade or Dragonfly in Old San Jaun. Both are great dinner spots after a day exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - on the beach - pleasent staff”
Reviews.Author: dchemist
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Juan for a cruise which departed the next day. I chose the Intercontinental because of their first class reputation and the closeness to the airport and situation lying directly on the beach. It is consistently expensive but that is no surprise. Be aware that there will be a â€œresort fee (15%)â€� added to your bill as well as charges for internet access (Per device!!!). I knew of both beforehand. However staying here was an indulgence. The food was good. We lunch at the bar by the beach and buffet breakfast outside next to the pool â€“ both pleasant and worth the cost. Note that if you eat outdoors your food is fair game for the local birds who will help themselves given the opportunity. We did not dine at the attached Ruthâ€™s Chris Steakhouse or outside the hotel nearby. We noted during a walk that there are some local restaurants nearby and some looked like they might be worth a try â€“ next time. If you leave the hotel on foot and turn left at the street, go about 100 yds there is a Starbucks in the next hotel. Our room was opposite the ocean and the view was pedestrian. If you can upgrade to the ocean side it might be worth the extra cost. Our room was fine, clean and pleasantly decorated (as an Intercontinental should be). A few aspects were dated as others have noted (a tube TV for example) and the bathroom was not contemporary. Both are minor but then again you pay serious money. Check in was fine although the room was not ready. I try and patronize ICHotels (which includes Intercontinental and Holiday Inns, etc) and hold a Platinum level which is supposed to offer some benefits. I asked at check-in and got the â€œits not in the computerâ€� answer. I suspect this is crap as I checked the reservation online and made certain the reservation included the membership numberâ€¦ I donâ€™t know the answer here but I think it saves them from having to give you the benefits (which should include room upgrade if available. Nevertheless, in retrospect itâ€™s minor and I noted it in my hotel survey response. I found the staff to be excellent. Helpful when asked and always polite and welcoming. We did not have the service issues that some other reviews noted. I am not sure I would stay here again without first checking other nearby resorts. Being on the beach is quite nice but there are other choices. You might keep an eye on the property website as they are certain to modernize in order to stay competitive.

Reviews.Title: “not very helpful employees”
Reviews.Author: pattyg56_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice--but it very expensive. Not sure I woukd want to stay there again. I use priceline and could end up staying there again, but I would find cheaper places to eat in area and try not to ask employees any questions--they were not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: MassIS300
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the San Juan Intercontinental at the end of January for a week. This was our second time here. We booked on HotWire for 110/night and then upgraded to an ocean view when we checked in for an additional 40/night. I know that the book price at their website is closer to 300/night, which I wouldn't pay for this place. But for the total of 150/night for an ocean view, the value was excellent and I'd highly recommend it. Check-In was quick. However, we did check in fairly late in the evening on a Wednesday and on other days in the mid afternoon I saw lines (especially around the weekends). The room was tastefully decorated. Queen bed, pull out couch, refrigerator, flat screen tv, vanity area outside of the bathroom, for the ladies - a hair dryer in the bathroom, and a small balcony looking at the ocean. When we checked in, they did tell us that the ocean view rooms that we upgraded to were newer/better furnished than the "city view" rooms. Glad we upgraded though - the view is worth it. Air conditioner worked very well. There was a bit of a musty smell when the AC was turned down/off, but it's fairly typical of tropical hotels, and no more than we've experienced at other locations in the caribbean. The pool area is very beautiful, and the orchids hanging from the trees are amazing. The pool itself is unheated, and we saw no one swimming (with the exception of a few kids) the entire week we were there. This was a little bit of a disappointment (because the pool is huge with a waterfall and I would have liked to have gone in), BUT you're on the beach so it's hard to complain too much. The hot tub was great - very large and we often slipped down there at night for some relaxation and a cocktail. Pool and hot tub are open 24-hours. There is a towel stand as you walk out into the pool area, and they make you wear colored bands to show that you are a guest member. A mild inconvenience. Near the hotel itself under a deck overhang there was a ping pong table and a foosball table. The beach is the best part, although Isla Verde is on the northern shore and gets a lot of the direct weather and waves from the atlantic, making the swimming a little rougher than the south sides of the island. Chairs are provided free by the hotel, and a staff member is available to cart them out to you. Umbrellas were available as well, but had a fee that was to be charged to the room. We didn't need one so I didn't catch the cost. The beach is a great beach, and you can't go wrong with the Isla Verde area. When we walked up and down the beach you could find locals selling food or ice cream from carts - also very convenient. Ciao Mediterranean, their beach bar/restaurant, was nice. Prices were a little steep, but the food was actually okay. My wife loved their blue cheese burger, and their salads were excellent. Drinks pricey - $6 beers and $10 cocktails, but they can make a mean mojito that shouldn't be missed. Many restaurants and stores nearby. We frequently grabbed water, soda, beer and liquor and brought it back to our room instead of paying the resort prices all the time. For area restaurants, we tried Lupis (mexican - okay food, okay prices), Metropol (local casual cuisine - great food, great prices), Mi Casita (good breakfast, great prices), and Alfredos (in the hotel, great food, little pricey). Many more options in the area as well, including a starbucks in the neighboring El San Juan Hotel and a Bistro for EXCELLENT breakfast just down the road towards the Walgreens. The grocrey store across from the hotel was closed/vacant, so we did the majority of our shopping at Walgreens (carries everything, including food, beer, liquor and wine). The hotel's casino is small, but other than a couple of chances at slots, we weren't big casino people so it didn't bother us. We ate at the lobby bar one night to try out their special dinners for $10 each - not bad food. There is a Avis car rental in the hotel, and the lady (I forget her name) that worked there the entire week was super friendly. We rented a jeep for $70/day, but there were options for as low as $35. The valet service was also great - they were eager to help with anything from hailing a taxi to providing directions. A coffee shop was in the lobby as well, which we didn't notice until the 3rd day - which is too bad because they had great coffee and croissants (as well as several other breakfast options). All in all, it's a nice resort. Prices are very high, but if you blend them with local establishments and a few trips to the store for snacks and beer, it's not so bad. Some parts of the hotel are a little dated, but you could do worse. I'd definitely go back again if I was looking for a resort atmosphere in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: travel74Travel74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental at the beginning of December of 2011. It was our first vacation in over 3 years and chose this hotel because we had stayed at the intercontinental in the Papeete and had a fantastic time. However, this place is outdated, our first room had mold in the bathroom and the carpet was dirty. The bathroom looked like they had used a wet towel to clean the whole room and no cleaning detergent was used. They moved us to another room that was better but the carpet was still dirty. We were there for a total of 5 nights and on the last night we were awaken by the police arresting someone on our hallway. Obviously the hotel can't control people's behavior but there was blood all over the elevator and dripping down the balcony from the 15th floor the following morning when we were leaving. When we told the front desk person, she seemed uninterested. We will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: metalmomma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on one of the best beaches in the Carolina area of San Juan Puerto Rico. The hotel has gorgeous grounds, beach bar, lots of lounges with umbrellas surrounding a lagoon like pool with a little "island" and waterfall. It is not far from the airport and has a bus stop almost right in front that serves Old San Juan buses that are very inexpensive. Senior rate for a ride is only 35 Cents. Bus 53 takes you right to the bus station in the Old City. You can then take a free trolley from there to the many tourist stops in the Old City. There are a few local restaurants just a few blocks from the hotel. The food in the hotel is ridiculously expensive, so unless you wish to spend your vacation dollars there, take a little walk or go into Old San Juan where you can get some great cuisine for very little money. The rooms are nicely appointed, but the bathroom was pretty small and average for such an expensive place. Beds and linens are the typical Holiday Inn improved bedding--very comfortable and crisp, clean sheets. Ask for a room facing the pool and beach area. We were only at the hotel for one night prior to a southeastern Caribbean cruise. Unfortunately, the hotel is quite a distance from the port area, which is in Old San Juan, so you need to take a $25 dollar or more Taxi ride if you have any luggage, as the buses really are not equipped to handle luggage. Better to stay in Old San Juan if you are taking a cruise. The hotel has a large casino, but we did not gamble, so not sure just how large or nice it is. We ate at a little restaurant almost across from the hotel which was inexpensive and very good. Cannot remember the name, however. The hotel was a nice place to relax and enjoy the beach and pool area, however, even if for a short time. We had extended check-out, so had a bit of time to enjoy the place before our ride to the cruise ship in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: LaQuanda H
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel and the staff were really friendly. The beach and pool were nicely maintained, they also had a guy by the name of Jose that will get beach chairs and umbrellas for you. You can also lay on the beach and order drinks and food. The location is within walking distance of pharmacies, other restaurants, hotels, clubs, and party stores for necessities. The biggest drawback we noticed was that the food is over priced but there are some reasonably priced options within walking distance. Request an ocean front room if available they are the rooms with the better view and newer furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay after cruise”
Reviews.Author: Mbruce
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel are beautiful - lush, floral, wonderful pool. We loved the singing frogs at night. It is oceanfront with free beach chairs provided. The beach is very nice. My sister and I jumped waves as we did as teenagers. It was great fun. We are in our 60's now. Our rooms were spacious, beds comfortable, tiny balcony. There were several places to eat. It was possible to get a good meal for $10, shocking. It was surprising that the main hotel restaurant did not serve lunch. It had a breakfast buffet until 1, then dinner. We did not eat there. We ate at the two outdoor venues and had 2 meals at the indoor bars. The only negative was check-in. I asked the clerk if our rooms were beachfront. She said "yes." We had to come back later to get the keys when the rooms were ready. That was when we found out they were city view. When we confronted the clerk, she said that she did not say that. She might not have understood my question, but she did say yes. There was nothing we could do. We had no confirmation in writing that it was beachfront. We let it go and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: gentility
Reviews.Content: After reading the range of reviews of this hotel, my wife and I were somewhat concerned. We just returned from a 5 day/ night stay from 2/5-2/9. Overall,our stay was very pleasant-most of the staff seemed sincerely interested in providing a high level of friendly customer service-with afew exceptions. Our check-in took twenty minutes because the front desk clerk disappeared into the office for 15 minutes without an explanation either before or after. It took an hour for our luggage to be delivered to our room from downstairs and there was no safe in our room. The room also seemed dated and the bathtub grout was less than pristine. However, the pool was magnificent and the front door staff was genuine and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price we got”
Reviews.Author: dogcrazzie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here October of 2011 as we got a really good deal via Cheap Caribbean other wise we probably wouldn't have gone down.
