The hotel was an older property however they've done a really good job with the updates and maintenance. The pool was very fun and located right beside the beach which is my favorite set-up. The property has a very nice beach out front and the water was terrifically warm. The water was very rough a couple days which worked up a ton of seaweed so that wasn't real fun but we made do! They have a gentleman you can pay to put beach chairs out for you which was fantastic. We didn't eat at the property as their prices were beyond ridiculous. And if there was anything I would say bad about the whole area is the food!!! I generally can eat anything but I had some of the worst food I've ever had and it didn't matter where we ate with the exception of breakfast. We found a wonderful little diner down the road that did a good job. I'm sorry I guess I'm spoiled with the Mexican food we love from the Riveria Maya. We were within walking distance to a large grocery store, pharmacies, party stores etc. so was very nicely located. If we had to do over now that we've been there we would stay down near Old San Juan but for our first time this was a good selection. So over all a good property, not perfect but for the price we paid perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “unkept promises”
Reviews.Author: steven262783
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental because we could use our points however we needed an additional room as another couple joined our group. When we checked in the 3rd room was not ready and the front desk clerk Edgard was pushing for us to sign up with the Ambassador program stating that all extra fees and upgrades would be waved upon us signing up. That meant we would get $272 in upgrades for paying the $200 enrollment fee for the Ambassador program. We told Edgard that we would think about it and discuss it furthjer when we came back to get the card for the 3rd room. 2 hours later we came back and it still wasn't ready so they offered us a room on the 15th floor rather than on the 9th floor with the rest of the group. We took the room and also told Edgard we would sign up for the Ambassador program and reiterated again the original offer. We completed the transaction and thge next morning I had my statement showing the upgrade charges and the Ambassador fee, I was assured it would all be corrected. Not true as 5 weeks later 5 calls I have made to the front desk Managers have not been returned and even e mails to Intercontinental's corporate site have not resloved the issues. They refunded 1 of the upgrade fees and then another $50 after my e mail for corporate office but no phone calls explaining why they won't refund the other $136. Very disappointing as the hotel is a great vaction choice but this leaves a very bad taste and should be a warning to everyone that goes there that they do not honour their promises.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Trotter333
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Excellent pool area and beach. Staff very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill...”
Reviews.Author: ladylaw7
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico is one of my favorite destinations when looking for some beautiful beaches and surf. I stayed for the first time at the Intercontinental in 2010. The beach is very well kept and the porters are there to bring your beach chairs wherever you would like. It was expensive, yes they charge $20 a DAY for internet service, $8 for a bottle of water, and the breakfast buffet cost you $50 at minimum per day (for breakfast!). Given the fact that I loved the beach, and the convenience of being able to walk to the Starbucks next door at the ESJ and down to Pueblo for some room snacks, water, etc., I thought that I was making the best out of it. At the end of this trip, my boyfriend and I purchased their Ambassador Club membership. We were told this includes a free night stay, a free room upgrade and complimnetary water and fruit daily in your room, to use at each participating hotel. We ended up spending more than we hoped with the nickel and dime approach (coffee in the hotel bar was $5 a cup after tip). We did go back last year, 2011 and will NOT GO BACK AGAIN. First, they refused to honor our free night certificate, saying that we didnt book thru the proper office. I spoke to the Ambassador Club rep for booking directly for this reason and was told what I had to do to retrieve the certificate. They would not honor it. They also would not upgrade our room, nor compensate us for the difference. The front desk staff are rude and will make you wait while they ingnore you and continue typing or speaking to another rep. We left the front desk after feeling defeated and went to our room. This started the trip off on a bad footing. We then proceeded to continue to spend $50+ a day for breakfast (you dont have a choice, there isnt another breakfast place). My boyfriend had the full buffett which was about $28ish, while my appetite choose the continental breakfast which was a choice of 3-4 pastries and oatmeal for a whopping $18ish. We continued to head over to Pueblo every couple of days to buy a case of bottled water and snacks for the beach. After this trip, we will NOT go back again. I do love Puerto Rico, and this year, I will be looking into a private rental!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for leisurely breakfast near pool”
Reviews.Author: CC L
Reviews.Content: Our flight was significantly delayed so we took a short cab ride here to while away the time and enjoyed a good breakfast on the patio near the pool. The staff were pleasant and the pool area was nice, it was not crowded and the property was very clean. We walked next door to the San Juan resort and, by comparison, it was very dark (although the lobby area is attractive) and staff were less friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but a bit elderly”
Reviews.Author: mssrfoie
Reviews.Content: The property shows it's age. The rooms are neat and clean and show signs of age. The view to the ocean is striking. The neighborhood could be better. If you are happy with the price and you're not looking for a *** or **** hotel, this hotel may work for you. Ruth's Chris Steakhouse restaurant is on property.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Cellii
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at the end of Jan. and we were very happy with the hotel. The beds were heavenly - best hotel sleep we have ever had! Service was top notch. We spent every day at the beach lounging on the free beach chairs. One day we bought an umbrella for $10.00 but if you pull your chair up to the shade of the trees by the beach bar, that works just as well. The beach bar food is fantastic and so is the food from Room Service. (Yes, pricey but easily shared by two!) We didn't eat at the main hotel restaurants but did notice they had Early Bird Specials at pretty reasonable prices. For breakfast, we ordered a la carte and didn't have the big buffet. The Continental Breakfast was also a mini buffet with cereal, yogurt, bagels, sweet rolls, fresh fruit and more. We did go across the street to Mi Casa for one breakfast, like some folks recommended. We weren't impressed. We took the local bus into San Juan ( instead of the $21.00 taxi ride) and it took about 1/2 hour and cost 75 cents; plenty of seats in the morning. My only suggestions to the hotel for improvement: the pool is too cold, the jacuzzi is not hot enough, and the music at the pool is too loud. One last note for those thinking of going to the Intercontinental: If you are a bit overweight and worried about wearing a swimsuit, no worries here - so if everyone else!

Reviews.Title: “$ for EACH DEVICE on internet”
Reviews.Author: knicksmets
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel right on the beach. The pool is especially nice as is the hot tub. The beach restaurant is convinient and the gym is decent which faces the ocean. The location is close to the airport but far from old san juan. For the price, this hotel is a good option. No major flaws except for one. Internet. Not only is it 20 dollars per day for internet, but it's 20 dollars PER DEVICE for the internet. So if you want your phone and ipad both to have internet access it will cost you $40 per day. Why not do your customers a favor and just include internet in the price of the room? If it weren't for this problem we could consider coming back to this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fees, fees, fees”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaToronto
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely resort... But hang onto your wallet. Fees for just about everything. From the $8 bottle of water left in the room for our "convenience," to the $10 sheepishly requested to rent what looked like a Walmart beach umbrella, to the ridiculously overpriced Internet service ($16.95 for 'basic' and 19.95 for 'premium' high speed) ... I felt not like a guest but a walking ATM machine. If I were paying full price like most guests... And not the bargoon Hotwire blind rate... I would have been outraged. The beach is lovely though, the rooms comfortable and the staff were terrific. I didn't like Isla Verde much however. It's one huge ugly strip lined with tacky fast food joints and half empty, 60s era shopping plazas. Recommended restaurants nearby: Mi Casita across the street for breakfast and lunch. Metropole (about 100 yards to the left of the hotel exit) for fantastic and reasonably priced Cuban/Puerto Rican food. Both are local favorites. Bottom line: if you are going to San Juan, have to be on the beach and can get a good deal on this hotel... It's a good place to stay. Next time though I'll stay in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Rum, mafongo & ocean breeze”
Reviews.Author: maggie106
Reviews.Content: Frozen rum drinks are only $8, delicious mafongo lunch special only $9.95. Excellent coffee, and concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Overall experience of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jane05661
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 day vacation at the InterContinental San Juan Resort. I would strongly recommend this hotel to others. The staff is friendly and helpful and if you have any questions go to the hotel concierge Nestor he is the greatest and very helpful. If you are going to Old San Juan take the bus not a taxi it is only .75 cents on the bus one way and 20.00 dollars one way with a taxi. Do not take a tour to the Bacardi Rum Factor very pricey I believe around 63.00 per person. You can go by yourself take a bus for .75 cents and the ferry over to the factory is .50 cents and the taxi to the factory is 3.00 dollars a person one way. I would also recommend going to Walgreens which is about 1/4 of a mile left of the hotel to save big bucks. The food and drinks are very expensive in the Hotel. $8.00 dollars for a beer and $12.00 for a mixed drink. You can save alot by going down the street. Also there is a Pueblo Market close by also. The Bio Bay was fantastic I would recommend this also. Again if any questions go to Nestor he is very helpful. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms need an "extreme makeover" badly!!”
Reviews.Author: JBod6157
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for a 4night/5 day trip with my family of 4. The rooms and bathrooms are in such bad shape and when i complained, they didn't deny it!! I asked for the room they have pictured on their website (which is what i thought i was getting) and they weren't receptive at all! Offered to put me in another room that had slightly updated furniture (who really cares about that?) but the bathroom was in the same state (refused to bathe my 3yr old and 18 month old in the tub - had to hold them in the shower!) the rest of the property is great... such a shame they've let the rooms go to crap! hardly a 4 star resort considering the ESJ is right next door...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Bstnma
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter,age 18, stayed here for a week in April and enjoyed it very much. Friendly helpful staff, clean, nice rooms. Close to airport and Old San Juan. If you plan to venture out on the island then I would recommend renting a car it's much cheaper than taxis. If you golf , there are 5 courses between 25 to 45 minutes away. I'd recommend El Conquistador for golf but definitely not the hotel. At InterContinental there is a Ruth's Chris steakhouse which is very good. If you are looking to hang out at the pool or beach and just relax as we did then you can't go wrong. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family trip.”
Reviews.Author: JenSM20
Reviews.Content: We are having a great time here. We are traveling with 2 kids, ages 3.5 & 5. The hotel staff has been very friendly and helpful. We are on the 16yh floor in an Executive Suite so that we had plenty of room. The rooms are clean, comfortable and oceanfront. I don't think the hotel is amazing or super posh, but the prices are reasonable and the pool, hot tu. and the beach are great. Next time we may stay closer to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Was more than pleased with this resort!”
Reviews.Author: engine643
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel for a pre-Cruise stay on Hotwire because we needed a room for 4. Was a little apprehensive about our choice after reading some reviews but they were short lived once we arrived at the property. We arrived at the Hotel at approx. 2:30 PM and we were immediately greeted by the bellhops. They tagged our bags and stored them as we were not sure we could check-in yet as the stated time is 4PM. When we checked-in the process was smooth and to our surprise our room was ready.Went to our room and found a very nice room looking out towards the front of the resort. Not an Ocean view but who cares anyway. The room had two double beds as we requested and found the bathroom to be very nice. Our bags arrived within a few minutes from the bellhops. Got changed and went to the beach which was the nicest we had seen in 4 trips to the San Juan area. We have stayed in Condado the other times and this was way nicer than the beach over there.Beach chairs are included with your stay, however an umbrella will cost you 10 bucks for the day. The pool area is gorgeous with an abundant amount of chairs.Towels are available and they will give you a wristband confirming that you are a guest of this resort when getting a towel. The hot tub was working just fine so no complaints here. We did not eat at any of the Hotels restaurants as they seemed way overpriced so we walked off the property to a Chili's which was right down the street to the left across the street when leaving the property.There is also a Subway and a Burger King the other direction if you don't like Chili's. This is a very safe area and we never felt uncomfortable walking at night off the property. I cannot for the life of me understand how people can give this place a bad rating. I am not a picky person and to me this was a very good value for the money that we paid. San Juan is a very expensive place to stay so do your homework before booking a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst room ever. How could this be a 4 star resort.”
Reviews.Author: Thick8272
Reviews.Content: This place is in need of an upgrade quick. Stain on carpet. Bathroom counter is old and stained. How could they even think that this is acceptable. I am so disappointed and I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: romeo204
Reviews.Content: Shame on you Intercontinental Inc. for draining this rich and celebrated property from what could be one of the finest hotels in San Juan. To describe the rooms as being a "bit worn down" would be to kind, in my opinion. Layers of paint doesn't hide her age. It's actual sad that this hotel is in the state that it is because you can easily see the granduer that this old gal must have celebrated back in the day. The location is great - just minutes from the airport, and there are an abundance of restaurant choices in the area. The pool area is fairly well kept however the beach was filthy with weeds due to a strong current. (certainly not the hotels fault, blame mother nature) Let's just say that if you get a deal on Priceline or Hotwire for under $100, take it because the Intercontinental is absolutely not worth the rack rates they publish.

Reviews.Title: “Average but great location”
Reviews.Author: M K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Thanksgiving weekend for a few days. The hotel is a short trip from the airport (about 5 minutes and a $12 cab ride) and located right in Isla Verde, which is the best place in San Juan to stay. It is an easy commute from the airport, which is nice after a long trip to get there. There are good restaurants (the Metropol across the street has the best local food and Pizzaiolo down the street has the best Brazilian pizza) nearby and it is right on the beach. You don't have to leave Isla Verde when traveling to San Juan unless you want to go to Old San Juan, which I do recommend at least once. The hotel itself is a little run down for the price. Everything in the room was perfectly functional but the bedspreads were old and cheesy and there were no modern amenities. The pool was fine but nothing special. The fitness facility had decent equipment and you can look at the ocean while on the treadmill, not bad. This was my 4th trip to San Juan and I would say that I would not stay at this hotel again. If you go, you should splurge on the El San Juan next door which has a much prettier pool and better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic grounds, pool, and beach!”
Reviews.Author: rbyrd48227
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit worn and elevators are slow particularly at check out/in times.

Reviews.Title: “Went down since last year- hot tub broken, charges for internet.”
Reviews.Author: dsf53
Reviews.Content: Last year I enjoyed this hotel so much that I joined the Ambassador program, which gives you an upgrade, a free night ( at the Ambassador rate, however) and some other things. I had appreciated the wireless internet being included in the resort fee ( around $50/day), and enjoyed the water aerobics and salsa lesson while I was there. None of this exists now. The internet is $16/day, and there are no activities. The hot tub broke on Sunday of a holiday weekend, and it remained broken even as we departed on Tuesday. When we arrived, having booked two beds oceanfront, the front desk delighted to tell us of our Ambassador upgrade to a suite. We went upstairs to find the suite had a city view, and a single king bed for two travelling adults. We went back downstairs and was told this was the upgrade for Ambassador. Not wanting a city view, we declined. The manager did give us one free breakfast, which of course we found on our bill on our departure day. Our fresh fruit and water , part of Ambassador, was 2 apples, one orange, and ONE bottle of water for two people. Not fiji, just the hotel bottle that they give out in the casino. And it was not daily, just the one time. I asked the man who delivered did they really mean to give one bottle of water for two people and he said yes. The pool area was nice, but they were spraying Tilex right next to us while we were in the pool! I don't know if the management changed, but the changes this year were not for the better. I really wanted to relax in the hot tub in the early evening, and I cannot imagine why they could not get this fixed in three days. I had also brought my iPad expecting the internet to be included in the resort fee, they had changed that 4 months before we went. The elevators had problems when we were there as well, and you cannot tell if it is coming, or going up or down, and it closes before you get there.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: travelfan725
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental in San Juan for 4 days in December 2011 and throughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel is well located 10 minutes from the airport and on a beautiful beach. The property, while older, is very well maintained and is full service, with excellent (if expensive) restaurants, and very large pool, and a small casino. The rooms are very comfortable. The hotel is located right next to the El San Juan, one of San Juan's premier nightlife spots which has a much larger casino. And there is an excellent conceriege service booking many tours of other parts of the island. This is not a hotel for those looking for a secluded, very quiet Caribbean vacation. But if you would like to be in the middle of the action, on a lively and beautiful beach, at a full service hotel, you can't go wrong at the Intercontinental. A couple of caveats - the Isla Verde neighborhood, where the hotel is located, offers few nearby restaurant choices outside of the large hotels. However, it is a short cab ride from the old city of San Juan, where restaurants and nightspots abound. It is also very close to the airport, so one occassionally hears jets arriving and departing, particularly from the non-oceanfront rooms. However, this sound is not very noticable, and is almost completely absent at night, when there is little airport traffice. Also, don't expect a Las Vegas style casino. The casino is very small, smaller than the lobby, with about 5 blackjack tables, a bunch of slot machines, and 3 over-crowded poker games (beware non-spanish speakers - not much English spoken on the poker tables). If you want a nicer casino, go next door to the El San Juan. But I think this is a minor quibble, given the hotel's other advantages. All in all, a very nice hotel, with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: mimiFairfield_CT
Reviews.Content: We found the Intercontinental through Liberty Travel and booked an ocean view room. The view is spectacular but you should definitely be ABOVE the 8th or 9th floor. The hotel is VERY close to the airport and is highly recommended for those who want to get straight to vacation! Within an hour of landing we were at the beach with a cocktail in hand! The hotel is lovely. Not state of the art but perfectly comfortable (the beds were absolutely the most comfortable I have ever slept in!) and we found the direct beach location with easy access to towels, food and restrooms very convenient. The pool was beautiful and the crowd is lively over the weekend. Certainly not stuffy! We watched football from the swim up bar and napped daily in the sunshine. Drinks and food were pretty expensive at the hotel. The casino and party scene at the hotel is pretty weak but we LOVED going next door to the elegant El San Juan for gambling and dancing! We took the bus (75cents!) to Old San Juan. It took about 45 minutes and we enjoyed the huge San Sebastian Festival that had the streets teeming with partiers.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun.........”
Reviews.Author: brads45
Reviews.Content: We just finished a wonderful trip to Puerto Rico with an extended stay at the Intercontinental San Juan Resort and Casino at the beginning and end of our trip. My wife and I are not casino people so really couldn't care less about the much maligned casino there, but note that the El San Juan Hotel next door is far nicer if people wish to gamble. We received a very favorable rate of under $200/night including the resort fee which we booked in advance which was more than reasonable considering the wonderful outdoor facilities this property has. For starters, the sprawling tropical outdoor pool area is very clean and includes several connected pools, waterfalls, a hot tub, swim-up bar and tons of seating. The beach is very close behind the property and there is a nice friendly bar with alot of seating which looks out over the ocean. Food is reasonable, drinks a bit expensive but you are paying for the ambiance here, absolutely beautiful. Oh yeah, our rooms were very nice as well, comfortable beds, quiet, plenty of room, hot water, a safe and a balcony, everything to make for a very enjoyable stay. We will definitely stay here the next time we are in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mydoghatestravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 9yr old son, January 6, 2012. Booked the room through hot-wire. Room was just a regular "city" view, on the 5th floor. Nice and clean. Staff was very nice. We were a little confused as to the restaurant situation, so just grabbed a bite to eat in the bar area - $10 steak was good enough for my husband. In the morning we didn't feel like going off site, so sucked up the $20 breakfast. ouch. that was the only down part to the hotel. We made use of the towels and beach toys and went out on the beach for the morning before checking out at noon and heading on to our cruise. There was always security was watching the gate to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously outdated, mediocre room, average amenities”
Reviews.Author: ouuga
Reviews.Content: I booked a city view room for one night on Hotwire for around $125 + taxes + the resort fee. I would echo what others have said about the city view rooms. They are seriously outdated, with cheap furniture, old televisions, with a strong smell of bleach and dinged paint and dirty/old tiles. The television service was awful- not a single channel came in clearly (all with the old-fashioned fuzz from tv's of yesteryear). I am honestly surprised that the InterContinental brandname is allowed to be on this resort. Furthermore, our room lacked an alarm clock and a safe. I didn't complain since I was only there for under 24 hours, but I would have complained if I had booked multiple nights. For a hotel to bill itself as a 4-star resort, I would've expected better, hence the poor rating. I would have given it an average rating (3-stars) if it had advertised itself as a 3-star resort. (They even had the 4-star certificate from TripAdvisor on their front desk) I found my stay at the Stellaris Marriot resort & casino to be a better value for a one-night stay. The pool area is gorgeous, though the water is very cold, despite 80+ degree outside temperatures. The pool furniture is nice, but the grounds just need to be spruced up (worn tilework, dirty tables, old outside furniture). The cost for drinks and limited food options at the resort is very high. Just go across the street to Friday's for a cheaper meal, though I'm guessing that the Ruth Chris steakhouse on site lives up to its name. The front desk staff were not the most efficient I've encountered, and I found it kind of off-putting the way she said "You've booked one night with the Hotwire rate". It just struck me as odd, as I've used Priceline and Hotwire numerous times before at other hotels and no one has ever said anything. And just one funny aspect about my stay: A can (not a 20 oz. bottle; a can) of Diet Coke was $2 or $3 if I remember correctly. Last, the casino was poor/average and small. There were plenty of slot machines, but only two poker tables that reminded me of a charity poker game set-up in a church basement. The table games were not busy at all. Overall, I would have given this property an average rating and it they promoted themselves as a 3-star resort. They didn't; they get a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: smokin s
Reviews.Content: Liberty Travel had the flight times and and the room booked wrong,so the trip started out bad.The Hotel was just OK,not worth the 300 a night we were paying.Nice pool area,There were no shuttles for the hotel.I would go back to St. Martin or St Thomas instead of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: roycharles
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here finishing up a week long driving trip around the island. It's hard to fault the quality of the staff and the service. Valet parking, check in, baggage service were crisp and correct. Front desk worked hard to find us a nice sea view on a high floor when the hotel was 95% booked. Our room was decent but nothing terribly special. Room was of average size, bathroom rather spare.....old TV.....but the room was quiet and the A/C was fine. The Sunday buffet was very nice......ate outside on a perfect January morning.....very comfortable......food was good and service excellent as it is throughout the hotel. We spent some time at the beach bar watching football during a couple of evenings......had some snacks.......drinks were great.....service excellent......food just OK.....but it was short orders....not fine dining. Did not use the pool but it looked great......lots of users. Like so many Caribbean beach hotels.....this one finds itself becoming a little victimized by the climate and its age. It could use a little investment. Having said that, I think that it stands up well to its competitors in its class.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: hajarpa
Reviews.Content: Arrived New Year's eve with husband and daughter, ocean-front room was ready -- in great condition, fabulous view. We immediately had lunch on the beach (great coffee surprisingly at the beach-front restaurant). Water was warm, clean, with beach chairs and umbrellas ready for us. Beach not crowded but not deserted either. On New Year's eve, the hotel was swarming with locals dressed to the nines, live bands, and a fantastic atmosphere. No rowdy drunks! Each day we were able to have coffee at the lobby coffee/pastry shop, head to the beach and pools, and have lunch at the pool or beach. We had fantastic puerto rican food at the pool bar (Mofungo and Parilla). The concierge was very helpful with planning day trips, renting a car, arranging transportation, restaurants, etc. One of the days we headed to Old San Juan and had a fab time exploring el Morro, taking amazing pictures, eating dinner, and soaking in all of the history of this beautiful city! We walked to several neighboring hotels, and although the lobbies of El San Juan and the Ritz were beautiful and might have more shopping available, the beach at Intercon was better than ESJ and Ritz (the scene pool-side at ESJ was really not family-friendly). We were very happy that we chose Intercontinental after lots of research. An added bonus -- the hotel provides towels, table tennis rackets, pails/shovels for the beach, and lots of other activities for kids (incl a playground by the pool). No additional cost, no hidden fees unlike many other resorts. Of course the food on site was expensive, but after we dined off property at Platos restaurant (down the street) and in old San Juan, the prices were not really that much higher at the hotel than at other stand alone restaurants. Go, enjoy PR, bring lots of sunblock and brush up on your spanish!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous time.”
Reviews.Author: texanime
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great stay! We were greeted by very friendly staff that immediately moved us into our suite. The room was large and clean with fabulous views of the ocean. The swimming pool(s) were huge and fun, and the beach was clean and not over crowded. The casino was nice and they even had little boutique shops to blow what cash you may have left. The pizzeria and ice cream shops were great! You can walk to good local food restaurants as well. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here”
Reviews.Author: Sandsculptureman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice already and have reservations for a third trip in Feb, 2012. Nice pool area, great beach. Nice property overall. The beach access is the best. A short walk from the hotel through the pool area puts you on the beach. The beach attendants are the best. Very helpful. My idea of a great vacation is to spend all day, every day on the beach doing sand sculptures. This beach has plenty of great models to work with! The first trip only one elevator was working and there were always long lines to get to the room. I don't understand why during our entire 10 day stay it could not have been fixed. everything seems to move slow here, but I guess that is what a carribean vacation is all about. Ruth's Chris is good. Alfredo's is nice. Nothing is cheep. Breakfast buffet at Alfredo's is expensive but good. Mostly walk across the street to Mia Castila for breakfast. Ciao (?) is the restaurant / bar right on the beach. Decent food at fair prices. Maybe a little expensive for what you get, but you are on vacation, and it is right on the beach so you have to expect that. Overall I love this hotel and Puerto Rico. It's close, less than 4 hour flight from Hartford. American money makes it easy. The people are very friendly and almost everyone speaks English.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DeeDel6-2
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in the Isla Verde section of San Juan and we were not disappointed. Only there for 4 nights, this beach getaway was only a $10 cab ride from the airport. The hotel lobby is impressive and it was decorated for the holidays in very tasteful fashion. The casino needs an overhaul - we were next door at the El San Juan casino and it was far superior. The room was just fine - but the bathrooms could use an update. Angelo's Italian restaurant was very, very nice with a prix fixe menu that did not disappoint. Also onsite is Ruth's Chris Steak House and I highly recommend dining here. The beach is very nice. We are Punta Cana enthusiasts. If you are, as well, this beach will likely be a disappointment. But based on the areas in San Juan, this beach is perhaps the nicest. It was quiet, clean, and restful. Beach chairs are provided by the hotel and while a little on the 'tired' side, they were just fine,too. We'd return here for a deal like the one we scored when booking, but I'd consider the Ritz Carlton in the same area, as well.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL, BEAUTIFUL POOL & BEACH, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: drewfromnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late November/early December for six nights and had a wonderfully relaxing time. We were upgraded from a garden view room to an ocean view room, and the view is truly spectacular. The beds were super comfortable. The grounds are lovely and well-kept, the pool is fabulous and the beach is nice. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. The amenities included complimentary use of the steam and sauna in the spa (located below the gym). We ate lunch and dinner several times at the pool bar and ordered from the local favorites on the menu at the incredible price of $10 an entree. Best of all, the food was excellent. Although the area outside the hotel is not that pretty, be sure to go into Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: dbrooks71
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort in San Juan. First class accomodations and the sandy beach is right at your door. Concierge was very helpful and courteous. The casino is a nice size for a resort. You have to check out the huge jacuzzi and breathtaking pool with waterfall. There's also an outdoor Tiki bar, located on the beach within the property. While a guest at the property, you receive special wristbands to go on the beach and can use the complimentary lounge chairs, which are cushioned and very comfortable, located right on the beach. Go early though, they only have so many. Enjoy a delightful island drink on the beach while lounging. Outstanding views. Took a tour of the rainforest, too and enjoyed local shopping. Many restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay in room 1605”
Reviews.Author: stprue
Reviews.Content: Okay, so my wife and I stayed in room at the Inter Continental recently ( End of December 2011) for two days and the resort itself is decent, but I wouldn't recommend anyone staying in room 1605. The room itself was not up to date and the shower grout was chipped and pealing away, which let water under the shower, giving a water-bed-like feeling on the tub flooring. Other then that the room is fire considering that it has not been updated and facing the street or "city-side". I would like to now touch on the strangest happenings that my wife and I have every experienced. During our stay, my wife was stroked along the arm one time and grabbed another time, by an unknown something/ghost!!! When we were checking out, her backpack was literally thrown off the bed onto the floor. Her backpack was approximately 30 lbs in weight and approximately 2 feet away from the edge of the bed and facing down on the bed. It would have been impossible for the backpack to fall off the bed on it's own. My wife and I were both right there and heard the bag fall. We did not witness it, but we were both just a few feet ( maybe 2 feet) away and we both remember the bag being on the bed in a position that it couldn't have possibly have fallen off never mind be thrown off like we heard. My wife and I have never experienced anything like this ever and are not sure what to make of it, but were officially freaked out and will never stay in room 1605 again.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: nancyjoy52
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an excellent choice for our family. The staff is very attentive and courteous. We received great advice from the concierge on restaurants, car rental, and activities for our adult family. We spent time on the beach where the staff again was very polite and attentive. Our first night we ate at Chris's Steakhouse on the property which was expensive, but worth it. We also saved money by visiting the grocery store (within a 15 minute walk) and using the refrigerator provided in the room. The only negative was the cool temperature of the pool. We certainly would return to this hotel if we decide to visit Puerto Rico again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway with the little one...”
Reviews.Author: DSophiaNY
Reviews.Content: This location was great, they definitely cater to the little ones, they have a game room and daily activities to keep children entertained. My daughter loved the pool and the adjacent beach front. I personally loved the well equipped gym and the well placed treadmills which faced the beach. They have a great happy hour bar which serves delicious authentic Puerto Rican food. There's a Starbucks next door at the Astoria and there is a supermarket about two blocks away. If you're interested in getting around town on your own, the metro bus stops right in front of the hotel. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Great as the First Time”
Reviews.Author: unikka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 11/30/11 to 12/4/11. The staff was very friendly from the time that we walked through the door. Unfortunately, the rooms were not very nice. The rooms need a major overhaul partly because it is time, and partly because most people that stay at hotels are slobs and do not have any respect for property that does not belong to them. The sofa in the room was filthy, it had nail polish on it, and it was just gross. The furniture was falling apart, the door knob was falling off the bathroom door, and the toilet paper holder was broken. We stayed here 3 years ago, and our experience here was much better. Needless to say, I do not have a desire to ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good pool, easy beach access, dated rooms, billing errors”
Reviews.Author: Satyajeet H
Reviews.Content: We bought a 3 night package at this resort through Costco for a trip last month. Overall, the resort is good. The pool is good sized, and has a shallow wading area which is perfect for smaller kids. The property is right on the beach, although Isla Verde is a public beach so the resort does not have any exclusivity. The beach itself was quite disappointing with tons of seaweed being washed on to the shore. Our room was 'City Facing', and was quite ordinary. The biggest surprise was that it still had a 29" tube TV set, which seems really cheap for a property that bills itself as a premier resort. There were a few ants in the bathroom, and the housekeeping staff kept restocking the bathroom with just two sets of towels, though there were three of us (my wife, son and I) in the room. Talking to the bellboy, we were told that the 'Beach View' rooms had the flat screen TV's, so if you care for them, you will have to pay a premium. The most disappointing aspect of our stay was definitely the errors in the final bill during checkout. We had booked our package through Costco, which gave us a 20% F&B discount on the property. This was not automatically applied to our bill, and I had to ask for it to be applied. Additionally, we were billed for 3 days of parking on the property ($20/day), though we returned our parking permit to them on day 2. This too was corrected after I pointed it out. Bottom line - be very meticulous in reviewing your final bill. The location of the property is great, and you have a lot of restaurants within walking distance. There is also a Walgreens nearby for basic necessities.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: ashleywyatt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful older hotel. Lobbby spectacular but rooms could use a facelift. Food was very good, especially the buffet breakfast, all made to order. We will probably try a newer hotel downtown next time. Get an ocean view at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property & Location :)”
Reviews.Author: cookie225R
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here pre-cruise and loved it! Restaurants are walking distance, specially Don Jose Restaurant which is about 2-3 blocks to the left and right after that there is a walgreens (lots of souvenirs) I wasn't crazy about "Mi Casita" restaurant which is highly spoken of in Cruise Critic. The hotel has great customer service,very beautiful grounds and pool. The beach is very nice and we even sat out there at night. Another thing we loved was that we could just walk next door to El San Juan Hotel for dancing all night long :) . Making reservations again for March 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as we remembered”
Reviews.Author: Barca8236
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited this resort exactly 2 years ago. We had a really great time. It was our last vacation before my wife became pregnant, so we really enjoyed the pool/beach (including the swim-up bar) and nightlife (plenty of good restaurants/casinos either on site or within a short walk). We just came back from our first family vacation with our 15 month old. We stayed at the same hotel because of our prior positive experience and because of the reasonably priced suite they had available. And while the vacation was great, the hotel just wasn't what we remembered.... more run down/dated furnishings, moldy tile in the bathroom, spotty housekeeping, unresponsive/unaccessible management. And we had to wait several hours after we checked in for the crib (which we pre-arranged when we booked the hotel and reminded the check-in clerk, the bellman, and the housekeeper we needed ASAP) to be delivered to the room. Granted, they do plan to remodel the hotel next year, but Intercontinental is not a brand that you expect to have such disappointing service.

Reviews.Title: “read your bill carefully upon checkout”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: The facility is okay. And we did enjoy the beach a lot. But they billed me some meal services I didn't order. When I asked them to show me the receipt/ticket, they told me they couldn't find it. And they promised not to charge me until further investigation. But they charged anyway w/o bothering to find the receipt. It took them 2 weeks to find the ticket after I called to complain. It turns out it's not my signature on that ticket. They promised to refund me right away. But they didn't. I called again a week later, and the same lady promised me the same thing again. It has been more than a month and I haven't got my refund yet. Just be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanielee1112
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days pre-cruise and loved it! We weren't sure what to expect since the reviews are so wishy-washy. The pool was beautiful and almost no one in it throughout our whole trip there! They gave you free beach chairs as well - they set them up and dusted them all off for us :) We were even upgraded for free to Ocean View since it was our Honeymoon! The bed and pillows were SOOOO comfortable and I loved our balcony! Only complaints was all the seaweed on the beach/water. I know there is always going to be "some", but it was EXTREME seaweed - literally more seaweed than water! The front desk said this was abnormal for this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in November 2011. We had 2 rooms for a group of friends. We arrived early and checked in. Check in was 4pm and we weren't provided our 2nd room until well after 4pm. There were 3 of us in the 2nd room and everyday we had to call for a 3rd towel. One room wasn't cleaned by dinnertime one day. No hair dryer in one room and stains on the carpet. Room service breakfast was disappointing (pancakes and waffles). The most frustrating was they did not have the proper names on the rooms. We stopped in everyday to update-seeing as you had to explain at the pool everyday and it was never corrected. Due to this, we were not to be charged the extra $40/day to have a 3rd person in the room. A month later, I'm still having to call to get refunded that amount. We never received a bill for it, they put it on the card w/ the incidentals. They acknowledged we were overcharged, but are extremely frustrating and unhelpful. There are too many options out there to deal with this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: busdriver159
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. We only stayed 1 night but wish we could of stayed more. The rooms are very nice and the beds are super comfy. The pool and beach are just wonderful. The hotel is super clean and all of the personel are very friendly. It was worth every penny. We didn't try the food in the hotel but it seems reasonably priced. We went to the casino and it was fun. Not too small or big.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good hotel to spend a night after a cruise, although a bit far from old San Juan, the party center of the city, but really nice beach and conveniently close to the airport. Good service and great pool. Cons: I would skip the breakfast at Alfredos as it can be a bit expensive and the food is sub par. Down the street is a Starbucks and other places to get a good meal at a reasonable price. Room wasn't ready when we got there and they said they were going to call when it was ready but never did.

Reviews.Title: “everything was as stated”
Reviews.Author: saucemonsters
Reviews.Content: stayed here pre-cruise from san juan. exceptional staff. from the first Hello to Goodbye. all of our needs were met. the hotel was booked solid, a wedding going on, but i experienced NO problems. they checked us in early. and when we checked out, they stored our luggage after recommending that we wait until 4 or 5 to board our cruise. we enjoyed the pool, the beachside bar and the beach. very pleased and would recommend. i try to go to a different place on each vacation, however, i would definitely come back here for an extended weekend !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Smc123456
Reviews.Content: Very poor room service! Asked me to call room service to get food microwaved, got it for one day but not for the second! Spoke to manager hector Sanchez who gave an unprofessional reply. Can't we expect our food to be microwaved? I offered to do it myself. POOR SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “get away vacation to relax”
Reviews.Author: wilson1950
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for 4 nights and 5 days the end of nov 2011 to dec 4,2011 and everything was wonderful got to the hotel around noon and our room was not ready so they said we could leave our baggage and look around about one and one half hour later they called me and said our room was ready we were on the 9th floor and had a ocean view room up graded at no charge the people at the ront desk was very helpful my husband asked for a bathroom that had lots of safety devices in the shower and they said no problem the bed was very comfortable we did not et in the hotel but there were several well known restaurants in walking distance we live in florida but i can say that we loved sitting on the terrrace and beach and the breeze was very nice not like in fl very relaxing everyone at the hotel staff was wonderful and helped if we needed to know anything i definately will go back to that hotel the casino was small but i did win a little it was even better than the cruise we took in july to ireland and scotland i have been to puerto rice 15 times in my life and a lot of things have changed i was hoping to look up my cousins but couldn't i would recomend this hotel if you want to get away for a short time because it was vey relaxing and we felt refreshed when we returned home

Reviews.Title: “Choose a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgini
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I expect an Intercontinental Hotel to be a step above the Holiday Inn, part of the same group. Unfortunately, it feels to me like the Intercon chain is rapidly becoming a Holiday Inn in disguise. I stay at this hotel in early November. Being a platinum member of their rewards program for some years, I expected an upgrade and at least, a nice ocean view room. I got neither. What I got was a room that was reeking of mold and mildew, so bad that after 5 minutes I could hardly breathe in the room. I went down to the front desk and after 15 minutes of haggling finally got the night manager to locate another room for me. This hotel is in bad need of a major facelift, or just change the sign to Holiday Inn, but it would still need some work. I had a friend who was celebrating her 5th anniversary (that is why I was there). They called them the night before and told them they were way overbooked. They put them in a time share complex a couple doors down for a couple of nights. The hotel did "pay" for the nights, but it was a total step down. The casino was pretty empty as was most of the restaurants. The pool wasn't that clean. I could hear the people in the room next door discussing where they wanted to go to dinner. Overall, it was a pretty bad experience. For my two cents, I would stay at the El San Juan or the Ritz nearby if you are spending this kind of money. This is really a 2 star hotel on its very best day!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sandygb
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. The hotel is a fabulous location- close to the airport, restaurants, excursions, etc... The beach is beautiful for both walking and swimming. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The kids club was flexible and helpful. The pool was perfect and our rooms were great. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: 93LoveToTravel
Reviews.Content: If you are lucky enough to get a "room with a view", it is spectacular. The hotel is an older hotel, but very well maintained. The grounds are beautiful, the pools and lounging areas, very clean and well kept. It is very expensive, maybe overly priced, and we were advised by two different sets of people while walking on the beach, that there were numerous places within walking distance to eat, as the food was very expensive in the hotel. We found the front desk service very slow, there were only two people working and we probably waited for 20 minutes to be served. There should have been at least one other person working. While we were sitting around the pool, there was a bit of an accident, and my husband went to the lobby to get some help. People reacted immediately and showed the utmost of concern for the elderly individual. We were quite impressed. Overall the experience was very nice, and we would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ROYAL TREATMENT FOR THIS ROYAL PLATINUM AMBASSADOR”
Reviews.Author: forcoli
Reviews.Content: Our week long stay at the Intercontinental San Juan Resort and Casino was nothing short of amazing! We were relaxed and were treated like royalty. After only a few days, staff was greeting us by name! We stayed in a King Clubroom Suite on floor two. The room was nicely decorated and the amenities were more than sufficient. Our room was always cleaned quickly and immaculately. The complimentary evening hors d'oeuvres were spectacular and the staff throughout the entire resort was very friendly and accommodating. The pool area is beautiful and clean, as is the beach. We ate breakfast buffet daily at Alfredoâ€™s as well as Thanksgiving dinner and found it to be very good with impeccable service. We also ate dinner at Ruthâ€™s Chris restaurant which was fabulous. We dealt with both concierges and their knowledge of the area and attractions was impressive! I canâ€™t say enough good things about the management and staff at the Intercontinental San Juan Resort. They are friendly and more than willing to assist customers in any way they can and continuously go over and above their call of duty!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Guest”
Reviews.Author: Carlotta M
Reviews.Content: I return to the San Juan Intercontinental several times a year. It is an older hotel, but well maintained. It has a perfect location on Carolina Beach. The real reason I keep returning is the great staff. They do everything to make your stay relaxing. From the door men who greet you when you first arrive to the wait staff at breakfast, the maids who make up the rooms, and the pool staff everyone is pleasant and helpful. The rooms are old like the building, but they are very clean and comfortable. The pool area is very nice and as I said the beach is super. I have stayed in a number of different rooms and they have all been immaculately clean. I also like the location. For a change you are in walking distance to the El San Juan and Ritz hotel. The hotel is right on a bus line if you feel like day-tripping to Old San Juan. There is a small casino in the hotel. If they have missed the boat on anything it is the casino. They renovated it about a year ago. They took out all but three quarter slot machines and all but six dollar machines. They have tons of penny and nickel machines that are mostly empty day and night. On the grounds of the hotel is a Ruth Chris restaurant that is very nice and an Italian restaurant Alfredo's that is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade badly”
Reviews.Author: Marianne P
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be wonderful. It has a beautiful swimming area, a swimup bar, a private beach with a nice beachfront restaurant...BUT the first two hotel rooms I tried had visible black mold. There was black mold in the conference room we met in as well. Everywhere I was, I could smell mold and mildew. It aggrevated my allergies to the point, I had to leave early. So, regardless of all the pluses, an unhealthy hotel is unacceptable in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Paula B
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews I was anixous to see for myself what this hotel was going to be like. We arrived at 2:00 pm and were given our room immediatley.We were pleased to see how nice our ocean view room was. The grounds were very nice as well as the beach. We took advantage of the tours they offered and could have not gotten better service. Tours were alway's on time and well worth taking, cannot say enough about Ruth and Marcella and the service they gave us. We asked for a late check out and without hesitation they gave us 3 more hours and offered a hospitallty room if we needed it after we did check out. Drinks and food were a little over priced, but there were plenty of places within walking distance that were reasonable. Would definely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best pool area”
Reviews.Author: technomadps
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with kids. Pool and bd hot tub area was big and enjoyed by everyone. Beach access was great. Staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “It's an okay place to stay......”
Reviews.Author: PerfectBreezeTravel
Reviews.Content: I love the grounds here.... It is set up very nicely. The pool area is beautiful and it has easy access to the beach. However, the drinks on the beach is overpriced and not that strong at all. The rooms are ok!! Needs a little bit updating but I bid $89 a night for it on priceline so I got it for a steal!! I can now say that I have stayed here but I don't have to necessarily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nine Days in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: IslandManCapeCodMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed Oct 25 to Nov 2 (2011) celebrating our 46th wedding anniversary. From arrival to departure, our stay was extremely positive. Check-in was fast and friendly, and hearing it was our anniversary, they upgraded us to an oceanfront room. They couldn't have been nicer. During our stay, we found the staff friendly and accomodating at every level. Our room was cleaned in timely fashion each day, with all amenities continually replenished. We were each able to get two beach towels any time we asked at the towel hut, and one day, after a brief shower, they quickly exchanged the wet towels with dry ones. The pool is superb, the beach was clean, there was visible security at the beach entrance which made us feel that we, and our belongings, were safe and protected. All in all, it was everything we hoped it would be, and we look forward to our stay next October to celebrate our 47th.

Reviews.Title: “Isla Verde Tropical Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Jane C
Reviews.Content: The pool/jacuzzi area are definitely the highlight of Isla Verde's Hotel row. I was informed on arrival I was "upgraded" to a better king room. If an upgrade includes a full view of the roof, I guess it was fine. However, I was not going to look at a roof for 2 days in PR while on business. For $50 I upgraded myself to a high floor full view of the ocean and pool area and was not disappointed. The rooms are dated but comfortable. The staff was attentive and professional.The pool, beach, gym and jacuzzi were truly the relaxation areas I needed and provided a retreat away from the Casino atmosphere inside. This property has some gem characteristics but you will pay $$ for the amenities you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, no major issues, knew how to charge”
Reviews.Author: Spiderpig41
Reviews.Content: I was Island Hopping and decided to stay here as I needed somewhere close to the airport and highway ready for a drive to Arecibo telescope the next day. I was given a sea view on the 15th Floor. Likes - Check in was easy enough, room was clean and had everything I needed. Wifi was Ok and the bar was relaxing enough. I enjoyed the pool, gym and jacuzzi early in the morning when it was lovely and quiet, plus a pleasant walk down the beach lost in thought. The hotel is easy to navigate and security are omnipresent if that is a concern. Dislikes - The turn left and you will be charged for turning, attitude of the hotel. Tiny balcony and a concierge which never seemed to be there when I needed to ask a question on 3 occasions. Reception was helpful but always pointed me in the direction of the missing concierge. I don't mind paying for a service but in one night the charges for beers, parking and some other items were almost the same as one nights accommodation. This wouldn't put me off from staying again, just a note to other travellers who may have some budget restrictions. Valet parking dudes were always helpful, note to staff though when recommending places nearby, try and find out if they are open to save a very long walk......Not the best ICH I have stayed in but not the worst. As for Isla Verde in October, I wont rush to come back. Now the Bacardi tour and the Arecibo Obsevatory were great fun. As for those who get authorised $100 per night, I had prepaid and still got charged $288 for the room plus $100, which I got back about 3 days later......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: Magpie2167
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time! Please know ahead of time they put a $100 per nite hold on your credit card for incidentals. The hotel is in a great area, close to everything, helpful concierge, great room service, (he helped me figure out a bus route), on the beach, not deluxe deluxe but definitely adequate for a nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Isla Verde Resort”
Reviews.Author: maytraveller2
Reviews.Content: I stay in Isla Verde on business 2-3 times/yr and this is my favorite of the resorts there. The Intercontiental has a friendly staff and the beach bar stays open in the evenings even diring the low season. The rooms are comfortable and the ones I have stayed in are in better condition than the ESJ. If the casino is important, stay elsewhere, as he IC has a very small one.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as seemed”
Reviews.Author: xxxmystik
Reviews.Content: Very disapointed they weren't accommodating as I would have thought. Maybe because we booked through a discount items but everything we asked for wasn't met. The room keys kept deactivating maid service wasn't up to par n when asking for a late check out was also told no. Ill never return I was here for my birthday the pool is the most appealing staff suggested places to eat that were awlful... I. Am not a hotel snob and expect more then I pay but for what I paid I expected more!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Believe the Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Nicole L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the El San Juan in the past and could not get a room. My travel agent suggested I stay at the Intercontinental, that it is just as nice. I read lots of reviews and was hesitant, as many weren't so good. I dont know what everyone was talking about. The rooms were clean, the staff was super friendly, attentive and fast to assist. The restaurants were great! The pool and beach were clean and very well maintained. There was security at the pool and beach, so locals and other vacationers could not pool/beach hop. I would hands down stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Decent Location, Needs Better Casino and Dining”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixroby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick romantic getaway. It was our first time to Puerto Rico. The location of the hotel in terms of being on the beach was fantastic. However, outside the resorts there is not much here. In fact, the areas outside the resorts seem somewhat divey. The resorts does have some restaurants as do the nearby resorts, but everything there is expensive (breakfast buffet for $28? really?). One day we tried walking the street and really couldn't find many alternatives. The casino is really tiny. We much prefered the casino at the hotel next door. The Japanese restaurant was good and offered both Teppanyaki and sushi selections. I think next time, we will try the Old San Juan hotel next door. The whole environment had more energy and lively excitement. One night at Old San Juan, they have a 3-man band playing with old local residents dancing and laughing. It was cool. Then we went back to the Intercontinental and it was like "crickets". The pool is very nice though and the access to the beach is perfect for morning runs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mariann73
Reviews.Content: We spent two nigths in the hotel, before a cruise from San Juan. Our room was very nice, the bed was the most comfortable I ever slept in! The hotel was clean, staff very polite, the garden lovely green, nice beach with calm water... absolutely perfect!!! Negatives: by the check in the hotel asked a 200 USD deposit by card (maybe we will make something wrong in the room...) The parking was on the opposite of the street, for 20 USD /day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelingpants08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights before our southern Caribbean cruise. It is very close to the airport (5 minute cab ride) and about 10-15 minutes from the cruise terminal. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, the rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly. The pool area is very nice as well as the beach area. We felt very safe on hotel grounds as well as the surrounding area, even late at night. Hotel security was constantly patrolling and local police were always patrolling nearby. I can not comment on the restaurants in the hotel since we did not eat at any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: bercre
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this Hotel on three trips to Puerto Rico, and we love it. The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the concierge is a great resource for restaurants, tours, etc. The pool area is beautifully designed in a way that you can always find a location that is relaxing and not so close to others, and even though we go at the busiest times in Feb or April because of my sons school schedule, finding a lounge chair is never a problem. The breakfast buffet is great and sitting outside having your breakfast and reading the paper is the best way to start your day. The buffet is alittle pricey, but not any more then other Hotels in the area. The casino is alittle small, so we go to the El San Juan or the Ritz to gamble, both within walking distance. My only complaint with this Hotel is that they still have rooms without flatscreen TV's and that is unacceptable for anyone paying premium dollars at the busiest time for a Hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Price!!”
Reviews.Author: geminigurl612
Reviews.Content: I had first stayed at this hotel for work. It was such a great experience that I came back with my Husband for a relaxing getaway and 5 times after that. This hotel is Centrally located. 5 min from the airport and 15 min from Old San Juan. The area is called Isla Verde and it is very safe. It is a strip of just hotels and condos located on the beach. The hotel and rooms are very clean. No moldy smell that you could get in other tropical hotels. If you get a room overlooking the Ocean it is simply breathtaking. The Staff is very friendly and helpful. The Pool is clean safe and fun. Food is great at the hotel. It can be pricey but is worth it. The beach is patrolled by hotel staff and is sectioned off for guests only. If you choose to stay at this hotel you will not regret it one bit. I used to stay at the Courtyard Mariott a few blocks away but not anymore. This is the only hotel I will ever stay at while in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Just O K”
Reviews.Author: drumdan2002
Reviews.Content: The Beach, Service, Room quality is just O K. The pool is very nice! If i could go again I would stay at the Gran Melia Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: 23ARJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful, and the pool was even better! Rooms were very clean and the concierge was extremely helpful, they helped us book our own tours, and save money by not booking the pre made packages. The food was delicious, as were the drinks and we definitely had a great time here. The only downside was that there were mostly chain restaurants in the vicinity and we had to take a cab to Old San Juan to get more of a variety of food.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property, Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: FITfalcon
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a good time staying here. Our trip was only 4 nights, but we made the most of the time here. The staff was excellent and courteous. We dropped our bags with the porter and our room wasn't ready yet. He let us in the back room so we could grab our swimsuits and hang out by the pool while our room was prepared. Our room was pretty standard, but very clean. The bed was very comfortable. We spent the majority of our days migrating from the beach to the pool. The beach was beautiful, although the umbrellas required a rental charge. Instead, we just went back to the pool area where there were always chairs with umbrellas available. The pool was gorgeous and big. The drinks were resort priced, but there is a Pueblo supermarket within walking distance, behind the embassy suites, which we put to good use. We were looking for a nice relaxing trip after a more hectic and adventurous vacation in June. We definitely found it at the Intercontinental. There was never a rush to get anywhere or do anything. At all times of the day there was plenty of space at the bar, beach and pool. However, if you are looking to see San Juan, or Puerto Rico, you should rent a car. The Isla Verde area is a long strip of hotels and average restaurants. There isn't much to see in walking distance. The parking rate at the hotel was $20 per day, but if you have the placard from the hotel you can go in and out as much as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Tracyktn
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Intercontinental Hotel in San Juan. The pool area is beautiful and has a swim up bar. The beach right in front of the hotel was amazing, it was nice to have drinks brought to your beach chair (they are pricey though). Our room was clean and comfortable. The valets were helpful and stored our luggage for a few days while we flew over to Vieques. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “getaway”
Reviews.Author: getaway792
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stay there for 4 nights ,,,i would say in a brief note ,,this hotel is nice ,,,definitely would tell every one when planning to go to puerto rico make sure you stop at the intercontinental

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way.”
Reviews.Author: paris7002
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this resort with my family. We reserved 2 rooms: one double, one single with a pull out sofa, both room with city views. There were no lines at the check-in counter at anytime during our stay. The front desk personnel was nice enough to let us check in early, and check-out late. The resort is absolutely beautiful and elegant, and located right on the nicest beach in San Juan, the pool is stunning, and the service is impeccable and very attentive. Lounging chairs are provided at the beach. I will certainly use this resort again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for better comfort in the city”
Reviews.Author: Stangsfan311
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay over the weekend of Oct. 21-24 and got a heckuva deal on priceline - keep that in mind, I know some of you probably pay a lot more and likely expect more, but for the price I was extremely satisfied with my stay. I had stayed in the Dominican Republic a couple months back at an all-inclusive resort and, while I enjoyed my stay for the most part, I was constantly hassled about upgrades and joining the timeshare group. Not the case here. To my surprise the Intercontinental is a very hands-off establishment (some may not like that), but, that said, they are still extremely friendly and cordial when necessary while not creating that feeling of constantly being on top of you. I mean, I'm on vacation, I want to relax and the Intercontinental let me relax! Yes, it's not all-inclusive, but at the price I paid (and I imagine a fairly common deal, especially in off/shoulder seasons) I was happy to try their affordable bar food once (pretty decent mofongo) and sample the nearby restaurants. I even won a little cash at the casino. The pool area is nice (though the hot tub gets crowded, especially late) and while I wish the pool could be "open" later (I mean, we hit up all the sights during the day), it essentially was available for swimming for awhile after dusk. I guess this is a common theme at most resorts with pools, not many people seem to use them late... The beach access was great too and the InterContinental arguably gets the best swath of Playa Isla Verde. City view room was just fine, simple and clean, plenty of TV channels (though a older CRT style TV). The bedding was super comfortable - my girlfriend and I might even order the comforter! It would be nice if the hotel had a little store or vending machines (maybe they do, but I couldn't find them on the commonly used floors (ours and the lobby, and the downstairs). It seemed most people walked a few blocks to the Walgreen's - so we did the same. I feel like I have a low standard for giving hotels a 5-star rating in my book, but it all comes down to this for me. I'm simple. Give me clean rooms, a friendly, stress-free attitude, let me be myself and relax, and give me a few things to do after a busy day, especially at a vacation destination like Puerto Rico, (swim, gamble, maybe eat, watch tv) and I'm ok. It's amazing that many hotels come short of this mark! I honestly couldn't have been happier with the Intercontinental. No place is perfect, but they hit every mark I needed them to.

Reviews.Title: “Please explain the room change process”
Reviews.Author: PaigeA490
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinenttal San Juan Resort and Casino from 10/222/11-10/24/11. The stay in the room was nice. the view was great. What I didn't understand was being made to check out after the first day only to check back in for a new room. This would not have been a problem if the move was due to the room being prebooked for another guest but it wasn't. I was given the same darn room. I checked out by 12 only to check back in at 4p.m. Please explain this madness to me. I was very disappointed in this entire process.

Reviews.Title: “Pool area Beautiful, everything else so so”
Reviews.Author: wherestherum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in SanJuan for a few days post cruise. Got a deal on this hotel through travel site, good thing because you should not pay full price for this hotel, not sure how the star rating works, but it falls short here. As I mentioned the grounds are beautiful. It is located right on the beach. The staff was unfriendly and seemed put out by answering questions. Don't try to get into a room early, maybe you can if you pay full price, not sure. The room was tired, smelled of smoke (although was a non-smoking room), cracked tile in the bathroom and the toilet kept running after flushed. This hotel is within walking distance of many places to eat which are better priced. Summary, ok for a day or two, enjoy the pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best money spent.”
Reviews.Author: kperalta5
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I just came back on Sunday. We got an early flight coming in and arrived at the hotel at 11 am- knowing check in was at 4pm we dared to ask about an available room anyways. Luckily there was an available room and the receptionist upgraded us for free. The room was clean- our safe did not work but they came in to fix it within 20 mins. The views from the back balcony was an amazing view. My favorite part was the waterfalls in the pool. Amazing... The staff were amazing. I have no complains. It was truly a great hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, we loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: brookesaunders
Reviews.Content: We found the setting extraordinary, and a world class pool, great beach front with snow white sand, nice staff, and easy location to do other things in San Juan. Here's a video I made of our stay. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oZa5Wi5MgUg

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tsterling
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, helpful staff, lovely pool, quiet beach, comfy beds, great restaurants (Alfredo, Momoyama). Would definitely stay there again. Close to the airport. Be sure to walk next door to see the lobby of the El San Juan, where there is a Starbucks, by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mothermooseCanada
Reviews.Content: We were put up in this Hotel for 1 night before our cruise. It was Unbelievable. Our Room was smaller but the Hotel and Location were Awesome. This is a beachfront Hotel with a Beautiful arrangement of pools before you get to the beach. Small cafe type places off of the pools and beach to eat and have drinks. A wonderful FRESH Sushi Bar. The Beach in front of this hotel is undescriable.!! To See is To Believe! Highly recommend this Hotel. Our Room was Clean and the Food was Def. Acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Sherryann33
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Intercontinental San Juan for five days. Overall, I enjoyed our stay with a few minor issues. The hotel is about 10 minutes from the airport and a taxi ride will cost you between ($11 - 14). Check-in was quick and there was no line to wait in. The staff was pleasant and accomodating. Please note that this hotel charges $100 per night for "incidentals" which they will hold against your credit card until your departure. We had a city view king size room (with a pullout sofa) which easily accomodated all three of us. My major gripe with the room was the smell - it was extremely musty and had a lingering dampness. My allergies and those of my friends suffered quite a bit because of it. For the most part we kept the balconly door open just to get some fresh air. The room could also use some updating (no flat screen t.v....really?). The grounds including the pool and jacuzzi are very nice. Contrary to other reviews we found the beach to be extrodinary! It's true if you walk past the hotel in the direction of the other hotels it is not as nice (but this is a clear indication of how well they take care of their part of the beach). We did not eat at any of the restaurants because we found them to be way overpriced (breakfast alone could easily run you around $40). Instead we visited local restaurants all within walking distance of the hotel (try Mi Casita and Armandos). We visited the Spa and took advantage of the steam room and sauna which is all free. Overall this is a nice choice among some of the other hotels in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Below my lowest expectations”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace to the Intercontinental brand. The building is in severe need of remodeling, the rooms are dirty, and there is no trace of the hospitatality you would expect to be greeted with if you have stayed at any other Intercontinental Hotels. Our two day stay (Saturday 10/8/11 to Monday 10/10/11) began with a 25 minute wait in line to check-in. Four front desk staff stood behind their computers while their computer system was inoperable, while allowing the guests trying to check in to simply mill around, without giving anyone a clear indication of how long it might take to get their system back on, or able to even clearly articulate what the problem was. There was no one to greet guests to detail that there may be a wait to check in, or to even encourage a line be formed. There was simply no consideration given to advising guests of the problem and saying what was being done about it. With the computer system finally fixed, we were able to check-in. My wife and I are Priority Club Platinum Members, which entitles us to a free upgrade to the best available room at any Priority Club Hotel. I booked my room through Priority Club, however the Hotel claimed to not have my number on file. No problem, I brought my Platinum Priority Club for that very possibility. The front desk person checking me in didnt seem to know whether or not he was allowed to upgrade me, even though there were suites and high-floor rooms with water views available (which would have been their best available room, and a substantial upgrade over the King Room that I booked). So he brought the Manager, Irene over to facilitate the upgrade. This is where the true colors of this resort really shined through; Irene didn't want to give me any kind of free upgrade!
