Irene first stated that they don't "have" to give me a free upgrade, and that was at their discretion. OK Irene, way to start off on the right foot. I reminded Irene of the terms of the priortity club platinum program, that clearly stipulate that the upgrade is to the best available room. Irene responded by stating that "We aren't really a Priority Club Hotel, because we are an Intercontinental". But "Irene", I said "here is the Intercontinental logo right on the back of my Priority Club Platinum card, and over there on the counter is an advertisement for earning Priority Club points while staying here". Irene's response to that was something about it being Puerto Rico, and no Priority Club benefits apply here. OK so you get the gist: they won't upgrade you even if you are a Platinum Member. Me? They claimed that the best they could do for me was room 724. This room had a semi-view of the pool, and semi-view of the ocean, being that it was about the level of the tops of the palms. OH yeah, and it was directly across from the elevator. The grounds of the hotel are nice, the pool is nothing you can't find elsewhere for cheaper. In my opinion the Hilton Caribe's outdoor area blow it out of the water, at a fraction of the price. The staff elsewhere in the hotel were fair (although don't ask for two towels at the pool, you'll get a scolding). The only problem I had was when I heard a male and female housekeeping staff on my floor complaining to each other about always cleaning up after Gringo's. I guess housekeeping at this hotel just assumes that all Gringos no comprehende Espanol. Our room was dirty from the get go, but it's not like it was the kind of dirty that I could have asked housekeeping to take care of. Our air vents were caked with dust. The corner of the wall behind a night stand seemed to have never been vacumed or dusted, I cant describe to you what I saw with my eyes in this corner of the room. The bathrooms are nothing you won't find at a yet-to-be remodeled Holiday Inn. Small, cramped, and again dirty. The sprinkler heads had a heavy coating of dust hanging from them. The crown molding in the rooms seems to have been installed with gaps between sections of molding, allowing actual mold, and dust to cake these crevices. There was an actual crack running the length of the ceiling in our room from the sliding window to the wall behind the headboard. I mean these are items in the room that can't be cleaned or fixed by housekeeping, they're just indicitive of a hotel that is old, dirty, and in need of a facelift. Checking out? You guessed right, the computer system was down again! I couldn't even get a simple reciept for my stay, until I waited about 45 minutes! During which time, I actually saw that they were displaying a certificate of excellence from TripAdvisor, ironic. Bottom line, don't go here. Pay a little more and go to the El San Juan next door, or stay in the Condado area. This hotel should be stripped of the Intercontinental brand name. If any of you have stayed at the Intercontinental Times Square you'd know what real hospitality is.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother booking here...Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Lnav2121
Reviews.Content: This hotel may look nice but the management is less then 1 star. They are the worst and completely unsympathetic ... Anyone pls free free to email if u have questions.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best - not the worst”
Reviews.Author: Scott S
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant, if a little outdated. The suite we had was very nice and spacious - clean and tidy. The bed was very much too soft for our taste, but it could have been worse. The staff was generally very pleasant and helpful, but occasionally a little 'slow', as in response times. It is an 'island' after all - running on 'island time' frequently. Location is not particularly close to anything but the airport - you'll need a car or taxi to get to most major shopping/restaurant/attraction areas.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: d d
Reviews.Content: filled all expectations. Clean, quiet, good service and food. A bit expensive on the drinks but you can take a short walk and buy your own if you want. checkin early no problem.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Surprise - Beautiful, Clean and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: PyratCapn
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as an online deal and were pleasantly surprised at how well kept, clean and the friendly the staff was. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Cooperdoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental San Juan for an overnight after a 7 day cruise. I thought it was everything I expected and more! I was impressed with the beautiful, modern lobby, the monstrous pool, and the great access to the pool. The rooms were clean, and the service was fine. The hotel is w/in walking distance of restaurants, and shops (part of the large hotel next door). One negative thing even other guests remarked on....the elevators are extremely, extremely slow. But, overall, great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Island Delight”
Reviews.Author: Eve26
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The grounds were beautiful and very well kept, we observed staff cleaning day and night. The pools and huge hot tub are open 24 hours so late night swims are possible, this is particularly nice because ithere are less young children in the pool then. The waterfall pool was so refreshing in the dead heat of the day. The gym was a bit small so it wasn't that well equipped, it also was not in the hotel but closer to the beach side of the property, however we did enjoy using it several times during our stay. The hotel is on the beach though it is closed off at night. The beach was clean and wonderful to swim in every day. We did not see the problems some other reviewers were complaining about, the water was clear, blue and warm. The restaurants and bars were pleasant, food and beverages were well served and the staff had good customer service skills gladly clearly explaining local dishes that were on the menu. Our only disappointment was with the entertainment, one night it appeared as if the DJ had fallen asleep during a set, overall it could have been more livelyand more extensive. There were many well appointed common areas in the various level lobbies and around the outdoor bars that were comfortable and enjoyable to sit and relax in. Our travel agent mentioned that we were celebrating a milestone anniverary this year -the date was earlier this year. We were delightfully surprised to receive a complimentary bottle of champagne and fruit platter-what a nice touch ! Other reviewers have noted the quoted rate for the included breakfast was high howvere there was no pressure to give a tip nor was an amount suggested . It did apper to me that some guests made more use of the wait staff's services then others. There was a broad range of food choices including eggs made to order. All of the staff we encountered were polite, friendly and seeemd interested in making our stay as comfortable as possible. The location is great, good access to everything .We took the bus into Old San Juan for seventy five cents! We also visted nearby Pionones-what a great experience wonderful food in a very enenergetic atmosphere as well as the Banarios de Carolina a beautiful nearby beach. When we rented a car the main roadways were easy to access. We were pleased with our selection and have recommended the hotel to others and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kevin_makatak
Reviews.Content: Here on business for 5 days. Greeted by doorman/valet/bellhop, everything went smooth. Displayed my Priority Club Platinum card at check in. Nothing. Not even a water bottle. Holiday Inn Express at least recognizes you as a member! Room was clean, A/C was quietly up to the task, instant hot water in shower*, very little noise heard from surrounding rooms, good free internet. I did hear the band from the adjacent hotel where a pool party was happening, but it did not keep me awake. The view from my room on 16 was fabulous. Had dinner in Alfredo's, it was OK. However, the bar/grill on the beach was a home run, we really liked it. *my colleague had room 1618, no hot water!! Bottom line: I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: The room is no better than an average Holiday Inn, pool was dirty, and when it was time to got o bed and get ready for a busy business day, the hotel and casino next door cranked up their live band so loud our sliding door (on the 15th floor) was shaking. We should have been warned The music played until 12:00 am. Hugely disappointing, not worth the money. I am mad as hell!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nothing to wright back home about... not worth the money :o(”
Reviews.Author: Damarys D
Reviews.Content: The resort staff members are very nice and the pool and beach is beautiful. The restaurants are yummy (we ate at Alfredoâ€™s and the upstairs cafÃ©) but the rooms are not to par. They are nothing to wright back home about... very disappointed in the cleanliness of the room and bathroom, Very old and run down. I would not recommend my friends or family to spend their money in staying at this resort. They really need to remodel the rooms. Very disappointed and the next day we moved to a different Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, great pool, nice beach, but overall an overpriced resort”
Reviews.Author: sg4878
Reviews.Content: Having started my vacation at the Marriott Courtyard Isla Verde Resort, the InterContinental was definitely a step up upon arrival: the grounds were much nicer and cleaner; the reception area and lobby beautiful and inviting (except for the mosquitos everywhere!); and the staff very professional. I initially had a king-sized room on the 5th floor near the very end of the hallway. As the three other rooms at the end of the hallway seemed to be all partying together - and the walls clearly being quite thin - I asked for a different room and was given another king-sized room on the third floor. It was much quieter, but lacked a safe in which to store my valuables. After 3 requests over the phone (each was not fulfilled), I finally asked the front desk in-person to have a safe brought to my room (it finally arrived, 3 hours later). The room itself was fine - nothing particularly special, but certainly not a budget hotel room, either. There was clearly some moisture damage around the air conditioning vent, and the bathroom paint was suffering from heaving moisture exposure as well. San Juan is humid, so this is undoubtedly unavoidable, but I was surprised that the InterContinental was as weathered as it is for the price. Paint around the resort was showing its age, and a lot of the metalwork around the place was rusted. The restaurants in the hotel are very expensive, even by Los Angeles, DC, or Boston standards (maybe not NYC standards...). I tried Alfredo's one night and found the service terrible...and I dined there on a Monday evening! The bar and restaurant along the beach was simple, but had decent food, if not a bit overpriced, and good drinks at a reasonable price. The best part about the InterContinental is by far its pool areas - the pool is huge and has several calm alcoves, as well as a water fall, plenty of shaded areas, and nice loungers and umbrellas. There was ample seating by the pool, and the towels they use are very big and fluffy. They seemed to run out of towels quickly, but I appreciated them giving out two to each individual that requested more than one (hence why they probably run out so quickly, but you can't have it both ways I suppose). The beach is quite nice here, albeit a bit busier than further down Isla Verde (toward the Marriott Courtyard)...beach chairs can become scarce, and there really isn't any shaded area on the beach unless you rent a rusty, moldy umbrella for $10 from the resort...and these become scarce as well as the morning turns to afternoon. There seemed to be a lot of families staying at the InterContinental, too, so the beach crowd was a bit noisier than one might hope. Overall, I don't think I'm going to revisit the InterContinental San Juan Resort, but if anyone is looking for a family-friendly pool and beach resort on Isla Verde, it's probably not the worst Isla Verde has too offer. There is a resort fee, and as mentioned before the dining options are VERY expensive, so keep these things in mind before booking. Expect a 3-star experience at 4-star prices and you'll probably be content with your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff Should be Fired”
Reviews.Author: P M
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this beautiful hotelâ€¦ until we checked out. The good: Beautiful hotel, nice rooms. Gorgeous common areas, good location, nice clean beach. Great views from the ocean view rooms on a high floor. The bad: 1) Clientele not of the caliber I would expect for the Intercontinental. Lots of riff raff and ghetto types. Lower middle class abounded. Could be due to cheaper prices during the off-season making it more affordable. 2) BEWARE: The â€œfreeâ€� breakfast buffet that is included with many rooms does NOT include tax or tip!!! They jack up the price to $27 per person for the buffet, knowing that most individuals have it â€˜includedâ€™ in their roomâ€”they charge so much so the wait staff gets bigger tips for doing virtually no work. 3) Inconsistent housekeeping. They routinely left out one or two obvious toiletry items, or forgot to replace a towel. Very strange. We had to ask multiple times to get toiletries filled, and sometimes they just ignored our requests. 4) LIARS AT THE FRONT DESK. Ms. Perez is really a piece of work. When we were checking out, we told her that was felt mislead about the breakfast buffet included in our room, as well as the resort fee. Before booking, I called the hotel to ask about how much the resort fee was. They said 14%, which ends up being ~$20/day. Resort fee was actually 16% we found out, and ~$26/day for us. This isnâ€™t insignificant when you have a 10 day stay! Additionally, when we called before booking we asked for all the specifics around the breakfast buffet, and if there were any extra fees. They said NO, and LIED about the fact that tax and tip (~$12/day) were not included. If you add all this up, for our 10 day stay, we paid almost $200 more than expected. When we told Ms. Perez that we felt misled, she first gave this haughty laugh and said â€œWell they [front desk staff] donâ€™t like to tell people about [tax and tip not being included for breakfast].â€� When we pressed her that she knew there was a problem and hasnâ€™t done anything about it, she got very defensive, and started telling us that, â€œNo, they told you about both of those things ahead of time.â€� Excuse me, but you were not on the call. She then told us that â€œThe front desk staff are trained every day on the script to use with customers. They know they have to tell you about the tax and tip for breakfast, and they know what the resort fee is.â€� She basically backtracked and lied. She first told us that the front desk staff donâ€™t like to tell people the truth about the extra fees, then DENIED that theyLIED! She kept cutting us off and talking over us (extremely rude), and then started saying â€œif you want money back you have to talk to [the travel website we booked through].â€� Actually, we never asked for our money backâ€”we just kept asking her to be honest with guests next time! Eventually we just walked away since it was like talking to a brick wall. Thanks for ruining the end of our vacation, Ms. Perez. You and your front desk staff should be fired. The rest of the hotel and wait staff were at least friendly and hard workers. Stay at the Ritz Carlton down the street instead. You'll be treated much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in a very expensive area of San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_M_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through Priceline! The Intercontinental was a great value and we really enjoyed our stay. The room was fairly clean with modern conveniences. The pool area was just okay - the pool was not heated. Food on the resort was on the expensive side, but the area in general is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the quality of the room”
Reviews.Author: crimscrem
Reviews.Content: We're currently at the hotel. Booked a week long trip. The main areas of the hotel, like the entrance to the hotel, lobby, and pool areas are nice. They are what one would expect of an Intercontinental hotel and the price per night they charge. The room we got is not good. We are not in a recently renovated room. The carpet is very worn and old looking. Bathroom is very small. It's hard with us having our kids here. Very old TV (old CRT). The fridge (which is nice to have) is rusted in various parts. The website says all the categories of rooms have DVD players. Well, our room does not have one. Everything is just very old. Not what I expect for the cost. Also, we keep getting only 2 bath towels even though they know that we have 4 people in the room. They are quick to deliver towels when we call. I have been pleased with the service. The pool areas are nice. The waterfalls are a nice touch and the kids really like the pool. There are plenty of chairs and umbrellas. Isla Verde beach is right off the property. This was one of the main reasons we booked at this hotel. That being said, we're a bit disappointed with the beach. There's a noticeable amount of trash. As others have said, there is a good amount of grass/seaweed that washes ashore. The water is not what I consider clear, and the color isn't what you see in pictures of the Caribbean. Each wave brings in a lot of sand. It's no where near the type of beach and water you find in places like Provo in the Turks & Caicos islands. Back to the hotel, the staff was great getting us beach chairs. Umbrellas can be rented for $10/day at the beach (free at the pool). The area is nice in that there are plenty of places to walk to and grab a bite. But overall, we would not stay here again because of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, good location, mediocre staff.”
Reviews.Author: jlp306
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night after a cruise and getting a deal on the room from Hotwire. The pool area is amazing, full of trees and a great swim up bar. And then steps after the pool you can be at the beach. Both were great but were VERY crowded, mostly wih families. The bellhops were the nicest and most helpful staff. They get an A+! The front desk was unhelpful and the woman atthe "tours" desk didnt know when the El Morro fort closed, which should be basic knowledge. Also the hotel showed some signs of wear under all the pretty furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Trip ruined even before arrival!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl30
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about traveling for not only our anniversary but also for our first trip with our child. I booked my trip through Costco travel. I called ahead to ask the manager if we could be upgraded for our anniversary and was told that we would be in a junior suite. I called the week prior to confirm the reservation and was told that there was no such upgrade. After speaking to the manager, Ms. Perez, she denied ever speaking to me and went to far as to say that â€œIf I wanted an upgrade I would have to pay for it. You have the lowest, cheapest room in the hotel and just because I ask for a mink coat doesnâ€™t mean I get one.â€� Horrified at this response I asked to speak to her supervisor and was informed that no one was available. Apparently the management at this hotel is always out of town. A day or so later I get a call from the front desk manager. After explaining in detail what happened, she told me that I would be upgraded â€œupon availabilityâ€�. Long story short when I got there I was told NOTHING was available. Ms. Orsini the manager gave me a long explanation of how everything was booked. I received a small â€œupgradedâ€� pool side room which had views of the roof. Only half of this hotel is renovated. If we were in the renovated room I would hate to see the other side. Small room, small bathroomâ€¦ dingy at best and hair on the comforter. Having been told all of the ocean view and junior suites were booked I was surprised to see the hotel practically empty. Out of curiosity I checked on a few sites and was shocked to find open rooms all over the place. At this point I decided to call the front desk who kindly told me that I could upgrade to whatever I wanted for $40/day. I was disgusted. Basically the manager was lying to me in order to avoid an upgrade. The only thing she did do was let us use their cabanas by pool. We only ate at the splash bar by the pool and the food was over priced and mediocre at best. Upon arriving home I contacted the general manager about my experience. He told me that hotel was at near capacity and so there were no upgrades. Of course he forgot about the $40/day that was offered to me and the fact that there were only a few guests. I would stay away from this property. The El San Juan seemed much nicer and had many great restaurants and it is right next door. I simply wanted a nice room to celebrate with my family and should have changed my reservation after the first issue.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: 1greatlife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are currently staying at this hotel...just checked in yesterday. I wanted to write the review ASAP so that you could avoid booking here. In appearance, the grounds are beautiful. However, there are multiple maintenance issues with the room. The fan made noise, toilet kept running, no safe in room, no book with hotel amenities. It took several hours to have anything done. We were told some rooms had safes and some did not..they are in the process of installing them but did not know which rooms had them. They indicated the books which would show the hotel amenities are currently being printed. When we spoke with a manager, she lied to us, told us the property was not that big, and we should call the front desk if we needed any information. She was extremely rude. The hotel fixed the fan and toilet and installed a safe in the room. They offered nothing in return for the rudeness and inconvenience! (we are staying in an ocean view room and paid quite a lot). The maintenance staff and bellhop were extremely kind and professional.. Too bad the hotel management is not. The hotel may be a good bet in another few years...if they can resolve the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Working man's paradise”
Reviews.Author: katy562
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here in August and were dazzled by the pool setting, the swim-up bar and the ocean-front lounge accommodations. Drinks were of course pool-side pricey but the service was very good. We met lots of nice people and families, including airline employees and military personnal and their families who were also excited to be staying in a full-service resort. This resort tries to be the only game in town, but with a little homework and an intrepid spirit there are ways to enjoy the greater San Juan area on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: peachyjash
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Intercontinental was great! From moment we got out of the cab, the staff was welcoming, courteous, friendly and accommodating throughout all aspects of the hotel and our stay!! I can't get over the fact how staff was so helpful and really did want to assist in any way they could. The food choices at the hotel were good especially at the Pool bar/restaurant and breakfast buffet. After our first breakfast at the hotel, our server, Francisco remembered the way I wanted things for my group and made sure he had everything ready once he saw us being seated - talk absolute personalized attention!! Our server at the Pool bar, Pedro also went out of his way to make sure we got everything we wanted - we truly were catered to and it was a great feeling!! All the staff were great but these 2 individuals made us feel more special than we imagined possible!! There were a variety of local and chain restaurants within walking distance so it was nice to have options available. Very nice grounds and spacious pool (gotta love the waterfalls), grounds were kept immaculate and the hotel personnel were conscious of keeping it that way. The casino is not much but it was nice to have as a distraction (we didn't mind since gambling is not really our thing). The beach was beautiful!! We were very relaxed and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms could be bit more modernized but they were always clean, comfortable and nicely refreshed. I have to say this experience in PR was quite different from the one I had last year while staying in Farjardo and it was the kind of experience I'm used to having while on a tropical vacation.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Hotel - The right choice”
Reviews.Author: Beachpeach64
Reviews.Content: My sister, friend and I visited Puerto Rico for the first time and stayed at the InterContinental Hotel in San Juan. We narrowly escaped Hurricane Irene and arrived there seeing the aftermath. We were unable to enjoy tours to the rain forest, Luguillo beach and the luminescent bay because of Hurricane Irene, but enjoyed our trip tremendously. The Intercontinental hotel was only one of the hotels in the area that didn't lose power from the hurricane. The staff was extremely helpful, pleasant and willing to do anything to accomodate you. We loved our floor (9th) room custodian, Hilton. The Alfredo Restaurant was excellent for your buffet breakfast and dinner with Ida as our gracious host and many, many more pleasant employees from this beautiful hotel. Please visit them and enjoy your stay....we did!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Papoose55
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 8/22/11 at 2:30 a.m. We were there after the Hurricane Irene hit the island. They had a back up generator. The staff was horrible. Also they gave no amenities to people that stayed there during the hurricane. The staff acted as if it was an ordinary day. The weather was bad. There was nothing to do at the hotel. The hotel did not do anything to make the stay comfortable. It was like it was normal weather. No one asked if we were comfortable or not. We never saw a Manager.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental San Juan Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: regent7
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel if you want to go to other hotels for such things as a casino or a restaurant. The room was fine. Shower ok. The hotel has a nice beach and pool area, however, other than this nothing to write about. There were a lot of airline personnel in the lobby when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatubus
Reviews.Content: The Lobby is nice as is the pool. Only issues are with maintenance. Upon taking a shower in the room, the water came up to my ankles. Either cousin IT stayed before us or the housekeeper did not clean the bath tub for a long time. We got that fixed. I turned the TV on the 2nd day of my stay and it did not work. I checked everything I could but had to call the front desk to get it fixed the next day. The 3rd day, a huge leak came from the ceiling (AC) and a bunch of our stuff got soaked. They fixed that too. Either there is no preventive maintenance being done or we were just in the unlucky room. As for the pool, it was fine, the Cuba Libres hit the spot. The casino was small and they only had 4 dealers, so there was no craps. Also, the comps here sucked also. The waitresses in the casino rarely came by, so we had to get drinks (paid) from the lobby in order to have some. I might try another place next time, even though this was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel w/nice beach and lovely pool-but not really a resort”
Reviews.Author: paintcab
Reviews.Content: There didn't seem to be many all inclusive options in PR, so after reading reviews, I chose to stay in a more urban hotel to have better food options. This wasn't a bad choice at all. Mi Casitas is right across the street and very good. Arianitas and fried pork mofungo was yum. Lupi's is good for drinks, but the food was meh. Alfredo's in the hotel was good-but yes, on the pricey side. We had buffet breakfast included and 20% off any food or drinks in the hotel. Coffee is great! We brought some home. Cafe Meditoranno on the beach is not part of that deal we found out. The pool is very nice, tho smaller than we are used to. We are getting very spoiled. The beach was a pleasant surprise. Very little seaweed and not crowded at all. It was fun to hang out in the waves and then walk right back in to the pool. The room was on the smaller side and was probably the least favorite part of the trip. The fridge froze our water and there was some mold around the ac vent. I told the front desk about my issues and they addressed them right away. Still wasn't 'perfect', but who stays in their room on a trip. No HBO or Showtime was a big dissapointment as we are not casino types. Make sure to keep the balcony door fully closed or the ac won't turn on. Excursions from this hotel will take you longer to get to. They all seem to be out near Farjedo. We took a catamaran snorkelling trip to Iktakos. The boat and crew were all fine, but the snorkelling itself was awesome. Schools of tropical fish and even a sting ray. Very cool. Reefs were in pretty good shape. We also took the bioluminescent bay kayaking trip. This was very cool as well. They take too many people and it goes slow at first, but once you are in the bay it's fascinating. Take the bus to Old San Juan for 75 cents. Totally easy to do and with a map from the hotel, you can do this on your own. If your flight leaves after check out, don't worry about getting the hospitality room the front desk offers. Throw your clothes in a bag and hang out at the pool and when you want to clean up for your flight, go to the spa. There are showers, towels, soap and shampoo. They don't tell you this at the front desk for some reason. Our flight left at 6pm, so we got to be at the pool until 3pm. It worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Pool, but...”
Reviews.Author: keokee98
Reviews.Content: This resort is very close to the airport... If you want to rent a car, the streets are the same as they are in the US. This hotel also has AVIS in the lobby. There are plenty of restaurants in walking distance, a grocery store and drug store. Since we were there during Hurricane Irene, we were stuck in the hotel for the majority of our stay. The bar in the lobby was very crowded and it took forever to get your food once your order was placed. The front desk staff is VERY slow. We asked Room service for a martini shaker and after calling another time and 2 hours later they finally came with a martini :( More pros... The pool was nice, there is a swim up bar, drinks are expensive, the beach is nice, but you have to pay for chairs and the water is beautiful! I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Mix feeling”
Reviews.Author: dgpr07
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I am a local came to stay one night because huracane Irene took out our electricity in our home, no air, no tv, no water you could imagine so we decided to hop down to the isla verde district everything was booked but to our lovely surprise we found availability in the intercontinental. At $367.00 per night plus $25.00 for valet parking I'm thinking VIP baby but when we check in the room to our surprise the air wasn't working, no cable, room looked a bit outdated, look, I'll let the cable situation pass and even the air because they did fix it after 30 min. But I don't get the over $300.00 dlr tag price for such a small room that looks outdated. When I go to the USA I can stay in one of this small hotels for less then half the price and does rooms are pimped. I think this hotel is over rated, over priced if you are going to chrage me almost $400 dlr a night with taxes I would expect too feel really good as soon as I come into that room and I didn't feel that magic that makes your eyes drop when you enter a really nice room sorry guys but I got to call it as it is. At does prices Turist and or local deserve better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ARubins
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the InterContinental Hotel and was quite surprised by my overall experience. My room was spacious and lovely and of course I enjoyed my spectacular view of the ocean from the top floor of the hotel. My only gripe was check-in and check-out. Typically there was only one staff person working the front desk, regardless of the time of day. One would think management would staff heavier closer to check-out (noon) and again closer to check-in (4PM) but this was not the case. I was in a very long line of very unhappy guests during my check-in and ended up taking it upon myself to locate additional staff to man the front desk. Hotels of this caliber should be proactive not reactive. Otherwise, I enjoyed my stay and look forward to returning. I also look forward to a much improved check-in/check-out process.

Reviews.Title: “resort amenities on a budget”
Reviews.Author: escapetheburbs
Reviews.Content: We had two nights planned in Puerto Rico and we were on a budget. We set up our Priceline search using "San Juan" for the hotel area and we checked "resort" under the star rating. Priceline lumps the beach front hotels in Carolina with the Old Town district, so there is a wide variety of properties and a pretty good distance between them. The InterContinental is on the beach in Carolina which is about a $24 cab ride from Old Town San Juan. The public spaces are expansive, attractive and well maintained. We really enjoyed the huge pool and the beach was really nice. We requested an upgrade to a beach or pool view room, however the hotel staff made it clear that there are two kinds of rooms at the resort; renovated rooms with views, and rooms that have not been upgraded. Unfortunately our $110 Priceline room was of course not renovated. Our room was spacious, but a just a little outdated. The fixtures were nice, but visibly worn. The carpets were stained here and there and the vents were dirty. So considering the price, we got what we expected. My only serious disappointment was that the bed linens were not well cleaned, so we found some truly nasty stains of indeterminable origins. It took the cleaning staff a couple of hours to get us fresh linens and they were visibly bothered by our complaint. In a nutshell, for $110/night you get resort amenities and a budget room, so hang out at the pool and enjoy the laid back Puerto Rico vibe. Oh, and be aware of the $17 resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, but also great for business trips”
Reviews.Author: DrPaxil
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here at least 10 different times. I've had some disappointments with the room before but for the most part had a great experience. The current manager seems to want to make improvements. The pool area is awesome! First of all, it has beautiful tropical plants with thick lush plantings. The pool is great with lots of space to sit or lay out. The beach is also very clean and well kept. I also recommend the SPA. Very calm decor, usually there's a special goin for massages or treatments. Above the SPA, the gym looks to the ocean with good equipment selection. If you come to Puerto Rico for the first time and expect US style service, you need to realize how the cookie crumpled in PR. Folks there are easy going, love life and their beautiful island. With that, you need to understand that folks don't get excited, include waiters, front-desk staff, etc. This might be interpreted as bad service. Not true. A smile and a "buen dÃ­a" goes a long way. Enjoy your time at this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: BronxSister
Reviews.Content: Our friends and I just returned from a much-needed vacation at the Intercontinental. The property is clean and well-maintained and the staff is courteous, professional and friendly. Upon our arrival, which was pretty early, we were able to check in. We were able to hang out around the hotel until our rooms were ready - which was also early! My only gripe is that the breakfast menu at Alfredo's was ridiculously expensive ($6 for orange juice; $27 per person for buffet; $4.00 for a cup of coffee!) When we saw those prices, we left the table and walked across the street to Casita where we had a great breakfast for under $10 each. As for coffee, there was a Starbucks in the hotel next door - which suited us fine. Overall, a nice hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Unprofessionalism"”
Reviews.Author: DawnM730
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel, we were greeted and checked-in. The associate confirmed that we would have a king bed. Our rooms were not ready and they would contact us as soon as they were. Several hours later we were contacted that our rooms were ready. We entered a room that had two beds. We returned to the front desk, explaining that we requested a king bed. That's when the rudeness and uncooperation started. The associate at the desk stated that we never requested a king size bed. I asked her to pull our voucher as it clearly stated that we did. After pulling the voucher she then stated that we were told that we could not have a king size bed when we checked in. I explained that this was not true that we had been confirmed to have a room with a king bed when we arrived. Ms. Perez, the front desk manager, now gets involved. She starts explaining that she was trying to accomodate our request to have adjoining rooms with my sister-in-law and brother-in-law. So I asked why we were on different floors? She had no answer for that. The she said, didn't you have a problem with your credit card? You needed to have two credit cards to cover the hotel charges. I had no problem with my credit card, and was offended by her condescending attitude. I stated that there was no problem when I checked in. She then went to check on the computer. I guess she didn't believe me. After checking she said oh it was another couple whose last name started with the same letter as yours. Then Ms. Perez left. I aksed to speak to her again. She was quite hostile. I simply asked for an explanation as to why we didn't have adjoining rooms or the king size bed. She nastily said I already told you. (Which she had not.) After explaining to Ms. Perez that she did not give an explanation she then proceeded to give me a story that another couple was given the room. This turned out to be a lie. My sister-in-law saw who was staying in the room, and that couple didn't check in until many hours later that same day. It was a frustrating experience all because the front desk didn't know what they were doing. The ineptness apparently started with the front desk manager. It was uncallled for. Instead of just saying.... okay we will take care of this and get you a room with a king size bed, I was called a liar, and then told my credit card was a problem and not once was I treated with respect. The customer is always right! Well, not at the Intercontinental's front desk Although the room was nice and the remainder of the trip was pleasant I would NEVER stay at this resort again. There was very little entertainment, limited dining options and a bit boring.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT MANAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: #1METSFAN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for 5 nights last week. The hotel overall is nice especially the pool and beach area. The hidden deal at this hotel are the $9.95 meals they have for lunch and dinner. An unbelievable deal for a 5 star hotel in Puerto Rico where you would normally pay over $20. I am writing this review to commend the management of this hotel in particular Mr.Hector Sanchez and Mr.William Mercado. I had a problem after checking in and Mr.Sanchez fixed the problem and then gave me and my family free breakfast at the hotel which runs about $27 per person. He couldn't be more pleasant and sympathetic to my needs. Also I need to commend Mr. Mercado who is one of the managers of the food and beverage department. He continually would greet me and my family and made sure we were being taken care of either in the bar or restaurants. He is truly a great person and an excellent manager and an asset to the staff of the hotel. My vacation could have been unpleasant if it weren't for these 2 gentleman. They both should be comended and I hope this review reaches both the hotel and corporate offices.

Reviews.Title: “Convience is the Key”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: Positives: convenient location, close to the airport, staff was friendly and attentive, very nice pool, on the beach, close by businesses (restaurants, rental car, drug store), bus that takes you to old san juan in about 30 minutes, 4 restaurants in hotel. each room has it's own balcony. Rooms were ok, not as nice as other 4 star hotels we have stayed in. Feels like updating is needed. Overall hotel was decent. staff was very good, definitely above average. We would recommend to a friend if this was the location they were looking in.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelor84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! Checked in @ 9am-stayed in the tower room with a view of the city-no complaints as I was only in the room to sleep. Still can't figure out why people complain about a room on vacation since one is in their only to sleep. AC was great so was the fridge. Those complaining about the cost of drinks in the hotel didn't figure out there was a supermarket a few blocks from the hotel where u could buy beer, wine and drink it on the beach! The drinks at the bar are NYC prices, however things in Puerto Rico are expensive. The food in the hotel was AMAZING!!!!!! The food was authentic puerto rican-very affordable. Planning to go again shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Experience by Management and Quality of Stay”
Reviews.Author: RubenV76
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel on Priceline.com and got my room for $90.00 a night and I booked 2 rooms for 3 nights then after reviewing the hotel I requested to add 3 additional days to my booking and upon check in I was greeted by a female named Yolonda and she assuured me that she would authorize my credit card for my entire stay to avoid additional charges and then on my 3rd day I awoke to a text of a $150 charge to my card by Intercontinental for additional $150, I then called the front desk letting them know of my disaproval of them charging me again and of course the girl who did this was not in and I asked to speak to the manager and she became combative with me that made me angry and she said that I had to be charged an additional fee of $150 for my stay and that I would be charged an additional $150 on my last stay and I tried to explain what I was told by Yolonda and she would not hear of it. I told the manager that now I had no money to spend on my trip for the authorizations prevented me from having money and she said that was not her problem that I did not have enough money in my bank. I got Irate and asked her for the number to corporate and that I wanted to make a complaint against her and she said for me to come down to the lobby to get it instead of her giving it to me on the phone. I asked to be released from my remainder of my stays to check in to another hotel and she refused and hung up the phone. I then researched the internet and obtained customer relations and spoke with someone about my concerns and now my vacation is ruined as well as my budget for my trip so no reason to go outside since I have no money to spend since the hotel manager wanted to be combative and argumentative. My brother also got a room and his room the bathtub would not go down with the water and the fan in the bathroom did not work and the room had visible sign of water steam in the walls paint and they offered a change of rooms but while we were out since they had no rooms available to switch they called us twice asking when we would be back so they could switch our room and we had to comeback from our tour early to switch rooms. I can tell you that they are rude and unprofessional at this hotel and management would not adhere to what their employee had stated upon check in. My recommendations that If I was you I would run from this hotel and check in somewhere else. I recommend when in San Juan the Conrad Plaza hotel, Caribe Hilton & El San Juan Hotel. Customer Relations gave me a reference # 25149603

Reviews.Title: “So much better for the money”
Reviews.Author: DNiceguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, but for two people looking for fun, and a friendly staff, this is not the place. No nightlife, the El San Juan is close, but why not just stay there. This hotel food is just OK, other then Ruth Chris, but again it's not part of the hotel. If you get a great deal, feel free to stay, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “For great pools & beach access this is the place to go”
Reviews.Author: born4travelCA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the middle of Isla Verde 10-15 min from Old San Juan. A good place to go for couples, older folks and families with older children. All balconies can be opened up and are rather small so I did not feel I would go here with smaller children. Now my son is older, teenager and he absolutely loved the pool and beach area and so did I. Also the pool bars were great; awesome view and pretty. The rooms are smaller and a bit musty; I faced the city side and also felt the room was pretty damp inside. I do in parts contribute this to the carpets, not ideal for carpets in a place where the floors get wet so much due to travelers utilizing the pool and the rain falls in general in that area. Tile would be much better and sanitary. The mix of guests were another thing; this may have been a 4 star clientele and it was when we arrived in the middle of the week; mostly conference attendees etc but towards the weekend the place got filled up with many guests drinking in the hallways or pool and Iâ€™m sure the drinks were not purchased at the hotel but brought from outside. Sort of takes it from a higher level and brings it down a notch. Perhaps the rates are too low over the weekend in order to fill this hotel. Just saying that as I work on a hotel so got an idea. I would certainly be back traveling with teenager or older family members; pool/resort area outside is worth it, (can also be romantic â€“ the sunset outside). Traveling with friends or smaller kids I would choose another venue. Staff was pretty nice, professional attentive; did what they could with what was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Room was moldy - too many extra charges”
Reviews.Author: rwexler
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at another hotel in SJ. The InterContinental has nice facilities outside near the pool area. But we got off to a bad start when at check in the room wasnt ready and we were given a temporary key to use a room for 30 minutes for my family of four (including a 5 and 3 year old) to change clothes in 30 mins - a minute more and we were informed we would be charged 150 USD for use of the temporary room. Not very classy to say the least. Ive stayed at hotels all over the world and never heard of that one. But the worst was the room itself. Do NOT STAY ON THE CITY SIDE - the rooms are wet humid and moldy. The carpets are disgusting. I do not think that it can be healthy. When I asked a woman at the front desk about the wetness in the room she said it was the "rainy season". Yet we've been in SJ during the rainy season just last and managed to have dry rooms. Others who stayed on the sunny side - beach side - didnt have this problem. Also for an intercon surprised they do not have a DVD player or IPAD doc etc which is kind standard nowdays. The breakfasts are good and I suggest if it is not part of your package just pay for the buffet rather than a la carte - as your a la carte eggs and coffee will end of costing about the same anyway (according to others). The pool is nice and my kids loved it. Very happy the casino is off to the side and not so prominent. But the downside was the room. I dreaded returning to it each evening. Also the fan in the bathroom didnt work well so the steam from the shower had no where to go. Concierge was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: AlliVacaGIRL33
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write a review about this hotel because I don't typically stay at super-touristy hotels for several reasons. First, I never hang out in my hotel because I'm always on my agenda to explore the city/country. Secondly, I often do not like contrived hotel chains that do not offer a real feel of the city/country. I think for many tourists these types of hotels are just a way to feel luxurious or comfortable enough to keep tourists within their own comfort zones. I think that's okay for some but just not me. My partner and I happened to have some free nights so we decided to use them! And even though I do not favor these types of hotels, I could not help but to notice the professional staff demeanor and personality. From the concierge, hotel representative, housekeepers and valet...all were very friendly, helpful and respectful. I value this and it made my stay at the Intercontinetal worth it! If you would like to have an easy stay with staff that actually cares about what you have to say and how comfortable you are then this is the place for you. My stay was flawless from beginning to end and much due to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Pools & Beach”
Reviews.Author: The_McSmiths
Reviews.Content: Got there at noon and check-in wasnâ€™t until 4 pm, but they let us pre-register. They held our luggage and allowed us to use the pools/beach while we waited. Room wasnâ€™t ready until 4 pm, but we had a blast enjoying the pools! The people were very helpful with anything we needed. We had a city view room and it was great! We had great views of the city and could â€œpeople-watchâ€�. We didnâ€™t miss having a beach-view in the least! The balconies are only large enough to stand on so you wonâ€™t spend much time on it anyway. There are some larger balconies on rooms adjacent to the pool area which looked like they would be nice although they might be louder. The room itself was plenty large for the 4 of us, although nothing special. However, we spent very little time in the room! Pool area was beautiful! They had a large swimming area, waterfalls & a huge hot tub. The swim up bar was very busy during lunch hours and hard to get service, but you can always go to the beach bar to get something if that one is too busy. They have a huge bar between the beach and pool with seating on a deck under umbrellas or at tables on the beach. So, you can enjoy drinks/food wherever you prefer. Beach lounge chairs are free and comfy. The beach is absolutely beautiful and perfect for swimming. If you want to rent jet skis you can do that just a short walk down the beach. When on beach, we would take a short walk to La Playita to buy a bucket of beers for MUCH cheaper than the resorts on the beach (when walk out of hotel onto beach, turn right and walk down beach â€“ go to end where beach dead ends onto a road and hotel is right there on that road). They would actually just pack the beers in ice in a plastic bag so you wouldnâ€™t have to return the bucket. For meals, we would just go to the strip mall across the street to Mi Casito for some good Puerto Rican food for much cheaper than the hotel. We did take walks down the street in both directions to check out places to eat but didnâ€™t feel very safe. We didnâ€™t have any problems, but the area did seem dangerous & you should be careful. If you need any essentials, you could take a right out of the hotel and not far down on the other side of the street, there was a Walgreens. Right near that Walgreens is a Howard Johnsons that has a restaurant in the lobby, Faccio, with the best pizza! We had pork & plantains for toppings and it was great! As other reviewers have said, check-out at the hotel did take a long time but you can do express check-out if you donâ€™t want to see your bill. If you want to see your bill, I would suggest doing that earlier that morning just to check and then do express check-out later when you are leaving so you donâ€™t have to wait in line for 20 minutes. Overall, we would stay here again! It was just the perfect setting for a relaxing pool/beach vacation and easy to set up tours (Louie's VIP Tours) or take cabs to anywhere else you would want to go.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Isla Verde!!”
Reviews.Author: jlandatty
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times on business and I am never disappointed. The rooms are spacious and well furnished. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the hotel is one of the quieter ones in Isla Verde. Most important, it is right across the street from my favorite local restaurant, "Mi Casita," which features some of the best puerto rican food on the island; try the mofongo, no one does it better. The Isla Verde neighborhood is safe and close to the airport. I love the workout facilities offered by the hotel and the beach is second to none. All in all, this is a great place to stay and the employees are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable, Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Reinaldo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the SJ Intercontinental for our wedding anniversary weekend. Our suite on the club floor was beautiful, the service impeccable, the attentions of the staff unmatched. We live in Puerto Rico and have stayed at just about every hotel, but this one ranks up there at or near the top. Dinner at Alfredo was unforgettable. This is a resort that knows how to keep its guests pampered and happy!

Reviews.Title: “puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: josehmcallister
Reviews.Content: Americans should be conscious of where we spend our vacation dollars. I choose to spend it with fellow americans on the beautiful beaches of isla verde. Warm beautiful green water beaches and friendly puerto ricans willing to help and assist in enjoyable vacation. would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Resort Worthy”
Reviews.Author: nchristo
Reviews.Content: This place was great. It was clean, beautiful, right on the beach and the staff was so friendly. They have a small casino, a beautiful pool, multiple restaurants (one right on the beach) and a great lobby bar that has a $15 happy hour from 5-7 for all the beers you can drink, it was awesome. They also have a fantastic beach with chairs available to all guests. The room was pretty standard but it had a refrigerator in it which was nice. It is in a very safe area, within walking distance to tons of restaurants and bars including the Brother Jimmys on top of the El San Juan and the place we went- Platos Restaurant, that the concierge recommended was amazing. Definitely recommend this place to all people staying for pre-cruise or for longer. The Pueblo supermarket is also very close by to stock up drinks or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but, Small Rooms for the Price”
Reviews.Author: ajc3691
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on company discount and it was well worth it, beautiful location on the beach and pool right there with a bar and restaurant. The only complaint I have is that the place could use a bit of a makeover outside, it's not dirty or anything just that the area looks old and could be redone in a few years. Also the rooms are sort of small if you have four people or more I'd recommend two rooms. Overall a very nice place and had nothing to complain about, nice casino and definitely go to Ruth's Chris for dinner while you're there!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the InterContinental and will be recommending it to friends”
Reviews.Author: empres1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two post cruise nights at the InterContinental in November of 2010 and loved it! Our room was on the top floor and overlooked the pool area and ocean. The staff was very helpful, our room was clean, the bed was great, and the ocean area clean. A visit to Old San Juan is a must. All in all it we had a wonderful time and are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvle2
Reviews.Content: I just loved this place and we will be back next year and my plans are to stay here again. I loved the staff who were very courteous. Our luggage was brought to our room within 5 minutes of getting into our room the young man who brought it in set up our luggage very nicely in the room. Soon after we went swimming and that experience also was GREAT! The layout outside is just awesome and perfect. I truely recieved my getaway...also right in the backyard is the ocean. I would recommend this place in a heart beat. I was able to charge to my room without the hassel of carrying my wallet which was very helpful when at the beach with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “nice room great location, service sucks BIG TIME”
Reviews.Author: AngelDavid32
Reviews.Content: I change my stay to the near by Embassy suites same price a much better customer service and a free 5-7 managers cocktail.The security guys in the intercontinental are very arrogant, have a problem with one of them because my wife forget to get a wrist band for the pool how stupid is this. And the lobby at night is very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable!”
Reviews.Author: princessoftravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental when we were "snowed in" in Puerto Rico coming off a Southern Caribbean cruise. They were very welcoming. The resort is beautiful. We had a view of the ocean and were just steps from the beach. My husband enjoyed watching college basketball at the pool's swim up bar! The Old San Juan Hotel was just a short walk away. We spent an evening there enjoying the music and had dinner on their rooftop restaurant. We were glad to get back to the Intercontinental at the end of the night. The atmosphere at OSJH was fun and noisy, but nice to return to the peaceful atmosphere of the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed at all--better than some reviews said.”
Reviews.Author: mel50207
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice. The beach in front of hotel was warm and nice...the restaurant next to the beach was really fun to have drinks at. Great mojitos. The water in the ocean was full of seaweed to the point where it was kind of gross (for me) to swim, but it's the ocean, it's not like the hotel staff can control that. And it looked gorgeous. Clean rooms and beds. Warm water in the pool. Casino was fine for us even though it was small. We played roulette and it wasn't too crowded, very clean too.

Reviews.Title: “Awful people”
Reviews.Author: ke_jayhawk
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here before we left for our cruise an after one night I couldn't wait to leave. After arriving we waited in a line with only 2 people in front of us for 15 minutes. We were told our luggage would be brought right up. While waiting for it a maid walked right into our room then quickly left after I she saw us. Finally after 30 minutes waiting for the luggage that would be right up I went downstairs. The guys who took our luggage were screwing around and our stuff was sitting in a room. I asked about the maid walking into our room and if we should expect more of this. The lady up front assured me I was wrong and this did not happen and proceeded to ignore anything else I said. Also, if you feel like paying $22 for 2 drinks this is your place. They are far to proud of their food and beverages. I paid $25 and got a plate with 2 shrimp and 2 scallops and a small salad of spinach leaves. Would never ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice post-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: aylee
Reviews.Content: STAY DETAILS May 1-2, 2011 Standard cityview double room upgraded by hotel to oceanview king room Rate: part of a flight+hotel package from Expedia I highly recommend this hotel for its location and the beach. We booked the hotel as our post-cruise accommodation for one night. We got it as part of a flight and hotel package from Expedia for a total of $982 for 2 people. We chose the cheapest room, a cityview double room, but was surprised to see the room they gave us was an oceanview king room. We didn't want to leave! We only stayed here for one night and weren't able to fully utilize the features and amenities of the hotel. So this review may not be as complete as I would want it to be. LOCATION I like the location as it is close to restaurants and shopping centers. However, it is not close to Old San Juan, it was about a $19+ taxi ride. PREMISES The hotel was nicely decorated and clean. There were lots of comfortable chairs and coffee tables in the lobby which was very convenient for us while we waited to get checked in and waited for our tour guide. I like how the hotel area was not too big - easy walk to hotel's facilities. STAFF The bellboys/luggage/porter staff were very nice. They opened the taxi door for us as soon as we arrived and took our luggages from the taxi driver. We got to the hotel around 8am and our room wasn't ready so we had most of luggages checked in with the luggage staff. We had to get stuff from our luggage a few times and they were very happy to take our luggage out and put it back in again. Our room was ready when we arrived from our tour and one of the luggage staff took all our luggages to our room promptly. The front desk staff was nice too, but nothing extraordinary. The lady at the small cafe at the lobby was a little rude. I purchased a can of soda and a donut and she made a face when I gave her the money. I don't know why she did that. I didn't think I needed to tip her for selling me soda and donut over the counter. ROOM We were surprised to see that we were given an oceanview king room (Rm 1620) on the top floor! It was great! The room was clean, though you will see in the knobs that the hotel is a little old. The balcony was very tiny, you can't fit a chair in there. But the view was beautiful! The bathroom was a regular size. A bathrobe and a pair of slippers were provided. There was a fridge that I wouldn't call a minibar because there was nothing in it. The bed was very comfortable. And my husband loved the sofa where he could read his book while I watch TV from the bed. AMENITIES Internet The wi-fi from our room was slow most of the time. There were times that I couldn't even get any signal. My internet connection from my phone was faster. Pool The pool was very nice. The landscaping around it was very nice as well. However, because of the trees surrounding the pool, there were leaves that have fallen on the pool. Beach towels were provided free of charge by the pool. Beach The hotel staff does a great job keeping the beach clean. There weren't a lot of people as well which was great. We were only able to visit 2 beaches in Puerto Rico (Luquillo and I forgot the name of the other) and the beach at the hotel was nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Common areas make this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SPMT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at the San Juan Intercontinental. The hotel is not new and the rooms show it. The common areas of this hotel are what make it worth the stay. The lobby is very nice and the pool area and beach are just fantastic. The moment you step out the back of the hotel to the pool area, you are amazed by the look and the atmosphere. Beautiful pool with falls, good sized spa, plenty of chairs and bars. Even more amazing is the beach area. The beach is public but it is one of the cleanest beaches I've ever seen and you can walk along it for a good half hour. Hotel: As mentionned, the rooms are tired. The view from the room is nice. There are balconies but they are too small to sit on. There are rooms in the pool area that could be interesting if you like to be close to the pool. We did not try any of the restaurants. There is a casino in the lobby area. Location: The hotel is close to the airport but it is quite a ways from Old San Juan. We took the local bus on several occasions to get around. It takes around one hour to get to Old San Juan which is longer than it would take by taxi, however at a cost of 75 cents compared to around $25, it is well worth it. The buses have AC and are modern. You need the exact change which is a pain. Taxis are way over-priced. They have taxis that are reserved for tourists which is a licence to over-charge. There are much nicer hotels closer to Old San Juan but I doubt that they enjoy as good a location on the beach and they are probably more expensive. Just for the pool and the beach, I would choose this hotel over the more modern hotels. Old San Juan: This is worth a vist or two. The place is packed with stores (many jewelry stores) and restaurants. There are a couple of old forts that are worth visiting. You can take a ferry to the Bacardi plant for a visit. It is a bit complicated, take the ferry (50 cents) from Old San Juan, take a taxi on the other side ($3 each way per person, they are waiting for you when you get to the other side). The vist is interesting (free with 2 free drinks including 8 year old rum) but it is a little long. The visit including getting the ferry and taxis took about 3 hours. Restaurants: There is a wide choice of restaurants and prices are around the same as in a North American city. Overall, this was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with the family”
Reviews.Author: ha1968
Reviews.Content: A good place to bring the kids to kick back and to relax on the beach or by the pool. The resort and rooms were clean, the staff very helpful and accommodating and a very safe enviroment for the kids. The pool was refreshing (open 24/7) and the beach is right there and clean. Keep in the back of your mind that you can rent cabanas out for the day (24hrs) by the poolside or a beach umbrella (the sun is strong) - they didn't tell us that these were rentable items when we checked in (umbrellas by the pool are free though). I probably would have passed on the room upgrade and picked up the cabana instead. The food & drinks were good to great (depending on the restaurant you went to), prices were on the high side (no bargains here). I recommend hitting up some of the local places for breakfast (all in walking distance) and maybe hitting one or two local places for dinner or shooting down to Old San Juan for dinner. FYI >> There's a small empty frig in the room where you can stock up on drinks and snacks for when you have the late night munchies or for ceral for the kids in the morning. As for sightseeing, stay away from the tour desk in the lobby (unless you want to spend a ton of cash), and go see Nestor (the concierge). Nestor gave us great ideas on where and when to go and saved us a bundle of cash by us doing the sightseeing solo. I think we will go back again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Case of the missing room then kids in the room”
Reviews.Author: NYYFan27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 6/18 -6/21. Checked out of La Concha on the 18th and drove here to check in. Had 2 rooms booked through Hotwire. Well when I got to the front desk at around 2pm and tried to check in they told me they only had me booked for one room. Showed him my confirmation from hotwire that showed 2 rooms. Then I was told there was only one confirmation number so that meant it was only for 1 room. I told him he was wrong. He then told me they needed to get in touch with Hotwire to try to clear this up. Waited about 209 minutes and the clerk told me they were having trouble getting in touch with Hotwire. I then called Hotwire myself and they picked up promptly and I explained the situation to them. While on the phone they put me on hold and 2 minutes later told me the issue has been solved. I went to the front desk and the clerk did then tell me all was corrected. Why could I get in touch with Hotwire quickly but they couldn't? Doesn't make sense. While checking in I bought up being upgraded to ocean view. Told it was 40/night per room. I agreed to it. Was given rooms on the 11th floor. One was ready one was not. Gave me keys to the one that was ready and proceeded up to the room. Much to my surprise when I opened the door I saw 3 kids in the room watching TV. Not sure who was more startled them or me. Now downstairs again to the front desk and explained that the room was occupied. Now they were very apologetic. The desk clerk couldn't have been nicer. Was upgraded to the 16th floor for both rooms, given a 5pm checkout at no cost and 2 free breakfast's. Thought this was very generous of them. Got up to the room and was pleasantly surprised after reading many of the reviews. Room was great!! What a view. King sized bed looking out over the ocean. Bathroom was spotless. The tub is old but fine. GREAT water pressure. AC worked fine. Very pleased with the room. Beach was good. Not sure about the comments about no cushions on the lounges. All lounges had blue cushions. Very comfortable. Pool was nice and warm. Not cold as some have said. Drinks were very good and priced as any other resort. you do have a fridge in the room and could always keep drinks in there and bring them down to the pool. All employees we encountered were nice. No issues with service. Grounds looked great. Very relaxing. No trouble getting lounges on the beach or at the pool. Food was only so so. Beachside grill has sandwiches, wraps and burgers that were pretty good. Alfredo's not so good. Had dinner there one night and was at best fair. Would not go back. Buffet breakfest average at best. Gave it 4 stars on account of location and pools and room. Must say loved my room.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, better options in the area”
Reviews.Author: farrlynn
Reviews.Content: I was in PR for a wedding. We got a really good deal, which is why we chose to stay at this hotel. We had an issue with our first room, there was a hair in the bed and there were exposed wires in the room. Our room was also right next to a very rowdy group of people. We complained o the front desk and spoke to a manger who told us that the exposed wiring was normal, however when we were moved to another room there were no exposed wires. Their breakfast buffet is nice and the pool area is very nice, but they have a wrist band system and won't allow you to bring friends to the pool, so we spent most of our time lounging at the ESJ pool area with others from our group. Service was sufficient. I would stay here again only if I got another good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location on the ocean”
Reviews.Author: mccainmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting. Hotel is older but comfortable. Rooms clean and spacious. Very close to the airport so very convenient. And even though I could watch the planes landing at the airport, could not hear them.......Hotel has nice pool and beach facilities. A lovely outdoor terrace off the restaurant. Other than catered events only had breakfast in the restaurant. Hard to get coffee from the server during breakfast and had to eventually serve myself.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation @ Intercontinental = Stay @ the Hampton”
Reviews.Author: trooks
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Intercontinental several years ago and were very eager to return for a one night stay before our cruise. We booked our room on HOTWIRE for $179 for a Saturday night. Upon check-in we were told they were oversold and we would have to go the nearby Hampton (this practice has been reported by other reviewers). As compensation, they said theyâ€™d reimburse us the $179, and pay for the room at the Hampton. Initially we were going to argue, but it was after 7 pm and we were tired from the long flight so we took them up their â€œofferâ€�. While the Hampton was certainly nowhere near the quality of the Intercontinental, it was fine for one night. Interestingly the Hampton front desk staff told us that the Intercontinental routinely oversells rooms â€“ and even showed us the stack of â€œover-soldâ€� reservations they had for that night! When we had not received our refund two weeks later, I called the Intercontinental on a Sunday, but was told Iâ€™d have to call back the next day during business hours to speak to accounting. I hung up and called HOTWIRE who called the hotel and immediately credited us the $179. While we did wind up getting a free room for the night, it was not the way we wanted to start our vacation! Shame on you Intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled!”
Reviews.Author: mindvibe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times and it's all been for work. It's not a place I would choose on my own accord. Don't be fooled by the beauty of the seemingly peaceful and beautiful ocean view. That's one of the few things that are worthy at this oceanfront property. Arriving late last night, I go to my room, only to find out that there is water all over the floor in the entry area. I took a few towels and cleaned it up. It was around 1am and I did not feel like changing rooms at this time. I took care of that with the towels, or at least I thought I did. I get into bed and figure I'll watch some tv before I go to sleep. I was looking for the remote and it was no where to be found. After calling the front desk for a remote, the concierge brought me up in one in a very timely fashion. However, when going to door to let him in, I noticed the floor was inundated with water once again. This was not good. I had no choice but to call the front desk and inform them of the situation. The maintenance people came up and advised me that the AC was continuously leaking. I could have traded rooms or slept with no AC. Given that it was now around 230am, I opted to sleep in my room without the AC. I did have a good night sleep though. I did not wake up the next day until the noisy guests in the hall were using profanity loudly amongst eachother. In the morning, I asked the front desk if they could provide me with a complimentary breakfast for my inconvenience of the previous night. They agreed to do that. I then get down to the restaurant, where the breakfast was served until 11:30am. I was told that I had to sit outside because there was a private event inside. No problem. Sitting outside was fine, regardless of the fact that there was not one person in the indoor breakfast area or for the fact that there were throngs of pigeons crowding the nearby tables. I ordered my breakfast from the menu and not the buffet. There was only about 2 other people outside in the breakfast area. My breakfast was a simple egg white omelet with toast. The breakfast took about 45 minutes to arrive. After the first 25 minutes, the waiter informed me that the cook never received the order because the printer was broken. I said ok and just looked forward to getting my breakfast as I was very hungry at this time. A few minutes later, he was nice enough to bring me a plate of fruit while I was waiting. 15 minutes later, when the breakfast does arrive, it was a plate of very watery, undercooked egg whites, with potatoes. The potatoes were good. I guess it's really not that hard to mess up potatoes. I have to also say the coffee and orange juice was good. Upon leaving breakfast, I notice the whole indoor breakfast area was still empty. The special event that I wasn't informed of was probably happening later in the day. Too bad they told me that I had to sit outside because of the special event.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: skymo99
Reviews.Content: I am a Flt. Attendant for a major airline- This is one of our layover Hotels. The room's air condition was not working. That was the good point- I had left my Bose Headset in the room.By the time I reached the airport, I called the front desk-the front desk put me in touch with "Lost and Found" I asked if the room had been cleaned, the security man did not care one bit-I asked if he could go to the room and retrieve my Bose Headsets, and said I would have to wait until after 7pm- to call and see if the housekeeper turn the Headsets over to Lost and Found- I call the Mgr. twice and her reply was I had to talk to Lost and Found- After 7pm- I called and Security stated no Headsets were turned in. I asked to make report- NO ONE at this Hotel seemed to care or wanted to help me try to retrieve my Headsets. If I had to pay for a Hotel in San Juan it would NOT be this Hotel. No one seemed to want to help or care.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location”
Reviews.Author: GSanks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Intercontinental the weekend of June 3rd. All of the hotels in this area are nice. However, they are also older hotels. We usually like to stay in new hotels. The common areas are great. The hallways are dark. Our room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable. However, when we sat on the end of the bed the mattress tilted up on us. We had a room on the 11th floor with an ocean view that was amazing. It rained a little on both days that we were in San Juan. It was very humid. I also had breathing/allergy problems on both mornings when I woke up. I wondered if there was mold or something in the room causing me to have allergy symptoms. My symptoms went away when I was in the common areas and outside. Although this Intercontinental is not like any other US Intercontinental that we have stayed in, we would definitely stay again. We also had a great time listening to live music in the lobby bar in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WANNABETHERE86
Reviews.Content: I had been here several times before, was very pleased, so I had set expectations. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. The refridgerator wasn't on when we checked in, we noticed right away and asked that they have maintenance look into it. Had to call several times before they came to look at it. Turns out it was unplugged (we couldn't see or access plug behind the big amoire, so we waited and waited for 4 hours). Had very small ants in the room. Toilet ran continuously. They now charge for things that used to be complimentary such as the use of cabanas by the pool ($50 day). Drinks more expensive at pool bar than beach bar, for ex., mojito was $8 on beach vs $13 at pool bar!! No more pillows for lounge chairs :-( Service was lacking in general, had to ask for more shampoo and conditioner. Key card didn't always work had to be reprogrammed. City view not too good . . . cab see and hear the jetliners from nearby airport ... very loud. One of the 3 elevators was continually getting stuck but was not fixed the entire week even though they had a full house! Spent way too much time waiting for the elevators.Not much to do in the rain on the resort. Resort website showed daily activities listed for each day, but they only have activities on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Will go back!”
Reviews.Author: bmrgrl76
Reviews.Content: We visited the Intercontinental March 24-27th with two other couples for our anniversary. We had a great time The staff was very friendly and helpful. We even got an updrade to one of the club rooms upon check in without asking for it. It was a very nice. The drinks and restaurants in the hotel are pricey. However, there are several restaurants within walking distance if you choose not to dine at the hotel.
