There is also a liquor store nearby if you wish to purchase your own alcohol to keep in your room. The pool temperature was a bit chilly, but after getting in you'll adjust to the temperature. The beach was not the best, and was good only too relax under an umbrella and have a drink or two. We're not big beach lovers, so that wasn't a big deal to us. We did dine at the Ruth's Chris at the hotel our last night there, and the service was great. We will definitely stay at the Intercontinental again when we visit San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and continue to go back”
Reviews.Author: lborst
Reviews.Content: We loved the quiet surroundings, the beach, pool, restaurants and the poeple. The service was extremely excellent. We have no complaints. It is all good.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE I'VE SEEN IN YEAR!!!TV'S NEEDS UPGRADE YESTERDAY!!”
Reviews.Author: onvacpr
Reviews.Content: First of all i stayed during the memorial weekend,and decided to read first to give my true experience,yes some where loud so what its a long weekend,pr is famous for wild partys!did anybody noticed that there no fights that i remembered in my 2 night stay,3rd eveyone at the outside is always asking in a polite why if we need any help etc,theres 3 people who i remembered very well one is hector,very educated young man and very friendly let me add second there was the front desk agent jenny always would smile and say hi,and never seen these people upset!now for the last person is this man who would never forget my name,when i arrived,everytime i would eat with my family etc,when i left,and i asked him how does he memorizes so many names,the most impressive answer because im suppose too..wow!! Great staff!!just great :)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Aangelosanto
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a family vacation at the Intercontinental San Juan. I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised, especially after reading all of the sub-par reviews beforehand. The grounds were gorgeous: great pool with swim-up bar and beautiful beach area. We never had a problem getting chairs at either location and had beautiful weather (we lucked out since May is supposedly their "rainy season"). The gym was also nice (small but had all of the necessary equipment and was very well air conditioned). One of the main reasons why we loved the hotel so much was the staff. There were 5 employees that really helped make it a memorable trip for all of us. I recommend looking for the following people if you stay at the hotel: Jimmy (bellman) - Jimmy was the first person we had contact with when we got out of the taxi. He was extremely helpful, especially while venturing to Old San Juan (he reviewed a map with me and even marked all taxi stop locations). Jose (was either giving out chairs/umbrellas at the beach or at the pool cabana) - He was very friendly and accommodating while setting up our umbrella (note that the hotel charges $10 per umbrella). He was great with answering any questions we had and we looked forward to seeing him everyday. Fernando (security guard at beach/pool area) - I can't even begin to say enough about him. Despite working at the crack of dawn, he was extremely pleasant and welcoming. My dad and I talked to him every morning (and pretty much every time we walked by him throughout the day). He really cared about the well-being of the guests (he gave me a tip to soothe my sunburn which worked wonders) and went above and beyond for us. Rafael (chef at Momoyama) - I highly recommend Momoyama. It was one of the best Japenese places I've ever been to. The food was delicious (go for the bisuteki style menu). He was incredible and very entertaining while cooking amazing food. He even let my brother get up and try cooking! Freddie (dealer at the casino) - Freddie was the man! We never wanted to leave his table! In addition to being a very patient dealer, he was very informative about Puerto Rico and where to visit/eat/etc. The Mediterranean Cafe was idea for lunches and had great drinks (we recommend the Voodoo). Just beware of the pigeons/birds - they are relentless! The drinks and food did get expensive but there is a foodstore around the block where you can stock up on snacks/waters/alcohol if you choose. All in all we had a fabulous time! I would definitely go back and am glad I didn't take all the negative reviews to heart before I went!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is very dated”
Reviews.Author: Taurian34
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the Hotel in May of 2010.The hotel is ok to stay at...I was not really impressed with the decor. Its a very dated hotel that needs some remodeling. On the other hand the grounds, pool and beach were nice but for the price you can stay at a better hotel. I would recommed the La Cocha, Marriott, Hilton or Condado Plaza Hotel in the Condado area of Puerto Rico unless you want to stay at the Ritz Carlton in Isle Verde. This is just my preference others may not agree but there are more restaurants and things to see in the Condado area and its closer to Old San Juan..

Reviews.Title: “Urban Fiesta was just the icing on the rotten cake.”
Reviews.Author: SunFunSun
Reviews.Content: Sorry, I wanted to love this hotel, but no such luck. Stayed here 11 yrs ago and loved it, but not much done to it since then. We go frequently to visit hubbyâ€™s family, but wonâ€™t be going to tis hotel again for sure. Pros: Good water pressure in shower Towels were large and slightly soft Fast (and free) internet service Lighting in room Friendly staff everywhere excluding the front desk Concierge and computer system to find restaurants VERY helpful. (Thanks, Nelson!) Buffet breakfast at Alfredoâ€™s was very good ($25pp for full and $19pp for continental bâ€™fast) Best part is Intercontinental is in walking distance (next door) to El San Juan hotel and ESJ has great night life on the weekends in the lobby. Fun, open-air sports bar on roof too. CONS: Room condition â€“ dresser was very chipped/beat up; fridge had rusted shelves; dÃ©cor was not logical (Spanish dark wood and large leather headboard with beach colored walls, sofa and pillows.) Mold on shower ceiling So much paint on bathrm door, it did not close fully. Uncomfortable bed and pillows Poor bed linens â€“ got a very bad â€œrug burnâ€� on my elbow when tossing in my sleep in the middle of the night trying to get comfortable Can hear people in next room perfectly clearly when standing in the tiled foyer next to adjoining door with the doors closed. Front desk staff â€“ Very monotone staff, not very engaging, they seemed unhappy to be there. Had issues getting into my two reserved rooms. Got a lot of runaround with being sent to a room that had a burst pipe that maintenance was working on, but front desk did not know. Then got a â€œtemporaryâ€� room â€“ not sure why, but hotel felt they were the greatest in the world for doing this, just meant 3 moves to us. When settled asked what they would do for us (because nothing was offered). Got a blank stare back. Asked to speak to Manager, got a lot of â€œweâ€™re sorry, but we did the best we could â€“ even gave temporary room.â€� Still no comp of any kind. Finally asked, â€œdonâ€™t you even give a free drink for this disruption?â€� Got a free rum punch for each of us (4). Big deal. FYI, I have platinum status with Priority Rewards program, but that meant nothing at this property. Lobby entertainment was boring Thurs and Fri evenings (was not there Sat night, so not sure what happens then.) We were double-charged for one of my two rooms. One room bill was fine. The other room was charged after the first 2 nights of the 4-night stay. After the 4 nights, got another bill under the door for the full 4 nights. Brought this to the attention of the front desk at check out. They said the 2-night statement was just a mistake and the 4-night statement is what Iâ€™d be charged. Not true â€“ charged the 2 nights and then the 4 nights for the one room. Worst of all was the music being played at the beach bar/restaurant. It was for the large group in house, but it was on the hotelâ€™s speaker system at the beach, blasting away for all to hear. It was rap music with the most profound language and horrific expressions I ever heard at a family resort (and Iâ€™m no saint, profanity is in my life, but not shouted in public around families and children as this music was.) I would love to share some of the lyrics with you here to know what the hotel was amplifying, but my post would never make the cut into Trip Adv. Like the last reviewer, we also left the area to avoid the offensive music and general X-rated behavior of the Urban Fiesta group. I know the hotel did not know what they were booking, but they certainly could have enforced a better atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great beach and pool area!”
Reviews.Author: ddator
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on a trip to PR with my Mom back in March. Our room was so nice and quiet, we had a corner room on the 16th floor. Hotel is clean and nicely renovated. I loved the pool area as well, the only thing I would say is that the music was a bit too loud all day long! But really it was nice. The beach outside the hotel was really great too, people selling jewelry and other goodies. Staff was friendly for the most part. Pedro, one of the pool attendants was extremely friendly and helpful. There is also a place to rent cars inside which was very helpful. Ruth at the tour desk was so helpful and also from New York. El San Juan hotel next door has a Starbucks which was great. Overall I would highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and Loud”
Reviews.Author: DCsCharles2007
Reviews.Content: Are you 18-25, don't mind a little plaster in your shower water, enjoy hallway chatter, and like to have your bed shake a little everytime someone on your floor closes their door? Boy, do I have the hotel for you! She's old, she's moldy, and yes folks, she can be yours for the small price of $300 a night. Frankly, I'm a little shocked and suspicious of this hotel's ratings. Tripadvisor, I think they may have duped me!

Reviews.Title: “terrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: harvey32655
Reviews.Content: after checking in, went up to the room and the room key did not work. as luck would have it, my room was at the very end of the corridor. went back to the ckeckin desk and was given a new room key. upon entering the room i found the room was already occupied! i hauled my luggage back downstairs to the front desk. and not so much as an apology was given. the gentleman at the front desk escorted me to my new room, which was an ocean side room, but could not actually see the ocean as there were a lot of palm trees in front of the window. again, after being escorted to my new room not one word was spoken by the hotel employee.............. that's the definition of terrible service!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing rooms and breath taking views”
Reviews.Author: jjcoello
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the intercontinental. We were lucky enough to have an ocean view room on the top floor of the hotel! The room was VERY spacious with a King bed and a small sofa coach. When we were tired of laying by the pool or ocean we relaxed in our room with our balcony door open listening to the waves. During our three night stay we indulged in a couples massage, a must to complete this romantic vacation! I'm only giving this hotel 4 stars because we were disappointed in the service and prices.

Reviews.Title: “We love Nestor!”
Reviews.Author: benitez22
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got to the hotel, Nestor our favorite consierge took us in and took time to tell us where to go waht to do and how to do it! He was great and we had the time of our lives! Rented a car on our first full day and saw El Yunque and swan in the waterfall, visited Luquillo Beach which was full of color and beautiful landscaping, and then went to Colebras (?) for a kayaking tour to the bioluminecent lagoon, which was exquiset! We also got a history lesson at the Bacardi Distillery and the forts in Old Saun Juan which was very meaningful to us as Puerto Rico is part of our faily heritage. Loved the architecture and colors of Old San Juan, took the bus there 2 days in a row from the hotel, locals are very friendly and will tell you were to go for the best of what ever you are looking for. We found most people speak English and Spanish. Our favorite place to eat was in Old San Juan it's called The Latin Roots it's behind Senor Forgs near the piers, food was excellent and authentic and service was good, prices were not bad either :) We CANNOT wait to go again and will absolutley be staying at the Intercontinental again, the landscaping on the property really brings in the elements of the island, it was beautiful and we loved our beach! Pool bar, is pricey we paid $85 for 7 drinks, it was nice but and the bar tenders are really good and friendly. We learned quickly though to go to the Super Max which is the market that locals use unlike Pueblo which is pricer because most tourists use it. HAVE FUN and get out everyday! Puerto Rico is a beautiful island go see it! Gracias Nestor!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Casino”
Reviews.Author: mfmlrlf1
Reviews.Content: Tourist be careful with the casino. They make their own rules. Played poker there on a trip and the dealer mucked my hand during showdown because I turned one first and then the other when I had the winning hand. It was a big pot and they didn't even check the cameras. The dealer paid the local player without even calling the casino manager for review. Supposedly it was an "automatic muck" because the cards weren't turned exactly at the same time. Go somewhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: kb854
Reviews.Content: Following a cruise we spent two nights at the InterContinental, and had a marvelous time. The check-in policy, starting at 4pm, is exactly what is meant. We arrived about 45 minutes prior to that time, but could not officially check-in until 4. The room we were assigned had a slight plumbing problem so we were pleasantly given an upgrade room. The room was very clean and well appointed. There was some noise heard from the adjoining room, but mainly when they had their balcony door open. The pool area was wonderful. The fitness spa has the basic equipment, but it is well maintained and quite new. There is a rather private beach area with a good supply of lounge chairs. Though the hotel has several very good restaurants, a casino, and a gift shop, their location is within walking distance to other restaurants, shops, etc. A two night stay is barely enough time to enjoy the hotels many offerings. I certainly recommend staying here and would readily stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review from visitor”
Reviews.Author: acana3
Reviews.Content: I visited the Intercontinental San Juan last Friday, April 29th. The lobby looks amazing and so does the pool and beach area. A bit cramp the pool area but there was space to get away from the crowds and children. Lots of tress and the beach was great. We actually went in for lunch and ate at the Beach restaurant. The food was awfully BAD. It was so bad that it ruined my day since I got sick from eating the food, luckuly it only lasted that day. The food was priced like any other beach front hotel but you can probably eat better quality food at a food chain. Awful Awful Awful and is very sad since the view, the waiters and the atmosphere were perfect. Since we didn't stay in the hotel, it is only fair to review what we saw and from my experience I would like to go back and obviously stay AWAY from the beach restaurant. Parking is $16.00 dollars a day and is very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst Intercontinental ever!”
Reviews.Author: novadancer
Reviews.Content: Terribly disappointed in the Intercontinental brand after staying at the San Juan location. We were here for a wedding and I don't know if it was the fact that we had a "group" rate, but the room was horrible! First, we requested an early check in and late check out several months in advance. However, our room wasn't ready until after 4 pm (regular check in). The pool was never overly crowded so I find it hard to believe they didn't have a pool view room ready! And we certainly didn't wait until after 4 pm to get a room directly across from the elevator and housecleaning. The noise from guests getting off the elevator late at night and then first thing in the am from house cleaning meant little sleep. And the rooms are paper thin - we could hear conversations in the next room. none of the lamps worked in the room - I had to request service on them and the room didn't come with the standard directory (room service, amenities, etc). I even asked the front desk for one and they told me to call room service and they'd read the menu over the phone. So the hotel lost my money as I wanted to get info on the spa. The pool had debris in it EVERY day, so it's unlikely they were skimming the pool daily. I would never recommend this to anyone and had the wedding not been at the hotel, would most likely have immediately changed hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Party Hard, Not Fun”
Reviews.Author: touristwoman
Reviews.Content: I was to have a room poolside, with direct walkout to the pool. The pool was super crowded, not a single chair to be had anywhere, and the chairs packed in too tight to move. Loud, blaring music and cloudy pool water turned me off. The beach it is located on is large and beautiful but a bar on the beach blocks the pool side view to the ocean. My room was super loud with screaming partiers, and though I like to have a few drinks I didn't enjoy feeling like a piece of meat for the many drunk dudes. I expect that this hotel would be much nicer during a time when crowds are lower, then it might even be very relaxing but I was there during spring break. There were some service problems with the ambassador level check in and I was left waiting for several hours into the late evening with a check in problem though I had previous reservations. I departed much sooner than I had intended and I enjoyed the Hilton Caribe much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: trichter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for three nights. The location at the beach is nice, the beach also. But the rooms are in an ubelieveable bad condition. We had a seaview room on the 11th floor, the carpet is dirty, there is mold at the wall near the air condition, there is no minibar, just an empty fridge which is dirty and rusty. There is dust everywhere and an empty bottle behind the dresser... We stayed in 11 Intercontinental Hotels before and we were always satisfied but the one in San Juan is really not worth to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing but some service issues...”
Reviews.Author: 6van
Reviews.Content: Switched from the Ritz to the IC for the location and value - Ritz not worth the premium price. My wife and I stayed 4 nights during Easter break. Club Room worth the added cost, ultra quiet and decently appointed, as well being perfectly situated, along with special service of cocktails from 5 to 6 for club guests only. Hotel grounds are lovely, immaculate and beach is first-rate. Perfect location with top restaurants such as Ruth's Chris Steakhouse (in hotel) and The Palm next door in the El San Juan. The only deficiency in our stay - and it's important to consider - is apparent under-staffing in certain venues, especially during breakfast service. Also it was inexplicably difficult to make a simple restaurant reservation being phone switched around excessively. Security and housekeeping were fine and everyone was very friendly. If the service issues are remedied, I would rate it 5 circles, but will recommend anyway giving it four and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Pool area, great customer service, watch out for hidden taxes on final bill!”
Reviews.Author: Noni72
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel are lush and tropical, when you are at the pool you feel embraced by the gardens. The pool is refreshingly cool water. Isla Verde Beach is wonderful. The hotel itself had great customer service, especially in the morning, and at the beachside restaurant (Cathy, Cathrine) - recommend the Mojito - best we had on our vacation. Would encourage visitors to go into Old Town (taxi round trip $40 or bus .75cents!). The bus takes longer, but great people watching. The only downside of the bus, is that there isn't much of a schedule, busses run somewhat infrequently, but there is a bus stop right in front of hotel, take T5 or 53, both will bring you righ into Old Town near Pier 4, and you can walk several blocks to the wonderful culture of Old Town. HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend Triana restaurant - live music and flamenco dancers Fri/Sat - great atmosphere and the food was the best we had the entire week. We also utilized Ecoquest tours for the kayak/zipline adventure which was awesome - despite my fear of heights. Also, the rainforest tour arranged through the consierge was well worth the $53. Unfortunately, we ended our vacation discovering that there was an addition 11% and 16% tax added to our final bill ($780 in taxes mind you) that we were not prepared for, so that stunk! The people of San Juan are beautiful and kind, cannot wait to go back in years to come for another visit. Also, to use the "business center" you have to pay to use the internet, that seemed absurd for how much we paid to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Beach”
Reviews.Author: Ab42187
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Puerto Rico at the Intercontinental San Juan Resort & Spa earlier then we could check in so they let us use the facilities while they got a room together. We loved the pool area. It is extremely nice and relaxing. The only downside was there did not seem to be enough chairs for everyone. The beach area was also beautiful and extremely nice. We were close to a handful of restaurants and other resorts that offered restaurants. The hotel itself has an awesome outside restaurant right on the beach that serves pretty good and inexpensive food.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice pool & beach, great location!”
Reviews.Author: abledotbaker
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly and helpful. I read the other reviews and I can't believe anyone had a problem with the staff here. They have gone out of their way for us many times. Rooms are clean, beds comfortable. Rooms have coffee maker, iron, hair dryer, fridge (no expensive minibar - you stock it yourself!). We had an ocean facing room this time (trip number four) but other times we had the South facing rooms, which have a great view of city, planes coming in and the Laguna San Jose. There was live music on the deck for an event the first night of our stay but every other night was pretty quiet, even though the hotel was pretty full. Restaurants are excellent but pricey (as are ALL the hotel restaurants.) Just across the street is Mi Casita restaurant were we went for breakfast EVERY day we could. Inexpensive and great food. Good for dinner, too. The area is pretty safe at night and you can walk to a bunch of eateries, grocery stores and lots of fast food places, if you are so inclined. Downside? Balconies are small. Can't think of anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations.”
Reviews.Author: maximus1020
Reviews.Content: I almost had a meltdown trying to choose which place to stay when booking this vacation. I chose the intercontinental on a recommendation and I was not disappointed. The location was great. The beach was amazing and the pool was beautiful equipped with waterfalls and swim up bar to drink and eat food. The rooms were clean and didn't have a problem with bugs, mosquitos or anything like that. The continental breakfast was great and did the job. It was also really relaxing eating outside right before the pool. The local restaurants hit the spot especially with Mofongo. The best part of this place is the staff though. They are all so friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to make you feel welcomed and to give you a very relaxing experience. Also, the drinks they bring you were out of this world. We did the night kayaking to see bioluminescence bay which was so cool. We are definitely coming back here. Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, great beach and great location”
Reviews.Author: CJD67
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute getaway Apr 18 - 22 and really enjoyed the InterContinental. Check-in was very smooth thanks to Yvonne at reception. The grounds are extremely well kept - lobby, pool and beach. If you are lucky, Nestor will be the concierge when you have any questions. He REALLY knows the area and helped us with restaurants, directions, and a great last minute car rental from Charlies which was 4 blocks away. There is a 24-hour Walgreens 4 blocks to the right, and a liquor store 4 blocks to the left. Have dinner one night at Platos, authentic Puerto Rican food a few blocks left of the front entrance, and try a pitcher of Ana's coconut sangria. One morning we got Starbucks right next door at the El San Juan hotel, and took the public bus to Old San Juan. The bus was only $0.75 per person, but took about 40 minutes. We took a $20 cab back and was about 25 minutes. Cab fares aren't metered, but depend on how many people and what zone you travel to. The pool can get crowded, so be patient if chairs arent immediately available. There is always turnover. We never had a problem getting chairs on the beach. Our room was ok, and just beginning to show its age. TV reception is weak and not hi-def. Lastly, they whack you with a 'resort service fee' which happened to be 16% of our daily rate. In addition to the 12.7% occupancy tax. We were aware of this as others have posted, but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lovely, but receptionists think they are better than their clients”
Reviews.Author: Nuni1982
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great, really nice swimming pool, jacuzzi, beach to die for, sand is so soft!! Try the cocktails they are really nice. Only downfall was their reception staff who were so rude. No help what so ever. They look at you as if they are paying you to stay there. When we asked where the toilets were the response we got was go ask the concierge. Rooms are very old and can do with modernising. We wasted a whole day waiting for the rooms to be made. Check out is at 12pm so surely it does not take 4 hours to clean rooms for the check in to be at 4pm. As a well known hotel, i thought that their turn around time for rooms should be a whole lot quicker. I would not call this a 4 or 5 star hotel. Location was good as they had taco bell, chillis, lots of puerto rican restaurants around. Next door was the waldorf astoria which was a million times better.

Reviews.Title: “Beach front, but not San Juan”
Reviews.Author: kendrac21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, a little older but we enjoyed the pool and beach. The rooms are plain but have a large balcony. The area around the hotel is very poor. If you never left the hotel this would be perfect, however if you like to explore, I would recommend staying in San Juan. The parking is misleading. They make it appear that hotel guests park for free but at checkout you pay an additional $16 per day plus extra resort fees on top of everything. We won this hotel on priceline bidding for $115 a night and that was a great value vs. $250+ as advertised. I would recommend this hotel because the pool and beach were so nice but only if your not paying full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Night Precruise”
Reviews.Author: pops_porter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a night before getting a cruise and it was a great start to our vacation. The view of the ocean from our room was great and the rooms were very adequeate with a desk, couch, chair, coffee table and nice bed. The bathroom was clean and very adequate. Check in was a breeze and there are plenty of places to eat on the property and in the area. Would definately stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: NeroFlash
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel for one night before a cruise. I contacted the front desk and let them know my other party would arrive before me and to let them checkin to the room. Everything went smooth. The hotel bar right of the beach was really great. The pool was great and the beach was very nice. The staff was polite and helpfull. The room was confortable and the internet work great and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: ElectricMayhem
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Intercontinental for a relaxing long weekend in the sun. Was not disappointed. Best part of the stay was the staff. Everyone we met at the Intercontinental including the front desk, bartenders, wait staff, blackjack dealers and bellmen were friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in Isla Verde, about a 10 minute drive from the airport. Taxis costs $10. The outside of the hotel is first rate. Very nice landscaping throughout the facility. Great lobby. Large pool area with plenty of seating and a variety of pools. Very nice beach with free seating (though they do charge $10 to rent an umbrella for the day). Water sports are not available from the Intercontinental, but there is a place to rent wave runners or go parasailing about a 5 min walk down the beach. Rooms were very nice. Bed was extremely comfortable and there was a decent sitting area. Free wifi is available. Food was pretty good as well. We got the breakfast included (which is a smart move because it is much more expensive otherwise). There are restaurants offering salads and sandwiches beside both the pool and the beach. We also ate at the Ruth's Chris steak house one night, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable and Pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Elois4u
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay first and then read the reviews which made me a little nervous because several people said that the staff was rude. I must say that the hotel was incredible and the staff was overly friendly. The doorman, pool hands and the front desk were my source for great dining and nightlife away from the hotel. I chose this hotel for the beach location and boy did I get more than I bargained for. AMAZING!!!! Isla Verde by far has the best beach when you compare them to the Condado or Old San Juan. If it's beach and pool are what you're looking for stay here and just take the bus or a taxi to Old San Juan or the Condado area. I would never take a cab to the beach. Some people complained that there wasn't any night life. Maybe if they would've talked to the staff opposed to looking down on them they would've found out that there is tons to do within minutes of the hotel. You just have to ask. I actually had more fun in Isla Verde opposed to Old San Juan. One of the Old town's bars closed at 11 and the other was Senor Frogs which I do NOT consider a club. Check out "Q" and La Placita if you're in your 20's-30s. Club Bravo is an 18 and over club located next door in the El San Juan hotel which had a line that was wrapped around the block....it opens at 10 p.m. If you're older you can enjoy a live band and salsa dancing in the lobby of the IC or the ESJ hotel. Do both in one night....you're on vacation. Restaurant to check out is the Atlantica (google it for the full name). OMG...amazing. The Paella was a little salty but the seafood was extremely amazing. I tried Aquaviva in Old San Juan..the food was good but they're more into presentation than portions. Im into portions. However, the little food bits were tasty...just not filling.

Reviews.Title: “Good trip...”
Reviews.Author: uga_travel
Reviews.Content: The pluses were the location, the pool and the proximity to the beach. The minus was the lack of a nightlife style scene in the hotel. The good news...the El San Juan hotel Waldorf down the street has a bar scene on Fridays and Saturday night strong enough for every hotel in P.R. Good trip. I'd stay at this IC again....(oh...the elevators are painfully, painfully slow. But that's the only real negative worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Ritz instead! The Interconintal is sure to disappoint!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kspadegal
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were so excited to take a vacation to San Juan. The photos of the Intercontinental look great online; however, you won't get 4 star accommodations nor courteous service. Bait and switch! A motel 6 is more like it but w a better pool. And the mgr wouldn't let us leave even though we didn't stay in the room. When we were shown our room, we cried. A horrible hotel and a horrible person to deal with. Run fast and far and tell all your friends to stay elsewhere too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient, friendly”
Reviews.Author: ourvan
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is thankfully close to the airport, as we didn't arrive until after midnight. Check-in was smooth, and after a quick tour of the grounds (pool/spa open all night), and my personal excitement over hearing the coqui frogs, we retired to the most comfortable hotel beds I've experienced in a long time. We opted for the mid-price range "lagoon view" room, which just means that you're on the city side of the hotel, but high enough to see the lagoon. (see attached picture - view from balcony). We didn't find the airplane noise to be bothersome, and actually enjoyed watching planes land. The balcony is very small, and would be my only gripe. We like to sit outside and drink our morning coffee when we're vacationing, and that was out. Not a huge deal, as we were up and out to enjoy the day. Loved the large, fluffy bath towels, and the shampoo/lotion/soaps provided had an incredible scent. Oddly enough, there is also a scale in the bathroom - like I really want to know how much I weight while I'm on vacation!! We enjoyed many a delicious breakfast at "Mi Casita" in the shopping strip across the street (scrambled eggs, bacon, cheesy potatoes and toast was about $4-5). Actually, we ate lunch and dinners at Mi Casita, too - great food, very reasonably priced/good people - they have delicioius traditional PR/Cuban food - mofongo and asopao, as well as "American" staples - hamburgers and pancakes. Also across the street - Baskin Robbins, Subway, Church's Chicken, Burger King, Ponderosa. (The convenience store referenced in other reviews is currently undergoing renovations - not sure if it's going to be a store or not when completed). Our "special occassion dinner" was experienced next door at the Old San Juan, at a restaurant called Koco's - delicious and memorable, recommended and arranged by Nestor, the Intercontinental consierge. You can't go wrong with advise from Nestor - find him in the lobby to the left of the front desk. Charming and knowledgeable - he'll take good care of you! Spent a day in Old San Juan - took the local bus there (75 cents/ea - exact change needed) and a taxi back. The bus was safe and air-conditioned and terminated right at Old San Juan after traveling through the neighborhoods. Nestor will outline a walking tour for you and tell you where to find the best restaurants and which trolleys to get on once you're there. We were only there for 3 days, so didn't do any other tours, but spent the rest of our time back at the Intercontinental for pool/beach time. The pool is clean and refreshing, with plenty of chairs, and I was excited to find real size beach towels. Because you receive a wristband, different colors each day, the pool area is kept free of "passers-through", and the beach is fairly private. There are some game tables (ping pong, air hockey) in the lobby by the pool, but unfortunately they're only available until 6 pm. If you're traveling with family and can't utilize the casino for entertainment, there isn't much to do in the evenings. Luckily, my kids are happy to hang out in the spa or plop in front of the TV...

Reviews.Title: “Pool and beach areas were awesome!”
Reviews.Author: GOPHERATRIP
Reviews.Content: We've been back from the Intercontinental for week now and we'd already love to go back! We weren't sure how things were going to go at check in. We got to th hotel around 3pm. The bellmen were very helpful and pleasant. They showed us to the front desk. There were 2 people in front of us and 2 groups came up behind us. Only one person, a man, was working. It took a good 10 minutes for us to get to the front of the line. Once there, the man did his job, but was not overly helpful. He did not answer our questions very thoroughly either. At the beginning of the check in process he told us our room was not ready. Shortly thereafter he told us our room was ready. There was no offer of an upgrade as so many other travelers had mentioned. We didn't care. We just wanted to get out to the beach! We didn't know how the towels worked at this point but found the cabana on the way out. The staff there was willing to answer questions, gave us towels and a security wrist band. We appreciated knowing that people who weren't staying there couldn't use the facilities and others couldn't wander through either. There were plenty of chairs on the beach and in the pool area. We never felt like we had to rush out early to find a place. We were in room 1105. The room itself was fairly small and basic. There was a king size bed, a desk with a chair, 2 nightstands, and a combination dresser/tv stand. Down the hall was the bathroom and a closet. The long hallway from the door past the closet and bathroom to the main space seemed kid of a waste. The furniture was exactly as pictured on line. Both it and the tv are in need of updating, but it was perfectly fine for our needs. The carpet, stone floors and countertops were also showing wear. Yes, the rooms could use a facelift, but they were clean. Housekeeping always came while we were out and made sure everything was replenished or replaced. Our safe worked just fine and we used it every day. We were also glad to have refrigerator. The balconies are super small. We had a mountain view and enjoyed watching the planes land. We live by an airport so none of that bothered us. The only time we noticed was when we were on the balcony or the beach. No big deal! We sat on the floor of the balcony, but I wish they would get a small table and chairs set. It could fit. Part of the package we booked from Cheap Caribbean.com was a 200.00 resort credit. We used it many of the places we could and had money left over at check out. The drinks and food were no more expensive than what is expected in a nice restaurant or resort. The food at the wine bar and Alfredo's was very good. We did not eat at other restaurants on the property. We did eat at the Mexican place down the street. It was ok. We also ate dinner at Mi casita one night. The mofongo was horrible. We did find a liquor store, Mad Dog's down the street. We also found the Pueblo grocery store. Walk to the left out the front of the hotel. Go down to Chili's and walk along the side of the building until you have to turn right. Walk along the back of the building and into the next lot. It is next to a bank. It was cheaper for liquor and had lots of candy choices for souvenirs. The staff was basically very friendly and helpful, especially the women. Some men were a little more dismissive and didn't want to take the time to be helpful. Maria at Avis was extremely friendly and helpful. So was the bell staff. The tour desk would answer basic questions but really wanted to sell tours. At check out there were 3 women working. We had gotten a preliminary bill that night before with preliminaries on it that were wrong. The food charge was applied to the resort credit. There were also 3 days of self parking on the bill. The problem was that we hadn't had a car on 2 of the 3 days they said we parked. 2 days were credited and our bill was corrected. They also gave us advice for bringing shells back. property. Get the drink in the bucket. It was very tasty!

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Puerto Rico...will be back for sure! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CarmellaOhio
Reviews.Content: A quick 5 days, awesome beach, excellent service and family friendly

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of anything to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: soontobeforty
Reviews.Content: After combing reviews for weeks, I didn't know what to expect. Booking through Priceline always leaves some uncertainty. We went prepared to pay the $200 to purchase the Ambassador Club to upgrade our room. This which amounted to an extra $50 a night still substantially less than the rack rate. It was well worth the extra cost. Check in was quick and easy. We were given room 1622 which right below the 3rd "N" in the name at the top of the hotel. Our view was wonderful, our room roomy and comfortable for 2. Yes, you will have to pay the resort fee ($17.92 a night). At other hotels, we might have had to pay for chairs on the beach, internet and the fitness center but the resort fee covered this at the Intercontinental. We enjoyed the beach for walking and sunning. The pool is cool but refreshing when it is 90 degrees. We ate at the pool restaurant (excellent burger and salad!) and Momoyama for sushi (great rolls!). Yes, both were expensive compared to eating in Ohio but what I would expect eating at a beach resort. Only issue we had were the people in the next room smoking on their balcony which blew into our room. Security was called and they were asked to stop. I used the fitness center 2 mornings, It was very well appointed and more than adequate for our short stay. We rented a car for 2 days to visit the rain forest (wonderful hike to the top of the mountain!), scuba dive nearby and the bio-bay tour (highlight of our visit to PR). Parking was $16 a day. We took a cab into Old San Juan which was easily caught in front of the hotel for $20 each way. Overall, it was a great visit at a great hotel. I'm glad we stayed at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: mpgenco51
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a 5 day trip to Puerto Rico. The choice of the Intercontinental-San Juan was the best. The location is just 2 miles from the airport. Our room, which we upgraded to Ambassador level, put us oceanfront which had a magnificent view & included a sofabed & large club chair. The bathroom was a little small, but the extra vanity by the closet was helpful. The staff at the pool & beach area were very helpful. For travelers with children there are nearby chain restaurants: Chili's, Burger King, Ponderosa. A large grocery store 3 blocks was great to buy snacks & bottled water, cheese & crackers, yogurt, which we could keep in the fridge in our room. The taxi service in Puerto Rico is quick & clean. There is a public transportation stop just outside the hotel for sight-seeing such as Old SanJuan for $.75, but allow about 40 minutes each way. The best part of the trip was the ocean & pool areas & having our 4 p.m. pina coladas under our umbrella ($10. daily rental). Go & enjoy this great spot.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: bq327
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year we have stayed at the Intercontinental hotel. Amazingly, many of the staff remembered us and gave us a warm welcome. Everything about the place is great maybe a little expensive but a safe place to stay. We will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lots of improvement needed”
Reviews.Author: uccman
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked this trip through a natonal website vacation program..we were very excited to be staying in a five star hotel.....we arrived on a Friday at about 2 pm and there was a huge line with only two staff members working...we were then told our room wasn't available but would be shortly and we left our cell phone number..several hours later, we had not received a call, so we went to the front desk and got our room....the clerk was obviously very impatient and just handed over the room card without saying a word The room was clean but surprisingly small..the king size bed basically took up the whole room...it basically seemed like your average budget hotel room with no amenities..we then went downstairs for our free drink (given for the wait) and had to wait almost a half hour to get it The pool area was very nice but the beach was sparse with no activities,and there were not even umbrellas in sight for the beach....there was no service as you might expect for drinks or food, probably because of being understaffed...the only time we really saw staff was every five minutes at the lukewarm tub (never hot) chasing kids away that were in the tub The best part of the hotel was the location.....it was near the airport and in close proximity to the more elegant El San Juan next door (we spent more time there).....the service at the Intercontinental was very poor and needs upgrading...finally, at the very end of the stay, we were told that we had a $200 food and drink credit that we didn't even know about-which would have been something nice for the clerk to have mentioned when we got our roon in the first place......if you can get a similarly priced roon at the El San Juan or Embassy Suites nearby, I would opt for it

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: tchizl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 25-feb to 3-march. The first day we got their early and our room was not ready even though I had called earlier to let them know. so we had to wait until check in time. It was ok though because we just ate in the lobby bar. The food was very good, but pricy. as it is at every hotel. when we got to our room it was very small. the hotel was sold out so we could not change our room to ocean view. we got the worst location ever! our room faced the front of the hotel. we heard people and very loud airplaines when we opened the sliding door. we could not hear it though when the door was shut. The bed I loved, very soft. My husband couldn't sleep at all for that same reason. During our trip we enjoyed the pool. We only went in once cause it was a little chilly. There were always avail. chairs. good service for getting drinks. it was a beautiful area. The beach is 10 steps from the pool and is nice. Good sand and water. good to swim. One lady got stung by a jellyfish though. Theres chairs for free and rent umbrellas for $10 for the day. The staff is great to get food and drinks. The location of the hotel is 10 min away from airport and 15 min away from san juan. theres a couple places to eat that are walking distance.lots of fast food places. no real good places to shop for clothes or trinkets. but they do have a walgreens about 5 min walking. they have a little shop on the very first floor. thats the only place in the hotel to buy water $4 snacks and things. the casino was real small. the salsa music on the weekends was good. you should check out the san juan hotel right next store. the lobby is beautiful. over all everything was good. I didnt see a lot of kids there. There werent a lot of things for them to do. but that also made it quiet which is what we were looking for. Nothing really to do at night besides the casio. you have to go out of the hotel for things to do. the ony thing I didn't like was how small the room was and the fridge was only cold enough for drinks. and the hot tub shuts off at about 10 or 11pm. I think I would go back, not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice...Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Nebby1
Reviews.Content: Service was great and food in the hotel was better than expected. We had the breakfast plan and were very happy with the quality of the service and food. We were did not have dinner in the Italian resturant untill we had been there a few days and were very surprized how wonderful it was. When we checked in they gave us an upgrade to a suite and that gave us the opportunity to enjoy the Club. We hope to go back there again soon. We love PR and we did realy enjoy this hotel. I cannot stress how friendly and helpful everyone was.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOSPITALITY EVER”
Reviews.Author: fuentesj7
Reviews.Content: From the 1st night to that last, it was the worst stay I've ever experienced! The hotel had a computer error and took $900 out of my checking account the second I checked in. I was told that they hold $100 for every night for security reasons. Well I was only there for 5 nights so they should had only held $500. I was told the other $400 was a glitch in their system. I then gave them a credit card to post the hold on and to refund me the $900 back to my debit card. By the time I checked out after 5 nights, the funds were never returned into my checking acct. The front desk also told me that there was never another card on file. So I basically wasted my time when I went down the 2nd day and presented them my other credit card explaining my situation. On the 3rd day, when I came back to my room from a day at Old San Juan, I realized a bag was missing from my room. I spoke to the front desk, manager Irene, and head of security and no one had an answer for me. The manager, Irene, who was the nastiest and most unprofessional manager I've ever met, told me that they are not responsible for missing bags in the rooms. When I finally checked out, I again spoke to the front desk and Irene and explained to them that my funds still hadn't been posted into my acct. The lady on duty at the front desk was more helpful than the manager. She called my bank and handled the situation in 10 minutes. Something that should had been done the second I told them my situation. Lastly, I recommend you pay very close attention to your bill. Whether it be at the bar or any of the restaurants in the hotel. Twice I had them give me the bill double the amount it should've been. Just like the front desk told me about my $900 transaction, I was told the bill was their mistake, or should I say a "glitch" in their system.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: sumarcha
Reviews.Content: When arriving to the hotel we were greeted by friendly warm staff, they were always there to open the front doors and helped get cabs quickly for us. The concierge was a big help, so friendly! The hotel was beautiful! The bar inside the lobby served amazing cocktails and the beach service was amazing as well. On the beach there were staff to carry out lawn chairs for you wherever you wanted to sit on the beach- they would carry several at a time and it was a great service to have. We spent a lot of time at the pool and hot tub both were very nice- pool has a great swim up bar with amazing drinks as well. The Alfredo's restaurant in the hotel was not as good as expected. We traveled with a group of 7 adults 4 children- we waited for over 10min to get in for our reservation and practically had the whole place to ourselves. Our waiter brought us bruschetta "compliments of the hotel" but ants were crawling on the plates...the pastas were good though. Our rooms were all very clean and spacious, balconies are very small and from the top floor it was a little intense to be out on, but the views---spectacular!! I would love to go back and stay at the Intercontinental again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, wonderful location, loved PR”
Reviews.Author: l0ng1slandbeechbum
Reviews.Content: Initially I was leary about staying at the Intercontinental after reading reviews but was pleased to find a fabulous hotel, clean, awesome pool, friendly helpful staff, convenient location. The room was nice sized and clean. Housekeeping did a great job. Fan in bathroom was broken but not too big of a deal, we managed without. Entire staff was friendly and helpful. The package we booked included 4th night free and a nice american breakfast buffet at the restaurant in the lower lobby, which is normally $25 per person. The front desk told me to charge it to the room each day, I figured maybe we would end up paying but were pleased to find the charges removed upon check out, no hassle. We went to a convenience store to stock the refrigerator in our room with water, beer, fruit and nuts for snacks. This store also had wine and liquor. Head right, cross Isla Verde Avenue turn down the side street and follow the signs towards outback. It was on the left in a building that looked like a white office building. Also the Walgreens across Isla Verde Avenue was handy. The small soft cooler we brought was very useful had no problem bringing it right down to the beach at the hotel. There were few taxes/fees upon check out. We opted for late check out for an addtional $75, if we checked out at 12 our fees would've been probably around $30 which wasn't bad at all. The location is great, on the beach which was beautiful, walking distance to everything, awesome pool/jacuzzi open 24 hours, although a little cold I found it refreshing. We went down to the pool at night as well as during the day which was fun. Lots to do at night, clubs, restaurants etc. The El San Juan next door is a great spot for people watching, check out the lobby. The restaurant right next to the El San Juan (Lupis i think) wasn't very good. We walked the beach to get to some of the nearby spots such as La Playita restaurant (great food, definately stop and see Blake the bartender for a drink he was awesome!) and the Beach and Water Club (had a quick drink, the restaurant is closed except for breakfast and same for the roof top bar) . We felt safe and it seemed quicker and easier than walking on the street. Old San Juan is the place to eat. The forts at Old San Juan are awesome, definately a must see. Rented a car to drive over towards the east coast to visit El Yunque and take a biobay kayak tour, Charlies car rental located across isla verde avenue towards the right was great. We didnt get directions just followed the map and didnt have much of a problem. Not sure if we hiked the La Mina Trail or Big Tree Trail but we ended at a waterfall you could swim in. Water shoes would've been helpful here but still it was nice to wade in. The hike was a workout, slightly difficult in my opinion but well worth it. The Pure Adventure website has very good directions to the marina where biobay trips leave (indicating landmarks because many streets are not marked/no signs). We just showed up there before 5, got something to eat at one of the restaurants near marina and signed up for a tour which left at 6:30, we didnt make a reservation for the kayak trip beforehand and it worked out fine. Around 5 pm all of the tour companies show up at the marina at Los Croabas with trailers of kayaks and pop up tents and set up shop. The only way we knew we were in the right spot at first was the sign for the Captain Suarez boat tour. We could hardly see the glow due to the very full moon at the time of our trip. The tour guides covered our kayaks with a tarp which helped us to see the glow. Great excursion, the kakaking was awesome, also a workout but definately worth it. Overall an awesome time, hotel was fantastic, I would definately return. Remember you are on island time in Puerto Rico service is very slow! At the Intercontinental this was not the case service was typically quicker than outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGal02
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our brief stay at the Intercontinental as a pre-cruise stopover. Got a good price from Priceline and had a room with everything we could need. It was a quick 5 minute taxi ride from the airport. The pool and beach were lovely, the staff was pleasant and friendly. Our only objection was their insistence on our paying an $18. "resort fee" given that we didn't have time to use a single "resort" extra.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway to celebrate spring”
Reviews.Author: NYCBookMark
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I took our 19-year-old daughters (collehe sophomores) for their spring break, booking through CheapCarribean.com. We were looking for shortest air flight (from NYC and Boston), shortest trip from the airport, and overall best deal. This package fit the bill for 5 full days, 4 nights. Isla Verde is a lovely horeshoe of beach front, with clean sand, low waves, and azure water. The Intercontinental is about mid-point. An older hotel, it was refurbished recently. The scale is pleasant and manageable (if you need to scoot back to your room for something, it's a quick run). We had vouchers and so ate at the Splash Bar for lunch (salads, sandwiches, local fare) and coffee, yogurt, and pastries from the little cafe/wine bar in the lobby for breakfast. Very pleasant. We went out for dinner to a local eatery or into Old San Juan, although the on-site restaurants looked fine. We just wanted a change. The staff at the hotel was lovely, especially the folks at the front desk, concierges, and towel dispensary. Pedro at the Splash Bar was particularly attentive, pleasant, and amusing. After a day hiking in the El Yunque rainforest (somewhat of a disappointment due to the lack of fauna, orienting materials, and signage) and a swim at the much-touted Luquillo Beach, we agreed that nothing could beat the comfort of the Hotel with its beach, pool, and amenties. (We did not partake of the spa and spent just a little time in the well-appointed casino playing slots.) One side trip we would recommend is the Luquillo Kioskos, local food kiosks just outside the Luquillo Beach. While the traditional fried food is plentiful, we tried tapas at the Spanish tavern Tapas 13 which were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice before booking”
Reviews.Author: Grammeto9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel several time and never encountered this problem. The elegance and gracious abmiance of the Intercontinental Hotel has been tarnshed by the recent introduction of salsa music in the pool area from 10 to 6 daily. Repeated requests to management to lower the volume, turn it off altogether or even change the type of music failed. Guests who want a peaceful and quiet getaway beware.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental in short”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkPower
Reviews.Content: Me and wife stayed 3 nights Fri-Mon. Oceanfront room the way to go. Room was good size, clean and had what you would need and would expect. Prices at hotel for food and drinks twice of what you would pay at a place on the street, but it was good, buffet breakfast ($60). That should say it all. Chairs on beach free umbrella's $10. Beach at Hotel clean and water warm sand pretty awesome. Unlike the Hotel pool not heated and not warm. Hotel is in very safe area. Police all over the place. Took the public bus to Old San Juan .75 cents with all the other tourist got to check out the hood and save a $. Again Police all over the place in Old San Juan. Very safe. Last tip check out the El San Juan next door very classy very $.But while there you must eat at the Palm for dinner $ but worth it. Nestor the Concierge was great and so was the rest of the staff. Not much at Hotel for entertainment but I recomend this place if not you would know it.

Reviews.Title: “The "WORST" InterContiâ€‹nental Hotel property”
Reviews.Author: Joe_in_NC
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights at the IC Hotel in January using priority club points. The stay was the absolute WORST IC hotel experience ever. I am a Royal Ambassador and was treated terrible by hotel management from check in to checkout. Hotel staff, especially Guest Relations and Front Desk Manager, was extremely rude when I questioned them on upgrading to a better (Platinum Royal Ambassador. Was told 3 different stories why I could not get upgraded to the Club floor or junior suite (standard practices at all other IC Hotels for Platinum Royal Ambassador Members). In addition to my experience with hotel management, the common hallways were very dirty and stayed that way for 2 of the 4 days. Rooms are very small and noisy. Would not recommend this hotel at all. I did not use hotel restaurants or bars in protest of check in experience. I do however recommend the restaurant and lounges at the El San Juan Hotel next door to IC which are extremely nice. Did use the IC spa and was cheated out of 15 minutes of paid spa time. When I complained to Spa manager her English went away. Relayed story to Front Desk Manager, who said he would look into the problem but never did. The last 2 years I have stayed on average 90 nights at priority club properties all over the world. This stay alone has encouraged me to seek out a new hotel group that treats all guest staying at their property (paid and reward nights) the same. If I am treated this way as a platinum royal ambassador, I canâ€™t image how other guest would be treated. Hotel appears to be more interested in entertaining the local population with their small casino than hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, pool, beach, & location!”
Reviews.Author: CandCTx
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 nt in a regular king room facing mountains. Check-in around 3P was seemless. Bed was one of the most comfortable I've experienced in a long while. Bath was small compared to other ICH properties. Pool was very nice & mgmt kept the riff-raff out, which I appreciated. Beach restaurant was avg & wouldn't serve limes with water b/c "only for alcohol drinks"...really? Even w/ a $30 sandwich & nachos?!? I'd stay here again given bed, location to SJU & pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: JimB4466
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental for 5 nights the first week in March. -Room was clean and comfortable plenty large enough for two.We were only in it to sleep,shower and change.85 degrees and sunny I am not in the room. -Lobby area was nice -Service was awsome.Waiter service on the beach and the pool.The door men were great.The conciere was helpful.We couldnt have been treated better. -Plenty of chairs at the beach and pool -The grounds,pool and beach were beutiful and relaxing. -The food and drink prices were reasonable.I wouldnt say they were expensive but typical.I am not sure what people expect but there are plenty of options(supermarket,wall greens,fast food,Chiles,Outback) if you dont want to pay hotel prices.For me I dont mind paying for the convenience and service.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not worth the $ unless you get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: lgirl83
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our stay. the hotel atmosphere was OK during the day and kind of quiet at night. for the price i expected a little more luxury in the rooms and lobby. our room smelled stagnant- even after it was cleaned and the bathroom had mold in the shower tile, ceiling and around the sink. YUCK> we had a city and view and that was OK, the sound of the waterfall was nice, but the blasting horns from traffic and the aeroport killed it for me. We also had a $200 room credit the was limited to certain bars and wine bistro that were really over priced so i don't feel like you gained anything. best part was the beach and Alfredo's restaurant the waiter Jose was GREAT! and had an excellent dinner. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmvasi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental in February, we had the most amazing time and would definitely go back again! We spent days at the beach or pool, where the waitstaff was awesome and very attentive. Chairs and umbrellas were readily available for no extra fee. The staff was exceptional. The women that we spoke to at the front desk were very helpful and answered all of our questions. The bell men were also great! They shared our love of the celtics and provided us with good conversation every morning! It was as though they really cared about us and our stay and weren't just being nice because they were paid to do so! Overall I give the hotel a thumbs up. Our room was very clean and the lobby areas were welcoming and nicely decorated. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommend to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but watch out when you check out!”
Reviews.Author: JHayman
Reviews.Content: We wanted a nice relaxing stay in San Juan and we got it at the Intercontinental. It is an older hotel, showing some signs of age, but still very nice. We loved lounging and reading by the pool and easy access to the beach was great. Overall I *may* recommend the Intercontinental, but with caution. Here is what happened to us. When we checked in we were told some things were included in our stay as a part of our package. Surprised by this I confirmed this with the gentleman who checked us in. Well, when we checked out a few days later, we were charged for these included services. When I disputed them, I was given an apology and told the charges were removed. This would be a happy ending, but it is not the end. Some 4 days later a charge from the Intercontinental shows up on our bank statement unannounced. After 3 separate conversations with Front Desk and Accounting staff, they would do nothing for us. The charges will remain and I have no further recourse. Lesson: confirm your charges with these guys, get it in writing and watch your bank statement closely.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on points”
Reviews.Author: egwood
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was okay but were glad that we were staying for free. Staff service was great and prompt. Hotel was clean. Pool was okay, not nearly enough umbrellas so if you are not reserving your spot by 8 am use a lot of sunscreen. The restaurants at the hotel were terrible, especially the one that was trying to pass as Italian (it was the first night so we were looking to stay in). The casino was a disappointment as well. Half the tables were closed and never opened, even on a Friday or Saturday night. The craps table never opened. The beach is good and I would recommend paying for an umbrella there. Unfortunately no beach service though so if you want something to drink you have to go back in.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the name”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: Very expensive. The rooms are average and the location is grimey and not very safe. Isla Verde is run down. Best stay down at the beach closer to town. Hotel very close to the airport. for everything good and bad that that entails. However the hotel is right on the beach. the beach bar restaurant has affordable and tasty food. The pool is fantastic. Everything else is below par. For the price paid I and my fellow travellers expected a lot more. I havwe stayed at many places that cost one third the amount and been nicer properties. Realize that you are not in San Juan; you are an expensive cab ride away. This is Isla Verde. So in summary; terrific pool. One of the best. Everything else OK in a 3 star property @ $100 a night but not in this property at over $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable week on a fine beach”
Reviews.Author: deenag
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a week here for our winter get-away. It was generally wonderful -- very nice room, good service, perfect beach. The only annoyance was it took 4 days to get moved from a 2-doubles room to a king-bed room (our travel agent somehow couldn't get this to happen originally). Rooms: Our rooms, city-view on the 8th and then 9th floors, were nice and comfortable, although not luxurious. The only problem we had -- light bulb out -- was fixed within 10 mins of our call. The rooms have mini-fridges, great since resort food is pricey (there's a Pueblo supermarket behind the Chili's, and a Walgreen's nearby, too). The wi-fi was fine for reading e-mail. And room service was prompt the one time we used it. Beach: Just what we wanted -- nice sand, not at all rocky, minimal sea weed, water not too rough. Lots of security, no harassing vendors. Chairs free, umbrellas $10. Pool: Also fine, although not heated. (And the jacuzzi was almost too hot.) None of the chair games we've seen at other resorts. Tour desk very helpful -- we went to El Yunque/Luquillo Beach one day, and snorkeled at Icacos Island another. (Also went into Old San Juan, and visited the Art Museum in Santurce.) Caisno: Small and plain. If you need glitz -- mega-glitz -- go next door to the El San Juan. Between the awesome lobby, and the casino, you will be blown away. (Both casinos good for small-time black jack players, $5 table at Intercontinental, $10 at ESJ.) Food: Pricey. Breakfast buffet is $25 (go across the street to La Casita if you want something in the $5-$8 range). Pizza at the beach is $15-plus (but feeds 2). Fruity drinks in the $9-$10 range. (Better mudslides at beach bar than pool bar.) Ate at Momoyama??? the Japanese place. Food OK, have had better Hibachi at Benihana's. Food alternatives: GO TO KOCO's at the El San Juan next door. It is kind of expensive ($125 for 2) but worth it. Also try Metropol (to the left a few blocks and across the street, by the cockfighting place) for good Cuban food. We also tried Brother Jimmy's? at the ESJ for ribs (so-so) and Lupi's for Mexican (decent) and another 24/7 diner for quick sandwiches, down the street, past Lupi's. Be aware that if you're not dining nearby, you will pay $30-$40 in cab fares to get to other restaurants in Condado or Old San Juan. (We went to Ropa Vieja in Condado for Cuban/Puerto Rican food and loved it). And if you're renting a car, there are steep parking charges most places you go.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: carsandquilts
Reviews.Content: After much research we chose this location and are very happy we did. The hotel is right on the beach with a beautiful pool. Wristbands keep out the non guests. The staff is courteous, friendly, helpful. Although the room was a bit small, it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. If you demand a view, pay an upgrade for an oceanview room. We were planning on upgrading, but they were sold out when we checked in. The restaurants are very pricey so we recommend traveling outside the hotel for authentic PR food. (we love to eat and drink local foods wherever we travel, you can always eat italian and steak back home!) The Metropol is delicious and reasonalbly priced with good service. Sightseeing musts are Old San Juan (the T5 bus is only 75 cents but SLOW so we took a cab back to the hotel $19 but only 15 minutes) We took the tour to El Yunque rainforest and it was the highlight of our trip. Book through the tour desk, our guide was fabulous. rrecommend this hotel. We had a great five days!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experince”
Reviews.Author: ysanchez07
Reviews.Content: We Just came back from staying in The Intercontinental Resort from Feb11-16. I had to say I was a bit worried about reading the previous reviews but it was by far the best hotel and stay I have had. Our flight arrived at 5:30 am and we got to the hotel around 6. Unfortuntely I already knew check in was at 4 so they told us the maid service wouldn't arrive till 9 am and we would have to wait. Granted we were tired but we took the time to walk around the hotel and walk down the street to the Walgreens which is on the down the street on the left. Its about a 10 min walk. We also walked over to the San Juan Hotel and Casino and had starbucks in the mean time. We came back to the Hotel and had breakfast till about 10 am or so. I checked back with the staff around 11 and they had a room available. Thank god because I really wanted to change and shower. We went to the Pool which by the way is amazing its a bit cold but I just decided to Tan. The beach is very clean and tons of security paroling the beach. When you get your towel they will give you a wrist band that will change colors every day so you can enter and leave the hotel. The beach is very clean with a few seaweeds but its well worth it. We decided to rent a Jeep for those days and they helped us give us directions how to get San Juan and to Piones and other places. It was pretty easy and saves alot of money rather than getting a Taxi. We went to eat at Mi Casita for breakfast avery morning for traditional Puerto RIcan Breakfast for 7 dollars!! Can't beat that price and the food was excellent. The hotel staff is very nice and friendly and we had no problems. We did have to leave a deposit for 100 a day that will be charged to your credit card and refunded after wards. But other wise than that I would deff come back to this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “unauthorized credit card charge”
Reviews.Author: Dermiegirl
Reviews.Content: hotel was satisfactory and standard for the price when checked out, we were told no charges when my credit card bill came, I found out that we were charged nearly 200 with no explanation!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: TomGR
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for 5 nights in early February after spending 3 nights at El Convento in Old San Juan (see separate review for that). Although I had done my research and expected the Intercontinental to be nice, the hotel really blew us away and exceeded our expectations in almost every way. First off, we got a great deal that included a free night and full breakfast every day. The breakfast buffet costs $25 per person so this was a great thing to have included. On top of that, we were upgraded for free to on ocean view room on the 7th floor when we checked in (we had booked and payed for a pool/garden view). Service was outstanding everywhere, from the door men to the car rental desk. The property is gorgeous and they are on a very nice, but busy, piece of beach. Like all of San Juan, drinks & food are expensive here. Although we didnâ€™t eat dinner at the hotel, we did have cocktails and lunches quite often at the beach bar restaurant. The hotel even has a wine bar which was very nice as well. As several other reviewers have mentioned, Isla Verde is not the place to stay if youâ€™re looking to visit OSJ which is why we split our 8 night trip between 2 different places. We rented a car one day and drove to El Yunque and a visit to Luquillo Beach. Although there was a lot of traffic, it was nice to be on our own schedule and it was also less expensive than going on an organized tour. Make sure to visit Nestor, the concierge, who was so helpful arranging or recommending anything. We did the spa one day and the facilities were very nice. There are several great restaurants close by; we actually ate better here than we did in OSJ which, again, surprised me. The best dinner we had our entire trip was at Pamelaâ€™s in Ocean Park, about a 15 minute drive from the hotel. Cheâ€™s, an Argentinean steak house, was also awesome and about a 5-10 drive or cab ride from the hotel. Within walking distance is Metropol for really great Cuban food. For the most part, we enjoyed the sun & sand here and basically relaxed in style which is exactly what we wanted. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “another bachelorette party”
Reviews.Author: southernbelle19
Reviews.Content: 2010 was the year of bachelorette parties for me. We had two rooms with 8 girls total. The hotel was pricey but we got a great discount through Highline Travel.com. The rooms were very plush with large bathrooms and the beds were sooooo soft. Seriously, the difference between 4 and 5 star hotels is the comfort levels of their beds and this was amazing. There were not a lot of young, single people staying at the hotel so there wasn't much of a party atmosphere. But I'm still glad we picked it. The beach section was so clean and the hotel staff always made sure we had chairs and towels and we even had umbrellas on the beach. We used the pool and poolside bar only once. It was nice, but mostly we spent our time on the beach. Also, I can't comment on the hotel restaurants. We were going to eat there, but decided to try some local options down the road. This turned out to be a fantastic decision as we had yummy meals, mixed with the locals and had some amazing adventures. We also did a day Canyoning trip where we rappelled through water falls. This was not for the faint-hearted, but for those adventure seekers, its a must do. Great experience, great guides. We did a second half day excursion where we went sailing and snorkeling on a large catamaran. The actual snorkeling was really good and we saw some really pretty coral and fish, but I'd prefer to be on a smaller boat. We were on this large party boat with lots of rum punch flowing. It was fun, but not intimate.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PA19
Reviews.Content: I am always pleased when I get this hotel. Great pool and beach area, nice public area, drinks are overpriced and weak and watery. Good food in the sushi bar, and a good meal in the bar at Alfredos. staff was nice there, especially the helpful barmaid who was lovely. Appreciated the robes and slippers. Couple in the room next made a lot of noise, but not the hotels fault, just ignorant people.I have no complaints, I didn't see bedbugs, I think some people don't know the difference between sand flies, and bed bugs, which both bite your legs. Good location, walk to the nearby supermarket and stock up on beer and booze, frig in room was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Dining, Beach, Room, Casino, and Service”
Reviews.Author: MarciaS8
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our last night of a 13 day vacation to Puerto Rico and Nevis.....but we will return to this site based on the wonderful experience we had here! We enjoyed Alfredo's restuarant on the premises, the casino was grand, a drink at the bar was well served, and the pool/beach area marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dukart
Reviews.Content: Just returned from beautiful PR to 5 feet of snow and 12 below zero. The InterContinental is a beautiful hotel and I am so happy I read the reviews and changed our reservation from the El SanJuan to the InterContinental. We had only 2 things that would love to change about the hotel- # 1 the water in the pool is FREEZING cold as they do not heat it. if you are swimmer you will be disappointed as too cold to swim in. # 2 the price of drinks are very expensive! I really think if they charged less people would be more willing to buy from them. Wish they realized all their guests are not used to New York prices. We ate in all the resturants except the steak house and the food and service were wonderful. Staff , cleanliness, services, check in and check out procedures great. If the two items mentioned dont bother you -- you will LOVE this place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean!”
Reviews.Author: erikaalexis
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel super cheap and are really enjoying it! Beautiful, clean, great location on the beach and in prominent Isla Verde. Bus stop is 300 feet away and would highly recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “A 4-star location and beach and pool, 3-star rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDude69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental in late January 2011 for 4 days, had a city-view room. Paid $150 a night through Priceline (not a good price, but was desperate). Hotel also charged me a $22 a night resort fee. It's a borderline scam but everyone is running it these days, so you just have to know in advance. Overall had a good time, mostly thanks to lots of sun and the beach directly behind the hotel. The lobby, pool, and beach area are the 4-star elements of this hotel. There is a stand by the pool where you give them your name and room number, and they give you beach towels and a bracelet to know you're with the hotel.
