Heated whirlpool, waterfall, and a bar (part of it is an in-pool bar). Small gelato stand off to the side. Small playground. There's a second outdoor bar/restaurant about 50 feet from the first between the pool and beach area. Great place for after sunset drinks and food (closes at 10:00pm). I sat on the beach and soaked up the sun for most of the days. Nice beach. It stretches for a mile and is shared by dozens of hotels. It was clean. The entire beached is raked and cleaned every morning. I had a few nice sunrise walks. Great beach to run along too. Weekends are best for people watching. The rooms are 3-star quality. My room was clean, the maid did a good job of clean-up and new towels everyday. I had a king-sized bed (that was more Queen sized). The bed was just ok. Clean white sheets, 4 white pillows, thin comforter. Air conditioning in the room. My room had a 2-foot balcony with just enough room to stand on. Best thing about the city view are the planes landing. Beautiful eye-level view of every kind of plane landing at the airport. Landing planes aren't noisy, but the ones taking off are. I loved to open up the sliding door and sit by the balcony taking in the heat and watching the planes land. Still, ocean view is better, I imagine. There was a small TV (an old Zenith CRT, not a flat screen) that was set in a cabinet with draws. There is a small refrigerator in the cabinet. The refigerator is empty. I stored water bottles in it (there's a nearby Walgreens). Also in the room: a small couch, wicker recliner chair, desk with chair, marble coffee table, and alarm clock with iPod dock (worked with my iPhone 4) by the bed. In terms of looks, the furniture was average---typical hotel furniture if maybe a bit dated. Pastel and white color theme. City noise, thin walls, and a two-hour time difference from Chicago made sleep difficult for me. I could hear the TV and couple's conversations from next door. Occasional police sirens and planes taking off. Recommend an ocean view for the quiet. The bathroom was small, only enough for one person to use at a time. Strangely, there was a small vanity room attached to bathroom where you could sit down and do you makeup. The two rooms should have been combined into one. There are three restaurants attached to the hotel. I ate at two. Alfredo's: Went late to the buffet, around 10:30, and it was a disaster. $25 and all the food had been sitting there for hours. Room temp (cold eggs, cold bacon, cold potatoes, cold pancakes, yuck). The waiter could have said something. There was a huge platter of sliced salmon it and no one seemed to have taken any of it. Tablecloths were stained and messy from birds and pigeons eating food off the outdoor tables. Momoyama was a Japanese restaurant. Had the sushi, saki, and Sapporo. It was a nice restaurant, but the food just ok and pricey. $75 for one person. Didn't try Ruth's Chris. We have one in Chicago. There is every major American fast food restaurant within walking distance (Wendy's, Taco Bell, Subway, Burger King, Church's Chicken, KFC, Long Jong Silvers, and on and on). There's a supermarket right across the street, and and the crucial Walgreen's a ten-minute walk down the street with reasonable prices on everything bu suntan lotion. You can get $0.99 bottles of water from the cooler. There's a Starbucks in the hotel next door to the InterContinental. Didn't go into the casino---it was dark and uninviting. You're just throwing your money away if you gamble in places like this. Go to Vegas if you want to have a good time gambling. There's too much sun outside! Conclusion: if you're a midwesterner like me who wants to get out of the room, escape the winter and soak up some sun on the beach, I can recommend the InterContinental or just about any decent resort in Isla Verdes along the beach. For beach-goers, location trumps amenities every time. Plus, the InternContinental supplies beach towels and easy access to the beach. Loved the pool and beach during the, and hot tub and outdoor bar at night. Really enjoyed my stay. Beautiful women on the weekends. But if you want modern room design, the InterContinental ain't it.

Reviews.Title: “Aging not so gracefully”
Reviews.Author: suepyt
Reviews.Content: The grounds are still beautiful and the pool exceptional, but the hotel seems to suffer from a down-grading of the quality of guest it used to have. The staff regard it as their hotel, not yours and the rooms, while clean, are now dated. Old TVs, funky phones. The weekend folks were young and did a lot of hollering around the pool. Public areas are still elegant, but the whole operation looks frayed and on its way downhill. Food and Drink prices were set as if it still was the fine operation it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: millr10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and we loved it! When booking this hotel, I was going purely on previous reviews so I was hoping for the best, and I got it! I made my reservations online but called the hotel to confirm that they received the reservation, I wanted to make sure everything was perfect. This also gave me an opportunity to let them know it was our honeymoon and the guest service person put a note for our arrival. This hotel was only minutes from the airport and we never really noticed any noise from the planes throughout our trip. About 20 minutes from arriving in our room we received a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberrries with a note congratulating us on our marriage and thanking us for staying with them. We ate at a couple of the restaurants in the hotel and recieved more complimentary drinks and food from the waiter when he found out it was our honeymoon! Because this is a beachfront property, on a public beach, there is staff at the entrance checking for wrist bands, so make sure that you get your wrist bands at the beginning of each day. The room comes with a mini refrigerator so my husband and I walked to the grocery store that was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel to buy some snacks and drinks to have in the room. The staff was great, especially the guys at the front of the hotel. They were always making sure we had god directions to wherever we wanted to go and when we were waiting for to leave on our horesriding expedition, they checked to make sure that we were using a reputable compnay. They always seemed to be making sure that we were being taken care of. The rooms were nice. I really liked the bed and there was a little area right off the bathroom with a table with a mirror and bench and I loved to sit there and do my makeup to get ready. Great place to stay and I would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not a slam dunk”
Reviews.Author: MichaelOB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I liked this hotel but would consider others before we returned. we were at the Intercontinental for three nights before embarking on a Royal Caribbean cruise. Room: very good. But you cannot get hot water for a shower mid-day. Also, the toilet seat wouldn't stay up (not an unreasonable expectation for what we paid). We paid $40 extra for an ocean view am am happy that we did. Food: way way way overpriced. Our first day, we had a lunch at the pool restaurant - a quesidella, club sandwich, fried plantains, and a few ice teas and the bill was $50.00. The next day we got Subway sandwiches and were made to feel very unwelcomed. We ate at their Italian restaurant and the bill was $100 and the food was a B-. The meal didn't suck but for $100, I want something so good I remember it a month later. This was not one of those meals. Staff: No complaints. People were all friendly. One more thing. For people who don't know San Juan - this is a great location if you want to sit on the beach all day. But Isla Verde does not have a lot going on, like Old San Juan. A taxi to Old San Juan is $20 each way so this isn't something you do just because. If you want a good range of restaurants and things to do, you may want to look at hotels closer to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: todarcie
Reviews.Content: I got a "good" Rate on this hotel on Hotwire. If I would have paid $249 per a night for this hotel I would have been mad as it was I was just disappointed. I expected this hotel to be a luxury hotel. I expected to stay in a luxury room. The room I was given at the front desk was horrible. I have stayed in better rooms at Motel 6. The room the front desk gave me had two double beds in it even though it my husband and I that checked in. We got in late from the airport so we did not change rooms. There was no remote for the small old T.V when we got in room we had to call housekeeping to get remote. There was no bottled water in room not even in mini bar which was empty you had to call room service to get anything at high prices. The room overlooked green roof and parking lot. I must have gotten the worst room in the whole hotel. We only stayed there for two nights before our cruise left so I was O.K with it. If I had booked this hotel for my whole vacation I would have been mad. I would not stay at this hotel again even if I payed half price. The hotel grounds were nice. The pool and beach were nice. The concierge was awesome he was very helpful and wonderful. The restaurant across the street is called Mi Casita. Yes the food is cheap but it is horrible. I would not eat there. If I stayed in San Juan again I would want to stay closer to old San Juan . Its costs $19 cab ride to get there. You can ride the bus for 75 cents. If you sit at the bus stop you will $10 cab ride offers to San Juan. I stayed at the Marriott in San Juan after our cruise. The Marriott was way worth the price and was a luxury hotel. Do not stay at this hotel you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time with the Family”
Reviews.Author: SouthJersey123
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 nights at the InterContinental with the wife and 2 kids ages 5 & 7. We had a great relaxing vacation and the hotel was exactly as expected. It is a nice hotel in a good location. If you are expecting the Ritz, then stay at the Ritz. The hotel is older and could use some updating, but the room was fine for the family and the accomodations were suitable. The beach and pool areas are great and the food exceeded our expectations, although a little expensive. I did a lot of research on TA prior to booking and wanted to answer some of the common questions/concerns: * The ocean had a lot of seaweed, but it didn't stop us from enjoying the waves * There was a Walgreens and a supermarket within walking distance of the hotel * Everything in the room worked fine, including the safe * The pool is not heated, but didn't need to be since it was 85 each day * The hot tub next to the pool only seemed to work every other day * The staff was generally friendly and happy to help * There was free WiFi throughout the entire resort If you are looking for more upscale, the El San Juan right next store was a significant upgrade. I would consider staying there next time, but without the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect long weekend with the kids”
Reviews.Author: DrBob5
Reviews.Content: Interesting as always to separate fact and fiction from the reviews on the site. Facts. The safe was locked when I got in the room and may have been broken, but I did not care and nothing was stolen. The pool is not heated, but it was over eighty and the water felt good after laying in the sun. There is seaweed in the ocean and last I checked that happens in the ocean. If you wade out about ten feet it was clear. The rooms are not huge but they are not small ala a w hotel. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. The breakfast staff was exceptional at the buffet. Food at the pool and hotel was reasonable for a resort. Not cheap but not bahama expensive either. They do charge the resort fee as they indicated on the site when booking so no surprise there. Overall great hotel resort, easily walkover to el San Juan to see the crowds. As for improvements. New beach chairs would be nice as would fresh paint on the balconies and better reception on the television. Still all told my kids wanted to plan on going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Kenr22
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at this hotel and quite honestly had no surprises, good or bad. Hotel was older, but maintained well. Rooms were comfortable and very well kept. The grounds were showing some age, but again taken care of. Weather was not all that good with persistant rain and cooler temps than expected. The prices charged for drinks and food onsite were very expensive. However considering the price of the room, we also realize that there has to be something profitable there to make this place continue. $10-15 for two drinks can get expensive over time, and dining prices were similar. Overall we know in the end you get what you pay for and that is what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool/Beach - Avg Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarciaB10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights-pre cruise. I booked through Hotwire (139)- as most always.. you get what you pay for.. After arriving I did upgrade to a ocean view, while many others had posted it was a 25$ upcharge, they charged us 40$ per night, and we were checking in at 10:30pm~. Then there are the resort fees as well. With taxes and all it came to about 208 per night.. certainly a reasonable price for an ocean front room. We were on the 15th floor. The room was fair at best, not very clean.. certainly was not vacuumed from previous occupants. Crumbs and walnuts in the carpet. The tile in the very small bathroom was gross. Stained with something red on a number of the tiles in the bath and hall .. They really should replace them.. And all the white baseboards needed serious cleaning. My husband also didn't like the bed at all. There was something that kept sticking him through the sheet! I didn't have that problem. We have stayed at other Intercontinentals, and were very dissappointed with this room. I would not stay at this resort again. But on the positive side, the pool area is very nice, and its a nice safe beach you can walk up and down. And Ruth Chris Steak house is there, we had an amazing dinner there. I don't think this should be rated a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel ... But why are the personal safes all missing or broken?”
Reviews.Author: jbrown104
Reviews.Content: I was here at New Year for 2 days before boarding one of the cruise ships; then back last night for a further day at the hotel. Whilst I find it impossible to fault the charm and friendliness of this hotel, it is showing signs of age. The baths need an overhaul and the TV system needs a decent upgrade. I have seen five rooms, four if which were missing safes, and one had a safe, but no batteries so it couldn't function. Suffice to say you could live with that for a few days, but if you were here for a fortnight it would be a bit of a bind. Tip: ask for a twin room. The doubles are a lot smaller by comparison, and two comfy queens are ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Good Time!”
Reviews.Author: crusnwsusn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights for a winter get-a-way. The weather was great, 82 and sunny each day. This was my second time staying at this hotel. You would want to request a room on a high floor facing the ocean, we were on the 14th floor and you do get the best view as you will be higher than the palm trees. The pool water was cold, it's not heated but the jacuzzi was nice & hot and we enjoyed that. There is waiter service at the pool, they do come around to see if you would like to order drinks/lunch. There are two places outside to order food and drinks, one at the pool and one right at the beach. The pool area is very pretty, the beach is nice, but there was a lot of seaweed which did smell foul. Everyday there is a very nice lady, Iris, who sells pretty hand-made jewelry at inexpensive prices right on the beach. She is friendly and is always ready to talk to you. It is a nice hotel, in a great location, with a helpful staff and I would stay here again. The Ruth's Chris steak restaurant is on the property and it was very good, expensive, but we enjoyed dinner there and we did go there again on another evening, sat at the bar and watched football games while enjoying cocktails. Lydia, the barmaid was a big Jets fan and made it lots of fun for us; she was a delight! The concierge recommended a wonderful restaurant in the Condado area, called Budatai, and we LOVED it. It had asian/fusion food, had nice atmosphere, good service and delicious food. I highly recommend it. Budatai is also in a great location to shopping and LaConcha Hotel, which was a very pretty and new hotel. There is a very nice breakfast buffet at the Intercontinental, many selections, hot and cold and fresh fruits. It costs $25 per person. I had a facial in the spa and it was wonderful. It was a 50 minute service, however, she spent well over an hour on my facial and I enjoyed it very much. The showers and locker area were clean and pretty. There is also a hair salon on the premises, near the gift shop. I had my hair blown out two evenings by two different hairdressers and they both did a wonderful job. ($35 for a blow-out) They were very friendly and welcoming. People working at this hotel are very nice including front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff. Our oceanfront room was nice, not exquisite, but it was clean. The hook on the back of the bathroom door was missing and there were no chairs out on the balcony, these were my only complaints. We did have a clock (ipod docking station) and a refrigerator, an extra pillow & blanket, an iron and ironing board in the room. Our bed was very comfortable, I slept great each night. This hotel is conveniently located about 5 minutes from the airport, the taxi ride cost $10. There is the El San Juan hotel right next door with more delicious restaurants, shops and casino. In addition, a few short blocks away is the Ritz Carlton with yet more great restaurants, shops & a fun, busy casino. There are other less expensive restaurants and stores right across the street from the hotel as well. There is also an italian and hibachi restaurant on the premises but we did not eat there this trip. My husband and son went to the Trump International Golf Course, which was 40 minutes away. They enjoyed it and said it was a beautiful course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skygoddess17
Reviews.Content: Everyone is so...nice here! Went there to celebrate my daughter's 1st birthday with my hubby. We stayed 4 nites. Room is roomy but bathroom could be a little bigger. Got balcony room with ocean and pool view which is beautiful!!! Pool is cold since water is not heated. It was in the 80's when we were there and the ocean is still cold. Most pple hang out at the Jacuzzi. Heard from a couple that the hotel's restaurant, Afredo's, is not so good. We have tried a Cuban restaurant, Metropol. Looks plain on the outside but nice decor inside. The grilled chicken and pork chop are delicious! Go during lunch cheaper..about $11 a plate. About 5-10 walk from hotel...take left from hotel and on right side after the cockfit ring. We also tried Mi Casita. Awful food and not worth the money even though they were busy. Cheapest place to get breakfast is Burger King...their whole grain flat bread with eggs, sausage/ham is delious and only like $3. Also, heard that Ceviche House is a great place but about 20 mins from hotel to the right. You can ride the bus. Didn't get to go cause closed during holiday. We went to La Leochera (?), roasted whole pig place) which is about 5-10 min walk from hotel to the right near a bank. Service is slow but food is delious esp the roasted pig. Good and reasonable price! Grocery store Pueblo is about 10-15 mins from hotel. 2 ways to go...go to the left of hotel and go under the Chili's bldg where there is the silver railing sidewalk steps, go straight and you will see the store. Also, another mini mart about 2 blocks from hotel. Go right to hotel and take right after the Burger King plaza, and mini mart is under condo on left. Ride to airport and back is $12 and each bag is $1 in the trunk. They have a set price so no scammers!!! :) This is a quiet hotel when we were there which is perfect! Also, they were so nice to our baby!! Free internet! yea!! :) parking is $18 I think but we didn't rent a car. Took the bus to Old San Juan for .75 cent. Make sure you have current change! No change on bus! Took about 40 mins to get there. Catch the bus to the right of the hotel and on the same side stop of hotel. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THE INTERCONFINENTAL SAN JUAN HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katanga12
Reviews.Content: Although the pool is very pretty I am sure that there are many hotels in San Juan that have a nice pool and are worth the price. We spent 3 days there before a cruise and we were VERY DISAPPOINTED with this hotel. The beach and the ocean in front of the hotel are FULL OF SMELLY SEAWEED. The smell was a very strong unpleasant odor. Every chair we were given was broken with broken welds. Our room had broken lamps, burned out bulbs and the remote was broken. The pillow looked nice when we first arrived but the first night it become obvious that they are (I think) feather pillows that are WAY PAST THEIR PRIME. They flatten out and it is like sleeping on sawdust. I asked for a few new pillows and they stuck like mildew, I couldnâ€™t sleep on them. There was not even a clock in the room. At the casino they donâ€™t bother opening several of the tables, like the crap table, even on the weekend nights. Most of the slot machines (over 75%) would not accept my ticket. I ended up walking from machine to machine trying to play a little slots and finely gave up every night. They probably did me a favor since the slots were very tight and I didnâ€™t observe anyone really winning in the 3 nights I went there. I used Priceline for the very first time to book this hotel and WILL NEVER USE IT AGAIN!!! There is a $22/day parking fee and to rub salt in the wounds they added a $17.92 per night resort fee to my bill.. If it was a decent place I wouldnâ€™t have minded but NOT WORTH THE MONEY - DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND FIND ANOTHER HOTEL TO STAY AT

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit dated, but not bad, well kept with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rcw198
Reviews.Content: Stayed from January 6th through the 9th prior to going on a cruise with my wife and two young adult children. At first I was a bit disapointed having stayed at the Caribe Hilton during my last stay in SanJuan. This disapointment was very short lived upon realizing that while the InterContintental did not have the glitz of the Caribe Hilton, it was much better located. Staying at the Caribe Hilton left very few choices for dining. The InterContintental is within walking distance of countless restaurants and stores. The staff went out of their way to make you feel welcomed. The pool and beach were great. There is an Enterprise car rental at the hotel next door. If you need a car, rent by the day and don't bother paying for parking. I just rented a car as needed and at the end of the day parked it in the secured Enterprise parking lot. While Enterprise was closed upon my return, I simply walked next door and returned the key the next morning. No parking fees incurred.

Reviews.Title: “Letting down the InterContinental Name - despite Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: NomiSF
Reviews.Content: The staff here are great. Housekeeping was very kind. However... if you are handed your keys with a "you are in room 430 (or 428)" say "no I'm not" and get a different room. Unless you enjoy the feeling that your neighbor could step over their balcony rail & walk a few steps over the lovely (not) flat tar roof of the restaurant & Casino to your room. Or stay in your room with the sliding glass door locked and look out at all the cigarette butts the sneaky smokers on balconies above you have apparently thrown onto your lovely tar roof view. Your room amenities will have been pillaged or traded to better rooms - no door on the armoire to cover the rusted, barely working fridge teetering on top of the safe, a scale in the bath that thinks air weighs 110 lbs, etc. Plus the 2 double bed rooms are very cramped. Fortunately we were able to move to a 1 king room on a higher floor the next night. The hotel is convenient to the airport (with lots of airline staff hosted here). Nice pool & hot tub & nice beach. Unfortunately you also hear the planes land. And near-the-airport = $20 cab ride to get to Old San Juan. If you want to sit by the pool & sip cocktails, this is the place for you. If you don't... well... You'll spend $40/day in cabs. I would not consider the smallish 60's rooms nor the tiny bathroom with (even in our upgraded room) a plastic liner to "update" the tub to be luxury or InterContinental level. There are coffee/tea makers in the rooms with free coffee & tea. But the Wi-Fi is crazy slow - even if you buy the upgrade you'll still not be able to watch any streamed video without constant pauses. So don't bother with the upgrade, just use the free wifi. Also not so luxury - the TV's as someone else mentioned are pretty old. Limited TV channel options. Our phone in the better room had non-functioning keys. And the fridge was still balanced on top of the safe. And had a rust spot on the door. But at least it worked & I didn't have to look at it since it was covered by the armoire door. The hotel was clearly built in the late 60's. I'd suggest they either go with it & play up the "New Cuba / Rat Pack" theme (a la the Beverly Hilton - who does this great), or throw in the beach towel on trying to be a luxury hotel. We stayed here for free on reward points. If we had paid even the "best price" I overheard at the front desk of $199/nt, I'd be VERY bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: arandikc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inter Continental San Juan in November. Upon check in we upgraded to an ocean view room with wonderful views of the beach. The staff was friendly, room clean, we were very happy with our choice and plan on returning again soon! The staff gave us wonderful dining suggestions in the area, very pleased. Our only disappointment was the very small casino on site.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DelmarSam
Reviews.Content: I had booked a less expensive hotel in Condado but fell for a Hotwire offer for a 4 star resort for only $20 more. The hotel turned out to be the Intercontinental. I then learned that there was an additional $20 "resort fee" charged by the hotel itself. For my $40 more, I must acknowledge that the beach and grounds are beautiful, but the room is shabby and dated. There are several broken items including one lamp and a lighted mirror. The door knob and sink faucets are loose. Worst of all though, is that the bath tub is not caulked and a lot of water has apparently found its way under the tub. It's very disorienting that the tub squishes and rocks under your feet and disturbing that it emits a foul sulfur odor from whatever is rotting under the tub. If we were not spending just the one night before a cruise, I surely would have demanded another room. A final word on the location: It is convenient to the airport and just a 5 minute/$10 cab ride, but inconvenient to Old San Juan. A cab to OSJ would cost $19 each way and it may not be worth your while unless you really want to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value”
Reviews.Author: meggy0019
Reviews.Content: I've been to Puerto Rico a few times and Carolina was a new experience for me. In my opinion, it doesn't have the best beaches and atmosphere (the ocean is FULL of seaweed- I laughed when i read that in other reviews but it's actually pretty gross when you find seaweed stuck in your bathing suit hours later). However, that being said I loved the Intercontinental. I thought it was clean, very pretty, and the pool was lovely. Our original package (booked through expedia) was for a stay at the Waldorf next door. However, we switched at the last minute after reading extensive reviews about bedbugs in the Waldorf garden rooms (and from the view from our hotel the back of the Waldorf wasnt looking so clean). It was a last minute switch but I couldnt have been happier! The Interncontintal is also fairly close to Old San Juan which I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back..........”
Reviews.Author: vprecious
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two days before a cruise and one night afterwards. The rooms were very spacious and had two queen sized comfortable beds. The staff were attentive and most friendly and willing to assist. The breakfast was fantastic, with a vast choice of everything you could wish for. The chef who does the eggs and omletts sings and dances as he cooks, he was my favourite. The hotel is in close proximity to the airport and there are many restaurants and shops in walking distance. The beach is clean and not at all crowded, there are some stalls but no one hastles you to buy. The gym is open 24 hours which is handy when you body is adjusting to the time difference. I loved Puerto Rico and plan to come back for a longer period of thime.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Lake In The Hills, Illinois, USA
Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience, would come back again”
Reviews.Author: Mccarlin
Reviews.Content: Well we just returned from our trip last night and my Wife and I had an amazing time at the Intercontinental. We were deciding between this hotel and the El San Juan and are happy we chose this place. The hotel looks newly renovated, very modern, very clean, and was just amazing. The service was AMAZING, hotel staff always opened the doors for you, were very polite, and made sure you were completely happy. This hotel has beautiful balconies so i would suggest upgrading to the ocean view as we did. It was great. The rooms were very clean, the whole hotel was clean. The landscaping was beautiful and made you feel a million miles away. The coqui's were singing every night through the whole resort. As with most hotels, the food was very expensive. I would suggest venturing out and getting food elsewhere as we did. There are a few options walking distance that was very good, including Mia Casita for breakfast/lunch/dinner and was priced right. Overall it was GREAT! If you are considering this hotel and the El San Juan next door let me just say the El San Juan is a very "vintage" hotel. Not modern at all and has the decor and looks of a very old rustic hotel, although beautiful, it wasnt for us. They also do not have walk out balconies at the El San Juan as our hotel did, so another downfall.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at intercontinental san juan”
Reviews.Author: dgbh
Reviews.Content: @ PR for a long weekend. Nice hotel but not the most elegant in the ICH chain - clean, pretty, convenient. with nice amenities. Beach is lovely and not crowded. Food outside at the poolside bars is adequate (burgers, fries, quesadillas, wraps are fairly priced for resort fare) good drinks. The Japanese restaurant is wonderful, Ruths Chris and Alfredo are other options (didn't go there, or to the other San Juan branches of many NYC restaurants). Hotel staff excellent. Several reasonable restaurants (fast food and not) nearby if you want to avoid the expensive hotel breakfast buffet extravaganza - Starbucks, 2 diner style restaurants, a cute bakery/cafe within a block with eggs, pancakes, etc., and a little mall across the street with normal fast food stuff. Isla Verde is close to the airport but only occasional airplane noise. My only complaint - and it is a biggie for me - is the truly beautiful, elegant pool is NOT heated. It was not a malfunction - this is not a new hotel - and I can't imagine why this upscale chain would not upgrade. PR is sweaterworthy at night this time of the year, the days are still a little short -- the OTHER pool hotels in the area are deliciously heated, we checked! Nobody goes in this pool because it is frigid and took my breath away (and I'm used to cold water ocean swimming!) Thankfully the ocean is warm and clean, and the pool is a nice for a quick dip - but not to do laps and enjoy for lengthy periods of time. It was a real bummer for me. If i'd known that we'd have stayed elsewhere, and I told the hotel management as such.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: BVI17
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night pre-cruise. The hotel looked modern, clean, and interesting. The reception staff seemed helpful, our room wasn't ready but we would receive a call when it was. We decided to have lunch at the pool bar which was good. However, the bar was definitely understaffed. The pool and beach area seemed nice but the noise from the airport was just too much. We definitely wouldn't want to spend a week listening to it. Two hours later (around 3:30) we decided to go and checkon our room. Another person was working the reception desk, didn't say hello to us and when we asked about our room responded with one word - no. As we walked away stating that the couple next to us got a room the staff followed after us saying your room is now ready. We headed up to the fourth floor and entered our room - yup the house cleaning staff was still in it. The rooms appear nice but the floors were never cleaned and we didn't see anyone using or hear a vacuum the entire time. That evening we decided to have drinks in the lobby bar. As I began to nibble on the pretzels / nuts provided I looked over and saw the waitress eating the pretzels out of the bowls that should we then bring over to the guests - yuck! Overall the hotel looks nice and could be 4 stars however it appears there is no management watching over those that interact with the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Experience”
Reviews.Author: Baby_Blu_Eyes78
Reviews.Content: We absolutly loved our trip to San Juan and this Hotel was simply amazing. We stayed in an Ocean View after being upgraded by the friendly agent at the front desk. Our room was clean and lovely. Parking across the street is safe but they do charge you by the day. I beleive th cost is 16.00 a day, but well worth it. The lot is montirored 24 hours a day by the agent. I cant comment on the food bec after reading reviews before going it was true that food is expensive inside the hotel. its a must to check out the resterant "MI CASITA" to eat. It is right across the street in the parking lot where the Burger King is. We ate breafast everyday their. CHeap and they have really good food. Open for Breakfast lunch and dinner. The pool was nice, get the drink Voodo. it has 5 rums - $16.00 it comes in a bucket but buy one and you will be set the whole afternoon. We visited El Yucan rainforrest --a must, Loquillo beach, RED BEACH on vieques. you can take a ferrry there. Ask the front desk about it. Old San Juan of course was great. We also went to Rincon. (2 hour 15 minute drive.) we got stuck behind the horses on the day of PRs discovery. Go over the El San Juan next door on Thursday-Sund night for live music and dancing. Salsa, merengue. : ( they didnt play any Bachata though ) First time to Puerto Rico and it wont be our last!!! You wont regret staying here. Get a rental car from Enterprise. They are the cheapest.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: crewtips
Reviews.Content: This property is what you would expect from an Intercontinental, no more, no less. I like the Condado area better, where the Caribe Hilton is, but if you want to stay near the airport this is perfect. Pool in nice, great gym overlooking the beach, Ruth Chris' Steakhouse downstairs and other cheaper options for dinning in the area at walking distance. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: RaleighNCCara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our family of five young adult "children" and a three year old grandchild to San Juan for some fun in the sun and to watch a college basketball tournament. I did extensive research before choosing The Intercontinental and I could not be happier with the choice. We stayed for five nights and had three rooms, tried pretty much every restaurant, bar, and service at the hotel and had not a single disappointing experience. At check in we were comped an ocean front upgrade for one of the rooms. All three of our rooms were on the eighth floor and even the ones with the laguna/city view were perfectly fine. Admittedly we heard some noise from the airport but it was not at all a problem. In fact, with so many of us arriving and departing on different flights, the short distance to the airport was a real bonus! Less than $15 cab fare, including tip...5-10 minutes travel time. Awesome! Yes, the rooms were showing a little age(basic, older tv models) but they were very clean, spacious and nicely appointed and the beds super comfortable. Plenty of hot water and lots of water pressure from the shower. Free Wi-Fi was a plus for those in our group who needed to do a little work. EVERY employee we encountered showed warmth and a desire to please...no attitude or rudeness from anyone, from the front desk to the servers to the housekeepers and valet parkers. LOVED the pool area and the beach. At the pool you will be given wrist bands but I appreciated that as a way to keep the pool and beach area free of non-guests. It was no big deal to grab a wrist band at the towel stand. Beach toys, games and paperbacks were provided for our use free of charge and servers circulated thru the pool area unobtrusively, ready to take food or drink orders for those of us who did not want to move from our cushioned lounge chairs! Isle Verde is such a great little strip with The El San Juan and The Ritz Carlton an easy stroll away if you feel like hob-nobbing at slightly (only slightly) fancier places. Personally, I thought they were a little too frenzied whereas the IC felt homey, relaxing, and welcoming. Several fast food restaurants and a Chili's are within walking distance, as are drug stores and grocery stores. We had need for a doctor one day and the hotel was quite helpful in getting one to come to our room. The concierge gave us great dining and touring tips. Our kids did spend a little time in the casino...perfectly adequate for their needs. At checkout we had a couple of small issues with our final bill and the front desk made the changes right away, with a smile and apologies and without any pushback. The servers in the Japanese restaurant, the wine bar, the beach front bar, and the main restaurant Alfredo's were attentive and delightfully friendly and we were very satisfied with the quality and pricing of the food. Not cheap but not that far off other prices in the area, and the convenience and great service were worth a bit of a premium. Loved all the yummy adult beverages, too! Our grandchild was treated like a princess and the servers at breakfast each morning (very good buffet included in our rate) even remembered her name. She loved "swimming" over to the swim up bar in the pool to order a Shirley Temple! Easy 15 minute ride to Old San Juan and a little less to the Condado area. We had a fabulous dinner at Marmalade in Old San Juan and also enjoyed El Yunque rain forest and a side trip to Luquillo Beach (gorgeous!). I would go back to The Intercontinental without any hesitation and want to commend the staff (especially Ida, Sonya, and two Williams!) and management of this property for ensuring that we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: waddell64
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights pre cruise at the Intercontinental Hotel and we had the best stay. We booked through hotwire so they had us in a city view room. The were able to upgrade to a ocean view for $25 it was definately worth it. We were on the 16th floor (top floor) and the view was amazing. Could see the ocean from the bed. The beds are very comfortable and the showers are amazing! We read other reviews before going and got plenty of recomendations. The food at the hotel is very expensive. The el san juan hotel next door has a starbucks and the pizza place was very good. There is a chilis across the hotel and the pueblo (grocery store is about a 5 min walk. We were able to buy soda and water and snacks cheap and take back to the hotel. The cab ride from the airport was $24 ($1 a bag) . The cab fare to old san juan is $20. We took the bus, there is a stop out in front of the hotel. You have to wait about 30 min but cost .75 well worth it. Look for the T5 that takes you too Old San juan. The pools at the hotel are very nice and there are plenty of chairs. The beach is very nice and is safe, We went and worked out at the fitness center and you look out to the ocean while working out! I already want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WillieC
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Intercontinental pre-cruise at the end of October 2010. We arrived at the San Juan airport around 9:30pm and took a cab directly to the hotel. It is a short ride and cost about $10 or so plus tip. We arrived at the hotel around 10:15 and were checked in at once. Since our original room was a â€œcity viewâ€� we were offered an upgrade to ocean view for $25 per night which we accepted. When we looked out our window the next morning we were glad we opted to spend the extra money â€“ the view was great. The room was on the 10th floor (I think the hotel has 16 total floors) and it was in excellent condition. The furnishings consisted of a nice big bed, a sofa, desk, easy chair and a large TV console that also contained storage and a mini-fridge. The fridge was empty and ready to be stocked with our own supplies. There was a large (36â€� or larger) flat screen TV on the console. Just off the entrance door is a dressing area with a nice sized closet which also houses a large digital safe. The bathroom is just off the dressing area with shower/tub combo and sink counter top. The bathroom was well supplied with shampoo, lotion and all the needed items. There was also a coffee maker located in the dressing area. The room had a large sliding door that opened onto a very small balcony. The balcony was large enough to stand on but not big enough for any furniture. The view was of the pool area and grounds and onto the beach and ocean. A fabulous view and well worth the extra $25 a night (the other side of the hotel looks out at the city and airport). The grounds of the hotel are very nice and well landscaped. The pool is very large and has adequate chairs so that it was never a problem to find one. The beach is also very nice, clean smooth sand, nice water and a good walking distance in either direction. The hotel has a nice beach front dining area as well as many dining options inside the main building. We ate a late dinner in the bar upon arrival and the pricing was fair and the food was good. There is also a wine bar at one end of the lobby that in the mornings doubles as a coffee shop with pastries. If that wonâ€™t do out the front door and to the left right next door at the El San Juan Hotel there is a Starbuckâ€™s. The hotel is well located for those that do not have a car rental. There are several dining options within a short walk as well as two Walgreens and a large Publix super market (a little hard to find but worth the effort for the good prices on beer, wine and snacks for the room). One word of caution â€“ many people have reported that Walgreens is a good place to buy beer and wine â€“ wrong very wrong as they do not sell either (checked both stores). The area around the hotel seems to be pretty upscale with lots of nice condos and other nice hotels and we always felt safe walking about even at night. We had no problems. We enjoyed an excellent meal down the street to the left of the hotel at a place that was highly recommended to us by a local we met on our flight down. It is called Metropol and serves Cuban food. It was excellent, full of locals (we seemed to be the only tourists there) and the prices are very decent. They also made the best mojito I have ever had! All in all we were quite happy with the Intercontinental and would stay there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Resort - I wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: twinsmom90
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed! This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and we weren't sure where to stay. The reviews were great for this hotel so we took our chances. It was by far the best choice we could have made. The resort is beautiful! The staff is extremely polite and courteous. We arrived about 3 hours before check in and our room was not ready but they quickly offered to store our bags and invited us to relax by the pool or one of the lounges until it was ready. We went to the pool area and were amazed at how beautiful it was. There were endless rows of cushioned lounge chairs in all areas of the spacious pool area. The pool was beautiful and very clean. The entire area was landscaped and arranged for a wonderful tropical feel. The pool area leads out to the ocean and the hotel staffs both the entrance to the pool and the ocean so it is accessible only to hotel guests, which we thought was awesome. The rooms were just as wonderful. Everything is so clean and beautifully decorated and the beds were unbelievably comfortable. We did upgrade to an ocean view and I would recommend asking for an upper floor on the west side to get the best view if you do this. They are a little more spacious than the city view rooms, but I would have been just as happy to not have upgraded. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. It was by far the most beautiful of any of the places we went to (and we went through a lot of them to check them out). There is a lot of places to eat. Best way to find out about them is word of mouth at the pool from other guests we found. MiCasita has a great inexpensive breakfast. Brother Jimmy's on top of El San Juan Hotel has great BBQ. We did splurge for dinner one night at Momoyama at the hotel. A little pricey, but very worth it. We will definitely be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: rhonda8791
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel great is the STAFF! Everyone was wonderful. The location is good, close to the airport (don't pay $40 per person for a shuttle, cab fare is $10-11 plus $1 per bag); surrounded by a few fast foods restaurants, if you choose not eat at the hotel (but the food at the hotel was good), there's other hotels within walking distances with nice restaurants, as well; the beach was great and pool was nice; I spent a lot of time in the jacuzzi (wonderful); casino is small, but ok; close by you can rent jet skis. The rooms are nicely sized. BUT the patios are in need on a paint job. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: wvumorgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights on our honeymoon and it was beautiful! The pool and hot tub area are amazing, and the location next to the beach was great! But if you are looking to be close to bars and restaurants in Old San Juan, stay down there. It cost us $20 for a cab each way. There are some great local restaurants (Mi Casita!!!) within walking distance of the hotel. Meals and drinks at the hotel were overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler102010
Reviews.Content: After the initial surprise and worry of how close to the airport the hotel is, we were very pleased with this hotel. The room was nicely sized, and although our 7th floor ocean front faced a tree, we could see ocean to the right and left of the tree. It also looked over some ugly rooftops of buildings, and the balcony had only room to stand. Other than that, the hotel was just great. The pool was wonderfully large, with one bar in the pool and one on the ocean. The restaurants inside the hotel were rather expensive, but there are plenty of choices around the hotel. Take a couple of trips into Old San Juan, one in the day and one at night. At first we didn't think we would enjoy another trip to San Juan, but after a week, those thoughts were quickly banished.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mikala6m
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was very nice and the staff was pleasant. The casino gives free food as well as free drinks, however some of the other nearby hotels have casino's that are a lot better. The resort had games and structured activities throughout the day and was very family-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: zg11206
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to get the real feel of Puerto Rico. Great frinedly service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: oaxacamexico
Reviews.Content: It was very clean, The pool was nice. The beach is very nice but don't stay in a room with ocean view because the view is not as good since the hotel is not as close to the beach (it has the pool between the beach and the hotel) unless you choose a room in a high floor. The casino is nice but is not 24 hours. The bar is small but nice. The terrace is nice too and the lobby is big and nice. The rooms are pretty but the tops are not in top shape. The location is perfect since there are many restaurants and stores close by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TrvlLots
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 days at the Intercontinental in San Juan, Puerto Rico and it was fantastic. The hotel is located right on the beach but it also has a huge pool with waterfalls and a hot tub. In the pool area they supplied towels, beach toys and games. The staff were all attentive, courteous and helpful. We stayed in room 1511 (double with a city view) and even though it was a city view, it was quite spectacular at night. The bathroom was restocked daily with shower get, shampoo etc and cleaned to a very high standard. There was a robe and slippers in the closet and extra bed linens if you needed them. Like others have stated the restaurants in the hotel was a bit pricey, especially for the drinks. We ate breakfast everyday at Mi Casita across the road where the food was great for a very reasonable price. We ate our other meals down town as there is a huge variety of restaurants to chose from as well as all the normal US fast food places. If you plan to go to Old San Juan, take the bus (either T5 or 53) for seventy five cents each way (make sure you have the correct change). The history there is amazing but don't where heels as there is a lot of walking on cobblestone streets. There is a little cafe/bookstore there called Camille's just up from the taxi rank that serves great food at a great price. We booked with East Wind and went out on a catarmaran one day which was great as my husband and son both like to snorkel. I would definitely recommend renting a car as the tours you book through the travel companies can be really expensive and it is easy to just grab a map and go. Rental cars run around $40-$50 per day but there is no charge to enter the El Yunque rainforest and for the Bacardi Rum Distillery tour, both of which were really enjoyable. Parking is a bit of a nightmare though and expensive too... All in all we had a fabulous time and would recommend both the hotel and the destination to anyone looking for fun in the sun!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: LivingTheEasyLife
Reviews.Content: One major caveat -- we did a number of excursions, so we weren't at the hotel all day every day, but the entire time we were there -- we LOVED it! The service was great from the concierge at the pool handing out towels, to the pool side bartenders, to the front desk staff, and housekeeping. I really liked that there was security at the entrance from the beach to the pool, so you knew the only people at the pool were guests. You have to wear a wrist band that changes color daily. The pool servers were also not pushy, stopping by your chair every 5 sec to see if you wanted a drink, but they were around if needed. One of our favorite things about the hotel was the $8.95 menu that you could get at the lobby bar or poolside. We knew, based on other other Trip Advisor reviews, that we would never be eating at the hotel restaurants (WAY too expensive), but to our surprise when we arrived we say a display for this special menu. I got grilled chicken with rice and beans and a salad with the BEST dressing I've ever tasted -- it was a full meal, perfect portions, and DELICIOUS -- did I mention $8.95! Best meal for the money of our 7 days by far. Rooms were great (ours was King, ocean front balcony, 14th floor), very clean, coffee maker with decent coffee (no coffee service in lobby, but Starbucks at the El San Juan, the hotel next door), mini fridge, and when you sat up in bed you could see the waves and tops of the palm trees out the balcony door. The balcony itself is very small, but perfect for just standing and enjoying. Loved also the colors of the room, very fresh and new feeling. I would say perfect for a couple, but if it's a family or if you're entertaining, you'll want something more. Location is a good jumping off point -- but not a ton that's great outside the hotel. Within walking distance you have Mi Casita across the street - a must try (great breakfasts and food overall), Pueblo a grocery store behind the plaza with Mi Casita (stocked up on some necessities for the mini fridge), and a good taco place/ bar down the street, fun atmosphere -- $1.75 for a great chicken taco! And if you're looking to go out, BRAVA located in the El San Juan hotel next door is the "hottest club in all of Puerto Rico". We went on Sat night (ladies free before 11, but guys $20!), however it was a great time and good dancing. The other thing about location is that you'll be easy access to the highways (and only 10 min from the airport). We had a rental car, so this was really important. However, (*IMPORTANT*) parking can be tricky. $22 to valet and $16 in the lot across the street from the hotel. I don't know about you, but that's a ton! Especially since our car was only $20/ day from Alamo. Sooo... street parking. Are talking to a number of police and the hotel concierge, we found that on weekends you can park all day and overnight on Isla Verde (the street right in front of the hotel) for free, however on week days, it's a 1 hour limit (9am-4pm), but still parking overnight is ok (but you have to move by 10am). This worked best for us because we did a lot of things during the day, so were fine to move by 10am. It was mainly tricky bc the front desk staff kept acting like not parking in their lot was a crime, and refused to give us any info. Needless to say, we figured it out, and only had to pay for 1 day of parking (because we chose not to leave the hotel that day). I never felt our car was unsafe on the street. Police are constantly patrolling. So, overall, the best was the room with super comfy bed and great view (ask for a high floor!!), beautiful swimming pool and surrounding area, and great service. Make sure to take advantage of a meeting with the concierge on day 1, they are great and have directions directly from the hotel to ANYWHERE you could want to go. And although the hotel is great, get out and go to Old San Juan and do a rainforest trip. We used Rocaliza and loved them!! Lastly, we used Apple Vacations to book so got a good rate -- like $850 for 7 days, so although it was amazing, we would not have considered it before bc it was so out of our price range. Enjoy Puerto Rico -- it's AMAZING!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for relaxing getaway with Tweeners - very nice hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: tiffk86
Reviews.Content: We book two adjoining rooms to have more space to spread out because the rooms were so reasonably priced. The hotel grounds are lovely, and the kids loved the pool area with swim-up bar. The restaurants were all great..we especially loved eating at the restaurant on the beach with our toes in the sand! We book a snorkel trip so we could see the Caribbean side of the island and loved it. THe breakfast buffet is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax with family, beautiful beach, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: LilifromLA
Reviews.Content: This is a great place, I wanted a hotel with beach and the beach here is beautiful, white sand and warm water. Pool area is great my daughters loved it and spa is also really nice. You can get Puerto Rican food at the hotel that was delicious. We loved it and will love to go back anytime. We got a really good rate of the hotel through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: BlueHabibi
Reviews.Content: Ok if you want to spend a lot of money overall, stay here. Everything is way too expensive. Rooms average, bathroom smaller than our home bathroom, food, drinks, parking $16per day (u park it) $22 valet. For example 2 drinks and one order of calamari $35. Pool is beautiful, great location, oceanfront and city views rooms, nightlife everywhere, close to airport, nice clean beach. There are other hotels close to the area a lot cheaper and very decent. So, if you want to be pampered and treated almost like a person from the royalty and spend royalty $$$ then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fine Hotel, Even Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: GettinOn
Reviews.Content: First thing you notice about this hotel is its visually refined grace. It looks wonderful in design, color and elegance, and all these qualities are conveyed without the over sophistication and opulence of many high-priced locations. The Intercontinental achieves a comfortable and non-overbearing richness. Next thing you find is the welcoming assistance of the staff at the entrance and reception. They too are attentive to guests without being false or cloying. Finally, the fragrance when you enter the lobby, at check-in and on each floor seems chosen with the same goal...to uplift and enhance your visit in a genuine, identifying manner that makes these places comforting and easygoing despite the proximity to opulence. Speaking of fragrance, the toiletries provided are the best I can recall: a Ginseng and Macadamia line. Enough for first impressions, the same comfortable and caring attention is to be found in the staff at the hotel, at the poolside, in the shops and restaurants throughout the grounds. It is in the bedding and the deckchairs and towels and pretty much everywhere. The one area where the hotel went a bit to upscale for my wife and I was in the availability ofreasonably priced food. Had we been traveling with a child, it might have been oppressive to face a $14 charge for a hamburger, dinner at Momoyama or Ruth's Chris, or Alfredo's. For the 2 of us, the poolside restaurant was a little steep, but close to being worth the price. Same for the lobby bar-and-food service. Luckily, there is a plaza across the street with inexpensive eateries. One disappointment was the Casino, which had discontinued its craps table, had a wait-and-see attitude about activating its roulette table and had limited gaming beyond low-priced slots and Texas Hold 'em Poker. It's a comfortably elegant hotel that provides a relaxing place to visit and very good business facilities, but be prepared to spend.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: SelenaMO
Reviews.Content: First night we see a bed bug crawling on the headboard, we got a new room but that was it. They offered us a breakfast ,oh boy! we couldn't sleep or relax for a day or two and they offer us a breakfast. We didn't see anymore or get any bites but if there is one there is another . They made us feel like we were at fault and didn't seem to care at all. I would stay somewhere else if I go there again. Very expensive and over rated. Rained every day. The pool is very nice and the beach is beautiful but this is not the time of year for sun.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Intercontinental San Juan”
Reviews.Author: terithecook
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay through Expedia - and we were surprised at how beautiful the hotel was. When we checked in we asked about an upgrade (booked the cheapest room on Expedia) and with the $50 per night charge, they upgraded us to Ambassador status, and gave us a gorgeous room on the 11th floor - almost a mini-suite. The room was spotless and the view was amazing - right out into the Carribean. We ate once at Ruth Chris (always wonderful), got coffee at the bar every morning (pricey but delicious), took the local bus into Old San Juan/Condado every day and even the bus back. The staff was attentive, always ready to help. We had an issue the first night with the AC (so cold you could hang meat) and it was solved by the time we got back. The pool was great too. We had such a great time we extended our trip one extra night - we didn't want to leave. We also ate at Mi Casita across the street our last night - why didn't we do that earlier? Delicious food, and reasonable too. Only complaint was rain - and rain - and more rain. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: RockyRaccoon
Reviews.Content: Extremely courteous and helpful staff. Very clean. Beautiful pool. Beach is about the softest sand I've ever encountered. I enjoyed the casino, although it's a tad small and the roulette and craps tables were closed. There are restaurants within walking distance, but tons of places within a short cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: eisidro2
Reviews.Content: My group of 3 friends stayed here during July 4th weekend and with flight and hotel package we ended up paying $900/person for 4 nights/5 days. It was a a little pricey, but it was worth it since the hotel was right next to the beach. The rooms were nice, beds were very comfortable and luxurious and the bathroom was good as well. The location of the hotel was great, it was walking distance to the beach/to the clubs (Club Brava in Hotel El San Juan) and the fast food restaurants if you want to save money. There were a 3 nice restaurants in the hotel, and we ended eating at Ruth Chris which was great but also expensive. Parking is not free and I believe it is $14-15/day across the street. The pool outside was outstanding and had a nice waterfall, a jacuzzi, and a swim up bar. Like all other Puerto Rico hotels, the casino was small, with Black Jack/craps, etc. Also the Texas Holdem poker table did have 2/5 No Limit games that lasted till 3am with quite a few good players. Also the concierge was very helpful and pointed out things for us to do in Puerto Rico. Only negative was sometimes service was slow as the manager took a while to check us in since our rooms were apparently not ready. Also breakfast is not included with the package. Would I stay here again? Maybe only if the hotel was cheaper and/or I want to impress my GF/wife/fiance. If I was to go ahead with a group of friends I would try to stay at Embassy Suites which is down the road since it's cheaper, roomier, and has free breakfast and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “would come back”
Reviews.Author: bestfood
Reviews.Content: service great, room the same,pool and grounds perfect. food very expensive? go across the st reet for breakfast . rent a car and get a gps ,we never got lost. have a great trip! by the way make sure you eat at bistro de paris ,the food was great and im a retired chef!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great amenities in a great town”
Reviews.Author: going_palces
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from 8/28-9/1. I must say I read a ton of reviews before leaving and the ISJ lived up to every single GOOD ONE. The travelers who give this place a bad review must either be the type of people that like to complain or they are the unfortunate victims of unforseen circumstances. The beach was nice, clean, not crowded at all. the pool/hot tub area- very nice, clean and not crowded. the staff ranged from being friendly to just succint, no rudeness though. The only restaurant we ate at inside the hotel was the Japanese one and the prices were comparable to the mainland U.S. You can still eat very well, at a lower cost , if you stick to sushi and/or appetizers. Our room was a 15th floor city view (still very cool) and the mattress was the most comfortable I've ever slept on. We were forced to stay indoors the day Hurricane Earl roared through, but it allowed us to catch up on some much needed rest.

Reviews.Title: “We had a ball”
Reviews.Author: sclem75
Reviews.Content: Me and the fam wanted to get away before school started. on the suggestion from my co-worker this hotel was all that she said it was. I will most definitely come back to this hotel. The pool and jacuzzi are open 24hrs. The bar staff was excellent "Kudo's to their "Mango Surprise" they were the bomb". The beach was right out the back and the staff was always there to make sure we had chairs and umbrellas. The hotel staff was nice and their customer services was excellent, from the front desk to the concierge to the Avis representative. We are pool people and the pool is huge, we never felt it was over crowded because we had a lot of room to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money on the Ritz Carlton....The Intercontinental San Juan has it for less”
Reviews.Author: mjh15
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The staff was awesome, very friendly, and eger to go out of their way to assist you with any and everything. My room was nice, but I would recomend you get a room with the pool/ocean view unless you just don't mind viewing the strip and incoming planes, which is the view we had and it wasn't bad. The casino here was not as nice as the Ritz, way smaller, but the outside pool area was way better than the Ritz. I know this because I visited them and minus all the fine fixturesThe Intercontinental has the exact same pool with swim up bar, waterfalls, and an even bigger and better hot tob that stays open 24 hours. They are very strick about letting anyone who is not staying at the hotel into the pool area, this is understandable, so if you want to invite company be ready to pay a fee.....well worth it tho. Plus the beach off The Intercontinenta is WAY nicer. From the walk up bar facing the beach, to the sand, to all the recreational water activites you could image rigt behind your hotel. They provide beach chairs, toys for the kids, and plenty of towels that become warm at night. During my stay housekeeping did quit and some old towels stayed in our room over night, but other than that I didn't notice she was gone, and this was the best trip ever. Funny thing to my trip to San Juan took place during ''Bonnie'' and we were still able to get out and see the city. Make sure you visit the Rain Forest, take the long hike to the watefall, visit Old San Juan, LaBombonera = must eat little cafe Rachel Ray rocommended, vist El Morro, The Bacardi Rum distillery, and take a day trip to either The Virgin Islands or Flamingo beach ranked one of the top 5 beached in the world. Enjoy your trip

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beaverfever
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here and everything was great. Lovely room, fantastic pool area and extremely friendly staff. Loved the swim up bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!! Worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: chelleum
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights and 6 days in Puerto Rico the last week of July. I was recommended this resort by one of my coworker. I read so many reviews on this resort from this website plus other websites. There were more positive reviews than negative but I was still was a little nervous, I really didnt know what to expect. I must say The people who wrote positive reviews were right on. The resort is beautiful!!! My Boyfriend and I had a wonderful time and we can't wait to go back. We arrived early around 12:30pm on a Saturday. Our room wasnt ready so the clerk at the front desk pre check us in, and they took our phone number and told us they will call us when the room was ready. We was also able to leave our bags with the bellmen until our room was ready. Two hours later they called and told us our room was ready. We had left the resort and was walking around the area so they told us when ever we was ready we can come and get the keys. I was so happy at how smoothly check in went, and when we got to our room it was clean and spacious enough for us. We had the city view and I liked it, because I was so fascinated with the planes landing at the airport. Yes, the resort is close to the airport which was great like maybe 10mins top. You can hear some noise from the airplanes landing and taking off but once the balconey door was closed you really didnt hear it. The bed is so comfortable I slept like a baby every night, and I was never awaken from any noise. The pool and hot tub was great. We utilities both morning and night since it was open 24 hours. We didnt hang out at the beach, since my BF dont like the beach. We just walk on the beach one day that it. The fitness center is really nice, they have all the latest machinces. The gym is facing the ocean so you can look out on the beach while working out. The only negative its really hot in there. The machinces have fans on them, I didnt even notice it. It was my BF who notice the fans on the treadmill and once I put it on it made a big differences. I loved the casino even though I didnt win any big money, but I did win enough to pay for breakfast and dinner for a three days. I'm not a big gambler so playing the slots was fun for me. They have the card tables but that not my thing. The casino was a nice size and the staff was helpful. The only negative some of the waitress/waiter stayed more by the card table offering drinks instead of coming over by the slot area. We went to Mi Casita to eat a couple of times, the food was Ok. Lupis was nasty, and La Playata restuarant was really good. The restaurant is outside facing the ocean, and the staff was really nice. We had room service several days from the criollo menu it was really good, and inexpensive. We took a walking tour of Old San Juan at night. We booked this tour with Debbie from legendsofpr.com it was really nice and fun. It was a two hour tour, and she took us to several different location were we took pictures and heard pirate tales and the history of Puerto Rico. We didnt booked this tour with the hotel we did it before we went to PR. That was the only tour we did, I really want to do the rainforest but I will do that on our next trip. We really just wanted to relax, and doing a whole bunch of tours wasnt on our agenda. We walked the whole strip of Isla Verde morning, noon and night and its really safe. There's police every where patroling the area by foot, bike and car. I like that and we never hesistant going out exploring the area or walking down to walgreen if we need anything. Overall the resort is clean, staff friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean everyday and spacious enough. No bedbug and the beds were really comfortable. The amenities were really great and I tried to use all of them. I booked my trip through travelocity and I didnt have any hidden charges at check out. I'm planning another trip to PR and I will stay at this resort again. It was A++++ experience for my BF and I. Just be courtesy to the staff and the staff will be courtesy to you.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware - not a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cranizzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. We got a great rate from Priceline, but because our arrangmements were through priceline, the hotel first wanted to put us in their smallest rooms - by the staircase. After complaining and finding out that no other rooms with King beds were available on the city side, we paid an additional fee to get upgraded to an oceanview room. The room and the bathroom was still quite small however, the view was spectacular. The pros - the pool area and access to the beach were great. There were nearby plazas that provided shopping at walgreens, specialty stores and restaurants. The cons - the rooms were small and unfortunately on the last two nights of our stay, several rooms on our wing got flooded due to a pipe bursting and roaches made their way to our dry room. They had managed to get in our luggage so we spent extra time making sure to pack without any stowaways. Needless to say, we were ready to leave and it left our visit with a bad taste. We did complain and during checkout they did provide us with a discount. Still, I would have preferred to have a different experience. So - if you ask us, the hotel rates more like a 2.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Very Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: jembi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here about 5 years ago, and much has changed since then. We were never approahed by the staff if we needed drinks, etc... You went to the bar and paid $10-16 for an adult beverage and $6.00 for a cup of soda, and the food was good but again very expensive, we paid $12.00 for six chicken wings and a handful of fries, etc.... We had breakfast at the hotel for five adults and one child and paid $140.00 for eggs...WOW... The service was not as it was five years ago. I have to say that the pool was open 24 hrs and that was nice for the kids.. I would recommend catching a cab to old san jaun (mojoito's) staff was very friendly and the prices for very reasonable. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: minnesotans4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days and enjoyed every moment. We had used Hotwire to book the room and were very pleased with our room. Everyone of the hotel staff greeted us with a smile and was so accomodating. Our room was wonderful with two comfortable beds. We appreciated the apt. size refrig in the room and was shocked to have FREE WIFI. I can't think of one hotel that has free WIFI. The bathroom is small but the bedroom was quite large. The pool area was great and quite large. We ate lunch at the bar and the food was delicious and quite reasonably priced. I so appreciated the help from the conceriege who honestly recommended restaurants in San Juan. The hotel is located on a terrific beach. There is also a Pueblo grocery store a few blocks away from the hotel. I think the hotel is in an ideal location. There is a bus stop very near the hotel that we took to Old San Juan. Everyone of the staff tried hard to please which I found refreshing. My son enjoyed the fitness center which looked out onto the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Area!”
Reviews.Author: AnissaSimone
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the InterContinental San Juan for a weekend in July. We needed a relaxing getaway in the middle of moving and wedding planning. The hotel was very nice. There are a few restaurants, a great pool area with jacuzzi, really nice beach, lounge areas, and very close to the airport. The room was nice. I loved the modern bathroom. I am usually a beach person however the pool area was so nice I found myself wanting to stay there the whole visit. Most importantly it is open 24 hours and at night there was a cove-ish area with colored lights, very few people and hardly any kids. The pool also had a swim up bar with flat screen TVs and a food menu. There was a lot of people watching the final game(s) of the World Cup at the swim up bar when we were there. The beach was great too but we spent our ocean time on a day tour snorkeling which almost did not happen. My only complaint is that the person working at the tours desk did not try and find us a snorkeling tour when the companies they use were booked. If my fiance did not have his lap top and we didn't search for our own tour we would have missed out on the experience. The second place he called has plenty of room for us. The location was convenient. For instance, there's a Walgreens, Denny's, Pui Bello, and a trendy Chili's near by. The hotel restaurants that we ate at Momoyama's and Ruth's Chris Steakhouse had good food and loud children. Yet there was not too many kids at the hotel. We both had already been to PR and chose not to do much tourist stuff on this trip since the hotel was so relaxing. Overall I enjoyed my stay and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: Latina1965
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here man times before and Im always satisfied, however my only concern was that they have become alittle lax in security...I noticed people from outside able to walk into the pool area through the beach..I didnt feel as safe as I used too. The staff is friendly, but I noticed not many around. I had to walk to the bar to get a drink. The pool rea and the beach are very nice...the pool should be cleaned every day and its not. The rooms are excellent. I always get an oceanview, because its so beautiful looking out into the water

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and wonderful pool area with great hotel staff; but horrendous Casino staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_722
Reviews.Content: Previous reviewers who wrote about the beauty of the pool area and beach are spot on; they are fantastic. The entire patio area is very comfortable with a nice layout The staff is also friendly and helpful. My wife and I have been down here several times and the concierge and valet staff here was the best we have encountered. The rooms are nice as well, but they felt slightly dated. So the main Hotel staff was phenomenal (including the people at the front desk), However, the same can definitely not be said for the casino staff. The Casino staff wasn't particularly friendly towards "out-of-Towners"; I guess they mainly cater to the locals who fill the casino so the hotel visitors are second thought. Some dealers were nice and friendly but the supervisor or casino bosses were simply rude and sometimes completely offensive. I first played only blackjack and ran into several discrepancies involving "mis-communications" and general mistakes by dealers and supervisors. The head supervisor (man in black suit) was called over a few times, and he was worse than anybody on the floor. (I know this isn't Vegas, but I've played at other casinos in PR (the Ritz or El San Juan) and was shocked by his abrasiveness and general apparent dislike of "Americans"). Most casinos value your play, that definitely can't be said for this establishment. I also played some 2-5 no limit hold 'em poker (the only poker game they offer). This game initially ran smooth, but numerous times discrepancies arose that were resolved by whoever screamed or argued best. (in normal casinos, the supervisor steps in and resolves all issues, this was far from the case) The dealers were adequate but they seemed to be left on their own, with no support from the floor (unlike most casinos where the supervisor keeps a close eye on each table; the female supervisor that was watching my game didn't seemed to be very in tuned to poker or the rules). The dynamic of the poker game is nothing like you have ever normally experienced. The "English only rule" clearly can't apply; because all the locals speak primarily Spanish. This usually isn't an issue, i have played in several countries where this is the case. However, at times it felt that the "non-locals" were at an extreme disadvantage.
