It seemed the supervisors were pretty close to most of the players, so they didn't seem like they had any interest in reprimanding questionable behavior. There were several times that people were simply showing each other their cards (in the middle of the hand). So poker may not be the best option (unless your are fluent in Spanish and prepared to get involved in an argument). So after a few hours of poker i quit. I figured this could be expected from the poker players, but what was truly surprising was the overall disinterest of the casino supervisors. Even when i went back to playing Caribbean poker or blackjack, the more i played the more i could feel resentment from the floor. (And for any regular who plays at a lot of casinos, they know this is the most bizarre thing ever.... Usually casino staff (especially the higher-ups) do whatever they can to make you feel comfortable and happy (so you keep playing) this was simply not the case.) Overall my wife and I had a great time in the isla verde area; there are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants in walking distance of the hotel and Old San Juan (or Condado) is only a ~$15 cab fare away. (make sure you talk prices before you get in the cab (the valet will help if you want.... each valet spoke perfect English and was very helpful). We ate at the sushi restaurant in the lobby and we both enjoyed it, they had a good lunch time special. There is also a Ruth Chris in the hotel, but we didn't get a chance to go there (I would imagine its pretty similar to any Ruth Chris in the States; which is usually fantastic) We had a wonderful "mini-vacation" but the time spent in the casino was unfortunately pretty miserable. My wife and I both ended up winning a decent amount of money; but we still left with this horrible feeling..... which shows that even winning didn't make the horrible attitude and discomfort any better. I recommend staying at the hotel, just avoid the casino for entertainment purposes. There is plenty to do on the island; so save the money and avoid the rude behavior. Go to old San Juan and walk the streets during the day. Also next door at the "el San Juan Hotel" they had Salsa dancing in the lobby after 8 pm which was a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we only stayed for one night.”
Reviews.Author: k00lj
Reviews.Content: On our wedding trip to BVI (Virgin Gorda) we had to stay a night at San Juan as out flight schedule did not allow for a good connection. We booked the Intercontinental in San Juan via Hotwire. We were happy at first as we normally like Intercontinental Hotels, and it was really close to the airport. Our stay was not what we would expect from a Intercontinental hotel at all. We arrived at around 13:00, first we had to wait for half an hour to finally check in, then they did not have any rooms available. They tried to sell us an $80,- upgrade, but no thanks. They completely ignored the fact that we were on our honeymoon and my fiancÃ©e was carrying a wedding dress around. The staff at the check in desk was unfriendly and really ticked me off. The first guy was helping others at the same time he checked us in, blabbing along in Spanish not paying any attention to us. When we asked to speak to a manager it took him forever to find one. The manager was not helpful at all and basically told us, you have to wait as you booked a cheap room. The most annoying thing was that the girl on the next counter had gave out around 4 or 5 rooms already to other customers. It seems they have a profound dislike for people booking though Hotwire. They promised to call us as soon as they would have something ready, but of course they did not. We waited at the hotel bar for 3 or more hours until we finally got a room. The staff at the Bar was friendly though. The room was average, a small bathroom in which I could hardly stand up straight. The AC was very noisy and woke me up in the middle of the night, the bed had some duvet under the sheet, filled with feathers that would annoyingly poke you. At checkout they charged us a $17,- resort fee!, for what?! We did not use any resort amenities and they kept us waiting for half a day. I was glad to check out of this place and head on to the BVI.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Girls Getaway at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: kanikab
Reviews.Content: Like others, I spent countless hours trying to decide between Caribe Hilton, El San Juan and Ritz Carlton for our trip to PR. We were SO pleased with the Intercontinental. We had a clean comfortable room that was serviced at least once (usually twice) per day. We easily found chairs at the pool and beach and getting pool towels was a snap! The restaurant on the beach/at the pool was fantastic and we ate and drank DELICIOUS drinks at some point every day. Intercontinental is perfect because you can walk over to El San Juan which is literally RIGHT next door for nightlife, more exciting restaurants, etc. but then return to a quiet, not-so-packed, more appropriately-priced hotel to relax and rest. I'd like to address some issues raised bout beach hotels in San Juan, and San Juan in general. 1) Yes, there are "locals" at the hotels. If being around Puerto Ricans bothers you, why go to Puerto Rico? I would think folks would stay in there own hometowns if people from other cultures are so bothersome. I personally LOVED that fact and felt like I was getting a real experience. Side note: Go to Luquillo Beach to really get some good Puerto Rican food and experience the beach the way the local people do. 2) The Intercontinental and the other beach hotels DO NOT HAVE BEDBUGS!! I got the same bites on my trip. The mosquitoes and sand mites are relentless all over the island. Put on some off and keep it moving! People claiming bedbug bites have been going to the beach, hiking in the El Yunque rainforest, and just walking around the Caribbean...where bug bites will occur. Side note: DEFINITELY do the El Yunque rainforest if you can. It is NOT for the physically challenged though. 3) Again, if cultural differences bother you, stay home. I travel A LOT and personally haven't met many cultures that compare to Westerners in terms of rudeness (and I say that as an honest American myself). Yes, Puerto Rican people have a different interaction style than the people of say Aruba and Jamaica. Yes, you may wait for service in restaurants and the hotel staff may not drop everything and run to your side whenever you call, but you will get served with a smile if you relax, put a smile on yourself, and realize that you are on vacation. 4) Rent a car if you plan on going on tours and such. For example, the tour to the Bacardi factory was at least $50 per person from the hotels, but the Bacardi Factory tour is FREE. You get 2 FREE Bacardi drinks there also. I highly recommend going. The admission to El Yunque is FREE also. Get a car! It will save you tons of money! 5) The restaurants at the beach hotels are expensive as stated in other reviews. But there are plenty of other options in the area. If you live in a big US city though, you will not notice the prices. I will say that these are gourmet restaurants and were certainly delicious. I did pay over $40 for a drink and a pizza at the El San Juan...but it may have been the best Cosmo and pizza I have ever had! 6) Monitor your tips! Any excess money given will be considered a tip unless you say "I need my change back." We made that mistake on more than one occasion. Many places include the tip but if you put extra money, the server will keep it. 7) For all of the hotels, the hotel grounds are better than the rooms. The rooms do need a bit of updating, but they were clean and comfortable and we didn't notice much because we didn't stay in the room except for sleeping at night. All of the Isla Verde hotels seem to spend much more on the pool, lobby, casino, restaurants, etc. than the rooms, which at the end of the day is probably a good idea on their part. 8) The hotel is close to Old San Juan which is a must for architecture, history, souvenirs, local music, art and people and of course...good food! 9) The "laguna" view is a view of the street, city and construction. There may be a laguna some miles away. "Pool/Garden" view actually faces the ocean but they are on lower floors the view of the ocean is blocked by lush and beautiful foliage by the pool. If you don't want to spring for ocean view, pool/garden view is a good choice. In all, I highly recommend the Intercontinental for families, young singles, older couples, anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice beach”
Reviews.Author: ReneeCR18
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 6 nights in July. We had been worried about the weather, as rain was in the forecast every day, but was assured on here that that is the standard forecast and that it doesn't actually rain that much. We got away with just one truly rainy day so that was nice. Check-in and check-out: Because of our flight time we arrived 3 hours before check-in. Our room wasn't ready so they got our number and said they would call us when the room was ready. We went back at 4 and because of the line didn't get to the desk until 4:30, at which point our room was deemed ready. Check-out was much more pleasant, mostly because the resort fee (that I had been waiting for after reading reviews on here) never appeared. We booked our flight/hotel package through Travelocity, so perhaps it was already included, but it was a nice surprise. Beach and pool: The beach had nice smooth (close to) white sand. Beach chairs are provided by the hotel for free, umbrellas are $10 (probably because someone has to come out and shovel a hole in the sand for it...well worth it for us). We didn't hang out at the pool much, it was fairly crowded even at night, but was nice. Restaurants: I have difficulty finding places to eat in Puerto Rico because I'm a vegetarian, however all but one of the places in the hotel (the bar in the hotel lobby) has numerous vegetarian options, which was appreciated. It is expensive but not outrageous. Ciao is the restaurant just off the beach and has a good drink menu where you get probably a 10-oz drink for $8-9. I recommend GuayaBOOM. They also had pizzas for $12-19 that are big enough to share if no one is extremely hungry. Alfredo's was nice, two entrees, a bottle of (relatively) inexpensive wine, and a shared dessert was $125 with tip. If you want a cheaper option I echo the recommendations for Mi Casita, directly across the street. When we wanted fast food to bring to the beach we would go to Subway next to Mi Casita. We also had 2 very good experiences at Plato's, about an 8-minute walk down Isla Verda Avenue. Room: We paid for an ocean view room, which was completely worth it. The view of the 'city' would be a little depressing from where the hotel is. The balcony was great to have, however it's not big enough for chairs. We would just sit cross-legged on the balcony and enjoy the view. We were next to the elevator but the noise was never bad. Room service was good and on the last night they made an elaborate elephant out of towels, which I got a kick out of. The fridge alternated between off (the plug kept falling out) and too cold (our 2-liter of coke completely froze) but was nice to have. Good selection of movies, we pay-per-viewed one for $12.99 on the one afternoon that it was raining hard. Gym: NOT AIR-CONDITIONED. I had intended to go a few times but after the first time I couldn't take how hot it was. There are vents downstairs at the spa but the gym is on the second level and had no air conditioning. Besides that it was fine and has a nice view of the ocean and individual TVs at the cardio equipment. Car rental: We wanted to play things by ear so we started looking into car rentals the day before we wanted to get one. The Avis desk was standing firm at $69/day for the cheapest option, so we booked through Enterprise online for $50/day and picked it up at El San Juan next door. Not bad for last-minute. Charlie Cars is also just a couple blocks down Isla Verda Avenue, as another option for comparison. Do yourself and get the insurance if you aren't used to Puerto Rican driving. Overall I would recommend, I felt we got a good value for our money (especially without the resort fee).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accommodations; Nice Staff...”
Reviews.Author: McVaugh
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for my wife and my summer vacation based on an ad I received as a Priority Club Member. Then (after so doing) stumbled upon the Trip Advisor Web site and began reading quite a few negative reviews which had me in a state of flux, i.e., terrible service/staff, antiquated rooms with bed bugs, over priced in-house restaurants, etc. Suffice it to say that I did not experience anything like that. From the time we arrived till the time we departed we were treated with all due respect and courtesy by every staff member we encountered, including Mr. Velaquez, the Concierge. Our room on the 11th floor was superb with a breathtaking view and was refreshed daily without fail. This is a beautiful facility. Now, regarding the in-house restaurants being a bit pricey, it's true; however, we dined at all 3 (Momoyama, Alfredo's and Ruth's Chris) and here's the skinny on our experience. Avoid AIfredo's at all costs as it was horrendous (service and food). Momoyama's was average at best and if your expecting the Tempanyaki Chef to put on a show, you'll be terribly disappointed. In fact, our chef wasn't even Japanese. Now, as to Ruth's Chris, don't miss it! Service was exemplary, food was delicious and the Manager, a Mr. Domingo Rosa Ortiz, is one of the nicest guys on the island who bent over backwards to ensure our dining experience was a memorable one. Lastly, if you don't have a rental car, avoid the .75 bus ride to Old San Juan at all cost. Pay the 19 bucks and take a cab. Believe me, you'll be much better off and in the end, you'll think it's a bargain...

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: mycousinbrynnie
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel with fabulous staff! It's taken me a while to write this review but I haven't forgotten how great this place was! Friendly and knowledgeable staff helped us book several day trips. Rooms are large and comfy. Pool area is great!! Alfredo's, the hotel's Italian restaurant was fantastic - definitely get the fettucini! Also, had good food at the lobby bar and pool area. Would recommend this hotel in a heart beat! Only issue we had was during check-in, although we had pre-paid the hotel required a $100 a day hold on your credit card, which was an extra $700 that we didn't have! We explained this to the staff and they were able to work with us. Great trip overall - planning my return trip to PR now!!

Reviews.Title: “It was kinda cool”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelBunny
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was not bad. Actually, it was beautiful. I loved the pool and laying out in the sun. The wait staff by the pool were very friendly and the cleaning ladies were very sweet. The lady that checked us in was not very friendly, nor was the lady that checked us out. At check out, I told the manager that they had bed bugs and he told me that their beach has sand mites.... SAND FLEAS... I actually have scars from this... I had a really bad reaction to the bites and my legs (mostly around the ankles) are scarred. I ended up having to go to a dermatologist. All in all had a great time! Except I was itching so bad I would not go out side for the last 2 days of our trip. (We stayed 4 days). I would recommend coming here if you were not going to spend any time on the beach, since it is not treated. Definitely do not come for the casino.

Reviews.Title: “great little get away”
Reviews.Author: mlomas
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. It was a 4 night get away to relax. We arrived at 12noon and we were able to check in. It was thursday and not busy. The check in went smooth. Since they were not busy they had a partial ocan view available on the 6th floor and they upgraded us because of our special occasion. Even though we were across from the elevator and was slightly noisy at times but it was worth seeing the ocean from our balcony. Jose was very friendly and helpful at the front desk. The beach had small jelly fish that sting. I was stung everyday in the ocean. Best bet is swim 9am-11am when the ocean is cooler, no jellys at that time. Great pool. We ate outside of the hotel everyday at some great little places( Don jose great sandwiches we loved their sandwiches the best, skip the Lupis for food not great but good margaritas and salsa, mi casita good breakfast and dinner place, metropol great cuban food and reasonable).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel saved our trip!”
Reviews.Author: LindaV_123
Reviews.Content: We were originally at the Conrad Condado and had to check out when it became apparent that they couldn't control the screaming local teenagers who were on all floors in both towers, hopped up on energy drinks and beer, celebrating prom. Look, I don't want to take anything away from their happy celebration, I just don't want to stay at the same hotel! But back to the InterContinental . . . They promised us a good night's sleep and they delivered. It was quiet throughout the property! The room was decent, nothing spectacular. A little rough if you look too closely. The bed was comfortable enough. The bathroom was clean and functional. I especially liked the make-up area with magnifying mirror (why doesn't every hotel have those?) The male daytime concierge was really fabulous. He sized us up and suggested some off road activities that were right up our alley. In fact, I found all the hotel staff very friendly. The pool area and hot tub was very nice, especially the waterfalls and little private pool. Aside from the coffee and wine bar, which met our needs, we did not eat at the hotel. I would stay at this hotel again. We arranged surfing lessons through Ricardo Carbia at Caribbean Surf School, 787-637-8363. His helper, Danny, was a great teacher. I didn't do so well but my 13 year old was a surfer by the time the lesson was through. He was happy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with a couple of very small issues.”
Reviews.Author: 7continentssoon
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental was great. We upgraded to Club Level, which was well worth the money. It included breakfast daily, use of a computer, private access, separate 2 story wing with ground and 2nd floor rooms off of the pool, afternoon cookies, wine/cheese in the early evening and knowledgeable staff. Lynn in the club was awesome, Jesus in the Wine shop at the hotel was a dream and all of the pool/beach staff were friendly and helpful too. We were there for 6 days. The small issues were, the dresser smelled of mold-but the room didn't and wasn't musty at all, the king size bed seems more like a queen and they are strict about check-out time, but are more than happy to let you check your bag and stay there. The bus stops less than a block away and is very easy to manage into Old San Juan and to the forts. It is only 75 cents. A cab is 15-20 dollars. Definitely go to the Bio Bay at Fajardo-it is amazing. The Rain Forest is also very fun and and easy trip-we rented a car for the day and it was easy enough to get around. Stop at the Kioskos at Laquillo Beach-it is an experience. We ate at Congas - very good and the owner was so proud of an upstairs deck the they are building. Very Prideful! Spread Eagle tours has a fantastic Captain(John) and will take you to the greatest reefs-more laid back than some of the other catamaran companies. We encountered a couple of other boats-they were like booze cruises, which are fine, but we really wanted to see fish/sea life and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: somersetdave90
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the property a few years ago and had a great experience staying in the Club level. I would have expected that those rooms would have been renovated by now, but they were not. We looked forward to the standard of service and selection we had experienced in the "Club" and were disappointed. We learned that it had been closed for a year and recently reopened and is a "work in progress". Prior to our vacation, I read reviews concerning food and beverage prices so I was prepared (I thought). One club sandwich 4 10 oz beers and tip cost us $50!. Old San Juan is definitely worth going to spend the day and the churches are beautiful. Barrachino's is my favortite restaurant in OSJ. El San Juan next to ICH also has some very fabulous restaurants including the Palm (check out Wed. specials) and La Piccolo Fontana. Expensive but great! We'll be back, but I will call first.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: DallasJeff004
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night on our way to Vieques so we didn't get the full experience. Overall the hotel is nice but nothing spectacular. If you are looking to save money do not eat or drink anything at the hotel as it is very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: hestiakd
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a beautiful hotel and the staff was very nice. The rooms could use a little sprucing up but they were not bad at all. The beach and pool were great and I found the food at Alfredo's was yummy! While all your meal options at the hotel were a bit pricey it's to be expected. Most days my husband and I would go to this cute place across the street called "mi casita" very good Puerto Rican food for a great price. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are ok but service really isn't...”
Reviews.Author: busorap
Reviews.Content: Rooms are ok but service really isn't good. Our fligt was 15 hrs late becos of a storm and the hotel refused to give us a refund or anything at all. Overall, the staff was pretty lazy and unhelpful. Concierge is useless.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: explore85
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great. from the moment we got from the airport it was great. the fare was only $13 from the airport by Taxi and it was maybe a 10min drive. they price the taxi before you even leave the airport so you dont get a meter'd fare. the rooms were very nice and they were very clean. it was a quick check-in process and they had a room ready for us about an hour before check-in time. the one downfall was there is a $14 per day resort fee that hotwire didn't cover. i wish they would've included it in the price. the services were great. the hotel is beautiful and the beach is paradise. there was a drawback, i understand the intent was for our security and exclusivity, but they came by one night and asked all the guests in the pool area what room and name. you could think that they would have done some better security at the beach gate and in the lobby. the taxi to old town was $19 but the bus (which doesn't run frequently) is 75 cents. we went on two tours. both booked by myself, but you can book East Island Catamarans through the hotel. They pick you up right when they say they do and it was AMAZING, i will rate on their amazing trip on another post. I also booked a rainforest tour, Rocaliza. The hotel has no connection to them but it was the BEST trip ever. I'm glad i didn't go through the hotel. I think all they had was hiking or zipling, but not both...Rocaliza was hiking, zip-line, and rappelling. I'll rate on them in another too. All-in-all this was a great hotel and i would definatly stay here again. i would recommend it to honeymooners, friends, family anyone who wants to have a good hotel, quiet time and beautiful environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mazzm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline for a precruise night $119 a room per night. Rooms were very nice, overlooked the main entrance, nice little balcony, average hotel noise. The rooms were very clean and the beds were great. The pool area and beach area were very nice and clean. Easy access to beach from pool area. Nice restaurant between the beach and the pool for informal food and drinks. Hotel is located in an ok area. There is a Walgreens located about a 5 minute walk from the hotel where you can stock up on your suncreens etc at pretty much the same prices as in the US. This saves a lot of space in your luggage for other items you want to bring with you. The casino is a bit small with very limited card tables and slots. The prices in the bar are expensive, I was drinking a martini which cost $11 a pop. We ate at the Japanese Steak House near the lobby and the food was incredible. I would definately go back there to eat:) Overall it was a great experience and I would go back and stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean & beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Portiany
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice & accomodating. It can be pricey but if you look around you can get a great deal. It was spotless. Only issue is price of bars & restaurants being high. This is typical with hotels so I wasn't overly upset about it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation & luxury at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Jill091
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are extremely friendly and service oriented. Jose in the pool towel service always made us smile each morning! The pool and beach were immaculate. The food by the beach is very good, but on the expensive side. We enjoyed breakfast at a bagel shop across the street with really good food at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE !”
Reviews.Author: Owen767
Reviews.Content: what an amazing hotel, grounds and staff. The beach bar, sand water was amazing. the sand was soft, the food was fantastic and reasonably priced, the drinks were cold and the water was beautiful. The surf was not strong at all which made the swimming very enjoyable. The security at the hotel was very good - without a wristband - no one was getting into the resort. The pools on the grounds were nice, very clean and nicely landscaped and inviting. The Beds - WOW - comfortable. our room over looked the front entrance. The night life was fantastic to watch and very safe to participate in. Would I go back and stay - IN A HEART BEAT Owen - Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Worst Intercontinental locations we've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: lusze
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a few of the Intercontinental Properties as a Ambassador / Priority Club member. This Puerto Rico location is the worst of all we've been to, it's old the property needs some major updating and cleaning. We go upgrade to ocean front room we got a great view but the room itself is old with very outdated interior, old and worn out furniture; bathroom is not clean. Amenity is poor. Service is not nearly as good as all other locations. i would not recommend this to any friend and especially any of the club member you will be very disappointed. Lastly, do not eat at the Alfredo food is terrible, everything is overcooked and the quality of food is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a beach weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: HuBison
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel has had many great reviews and there's a reason why. If you really want to stay in the heart of San Juan, it might be crowded but full of culture and events and lots of restaurants. But I really wanted a beach weekend away and that's what I got. It all starts with the taxi ride from the airport. When you exit the airport, don't look for a sedan, most of the cabs are large white vans and they will tell you it costs more to get to the Isla Verde area (which is a mile and a half away); be prepare to haggle or at least let them know that you know how much it should cost (that means do you research before you arrive). Once we arrive at the Intercontinental, EVERYONE was pleasant. We booked our flight and hotel together to save some money, but didn't really feel like we got a bad room (as some places do put their third-party booking guests in yucky rooms). We got a room on the 14th floor, in the front (facing the lagoon) in the middle of the hotel (next to the elevator and we heard very minimal traffic). Check-in and check-out were both smooth and easy. Our bed was comfy and plush and the room was nice, but the bathroom looked a little gross. It was a little small, but there was a vanity area next to it in case you needed a mirror while someone was in the bathroom. I believe the hotel was recently renovated, it just didn't look like they put too money into the bathroom. The ceilings in the room and especially the bathroom are a little lower that one might be used to, but the balcony was nice and there was fridge in the room. The pool was great, they have a swim-up bar and you walk through the pool area to get to the beach. What more could you ask for? The have a little restaurant off the beach with drinks and lunch items, but be ware, the pigeon population can be a little crazy. They don't flinch much when you shoo them away, but as long as you don't have food dropping to the floor, you should be OK. Back to Old San Juan-with 75 cents exact change and 45 minutes to spare (30 minutes if it's not rush hour), you can easily get to Old San Juan taking the A5 bus to the last stop. Once you arive, don't bother with the trolley, just walk, but get a street map. With a good pair of sneakers and 20-30 minutes, you can walk to the El Morro fort from the bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly service”
Reviews.Author: sfltraveler
Reviews.Content: We went for a girls long weekend trip. The hotel is very nice, the rooms extra clean and comfortable. The pool area is beautiful. We did notice this is a very popular hotel for couples, there were a few families while we were there, but not that many children. All of the hotel staff was very friendly, and went above and beyond to accommodate anything we needed. It was such a nice, relaxing weekend. Some pluses: drinks by the pool (on the pricey side, but were good), service to the beach chairs out on the beach, and walking distance to several good restaurants and nightclubs. Also, you are an easy taxi ride to spend a day in Old San Juan ($19 each way), and about an hour to El Yunque rainforest. I highly recommend renting a car for a day and making that trip. Swimming in the waterfall is an amazing (albeit cold!) experience. You can rent a car at the hotel from Avis. You will save money if you go online and rent vs doing it at the counter. Also keep in mind if you rent a car and keep it overnight you will have to pay the parking fee for the hotel...and it wasn't cheap, 20 or 25 a night I believe. The only hotel restaurant we ate at was the sushi restaurant, and I can say it was so good we went back again!! Also, Platos is a local restaurant within walking distance, go try the lobster mofungo..delish!! There is a small casino, we didn't use it. My only real complaint is that they don't have a nice lounge onsite with music...that would be a real plus. But since there are several within walking distance, this would not stop us from staying here again. In fact, we will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “very clean & hospitable”
Reviews.Author: denieguev
Reviews.Content: Priorities for me are quiet and bed comfort. The bed was comfortable enough and the noise...except for Saturday night was very much okay. I guess it largely depends on who you get stuck with in the room next to yours, because as with other hotels I've experienced in San Juan, the walls aren't thick enough. It's got a very nice lobby and pool. the room, i wouldn't describe as luxurious (similar to a hampton inn in the u.s.), but it was plenty comfortable. the spa doesn't seem to do massages from what i can tell.

Reviews.Title: “This gray lady needs a little work!”
Reviews.Author: jonders
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a 3-night stay for long weekend getaway. Our room was decent and had a OK city view. We requested an oceanfront room but that request was rudely and quickly dismissed. The best thing about the room was the comfortable bed. Amenities at the hotel were rather lacking. The food at "Alfredo's" restaurant was very average, but service was decent. The food at the pool bar was ridiculously expensive, and there's no place in the hotel to get coffee in the morning! Tip: The El San Juan Hotel, located a block away has an awesome lobby with several shops and a great bar with nightly entertainment and dancing. AND, they have a Starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience- stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sazoram
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights pre-cruise with my parents and children--what a place! Rooms were spotless and beds oh-so-comfy. Landscaping was lush and welcoming. We didn't know where to go first-hmmm, huge hot tub, pool with swim up bar or the beach? Plenty of chairs for all. The only complaint would be the exorbitant price of food-we just went elsewhere. Everyone was so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel but a few flaws.....”
Reviews.Author: ballyJersey
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at this hotel after cruising for one week on the Princess Caribbean. We booked our holiday with Virgin Cruises. Tue hotel was generally good and we were happy with the staff service who were plesant and helpful most of the time. However, there are a couple of areas that they need to improve on: 1) Main restaurant - Alfredos. This restaurant's food service was the slowest i have ever experienced. If you ordered two courses then you need to allow at least 45mins for each course to arrive. This is unacceptable and we did complain on a couple of ocassions to the manager who did not apologise or give a reasonable explanation. Plus only a few guests ordered wine by the bottle as the prices are generally far too expensive. 2) Lack of evening entertainment - there's not a lot to do at the hotel after you have finished you meal, so you would expect that the hotel would lay on the regular entertainment for its guests. However, we only say some musicians towards the weekend and nothing for the rest of the week. This is poor. 3) Japanese restaurant - as virgin customers, we were "allowed" to use our $60pp vouchers on Tuesday nights. We were offered a set menu and the food was generally of a good standard and service was good. However, i felt that the we shoulsd have been able to choose from the normal menu like the other customers. This was annoying as this restaurant was making at least $120 from each couple and the food delivered was not really worth that amount as the courses consisted of salad, soup, stir fry and ice-cream. Howevfer, luckily we did have a lovely ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice beach, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdogs0
Reviews.Content: We were just here for one day/night so we had limited exposure to a lot the hotel offered. We took a taxi for $15 USD to Plaza Americas Mall for shopping, be sure to show your passport at the customer service desk to get a coupon book. Lots of stores and fairly good prices compared to America in some stores. We also took a $25 USD taxi to El Camarero Race Track for an afternoon of horse racing, we sat upstairs in the restaurant and had a great lunch. The hotel was obviously in it's hayday a decade or more ago, but we knew that going in and found a comfortable bed, clean towels, nice staff, a great pool area and nice soft sand beach. We ate dinner downstairs in the italian restaurant and had a fantasatic waiter, better than expected meal, and really reasonable prices. We opted for a city view suite and actually enjoyed the local "noise" and music from the street far below, it felt like we were close to everything. I'm sure the pool/beach view rooms and suites would feel more secluded or relaxing, but we were looking for something different on this trip. As with most nearby casino/hotels, the actual casino was small but people were friendly. You can walk to other hotels, which we did, and there were a lot of other quality dining options just one or two hotels away. The only downside to the room was the bathroom. It was small and dated. Things worked well, it was just cramped. We talked about making another trip and staying here again when we have more time. A great value when you're not looking for the Spa Resort luxury type vacation, but a casual beach day and planty of nightlife trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beach and pool”
Reviews.Author: travelerplus2
Reviews.Content: After reading many good and bad reviews about the Intercontinental on Tripadvisor, my husband and I were a bit worried about what our stay would be like. Fortunately, it was great. We originally had reserved a room with a city view, but upgraded to an ocean view upon checking in by purchasing their Ambassador card for one year for $150 - which was less than paying for the additional amount of the ocean view room for 4 nights. Plus we get a free night stay at another location within one year. Our room was on the 12th floor with a beautiful view. The balcony is not much, but I just wanted to sleep with the doors open and listen to the waves at night. The room was clean and quiet. Small bathroom, but comfortable bed. No, the rooms are not cheap, but you are on a tropical island right on the beach. The pool was large with plenty of available chairs. The drink and food prices were outrageous - when we got there the first day we were starving and ate at the beach bar: a quesadilla, a salad, and three beers were $50. So later we went to Walgreens and the supermarket and bought our own liquor and snacks and brought them to the pool/beach with us and saved a ton of money. Beach was beautiful with no seaweed and warmer water than the pool. The casino was small, but my husband enjoyed the $10 blackjack table. The doorman, Ray, was great and gave us tips on where to go and how to get there. Took the bus to OSJ for .75 but it was a loooong ride. We didn't eat any meals at the hotel, but ventured out to the many local places within walking distance. Mi Casita was our favorite for breakfast - delicious and inexpensive. Metropol was good, but if you aren't fluent in Spanish, they were not much help with the menu. The El San Juan next door was bigger and fancier, but also louder, pretentious and more crowded. Jimmy's BBQ on the top floor was casual and fun though. All in all, we found the hotel very nice, great location, and the staff was friendly. We didn't have extremely high expectations, so maybe we were pleasantly surprised. Besides, I was on vacation - all I wanted was beautiful weather, a beach chair and a good book. I believe if you act respectful and friendly to others, you'll get that back in return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go on a Virgin 'Cruise and Stay' at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrightD
Reviews.Content: After a week's fabulous Princess Cruise we stayed at the Intercontinental San Juan for the following week. It wasn't a good experience. We waited around until late afternoon until we were given a room and our luggage. We were expected to eat a poor and tasteless buffet underneath the terrace which was used as a child's play space. We were squashed together on large picnic tables and had to sit on plastic picnic chairs. When we all complained we were given vouchers which hardly covered the cost of the food in the restaurant. The Virgin rep was very rude and we all had to get very angry before she arranged vouchers - which hardly covered the cost a meal in the restaurant. Some of the staff in the hotel were also rather offhand and seemed to resent 'Virgin' customers . All in all not a very happy experience for Virgin Holiday Cruises holidaymakers. When asking Virgin for proper compensation after this experience - some have been adequately recompensed and other not for some reason - which is completely unfair as we all experienced the same stay. All in all a spoilt holiday.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel thinks staff stealing from guests is ok”
Reviews.Author: Artemisthetraveller
Reviews.Content: My coat and cardigan were stolen from my room by person or persons unknown that had key access. I did report it to many senior managers, the tourist police and head office, but they really didn't give a damn. They just said that they couldn't find it! I said that was obvious as it has been stolen. Apart from the above, I wouldn't recommend this hotel as it is in a really awful cheesy area, the usual awful low quality American fast food restaurants and right next to the airport so very noisy. a small minority of the staff were really great but the rest.......

Reviews.Title: “Great post cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: WinemerchantPoole
Reviews.Content: Arrived hours before check in,but reception took our bags and we were able to use all the amenities whist waiting for the phone call to say our room was ready.The drink prices in the hotel are slightly expensive,but if you go out of the hotel(beach side) turn left and around 150 metres along are 2 bars,very very resonably priced drinks also selling food and playing great sounds. Room was great with a fab view,reception gave us a free late check out,all staff were fantastic,except mr miserable behind the bar in the lobby,wants to learn to smile and say please and thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, friendly, great for family with young ones!”
Reviews.Author: afeeoo
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband and 6 year old son...the best part of staying in this hotel besides being located 10 minutes from the airport and having a beautiful beach feet away from the pool, they had all the extras for the little ones to entertain them. From sand toys, board games, balls and noodles for the pool, movie night, entertainment througout the day and a little play ground no need to carry extra from home in your luggage. My son adored having the choice of pool or beach. Lots of towels with no problems, available chairs at all times at the beach and they set it up for you. The pool was another issue considering all those who come down before 7 am to throw a towel on many chairs to save spots and go back in ...but then again what hotel doesn't have this issue. We spent most of your time at the beach. We had a beautiful six days of amazing weather. We loved the long strolls in the morning at the beach, kite flying and sand castle building. The water was calm and relaxing to be around. Everyone was kind and friendly. The rooms were always cleaned by 10 am, room service was great. Must have a great dinner expensive but delicious..Rita's Steak House. We had excellent service for the two nights we spent there. Angel was our watier he was so kind to even give my son crayons and coloring pages. Make sure you ask for Angel and refer back to Mr. Allan. A dinner for three with tip is an average of $ 200 but well worth every penny. My son is a picky eater, they accomdiate the menu to suit is taste buds. So sweet! Over all, I would recommend this hotel and I do plan on visiting next April with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaandJarrett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fantastic time at this hotel. The staff was so courteous and helpful...from the bellhop to the concierge to the front desk. It is a 10 minute ride by taxi to the hotel and only cost $10. We were sitting at the pool 40 minutes after landing! We were really happy with our room and the spaciousness. Across the street from the hotel are plenty of fast food restaurants and a Walgreens. We were able to go cheap for breakfast and lunch and splurge on dinner. A cab ride to Old San Juan is $19 each way. We later found out you can take a bus fro .75 cents in to town and then cab it back. That was a great way to save money. The restaurants in OSJ are delicious...NYC quality!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: cmcgg
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Very nice place to go and relax and even to gamble a bit. Kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “beware of virgin 'half board' at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: portsmouthbrandy
Reviews.Content: On arrival the room was pretty grim - dated and small with views of tradesman entrance to the side of front elevation. we were spending 6 days after a cruise and were not happy. our only choice was to upgrade to another room. we chose a club room at the side of the pool with private patio. it was a shedload of money but hols are important to us so we paid up and were really glad we did. ref the virgin half board - you cannot even get two courses each for the 60 dollar voucher they allow you in Alfredos restaurant - it was so over priced, with automatic 15% tip plus numerous taxes etc etc. we took to the poolside bar to eat but even there two tasty but thin steaks with a couple of ice creams and two glasses of wine was adding up to more than 100 dollars!! so three courses was out of the question having mortgaged our lives to get the room upgrade!!! we spoke to others with virgin and many were supplimenting their meals to 30 -50 dollars/day. Poolside drinks etc were grossly overpriced - 2 cocktails 25 dollars!! 2 beers 20 dollars so we used the local supermarket for supplies - each room had a fridge - that was good! overall the hotel pool and beach were lovely and once we'd sorted the room, that was lovely but generally the hotel was dull and out of date. we found no problem with the staff all were friendly and helpful. its difficult to recommend this hotel - as a virgin customer id say no due to the food situation but as an independant when you could eat elsewhere i guess its ok - i dont know the prices but it must be high knowing what we paid for an upgrade over the basic room price!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go Deep Sea Fishing on the Sea Born out of Club Nautico”
Reviews.Author: seabassman
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was great, despite three days of rain, my fishing trip on the first sunny day booked through the hotel, on a boat called the Sea Born was a "Rip Off". I paid a double fare because I was the only one wanting to go out. We traveled about 20 Minutes, a couple of miles off shore, and started fishing. There wasn't another fishing boat in sight. There were however, a few Cargo ships passing close by. After three hours of trolling back and forth without a single bit we returned back at the dock precisely at 12:00 Noon. Aviod this boat and it's captain.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome honeymoon at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: texaschic84
Reviews.Content: This is long overdue, but we absolutely loved this hotel. We mentioned that we were on our honeymoon and got upgraded to ocean view and got free chocolate covered strawberries and champaign about 4 out of our 7 nights there. rooms were great, pool is awesome, right on the beach and close to local restaurants. we also got massages at the spa there on the beach which were amazing!! we will stay here again when we return!

Reviews.Title: “intercontinental san juan...5 star location...3.5 star hotel....worth it !”
Reviews.Author: repodude
Reviews.Content: ok....about a month ago...i wantd to take my wife and 2 kids...6/8...away for easter break....we're from nj...wantd direct flight...4 hrs tops...5 days...all done..i would recommend puerto rico..and i'd recommend the intercontinental...yes its dated...things arent new and shiney...yes the prices are high around the hotel...BUT THATS WHAT THINGS COST ON VACATION ! I loved reading reviews...people complaining about all that..complaining about the seeweed in the ocean !?!? complaining about people being rude...they were fine...u treat them with respect..u'll get some back..some review complained about the door not being held open everytime...i wasnt expecting it..but the door opened everytime for me and my family !! this hotel is 5 minutes from the airport..local restaurants nearby..local food....less expensive...near the ritz and el san juan...u can walk over..go to brother jimmy's have a drink on the roof...watch the sun set...awesome...all the old crabs that complained about this hotel are the ones that complain when ur kids are acting up on the plane...get a life !! anyway..the weather was great...5 days of 85 to90..sunny...4 hrs from newark airport....and for the record..i do pretty well for myself...could go anywhere on vacation....for 5/6 days...great weather...direct flight...choose puerto rico....and the intercontinental...

Reviews.Title: “terrible service and medicore rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: joelwilner
Reviews.Content: could not have picked a worse hotel for service....when we checked in said we didnt have a reservation!!! despite showing them confirmation..then gave us a room as bad as broom closet..told them we were supposed to have an ocean view room and showed them on our confirmation..they got very angry and abusive.....when they finally relented they gave us the wrong room and key......when we went back to tell them they were speaking in spanish how fun it was to "screw with the anglos" Unfortunately for them..we explained we understood spanish and every word they said!!! they went nuts!!! tried to reach the manager who of course was unavailable.... the rooms were mediocre at best....not up to IC standards at other properties plus BS resort fees and terrible food!!! DO NOT RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: crusnwsusn
Reviews.Content: We were glad we stayed at the InterContinental for our 5 day vacation. It was a pretty hotel, with a light tropical feeling. We had fun at the casino each night. Upon arrival at 2:30pm, we wanted to upgrade into an oceanview room. Rosie, at the front desk did find us a room overlooking the ocean up on the 14th floor but she was making unpleasant faces the whole time while helping us. The room wasn't ready so we walked around the pretty grounds and had a cocktail in the lobby. Our room was not ready until well after 5pm and we had to keep reminding the front desk that we were still waiting. However, once we were into our room, we were pleased with the accommodations. The room was clean with pretty and new furnishings and smelled pleasant. Our housekeeping maid was wonderful, had turndown service every evening. She removed our wet towels and gave us extra clean towels morning and night. The pool area and beach were wonderful. It was not crowded. There was seaweed in the water the first day but after that first day, it was beautiful and clean every day thereafter. Umbrellas are available for $10 per day at the beach. There were two ladies selling fun jewelry on the beach. Not once did peddler's come around bothering us to buy junk, that was appreciated! There was a place to get lunch and drinks at the pool and beach which was convenient. The italian restaurant was delicious for dinner, slow service however. They did serve a buffet breakfast here each morning which was very nice, we felt there was good selections and we enjoyed eating outdoors, coffee was delicious! We ventured away from the hotel three nights and ate dinner in Old San Juan at Aguaviva, The Italian Restaurant in El San Juan Hotel, next door to InterContinental and Pikayo at The Conrad Hotel in Condado. All three were excellent! We enjoyed great service, delicious food, cocktails and decadent desserts at these three fine restaurants, I hightly recommend them during your stay at PuertoRico. Getting a taxi to leave the hotel was quick and efficient at the front door, I appreciated that. The airport is only five minutes away from Intercontinental so going and coming went without a hitch. We were very pleased with our stay at Puerto Rico and at the InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel if You Have Booked With Virgin”
Reviews.Author: connedbybranson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel afrter a weeks cruise which was fantastic,what a letdown to be sentenced to a week at this hotel, staff were extremely rude to english customers apparently because we do not tip them enough, expected to eat in a childrens play area as we were deemed to be second class and given a $60 voucher for food that did not cover the over priced menu. virgin rep and staff at the hotel not interested in any complaints and a large group of us who stayed here are currently seeking compansation from virgin this has been an ongoing problem that virgin knew about in oct 2009 and by the reviews on here it is still not been resolved . So unless you want a holiday where the staff serve you 20 min after everyone else when they see that you are with virgin throw your food and drinks down are damright rude demand a tip, charge $12 for two plastic cups half full with frothy beer and want to eat a childrens menu in a childrens play area because they dont want you eating in the proper resteraunts then this is the place to go. (PS no wonder Branson owns his own Island he bought it out of the money he made conning me). Would i recommend this hotel to a friend NO i wouldnt even send my worst enemy here either as i am not that cruel.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in PR”
Reviews.Author: pjfarr1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental both prior to and following our recent Caribbean cruise. We could not have been happier with our choice! The hotel has an excellent staff! Very helpful and friendly (and make great drinks). We loved the pool area, always finding a great place to sit in the sun. The hotel also provided beach chairs at no cost to guests, although umbrellas cost a few dollars for the day. There was both food and drink service at the pool and beach area and we found it all good. Our room faced inland, so not much of a view, but our friends paid for the oceanfront view and it was spectacular! We dined at the Japaneese restaurant one evening, and found it pretty good, priced similar to what we would find locally. The fitness center was small, but its beachfront location and 24 hr access made up for that. The only negative we found was the lack of a place to get coffee!! We had to walk to the next hotel (EL San Juan) to find Starbucks. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My Destination Wedding in Paradise - PR is THE BEST! Thank you, InterC!”
Reviews.Author: WriterEsq
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been coming to PR from New York since 1986, when I was 8 years old for vacation. We have grown to love Isla Verde as there is something for everyone - a gorgeous beach, wonderful resorts, Old San Juan culture, great restaurants in the neighborhood, snorkeling, the casinos, great live music, etc. We recently held our destination wedding at the InterContinental San Juan Resort. 135 guests attended, almost all of whom stayed at the hotel. We also had our welcome dinner (which included all of the guests at the hotel). The entire weekend was a complete dream come true. Carlos Ortiz in Catering made both the welcome dinner and our wedding (with a beautiful outdoor ceremony on the beach boardwalk) absolutely incredible. From our very first meeting with Carlos where he set up a wonderful tasting for wedding reception dinner menu, to his assistance coordinating all of the details (along with our wonderful PR wedding coordinator, Milly Centeno). The food was amazing for our welcome dinner as well as the actual wedding. Our guests were blown away. Carlos even promised me perfect weather - and it happened! He thought of so many details - a water station for our guests for the ceremony, a way to light the boardwalk for a sunset/nighttime ceremony, decorating our bridal suite with rose petals and giving us champagne/strawberries - and calling us when we arrived to say, "Welcome home!" I had a lot of doubts and logistical concerns about planning a destination wedding, but Carlos and his staff made it wonderful. As for the faciltiies, this resort is located directly on the beach, 5 minutes from the airport. Our guests didn't have to rent cars. The lobby is very nice, simple - with a big, beautiful pool that's open 24 hours (we had a pool party after our welcome dinner at the pool bar). We had an incredibly large room on the 16th floor - the bridal suite, for our use. It was absolutely gorgeous and perfect for hosting a bridesmaid luncheon. The service at the hotel is amazing. From the person who picks up your luggage, to the person handing out towels in the morning, to the wait staff at the welcome dinner and wedding reception, to the staff in the business center, etc., etc. everyone there wants to help and does their best to provide top notch service. Helen Delgado in reservations was extremely helpful in coordinating our guests' rooms. The facilities are absolutely beautiful at the hotel. We had 9 nieces and nephews under the age of 10 who had a complete blast. My sister brought her two infant twin sons and cribs were available for them as well. They loved the pool as well. The beach was perfect for a jog or to play baseball on or frisbee. If you are thinking about a vacation or hosting any kind of event - the InterContinental San Juan Resort is the place to go. Wonderful food, incredible service and amazing attention to detail. We can't wait to go back!!! Our guests are still talking about how much fun they had. PR will always hold a special place in our heart and the InterC has become our second home.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MelodyD3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! It was right on the beach and we had a top floor room. Although our view wasn't the ocean it was spectacular anytime during the day as it looked over the whole city. There were cheap restaurants within easy walking distance and all kinds of local places to try out. The beach was always open and the bars were nice at the hotel. Everything always smelled amazing and the staff were very polite, although the general customer service throughout Puerto Rico was definitely lacking, it was an amazing trip :D

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Puerto Rico and definetly not our last!”
Reviews.Author: cgirl64
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean and roomy. Housekeeping staff and pool and beach area staff were excellent! Conceirge and Registration desk need work. They were less than pleasant. The pool is beautiful and beach is clean. The ocean view in the gym was awesome! Loved treadmilling each morning watching the ocean as the sunrose. Great location. lots of restaurants to choose from outside of Hotel. Loved Mi Casita across the street. Can't go wrong for Breakfast or dinner there. Yummy food at a reasonable price. Well worth the wait it gets crowded there. Souvinere shops along Isla Verde Avenue and bus stop outside of hotel (A5) to Old San Juan. Only 75 cents (exact change). Half hour ride to Old San Juan. Be sure to see the forts. Breathtaking ocean views! Will definetly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lesson from the all-inclusives in Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: HarleyGirlTravels
Reviews.Content: Since 1997, I have traveled every year with my S/O, my sister and her husband to Riviera Maya or Playa del Carmen. We have always stayed at 5/6-star all-inclusives so we were used to a certain standard. This was our first visit there...and there are no all-inclusives. We wanted to be on the water and felt after reading the reviews on the Intercontinental, it wouldn't be a bad place to stay. When we arrived our rooms weren't ready yet so it was suggested that we take a walk around and grab something to eat / drink at the bar in the pool area. 6 mozarella sticks, 12 chicken strips and 5 cocktails later we were $75 lighter. While we were eating, another guest started talking to us and told us that he never eats at the hotel because it's over-priced...as we just found out. We found a diner across the street and had breakfast for $2.99 every morning and it was great. One morning we wanted coffee at the hotel and four 12-oz coffees was $16. The free coffee that is available in the lobby is removed at 6:30am so that coffee can be purchased at one of the hotel restaurants. 6:30am seems a bit early to remove the coffee. All of our meals were eaten away from the hotel. The hamburgers at the hotel start at $14. We opted to not have our rooms cleaned every day since it's not earth friendly...but did make arrangements to havce 4 coffee packets in our room each day so we could use the in-room coffee maker. Not one morning were they there...we had to call for them each day. The front desk staff, as well as pool staff, were not friendly. The maids were very friendly and greeted us when we passed them in the halls. The few times we needed to stop at the front desk to ask for something, we did not get a smile or asked how we were...very cold. In Mexico we are made to feel welcome with a smile and warmth. The glass doors throughout the hotel were constantly full of finger prints....and were only cleaned once during the 6 days we were there. They are cleaned several times a day in Mexico. Our first morning there we walked the beach about 7am and it was filthy...food, bottles, cups, napkins, etc., from the night before littered the beach. In Mexico all of this is cleaned up before sun-up so the guests don't see it. The tables around the pool and patio area also had food and drinks from the night before on the tables every morning. I also did not feel as safe at this hotel as I do at the all-inclusives because there is no disignation, such as a wrist band, that distinguishes guests from non-guests. Anybody off of the street can walk into the hotel, order a meal, swim in the pool, etc. With all due respect to non-smokers, we are smokers and were not allowed to smoke anywhere on the grounds except for the beach, therefore the beach was one large ashtray. The people of Puerto Rico, away from the hotel, were warm and friendly...with an easy smile and a "good morning".

Reviews.Title: “Very Fine”
Reviews.Author: burkeohio
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night with a very good Priceline rate pre-cruise. INstead of asking for an ocean front room, we requested and enjoyed a high floor city view. Walked to the Pueblo for wine, had lunch at Burger King across the street, and ate dinner and breakfast at Mi Casida across the street. We had a great sundown drink at the bar on the beach, and the room was clean with great bedding. All in all, a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on fantastic Caribbean beach!”
Reviews.Author: TanMan59
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at the Intercontinental. We couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel, grounds, pool and beach. Easy walk to many restaurants...felt safe at night, walking with family to/from various stores, clubs and casinos. Balcony view was spectacular. Watch out for drink prices...beach bar less expensive than swim-up bar. One suggestion: if you can get a queen or king bed -- do it. The double bed with overstuffed mattress pillow felt really small for 2 adults. Other than than - we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Virgin Holidays, don't go here”
Reviews.Author: beltron
Reviews.Content: Just returned fron this hotel after booking a cruise and stay with Virgin holidays.We booked half board ,but 3 weeks before we departed a letter arrived from Virgin stating that there had been a change from half board to $60 vouchers for evening meal in Alfreado's restaurant.I phoned before leaving as I was concerned about this change ,however I was re-assured by Virgin over the phone that these vouchers were ample and that they had recieved no complaints as yet.Until now!!!.After the weeks cruise, which by the way was superb and I would like to thank Princess Cruises for that we returned to the Intercontinental hotel in San Juan to find that Alfreado's was Italian and if you wanted to have a three course meal you would have to select the cheapest option on the menu everynight.i.e pasta.If you selected a steak ,pork or veal you would not be able to have a starter or desert as meals were so expensive.We bought 2 starters and 2 steaks and had to pay $32 on top of the $60 vouchers.Everytime you entered the restaurant you were asked "are you with Virgin holidays" when we replied "Yes" you were basically treated with utter contempt and basically ignored.When you recieved the bill to sign they had added approx $18 for gratuity and $18 for tips so this brings your voucher value down to $84 per couple ,now when you see that a steak or pork chop cost about $36 means you aint gonna have alot left to play with, then you had to pay for side dishes to go with the steak, chop etc, and these were $7 each.You could use the vouchers in the momoyama restaurant once per week but you did have to go off the menu what the hotel had set. When we complained to the Virgin rep at the hotel we recieved the reply "well you could share a starter or desert,most people do"at that point you know you ain't going to get any satisfaction from the rep.Even some of the American guests at the hotel said Alfreado's was far to expensive.We will not be returning to this hotel and will definately not be booking with Virgin holidays again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: eagle7881
Reviews.Content: DON'T STAY HERE!!!! Prior to a cruise, we booked this hotel for the day before and after. We arrived at 2 pm to find the kitchen in the steakhouse was on fire. No one told us what was going on. We waited, on the crowded sidewalk in our heavy winter travel clothes with multiple bags of luggage, for 3 hours until someone tagged our luggage and allowed us to go to the pool area. Our room wasn't ready until sometime after 6 pm and our travel companions had to wait until 8 pm for their room. When checking out, asked if we would be compensated for our inconvenience and were told "NO, it's not our fault". The very simple room cost us $400 for a one night stay, the least they could have done was appologize. We returned after a wonderful cruise to stay one night before returning home. We checked in around 3 pm and at 4 pm the electricity went out. It wasn't turned on again until after 10 pm. Again the staff was RUDE and unapologetic about our inconvenience. This hotel is EXTREMELY OVER-PRICED and has the most unfriendly and incompetent staff I've come accross in years. I've stayed at cheap hotels that had better service. Also, don't buy a cup of coffeee at the restaurant. We ordered coffee and Bailey's, and for less than a total of 8 oz., we were charged $13 per cup. We will NEVER stay here again. Please don't make the same mistake we did.

Reviews.Title: “This resort was amazing”
Reviews.Author: Paully11394
Reviews.Content: I would recomend this resort to anyone because it was perfect. On the water you diddnt have to leave it for anything. The best resort EVER!! But I strongly recomend the ocean view rooms over the city view. The garden view looked vto be around the pool! The food was amazing also.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great pool. Pricey bar and restaurant though.”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_Ryan
Reviews.Content: If you're coming to San Juan (not old town), I'd seriously recommend this place. The rooms are fine (not really 4*), but large and clean. The 4* really shows when you head to the pool. It's huge, with plenty of space for sunning yourself (which we didn't, as it rained all weekend!!). Plenty of sun loungers and the facilities around the pool are top notch. Pool bar and then a snack bar just on the beach. Then there's the beach, the hotel is right on the beach. Location wise, it's brilliant. Casino is pretty good too, they should be, they took enough of our money!! The only thing that let's this place down is the price of food and drink. We ate at Alfredo's Italian restaurant and was seriously disappointed with the food. Very very bland and not that interesting. And it's not cheap. Drinks at the bar are very expensive, I'm guessing the reason is there's nowhere else to go. The hotel is on a strip of hotels, with few bars and restaurants. If I was going back to San Juan, I'd stay in the old town, but this hotel is well worth the stop. If it's sun you're after, here's the place, the pool side area is MASSIVE!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, family-friendly with nice pool and beach”
Reviews.Author: mmmbeerz
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It's probably not worth the full price, but it's a good deal if you can find it via a discounting service or as part of a package. My wife and I went with our two year old toddler. It was much more family friendly than we were expecting. The hotel had sand toys to check out. There was a small children's playground right near the pool with a climber. And the pool was very kid-friendly and open at all hours. They also showed a kids movie on the big screen and served the kids popcorn on one of the days that it rained. There was also some sort of kids' program for children that are slightly older. The hotel itself is located right on the beach. The beach is accessible via a private entrance right from the pool area. There are chairs to rent ($4/day) for the beach area. The ocean is not as rough as other parts of san juan because I believe there is some sort of breaker a ways off shore that keeps the waves from being overwhelming. We had an ocean-view room on the 7th floor. The room was spacious with a large king bed. The balcony was barely usable. There were no chairs, but you could walk out to check the weather. The hotel is about 15 minutes from Old San Juan. The drive is pretty simple for those with cars--we had one to avoid carrying a carseat around with us everywhere. Parking is available across the street for about $18/day. There is valet parking for those that can't walk across the street for an additional $5/day. The food at all of the in-hotel restaurants were definitely pricey. We didn't eat at most of them and chose to go elsewhere for most every meal. We did have a couple lunch/dinner meals from the place by the pool. The food was fine, not great. Like much of the island there is no shortage of fast food in walking distance. There are two Burger Kings, a Church's Chicken, a KFC, a Chili's, a Domino's Pizza and a Pizza Hut. There are probably others. There are very few reasonable price non-fast food places to eat within walking distance. There is also free internet (wifi) in the room. I couldn't find that anywhere mentioned on their website, but I'm writing this review from the room. There is also a $20/day upgrade to highspeed--if you really need that. I found the free internet to be fine for everything from logging into my work computer to viewing youtube videos.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not as expected”
Reviews.Author: linareva
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here for a night post-cruise. The hotel looks dated as you approach and the refuse area could be better hidden. We received a complimentary upgraded suite because of several issues encountered before arriving and at check-in(i.e., my husband went to the Main Lobby restroom and the faucet flew off the counter at him when he turned on the water). The bath was extremely dated. The balconies are tiny with no room for even a chair. Ruth Chris Steakhouse was closed because it had a fire. We ate a Alfredo's, waiter with an attitude and service to match, poor soup( i.e., minestroni was made with chickern broth and had almost no taste, looked like they threw a handful of veggies in just before sertving; cold tomato with crab had almost no visible crab and tasted terrible; passable entree.The beach bar was pleasant and service there was exceptional. We couldn't eat there that night because of a private function. The grounds are nice and well maintained, but you can't see the beach but for the four-foot wide iron gate with a guard posted. There is security everywhere you go outside and you have to where little red wrist bands to access the beach. It would be much classier to have tablet computers, etc. to verify you as a guest, anything that would make us feel like we weren't in line for rock concert tickerts. There are NO fish in these waters, probably do to the excessive amount of jet skis within feet of the swimming buoys. The tour desk was open the entire time we were there, but there are very few tours available each day and all leave early morning, so we had no tour options. The concierge said we could snorkel but he wouldn't recommend it because of the high amount of boat/jet ski traffic. He offered no options as to where we could go to enjoy a good snorkel. Save money by doing the Caribe Hilton, private beach, good snorkeling, scuba and massive grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Needed it”
Reviews.Author: MoniMoni39
Reviews.Content: We stayed at IC from February 26 through March 1. We found that Nestor helpful , knowledgable and should be in charge of training staff. We did buy Ambassador Club, enjoyed our room very much. The room was very clean, balcony is more than limited but did not find that too much of an issue . Pool was good and we did take advantadge of the beach, no problem with getting our chairs set up for us. We ate at the on the beach restaurant at night. It was good, comfortable and very relaxing. The nights we were were there we walked to the other hotels and felt safe. NIce restaurants were available within walking distance. There is the Palm at El San Juan just steps away , at IC there was Ruth Chris , unfortunately there was the fire and it was indeed a problem to sit it out and have Management offer up two drinks as compensation. The last day we were there the pool area was closed from 4 p.m. on to guests for a private party for the marathon. We did not know about this ahead of time so that was a bit offting too. They were invonveniences not communicated/managed right , however I would go back because of the location, the room was comfortable and clean. And more importantly we hope that experiences of how guests were handled during their emergency are lessons learned for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: guysair11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Feb 21st through Feb 26th We had an Ocean view room on the 11th floor that was fair with a king bed and a pullout sofa, flat screen tv and a poor bathroom more suited to a travelodge than a 5 star resort. The beach area was beautiful though for 3 days we had some kelp issues, the pool areas were also very nice but the landscaping was very overgrown and you could not see the pool area from the hotel rooms above it the pool water was a bit cool. The swim up bar was completely in the shade all day. The restaurants on property were overpriced with average quality, we found the service generaly very friendly and helpful overall during our stay. There are many restaurants within a short walk from the hotel property that can save you some money but there not all that great quality and it's not safe to walk around at night. Don't hesitate to talk to the conceirge on duty as we found there recomendation to be very helpful and quite accurate. Old San Juan was nice the historic area and forts are a must see the free trolley has stops all around Old San Juan but its not cooled and some trolley carsdo not even have opening windows. The business area of Old San Juan was very very crowded and has many restaurants of all varietys to choose from wich makes for a nice day trip. San juan is 1 very big very crowded slum and traveling around in the city is slow and sometimes dangerous. Taxis are plentiful but not exactly inexpensive the bus is cheap but hot and crowded. Overall we would not stay at the Intercontinental or in San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant and Relaxing but Not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: bbosock
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I stayed at the Intercontinental Inn on Priority Club Points. I was a bit disappointed to learn none of the perks that comes with Priority Club applies to this hotel-except being able to use the points. We were in a room not over looking the ocean which was a big disappointment. However if we paid the Ambassador Club membership ( an Intercontinental Club membership) we could be accommodated for $150, nope didn't want to do that. The hotel was very nice overall but nothing spectacular. Staff very accommodating and friendly. Rooms clean and the beds very comfortable. The room was adequate, not as small as I was expecting. The balcony was not a useable space but had a sliding glass door. Food was pretty good but expensive as other reviewers have mentioned. Beach was okay. There was a fire at the hotel's restaurant while we were there and the hotel was evacuated for several hours. The compensation for that inconvenience were 2 complimentary cocktails....some folks were very upset about that!!!! Nestor, the concierge was the best part about the hotel. If you go to the hotel be sure and use his services. Overall this is an average property, maybe a notch above that ,but nothing super luxurious. You can definitely spend mega bucks here--If I had to do it again, I think I'd chose a condo or splurge for a hotel w/ a water view and useable balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing wedding catering and service!!”
Reviews.Author: AngVali
Reviews.Content: There are no words to describe how wonderful our wedding at ICH was, the whole weekend!Â  The rehearsal dinner was great, food and presentation were delightful.Â  The wedding was perfect!Â  We had a lot of help of course from the decorators and band, etc. but the food WAS WONDERFUL.... everyone said the catering was delicious. All the staff was super attentive and great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but Alfredos restaurant is expensive with Virgin vouchers”
Reviews.Author: mallen111
Reviews.Content: Our stay was through Virgin Cruises - we stayed for the first night before the cruise and for six further nights after the cruise. It is in a good location next to the beach but there is little to do outside the hotel - best to drink in other hotels, rather than go to the few bars - its safer that way too. The hotel was very nice, the rooms were clean albeit it fairly basic. All staff were very polite. Our only grumble is really to do with Virgin rather than the hotel direct. Virgin replaced the half board accommodation with a voucher system. We got $60 per person for each night which sounds great but belive me, $120 does not go far in Alfredos. For three course and a glass of wine, you have to supplement your vouchers with at least $30 plus gratuity - NOT HALF BOARD. Also, when we complained, the Virgin rep was rubbish, dismissed our and the other 8 couples views. The hotel management were similarly unsympathetic. So be warned

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MassIS300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night before a cruise out of Old San Juan. We really enjoyed this resort. Great balcony views. Kids loved the pool area - very clean with landscaped waterfalls and palm trees in the center of the resort. Food is available poolside and nice beach bars. The beach front was also nice. Exercise room was exceptional, close to the beach with windows looking out over the ocean. Location is a $20 cab ride from Old San Juan (cabs pretty much line up on the street in front of the resort - no problem getting one). The area also has many stores near by such as Walgreens and a string of fast food joints. Overall we had a very pleasurable stay and we'd definitely consider staying here again for a longer period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever happened to Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: honest2010
Reviews.Content: Complacency and hence kind of hospitality one doesn't expect from a 4 start resort after paying so much. Couldn't care less attitude everywhere starting from check in desk. You think being a priority club member you ask for early check in -answer we are very busy and wait for couple of hours somewhere and then we will see!
