You though room may be slightly better than a budget hotel, you are set for a surprise here. Just an average room with old fashioned TV rather small for the dollar they charge. You want to visit lunch in Alfredo restaurant, good luck one chef servicing two restaurants in peak season!!! wait wait and wait with no real apologetic behavior rather rude and arrogant, we are very busy and their is only 1 chef. And then you want to order room service-they will declare we are very busy and it will take an hour, You still want to order!

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sadiecruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental one night precruise and then two nights post cruise. We really enjoyed the resort. The employees were especially nice, the bellmen were always ready with an open door and smile. Our room was fine, bathroom was dated but the bed was extremely comfy. We especially enjoyed the pool area, very clean and nicely landscaped. We sat in the shade on the beach (under the palms), beach chairs are included with the resort. We felt very safe and secure at the hotel. Wristbands are required to use the pool and beach chairs, a lot of security keeping watch. We ate at the beach bar two times, a little pricey and be careful of the add-ons, cheese on the burger was $2, an additional salad dressing $1. For breakfast we headed across the street to MiCasita. Really enjoyed our dinner at Jimmy's BBQ on the 10th floor of the El San Juan, go at sunset, a fun open air restaurant. Tried Mofongo at Platos, I was not overwhelmed! The Intercontinental had a great superbowl party outside, big screen TV, special prices on beer, food, and rum drinks. A lot of fun. Got the room through Priceline for a good price, would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “If all Puerto Rico is like this-I want to retire there!!”
Reviews.Author: Blackiefazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff opened the door each time we came & went with a smile. The lobby & outdoor areas were very elegant & very clean. We loved the pillows & pillow top mattress pad- I ordered them as soon as we got back!As in any resort hotel, the prices are steeper than what we would pay at home.Across the street is a little restaurant on a strip mall for breakfast- but if you go to then end of that mall, is a coffee & bagel shop to go. Also there is a Walgreens with in a few blocks & a Pueblo supermarket to the right ( facing beach) & a block down from Chilis. There we bought all out bottled water, snacks, beer & wine '& brought it back to the room's refrigerator.It was a walk with several heavy bags in the heat however. We went to restaurants in other hotels & local places. Even though we were near the airport- it was quiet & non intrusive.A cab into San Juan was $19 & there we could go anywhere. The beach area was clean & you had to pay if you wanted an umbrella ($10.)per day. The umbrella people & every one around the beach & pool were very pleasant & happy to let us practice our Spanish. They are quite observant of any peddlers/hawkers that attempt to disrupt the private beach.. The warmth of the employees & all the local people we encountered was so kind-even thought we have been to other islands. PR really felt at home. Also -can't help it- but it was great to leave NYC at 5 degrees & land in PR 3 1/2 hours later to 85 degrees!! The most romantic night my husband & I had, was at the beach restuarant, sharing a pizza, watching the water with our feet in the sand. Nothing could beat that! Do go! We didn't even realize there was a casino - no Las Vegas type noise!! Oh, check the events of the day calendar. We went to a drink education class, which was very funny & we got to sample small cups of the various concoctions. Not corny at all.Cute! Nice seating in the shade throught the lobbies

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money..”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTraveling2
Reviews.Content: This hotel cost over $600.00 per night - $689 with taxes and fees. It is rated as 4 star. I think it is fair to say it is a 2.5 star hotel. The rooms are 260 sq ft. The room smells of milldew, there is dust in every corner, the tiles don't match. The view on the 15 floor was great. The sevice at the breakfast restaurant was worse than the food and the food was of very low quality - the smoked salmon, quite salty. After the second night we moved to the Ritz. It was over $800.00 per night Puerto Rico, in general, was very expensive for the quality given. There are alot of other places in the world where one could get a whole lot more for a whole lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Fun!!”
Reviews.Author: StretchenGretchen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing.The view of the beaches and ocean day or night was simply breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “the rooms are a little tired”
Reviews.Author: shanandery
Reviews.Content: nice lobby. good staff. nice pool area. good beachside restaurant. room was clean. new bed linens but dated furniture, stained walls, and AC was just barely adequate. beers were about $6.50 each so they add up quick!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Pre-Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaGeocat
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews before we booked this hotel on Priceline for $100. I was not happy reading other reviews saying that they had "Roaches"! Well I am happy to report we had no roaches in our room on the 7th floor/city view. As we arrived from the airport via taxi ($14) for 4 people, the courtyard drive upto the hotel was very pleasant. Nice waterfall and wonderful foilage. The bellman were more than happy to take our luggage for us while we checked in. Of course the desk offered us the "Ambassador Club Upgrade" for $250 US. We declined since we would have an oceanview room on the cruise the whole next week. I asked for a higher floor room and were pleased to have a nice room on the 7th floor city view. Upon coming into the room they have marble floors in the hall and bathroom and carpet in the bedroom area. Nice deck that you can walk out on but not large enough to have seating. Nicely decorated with nice bed linens. It looked as though the carpeting was fairly new. The patio door was a little off track and had a 1/2" gap at all times even when closed. The room was clean but showing it's age. The circut under the sink was falling apart and hagning down which didn't seem to safe. Overall the rooms are fine just a little smaller than I had hoped and not a 5 star quality. The worst part of the rooms was the thinest of the walls. We could hear the two guys next to us talking as if they were in our own room. We were really shocked. While we checked out the hotel the bellman were supposed to be geting our bags to our rooms. We checking out the beach area and pool and went back up to our rooms to change before dinner but no bags. I called down and they said they would send them up. It took another 20 minutes which is way to long. We showered and changed and walked over across the street to "Mi Casita" for dinner. It was fancier than I thought. I was picturing from the reviews more of a mom and pop diner. It was nice with white tableclothes and nicely dressed waiters. Our waiters told us of the "specials" which sounded great. We ordered a Seafood Mofungo" which was good. The bill came and to our dissapointment the special price was $23. The normal seafood mafongo was $15. Oh well lesson learned, ask how much before you order. After dinner we we felt totally comfortable walking around both directions before heading back to the hotel. I wouldn't head off the main road but the main drag is fine. Chain restaurants around hotel include Pizza Hut, Subway, Burger King, Taco Maker and some chicken place that looked fine. With all that said lets get to the outdoor area of the hotel. This is the best part of the resort. The pool area is beautiful. They have a nice bar area with stools in the pool to sit on and have a drink. NIce large hot tub. When we were there it rained the first 2 days but we still enjoyed the hot tub while it rained. The pool was just to cold to swim in. On the 3rd day we were there the sun was out and it was 85 degrees but the pool was still really cold so we didn't swim. The restaurant by the beach is way overpriced for what you get. Like previous reviewers have stated this is rated a 5 star resort so keep in mind the prices of the resort will be higher. We didn't eat at any of the other restaurants on site. The beachfront restaurant service was slow as most in the carribean. The lobby is beautful and is joined by the casino. We went in and spent our $10 and that was it. The bar area is nice and the waitstaff there seemed a little faster. The coffee at this hotel was good but expensive. You could walk next door to the ESJ and use their Starbucks. Overall the hotel is nice but I wouldn't want to stay here a full week. Just to expensive, rooms just average, service slow and the location is better in Condado. You are closer to the airport here & I feel the beaches are nicer here but I would try someplace else to compare. We have did stay at the Courtyard Marriott Isla Verde which is rated a 3 star and honestly felt the rooms were just as nice if not a little nicer, location was just as good and service was equal. The ESJ next door seemed more upscale and has a nice rooftop restarant/banquet area that has great views. Cliental there seemed alot younger. I would book in Priceline again and take my chances at another 5 star and if we got this one again it would be fine...

Reviews.Title: “Copacabana Feel”
Reviews.Author: JanBerlin
Reviews.Content: That's my idea (without having ever been there) of Copacabana: 50's structure by famed architect Morris Lapidus, nice rooms with gorgeous views (when you get a ocean side room - being Ambassador Club members we were upgrade to such a room by courteous Hector from front desk), great pool with cabanas for rent and nice waiters, great beach and beach restaurant. Service at "Alfredo di Roma" was a mixed bag: host ladies (Gervana? Hello-o! She would be better off in room cleaning) had a HUGE attitude. Conversation went like this: me "Good morning", Gervana: "Two?", me: "Yes, please. Inside", Gervana: "Come on" (she seated us at a table outside). Wait staff in the evening was excellent, though. Be prepared that hotel has its price: cabanas (half day: 35 USD) and the forementioned "Alfredo" restaurant are really expensive. Breakfast - if not included in room rate - is pretty expensive too. As others mentioned before, the selection is so-so and the continental breakfast unusually not even includes cold cuts and cheeses. Location is good, if you not intend to leave the hotel. Otherwise it's a cheap, but uncomfortable 75-cent 45-minute bus ride to Old Town or a expensive taxi ride, as there is not much around the property apart from some low class neighbourhood restaurants. Good for a pre- or post-cruise beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: nymira
Reviews.Content: While this is not as upscale as some other hotels with the InterContinental name, it has a festive vibe that makes it perfect for groups of friends, families, and anyone at all who values access to the beach and a swim-up bar. The stretch of beach is lovely, and perfect for strolling and sunning in the winter and swimming in the summer (in winter it can be rough and choppy). Our room was on a high floor and had a balcony, and though we didn't have a view of the beach we did have a nice view of the area. The king-bed room was on the large side, with a couch and desk. Service was friendly and professional and room-service was prompt. Our only negative criticism is that there was a master of ceremonies-style person with a microphone announcing games and activities around the pool. I would have preferred a little less noise, but since people seemed happy to have it going on, it may just be personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: JFsB
Reviews.Content: Had a very relaxing week at the Intercontinental. Upon arrival, I decided to upgrade to an ocean view (rather than city view) room. Damien at the Front Desk was exceedingly professional and helpful; he advised me to enroll in their Ambassador program and upgrade for the week all for just US$250. A steal considering the stunning view from my top-floor room (see photos)! Each member of the hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. They make you feel right at home and canâ€™t do enough to be of help. The room itself was small but quite comfortable, with a king-size bed, sofa-bed, easy chair and desk / work area. Tiny bathroom. The safe is located on top of a shelf in the closet. I'm 5"5" and needed to get up on a chair everytime I wanted to put something in / get something out. It was great having the mini-fridge in the room. The grocery store directly across the street has closed; however, a Pueblo Supermarket (as well as a Blockbuster and post office) are a leisurely 5-minute walk away. Just take a left out of the hotel, go right on Calle Diaz Way, follow that around a bend in the road, and there you are. Very convenient for stocking your fridge with fresh fruit, sodas, and other essentials. The market also carries beer and alcoholic beverages. Donâ€™t miss dining at the restaurants at the hotel! I had a particularly good plate of spaghetti carbonara at the Italian restaurant on the Lower Lobby level. The restaurant / beach bar has a good selection: pizza, burgers, lamb pita, shrimp skewers, and salads. All good portions (not too big or too small) ranging from US$12 â€“22. Of course, they also have all the tropical drinks you could hope for (e.g., pina coladas US$6 without alcohol, US$8 with rum). The beach at the Intercontinental is lovely and wide. If you plan to use the beach, youâ€™ll need to get a wrist band at the towel hut. The hotel staff are diligent in ensuring that only hotel guests come and go from the hotel to the beach and vice versa. Beach loungers with cushions are available gratis, and umbrellas can be rented for US$10 / day. There are plenty of palm trees for shade if you need a brief respite from the hot sun. There were two beach vendors selling jewelry and the usual trinkets but â€“ thankfully â€“ there were no trolling vendors swooping down on you while you relax in the beautiful sun. The surf can get rough. During my stay, waves were peaking at about 7 â€“ 8 feet. Anyone travelling with small children should take extra care. The pool area is very pretty with several waterfalls, and a heated Jacuzzi. A taxi from the airport to the hotel is about a 10 minute ride and was $10 plus $1 for each bag.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssdIndiana
Reviews.Content: my fiance and I and another couple stayed at this hotel 2 days prior to a cruise then one more night after our cruise. I looked at all the reviews and had a pretty good idea of what to expect. I am happy to say that this place well exceeded my expectations. The cab ride from the airport was short, about 5 minutes. The cost is pre-determined, about $20 for 4 people with luggage. Upon arrival to the hotel, we found that only one of our rooms were ready and had to wait for a couple of hours for the other one. The front desk was very accommodating. They offered a temporary room so we could change into swimsuits and use the pool/beach while we waited. Once we had our rooms, we were very pleased. Although we only had a street view from our balcony, the rooms were large and comfortable, with a huge bed, lots of space and had a nice sitting area. I can't say enough about the pool area. It was beautiful. I called my family back home and told them I found paradise!! The pool area was awesome with ample lounge chairs. Every spot is a good spot with good blend of sun and shade. (It was hot hot hot in November, so a little shade was welcome) The pool was the perfect temperature and was large enough to have a little corner of the pool to yourself without bumping into everyone else. There was a waterfall at one end that was a lot of fun to splash around. There is a boardwalk with a bar cafe that separates the pool from the beach. Although the beach isn't the best I've seen, it's still the ocean and loved having the option. There were a few tables of vendors selling jewelry and trinkets, not pushy at all and in fact I had to work my way thru the crowd of people around the tables to take a look for myself. The bad...restaurants were ridiculously expensive. We paid $10 for two cups of coffee to go and the breakfast was around $17 per person. There are a few restaurants in the area, but you mostly need to go to Old San Juan or elsewhere to get much of a variety. A cab ride is around $15-18, although we were able to bargain with the cabbies a little. You can also take a bus for around $1.25. Tip.. there is a large grocery store about 4 blocks from the hotel. We loaded up on soft drinks, snacks and rum to take back to the hotel. We also found a great mexican restaurant/sports bar with good food and TV's all around to watch every football game playing that day. All in all, I loved this place and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs. Use Caution!”
Reviews.Author: thesalesmen
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice beach and pool area. Problem is Bed Bugs. If you stay here, check your bed, you might just have un wanted guests. Management does not seem to care if you bring it to their attention.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TandT_IrishItailan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to diffrent islands and thru most of the U.S. As a traveler you never know what to expect, some of our trips have been true nightmares, however this was an experiance as a true leisure vacaton and not just the hotel, the town and people of Isla Verde were also pleasent and quite helpfull. The Intercontinental was very clean and well maintaned the concierge service was extremely accommodating. The grounds of the hotel were lush with palm trees and wild orchids, while the beach was beautiful and the weather perfect. Being picky travelers there wasn't anything to complain about on this trip. The only problem was it rained for 20 Min 1 of the 5 days we were there (DAMN).

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge!!!”
Reviews.Author: WebfootChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We needed to cancel our trip due to medical reasons & Jossell Velazquez, the Concierge and spokesperson on the hotel's website, went above and beyond to accommodate us, refund our money, and even sent a basket of fruit to me when I was at the Intercontinental Hotel in Cleveland for my tests. We thank him whole heartedly and certainly appreciate his kindness!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Intercontinental, but at least you are in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Prayzur
Reviews.Content: This was my honeymoon location and I would not recommend it for a honeymoon. It was not a bad hotel, nothing was wrong with it per se, but it does not rate for a honeymoon. If you are looking for a nice vacation spot, this is a good location. You are right on the beach, near good restaurants and the service is good. The breakfast buffet was ok, I have had much better. If you are looking for a very romantic location for a special event, keep looking. If you are looking for a weekend or a few days of relaxation and affordable fun, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: midpoint
Reviews.Content: Great Service, attentive staff, wonderful location on isla verde beach, and a beautiful pool. Had an exceellent stay at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the Atlantic Ocean side of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: mellissarose
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the InterContinental San Juan Resort & Casino from Dec. 11-15. We booked through cheapcaribbean.com and got a 5 day, 4 night special. It included air fare from Philly, PA for a total of less than $900. Great deal! (We are not party-ers. We do not drink or going clubbing. We love a great beach and vacation to relax. We vacation about 4-6 times a year. I am 29 years old, married 7 years and have no kids.) Our direct flight of approx. 3.25 hours took us into the San Juan airport. From there, you can take a taxi. We paid $10 and it was worth it. It took only a few minutes for the taxi ride. The hotel check-in was painless and fast. They were nice enough to upgrade us for FREE to an ocean view room on the 7th floor. We would not have paid the additional $80/night for it, but it is beautiful. Because the hotel sits a bit inland compared to the neighboring hotels, the ocean view is more of the jacuzzi, pool and then the ocean view. The room was very clean. We checked the beds and saw no sign of bed bugs (we have read this several times on this website). In fact, we didn't see one bug in our room the entire trip and we left our balcony door open several times throughout the day. The hotel is on the Atlantic Ocean side of Puerto Rico. We did not realize this until our second day. The pool is beautiful and has a few "waterfalls" and different areas to swim. There is a swim up bar (not sure what the prices are since we didn't eat/drink at the hotel). The jacuzzi is large and did not get very crowded. The beach is clean and there are a ton of hotel lounge chairs to use. They had stacks of them. The hotel also has towels to use. You are welcome to take them to your room and get more when you go back down. Yes, there is a bracelet you have to put on - but they will let you put it on a bag or put it on your wrist very loosely and then take it off when you tan. As long as the bracelet is close, it is fine to take it off. The water was a bit cold but nothing terrible for this time of year (my husband didn't agree and said it was freezing, but it IS December!) but there were a ton of waves, approx. 2-5 feet high. There were not many swimmers in the ocean due to the pull of the waves. We ventured out a few times and stayed at waist high waters. We were fine. The water is not Caribbean blue that you see in most Puerto Rico photos. This is found on the other side of the island, about a 45 minute drive south. It is murky and had a lot of seaweed. Back to the hotel room - our air condition was cold and worked great. Unfortunately we could not get the room warm enough without opening the balcony door. Every time we set the air to 80 degrees, the cold air would blow and the room would get colder & colder. We had a hotel employee take a look. He was nice but his English was not great and he did not help. A few times we took showers and the water was not hot enough, even on the hottest setting. The internet is free & fast. ABOUT THE WALLS & NOISE - Yes! There is noise and the walls are quite thin. The first two nights we had loud neighbors who kept us up for over an hour. We didn't get woken up by airplanes but we were on the 7th floor and not too high up. The third night was quiet until the morning when we were awoken by hammering directly above us -- at 7am!!! We waited a bit and then called reception. The noise stopped and we fell back asleep. Then the phone woke us up about 1/2 hour later. Reception was calling to see if the noise stopped. Ugh. Then back to sleep for a bit until drilling started above us. We did not get through an entire night without something waking us up. We took a bus ride into Old San Juan. The bus stop is truly right outside the hotel to the right. It cost 75 cents per person and you MUST have exact change. You can take either A5 or C53 to go into Old San Juan. There was a couple at the bus stop for over 45 minutes before we got there and they said there hadn't been a bus by during that time. Thankfully the bus came within 10 minutes after we got there. This was on a Saturday so the bus schedule may be different during the week. The bus ride into Old San Juan took about 45 minutes. It is the last stop and the bus drops you off at a bus depot. Then you can take a (free) trolley to the forts, shopping, etc. Most are full and you have to wait for one to have room. After a bit of a wait, we were able to get on a trolley. We got off at the first fort. It is incredible! It is a mile or so walk to the next fort. You can get back on the trolley and take it to the next fort but why wait? We walked. We did pay the $3 to get into the second (and bigger) fort. It was very cool! Then another trolley back to the bus depot and a bus back to the hotel. Honestly we had plans of going back into Old San Juan for a meal and more exploring the next day but it wasn't worth the 1.5 hours of being on a bus & the wait between buses. The bus drivers were very nice and helpful. We were able to ask someone on the bus to ask the bus driver in Spanish if he would let us know when we were at our hotel. Our Spanish is shamefully awful. He let us know & we were back safely. Our room had a small fridge (no microwave) and there is a local grocery store within walking distance. It is called Pueblo and is a short 10 minute walk. We bought soda, bread, ham & cheese (to make our own sandwiches) and snacks. It really saved us money. There is also a Taco Bell, Burger King, Baskin Robbins, Wal-Greens, Ponderosa, Chili's, etc. within walking distance. The street is undergoing some construction but it doesn't feel unsafe. Domino's Pizza, Pizza Hut and Papa John's Pizza delivers to the hotel. Each is fairly cheap and fast. They are not allowed into the hotel so you have to pick up your orders outside. If you plan on renting a car, use Charley's Car Rental (not Avis which is inside the hotel). A small car rents for approx. $38 a day. We opted not to do this but all Puerto Rico beaches are public and you can stop anywhere on the coastline to swim. The resort puts out an "activity" guide each day. The activities are yoga, power walking, Bingo, movies and other light activities. Nothing much and hardly anything in the evening. The fitness center was rated "awesome" by my husband. I didn't go but he lifts daily and was thankfully for the Smith machines. We did stop in to see the casino. We don't go to casinos but this one seemed nice. Small, but nice. We also didn't go to the restaurants that are on-site. Breakfast is $22 per person, per day. We brought granola bars & then ate an early lunch out of the resort. All staff was very helpful. Concierge was also helpful and gave us many maps, ideas of where to eat, etc. Truly helpful. Since we paid less than $900 and probably another $200 while here, I feel it was a great deal. We had a nice time. Not an absolutely perfect time because of the beach water, but a nice time. We probably won't be back but we like to vacation in different places anyway.

Reviews.Title: “pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: ob606
Reviews.Content: booked through priceline. Hotel added surprise resort fee per guest once we arrived. pools and beach were terrific. Room was grrrrooosssss. I would not walk on carpet...kept shoes on. Would have complained but we were exhausted and only there for 1 night. Bathroom....YUK. Restaurant on premise good but expensive. Nice restaurant across the street in plaza. Secure beach. Felt safe. I suspect by other raters that some rooms are in better condition. I asked a woman in the elevator about her room. She said first room was horrible and she complained and was given a much better room.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and relaxing and gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: dtrains2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 16th floor Dec 5-9. We faced inward (didn't want to upgrade and pay more for ocean view) and the views were lovely. Yes, there are some planes, but we didn't find the noise annoying and were never woken up by them. The only time we were woken up was by our neighbors having a bit of a romantic interlude (trying to be polite here) one night. So the walls are pretty thin- consider yourself warned. :) After reading reviews here for months before our arrival, I have to say that we were very pleasantly surprised. I thought that even though the front exterior of the hotel doesn't seem very "new," the pool area and the lobby and the rooms were quite nice. We will definitely return and felt like the deal we got on cheapcaribbean.com was certainly worth paying again. Favorites: very friendly concierge who gave us spa coupons (Nasant, perhaps, was his name?), great front desk, bartenders (particularly Rosie at the swim up bar who made a drink up for me that I drank the entire vacation). Pool and Jacuzzi were great (thanks to the staff for enforcing the rule about no children). Proximity to airport very convenient. Bell staff great for getting taxis and making sure you don't overpay. Dislikes: overpriced on site options for eating. You can't save much by ordering room service, sadly. The breakfast buffet is either $22 for full or $17 for continental. There is an a la carte menu for it but considering that at the time we were there it was roughly $8.50 plus tax for coffee and OJ, you'd end up paying more for one plate of breakfast plus your beverages . Unlike previous poster, however, I found the buffet to be quite adequate. Made to order belgian waffles and omelettes. scrambled eggs, applewood bacon, pork sausage, pancakes, roasted potatoes, organic oatmeal with all the toppings, one hot item that varied depending on day (I saw spinach and egg burritos one day and ham and cheese quesadillas another), a full carb bar of toast/bagels/muffins/croissants, a fruit bar, a bagel set up with capers, smoked salmon, cream cheese, etc., yogurt...and I know I'm forgetting one or two hot buffet items. Plus fresh (not concentrate!) orange juice and strong Puerto Rican coffee. I found that to be quite an adequate range of selections. Dinner prices go up considerably. Alfredo's, the hibachi restaurant, the grill by the beach, swim up bar and Ruth Chris' (recently reopened) are your options for on site dining. we actually ate at the swim up bar several times and in the bar once. Upon advice, we tried Mi Casita and were very happy. Their black bean soup is phenomenal. :) I would highly recommend. Service is slow, but I found it to be the island, not the restaurant. My husband loved the mofongo with the fried pork. We also tried it for breakfast one morning and had a $12 check, plus tip. My bacon and eggs with toast and potatoes was $4.99. Are you kidding? How can you beat that? We found the supermarket previously across the street to be closed and were quite disappointed. It would have definitely saved us some money on this trip. We ventured offsite for my birthday dinner at Budatai in Condado on Ashford. This may have been the best meal of my life. I would very highly recommend trying it. The salmon entree with brown butter bernaise was to.die.for. Right now, the casino is undergoing renovation. There is still plenty to do but be aware that there is a little work going on at one end of the lobby. We found it to not be any sort of effect on our trip whatsoever. We also did a segway tour in Old San Juan that we loved and would recommend. No sign of bed bugs that have been mentioned by previous posters. We ventured next door to the El San Juan to check out their restaurants. While the pool facilities are comparable in my opinion, the inside had a much hipper, boutique feel to it. The Intercontinental is a quieter hotel (at least when we were there!). Since that is what we were looking for, we were very happy. However, if we were going out dancing or anything, we discussed going over to the ESJ.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay/ Would return”
Reviews.Author: ropqsr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights in Dec. Had a GREAT stay overall and would certainly return to this property. Always rely on trip advisor for helpful and accurate reviews. The reviews on this property are all accurate. It's a terrific property. PROS (Many): Proximity to airport (a very quick cab ride) Location of Hotel (close to other resort properties) Great beach for walking with very soft sand Smooth check-in/ professional staff Wonderful ocean view from 10th floor (pay the extra for the upgrade to ocean view) Nice meal at Ruth's Chris in Lobby mini fridge in room and nearby grocery store (good for keeping extra snacks and drinks) Room itself, clean, modern, simple with sofa and flat screen (nothing extraordinary) Nice pool, many lounge chairs Nice cafe on beach with chairs in sand for midday snack Felt safe/ security at pool, visible 24 hrs/d and entrance to beach Good gym with great ocean view while on cardio equipment Loved Old San Juan, much larger and more European than I had thought Many great dining options, cobblestone streets, pastel buildings etc... Loved El Convento hotel in Old San Juan. Go inside to courtyard. Had great sangria and tapas/ very pretty and historic property The culture/people...loved walking paseo del Moro and stopping at Cafe Princessa along the way. Loved how everyone would get dressed up to go out at night. More cosmopolitan than had expected. Great dinner at Di Parma in Condado. Outside with beautiful view of ocean and park Louis, Gucci, Ferragamo all right here for shopping as well Enjoyed drinks at La Concha in Condado and the overall scene in the lobby. Very modern, hip and luxurious (would look into staying there also if returning to P.R) El Yunque rainforest/waterfalls also wonderful. Rented a car for the day. Was an easy drive there and enjoyed hiking the trails for a couple of hours one day The Water Club: another cool place to go for drinks/snack at night/ top floor outside and within walking distance from Intercontinental Did the kayak tour in Fajardo of bay at night. We both enjoyed it and it really is a unique experience. Negatives (few) The hotel although nice, has very little to do at night. I like to tour, relax by the pool/beach during the day and go out at night for a nice dinner/drinks. The lobby bar is small and somewhat outdated. They did have some entertainment at night but we just had one drink and moved on. (ESJ hotel next door had a more upscale lobby) The pool bar is in a very shady location/ almost too cold to swim up and enjoy a drink. The food at the cafe on the sand was just ok, burgers, quesidillas, pizzas etc..

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience with nice ocean view”
Reviews.Author: GOGOCHILL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, in a good location, and the ocean view room on the 10th floor was excellent. The service was pretty average but check in went well and the concierge was helpful with our restaurant choice in Old San Juan. Check out was very slow. The cost was just over $300 per night so the value was pretty average. Mi Casita restaurant across the street is over-rated. The service is poor and the food is marginal. We went across the parking lot to get Buger King french fries after the meal. The best food is definitely in Old San Juan. Try "Taste" or "El Siguel". Taste is somewhat high end and El Siguel has excellent paella. We had a great time in Old San Juan during the Sofu culinary festival. Overall, excellent trip and we were glad we didn't stay at the El San Juan. It is a nice property but very loud and lively. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and glad we were able to control when we wanted noise or peace and quiet. I'll definitely visit San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a Great Time in San Juan !!”
Reviews.Author: Scuba_Doc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did a last minute trip to the San Juan InterContinental through Cheap Caribbean.com. When you buy through Cheap Caribbean, they should not add a resort fee at checkout because the resort fee is included. Donâ€™t pay for the airport transfers ahead of time, it costs too much. It only costs $10 for a cab and $1 per bag. We had 2 bags so only cost $12 for both of us. I was disappointed that we did not get an upgrade to a partial ocean/pool view room because of my Priority Club membership. The GM, Sharon Kilmartin and the front office manager, David Mejia could show better loyalty to returning customers. Iâ€™m sure the discount through Cheap Caribbean played a role. But if the hotels are going to wholesale these rooms out, they should NOT take that out on the customer! We are Platinum Level Members and got no recognition from the resort, whatsoever. When I asked about an upgrade and mentioned that we are Platinum Level, I was told we could get an Executive Club Room for an extra $30 per night ($120) or we could get the same upgrade by joining the InterContinental Ambassador program for $150 for a year membership. We decided to stick with the Standard Room, which was a very nice room overlooking the street. There was a small refrigerator, which was perfect for us. We went to the little market within walking distance (Pueblo) and got pastries, cereal, snacks, scotch, milk and juice. The grocery store Pueblo is less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel and is open 24 hours with super deals on spirits. We had free internet access the entire stay. The area is safe and close to airport. We did hear planes in the room on occasion, but not very loud. Airport noise never woke us up. The property is gorgeous, the beach is gorgeous and the weather was perfect. We loved all of the lush plants the soothing sound of the little Coqui frogs at the hotel. The spa is out by the beach and is expensive - $70 for half an hour. The fitness center was very nice and faced the ocean. It had all the equipment you could want. The casino was smaller, but it had blackjack, roulette, poker, and craps. Everything you need. This hotel has the nicest pool and beach in the area! The physical facility was VERY well maintained and extremely clean. The sand is soft and clean. You can enjoy the beautiful pool, which is open 24 hours and has waterfalls and many areas to it and the temperature was perfect. There are LOTS of free chairs and umbrellas at the pool and you can rent a fully enclosed cabana too. On the beach, ask the staff for chairs, they are free. The umbrellas there are $10 per day. There are several restaurants in the hotel, Alfredos has fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. Ruthâ€™s Chris Steakhouse is on property â€“ very expensive â€“ our dinner was $114, and we split a steak! Momoyamaâ€™s is a Japanese steak house where they cook at your table. There is a swim up restaurant at the pool and another restaurant out by the beach. All restaurants on property are very expensive. Plan to spend big money to eat here. I got a can of coke from roomservice â€“ a one dollar tip brought it to $9.46 for one can. The only thing that kept this trip a reasonable price was the trip to the market. BUT, across the street and within walking distance, there are many restaurants like Chiliâ€™s, Burger King, Subway, Denney's (DO NOT EXPECT FREE REFILLS on ANY drinks ANYWHERE except Denny's), Taco Maker, Ponderosa Steakhouse (good salad bar), Lupis Mexican Restaurant, La Piu Bello, Barrachina, Plaza de Mercado (restaurant / fruit market), Platos, Baskin Robbins, Churchâ€™s Chicken. A few blocks to the right are Walgreenâ€™s, KFC, Dominos, Pizza Hut, Wendys, and some local restaurants and stores. Go to Don Jose/Edith's restaurant down the street. It is a 24 hour "Mom & Pop's" kinda place. Delicious Puerto Rican food at reasonable prices. El Metropol is not expensive and has very good Puerto Rican food. If you want great coconut cheesecake and crab turnovers...go to La Playita. The easiest way to get to La Playita is to go out to the beach and turn right. Walk on the beach and go for an early dinner. Don't go through streets, you will get lost and the cabs charge you an arm & a leg...not worth it. The walk is only 5 minutes. The mofongo there is super. You can also go to Mi Casita across the street from the hotel for the mofongo (an odd but delicious concoction of shrimp, beef or chicken tucked inside a pulverized plantain mound, with a great sauce). Food and service at Mi Casita are sub-par. Next door at El San Juan, their lobby was awesome, including a live salsa band and there is a Starbucks, a Brother Jimmy's Barbecue (on the roof with an amazing view of the area), The Palm (expensive) and a nice pizza place. There is an Outback at the Embassy Suites. There are 2 Walgreens for sunscreen, hair spray, etc....one to the left of the hotel and one to the right. Both are a few blocks away. You absolutely must take the city bus (75 cents) to its terminus next to Old San Juan where you can see the old fort and board a free trolley that goes throughout Old San Juan. The best ride you can get for 75 cents ($20 by cab). In Old San Juan, I recommend eating at Tio Danny's on restaurant row - the best Mofongo in PR. There is also a Ben & Jerryâ€™s ice cream parlor in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the location and the awful”
Reviews.Author: jsnoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for one night pre-cruise. The Good: We got a great deal on this hotel so it was hard to pass up. The room was nice, clean and bed bug free. I even checked the mattress by removing the sheets and inspecting the seems of the mattress and there was no evidence of bed bugs. Also, the pool area was really nice, but we didn't get to use it because of the weather. The Location: The hotel is in an area where there isn't a lot of local restaurants to eat at and is a little shadey in the evening. The costs of taxis back and forth to Old San Juan ($20 each way) and to the Pan American Pier ($15 each way) really added to the cost of our stay. The Awful: As has been previously mentioned, DO NOT have breakfast in the hotel. There was a torrential downpour the morning we were there, so we decided to eat in the hotel. The cold breakfast ($17) consists of cereal, fruit and store bought mini-pastries. The larger hot breakfast ($22) includes the cheese and cold meats as well as some egg and sausage. In my experience a continental, cold buffet includes the meat and cheeses, so we were surprised when we were charged $22 each for the breakfast we had. Also the service to get coffee and juice was terrible. I never got the milk I asked for for my coffee, I ended up having to go to the buffet for it. Finally when we checked out they asked how our stay was, I said the room was fine, but that the breakfast service was terrible and all I got was a smile and "that's good" If you're looking for a good deal and don't plan on going to Old San Juan to eat, then this hotel would be a good option, but please go to the Mi Casita restaurant across the street for breakfast, even in the pouring rain!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort, wonderful San Juan beachfront”
Reviews.Author: pinknpretttty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last November with my boyfriend, and it was off season so the hotel was not too crowded. The entire stay was all-around very elegant... between the gorgeous hotel and lobby, beautiful room, and wonderful beachfront property with pool. Room had crisp white sheets, was spacious (had a couch and seating area) and was very clean. Staff was friendly, all speak English (as do most locals in San Juan). The pool and beach areas were taken care of very nicely. Food at "Ciao Mediterranean" the beach cafe was pretty darn good and not too expensive for lunch (but there's also a Wendy's and Burger King 3 minutes from the hotel for a cheap lunch)! Dinner at "Alfredo" the Italian hotel restaurant was pricey but great - got bruschetta and limoncellos on the house. Would definitely recommend "Metropol" about a 5 minute walk down the road. Have been going there for 10 years and the food (traditional Cuban/Puerto Rican) is consistently good. Attracts many locals too, so you know that means it's good. Casino is modern and sleek. In conclusion, thumbs up for Intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this place”
Reviews.Author: munchskin
Reviews.Content: Stayed her in Nov 08 had thought it was great. This year I have second thoughts if I would go back there again.. Found the front desk personnel rude.. Had issues with my room which was not resolved till the night before we checked out. a/c wasn't working, had company in my room (roaches saw 4) They sent an exterminator up each day. supposingly someoone for the A/c.. The poolarea/beach is great . The staff is great, after you get through the front desk rudeness. IThe issues were with my room. Could not change room because it was booked

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: george01
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through American Airlines Vacations and really I didn't know what to expect since the price was very good. Shouldn't have worried, the check-in was painless and fast, the room just great, nicely furnished, good size, suite like set-up with couch, chair, desk, etc. and ocean front on the 11th floor with an outstanding view. The balconies are rather small and have no balcony furniture to sit on. That, however, was soon remedied when I requested a couple of small banquet chairs (perfect size for the width of the balcony) and got them. Not only the chairs but a little table too to place in between the chairs for drinks, etc.. That's what I call service, and I enjoyed sitting on the balcony from then on. The room had a small refrigerator empty, which is a great idea for guests to put their own snacks if they so wish, and a menu of things that one could order from the hotel to place in the refrigerator for a fee. Great idea. Wish more hotels did this. Wine and snacks were purchased at Pueblo supermarket around the corner from the hotel. Good prices. I went to My Casita restaurant across the street in a small plaza but the quality of food has deteriorated considerably from a few years back. Tried it once and that was all. There are other restaurants and fast food chains to choose from nearby. I did try the beach cafe at the hotel, had the halibut which was excellent and reasonably priced. There is a Denny's for breakfast and other meals to the left of the hotel about 5-6 blocks down the street. Took the bus for 75 cents to old San Juan and came back by bus also. It was interesting, get details from the concierge. Pool is beautiful but never used it. Beach was excellent and so was the beach bar service (they used to bring me my Medalla beer in a bucket of ice to keep it coldl, again that's good service). They provide beach chairs and beach towels for free, but have to pay for unbrellas if one is desired, I think $15-$20/day. Check-out was very slow, maybe they should have more staff handling it in the mornings. While checking out I was asked if the chairs and table were still in the balcony, as they were going to remove them as soon as I left. All in all, it was a great stay at a very good hotel with excellent service. I'll definetely go back if ever in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jksholes09
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the hotel lobby we received nothing but exceptional service: Valets - - very courteous, helpful, and friendly, always offering assistance in any way (i.e. baggage, holding open the doors, and offering assistance navigating off of the property); Concierge (especially Jossell) - - extremely helpful, friendly, accommodating, and open with recommendations on the best places to visit, tour, and dine during our stay; Splash Bar (especially Rosie) - - food was wonderful and the drinks were out of this world (We strongly recommend the Bacardi Bomb, although you should proceed with caution) :-) staff offered lots of advice regarding local hot spots and flavors "off the beaten tourist path" The rooms are not lavish or overdone and are very comfortable. Our room was complete with king-size bed, couch, chair, coffee table, desk, 3-drawer dresser and mini-fridge. Also included was a plush duvet covering a down comforter, comfy feather bedtopper, plush pillows, and full lengh mirror on top of the gorgeous view of the beach/ocean (see picture provided). The location was ideal in our opinion in light of being here on our honeymoon - close enough to local hot spots and restaurants within walking distance, as well as very close to a couple of bus stops "paradas" that offer very inexpensive ways to get to other parts of the city (i.e. Condado, Old San Juan, etc.). While this resort offers everything you could possibly need during your stay (i.e. onsite Spa, Exercise facility, 5 Restaurants, Casino (slots and table games), Kids Club, 24-Hour Pool/Hot tub, Secure Beach Access, Free Basic Wireless Internet, Business Center, Island Tours pickup and drop off at the hotel entrance, on-site Avis car rentals, and 4 bars other adventures are a short ride away We liked the staff and location above all of the rest and while we disliked the "costs" for onsite drinks/dining (not uncharacteristic of this type of property - -resort/casino), they did not prevent us from drinking/dining onsite but encouraged us to venture off the property in search of local flavors for more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Intercontinental!”
Reviews.Author: martaharii
Reviews.Content: Our ocean view room on the 10th floor had an incredible view of the ocean and was very clean and comfortable. There is currently some street construction going on in front of the hotel, but this was not a problem at all. My Fodor's guide said that the exterior and lobby were outdated, but I thought the exterior was lovely, and the lobby, while a bit dark for a Caribbean hotel, was fine enough. I spend my time at the beach, pool, out and about or in my room, not in the lobby anyway! I'm not a casino person, but checked it out anyway - it is also under some construction, but the people in the casino seemed to be very happy with it. The pool is great, as is the beach area. The hotel provides beach chairs and umbrellas free of charge. We didn't try the hotel restaurants - we ate breakfast across the street at Mi Casita (in the little shopping plaza) every day, and generally ate dinner in old San Juan. The fitness center was also very well equipped and if you want to make a spa appointment, check with the concierge, she gave us a $20 off certificate.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great outdoor spaces, bars, and beaches”
Reviews.Author: vevans1
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 college students, and one teen) stayed in this hotel and we really enjoyed our stay. We had to rooms looking out towards the pool and beach which was just beautiful! The pool had several areas including a swim up bar area. There was a Japanese style grill in house which was very good that we ate at for dinner one night (even though it was on the expensive side). The rooms were cleaned everyday. The valets were always quick to get our car. The hotel was helpful when setting up or contacting excursions while we were there. very fun stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: UtravelbuggU
Reviews.Content: We liked the Intercontinental. Staff was very friendly and the ocean-view rooms were pretty good. It is an older hotel but it appears they've done some renovating and the rooms were comfortable and modern. The pool was good enough sized and the beach it sat on was pretty good. Felt safe the whole time. Like everyone says, the food in the restaurants was a little expensive. We did Pueblo's Grocery store nearby to get some basic food and water to save on costs. We did Room Service Breakfast one morning and the food was really good. For local food, our favorite was Los Platos which was down the road about 2 or 3 blocks. Lastly, the Casino here is extremely small and not worth it. We ended up walking next door to the El San Juan for the better Casino.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to be pampered!”
Reviews.Author: seawitch69
Reviews.Content: I booked this vacation through CheapCaribbean.com and really did not know what to expect when we got there because the rates were so incredibly low. Even for the off-season they were low! For the price I thought we might get there and find we were in the depths of the cheap seats. What a beautiful surprise though! CheapCaribbean and TravelZoo have made friends with me! We spent 5 days at this hotel and were treated like royalty. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. I dealt with 3 concierge's during our stay, but Nestor was the most knowledgeable about the island, tourist areas and roadways. He was extremely friendly, helpful and honest. I say honest because I had to leave some vital documents with him when we checked out to be sent home via FedEx. In most places, once you check out, they could care less about you. They might have sent it, they might not have. Here, not only did Nestor ensure these documents were sent as promised, he went out of his way to ensure a copy of my fedex receipt was waiting at my office when I returned. Nestor also gave excellent driving directions and ideas about where to go, what to see, and what kind of timelines to expect for the adventures we wanted to take while visiting. I have read some of the reviews stating that the island is suprisingly poverty ridden, but I disagree. It did not occur to me that is the first impression until I noticed my friend getting nervous in town. The bars on the windows are NOT there because of crime. They are there to protect from things being hurled around during hurricanes. Puerto Rico is an island with a laid back, island lifestyle. As a general rule, they open when they get there and they close when they run out of food or customers, whichever comes first. This slow, easygoing lifestyle is part of what makes Puerto Rico so wonderful! Most of the roads are terrible and poorly marked (because - gee - signs don't stay up in hurricane force winds) and they do drive like there is no traffic law, but as long as you stay alert, there should be no problem. The cleanliness of the hotel was mostly great. We upgraded so had an amazing view (ocean view - top floor) and as far as I could tell, the towels were changed out every day as long as we left the used ones on the floor (which is the same method used in most hotels today to conserve water for laundry if you don't need them changed out). The bathroom and dressing areas were separate from each other and from the main room, so we were able to get ready while maintaining some privacy. I have read some of the reviews about bed bugs and we did experience this a little while we were there. However, considering the proximity to the beach and the fact that "mimis" are just a regular part of island life, I don't think it had anything to do with the cleanliness of the hotel. They could easily have been bugs tracked in from the beach. Our ONLY complaint was that we found a tick on top of my friend's bed. Fortunately that was before she ever needed to sleep in it and it was removed quickly. Though the room lacked a microwave, we had a small refrigerator and a safe in which to our electronics and other valuables in while we sat at the pool or on the beach. This made me feel a lot better about leaving things behind so we could go have fun. Being kind of a worrier, I enjoyed peace of mind in leaving our laptops and cell phones in our room. Usually when you go to a hotel where there is nearby construction, the tranquility will be at least somewhat interrupted, but not here. There was a lot of constuction going on in the roadway directly in front of the hotel, but we didn't hear any of it at all. Except when we left and returned to the front entrance of the hotel, we did not even notice it. We did, however, opt for the valet parking so we would not have to find parking in this area of town and then walk through the construction zone. The price for valet versus self-park was only about $6 which was minimal considering the benefits. Inside the hotel, we chose not go into the casino since we decided our luck probably hadn't changed over the years and we would just wind up losing money that we wanted to spend. And, though we swore we were going to spend a day at the spa, we found that we didn't really need it after a full day just enjoying the gorgeous pool and jacuzzi areas. It was clean, bathwater warm, and sparkling. There were waterfalls and lots of little quiet spaces to hide out if you happened to be there for a romantic getaway. The swim up bar served drinks and food, which was really excellent, light fare after a couple of days of eating huge meals. It was your typical little sports bar, but underwater. The food was good, the drinks were better, and Javier was a fun, friendly bartender who was on tap with drinks before we knew we needed refills. For meals, we had room service, dinner at Alfredo's (in the hotel), the Mediterranean Cafe (on the beach), and at the swim up bar. All of the food was amazing! We both tried new items that we had never had before, and also had some of the standard favorites. Since we were there to enjoy the local culture, we also took a drive down highway 26 (east of the hotel) and found our way to one of the many little places to eat that dot the roadways. Our particular favorite was Nana's Place for their pinchos and pastelillos de camarones. Mmmmm! When it came to checkout time, the staff was there to help us take down our luggage and had it loaded in the car before we were even finished with the check-out process. Very efficient and friendly. Tipping is optional, and we did tip. But you won't find them standing there waiting for a tip like you will in some places. Overall, an outstanding visit and a beautiful, relaxing resort. Surprisingly family friendly AND adult friendly. We definitely will go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. But the staff showed me the bad side of vacation. The manager flat lied to me. They charged my credit card for my friends bill, even though she paid with her own credit card. (so, they collected double) I've been dealing with it for 6 weeks now... and it's hasn't been corrected. So be aware!

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again”
Reviews.Author: prexplorer
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our short vacation in San Juan yesterday, October 22, 2009. We had a great experience at the Intercontinental Hotel. We had an ocean view room on the 8th floor. The views of the ocean were beautiful. The hotel was well maintained and not outdated. I had stayed at this hotel when it was The Sands back in the mid-eighties. It has been completely changed and updated. Our room was recently updated, clean and comfortable. The furniture was all new, including a flat screen tv. The bed was very comfortable with all the amenities (4 extra large pillows, a down-filled matress pad, luxury mattress). Room service was excellent. The sheets on the bed and towels are exchanged only if you request it. It was stated clearly on the hotel's brochure in order to be eco-friendly. Face it, we don't change our bed sheets and towels at home everyday. For those who complained about poor maid service--try leaving a tip for the maid. They are working for your tips! We had a problem with one phone that went on the blink and the safe also would not open because the batteries inside eventually died. I spoke to the concierge and both were repaired immediately. A new phone was installed and the safe was opened by the hotel engineer. Great service! The doorman James was especially friendly and helpful. We were given $20.00 in casino vouchers to get started, but we never used them. We loved the pool area which was large and the pool has a swim up bar that served light fare. The grounds are beautiful and with mature trees including palms and it is partially shaded with a canopy, which is great for people like me who cannot tolerate the strong sun. There is also a bar and outdoor restaurant next to beach. The beach is clean and the hotel staff kept watch over the guests at the beach. There is also occasional police presence on the beach. The beach and ocean are really nice and clean and quite remarkable considering the fact that you are in a large metropolitan city. I wanted to make a comment about those individuals who claim that there are bedbugs at this hotel. I think it is hysterical. LOL. The fact is that in a tropical setting like Puerto Rico there are mosquitos and they do bite. Also, if you are at the beach and the sun is going down, the "no-seeums" come out and start biting. They are small insects and are rarely seen and they render nasty bites! I made the mistake of being on the beach when the sun was going down and they got me on my legs. The food at the hotel was pricey, but it was excellent. The food is not frozen or fast food, it is prepared by trained chefs. You get what you pay for. We thought "Alfredos" was excellent. My brother in law and I are amateur gourmet cooks and we are very disciminating when it comes to dining out and we both loved the food. They make their own pasta on site. This italian restaurant offered a special: 2 full courses for $89.00. We tried it and were blown away. The food was excellent. It included an appetizer, wine, main course and dessert. We ate there twice and it was some of the best italian fare we have ever eaten. The veal marsala was the best I have ever had. They also made the best sangria I have ever tasted aside from my own. The halibut was very tender and delicious. The creme brulee was out of this world. The waiters and staff were very attentive. Armando was great and went out of his way to please us. The bar in the main lobby had a special: 2 for 1 mojitos. They were excellent. One night when eating at Alfredo's there was a traditional Puerto Rican dance troupe that performed right outside the restaurant. It was a treat to watch. We also ate breakfast at Alfredo's and it was also excellent. It was pricey, but you get what you paid for. None of the food was processed or frozen. The pastries melted in your mouth. They even had salmon at the buffet. Everything was top notch. We did go out most of the time. We researched the restaurants in San Juan and went out to Old San Juan to eat and explore. San Juan has great restaurants. Do some research before you go. We went to La Bombonera almost every day for breakfast and loved the mallorcas! This restaurant is a local favorite and has been in business since 1902! We also ate at the Parrot Club, Bebo's, El Picoteo. We tried to do Manolin's, but it was crowded and we were short on time. On our last day, we had to check out by noon. We did so and the hotel allowed us to lock up our luggage and use a safety desposit box and a hospitality room at no charge. We stayed and enjoyed the beach and pool until it was time to depart for our 6:30 p.m. flight back home. We loved the Intercontinental and at the price we paid wondered if the hotel made any money. We got the great deal on Cheapcaribbean.com. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GAPeach-7
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel as well. The employees were very friendly and helpful all the time. We were upgraded to an ocean view room without asking at check in! I agree with the other reviewer that said the concierges could improve their knowledge a bit. We learned the hard way that the buses only take 75 cents in change and stop running around 10pm. We got to Old San Juan with our 75 cent fares but had to spend $20 on a taxi to get back to the hotel. We thought the concierge should've told us all this up front. We loved the beach, the pool is awesome, the bartenders are nice, attentive, and are generous with the liquor! The beds are comfortable, the showers are big enough, good water pressure, and you never run out of hot water. The hotel has great security which is a plus. My boyfriend was bummed that all the major league baseball games were purchased by some local station so they weren't available on our tv in the room. We watched them at the hotel's bars. We ate lunch at the pool bar and the food was great. We ate our other meals at some local places that we walked to from the hotel. We liked the free (384Kbps) WIFI too that we could access from our room. We are not casino people but I think a casino person would be disappointed with the casino here. It was very small and looked old and run down. I think the only people in there were locals.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but overall a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cybertlc
Reviews.Content: So I read up on tons of reviews on here before going to San Juan, and here's my experience. Having never been to Puerto Rico, I was surprised at the poverty. The area around the hotel wasn't bad, but also wasn't great. The roads were torn up, traffic was horrible, and the businesses were seedy! People would pull over and park ANYWHERE - in the middle of the road, blocking an entire lane, etc. We booked our trip through CheapCaribbean and got a great deal. It said we would get a free room upgrade with our booking from a Deluxe Pool/Garden.....and the next upgrade is Ocean View. Upon check-in, I asked for our oceanfront room and was told that the free upgrade is only for a city view room. I showed him the paper that said otherwise, and after some arguing back and forth the check-in assistant agreed and upgraded us to an oceanview room at no charge (as we were supposed to be). The room was gorgeous. Room 908 (9th floor). The view of the ocean was amazing. You could tell that the rooms were a bit older but had been upgraded. Newer paint, flatscreen TV, refrigerator, etc. Some people on here complained about a smell - everything smelled fine to me. The only thing that the room was lacking was a microwave. And yes - as others said, the refrigerators get TOO cold and sometimes freeze your food and drinks. Overall I'd give the room an 8.5 out of 10. I have heard others complain about "bed bugs." We did have a lot of bites on our legs, but we also visited the rainforest and walked on the beach at night so I can't say if these bites came from the ROOM or from being outside. Either way, it wasn't a huge deal to me. I didn't see a single bug in the hotel or in our room, and everything seemed very nice and clean. As others stated, housekeeping didn't replenish towels. We called down to the lobby and they sent some up immediately. We visited the casino one night. It's nice and small and out of the way. I actually won $80 on the penny and nickel machines! Towards the back of the casino where you redeem your winnings, it looked like it needed some updating (gaps in walls, etc.) We didn't eat at the hotel - there are plenty of other places to eat for cheaper. Church's Chicken, Denny's, Burger King, etc. I'm a picky eater so it was nice to have a wide variety of food around you within walking distance. If you rent a car (we did for the entire time), beware! Ha. The drivers there are HORRID. It seemed like every other car had a burnt out tail light, and they would swerve in front of you like speed demons. It takes some getting used to. You'll see trucks pulled over int he middle of the road, and you have to go around them. The cops do NOT care what people do on the road or where they park from what it seemed. I also saw many police vehicles with their lights on....casually driving down the road. I think they turned their lights on simply to get around some of the traffic. We did use the "business center" at the hotel to print our boarding passes. They offer free wi-fi in the rooms, but if you need to print anything you need to use one of their computers. I was charged $5 for 10 minutes of internet usage, and $1 per page in black and white. OUTRAGEOUS! We did NOT get charged any "resort fees," but you DO have to pay $16 a day for self parking. Seems expensive, but what can you do. The parking in this area is just HORRENDOUS - nowhere near enough parking. Upon checkout, everything went smoothly. We paid $55 in parking fees (Mon afternoon until Fri at 12 noon). Keep in mind that we did travel in mid-October (off season), which was GOOD. Less crowds! The weather was fantastic. The rain showers last maybe 15 minutes, and then it's back to bright sunny weather! One thing to mention - it is SO HUMID IN PUERTO RICO! Not a single breeze, just HOT AND HUMID. We were dripping sweat from walking only 15 minutes in Old San Juan. Be prepared! There are many Walgreen's on the island, but the one close to the Intercontinental is HIGH PRICED. Expect to pay double what you do at a Walgreen's in the States. We stopped at another Walgreens in Old San Juan that had much better prices. If it's close to the tourist hotels, chances are it's overpriced! For anyone else going, you MUST go to Flamenco Beach on Culebra. GORGEOUS. The best beach in the world. It's a $2.50 ferry ride from Fajardo (an hour from the Intercontinental), and $2.50 back. The snorkeling is phenomenal, and the beach is out of this world. We also saw the rainforest and Old San Juan, but Culebra was the highlight of our trip. If your goal is to see a great beach and snorkel......Culebra is for you! Overall - if you can get a good deal, it's a very nice hotel. Not perfect, but definitely not bad like some people have claimed. I paid $1100 for roundtrip flights for 2 out of Minneapolis and my free oceanfront room upgrade, including tax. That boiled down to about $100 a night for an oceanfront view, which is normally $250 a night. The Intercontinental was a great choice given the price we paid. I'd easily rate it a 9 out of 10. Not perfect, but definitely a very nice hotel. Very convenient location, and excellent pool (which is open 24 hours!) If you can get a good price, it's definitely worth staying here!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: RaineLaza
Reviews.Content: We booked the Intercontinental Hotel for a short vacation and we were so pleased that we didnt want to leave. We used cheapcarribean. com and they made sure all resort fees were well included in the price so we had no confusion or complication at the time of payment. At arrival we were upgraded to an Ocean view room too!! The room was very cozy. The bed was so comfortable that it was difficult to get out of it in the morning but when we took a peak through the balcony and saw that wonderful pool and that beautiful beach we just jumped out to start our day. We truly enjoyed our stay from the very first instant we checked in. The Hotel was romantic but also family friendly. The bar inside the pool was awesome!! The bartenders were so friendly! The pool was awesome, the Mediterranean Cafe by the beach was awesome too, the pool waterfalls were awesome the lounging area/chair availability was awesome. It was a great area to relax. In terms of location, the hotel was awesome too. Only $12 from the airport and $20 form Old San Juan. It is surrounded by places were to do simple shopping, eating and even getting licor at a discounted price. We went to Pueblo (24hr supermarket) to get our licor and some snacks, to Rest Don Jose and Chilis to get some food and to Walgreens to get some Sunblock. We walked a little further on Friday night at 3:30am and we got yummy pizza :) Oh BTW, the area is constantly patrolled by the local police and the tourist zone police so you feel very safe at all times. If you wanted to go anywhere, either by foot or by taxi the staff was friendly & super nice to give you directions and help. The only detail I think they should improve is their knowledge of nightlife options. We like to dance but when we asked the staff about places to do some dancing they didn't really know any other place than their neighbor hotel San Juan (great for Salsa) or the Newyorican Cafe in Old San Juan (great place too!). They should get more familiar with the party scene around the area for people like us who like thelocal night life. The hotel also had a 24 hours security force . We saw them at 4am at the jacuzzi area and even at that time they were wearing a smile. In terms of cleanliness, the hotel was impeccable! We loved, we love the island and we just cant wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful pool area. exspensive food and drinks.”
Reviews.Author: Noraflora
Reviews.Content: We wanted a resort type hotel that was big with a lot of stuff going on for our 4 day Spring Break Vacation. Through Travelocity we got a great deal for InterContinental but ended up spending much more than we had planned on on food. I would not recommend the restaurants at the hotel. But, there are some quick fast food places around the hotel. And a great place for breakfast across the street. We did love the pool and the bar by the pool. There was always an available chaise and great towels. Much more good than bad about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mcgeez
Reviews.Content: Stayed with husband at the Intercontinental San Juan for 2 nights. Nice hotel. The bellmen were attentive and we never had to open the door when returning to hotel. We stayed on the 1st floor of the Club Intercontinental area which gave us easy access to the pool and beach and had a nice little patio area. If youâ€™re looking for quietness during the day this part of the hotel would not be for you as you can hear the music from the pool. We did not mind as we spent little time at the hotel during the day. The pool and hot tub were great and are open 24 hours. There were games available for checkout at the pool towel desk. The workout room was adequate with multiple treads available (I think there were other cardio machines) and weights. Concierge staff was awesome and very helpful with recommendations, directions and web check in. Self-parking is across the street from the hotel, but easy and convenient. Location is super close to the airport. Casino is small but seemed to have the basics. Having heard how expensive the hotel restaurants were from reviews, we decided to eat off campus. There are several restaurants near this location and it is on the beach. Restaurants Mi Casita â€“ right across the street from the hotel, reasonably priced, small, good food (enjoyed the mofongo and tostones). Service was a little slow, but still a good place for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Raices â€“ right across from the parking deck the hotel suggests you use in Old San Juan. Small, energetic atmosphere with traditionally dressed servers. Food was good. Appetizers are expensive for what you get but tasty. Tornado (steak, shrimp with side) was good. La Bombonera â€“ Old San Juan; old school Puerto Rican restaurant. Went for breakfast and LOVED the mallorca! Very quick. Activities Caves and observatory â€“ We rented a car for $62 total for the almost 3 days we were there which gave us nice flexibility. We drove to the Camuy caverns ($12/person) and observatory ($6/person) which are in the same area and make sense to be done together and it took us about 1.5 hrs to get there (easy drive). That excursion would have cost $236 ($118/person) thru the hotel. Go early because the more people there are, the longer youâ€™ll have to wait your turn to be shuttled down to the caves. You could also hit the Bacardi facility or the large mall on the way back to San Juan (we ran out of time). El Morro â€“ Very interesting and inexpensive (~$6?). Lots of stairs. La Rumba â€“ dance party on a boat with bay tour. For $13 each we got to dance salsa, merengue, bachata, reggaeton while cruising around the bay (1 hour) in Old San Juan. The signage and flyers say the experience is 2 hours but the tour is only 1 and they sat at the dock for the first hour (with music). Note on driving to Old San Juan We drove to Old San Juan with no problem. Finding parking on the street was crazy so we parked in a deck in the evenings that was only $3 or $4 (take singles with you). Took a day trip to Old San Juan, found no street parking and we ended up in valet lot that was ~$4/hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Food, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mmeren
Reviews.Content: Great experience from the minute we arrived. Staff at the front door and desk, very friendly and helpful. We arrived a few hours before checkin time and we were still given a room right away. BEAUTIFUL beach, and very centrally located to shopping food and night life. Our room had a great view of the pool and ocean....great view to wake up to in the morning. We will be back to join the friendly staff at the Intercontinental

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravelbuddy
Reviews.Content: It is a good location if u have a car. The hotel pool is not big, however, you can walk out to the beach for swimming. The hotel looks old but with reasonable price. There are some fast food stores nearby and remember to take a receipt for free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cacheandcow
Reviews.Content: Booked our package through Cheap Caribbean. Hotel is in convenient location. The beach area is nice and clean with free beach chairs. Hotel's amenities are not luxurious but fairly nice (but little outdated). Service not great unfortunately. Overall we were satisfied but will not pay more for it.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel and People”
Reviews.Author: Borquia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so nice, and the people that work there were so friendly and kind. The Pool area is beautiful and the ocean in the back. We are going back next year and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: teenab313
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. wonderful warm pool and spacious. loved walking on the beach early morining. We enjoyed the exercise room late one night and early next morning. Hotel has a casino also. The check in time was a bit too long. Service desk girl was trying to handle check ins and answer phone reservations at same time. Bar and music at night were great. Walked out at night to surrounding areas and everything you need was there. Food, music, clubs, stores etc. Wonderfu weekend. Will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: frank8810
Reviews.Content: A must for a tropical paradise romantic experience. Great service, amazing pool, best beaches in Puerto Rico. Very helpful with booking paradise adventures and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, if you don't have to leave”
Reviews.Author: Khowaga
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental San Juan is a fairly typical offering from a chain known for a top level of service. The rooms are spacious, the grounds are meticulously kept, and the front desk is staffed 24/7. The pool is large and gorgeous, there's private access to the beach (which is a public beach, but well kept and safe), and there's even free internet in the rooms! On the other hand: the restaurants and the bars--while nice--are quite expensive. I was there for a conference and could easily have spent my entire per diem allowance on a single round of drinks. If you plan to eat inexpensively (or interestingly), you'll need a car. There are plenty of fast food outlets and chain restaurants nearby -- all slightly more expensive than their mainland counterparts (and, c'mon, did you come to Puerto Rico to eat at Taco Bell?). Tips: coffee and rum can be purchased at the Pueblo grocery store (it's a bit of a walk, but not too far) for much less than in the souvenir shops in old town or elsewhere. There are two Walgreen's pharmacies along Isla Verde, about 5-10 minutes in either direction. Although driving is not for the faint of heart, the cost of a rental + parking still worked out about the same as taking taxis everywhere, plus you have the freedom to explore on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrownSuga28
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the interContinental the staff was friendly and the service was excellent.
