When ever you asked for extra towels or anything it was given in a timely manner...The hotel is very children oriented. I would recommend it for families...But it was still a great stay if you are looking for a party atmosphere you may want to pick another location if you are looking to relax this is the place...I loved it and would stay again...I have no complaints...The beds were great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & Fun!”
Reviews.Author: furuca
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice but it was the employees that made our stay so much more enjoyable. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and seemed genuinely concerned with us. I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: iluv2
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my boyfriend and his 2 children (aged 8 and 15). This place was PERFECT! The location was great, the resort was clean, and the beach was the most beautiful section of beach we saw! The japanese restaurant on site was amazing...the hot tub was large and HOT! We rented a car and drove to the rainforest and stopped at the roadside shops/stands along the way. Was an excellent vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Well Appointed, Nice Grounds, BUT eat local & travel wise!”
Reviews.Author: ChloesHotMama
Reviews.Content: Overall, nice hotel. Older, but in good condition. Beautiful property. Nice foliage and fauna; flowers. Nice front desk/lobby area. Small casino (mostly 5 cent/10 cent/ 25 cent machines; $5 blackjack was great; had $15/$25). Right now the city is trying to upgrade the roads so you can't really blame anyone for TRYING to do right by the citizens and visitors. So the road outside of the hotel is torn up a bit, but the sidewalk is okay. Beware - RESORT FEE (added to the room charge), approx $25 per day per room; not sure how thats calculated. We were 2 people, so it might be $12per person, who knows? But it was on the bill! GREAT STAFF. Door was held open 90% of the time. Lobby was always clean and polished. Security was abundant; but no intrusive. Saw some kids come in off the street and head for the hotel, security was right behind them and asked them if they stayed her in Spanish. He politely escorted them to the door. Although there were many families, you didn't see kids running through the lobby. Staff was kind. Tipped daily. Room was cleaned daily. Towels daily. NO complaints! Pool had plenty of towels. Remember, we visited here OFF SEASON, OCT. 1 TO 4, 2009. I imagine things might be different going IN-SEASON when its busier and more crowded. We typically travel to places off season since we hate crowds and love the feeling of 'owning' the place; having it ourselves a bit. So, take everything w/ a grain of salt said in this review if you are going in the heat of the peak tourist season. Saw two beautiful twins, about 17 months old, with their mother. They stayed at the pool from 11am to 5pm almost. This hotel is family oriented. Soft music plays over their pool speakers. Clean pool. Board games you can check out at the activities desk. Call ahead to see if the 'kid center' is open; its seasonal and might be closed. I'd definitely bring our young daughter. Plenty of places for little ones to roam within watching distance in the sense of 'space' - there's enough area around the pool; its not cramped. Stay here IF you want to be close to the airport, right on the beach. 5 minutes from airport. $13 cab ride + $4 tip! Cheap! This is NOT the best beach in PR; this is a NICE beach; on par with Fort Lauderdale. There are better beaches all over the island, like Luquillo (about an hour drive away), but its nice. A bit crowded on Sundays, but still plenty of beach left. Locals take advantage of it; its not private, but nice. Stay here IF you want to lounge at the pool. It was closed the first day we were there for repairs (had been for a few weeks), but they did give $50 food/beverage credit PER DAY! Wow! We enjoyed spending time that on food and bar stuff. The trick was to spend it all that day! It was weird, but it didn't carry over it seems. I thought that was a 'trick'. At other resorts we've been at, you got $50 and you just spent it before you checked out, you didn't need to spend it that actual day or on a specific day. Anyway, it worked out! Stay here IF you want to be near Old San Juan, the Ritz Carlton is down the street, 5 to 8 minute walk (bigger, nicer casino; nice pool; some great photo ops at night!). SAVING MONEY TIPS: 1. Buy your own bottle of liquor, snacks & water at the grocery: Hotel is near the "Pubelo" - a local grocery chain. Nice. Reminded me of our 'Publix' or Winn Dixie. Clean, organized. You can get 90% of what's in an American grocery. When we arrived, we walked to the grocery (about a 10 minute walk; you have to go behind the Chilis restaurant; its in the corner, near the highway; seems odd when walking there, but its safe; just go right at the Chilis, head towards the highway, make a right and there's the big grocery). Water - you can get a 12 pack of Dasini water for $3.50. Why buy at the hotel? Liquor - there's a large selection of rum at the grocery store; all local favorites. Get it there cheap. Don't overbuy because remember you can't take it on the plane; you can pack it in your suitcase, but you can't board with it. Remember that, UNLESS you buy it after you check in at duty free! Excellent choices. Also, you have glasses in your room. I would make a cocktail, then walk downstairs and enjoy the free music or tour the property or go sit out by the pool or go get in the jacuzzi...why pay for $10 drinks when for $13 you can buy Bacardi Select and make 15 STIFF drinks! 2. EAT LOCAL: What's the point of visiting a town, just to eat hamburgers! So try the food! In Old San Juan, we ate at the "Cafe Puerto Rico" - excellent! Authentic. Huge meal for $7.99! Excellent Mojiotos - $6. Actually the best I had while there; smooth, no seltzer after-taste, very smooth and nice; not overly sweet. PERFECTION. Next door to the hotel is Don Pepe - make a left as you exit the hotel, its about 5 minutes; past that bar, Lupis; somewhat caddy corner to the Chilis. It's a small local eatery. Clean. Good! Great service. Meals around $8 to $10. FRESH. You wait about 15 minutes for it to come out, but take out was excellent! ON Sunday, I walked over to the grocery store for a few souvenirs, grabbed lunch there. The buffet at the grocery store is excellent; all fresh; long line, but worth the wait. Huge meal for $5.99. 3. POOL BAR & FOOD: Overall, I have to say that the few things they did as it relates to "Puerto Rican" flavor, they did well. Good tropical drinks! True, you might want to splurge on one drink at the bar. Even though, I'll admit it, I played poolside Bingo at the activities events, won a free drink ticket, BUT I already had my own drink from my room while I was playing bingo. But I did try their swim-up pool-bar. We purchased a sandwhich right before we left for the airport at the pool bar - TRIPLETA. Very good! $15.00 - we had a similar sandwhich for $7.99 down the street at Don Pepes, but hubby liked it so much, he spotted it on their menu and wanted it again; 3 meats - Puerto Rican ham, steak, and something else...piled high. Very good though, even if it was DOUBLE THE PRICE, not including tip. I guess at any resort, you have to balance being frugal with splurging. We splurged on the occasional drink, even though 85% of our liquor drinks were made in our room. We splurged on a sandwhich on property, even though 95% of our meal was eaten off property or take-out from another local place and brought back to our room to eat. 4. GREAT LIVE MUSIC & EXCELLENT BAR STAFF This was a highlight - they have GREAT live bands that play almost each night. One night, I saw 3 lives bands (3 piece small lounge bands)...all very good; they play for about 2 hours each; pack up and go. I was shocked by the talent and diversity; I listened to Salsa, then Latin Jazz, then instrumental, etc. It was great! Even though there's no club on site, for me the music was enough. If you are a young person looking for a CLUB bar scene (try Bravo, not sure of what hotel its at, but heard the younger college kids talking about that). But its not a CLUB hotel; this is a more elegant hotel. I'm 37 and I would say you mostly saw middle-aged professionals to older people; not a ton of teens around, and you saw late 30s people like me with young babies. If you want peace, quiet with a little bit of flair in the evening , then this is it. If you are looking for party party hard hotels (like the Hard Rock), then go elsewhere! But again be careful - drinks at the lobby bar are $11 each and w/ tip around $14, charged to the room, you can run up a tab quick! I loved the TAMARIND DELIGHT. Excellent. I splurged on that. BUT again, I would bring my drink down in my own glass, then to top my evening off, I'd order the Tamarind Delight. They don't bother you if you walk into the bar w/ a glass since its a lounge bar. They have no idea if you got it at the casino or where. Just use your in-room glass! BUT great attentive staff. Pretty waitresses! Nice bartenders. WHAT'S BAD: Alfredos - AVOID THE ITALIAN RESTAURANT. I'm writing management on this now that we are back in town. If you can't do Italian right, then don't bother. I had to send my soup back. Tasted like dish water. My husbands risotto was just average; he makes better at home and we're not Italian. They missed the boat on this. When I visit PR, I want PR food. Why not give me authentic baked goods, food, and drinks in a restaurant there. Why do I have to leave the property for a 'taste of PR'. Crazy! Beautiful restaurant. Great outdoor area. I sat there Sunday morning for a cup of $3.50 coffee, then tip = $5. Wow! I could have walked down the street to Don Pepes for a $1.50 or $2 Cafe Con Leche or something. But I was lazy. Its sad that such a great restaurant on this property is wasted. If you read other reviews, most diners HATE Alfredos. Overall, this trip did the trick for us - it was a nice location. In the center of it all. Thursday night, we checked in and used our $50 room credit; hung around the lobby bar and ate at that terrible Alfredos; Friday day we toured Old San Juan, then walked down to the Ritz. Hubby entered a Poker tournament there; lost after a few hours, but that was cool; it was entertainment for him. I sat by their lovely pool at the Ritz while he pokered! Saturday morning we rented a Jeep, put the top down, and drove to El Yunque. Excellent adventure. Sunday we lounged around the pool and went home. We stayed in 1616 - 16th floor; right -off the elevator. It was fairly quiet. Some kids moved in next door, but I was knocked out; hubby heard them, but I didn't. Excellent bed! Thick, comfy! Loved the ocean view. Would return again. Very romantic. Our first trip without our 17 month old; she stayed home w/ Grandma. Worth the visit! Definitely rejuvenated us. We were ready to leave because we missed our daughter, but if she was with, we could have stayed another 2 or 3 days! Would definitely return again. Just be smart and shop local, eat local. The hotel's drinks & food are a bit overpriced considering what's right outside your door in walking distance - local food & groceries...so...use the hotel for a great stay, pool, quiet, safe atmosphere, etc. BUT don't be afraid to take a 10 minute stroll for groceries or get the local food. And yes, there's a Burger King, Dennys, and a few other 'American' places nearby in walking distance too! Chilis is 5 minutes away too! And next door is the Old San Juan Hotel and they have STARBUCKS & other places to eat!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!! HEALTH and SAFETY ISSUES”
Reviews.Author: PuertoR_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel I upgraded to a suite. The refrigerator did not work, the remote to the TV did not work, and the service to get the room cleaned and fresh towels was horrible. Before going on the trip I reviewed the postings for this hotel and saw several people posting issues with being bitten by bugs. I ignored these facts because the proce was affordable for the hotel. Big mistake. I was severly bitten and found they were inside the couch. The hotel made me feel like I was trying to get away with something while I had huge allergic reactions on my arm, neck, head, and back. I spent money getting medication to resolve it. The hotel did take the blankets and couch items to a lab to get tested and of course, they say they did not find anything. They definitely have bug problems and do not want to resolve it. The attitude I get is that they do not care. For health reasons I would avoid this hotel especially if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel2destination
Reviews.Content: Was there for 3 nights with my husband and hated the hotel. 1. The air-conditioning in our room was a mess. It would switch off on its own and we couldnt get it fixed. The repair person who came hardly understood english and I couldnot explain my problem to him. 2. The refrigerator in our room whould freeze the milk we put in it. There was no way to adjust the temperature. Only set to freeze. 3. The housekeeping was lousy. The didnt replace coffee and sugar in our room. Had to call several times to get it the next morning. 4. Location of the hotel is not great. Must stay in San Juan instead. 5. Pool was not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, perfect weather.”
Reviews.Author: BenRunkle
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I along with two friends flew down to PR for the weekend. Our travel agent, Jimmy Strohmaier from Liberty Travel, found a great deal, so we jumped on it. The hotel is a ten minutes taxi ride ($10 +$1 per bag) from the airport. Upon arriving at the hotel there was hardly any wait to check in, but our rooms were not ready. The desk person gave us a few comp drink coupons, so we checked our luggage and explored the place. We ended up walking down the beach and grabbing lunch at a small hotel. The rooms were ready about an hour later, and we were all pleasantly surprised at their size and view. Each was on the 4th floor, but ours had a slightly better view, but ours also had a funny smell that we quickly got used to. I did call housekeeping about it and they came up and sprayed an air freshener, but that was a temporary fix. I contemplated complaining, but we were close to our friends, so we decided to deal with it. The pool was great. The beach was reasonably clean and the water was very refreshing. The hotel provides free chairs and umbrellas on the beach. While at the hotel we ate at the Hibachi place, the name is escaping me at the moment, but it was pretty good. Slightly inflated pricing, but it was fun none the less. The host, Franco, was very accommodating. The bar/restaurant closest to the beach is ok. The entrÃ©es we had were good, but the appetizers kind of stunk. On our last day they shut down the pool bar and pool for a two week renovation. The hotel was offering everyone staying at the hotel during this period a $50 F&B credit. Not bad, but I think I'd rather have a working pool. We visited Old San Juan and had dinner at Rosa de Triana, just across from the Convento Hotel. This place is a must eat - we tried 7 different tapas and shared a pitcher of their very tasty sangria. Give it a try! Taxis to and from the hotel added up quickly ($21 each way), but with 4 of us sharing the tab it wasn't so bad. We also visited El Yunque, a rainforest about 40 minutes from the hotel. There is a scheduled tour that is like $60 per person, but we opted to rent a car from Enterprise for only $27 and drove ourselves there. Seriously, you DO NOT need a tour guide at the park. Wake up early, get your car and go for it. Visit the visitor center and you will be good to go. ALSO, if you do it early enough in the day you can visit Loquillo, a town about 10 minutes from El Yunque. It is a great little beach town that is relatively free of tourist traffic. This was my first trip to PR, and I definitely plan on going back. I'd prob stay at the Intercontinental again, but may be tempted to check out options in Loquillo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: DavidPortland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in early September on a Priceline reservation but still got an upgrade to a partial ocean//pool view room because of my Priority Club membership. So be sure to show your Priority Club card at checkin, it helps. Tropical storm Erika was headed for Puerto Rico during my stay and the hotel installed a weather tracker monitor in the lobby so guests could watch its approach. Fortunately, the storm went south of PR and just resulted in one day of tropical light rain. Hotel is as described by others. I certainly recommend taking the city bus (75 cents) to its terminus next to Old San Juan where you can board a free trolley that goes throughout OSJ. I wasn't searching for gourmet food so tried many of the close by, inexpensive restaurants. Two choices I haven't seen mentioned are the Ponderosa and the Denney's. The Ponderosa (right across the street) has a great salad bar that comes with all choices except the hamburger. Denney's (which is several blocks left of the hotel's main entrance) had a great senior menu on the back page. Breakfast is particularly good. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: millersohio
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to San juan PR. This was our first time to stay at the Intercontinental and we loved it. Hotel food expensive but had a very resonable restaurant across the street in the shopping center. Many places to eat cheap with in walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms very pretty and comfortable. View of pool and landscape beautiful. I read a review that warned of bug bites..I too had several bugs bites on my legs but not sure where I got them. I would stay here again and we plan on going back..we can't seem to get enough of Puerto Rico. I wish there room rates could be a little cheaper. The area is safe and close to airport but did not hear planes in the room. This is a great place to stay! Go experience it!

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUG INFESTED HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: traveler9616
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE. I traveled here in September of 2009 during labor day weekend with friends. The hotel is INFESTED with bedbugs. A dermatologist looked at bite marks all over my arms, legs, neck, and back and knew it was bedbugs. The hotel is not clean, and not safe. To add insult to injury, the hotel has refused to issue a refund or credit until it "investigates."

Reviews.Title: “light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Ready2Trvl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are NOT a light sleeper. The walls are thin and I could hear our neighbors entire conversation. The service is wonderful. You will have to wait until late afternoon to get your room cleaned. The casino has free bingo every night. Avoid the Italian restaurant in the hotel. The food was nasty and expensive. The Japanese restaurant was great. If you feel like taking a walk, go to Don Jose/Edith's restaurant down the street. It is a 24 hour "Mom & Pop's" kinda place. Delious Puerto Rican food at reasonable prices. We ate there two or three times a day everyday. If you want fast food there is a Church's and Burger King across the street. The beach was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough But Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine but there was nothing about it that stood out for me though I (unlike others on here) did have excellent luck with customer service. Concierge was amazing and attentive and regardless of how many times he probably gives tourists the same directions and suggestions, he talks to you like he is customizing the perfect day just for you. So maybe one thing did stand out - this guy. My advice for staying here would be to do so only if you found a great deal for it on a discount site like I did. I would however NEVER pay full price for it when there are so many other nicer hotels in PR. Our friends were staying next store at El San Juan and whereas it felt a little cheesy miami-beach in decor, it was still much nicer. Both hotels share the same beach which is nice and seemed clean but we found there are much nicer beaches throughout the island. Isla verde itself is somewhat of a just ok area. It is touristy and developed because there are quite a few hotels and condos but would otherwise be not a great place to stay. If I had to do it again, I would probably book near the ashford avenue areas...equally touristy but closer to old San Juan and far nicer looking. Probably worth the addional $10 -$15 in cab fare from the airport. I was opposed to the fact that they charge extra for umbrella rentals. Resort fees seem to be the norm in PR and this hotel seemed to charge less than some of the others. It was nice that they warned us about this in advance. Skip the breakfast. $22 definitely not worth it and it baffled me that they had less than adequate non-tropical and fruit in a tropical location. Plenty of other cheaper places to eat nearby. Pool is nice but basic. Rooms were well below par and could use an upgrade. If an upgrade was done recently, they chose 1990's-esque furniture and decor. Again, good enough but not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with nice ocean front, bad room design and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Gatfly
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for our vacation at this location. The hotel was located very close to the air port, with ocean front access. But other than location and clean rooms, there not much going for it. Pros: *Room was very clean, at least the one we stayed at. *Towels were nicely washed, and smelled fresh *Furnishings were old looking, but well maintained *Hotel staff very friendly and helpful when tipped *The sushi restaurant in the hotel was very nice, try the sushi pizza if you go there. Price is pretty high though, abut $100 for a couple Cons: *Hotel staff not very helpful when not tipped. One day out of six, we forgot to leave the normal $5 tip for the cleaning crew, and they did not leave us any fresh towels or shampoo. *Rooms were very small, and poorly designed. It's a rebranded InterContinental. Everything is not to the normal standards. *Walls were paper thin. We could hear everything people say next door. There are two doors that join the hotel rooms together. Most of the sound came from there. First two nights, our neighbor was watching TV until 3 AM, and they had the TV on full volume. Tired as we were, we did not get much sleep. We tried to change room, but the other rooms were the same. Any one running in the hallway, you can hear it clearly. If you are a light sleeper, this is not the hotel for you. *Hotel beach looked nice, but it is littered with seaweed and other items. The pool is normally clouded with leaves, feather, and flowers as well. *The comforters had blood stains on them when we arrived. We called hotel staff to change them, but they said they were only able to change 1. I took out the camera to take some pictures of the bloodstains, that's when he said they will find another one right away. Over all, it was better than other hotels in the area. Which does not say a lot of quality of service in Puerto Rico. It was very clear that tourist traffic is light, and their business is hurting. But the sub par service and tourist gouging prices make other vacation destinations much more attractive. We had a great time in Mexico last year, and it cost a lot less. We would not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be robbed blind, stay here! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaRescue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks, on arrival the room was not ready, once here, found out it is not kids friendly. somebody with access to the room went in and looked troughtout our luggage and stole more than 1,000. dollars, requested for the safe to be fix, but NEVER got fixed. Very dissaponted, will never stay here again, 4 star hotel with 1 star staff. So, if you have money ready to be stolen from the comfort of your room while you are out and about, this is the hotel for you. management gave us the run around until we check out with no resolution. other guest got their jewerly stolen in the same week, just prior to check out. Loved Puerto Rico but hated the stayed. If you must go, please, please stay somewhere else. Loved the island and all the activities, people out and about are very helpful and you can find your way around. The food is great and very affortable but you have to drive outside the "tourist" area. great beaches and natural resources that PR provide are second to none. come to PR for a great time, but staye else where! do your homework and plan your trip carefully. as for me and my family will never, ever stay here and will advise everyone not to stay at the intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we didn't listen to reviews and judged for ourselves!!”
Reviews.Author: StatenIslandM0m
Reviews.Content: I received an amazing offer for this hotel and after I booked it I looked at reviews. I was so nervous by the reviews of out-dated furniture, crowded rooms, small balcony, unattentive staff, and even sand bugs that I was thinking this was too good to be true. Well, I am so happy that we went because the room was beautiful, the beach free of bugs, the balcony revealed a breath-taking view of the lavish pool and ocean and the staff were all friendly, attentive and very helpful!! The only thing this hotel is lacking is a coffee shop. The non gourmet restaurants were very, very good BUT expensive. Lunch for 2 adults and 2 children without alholic drinks was between $65-70. Alfredo's for breakfast was horrible and not worth $68. However, this hotel is located in the mist of fabulous chain and local restaurants all within walking distance. Take advantage of the Spa and Salon while at this hotel. I had the best and inexpensive 1 hour Swedish massage ever by Jessica. My 4 year old daughter also had her hair braided in the salon and the stylist was so patient and nice to her. We were also expecting hurricain Bill to pass our way BUT thank God it changed course. The hotel had TV monitors set up in the lobby daily tracking its progression. I couldn't ask for a better family vacation at the Intercontinental, San Juan!! We all can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “LUVVVVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: bridrob
Reviews.Content: We arrived in puerto rico, took a cab ($11.00) resort was literally 10 minutes away. Was greeted with a beautiful hotel and great staff. I mentioned it was my husbands birthday and we were given a complimentary upgrade to a higher floor with a great view. However afetr walking the property we decided to upgrade further to the more private residences which also featured a private club (lounge/coffee etc). We were truly impressed when we got the new room! Overlooking the pool area, right in the middle of everything, but when you retire for the night you wouldnt even know everything was right outside. It was so quiet and peaceful. In the morning you went out on your private nicely appointed balcony to drink coffee. Sure the food is a bit overpricedbut you can walk to just about anything if you dont want to eat on premises. The staff was MORE than gracious, and I really want t thank Rosie and the other consierre (sorry I cant remember his name) but they really know and love their jobs! The front desk staff especially William, could not be outdone. I truly felt like we were the only guests they had.Dont forget to go to old san juan 75 cents by bus/but we found a taxi for $10.00. We met the president (in Dennys of all places) and he invited us out for the night. Please visit, I definetly plan to next year!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: true443
Reviews.Content: I read all these great reviews and Im very confused. I decided to stay at this resort and Im not impressed at all with this place. It was a very sad place. The Ruth Chris steakhouse is closed down. There is no club there or any kind of night time entertainment. The pool is small. Oh yea and watch out for sand fleas. Every night i went to sleep i was itching all night and woke up with bug bites on my legs. My two friends also had bug bites on their legs also. They checked the beds and they said there are no bed bugs. They told us we have sand flea bites. Ive stayed at many different resorts in different countries, Jamaica, Dominican Republic (twice), Mexico (three times), Sicily, and I have NEVER experienced what the hotel people were calling sand fleas. I talked to the hotel manager and he was not nice about it. I told him that I was very unhappy that I had to wake up every morning with bug bites all over my legs at a four star resort. I was extremely disappointed. This place really sucked. I would NEVER reccommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow... just wow...”
Reviews.Author: ethree423
Reviews.Content: I read tons of these reviews before we went, the overall conses seemed to be that the staff was great and the food was over-priced... correct, but also... We flew in , took a cab ($12) and were the only ones in line to check in. We wanted to upgrade to an ocean-view room and also ended up joining the Ambassadors club ($150), includes a free night's stay which would be about $150 anyway. Smooth sailing. We get to the room and are floored the view, the room, everything was perfect and clean. We went to the 24 hr pool, yes, 24 hrs. and the relaxing began. During our stay we visited Old San Juan a couple of times (take the bus, 75 cents opposed to 20+ for a cab) The forts are very interesting, especially if you like history. On Tuesday nights @ 6pm they have a cultural festival at the Castillo de San Cristibol fort, one of our favorite activities. There are TONS of shops in Old San Juan, BEN AND JERRY'S ROCKED! I definitely recommend those things as well as YOU MUST go to Senior Frog's, you'll see when you get there. While @ the Intercontinental we booked the snorkeling trip... SO WORTH IT! We went on the Spreadeagle II (the crew are top-notch and fun) and had our favorite day in Puerto Rico. So much to mention. oh yeah, across the street there is a nice cigar store called Cigars PR if you like that kind of thing. Plenty of places to eat outside the resort so save your money, but do eat @ the Japanese restaurant. Despite all the bad reviews I read about it, they were ALL wrong. I think it's more about your attitude not theirs. DO NOT EXPECT FREE REFILLS on ANY drinks ANYWHERE except Denny's. We will be going back hopefully sooner than later. The staff is highly professional, kind and helpful. This was the best vacation I have ever had. Thank you Intercontinental! -E. Turner

Reviews.Title: “Batteries were completely recharged - We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: LMNOP25
Reviews.Content: We met up with friends that were staying at the Caribe Hilton and the Conrad Condado Plaza and we loved our hotel the best! We loved coming home to the sound of the little Coqui frogs and all of the lush plants at our hotel. The pool was great, the beach was beautiful, and the hotel had a quiet elegance at night. Were our rooms the largest and most luxurious accommodations we've ever had? No, but we don't go on vacation to stay in our room. It was very nice, the beds were more than comfortable, we had the usual amenities, everything worked and most importantly, it was clean. The only thing I will say is that the walls are quite thin so act accordingly! The casino at the hotel is low key and does not distract from the family atmosphere of the hotel. We went to the Ritz Carlton and ESJ, the hotel next door, to do our gambling and enjoy the night life. As with most resorts, things can be a bit pricey but no more than usual. La Casita across the street has great meals for very little money. There is a Starbucks, a Brother Jimmy's Barbecue restaurant and a nice pizza place next door at ESJ. You definitely should rent a car to go to El Yunque, take a hike to the falls and visit some of the beaches in Fajardo. Take the Bioluminescence trip, it's definitely worth the money, but take the tour for that, it's at night and you don't want to get lost. One last tip...if you visit during the summer months, go to Old San Juan early in the morning and get to the beach by midafternoon - it gets unbearably hot !! Yes, there is a lot of construction on Isla Verde Blvd, but there is a lot of construction all over San Juan so it's not exclusive to this hotel. Hope this helps and have a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “The best beach spot in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SirHopAlot
Reviews.Content: If you want these things: Top beach location Safe family environment Clean and well appointed rooms Super friendly staff Incredible pool and hot tub Restaurants across the street Walgreens and other stores within 2 blocks Casino.... on and on Then this is the place. Book early through Hotwire and save... we got an incredible package deal and were able to stay in a 4 star like this by booking months ahead of time. July 12 - 21 2009 Weather? Perfect. If it rains it'll only last 10 minutes. Beach? Perfect... no seaweed and no jelly fish... perfect sandy beaches perfect for the whole family. Not the typical frat house environment you find on a beach. Very friendly and welcoming. We ate off the property, across the street mostly, and saved a lot of money. There's a grocery store within walking distance too, so we stored some stuff in the fridge for snaking and drinks. It is an expensive place if you're buying poolside drinks, eating in their fine restaurant, etc... but if you follow some money saving tips you'll love this place.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: Globe79
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, staff was really friendly we spent a lot of time on the beach as well as in the pool and the facilities are reallly good and are very easy to access from the airport and its a short drive into san jaun so worth the amount we spent

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip!”
Reviews.Author: Lakers9
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the resort itself, however, I was not pleased with how out dated the rooms were. The resort staff was very friendly and willing to help with anything such as places to go and eat in San Juan. My advice to anyone planning on touring Old San Juan is to take the public transportation due to cost. The cab ride to Old San Juan was $30 versus .75 cents (no brainer) my family and I was on the bus. If you are planning on going to the rain forest please rent a car from the hotel instead of paying the cost for the concierge tour. The beach and resort pool was an excellent place for my kids and I. Overall this is a good place for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Was good but couldve been better”
Reviews.Author: LaDuquesa
Reviews.Content: Well to start off it was hard getting there due to traffic and construction. The hotel is located closer to the exit of Loiza so you are better off taking that route because it can take you about an hour just because of the traffic on that street. Check in was ok, I had to wait about 15 minutes to check in, there was 2 employees checking people in. I got an excellent price on Hotwire.com 2 days they charged me $275.00 and at checkout I wasnt charged the $14.00 daily resort fee. Parking (valet) came out to 23.00 per day which was fine if you would see how the street parking is over there you will pay the valet.The guys in Valet and at the door were excellent. Very polite, helpful and professional. Cute too :). At check in I requested a room that faces the pool and the beach but I was told it was 20.00 more a night , so I told the gentleman for get it, I knew this trip was gonna cost me and I didnt want to pay $40.00 more to see the beach, when I got to the room I was surprised because he did go ahead and give me the room I requested at no additional cost which I thought was a great start, that was nice of him. The room was beautiful, I had room 412, its a king size. The bed was sooooooo comfortable. Very soft, very clean. The room had a full size sofa bed and another chair, you can see in the pics. The room is big and we had a little balcony which I had my view of the pool and beach. I had free WiFi in the room so looking for things to do online was very simple. The room, towels, bathroom,sheets were super clean. Im very picky with that and I couldnt complain about the hotel at all. The Casino is small but very popular. I guess Im used to the casinos in Vegas and its not like that but it is a good size. Theres security everywhere, so you dont have to worry about your safety. I was in the pool till about 2am and there was security doing rounds like every 10 minutes because anyone from the beach can get in because the hotel is on the beach. The only thing I didnt like but I did understand is that to be in the pool area between 9-6pm you have to have a color band. I understand the pool was only for guests but I have family in PR that I wanted them to come drink with me at the bar by the beach and pool area but they were not allowed and they dont have a guest pass because I called front desk. I did get my aunt and uncle in just by getting them my bands and they said nothing to me about not having one, maybe they remembered me from the day before or they just didnt mind because in the 3 hours I was at the pool I spent $150.00 in drinks which was served to me by a very nice, cute waiter lol. Yes the drinks are expensive a medalla cost me $6.00 which that is the PR beer and when I went to the bar in Catano I paid $1.00, but I expected it to be that way this is a 4 star hotel so It didnt bother me. Just imagine how much I paid for the sex on the beach ----UFF-- lol. The access to the beach also has security and it was beautiful especially at night for a midnight stroll. Youll see people on the beach at night just relaxing, its very romantic. I went to a nice little spot called lupis the food wasnt that great but it had alot of people in there so the music was good they play english, spanish everything. Pricing I thought was ummmm high for the food but the service was great. I went to a club called Drums, and it was nice. Im 36 so listening to 80's rock, like Bon Jovi, Poison, also Erasure, Depeche Mode, Gino Latino and Spanish rock was great. They also played salsa and merengue, I went on Friday , I didnt hear reggaeton tho. The drinks there are real cheap. After there we left about 3am 3:30 we went to a restaurant call Don Jose which was on the way back to the hotel. Mind you we went to all these places by foot because they were all close by. Im glad because parking in that strip is crazy, expensive and good luck is you find any because this area is very busy. You have a mini fridge in the room and we stepped out the the grocery store Pueblo close to the hotel which is open 24 hours and bought like water, beer, and chips. The experience there was excellent its just the construction that was bothering me, but overall I give the hotel A+ and its 4 stars it deserves

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: SteveandSaraG
Reviews.Content: The staff, the staff, the staffâ€¦Did I forget to mention the staff? The InterContinental is very convenient to the airport. The rooms are clean, a little small, the ocean view is nice. These are upscale Holiday Inn accommodations. So, why would we mention the staff? This is how our story begins. We traveled down for a getaway for my 50th. We checked in, everything was beautiful. The room had all the necessary amenities. The next morning, full of bravura and little common sense, I jumped into the normally placid ocean. A storm happened to be brewing off shore and the waves lifted me up and dropped me on the beach and pounded some sense into me. So I spent the next ten days surfing a wheelchair with a herniated back. And this is where the staff part comes in. I got adopted. The word seemed to spread through the hotel that one of their guests had been hurt. And every single one of them bent over backwards to help (which I certainly couldnâ€™t do.) My lovely girlfriend couldnâ€™t go anywhere in the hotel complex without someone asking about me. The guys at the Splash Bar became like family to us. Room service went out of its way to provide a young, broken, old man some sustenance. No mistakes, my back was on fire. My girlfriend did everything she could possibly do to make me feel better. Weâ€™re in love, so thatâ€™s understandable. The staff at the IC doesnâ€™t know me from Adam. For them to come through like they did is an outstanding example of how hotel guests hope to be treated. Make your reservations with no reservations at this property. Youâ€™ll find a decent bunch of folks who just happen to be running a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and horrible service!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDiva28
Reviews.Content: Stay for 6 nights not worth the money. Plus they have an additional fee of $27 a day not included in the package deal. The hotel employees only help those they believe will give them a good tip. No one is helpful and the rooms are disgusting. My restroom had a leak from the ceiling. Lamps, radio, telephone in the room didn't work and were not fixed during my stay. There was not enough toilet paper or tissues. Pablo @ the Splash Bar only attended his "favorite" customers. Meaning if you are not white don't expect Pablo to even look at you, you can die of hunger. Horrible customer service, tips make this hotel go round and round. They judge your complexion and don't realize you give a better tip, and make a whole lot of money. Never again!! Oh other guest were noisy in the night and early morning don't expect to sleep here!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: OH2Go
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in San Juan and at an Intercontinental hotel. Upon arrival, I found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. I stayed on the 14th floor with a view overlooking the beach. The view was breathtaking and worth an upgrade. I probably would not have liked the hotel as much with a different view. If you are not into the casino, then go next door to the El San Juan or other close spots for the nightlife. The Intercontinental offered a quieter, more relaxing atmosphere. If you are traveling with children, I noticed that they do offer activities for them. Lying on the beach was like being in paradise. It is not overcrowded and food service is available. I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “PR, Not What I expected”
Reviews.Author: lisa e
Reviews.Content: Love that the hotel is just a few minutes from the airport, cost was supposed to be $12, but we were charged $13. We paid without fuss. Check in unbelievably long, other than that, we called concierge and front desk often for information and they were always kind and helpful. Had a clean, non-ocean front room with 2 double beds. Bathroom is the tiniest I've ever seen. Only about a few inches between toilet edge and the door. Housekeeping failed to leave enough wash cloths/towels each day so we called daily for more. Beds were comfortable, short on pillows. One Pool-average size and crowded at times, with some tree leaves and bird feathers floating around. Hot tub okay. Ciao grill on beach has good food and smoothies although over priced. Pigeons, crows and lizards were all around in the pool/grill area. Won $10 in casino... thats always nice. Booked swedish massages for my two daughters. $55 for a half hour. It was my daughter's 18th birthday and so I didnt mind the price. One strange occurrence: one morning my daughter and I brought back a croissant, hash browns and OJ from BK and decided to eat in the pool area because we'd seen others doing this the day before. One of the employees near the towel bar was starring at us very hard then slowly followed us to our seats. He stated we could not eat in the chairs but had to go to the boardwalk area. We then proceeded there as he slowly followed us again. By the time we picked out a clean table, he then told us we could not sit there either per his mgr over the walkie talkie. Now I dont know if his mgr had eyes all over the area or if this guy was simply picking on us or racist or what, but I was very aggravated after moving twice. We finally proceeded to our room to eat in peace. Besides Ciao, we did not eat at any of the other restaurants in the hotel. Ruth Chris was closed. For my daughter's 18th celebration, We were told to go to the Palm restaurant next door as a good steak house with seafood. It turned out to be a very poor choice. We had swordfish, king crab, and my youngest had chicken tenders. The other party with us, got the lobster for 2 special. It took FOREVER to get our food and it was SUPER OVERPRICED. Our ticket was $250.00 and the food was less than desired...no taste at all and they dont give you enough to eat. No salads or veges to go with meal like most places. This was the worst part of my trip because I truly felt I wasted money. Resort Beach was clean and had average crowd. Only went out there once for a few minutes, but my youngest became irritated or something was stinging her so we quickly got out and headed back to pool. This resort had no night life and nothing for my 14 and 18 year old daughters to do. We wanted to do some of the excursions (zip line, rainforest, caves, or biobay), but all were pricey for 3 people and did not include transportation. I did enjoy visiting plaza las americas($20 each way by taxi). Very large mall with prices similar to the states. Off the resort, we went to old san juan $20 by taxi each way. I dont understand the hype. Everyone says its a must see, but for me it was OKAY...saw the forts, rode the trolley, walked the crooked sidewalks in the heat, visited a few stores, coach and such, but nothing special. In fact, the highlight of my visit to old san juan, was the BEN & JERRY's ice cream parlor. The strawberry cheescake ice cream in the homemade waffle cone was sooo delicious. About the immediate resort area. Trash is on the street everywhere and there are bad smells from garbage. Be careful on sidewalks as they are very uneven and some are partially contrustructed. There is a chilis and dennys to the left, several blocks down after you pass ESJ hotel. A few blocks to the right is a walgreens, KFC, dominos, pizza hut, churches, wendys, burger king, and some local restaurants and stores. We patiently waited 40 minutes in wendys, 30 minutes at burger king. Workers moved very slow as if on Jamaica time. Walgreens and dominos had much quicker service. Note: there is way too much contruction on Isla Verde Ave directly in front of the hotel. Dont expect to catch the city bus as scheduled. We waited forever in the heat one morning, but it never came and so we quickly hopped in a taxi that stopped in front of us. Overall, It was an okay trip. I was just happy to be away from home and work, but I know I will not come back to PR. We found Mexico to be a much choice. Better food; faster, better service, friendler people and a cleaner resort district. Sorry, no pics this time. It pretty much looks just like the online photos.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Pool & Beach”
Reviews.Author: ChiTown16
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days and really enjoyed ourselves. We found an unbelievable rate that made this trip steal we couldn't pass up. Given the hotel rate, we were not disappointed when we learned that even the Club Level rooms were not up to par with the other InterContinentals we have stayed at in the US. The hotel is obviously a renovation from a lesser brand that occupied the building before. The rooms were decently sized, however, the bathrooms were not up to the typical InterContinental standards. Our room overlooked the mainland and literally looked over the San Juan airport landing runway. We expected this, so it was not a shock and we made the best of it. However, I would expect someone to be shocked if they didn't realize exactly how close the airport was before they arrived. The pool area was spectacular. It was a gorgeous oasis that I didn't want to leave. The beach was wonderful as well. It was ideal for laying out and relaxing or taking a long walk. We booked 60 minute massages at the spa. The spa was mediocre and rather over priced for the quality of service received. If you want to go to Old San Juan, it is a $30+ cab ride but worth it. Old San Juan is not something you want to miss. The casino is small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Theft and Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: DissapointedTx
Reviews.Content: Room service stole my blackberry from our locked hotel room-The Americas Guest Services department said that since it wasn't in a safe they weren't responsible for their employee taking it. Really? Are they somehow exempt from laws against theft? Three people at the hotel including a supervisor of security and member of management all said they would call back after reviewing the situation-that was two weeks ago-----nothing has happenned. Also-they don't mention that you'll be charged something like $15 a day for services including towels and internet. As for the internet-we never had a connection. We complained about that the 1st day and as apparently is their standard practice they said they'd have someone called to fix it but never did. The cable also never had a clear picture the entire time we were there. Of course, we requested someone check on that and again were told it would be resolved but it never was. BTW, the casino is exceptionally small.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental San Juan With Girlfriends”
Reviews.Author: Caressa
Reviews.Content: The grounds are fabulous. The rooms were ok -aging and in need of a little updating. the hairs found on the towels were a daily concer-Yuk! If you book here, be sure to ask for everything that you are supposed to get with your package. We paid extra to join the Ambassador program in order to upgrade to an oceanview. I am still waitning on my paperwork. The promised fruit basket was a plate of overripe fruit with one bottle of water. They volunteer nothing, some of the things we were promised never materialized or were cheaply done. They refused the free breakfast that was suopoosed to be included, and they ran out of the coupon booklet. I noticed other guests had the same issues. You would think that it woulod be worth it to give guests what they have been promised?? The bartenders were great. Not a lot of nightlife especially after Sunday night. Bring bug repellant if you plan to be on the beach at night or in the early morning. The staff was nice. The casino was fun and we actuaally won a few dollars. Overall we enjoyed the trip. Wefound the ESJ next door to be not near as pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, the location was a bit commercial...”
Reviews.Author: adibened
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and though the prices for the restaurants are pricey, it is in line with having an overnight stay at any top quality hotel. You'll pay $14 for a hamburger, but you'll pay $14 for a burger at Applebees. The pool was immaculate, never a shortage of chairs, we were 10 people. Prices are $10 for an alcoholic drink, again in line with any hotel, bar, restaurant. We chose to go to the Pueblo supermarket about a 10 minute walk. We bought beer, water, bread, coldcut, peanut butter, chips, soda, apples, grapes, etc... and brought down a cooler every day to the pool. This did help the stick shock of the pricey food. My family is 4; 2 adults and 2 teens. We went with 6 other friends and one other child. The room was clean, bed was perfect, they have updated sheets and the minute you walk into the hotel, it smells clean. The staff at the hotel were incredibly helpful and incredibly polite. There was never a shortage of top quality service. The service, however, as in most of Caribean could be slow. We did go to MiCasita for breakfast almost every day, affordable, decent food, but really slow service. We took a cab into Old San Juan, I recommend eating at Tio Danny's on restaurant row - the best Mofongo in PR. We tried 3 other restaurants and nothing compared. The pool is open 24/7 - so a room on the 3-6th floors facing the pool/beach (one in the same) would be annoying. We choose the $150 upgrade and got on the 15th floor and had an incredible beach view and heard nothing from the pool. They have an incredible gym that faces the ocean. The beach was beautiful, very, very clean - no sea weed or rocks. The only dissappointment we had was the waves were not existent. We like some waves in which to body surf. Put it to you this way, my friend who is a non swimmer went in the ocean to his chest because the water was so calm. We choose the catamaran excursion from the hotel, $89 per person, and it was really a lot of fun and a worthwhile expense. We were there for 6 night - and that was just about right. Down Side: There is no night life at the hotel at all, the street is under construction so it is difficult to walk and there is not much to walk to. We had kids with us so we couldn't bring them into a night club or the casino. We had been to other hotels where there were night time comedy shows, or even hyponists or dancing or something, there really was nothing to do. Though PR is beautiful, I would say this was not a very caribbean feeling vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanD
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The room was very comfortable and clean, and the bed surprisingly good. We got a 12th floor with ocean view, which was fine. The pool with it's waterfalls was very nice and we had no problem getting a lounge chair or two. The beach bar is pricey as to be expected, but the service was good and food also was very good here. We loved the beach! It was very clean, the water clear and the sandy bottom was almost totally smooth. Not much to see if you snorkel here, but we took a snorkel day trip that made up for it. We discovered a very fine little restaurant nearby " La Piu Bello" a diner style place with good food, a nice menu and terrific gelato for desert. They also have a full bar. Other nearby spots are mostly fast food, but Mi Casita across from the hotel has good local fare. Also a few mexican restaurants are also nearby, and a Pueblo Supermarket is a few blocks away with super deals on spirits.

Reviews.Title: “Everything went very smoothly”
Reviews.Author: captainron6122
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did a last minute trip through Cheap Carribean. Everything went very smoothly and was better than some of the reviews reported. Arriving at 8:00 a.m., we checked in quickly and were given a 14th floor room. We did notice that starting around 3:00 pm, there was always a line to check in. The hotel is very nice but not lavish. Check out was a bit longer as people in front of us were having problems. The room was adequate, comfortable bed, had the amenities reported, old tv. Nice view of the mountains when ignoring the mess down on the street. The staff are extremely friendly, professional and helpful. In fact everyone we met in Puerto Rico was like this. Taking the local buses is easy and cheap. Gentlemen stand to give seats to women. Be patient waiting for the bus, enjoy talking with locals, learn about real life in PR. We really enjoyed the catarraman snorkeling trip and rain forest trip. We even rented a car for a day and drove thru the mountains to the south coast. Dining is on the expensive side in the hotel. Had one very enjoyable and reasonably priced dinner at the beachside restaurant, pizza and salad. Most of our dining out was at local places. Food and liquor shopped at Pueblo which is a 5 minute walk. Rented a Hobie sailboat next door. Many reviews reccomended Mi Casita for dining. It was our least favorable place. Enjoyed the Plaza de Mercado, a local fruit market and restaurant area. Had a great batida, a blended fruit drink. The pool is wonderful. Overall this was a great trip. I would have liked the hotel to have more adult activities, more water activities such as small boats, sailboats. The area outside the hotel is tacky and we spent every day away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit!!”
Reviews.Author: Luvjones673
Reviews.Content: We just loved San Juan. The island was beautiful and the people were extremely friendly!! I would definitely go back!! And the hotel InterContinential Resort and Casino was above what we imagined. The room was fantastic, all new furniture, nice size room and the bed was beyond comfortable, I could of layed in it all day (but I was on Vacation!!). And the staff was extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend this resort to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location older hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitneygirl
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and loved the location. The beach and pool were awesome and I went to the spa and had the best massage ever! the spa area was beautiful. We ate at the Italian restaurant in the hotel - it was good but overpriced. The casino was small but met our needs. The hotel and spa staff were wonderful but the hotel rooms were a little old but the view was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Finally able to Relax”
Reviews.Author: MeetingEventPlanner
Reviews.Content: I'm a corporate meeting/event planner by trade for a professional organization that happens to be my client. I only deal in four star hotels, so it's safe to say, I know what I'm looking for. Since I was spending my dime on this trip and not the company's money, I did extensive research to make sure I was getting a good deal, and the hotel would meet my expectations. I went through Bookingwiz.com, and selected a deal through Hotwire, for about $500 each (two people). The duration of the stay was from June 15 - 19. The hotel is extremely close to the airport, less than five minutes, and a $12 cab ride. The closeness to the airport concerned me since I read some reviews that said they heard planes constantly. I heard nothing in the room. Occassionally, on the beach I head the "roar" of the planes' engines as they were landing/taking from the airport.. This is nothing to concern yourself with. You'll know that you're in for a wonderful stay as your cab comes up the beautiful tropical driveway. The bellstaff are exceptional. I have read about the long lines for check-in; however, I believe since we arrived on Monday, we missed the crowd. We were offered the $150 upgrade for a beachfront room, I took it because I knew that under normal circumstances it is $80 per day. You will also have to pay a resort fee. It's based on a percentage of your room fee. Our's was approximately $14 a day. For any decent, big upscale resort, this is typical, so don't have a cow. Our reserved room was ready, but due to the upgrade, we had to wait until approximately 3P to get our room. They did call my cell phone while we hung out a the pool bar (food and drinks were wonderful while waiting) to let me know the room was ready. I did have to ask to move to another beachfront room because I did not feel that my money should have gone to a room that had a rusty refrige, due to humidity, a non flat screen TV (as promised) and orverlooked the faded out paint job on the casino's roof. The second room was just fine. The pool area is amazing, the beach area clean (no seaweed), chairs are free (umbrella a charge of $10). We never needed one because we had slight cloud coverage daily, this kept some of the heat away. I will say, save your time running around buying stuff (lotion sunscreen, etc), and stuffing your suitcase before you leave home because there is a Walgreen's to the left and right of the hotel (within walking distance). You can pick up all of your supplies there. If purse strings are a little tight on cash, there are plenty of non-hotel eateries around (Chili's, Burger King, Pizza Hut, etc, etc) I'm not a huge fan of experimeting with food, but there are also plenty of other local eateries in Old San Juan. Old San Juan is a wonderful area to walk and take in the beautiful colors of the city. Be mindful though, it is $20 each way, to get to/from Old San Juan, via cab. As far as adventures, we did a snorkeling adventure. I'm an Atlanta city girl so I've never done anything like that before. OMG, what an experience!!! I went with the Spread Eagel tour. As far as I'm concerened, a good choice. Approximately $103 (incls. pick-up from hotel, excurision, food, gear, underwater camera). Didn't do a lot of touring, but others we spoke with said that the rainforest was great, and touring around to other cities was nice. You should note, if renting a car, the locals drive like New Yorkers. To conclude, special thanks to Ray, an individual that works as bellstaff -- great person, great assistance. This was a wonderful trip/stay, trying see how fast I can get back here. FYI...someone in a previous review complained about the distressing view of the city, I agree, not a pretty site, but are you really there to take in the city...once cradled in the comfort of the hotel, or out touring, no need to worrying about that.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ViolentJems
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning and for $150 upgraded ourselves to ambassador status which upgraded us for 4 nights to ocean view, gave us a free night at any intercontinental in the future, a free movie rental, and fruit basket. Definitely worth it. The rooms were nice and the bed sooo comfy. The view was great, the staff friendly, and the food at the restaurant was good. Kind of expensive as any hotel restaurant would be, but it was fine. The casino was smaller, but it had blackjack, roulette, poker, and craps. Everything you need. The pool is open 24 hours which is nice too. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. Oh an the avis on site was really convenient. Only one person working and bringing the car, so maybe plan ahead if youre tight on time!

Reviews.Title: “One Word "Amazing"”
Reviews.Author: claytonnc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the InterContinental from North Carolina around 3:00, June 7th, Rosie assisted us with check-in and we were in our room at 3:40. Fantastic service from Ray greeting us until June 13th the day we left. We did upgrade our room for $150 and it was nothing but perfect. Our room was 818 great views, very quite, fruit and water the first night, 2nd night some kind of chocolate cup cakes with cherries (holla somebody, these were so good), another night a free movie ~ wonderful. We rented a car for one day and drove to the El Yunque - beautiful, then to Luquillo Beach area to visit the kioskos. We eat at El Jefe - omg, this food is to die for, the burger with the puerto rican cheese yummy!!! Great service there also. This was just an amazing trip. Several little places to eat right across the street, however, only one bad review for this trip. We eat at Mi Casita (we read so many good things about this place and the food) the first night it was a little crowded the food was cold and the cornish hen was so dry you could not eat it, service was poor, we gave this place a second chance for breakfast- not many customers this time, but again the service was horrible, they served our coffee and the food arrived 25 minutes later no refills on the coffee, not one time asked if everything was ok, same way the night we eat there also. The staff just stood there and stared at us the entire time, a very uncomfortable feeling ~ needless to say we did not go back and will not in the future. We did a day of sailing and snorkling with East Winds these folks are awesome, we had a great time. Overall one oth the best vacations I've ever taken and would stay at the InterContinental Hotel again - the neighborhood surrounding the hotel however, does need a little cleaning up. PS...anyone staying in room 818 look in the desk drawer in the back there you will find a Puerto Rico coupon book and coupons for East Wind, with the coupon book there are several buy one get one free meals that saved us a ton of money, there was no way we could use them all and a 10% total bill for East Wind...enjoy and pass on to the next guest please. Have a wonderful time, it's beautiful! Booked entire trip through hotwire and paid with the $150 upgrade $81.00 per night, booked 6 months in advance.....about $70 added to credit card for resort fee, hotwire explains this when you book the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise waiting”
Reviews.Author: Nikke44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! We done tons of research before leaving and nothing could have prepared us for our stay! From the ease of the check in, the assistance from the concierge, the daily activities to the attitude of the entire staff - nothing can compare! Our trip was made 500% better by staying at this hotel. Every member of this staff went out of their way to be of assistance and provided all sorts of information and amenities. The daily activities included with the rate ranged from mini massages, family movies daily, drink mix classes to coconut bowling. Some previous reviews complained about the prices but I strongly believe you get what you pay for. Even though this hotel provides in house tour scheduling they have no problem giving you details information on how to do things on your own to avoid the additional expense and the bartenders make the best Pina Colada's in the world! They even gave us some of their specialty drink recipes. If you are looking to go to Puerto Rico this is the place to stay!!!! Plus there are all types of restuarants directly across the street. Make sure you try Momoyama (the Japanese Steakhouse) in the hotel and sit cook top side for a fabulous experience. And for breakfast head right across the street to Mi Casita!

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit”
Reviews.Author: macleodProvidence
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in May following our son's wedding. We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for three days for the wedding before this. I loved the Ritz. So, here we go. The hotel is very clean and pretty. It's a more informal feel than the Ritz but lovely! The beach was great, a little more public than the Ritz which can have it's down side. Sorry. The thing that bothered me about this hotel was the lack of bottled water. You had to purchase it. At the Ritz, it was included in your hotel stay and we had to go to the grocery store to buy some here. We upgraded, for a fee, to an oceanfront room, and it was worth the price. We originally got the room, reasonably from Hotwire, but wanted to be oceanfront. The restaurant was great, but deserted. I think the price was very high and a turn-off to other people maybe. The little restaurant across the street was reasonable and delicious. We loved the pool here; there was lots of room and never felt crowded. Overall, I preferred the Ritz Carlton, but my husband really loved this resort as well. You can't go wrong with either resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location and luxury”
Reviews.Author: philgaunt
Reviews.Content: We got in on Priceline for half the price of the other beach hotels. Staff was great on check in. All the rooms have balconies. The pool and beach are great. Not the best selection of surrounding food places. Really close to airport with a nearby grocery to get ready for your cruise. Hate the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, with great service and better than expected food”
Reviews.Author: momesso03
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Intercontinental San Juan was better than expected in several ways and a little disappointing in a few other areas. Better than expected: The pool and beach are great. Neither was too crowded that you could not relax and both were kept very clean with great service. On the beach the lounge chairs are free for guests (expected a fee), at the pool the chairs are comfortable and updated. The food and drinks at the pool were also above average. We were able to swim up to the bar and order our drinks and food - which were always prepared well. The bed was incredibly comfortable. After all of the on-the-go activities of the day, it was nice to have an extremely comfortable bed to come "home" to. Also, the rooms were very quiet. An occasional sound from the hallway were the only sounds that we heard over the 4 days. The toiletries were also good quality - no need to bring all of your own soaps, shampoos, lotions... The concierge and trip planner were very helpful with recommendations of local restaurants as well as exciting excursions. The Alfredo restaurant was very nice, while very empty. Both the food and wine menu were better than expected for the hotel property restaurant. The location - based upon ease to get elsewhere in the city easily was good. A quck 3 minute taxi got us to/from the airport. It was about $20 to get to Old San Juan and we were near the highway for our tours. Could have been better: Our room overlooked the roof of the casino - though it was labeled pool-view. You could see the pool, true, but it was beyond the roof view just outside our balcony. Compared to the luxury of the bed linens, the towels were older and scratchy. There was not too much going on at the hotel. Jazz played nightly at the lounge bar, but other than that, no real "life" to speak of at the Intercontinental. The area of town is not the best looking area. Though it seemed safe enough, it was a little dirty and run down. However, this did not mean that we could not find dining gems within walking distance. Overall, it was a good place to retire to each night and a good place to relax by the water. When we wandered over to the El San Juan next door, we found the "nightlife" we were looking for; happening casino, many lounge bars with many younger patrons, salsa music and Brother Jimmy's BBQ on the roof with an amazing view of the area. Our concierge suggested Barrachina for authentic Puerto RIcan food. Though it was virtually empty on a Thursday night, the food was amazing! We also found a small local restaurant across the street, Mi Casita, which also had great food at low prices. Avoid the hotel breakfast buffet and head across the street! We took the LA Marquesa Canopy tour - well worth the time and money. The guides were friendly and made us first-timers feel safe while swinging through the trees. We also took the short El Yunque tour. This one was good for those just wanted to check "rainforest" off their list. If you want to really explore it on your own, there is probably a better tour or get a rental car and go out on your own. The guides were knowledgeable and friendly, but that did not make up for the slow pace of the tour. We saw little wildlife or vegetation compared to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “our fourth stay at the intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: jrf_8
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned for our fourth stay at the Intercontinental. A few things have changed since my husband and I last visited in February of 2008. The hotel has started playing music by the pool. When I first got there I was very annoyed by this since I hate hearing blaring music when I want to read and relax. Everyone has ipods that they can listen to if they so choose. I must admitt by the end of our stay I did not really mind it. They did not play a lot of obnoxious music real loud - you could tune it out for the most part. However, I still wish they would keep it a serine, classy atmosphere. The other change that was not for the better was that they now charge $150.00 per day to rent a cabana. The problem with this is they do not have enough umbrellas so there is not a lot of shade for fair skinned people and people with young children. These two issues were the only negatives that I can say. The rooms were decorated very nice (ocean view) and well maintained. I recognized a lot of the staff from previous visits which speaks well for the company itself. The grounds are keep very well and the staff is very professional and friendly. Overall we had a great trip and we look forward to our fifth stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: crobichaux7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5-night stay at the Intercontinental in San juan, PR. We have stayed at an all-inclusive resort (sandals, dreams) for all of our prior caribbean/mexico vacations, so we were not knowing exactly what to expect. We are extremely pleased with both the service, staff, and cleanliness of the resort. The grounds were beautifully landscaped and the staff couldn't have been any more helpful. The only negative thing i can say about this resort is the price of the restaurants on the grounds. we paid 50 bucks for my husband and i for breakfast which was definately not worth the money - i would suggest going across the street to mi casita restaurant for a good breakfast that cost 15 bucks for my husband and I both! the casino in the restaurant was pretty cool - better than we expected. overall, we were very pleased with our experience!

Reviews.Title: “It was cool”
Reviews.Author: Tifplace
Reviews.Content: Myself and three other girls stayed at the Intercontinental May 13 - 16th. I got it for a really good price via hotwire. Overall the hotel was nice. The pool area was very pretty. The beach was the beach. The rooms were clean but there was a lot of moisture in our room. We would leave the ac on when we left and when we returned our room was still hot and muggy. They have a ton of security so you always feel safe. The staff was attentive and all of our request were meet in a timely fashion. My biggest gripe was the location. There are things to do in Isla Verde. There are restaurants and clubs. Unfortunately, we spent most of our time in Old San Juan. They have a bus that can take you to Old San Juan for .75 but it will take about 35 to 40 minutes. A cab was like 20 minutes but it was 20 dollars. I wish I would have realized prior to booking that we were going to spend most of our time there. I would probably have stayed in Condado. For the price I received on hotwire, the Intercontinental was well worth it. It is a good place for a family or friends vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. Fantastic, clean, updated rooms, the gym was outstanding, and the beach very clean (the water has quite a bit of seaweed in the morning). There are restaurants and bars close by and the airport is only a $12 ride. I don't really have any complaints about this place...I was expecting to be the same old canned Intercontinental rooms, lobby etc. The only thing I would say is that this hotel is a long ways from Old San Juan so you'd have to take a cab (maybe $15-$20). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovesthebeach48
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the IC and had a great time overall. The first day was rough though. After traveling all day we were stessed and just wanted to get on the beach and relax, but our room wasn't ready when we checked in. The staff member who checked us in pulled us up on the computer and said I'll be right back. After quite a long time she came back and acted like nothing was wrong. She put a hold on our credit card for $100.00 per day for incidentals. I questioned her about this and she just put a hold for $400 instead of the $700. I was told it was for incidentals. I didn't like it but there wasn't anything I could do. When our room was finally ready we were very happy until we got in it. They gave us a standard room when we had upgraded to a pool/garden room. I called down to the desk and the woman blamed the mix up on Cheap caribbean.com whom we booked through. They comped us breakfast which was definately not worth the $46 plus tip. I called CC.com and they in turn blamed the mix up on the hotel. We did get into the right room the next day and the view was fabulous! I would definately recommend the pool/garden view room. I was very angry because I felt the hotel knew they didn't have the room we payed for but didn't say anything to us at the time. I feel they should have upgraded us not downgraded! After this first day I found the hotel to be very clean and very friendly. The casino was small but very nice. We actually won enough money to pay for all our meals for the whole week! The beach was beautiful and clean. The water was warm and a little rough, but that didn't stop anyone from enjoying themselves. There was always someone at the beach to help with the chairs and they were always very friendly. The pool was beautiful with a waterfall and small bridge. The restaurants in the hotel were expensive, but there are plenty of other places around the hotel to eat so this wasn't a problem. Because of our winnings in the casino we only ended up spending an average of $77 per day which included our meals, gambling and shopping! All in all we had a great vacation! I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: muleqt99
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a 4 night stay at the Intercontinental. It was a great hotel- friendly staff, clean room, nice casino, BEAUTIFUL pool area and beach (we never had any problem getting seats at either). We upgraded to an ocean view room and it was so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vgomez1215
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went with another couple for a week the week of April 17th. Overall, the hotel was great. There was always friendly staff available to give us towels and set up beach chairs. We always found lounge chairs in great spots as well. The only part of the trip I would have liked to change would be the front desk. The person who checked us in was so slow. He also gave us room keys that did not work. We had to get new sets of keys three times. Finally, I asked to be escorted to the room- it turns out that one must not keep the room key anywhere near a cellphone. I've never had that issue before-and if indeed that is the case, front desk staff must let the guests know. If you are looking for extracurricular activities, I would HIGHLY recommend ziplining, well worth the $125. Just ask the concierge (they were helpful despite some reviews on here). We originally wanted to go cave diving but they were closed until mid-May. If you are planning on going to the bacardi factory, el yunque, or culebra island, your best bet would be to rent a car. It is free to go into the bacardi factory (which is blah, nothing too exciting), and el yunque but the hotel charges ridiculus fees, upwards of $50/person for day trips. We had a car and did the yunque, factory, luquillo beach, and old san juan. Besides it also gives you a little freedom to come and go as you please. There are car rentals right in the area. You will get a better rate if you wait to book once you get there rather than making the reservation ahead of time. However, whatever you do, do not go to Enterprise at ESJ- we waited about 2 hours for the rep. to show up, he kept calling and telling us he will be right there yet we were waiting forever. I would definitely stay at the intercontinental again sans the other couple (not the hotel's fault). I am having withdrawals from the hotels linens and bedding- so comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for R&R...Nice Beach....Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: DF0403
Reviews.Content: This was a surprisingly nice hotel as "city" resorts go. Don't waste money booking transportation in advance. I spent $118.00 for 2 of us with Orbitz for the round trip transfer to and from the airport. It's only a mile and a half and a cab costs $11.00 each way.
