If you plan on arriving early, keep your beach/pool wear handy. Check in is at 4:00 and they pretty much hold to it. I reserved the "laguna view" room which is in the front of the hotel facing a parking lot, the city and in the distance mountains and a lagoon. Floors 7 and up qualify as laguna view. It is noisy in the front. You will hear traffic and planes all day. The balconies are small and no room for chairs. The room was clean although candy wrappers were found. The furnishings were on the old side but the bed was great. There is a separate vanity area for the ladies with a magnifying mirror, vanity bench and plenty of light. There's a safe, old TV, IPOD station and free wireless internet throughout. The restaurants are expensive as well as the drinks. There are good local restaurants all within walking distance. Try Mi Casita direclty across the street. There are also fast food places close by. The pool area is nice with 2 bar/restaurants. The chairs are taken early by way of "towel" reservations so go early and pick your spot. The beach is clean, the water perfect. Security all around so you will feel safe anywhere in the area. Overall, a really nice place for rest and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: vbw
Reviews.Content: Great beach, great salads at the beach cafe, definitely reserve an ocean-view room airport is close by and you hear plans all day (but it's not too bad), the play music all day long at the pool which is annoying, we rearranged the furniture in our room so that the sofa was facing the window so we could enjoy the view, bathroom was a bit tired but it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “so much better than I expected, and I expected a lot!”
Reviews.Author: weedie324
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on a flight/hotel combo with Orbitz to stay at the Intercontinental. I expected 4-star treatment, but was a little worried after reading some comments by others about the hotel staff. Perhaps because we arrived at 9pm and didn't have to compete with others trying to register, we started off on the right foot with a wonderful check-in experience, that pretty much signaled what we got for the duration of our week there. The hotel was not booked to capacity, so maybe that helped, but we had nothing but the best kind of customer service from all the staff there, from the doormen, who had great suggestions for outings and restaurants, to the people who hand out the towels by the pool. Everyone speaks English really well, and their can-do attitudes and warmth really made us feel at home instantly. The room was nothing fancy but extremely clean and up to date with furnishings/decor. Everything worked fine (hair dryer, TV, alarm clock) and our daily cleanup was done to perfection. We especially liked our view -- 11th floor oceanview and our little balcony. The comments I'd read about the seaweed on the beach turned out to be not true. A little dried up seaweed accumulates along the tide line every day but the hotel has a vehicle that sweeps it out every day. The beach is beautiful and clean and so close to the pool, and the watertemp was perfect. Likewise, the pool is wonderful, clean and not too crowded, and open 24 hours. Going down to the pool, and using the outdoor Jacuzzi, each night, became a favorite activity. The fitness area is small but well-equipped, and there was no competition for the equipment. Never used the casino, but enjoyed watching Celtics playoff games in the bar nearby. We took the advice of many to avoid eating at the hotel and saved a LOT of money. We had either a breakfast or a lunch at our favorite place: Mi Casita, just across the street from the hotel. FAST and courteous service, delicious Puerto Rican style meals at very reasonable cost. You MUST try the local specialty, Mofongos (an odd but delicious concoction of beef or chicken tucked inside a pulverized plaintain mound, with a great sauce) , and the shrimp Asapao (soup) there. We walked the 10 minutes to the local Pueblo supermarket to stock up on yogurts, orange juice, and fruit, which we stored in our room fridge. Great supermarket -- clean and well-stocked. We saved a lot of money this way and it kept us from overeating! We used taxis several times to get around and then rented a car from Avis (agent at the hotel lobby) for two days, which was perfect. We used it to get to El Yunque rainforest and a beautiful almost deserted beach at Luquillo, as well as to the Plaza Los Americas (a huge shopping mall, like every other U.S. mall) -- we were traveling with a teenage daughter, and that was a small concession to make. The car also allowed us to get to some restaurants away from the tourist centers. We especially liked driving to the "strip" of eateries in Carolina, along the beach, (just 10 minutes from the hotel) to taste the local food: try lunch or dinner at Soleil. Dinner at Atlantica was very nice (fresh fish), and Lupi's, a block from the hotel, is easy, fast, cheap Mexican in a sports bar environment. The weather was beautiful until the day we had to leave -- how perfect is that? We left in a rain shower. Overall, there was absolutely nothing to mar our 6-day experience in San Juan, and we returned home rested, relaxed and feeling good about Puerto Rico overall and our Intercontinental hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a long weekend at the Intercontinental. We had a nice room and a pleasant stay. Look for travel packages that include breakfast -- you can save a lot that way. The intercontinental is a 3.5 to 4 Star hotel on a nice beach. It is much quieter than the neighboring San Juan Resort which seemed much more lively (but we were looking for a quieter get-a-way). The casino is small -- but has poker, which was a must for me (however the rake is high). San Juan is about a half hour by cab, but worth the drive for some very good restaurants. The concierge is excellent and will help you with restaurant selections. The spa is good -- I had a very good (but expensive) massage. We had an amazing meal in the PR Museum of Art (very expensive and quiet, but enjoyable).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: jryanlawyer
Reviews.Content: Ok, so how do I begin? I guess I should start by saying that we had a good stay at the Intercontinental overall. The reason why I gave it a 3 is because the services and accommodations did not quite rise to what we thought were solid four star accommodations. Actually, 3.5 stars is probably the best way to describe the IC in our opinion. 1) Accommodations/Amenities- Like many of the other posts have already stated the front desk has serious issues. The long lines upon check-in were the direct result of poor management. There were enough representatives at the check-in lines to have minimal wait at the front desk. Instead, the weight was 30+ minutes and the lines had only a few people in them. We decided to pay the extra $150 for an upgrade to an Ocean view room; I love to the look at the ocean when I wake up in the morning. When we got to the room (8th floor), it was horrible. Hardly an ocean view (could barely see the ocean); it was more of a rooftop view. 2) Restaurants- We love to dine and do not mind paying if the food is good, but the prices at the IC was over-priced with no justification. For example, while we were waiting for our room we had lunch at the beachfront cafÃ©. We spent $40 dollars for 2 sandwiches and 2 cokes (no drinks). The food was mediocre at best. To their credit, however, the Splash bar (near the pool) had much better food and at better prices. There were so many restaurants in the area that it makes no sense to eat on the resort. The concierge gave us excellent dining recommendations and we enjoyed dining around the town and in Old San Juan. 3) Beach/Pool- Both the beach and the pool were pretty nice. The pool was nice, but small, and the beach was wide, but not as blue and pristine as other Caribbean destination. But all-in all we enjoyed them both. 4) Casino- we are not really gamblers, but it was cool to have a casino on premises. We also went next door to El San Juan where their lobby was awesome, including a live salsa band. They also had a casino on premises. I recommend taking a visit. 5) Overall- Despite a few mishaps, we did enjoy our trip. Most vacations are what you make them. We enjoyed

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool and beach”
Reviews.Author: WineLoverNJ
Reviews.Content: 1. It's not a 4 star hotel by East Coast standards. Maybe 3 1/2. The rooms are clean, but small and the furniture needs to be replaced. The bed is comfortable and they have very clean sheets. Bathroom is small, but ok. Also needs a facelift. 2. Only the better rooms have a flat screen TV, all others have the old style TV sets. 3. Get the ocean view room, it is worth it. The views are spectacular. All rooms have balconies. 4. this hotel has one of the nicest pool and beach in the area! the sand is soft and no shells! We had no problems getting beach chairs and towels. they are provided by the hotel. You pay $10/day for umbrellas if you need one. 5. the restaurants are good, try them all. Do not eat there if you can't afford it. It will cost you $100-$200 for a couple. For those with a tight budget, there is an Outback and a Chili's in a walking distance and a bunch of fast food places right across the street. For breakfast go to Mi Casita, $5-$8/person with coffee and OJ! 6. This hotel is very kid friendly, so if you don't like that, stay at ESJ next door. It's really not that bad though... 7. Overall, the hotel is nice and in a great location. Go for it. Remember, this is a resort and the prices are the way they are, but if you are on vacation, stop complaining about everything and relax and enjoy. The service is awesome everywhere and everybody is nice. If you go to Old San Juan, try AquaViva - absolutely amazing food; better than Dragonfly!

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental San Juan is a low-end Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: kislev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely inelegant with low ceilings throughout and terrible rooms. The only thing worse is the help which is either non existent and rude. Stay at the Ritz or ESJ or stay cheaper with a Holiday Inn (cleaner and newer). Do not be fooled by the branding of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Much less than what I'd expect of a AAA 4 diamond.”
Reviews.Author: islandhopping75
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in my stay at the Intercontinental Hotel in San Juan on April 13, 2009. It was not what I expected of a AAA Four Star hotel. I paid $219 not including the $30 resort fee and taxes. The night before I paid $249 at the Ritz and it was a far better experience. At the Intercontinental, I was unpleasantly surprised by the following: 1. No Welcome Book: When I got to my very small room, there was no information about the hotel. I called the front desk and asked. They said it was under revision and asked, "why-what do you want to know?" 2. Clock broken: the alarm clock was set on the wrong time; parts were missing and I couldn't fix it. 3. Toilet flushed spontaneously all night. 4. Garbage on beach: Up for walk in morning at 8am: beach in front of hotel was lined with garbage in the sand. 5. No info given to me by clerk at check in; had to wander around to find gift shop, fitness center, etc. 7. Small, dark, smelly, noisy room; lamps weren't plugged in; after I plugged all in and turned on they were dim. Noise from traffic on street and from people late at night near elevator. The room had a stale odor like mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you want a city beach”
Reviews.Author: janer188
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights after 4 nights at the Rio Mar Beach Resort. We preferred the more tucked away location of the first, but this is still nice. Busier hotel with lots of people. Beach had a smell from the seaweed, and people grab the beach lounge chairs early in the am. so seating around the pool was limited. Workout room has a great view of the ocean. We were fairly and aptly warned about all the extra charges and expensive food costs and we avoided were could. Join the awards club for free and the upgrade your room upon check-in. Personally, I think there are prettier parts to the island. If you have a car and can stay further east, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Masscouple
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here, after staying one night at La Concha in Condado beach. Out of the two, La Concha was a prettier hotel. but the IC had much more action and was on a nicer beach in a better area. We arrived at 12 and disappointed at the very long line to check in. When we did, I asked if we could be upgraded (meanign for free as there were empty rooms) and was politely told it would cost me. I passed. We had to wait for a call on our cell for an empty room. Big upset. We checked our luggage and walked around. The El San Juan hotel is next door, followed by the ESJ towers and then some eateries. We ended up at Lupis, like I bet a lot of tourists do, and it was terrible (see my review). What a tourist trap. We headed back to the hotel around 2:30 to find our room was ready (no call). It was on the top floor - 1629 - and facing the street. But it was a great view and I am glad I didn't pay for an upgrade. The room has a lot of earth tones in it - and it very comfy (big sofas, chairs, fluffy bedding, lots of pillows). The tv is a CRT and the the cable would get staticky when the the TV was angled toward the bed. There was no HBO, even though it was on the channel list. The balcony lock was broken, but there was a security bar (and no way for anyone to get up that high anyways). The bathroom was nice and had a tub. We were very disappointed to find out Ruth's Chris is closed. They are renovating it. Which reminds me, the femal concierge with short brown hair is awful. She gave out lousy advice, if any. I witnessed her tell people that there was nowhere to shop nearby, there were no shows in Old San Juan (We walked by one), etc. We ate at every other eatery here though, Momoyama is Japanese and just okay. Very overpriced. Alfredo's is excellent and romantic. The splash bar had good wings for around $9 but there drinks were $10. I ordered a Miami Vice and got one sip of alcohol. Be warned. The mediterranean cafe (beachside grill) had an awesome quesadilla. The pool is awesome here. It is big and windy and has a bridge, a whirpool, rock waterfalls, etc. There are chairs all around, but we often had to work to find 2 together. Lots of people leave there towels on them and disappear. If i just saw a towel, I got rid of it. Sorry! Had to do it. This is a very kid friendly hotel (we left ours at home and were enjoying our first trip alone). Unfortunately, people were allowed to throw balls in the pool, which took up way too much space. Kids were given water guns too. The worst - my biggest complaint to the managers: ENFORCE THE NO KIDS IN THE HOTTUB RULE. It was posted that no kids under 12 were allowed yet it was kid heaven. Kids everywhere, and I mean from 7-12 years. Some with parents and many without. It was not relaxing at all!! You also had to wear a wristband at the pool, which was a joke as you were only given one at the towel hut and could easily walk right by it. Most people came from the beach into the pool area without them too. There were chairs on the beach, but they begin taking those away before 6:30. We were kicked out of our chairs very rudely at 6:20 when we were watching the sunset. It made me mad that they came to us first when there were plenty of empty chairs. You are not allowed on the beach by the hotel after 7. Not fair. The beach of Isla Verde is very nice. Soft whitish sand. No seashells whatsoever though (unfortunately) and way too much seaweed. The hotel should rake this up and help remove it from the water. To get to the water you had to wade past A LOT of seaweed. Then you were in clear water. But you had to come back through the seaweed again. For the huge resort fee were spending (14%), they should help with this. You can walk the beach far in both directions. But you cannot walk it to the Ritz,which was not clear based on the map on tripadvisor. You would have to leave to the street, walk down some way, then enter through the ritz. There are jetskis and kayaks for rental down the beach. You can get a surf lesson but there was no surf! The casino is small. The hotel smells great because of a scented oil they put out. The doormen are excellent and friendly. The grounds are gorgeous. We really enjoyed our stay and now want to come back with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal through hotwire! Terrible check in”
Reviews.Author: northriverqueen
Reviews.Content: I loved the value we recieved through hotwire. The hotel is beautiful,and has everything you need right there.Meal prices and drinks are expensive here though. The pools are beautiful,and also the beach is warm with clean sand and alot of chairs. The rooms are very nice too, we has connecting rooms. One with a king and a sofa the other with 2 queens. It worked perfect for our family of 5. Check in was terrible slow. Only 2 check in lines. Each line had about 30 people in them so it took more than an hour to get checked in. We were not able to get our connecting room right away either. We had to wait until 8pm for that room. We did get our first room at 3pm,but were told that our connecting room had a late check out,and they do not guaranty connecting rooms,even though we had it booked for 2 months. It was very inconvient for 5 people to shower for dinner while we waited for the 2nd room to open up. After we did finally get into our 2 rooms, everything went well. They were quick to bring extra towels and coffee too. Our waiters at the beach bar/restraunt were exellant! I think it is a wonderful hotel,but they need to work on the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: WillPwr
Reviews.Content: My friend, Cordelia and I jet-setted to the island for my 28th Birthday. Friends recommended this hotel and I was very pleased. The front desk staff, clean rooms, wonderful pool area to location were A+. I was warned that there would be an odor in the rooms so I traveled with "plug-ins" which were not even needed. The conceierge were very well iformed. One young lady who was expecting a child (name escapes me) was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste money on a club room...”
Reviews.Author: RadWife73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Intercontinental San Juan in a club room that we paid a good bit extra for. Perhaps "my bad" for not inquiring what exactly that entailed, but in our minds, we equated club level with club levels we have experienced at other chains: continental breakfast, evening hor d'oeuves, etc. None of that here. Nothing but some coffee and hot water for tea that seemed to be put out after 8 a.m. and seemingly never refreshed. Apparently they discontinued the services we were expecting on January 1st. The room itself was nice (tv could use some upgrading, and the ventilation is awful, so be forewarned, if your neighbor smokes in this nonsmoking hotel, you are going to feel like you are smoking too), the hotel was nice, service was excellent. The halls in the club level did smell mildewy and moldy, but it's on a beach, so not totally unexpected. Pool area and beach were more than adequate. The gym had plenty of equipment although in a somewhat small space; oh, bring your headphones for the tvs on the cardio machines, they do not provide them. I can recommend this hotel if you get a good deal (warning: there are tons of extra fees, but that was made very clear to us when we booked), but I cannot recommend club level. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Will never return to this hotel or any other Intercontinental hotel”
Reviews.Author: escape28
Reviews.Content: From a previous review....A casino employee who dealt cards got me very sick by coughing and sneezing on the cards and the hotel decided it wasnt his fault. .refused to take any responsibility at all... decided this week..that it was me who came to their hotel sick...because I would get on a plane sick and show up there sick....WHEN IN FACT I COULD HAVE CANCELLED MY TRIP 24 HOURS IN ADVANCE IF I WAS TRULY SICK.. so that rebuffs their claim that I showed up sick. I stayed there for 4 days..and I offered a compromise of giving me 2 days to make up for my being sick because of them... they wouldnt compromise, and insisted through my credit card company I showed up sick. In this economy, if this is how they want to treat their customers, I will never go to their hotel ever again. Intercontinental customer service, is uncaring, obnoxious, accusatory, and most of all, CHEAP. If they gave me 2 days...I would wind up paying for 2 more days..eat at their restaurants, gamble in their casino and continue going year after year. They wouldnt act in good faith. There are other hotels to stay at. So I will do that. Intercontinental...customer service at its worst!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelWinks
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to visit. The staff are very helpful and friendly. My daughter and I stayed at this hotel while my husband continued on to B.V.I. for business. The staff kept a sharp eye on us while we visited the beach making us feel completely safe. The pool is very nice complete with a waterfall and swim up eatery and cabanas. Also, there was an iguana named, Suzy tied to a water fountain in the pool area and my daughter found her very fun and interesting! Our daughter was given a straw hat by the staff on the morning of our departure. This made her feel very, very special! The only downside of our trip was a false fire alarm that went off twice in the middle of the night. The experience frightened my daughter, thinking there was a fire and had to walk down over eight flights of stairs packed with people trying to get out! Honestly, I laugh now thinking that someone in the casino was needing a diversion of some kind!

Reviews.Title: “One of the least attractive Intercontinental I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelerDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located mid-way between the airport and the Old Town. I am not sure how it compares to the other hotels on Isla Verde but it is definitely one of the worst Intercontinental hotels Iâ€™ve stayed at around the world. The rooms were not very clean, room service was slow, pool and beach area were always very crowded. The hotel has a casino on the main floor, so it is always busy and chaotic. Also, keep in mind that the room rate will have about another $100 added per night to cover â€œresortâ€� fees and taxes. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Puerto Rico, Great Deal @ Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: PatsFanAlex
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day vacation in PR @ the Intercontinental. We got a great deal through Hotwire and the hotel was a great value. Puerto Rico is amazing and the Intercontinental facilitated a great trip. Pros: Incredible beach right outside hotel, warm water and soft sand Pool area is gorgeous Great location - easy to get to a variety of destinations Friendly staff Top notch fitness center Casino is cool, not really gamblers but it was fun to watch the games Cons: Our room had 2 "queen" beds, but they felt like doubles. We would have had to pay to upgrade to an ocean view room to get a king bed. No thanks. This is one of the ways the hotel can afford to offer such great deals - try to upsell us on everything. Parking is very expensive Tips: Go to El Yunque rainforest, preferably during the week. We went on a Sunday and it was very crowded with Puertoriquenos having BBQs. The trails were great - bring a bathing suit and towel for Cacada La Mina. We did an ATV tour through the outskirts of the rainforest at Hacienda Carabali. This was a ton of fun, and they stopped at a river where you could jump off rocks into the water. Old San Juan was spectacular. A cab costs $15-20, the public bus is $0.75 but is pretty slow. We made the mistake of doing this on a Monday when a lot of things were closed. Hit up El Morro, but don't forget about La Fortaleza and Casa Blanca. We had some great meals, all very reasonable: Atlantica (on the outskirts of old San Juan) - great, fresh seafood Waterfront (in a beach town called Pinones about 10 miles east of San Juan) - fresh seafood, beautiful view Metropol (5 min walk from hotel) - delicious local cuisine There is a Starbucks @ El San Juan Hotel next door and a diner-type place called Mi Casita across the street that had local dishes and was pretty good. If I did it again I would not rent a car for the duration of the trip. We only needed it the one day we went to El Yunque and Hacienda Carabali. You can get a car from an Avis right outside the hotel. The parking was too expensive to justify having a car for the duration. If we had more time, we would have done kayaking in the Bioluminescent Bay in Fajardo and a snorkel cruise in Fajardo. Oh well, 2 reasons to come back to Puerto Rico soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, too many kids though”
Reviews.Author: RecruiterFL
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Puerto Rico I chose to stay at the Intercontinental. It was overall a nice experience. The staff was very attentive, the pool area was nice, and the restuarants within the hotel were great. Next door at the ESJ there was a Starbucks and many other fast food restaurants to choose from. It was convenient to the airport also. My only issue was the fact that kids were everywhere. If they could only have an adult pool area and enforce the rule (they posted) no children in the hot tub, it would have been perfect. Good job Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon and Great Adventure...Loved IT”
Reviews.Author: sacccutie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stood at Intercontinental from March 8 to 11th and it was like paradise. The hotel is beautiful! I'm a neat freak and this hotel was very clean. It's Right on the beach, has a pool bar and a bar by the beach and waiters that serve you on the beach!The staff was wonderful and very pleasant. English is spoken as well as Spanish so that was a plus. We booked a hotel and flight package through Travelocity who were very accomadating, considering our flight being cancelled because of a snow storm in NY where we live. At no extra charge, they switched the dates. We reserved a car online through Budget Cars whom picked us up from airport and took us to their store which was literally 2 minutes away. Renting a car was a great idea because we got to explore San Juan. We went out of the hotel to get a taste of Spanish food..Yum.Theyre are restauraunts up and down the block Oh and Old San Juan was really fun. Lots to do, historical sites, and places to shop. We just cant wait to go again!! PS it's cheaper to book on a weekday then weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: PA19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the property Valentines Weekend. I booked through Hotwire and got a very good rate. The room was nice but nothing special. I took notice of how incredibly clean everything was, even the hall way carpets etc. The security staff seemed to be on the ball, keeping a keep eye on coming and goings. The grounds and pools were first rate, with plenty of towels, and some activities for kids.The beach resteraunt was good the staff nice. The Japanese food was good and reasonable, Ruths Chris too, and no more expensive than it is here. Its a resort, dont expect 2 dollar drinks anywhere on the strip so why complain? If your cheap (like me) just walk around the corner to the Pueblo and stock up. At check in I got a coupon for 20 bucks off on a massage. The spa was nice, and the massage very good. And not outrageously priced ( about 100 bucks with coupon). I have no complaints and will try to stay again. I will say if I was paying rack rate, I would not have been impressed with the city view, and would expect an ocean view at that price.But very friendly staff, very clean, a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Online booking? Beware!”
Reviews.Author: FL2007
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Intercontinental for an overnight stay in San Juan and booked the room through Priceline. Upon arrival the desk clerk informed us that ther e would be additional taxes and fees involved because online prepaid bookings do not include their resort fees. I spoke with their manager and was assured that unless we paid, they would not honor the room. We then were put in the older two story wing, on the bottom floor that smelled damp and dirty. Food prices are exhorbitant. Like others have mentioned, go out to the street and take your pick of other places with great food at decent prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and resort, Expensive Food, Watch your Stuff!!!”
Reviews.Author: auburnyellowrose
Reviews.Content: My inital review of the hotel was positive. The doormen met us at the cab, took our bags and made sure we were in order. Don't even think about checking in early...not possible trust me. We arrived around a quarter to three and to wait for our room after traveling all day. Cool. We got lunch and watched the water (beautiful by the way). The staff made our stay really enjoyable, giving us tips about places and expectations. I will say don't drink or eat in the hotel. Too expensive. There are plenty of local restaurants around the hotel that have great food. Drinks are $8 which is average for San Juan, no problem. I will also say that you should definitely keep your stuff under wraps (as in lock and key). My credit cards were compromised while I was on the beach - and yes they were in bags in my hotel room. Somone on the staff went through my stuff. When I called, I got the run around. I won't be coming back unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go Back”
Reviews.Author: JimboUsa
Reviews.Content: Recently we had our second visit to the Intercontinental,San Juan,PR. We booked our trip through a Yahoo travel site. Our trip was postponed 2 days due to a snow storm in the Atlanta area. I immediately notified the hotel directly about the weather circumstances beyond my control and inquired about a credit or extending my stay 2 more days in exchange for the 2 days we lost. I contacted several managers at the hotel and got nowhere. They refused to give me any credit or any consideration for our situation. Yahoo travel was also unsucessful in negotiating. I had to add two days extra at my own expense. I'm not happy that the hotel refused to credit me those lost 2 days even though it was due to weather circumstances beyond my control. Also, when I added the additional 2 days, no one let me know that I would be charged 2.5 times the resort fee due to the higher room rates. I paid $41/day for the "resort fees" for the additional 2 days as opposed to $18/day "resort fee" I was charged for the first 3 days. When I inquired at the front desk that said that the resort fee was a % based on your room rate. In summary, it is a shame that such a beautiful hotel with excellent staff has management that is only interested in "sticking it to you" whenever money is involved. Unfortunately,we will not return to this hotel and it is not due to the staff but due to poor management!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here. Dine elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: AdGuyJack
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds were great, and just 5 minutes from the airport. The beach was nice and clean (and safe). The food was very pricey, and mediocre at best - the most disappointing aspect of our stay. We recommend crossing the street and visiting Mi Casita Restaurant - good food at very reasonable prices. You'll also find a small grocery store in the same strip mall - perfect for buying bottled water and beer/sodas at about 1/3rd the price ot the hotel. There are also a number of fast food restaurants in the area. While the icy, fruity rum drinks were "intoxicating" and tasty, both my wife and I had resulting stomach problems that soured our second honeymoon for a bit. Stick to bottled water, beer and wine to avoid that issue. Overall, the hotel was nice with friendly staff, a large hot tub and pool, swim up bar, and recently renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value...great service!”
Reviews.Author: beefree383
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 6 nites last week and really enjoyed this hotel. We used a local travel agent who set us up with a pretty sweet deal. Ocean view, breakfast everyday, and all the 'resort fees' etc. for a very resonable price. (You have to try the banana pancakes!) The room was done well, modern and very clean. GREAT bed, flat screen TV and nice bath. You can tell it's an older property that has been kept up and improved very recently. Great pool area, (arrive early to save the best placed loungers) public spaces and a very nice business suite on the 3rd floor. From James the front door bellman to sweet little gal who hosts breakfast at Alfredo's -the staff was VERY courteous and VERY helpful. All in all a very relaxing hassle free time! I'd go back to the Intercontinental the next time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: RussJ35
Reviews.Content: My girl and I stayed at the intercontinental last year and we had a great time. Great pool scene along with easy beach access makes for a great vacation. Very close to airport and not too far from old san juan, if your looking for a very nice hotel that's clean and safe give intercontinental a try. P.S it's on the strip so you don't have far to walk at night if you wanted to explore the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, close to the airport - convenient for short stays.”
Reviews.Author: PedroPortugal
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is not a top luxury hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable; staff is attentive and efficient. It's a beach front property and the pool area is nice but very small for the hotel size so it feels always overcrowded. The pool is not heated, so the sea is warmer than the hotel pool. There is a casino and several dining options. There is room service available but there is no room service menu, which I found a bit odd. In summary, pretty much in line with expectations but not surprising in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered!”
Reviews.Author: Adams
Reviews.Content: Everything is here to relax. This is a "stay put" kind of place and may be best experienced with a few days in another part of the island if you want a taste of Puerto Rico. The beaches are beautiful, clean , raked and safe and the water warm. They will put chairs by the ocean for you but you will be charged for the umbrellas. The grounds by the pool are also perfect for relaxation and well manicured. Service is wonderful everywhere. The rooms look like the web site and the ocean or garden views are much preferred. The city view looks out on the noisy street. There is not much night life but the El San Juan is right next store. The gym is small but has everything you need.The area itself has not much to offer and you will need a car to experience other parts of the island and there are the tours. The restaurants are over priced on the property. There are wonderful restaurants within walking distance, the Metropol for dinner and for breakfasts and lunches Ma Casita. There is a refrigerator in the rooms and a small grocery store across the street along with plenty of fast food options. The coffee in the room is good but avoid the coffee on the property where you will pay close to 4 $ for a small cup of what tasted like instant coffee. There is a Starbucks at the El San Juan. The drinks are great. This is a family place or for those that want a relaxing vacation- my only complaint is that it could be anywhere in the Carribean or even Miami- everyone speaks English and even the TV channels are in English.

Reviews.Title: “Had a horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: escape28
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Intercontinental Hotel in San Juan. This first time I had a very nice trip and was very impressed with the hotel. This time around, I had a horrible experience that will cause me to never return to this hotel or any other Intercontinental hotel anywhere. I arrived at the hotel around 1 PM and went to check in. I was told that my room wasnt ready and that they would call me on my cell when it was ready. I was fine with that and my wife and I decided to go have lunch and walk around.. We got our room, relaxed for a while and then went to have dinner. After dinner my wife went to the slot machines and I went to the Carribean stud poker table. I sat down, and immediately I noticed that the dealer was coughing and sneezing all over the cards. The pit boss was standing there and did absolutely nothing. It was disgusting. I stayed maybe 4 or 5 hands and was done. Nothing was being done, and I was angry. When I went to my wife right after I got up and told her what happened, she told me she saw one of the waiters coughing and sneezing also. Needless to say, the next morning I had a cold and sore throat., and soon after my wife was sick as well. Our trip was ruined. We were miserable. Upon checkout, the manager asked how my trip was, and when I explained to him what happened, he told me that the hotel was a separate entity from the casino and that there was nothing he could do for me. He walked me over to the casino manager and when I explained to him what happened, he shrugged his shoulders like he didnt care. I asked why the pit boss would allow a sick dealer to work the tables and he said,"What am I supposed to do, I cant send a dealer home with just a cold" He said I couldnt prove that the dealer got me sick. I was dumbfounded. The hotel manager did nothing and the casino manager didnt care. In this economy, this is the kind of customer service that cause people to go elsewhere. When I got home, I called the hotel 800 number customer service to explain what happened, They said someone would get back to me in 48 hours. Well 7 days later, no call. I called on the 8th day, and they said I would get a call back that day or the next. That didnt happen either. I called back again, and was told that customer service the for hotel cant help me because the casino and the hotel are 2 separate businesses and have nothing to do with each other despite the website being one(Intercontinental hotel and casino). They told me, Id have to speak to the casino on my own. I said I did that upon checkout and got nowhere and that to do it again would be pointless. They said, then the matter is closed. I said that I paid them for my trip, not the casino, and they said it wasnt the hotels fault I got sick. So I got nowhere, but learned a valuable lesson. The Intercontinental Hotel customer service is the worst customer service I have ever seen. I paid THEM for my trip, but they did not provide me with a safe environment. Be aware that the hotel and the casino are separate, and the hotel does not care what happens in the casino. I was treated rudely, by the hotel, by the casino, and by the hotels 800 number customer service. I will never stay at any Intercontinental hotel anywhere ever again. It is apparant that the casino managemt does not care if their employees come in sick and get customers sick, and that the hotel doesnt care if THEIR customers get sick either. When we got home we needed a few days to get better from our worst vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: elwoodSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Intercontinental and we loved it! I traveled with my husband and 5 year old. They upgraded us to an oceanfront room on the 10th floor with a king bed and pull out sofa for our 5 year old. But I had to buy the Ambassador club for $150 worth it! I thought the food wasn't too expensive at the hotel pool bar and the portions were really big. All the rooms have fridges as far as I know so stock up on all your drinks and snacks and save yourself a bundle. The only complaint was the noise around our room the last night. Slamming doors and a shouting in the room next door at 4:00 AM after the casino closed. NOT the hotels fault! I should have called security but was afraid my daughter would wake up, who managed to sleep through the noise. There are plenty of stores close to stock up on everything, so do that and save some big $$$$. Would def go again. The beach and pool were great, and it is a VERY family oriented hotel with tons of activities for the little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and nice beach, but pricey food”
Reviews.Author: josborne01
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a good location. Very clean and well kept beach. I was there in February and it was 85 degrees and sunny every day. Would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone. I give it 4 stars on everything... but to be honest, I expected a little bit more for an Intercontinental. They didn't go that extra mile to get the 5 stars. A few great tips: - The hotel restaurants are very pricey and the food isn't so great. After a couple days, we went off the hotel for our meals. Lots of options nearby such as Denny's, Starbucks, Subway, etc. I reccomend you go into Old San Juan if you want to experience local food. - Across the street and around a corner is a big supermarket and US Post Office. Ask the door-man for directions. - There is a cockfighting arena nearby if you dare. Yes, its legal in PR. Also a restaurant next to the arena that I hear is great (never been there). - Visit the neighbor hotel called the "San Juan". It is awesome! An amazingly beautiful lobby with live music almost every night. It is a local hot spot and everyone goes there for dinner, drinks and dancing. The lobby is packed with revelers on the weekend. And there is also a bar on the roof of the hotel (never been there). - Be aware that customer service in Puerto Rico is not the same as in the USA. Be prepared to wait. And be prepared for them to forget your order, etc. I call it "island service" and deal with it. No point in getter overheated while you are on vacation! - Splurge on the guided trip to the rainforest and hike to the waterfall. It cost $64 per person when booked at the hotel concierge. It is well worth getting off the hotel and seeing and learning about the real PR. - Instead of a $25 taxi into Old San Juan, try the local bus. Its fun and you'll get to see more of the real Puerto Rico. Its only 75 cents (need exact change). It is the A9 (or A5?) and the C53 bus. The bus stop is right outside the hotel (ask a hotel door-man for info), and Old San Juan is the last stop. For safety reasons, you might want to take a taxi after dark, though. - Be careful in Old San Juan at night. Probably not dangerous. Just be aware of what is going on around you.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Beach”
Reviews.Author: JoyceofLife
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one day pre-cruise stay. The hotel was clean and nice. I thought the pool area was extremely crowded. We could not get a chair anywhere near the pool but there were plenty of chairs on the beach. I felt you could sit near a pool anywhere so the beach was the obvious choice for me. I read the reviews about the beach being so nice and it was all true. There was some shade under the trees if you wanted it. The hotel provided nice thick towels to put over your beach chair which was nice. The chairs were also free so I really appreciate that. The room was a little outdated but clean. The bed was comfy. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants but we ate at a few of the nearby restaurants (Ponderosa, The Taco Maker and Chill's). I felt the cost of the area was expensive overall. Overall, we had a very nice time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, very family friendly”
Reviews.Author: CBraz88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 2 children (4 yr old and an 8 month old) and had a fabulous time. We had an ocean view room with a king sized bed and a pull out sleeper sofa. The room itself was very nice and the view was amazing. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful. There were different activities you could participate in each day (bingo, yoga, drink demos, towel oragami, etc) plus extras for the kids such as a family movie outside with popcorn, face painting, etc. The pool staff even provided sand toys for the kids to use on the beach. We were very happy with our stay here and would love to return sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVirginian
Reviews.Content: My wife and two boys, 13 and 16, had a terrific time at the Intercontinental and highly recommend it. Service is outstandingâ€”helpful and informative. For instance, when stepping out front to hail a taxi, the doorman inquired where we were going (Old San Juan), and then gave us a brochure, map and a few tips while the cab pulled up. Other encounters with bellhops, waiters, concierge, pool attendants, etc. were uniformly pleasant. The pool area and beach are beautiful, and the hotel provides free towels, chairs and an umbrella, which an attendant carefully plants in holes dug for both the pole and an anchor rope. The beach is wide and very smoothâ€”no shells, rocks, coral, etc., thus itâ€™s great for swimming and sunning. Large pool, hot tub and health club were very clean and well-maintained. Attendants are ever- present and constantly tidying up. The highlight of our vacation was a day-long snorkeling trip on the Spread Eagle II, costing $90 per person, reserved by the concierge. A comfortable bus picked up us and a few others at 8:30 a.m. for an hour-long ride to a marina at the northeastern tip of Puerto Rico. At 10 a.m. we boarded the 50-foot catamaran with 16 other customers and three crewmembers for an hour-long sail to Icacos Island. All snorkeling equipment was provided, and the engaging captain gave me and some other beginners a lesson before we entered the water (floats are also available). There were about five kids under 10 or 11, and adults of all ages and aquatic abilities. After the first snorkeling stop at a shallow beach, the all-you-can eat buffet lunch of sandwiches and salads was ready (included in the price as are drinks and snacks all day). Then the boat moved to deeper water near a coral reef where dense schools of fish nibbled at bread we fed them. Two other snorkeling boats anchored in the same places on the same schedule and the three boats raced home under full sail when all departed about 3:30 p.m. Even if you donâ€™t want to snorkel, this enjoyable sail and great views would be well worth the money. As noted elsewhere, the hotel food is expensive but excellent. We passed on the $17 continental breakfast buffet and $22 full breakfast in favor of the bagel place in the shopping center across the street, where you can eat any breakfast foods there or take out. The fridge in our room helped hold down costs with our own drinks and snacks. Mi Casita in the shopping center is a good inexpensive option. J.H. Yeeâ€™s Asian Bistro restaurant two blocks away also is excellent and reasonably priced (try the Genghis Khan beef). Turn right out the front door, then left at the first street to the Holiday Inn. This also is a quicker route to the large Pueblo supermarket (pass the Holiday Inn and Embassy Suites and bear to the left). We did have a great dinner at Intercontinentalâ€™s Alfredoâ€™s, where you get a complimentary glass of champagne and hors d'oeuvres (but adding some chicken to the Fettucine Alfredo costs $10). However our best meal was the high-end Koco Caribbean in the El San Juan Hotel next door. You can assemble â€œsmall platesâ€� and entrees to shareâ€”the braised beef short ribs are absolutely fantastic; the crab cakes, coconut shrimp and fish taquidos also memorable. A taxi to Old San Juan was $19 plus tip one way. Taxi to El Morro fort at the west end, the highest point, then afterwards walk into town to shop. We ate at La Bombonera, 259 Calle San Francisco, for authentic local food (roasted pork, friend plantains). Then finish with Fort San Cristobal if youâ€™re up for another fort with great views and lots of tunnels, lookouts and stairs to climb on. At the eastern end near San Cristobal is Plaza Colon, where thereâ€™s a taxi stand. If you go to the forts, keep an eye on little kidsâ€”there are lots of sheer drops off the stone walls. Our room on the 11th floor, city side, was well-furnished, clean and everything worked fine. The beds were extremely plush and comfortable. Although we were not bothered by any noisy neighbors, we could tell the hotel walls are not well soundproofed, so that may bother light sleepers or those near loud guests. The air conditioner was generally quiet, but did have a sporadic rattle that kept me awake a bit. But the pillows were large and soft enough that I could easily wrap it around my head to block any sound. There is occasional airplane noise but it was infrequent and not bothersome. This is an urban environment, not the most upscale except for some of the hotels, with city street traffic and lots of local businesses and chain restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sandy927
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August of 2008, with my family, and enjoyed it very much! The service was great, and the hotel itself was beautiful! The pool and hot tub were also very clean! I'd recommend this hotel to everyone! My experience was an unforgettable and admirable one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: GroveP2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, and has a lovely well-maintained pool and beach. However, the rooms themselves need to be refreshed. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was clean, but I was expecting a more luxe experience from an Intercontinental. It was a bit shabby. The furnishings and bathroom were slightly in disrepair. Food and beverages are ridiculously expensive, but I was expecting that in a higher end destination resort. I much prefer the laid back vibe of this hotel to the Vegas-style neighboring El San Juan, but I do wish the Intercontinental San Juan was a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: specialgifting
Reviews.Content: Not the Intercontinental quality that we were expecting.. a rather disappointing experience. The room had a funny smell and things were falling apart.. The staff was not too helpful. The place was very loud in the evening - felt more like a college dorm rather than an upscale hotel. The cleaning ladies were barely doing their job.. On the plus side, the beach was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shellyboo70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental over the Christmas holiday, for 5 nights. What a beautiful resort. We never used the Casino, since we're not gamblers. The pool was gorgeous and really enjoyed the evening swimming. The staff was extremely helpful, and kept the hotel in top shape. We got our room through Hotwire, and we were very pleased about the property. We coudn't have asked for more!!! We did not use any of the hotels restaurants for dining, since we really wanted to experience the local flavor. There is a great restaurant, Mi Casita across the street, that was tasty and well priced. We rented a jeep and parked across the street for about 16 bucks per night, and had access to a parking area 24 hours a day, the lot is safe, and is alway attended by InterContinental staff. We will defiinitey stay at this location again and again. I wish I were there right now!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: glory4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 4 year old son in January. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of lots of stores, other hotels and restaurants. The hotel was covered in amazing Christmas decorations and still smelled of pine. Their sushi restaurant was amazing and our son loved their fish tank as well. Our room was on the 15th floor and was very spacious with a pull out sofa. Our only complaint with the room was that we had a room facing the road and there was lots of road noise and sirens all night. I would upgrade to an ocean front room in the future. The front desk staff and bellmen were all wonderfully attentive and considerate. The beach is great, as is the large pool. Overall we had a great stay and would love to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Intercontinental San Juan”
Reviews.Author: FBScuba1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had an excellent time at the Intercontinental in San Juan! We were in PR from November 5th - 11th. The hotel is top notch in terms of service, amenities, check-in, check-out, etc. The bellmen, valets and concierge were extremely courteous and helpful with recommendations on food, excursions, directions, etc. The pool is pleasant and beach is great. Had an ocean front room which made the stay that much better. All the conveniences of home can be found at shops within walking distance from the hotel if necessary. You should definitely make it a point to eat lunch or dinner at Mi Casita which is in the shopping center across the street. I would definitely recommend renting a car and heading to Old San Juan for some site seeing and some good dinners (Dragonfly is a great place to eat). Also it's worth it to make a trip to El Yunque rain forest for a day. There is an Avis located right in the hotel and the rates were very fair. Parking lot across the street. If you're up for the party scene, the Old San Juan Hotel is right next door and there is plenty going on there. All in all, we both had an extremely pleasant experience at the Intercontinental and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fire alarms in the middle of the nights, raw sewage, 22% tax”
Reviews.Author: happycruiser11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many places in San Juan but wanted to try this hotel because it is top rated. (Marriott, esj, and Embassy suites are all wonderful) I booked my husband and I here for the first 4 nights of our honeymoon before we caught a princess cruise to eastern Caribbean. First glance, I loved it, it was gorgeous, friendly staff and nice restaurants. It stopped there: beware of an extra 22% hotel tax they tack onto your bill on that "credit card for incidentals" I have never had to pay this at any of the other hotels. I pre-paid everything this vacation with priceline, so I was perturbed at this. Beyond that minor aggravation, a fire alarm went off two nights in a row at 1:40 and 3 am. I can understand one night having an accident in the kitchen, but two? Beyond that, the manager of the hotel had no idea that the first night it had gone off, he said, "oh, it must have been a floor alarm that someone on your floor tripped." But that he had no information on it and oh well. I"m a very light sleeper and being woken from dead sleep to a very loud siren and loud booming voice saying "a fire has been detected in the building" was not my idea of a nice honeymoon. Ok, beyond these two obstacles, we decided to book an excursion on the island. The concierge was very helpful and we decided to take one (mind you very expensive one) that took us to El Yunque, Luquillo beach, and Bioluminescent bay. I had heard great things about the first and last, but never luquillo. I asked the concierge and he said OH its wonderful, best beach on the island, so we went ahead. The rainforest was nice, but when the van dropped us off at the beach and told us they'd be back in 3 hours, we were a little freaked out. We couldn't see the beach from the parking lot so before the van drove away, the guide told us he'd pick us up at the food shacks a half mile down the road at 6pm. Passing them on the way in, it looked like the worst part of the barrio, so we decided we better stay on the beach as long as possible. The van drove away and we walked towards the beach. As soon as we got 10 steps further (of course the van was long gone by then) we saw homeless people sleeping on the beach which was littered with trash and bugs. A few people were swimming but the water looked a little of a weird color--I"m from new jersey and even our beaches didn't look that gross. So of course with every disaster of a honeymoon, the clouds darkened for a storm so we were forced to walk to the barrio food shacks. On the way we noticed a nice large river of raw sewage (yes it was for sure as it smelled like it as well) that flowed right into the beach. (we're talking raw sewage into a beach 0.25 miles from the center of the beach) So in the barrio, we were like sitting ducks, we might as well had a target on us, so we spent the 2.5 hours left in the corner of one of the shacks playing pool and trying to generously tip the people at that food stand in hopes we wouldn't be shot or mugged. Finally we got picked up and were brought to Bioluminescent bay in Fajardo. It was nice, but since it was still storming it was a bit short and they didn't let us swim in the water, just kayaked 40 mins round trip to shake our hands in the water and return to the shore. Afterwards, talking to other people on the island, they said the best place to see Biobay is in Vieques (an island off the eastern coast). I give this background because the concierge at the hotel is the one that put us on this. We asked a few cab drivers that they get for you at the hotel and they all say Luquillo is their favorite beach, but any taxi driver not around that hotel will tell you culebra or some others on the western side or southern part of the island..... suspicious, to us it seemed they were all in coohoots. OK so when we went to check out, we asked the manager about this, and he told us, look it up online, its a wonderful beach! I said I dont care what it said online, we've been there and seen the area, seen the sewage and contamination, and its crazy they keep sending people there. He didn't seem to care, so great if he likes swimming in raw sewage (which is where I'd like to dunk him now), I just advise the rest of you dont. :) So to not ruin your vacation or honeymoon, this is a beautiful hotel, but I'd advise stay in The Embassy Suites (free hot breakfast and free happy 2 hours) or El San Juan and with either you can walk to Ruth's Chris steakhouse or any Intercontinental amenities.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rwinks685
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed at. I discovered this hotel during 9/11 (where I was forced to stay during the air space clousure) and fell in love iwth it. I have returned at least once a year since then. The service is great. I have never had a problem with staff. They are helpful and go out of their way to meet your needs. The beach is very nice and rivals any in the Carribean. It is clean and safe. I have never been bothered here by beggars, etc. The pool is really cool. Waterfalls, swim up bar, adult area, kid area. What more do you need? The only draw back is if you sleep in, you may not get a chair! My kids and wife love it too. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Even though it is near the airport, you never hear the planes. Very quiet. If you are looking for a quality hotel in San Juan, this one is worth evey penny.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LifesATrip007
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I and another couple) stayed here one night after our cruise and we all absolutely loved this hotel. I was nervous because I was the one that made the reservations and you know how that can sometimes go! But from the moment we checked in to the moment we left we enjoyed our stay tremendously. When we arrived we were immediately greeted as we got out of the taxi and our bags were taken care of. Check-in was a breeze...although that could have something to do with the fact that there happened to be no one else in line when we arrived! We arrived early and our room wasn't ready which we didn't expect it to be. We were offered a "hospitality" room (which was one of the hotel rooms) to use to change/freshen up, etc. So we put our suits on and headed right out to the beach for the afternoon. The staff were all friendly. I was pleasantly surprised when we checked out the next morning that the gentleman behind the desk actually remembered my name and greeted me by name. The hotel room itself was great. I didn't find it small at all (could that be because we just came off of a week on a cruise ship???). There was a vanity right outside the bathroom which was perfect for hair and makeup and best of all - the lighting was good for doing your makeup! (Women can relate to this issue!). We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that. We did have breakfast in a small diner located in the strip mall across the street - food was good (typical breakfast stuff) and very reasonably priced. The hotel is about a 5 minute ride to the airport and I was surprised that the whole afternoon we spent on the beach (and the next morning) we never heard any planes go by. All in all I highly recommend this hotel and if we go back we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Raving Reviews! Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: didiette
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Intercontinental during our 3 night trip to Puerto Rico Oct. 17th - 20th. We really enjoyed our stay here. It was a quick ride from the airport, costing us about $15 with our luggage, and when we got there, the bell guy who greeted us (Ramon) very warm and friendly. We checked in early and our room was not ready, but they held our bags and encouraged us to walk around and view the facility. The pool area was very nice, and just steps beyond that was the beach. The landscape of the pool area was awesome and the swim up bar was a definite plus. Since we were traveling in the off season, there weren't many people there and so it was easy to get service. All the staff members were extremely friendly, curteous, and professional. I have nothing but the best to say about them. David, the bartender, was the best! He gave us wonderful recommendations for food and was always available with a helping hand. The room was a bit small, but it was functional. The bed was comfortable and we had fresh towels everyday. The only bad thing was the bathtub took so long to drain -- by the end of the shower you'd be standing in 3" of water. The hotel lobby was nice and bright and I enjoyed their casino as well. We won the first night, but gave it all back plus some throughout our stay. I would definitely go back to the intercontinental and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Que Sabor! What Flavor!”
Reviews.Author: foxyb03
Reviews.Content: Que Sabor! What flavor! From the minute you enter the premises of the Intercontinental San Juan you are surrounded by lush landscaping, friendly bilingual staff, and native salsa music. I was not disappointed. The rates were equal to what you get. The grounds were kept clean. Staff and security were visible 24 hours a day. My husband and I stayed for a week and visited the spa daily. It was empty most days but is complimentary including bottled water, robes, fruit, and a nice dry/wet sauna. The gym overlooks the ocean and has very up to date equipment. I would advise all to eat majority of meals outside of the resort as breakfast alone cost us $45. There is a grocery store along with restaurants offering cheap authentic Puerto Rican cuisine within walking distance. The concierge can get you anywhere you want to go along with available cab service stationed outside the front door of hotel. I plan to go again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: KfromME622
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for four nights, and had a great time. The hotel was clean and beautiful, although the room decor was a bit dated. The bed was super comfortable, and the pool and beach were clean and well maintained. The staff was very accomodating, but the best part was that they left you alone. I have been to resorts where the pool area staff hovered around you and asked if you needed anything every five minutes, but here they were visible and available, but left you alone for the most part. The beach was clean and not too crowded. The surf was a bit rough and there was a bit of an undertow, but it was fun. Just watch out for the stinging urchins! We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants, but we did get room service and the food was just okay. We got the continental breakfast in the lobby each morning and took it down to the beach, which was great. The coffee in the lobby is so good! Overall, this was not a bad hotel, and I'd stay there again if I ever go back to San Juan. Just be sure to ask for a room overlooking the pool and ocean, since the view on the other side is not so great. Also, be aware that the hotel (and in fact all of the Isla Verde area hotels) are very close to the airport, so you will hear jets taking off and landing all day. If that will bother you, you may want to try Condado or one of the other parts of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome quick getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: epleiss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for my birthday and it was just perfect. If you are looking for a relaxing atmosphere without the big crowds (low season), this is the place to go. The hotel has an elegant flair and they try to make it feel as luxurious as possible, don't expect Ritz Carlton level and you will not be dissapointed. The hotel: Same as everyone else says : nice people, slow front desk, helpful when needed and always opening doors. As far as the food at the hotel, we only ate there once and it was good but pricey, $48.00 for lunch that consisted of a burger, a sandwich and two drinks, ouch. Stay away from the drinks at the beach bar, we ended up ordering two $15 drinks that were not even that great or strong or big. Check with the waiter about the prices before you order because they don't list them on the menu. The rooms: Nice and clean, not imaculate but clean. The bed was soft and plushy, super comfortable. We also upgraded to ocean view and it really is worth the money. We were greeted with wine and strawberries for my B-day which is always nice. The beach: We read that the beach in Isla Verde is nothing compared to the not so touristy beaches that PR offers, so we didn't know what to expect. When we finally checked in, ( that took a really long time) we headed to the beach and it was beautiful. Blue, calm and just what we needed. There were maybe 8 other couples on the beach, so it felt very private. It was quiet, and so relaxing. The beach alone is worth the trip. We opted to rent a car, and I would say that if you are planning to do some exploring you have to rent a car. It is very easy to get everywhere and the freedom you get to leave when you want and go whenever and wherever you want to go is awesome. So, unless you are not moving from the hotel, rent a car, it is worth it and cheaper. I definetaly agree with the fact that organized tours are not worth your money. We explored so much, Luquillo beach, the rainforest, Old san juan, Pinones on Sunday when all the locals go (fun and very PR, if you want to sample local food, brace yourself and eat). The only tour I highly recommend is the Vieques Bioluminecent tour. East Island Excursions is the only company that can arrange a night trip and bring you back to Fajardo, which is a 20-30 minute drive from Isla Verde. I will do it again in a heart beat. To read more about it, go to puertoricodaytrips.com. Don't forget to schedule your tour according to the what phase the moon is in. The biobay is best experienced on cloudy, moonless nights. Food: Well, I guess this is the only down side of our trip. We are very adventurous when it comes to food and we were looking forward to trying the local fare. Unfortunately, most of it didn't agree with me, lots of fried and super fried foods. But that is just me. We ate at Mi Casita one night and it was good, we also tried Pamela's for my actual b-day dinner, and even though that was pricey, about $200.00 for two with drinks, it was so yummy. I am definetaly coming back with the kids, the hotel's pool is awesome and beach access steps away. I recommend everyone explore PR, it is really beautiful and so different than your usual Mexico vacation. I look forward to coming back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Splash”
Reviews.Author: screwgg
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels i have stayed in hands down. The staff very respectful and courtesy the concierge very knowledgeable and friendly..the amenities were great The pool amazing..its great to be able to swim up to the bar in the pool... and the hot tub was big and relax and your a hop skip and jump away from the ocean... Upgraded to an ocean front view which was well worth the money loved the Coqui's lol

Reviews.Title: “A great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelscott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for 2 nights before our Southern Caribbean cruise. We were met by a wonderful staff, always with a smile and a greeting. The entire staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was beautiful, and our room was spectacular, very clean, with a comfy king size bed. The pool area was great, the pool itself was phenominal with a waterfall and a swim-up bar. The hotel is situated on the beach, which is a short walk from the pool. We had a great time and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The only downfall is the food prices at this hotel. However, there is ample food choices for the bargin hunter just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: buddybella
Reviews.Content: We would recommend the Intercontinental to everyone. Beautiful, clean, friendly and helpful employees. Not a bad thing to say about our stay. Our vacation at the Intercontinental San Juan far exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Tips fom a 3rd-time Visitor”
Reviews.Author: SalseroWes
Reviews.Content: Background: I'm 28yrs old, I have been to San Juan 3 times in the past 2 years - twice at the El San Juan when I was single (next door) and once at the Intercontinental with my girlfriend (this visit). The Hotel: My first impression was that the hotel was very nice. It is centrally located in relation to popular tourist attractions (Old San Juan and El Yunque Rainforest). It is right on a beatiful beach. The lobby is quite small and not much going on. If you are looking for action the El San Juan is right next door. Overall, the pool and the lobby is much nicer at the El San Juan but for a family, couples, a relaxing vacation or elderly people, the Intercontinental is a better choice as it is much quieter and well lit. The El San Juan is very trendy, dark and loud (think night club) - but if you are single and younger (under 35) the El San Juan is a better choice. The Room: I originally upgraded to a room with an ocean view but when I got to my room on the 7th floor I noticed that most of the view was obstructed by trees. I immediately called the front desk and they gladly changed rooms to the 14th floor...that view was SPECTACULAR!!! Moral of the story - make sure you call for a higher floor because "ocean view" is pretty much anything on the side of the hotel that faces the ocean...it doesn't necessarily mean that you can see the ocean LOL! My only complaint was that the walls were paper-thin and you can easily hear people in the next room and it can be hard to sleep at night if you have loud neighbors. I had to call security all 3 nights I was there - it's not the hotel's fault that these people were really loud but just keep in mind that the walls are thin. The Hotel Staff: The staff is extremely courteous (much more than at the El San Juan). There was always someone to open the doors to the hotel for you no matter what time you entered or exited the hotel (and they never asked or expected a tip). The concierge was very nice and helpful as well. My only complaint was that the service at the front desk was a bit slow. House keeping was very quiet when cleaning other rooms- they were like ninjas - you dind't even know they were there. I left my room for breakfast, put the sign on my door to get my room cleaned...came back 45min later and my entire room was clean. Rental Car / PARKING!!!! : This was the best part for me...right accross the street is a self-parking area...it costs $16 per day and you can go in and out AS MUCH AS YOU PLEASE! This is such an advantage if you are doing any sightseeing. DO NOT waste money on organized tours...all the signs in San Juan are in English and easy to follow. Rent a car and you will save yourself a TON on money (including a $15 cab trip each way to and from the airport). I reserved a car from the airport on priceline.com for $15/day tax inc.!!!! That's $93 for a 4-day, 3-night weekend for parking and the car - You can't beat that! Old San Juan and the Bacardi factory are 15min by car and the rainforest is 45min away. If you take an organized tour this will cost you at least a couple of hundred dollars per person...for something that can easily be done on your own! However, make sure you bring a GPS - it will really come in handy - if you don't have one, most rental car companies can offer you one at a marginal rate. RENT A CAR, RENT A CAR, RENT A CAR!!!! Where to eat: Right across from the hotel there are tons of restaurants (Burger King, Pizza Hut, Wendy's, Subway, KFC...). My suggestion would be "Mi Casita" it is fairly authentic and relatively inexpensive and the food is good...BUT BEWARE the service can be long. I have eaten at this restaurant 5 times, dinner usually takes at least 45min for you to get your food and breakfast is around 25-30min. However, the last day we were there, dinner came out in 15min and breakfast came out in 10min...so I would say it's hit or miss but prepare for the worst. Don't go when you are extremely hungry because chances are you will wait a while. Try their Signature Mofongo dishes (mashed plantain topped with a tomato based sauce and your choice of chicken/beef/shrimp.) Overall, the wait is worth it - both for the quality of the food and especially the price. If you eat at any of the hotels, don't expect to get out of there for under $100 for 2 people (wine not included). Another option, is there is a grocery store within 5min walking distance from the hotel - you can't see it, so ask the concierge how to get to the "Pueblo" grocery store. There you can buy water, drinks, and even prepared food for dirt cheap prices. Also, there is a Walgreens 5min walking distance as well. Beach: The beach is very nice but can be crowded in peak seasons. It is a long beach - I'd say at least 5 miles. The sand is groomed every morning. The water can get rough if there is bad weather but generally, it is really good. The good thing about this hotel is that the beach chairs are free. Some other hotels charge $4/day for beach chairs! Things to do: If you like booze, the Bacardi Factory is nearby, you can go on a tour once you get there with your rental car =) Old San Juan is beautiful - make sure to bring a camera. There are a few old forts that can be visted that will give you a great view of the ocean and the city as well as a history of the island. Also, there is a path that you can walk on right by the ocean that takes you all along Old San Juan. El Yunque rainforest: This is a must! Take your rental car and drive to the rainforest; there are many well marked trails that are paved. You do not need a guide or to go on a tour. If you go by yourself - it's FREE!!!! All you have to do is print out a trail map from the internet first. On my first trip in 2005, I went on a tour that cost me $60...we walked for an hour and we were done. This time I did some research and did the La Mina trail and the Big Tree trail and that was amazing - nothing like what the tours take you on...breath-taking scenery and a gorgeous waterfall at the bottom. The rainforest opens at 7:30am; if you start hiking before 8:30am you will be fine otherwise expect crowds, especially at La Mina Falls. Both trails I took were about 40min of hiking...the La Mina trail is MUCH nicer than the Big Tree trail but it is also a bit harder to do. If you are in any decent shape, I suggest the La Mina trail down to the falls and the Big Tree trail back up. I hope this helps you out, I really love Puerto Rico and it is clear why it is called "La Isla Del Encanto". I am set to go back in May and visit Culebra, home to Flamenco Beach - rated by Discovery Channel as one of the nicest beaches in the world. If you have a week in PR be sure to check this out - I am sure that you won't be sorry =) Wes

Reviews.Title: “Breathe - Taking”
Reviews.Author: PhoeSky
Reviews.Content: The hotel was steps from the beach. It is locate along the hotel strip 5 mins from the airport. A girlfriend and I stayed here for her birthday and she loved it. We were upgraded to an oceanview room without even asking for it. There are plenty restaurants within the hotel but we did not eat at any of them. There are restaurants along the strip and you have your american chains (Burger King, Church's, Wendy's, etc) I could have not asked for a better hotel. The grounds were well maintained, the staff was always helpful, and I love the huge swimming pool. What you are not told is that there is a hotel fee of $10 a day, but they hold a $100 a day on your credit card. I don't have one bad thing to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mom, Hubby, Kids all loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sambamdoo
Reviews.Content: We took my mom here for her 65th birthday knowing she loved PR. Well, it was a GREAT trip- except for the rain the last few days. We were there from Oct.9-13 and even though the hotel was full, it never felt that way. Everyone loved the resort, hubby-hard to please, mom-harder to please :-) and our 2 little girls- 5 and 6. Our 14 year old was a bit bored due to the fact that there weren't many teenagers for her to hang with. Wonder if they have a kids program during peak season? They did show family movies every day at 5:00 p.m. The pool was beautiful, the staff amazingly friendly, beach clean and lovely. I do prefer the Caribbean Sea to the Atlantic Ocean but Intercontinental can't do anything about that. LOL The casino was fun- as mentioned, free food and drinks while gambling. Old San Juan was great shopping and beautiful. Will definitely be back, but beware as hotels everywhere, the food and drink prices were high. Mix BK, Subway,Mi Casita with hotel food and have a WONDERFUL time. We did.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: ErosCincinnati
Reviews.Content: What an amazing trip! I just returned from San Juan and cant wait to return. A girlfriend and I wanted to get away from the Midwest for a long weekend and we chose Puerto Rico. I imediately came to Trip Advisor to find a place to stay. We are SO GLAD we found the Intercontinental!!! The staff was so personal and friendly, the grounds were beautiful, everything was clean...it was spectacular! Of course a couple tips... *Grocery shop ASAP! Every room has a mini fridge. Pueblo (local grocery) is a short walk. We got breakfast snacks, alcohol, mixers, snacks, water bottles, sunscreen, etc. The food and drinks at the hotel were great, but pricey.
