Grocery! *Book snorkel trip with Castillo Tours (castillotours.com) to Icacos. BEAUTIFUL and FUN! Good day trip. Plenty of time for evening plans. Ask for a tour with Tito & Crew. They brought us Pina Coladas in the water! Service. So much fun and SO professional! *Salsa dancing next door at the El San Juan! Hot sopt for San Juan and DEFINATELY the best dancing we encountered. *Eat at Platos!!! 5 min walk down the street. Get the fried plantain and Mahi Mahi...delicious! *Massages at the Spa were a perfect conclusion to our trip. They were so relaxing. Definately choose this hotel!!!! Perfect for Girlfriend trips, honeymoon, families(not too many small kids, better for teenagers/adult children), aniversary, birthday, batchelor/ette party, EVERYTHING!

Reviews.Title: “Fab weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Rumahputih
Reviews.Content: Booked a two night stay with some left over Jet Blue credits and flew with our 6 month old baby from Orlando to San Juan. Airport transfer was only 5 minutes by taxi and check in was quick. The room was a little more dated than I'd expected but very clean and comfortable. There was a good band in the lobby both Friday and Saturday and a great atmosphere for a couple of drinks and an impromptu dance. Took the free bus to Old San Juan (A8 or C53) from outside the door, much cheaper than the $20 cab although it did take 40 minutes. Pool area is stunning with rainforest landscaping and a large jacuzzi & pool with several bars, including a swim-up bar, also the beach is just beyond the pool area which is clean and quiet. We ate at the Fettucini Italian restaurant by the pool area which was reasonably priced and excellent food and wine. The fresh focaccia bread was a highlight. Over all heartily recommend this hotel for a getaway and we had no difficulties with our little one.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gatorbucboy
Reviews.Content: We went in the off season and paid less than $2000 for airfare and three nights at hotel for four of us.. We have a 3 and 5 year old who loved it. The pool is fantastic with waterfalls, swim up bars, and even a shallow platform for the kids to play on. The beach is steps away and there is an outdoor restaraunt so you never have to go in. There are some good places to eat at the hotel but we found that if you want authentic puerto rican food all you have to do is go across the street to Mia Casita, fantastic food and very inexpensive. We took the public bus to Old SanJuan and the fort. Took us an hour to get there. On the way back we took a taxi for $20 and it took 10 minutes, worth it! At night there is always music in the lobby and the casino is small but very adequate. Complimentary sandwiches and beverages at gaming areas. We will be going back and recommended it to all traveling types.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again.”
Reviews.Author: MYPRITI
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Intercontinental San Juan. Once again, it was very clean and very nice. We reserved a suite, which has a separate living room, tv and fridge. There was another fridge and tv in the bedroom. The staff was nice and helpful. I liked the location. Isla Verde is a public beach, and very clean for a public beach. Great diner across the street, very convenient. Love the fact that it was literally 5 mins from the airport. Great for a quick get away. Just a very easy, convenient trip and the beach is beautiful. One silly thing that disappointed me was the fact that complimentary bottles of water were available at the towel desk during our last visit but not during this visit. The pool is nice but a bit small. The pool area is beautiful. Very lush, and nice landscaping - makes you feel like you are in your vey own oasis, which is how one should feel while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay- Probably wouldnt return”
Reviews.Author: lynachka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for 7 days, Sept. 17-23 for our anniversary. We didnt have to wait too long to check in and we upgraded to a ocean front room for $150 extra. Here is my honest review: When I saw our ocean front room I was shocked by how much they charge regular price for it. There were tons of ants in the bathroom. I had to call housekeeping a couple of times to spray the bathroom. There was mold everywhere. Rooms are dingy. Old carpets. Old furniture. I would never pay full price for this room. The actual hotel grounds were ok. Pool was clean. The Beach was AMAZING. The water was perfect and the sand clean, hardly any rocks. We really got to relax. I must also point out that we visited during Peak Hurricane Season so there were hardly any people staying at the hotel. Next to the pool, there must have been 10 people the entire week. If your'e going during high season, the pool area is pretty small and I can see it crowding really easily. The food at the hotel was BLAH. You're better off going across the street to Mi Casita for breakfast (will cost you $15.00 rather than $50.00 at the hotel). Dinners are VERY expensive. We spent an average of $140 every night just for dinner. Lunch runs about $45.00 for two people - and we dont eat a lot. So food is extremely pricey unless you want to eat fried fast food for the week. Wendy's Burger King, KFC, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, all across the street. We ate mostly at the El San Juan Hotel. That hotel looked absolutely beautiful. Food was amazing at Koco, The Palm and Yamato. If I was to go back to San Juan, I would probably try staying at the El San Juan. It was way more modern than the Intercontinental. Overall, unless you are getting a GREAT deal at this hotel, I would recommend choosing another one. They really need to fully clean and maintain their rooms, not just their outside property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: charliecannibal
Reviews.Content: 09/11/08 - 09/15/08 ----- great place to relax and get away from it all. 1st thing you notice is lots of green everywhere. Beautiful plants and trees everywhere. even though this is part of the United States, spanish is their language. although once they realize you speak english they will switch to english. I must agree everyone was polite and friendly, very warm people. I would recommend that you rent a car even if you are staying a few days and plan to sight see, I rented one from avis at the airport total was $202. US dollars including all insurance, gas refill, rental on a gps (garmin) map device and fast easy return drop off. it saved me money compared to all the other tourist who spent lots more just getting around to a few of the tourist sites. I was able to see so much more of the city and surrounding area. able to go the many more tourist sites ( I would Plan out the places i would want to go to first though). and when needed went to the grocery store, target, and was so very convenient. traffice not to bad pretty much like everywhere else, all signs are in spanish, be careful of Rush hour although people are nice and let you move over, Just the cab ride from the airport which is less than 3 miles away is $21. Because the cab drivers know that this is a high price hotel they will charge you more. parking is scarce so it is worth paying the $16 dollar fee to the hotel to park across the street in their lot with in an out priviledges. A car rental is something i would recommend you splurge on, the hotel is right next to the old san juan hotel that has a starbucks in their lobby, about 12 blocks further down is the ritz carlton hotel. ok now the intercontinental is an older hotel (as are all the other hotels in this area) that has been remolded but it very nice and kept up. the landscaping is very green, very large pool mostly 3 ft deep with one 5x5 roped off section that is 6 ft. has waterfalls as part of the pool and a very large hot tub, swim up bar, lots of padded loungers to lay out and get some sun. in your room you change into your swim clothes and take the elevator to the lower lobby where you exit to the courtyard go to the hut by the pool to get a wristband that identifies you as a hotel guest. Large free towels are provided, as you walk toward the beach you will pass the hotels spa on the right and then the bathroom area that is provided along with outdoor shower to wash off any sand upon return. Just before you exit the hotel pool area a restaurant bar Splash is there for drinks or food. the hotel provides free lounges which they will carry and set up for you so you can sun by the ocean. 30 feet away is the ocean and it is Beautiful, i can not stress this enough, the sand is clean, cream colored and warm to your feet, the ocean water is clear and warm, just beautiful. I noticed that there was a shark net way out set up by the hotel so guest need not worry about being bothered while in the ocean. so you can forget about all those shark movies and just enjoy the beautiful ocean water. There were no life guards so be careful any undercurrent pull i felt was very slight and i do not know how to swim so i kept near the shoreline. this part of the beach is owned by the hotel, it is kept up and very clean, hotel waiters walk around to bring you drinks or anything you may need. there are also locals selling food, ice cream, and hats and jewelry but not to many to bother you. even on weekends this part of the beach is not crowed since it is not a public beach area. there are also vendors who provide jet skis for rent, a banana boat ride (where you ride on a catamaran style boat that is being pulled by a larger boat and hang on while the banana boat your on bounces and splashes in the ocean) also they provide parasailing where you are attached to a parachute and also pulled by a boat so that you soar in the air. Life jackets are provided and rates are posted so take some money with you if you want drinks, food, or to purchase the rides. miles of great beach if you want an early morning run which i did see people taking advantage of, sunset walks, or just a walk along the shore with the waves tickling your toes. not much to see though since there is only the back of condos and other hotels to see. ok back to the hotel, had a nice clean comfortable room, large king bed, 40 inch flat screen tv, mini fridge was empty so i put my own vitamin waters and snacks in it. small 3 ft balcony to stand from and take in the view. beautiful ocean view, housekeeping was great very attentive and polite. hotels have small casinos, nothing like vegas, but if you like to gamble they will serve your needs, free drinks and cocktails and food snacks from the casino waitstaff. Mostly slots with a few tables for blackjack, texas holdem, roulette, 3 card and carribean poker and craps. can be a fun night, upon check in ask your clerk for casino coupons if you want to gamble. also they have a lottery you have to buy tickets at any convience store and the concierge can look up the winning numbers upon request. on weekends in the main lobby bar free music is provided salsa to move your feet too. they also take request, man those people can swivel their hips. wow! there are many walgreens drug stores within walking distance and fast food places right across the street. ok now for food hotel has great restaurants, ruth chris, yokomama, and italian and also one for american food. Denny's and walgreens drug store are 8 blocks up toward the ritz carlton in the very little isla mall, for a great american breakfast or food 24 hours. they don't have late brunch anywhere so if you want breakfast after 11am this is the place to go. a local restuarant Mi casita is right across the street for local puerto rican food and it is great but pricey. used to be cheap but now entree's run from $ 8 to $20, but they give you a lot so maybe you can share, when i ate there i had to take half home all the time. baskin robbins ice cream is right next door. just remember when standing in front of the hotel intercontinental facing the street, fast food across the street and to the right, to the left Starbucks (in old san juan hotel lobby) denny's, walgreens, Chili's( open in November 2008) to your left all within walking distance. Well hope you have a great trip in puerto rico, lots to see and do, take advantage. although i did see and do what i wanted i went with the purpose to disconnect from all cell phones, email, and everything else. i did completely relax and spent most of my time on the beach and in the beautiful ocean, and getting some sun. I will return for a much longer visit. I hope this trip will do you as much good as it did me, just remember ---- relax, relax, relax, unwind, let the ocean waters wash all your cares away. walk on the beach at sunset and fall in love again, even if it is just with yourself. peace. sincerely charlie

Reviews.Title: “The Intercontinental Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: LauraTheExplorerNyc
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking the beach. Upon arrival, there was a piece of chocolate cake in our room because my birthday would occur during our stay. The first night we walked on the beach right off the hotel and watched a beautiful sunset. Every day we swam up to the bar IN THE POOL and had drinks (cappuccino colada!!!) and the best chicken quesadillas! One day I hung my bathing suit on the balcony to dry, and a gust of wind made it fall below to a rooftop ten floors below our room. My fiance (well, back then he was a mere boyfriend but we since got engaged!!!) went down to the concierge to ask for help, and minutes later a maintanance worker was sent to rescue my bathing suit and he promptly brought it to our room. Another time I left my watch near the pool to go for a swim, and one of the pool boys must have thought I left it there and took it to the lost and found. When we inquired about the watch, they were very helpful and the concierge even made me prove that the watch was mine before he handed it back to me. At the hotel's recommendation, we celebrated my birthday at Pamela's, a beautiful restaurant right on the beach. It was so romantic and delicious. We loved the Intercontinental and would recommend it to anyone who likes to swim up to their bar and hang their bathing suits to dry on the balcony. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: daver328
Reviews.Content: We had a great getaway and highly recommend the Intercontinental! Highlights: A very well kept and professionally landscaped pool area. Open 24-7. The beach is very well maintained also and only a few steps away. (The hotel is on the beach) Many excellent places to eat at the hotel and plenty of more affordable eateries within a very short walk. Excellent service in every area. Clean rooms - clean hotel. Very adequate fitness center. Spa appeared to be adequate although we never used the services. The hotel even set up a large screen television and showed family movies each night -with free water and popcorn for the kids. Concierge service was very helpful with maps and driving directions and bus information etc. (tour info too - although we preferred to go it on our own - mostly). There is an Avis car rental at the hotel. We used the free wireless internet to make our auto reservation, taking advantage of discounts. Service was very good there as well. We had excellent service without exception. We had a very safe and enjoyable time! We booked at this time of year to have a relaxing vacation during a "slow" time. Our goal was to relax, take it easy and not try to do too much. We made no firm plans - other than the flights and hotel - but had a few activities in mind, if we felt like it. We stayed five nights beginning September 8th. The taxi ride from the airport was very short($11.50 plus $1 per bag). Check in was smooth and timely. The representative did advise us, however, that there was a apx $10 per night service fee that was not collected by "Priceline" that would be collected a check-out. There were no other suprises. Being "Priority Club" members we asked to upgrade to an ocean front view room. After declining to purchase the upgrade we were upgraded free of charge. The view was wonderful! The restaurants at the hotel are top notch, steakhouse (Ruth's Chris), Japanese (MomoYama) and Italian. There is a pool bar and a restaurant/ bar with a large deck right on the beach. The restaurants, and "pool drinks" can become pricey fast. No worry, there is a small market across the street and Walgreens right down the street (either direction). And we had a mini fridge in the room! (which we stocked with bottled-water and diet Coke purchased outside the hotel) There are many affordable eateries all within a short walk: Mi Casita's (Local), Subway, Burger King, Wendy's, Church's, Lupi's (Mexican), Baskin-Robbins (ice cream), Taco Maker, Chinese ... We did eat one night at the Italian place at the hotel and had great food and service. We had the best of both worlds - We mainly went to the pool and beach each day ... and enjoyed the hot-tub each night. And we had the best of both worlds here too - pool and beach! Although we did not, there were Jetski rentals available on the beach by the resort next door. Although we brought our personal snorkle gear - we did not snorkle and I got the impression that for really "good" snorkling we would need to go elsewhere. Nevertheless, a great beach and water right outside your door! We did go to Old San Juan one half day. You can rent a car, take the city bus (easy and safe - just don't go late) or pay for a cab. We rented a car one day as well and drove to the National Park/ rainforest . (about 45 minutes drive - tops - use the toll road!) The conceirge and all the staff were very helpful with questions to help plan with these activities. Check-out was uneventful and prompt as well as the taxi to the airport. Just a wonderful, and clean place with good service. Our first time ... but hopefully not our last ... David and Tammy

Reviews.Title: “We had a FANTASTIC stay at the Intercontinental! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: GoingPlacesPA
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews before booking our 4 night/5 day vacation through Continental Vacations since my husband and I could choose from a number of hotels and were undecided. I am SO HAPPY we stayed at the Intercontinental. I read some of the negative reviews and couldn't disagree more! We are already talking about going back! We arrived at noon on 9/10/08 and knew the check in time was 4pm. The desk clerk was very sweet and not only allowed us to check in early (no additional fee) but also upgraded us to a beautiful 7th floor room that faced the ocean. The room far exceeded our expectations. The king sized bed had a feather top and was extremely comfortable. We had a large flat screen TV too. The walls were painted a soothing light blue with tasteful art and a sofa, chair, and table. I loved our view from the balcony and enjoyed seeing it when we woke up in the morning. This is what a vacation should be! The pool area was large and mostly uncrowded. They provide a bracelet to wear in order to pick up towels and so you can get access to the connected beach. We were provided extra towels when we asked, although didn't really need them since they are more than adequate in size. The blue cushions on the lounge chairs made them extremely comfortable (be careful about falling asleep in the sun!). Another reviewer wrote that there was bird waste on the cushions but we didn't see too much of that (plus come on- we're outside!). We spent time in the jacuzzi and swimming under the 3 waterfalls, and visited the swim-up bar a few times too. The drinks were good (try the mojito) but expensive and a bit 'weak'. Some new friends told us to go to the bar closest to the beach and get the big 32 oz drinks (drink of choice: the yummy "Voodoo") to get our money's worth. We didn't order food at the pool area since it was a bit overpriced. For the most part, we ate our meals outside of the hotel since we like to try local food/restaurants. Mi Casita had excellent breakfast and dinner. The breakfast was inexpensive and filling (don't forget to order the potatoes!); our dinner was out of this world (I had the seafood paella and my husband had something they created for him). This is not fast food so you can't expect to get your food in 5 minutes! You should try Metropol for fabulous Cuban/Puerto Rican food (try Cuban fried pork, the grilled salmon, plantains, and definitely the black beans!). We went to Lupis for a casual dinner and loved the fajitas and beef enchiladas that we washed down with margaritas. We had a wonderful dinner at the hotel restaurant Momoyama on one night since we love sushi. We suggest the seafood tempura, spider roll, California roll ( or ANY of the sushi) and finish your meal with the guava cheesecake. The Manager came over a few times to check on us which was nice. The Concierge was more than helpful when we asked for suggestions. We took the rain forest tour and had a great time. The guide told us that it would be 7/10 of a mile but it was a lot longer with some steep hills/inclines which could be a bit slippery. Be sure to stretch before taking the tour and wear appropriate shoes/sneakers. We saw (huge) snails, birds, and plenty of lizards but not much other wildlife (such as snakes). We enjoyed seeing the beautiful lush scenery and waterfalls. The area near the main waterfall was a bit crowded and the water was cold but plenty of people enjoyed it. Be careful because the rocky terrain can hurt your feet- wear water shoes or sport sandals if going in near the waterfall! We rented a car from the hotel for the day (about $35) so we could explore a bit more (we didn't want to rent a car for the week since we didn't need it and parking at the hotel is $16/day). We went to Old San Juan and the huge Castillo San Felipe del Moro Fortress. We spent a lot of time on the beach since the water was so warm and a gorgeous blue hue. Dig your feet around a bit in the ocean and you might come up with some shells, coral, or sand dollars (be sure to wash, dry and bleach them after you get home). The on-site gym has all the machines or equipment you could want (or need?) to use. The ellipticals, bikes, and treadmills face the ocean and have tv screens built in. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and courteous. Again, I hope you stay at the Intercontinental and enjoy yourselves as much as we did! We can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars at best. We had problems, but management did come through for us.”
Reviews.Author: suzieboston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the IC San Juan in early September. I love Puerto Rico (this was my 5th hotel stay in PR in a year and a half) and was thrilled to bring along a friend who hadnâ€™t been before. We chose the IC because we found a really great deal online. I had been in a lobby a few times and it seemed nice. I wasn't scared away by a few negative reviews on Tripadvisor, but perhaps I should I have been. We encountered cleanliness issues in our room, and service issues in general. To give some specifics, we encountered a dirty carpet full of dust bunnies under the furniture, hair left in the shower, mold in the bathroom, half-hearted daily housekeeping, and a soiled bathrobe. Room service screwed up in several ways (waking me up before 7 am to verify my order which I placed the night before, then getting the order wrong anyway, and serving it cold). Waiters at the pool literally never came by, though we did see them, so we would eventually give up and get our own food and drinks. It was frustrating, but Irene, the club manager, did set things right for us, comping the room service and adding a few other nice touches. So, while we encountered annoyances, allâ€™s forgiven. She was extremely professional. Like most nearby resorts, they nickel and dime you; prepare to pay for everything. The best bet is to stock up on water, sunscreen, and snacks at the Walgreens right down the street. The gift shop has cheaper water than the bottles in the room if you need it. (FYI, there's no complimentary water in the gym except the old-fashioned communal water fountain; they will sell you a Gatorade for $3.) On the plus side, the hotel has a nice location on the beach, a good pool, a swim-up bar with great bartenders, and a decent gym. The waiter on the beach (not poolside) did come around often enough. The gentleman who sets up chairs and umbrellas on the beach, Jose, was very friendly. Because management took the time to hear my concerns and fix the problems, I canâ€™t give this place a less than three stars, though it's really more like a 2.5 out of 5. I wish I didnâ€™t have to take time out of my stay to complain, which I donâ€™t like to do. I think part of the problem may have been that it was a generally slow season but a busier holiday weekend, thus they may have had more people than the staff could handle. I also feel like the IC is an upscale chain, but this particular IC is not like other Intercontinentals. This IC thinks itâ€™s a 4-star hotel but operates more like a 3-star. A better choice in the same price range is the Courtyard Marriot Isla Verde, which is not as fancy a hotel (no high end steakhouse, no opulent lobby) but absolutely excels in its class and has great service and better food. As for Ruth's Chris, I have now eaten there twice and am not impressed at all. You can get less awkward service and similar quality cooking at the Outback, but if you want to splurge, go the BLT Steak . I've probably eaten there at least 10 times and each time it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull Property - Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: miamiskyboy
Reviews.Content: This resort leaves a lot to be desired. The place is very, very old. The lobby and public areas have been somewhat re-done. But not to the standards of Intercontinental property's in the US. Check in was a breeze, courteous, and very efficient. Except that I was charged an additional resort tax and fees that where never mentioned when I booked my reservation. A resort fee at a resort that charges a fortune for water in your room, charges for everything. So not sure what the resort fee is for. My room was dated, worn, and torn. The furniture was very old rattan and wood. The french door with mirrors for the bathroom was very 1980. The A/C was loud and did not cool to well. Carpets where frayed, stained and torn. Not the room that you would expect at an Intercontinental Hotel. It was actually a Jr. Suite with a separate bedroom and living room. Old style box televisions and no mini-bar, no robes, no upgraded amenities. I faces the lagoon. My friend had a room facing the ocean (#820). Those rooms have plasma TV;s and upgraded furniture and bedding. But the rooms (mine was #821) with odd numbers that face the lagoon are old school. Make sure u make it clear ar check in that you want one of the newer rooms. Turndown service is a joke. Its not included automatically. You have to request it. All the do is come in and close curtains. That's it. No chocolate, no refreshing of room. no extra towels. Nothing. Why even offer turndown service if they are not going to do it the right way ? Pool area is absolutely amazing. What a nice pool and bar area. I really enjoyed that part of my stay. Except that the hotel has this crazy policy about (1) single pool towel per guest. You have to sign for it, get a bracelet, the whole thing is in convenient and more "Cancun all inclusive $79 a night hotel" then 5 star resort. I mean at almost $400 a night on average here. You expect a certain level of service. The chaise lounges have comfy blue cushions on them. But they are all dirty, old, mildewy . and stained. You need (1) towel to cover them and then (1) towel for yourself. There are no bar attendants that come to you. You have to go to bar yourself and get your orders in. Drinks are expensive and taste terrible. Spa was ok. I had a massage with a male therapist. He was good. But they cheated me out of 5 min of my service. He finished earlier. This is not honest and not right. I was upset. But they did not seem to care. The girl at the desk did give me a 5% off for my inconvenience. But an apology would of been better then 5% off. The spa has a relaxation area with bottles of water and tea. But there is no sugar for the tea, no honey, and nothing to stir the tea with. When I asked or honey or sugar. I was told they had none ??? Breakfast at "Alfredo's" is cheap at only $22. When you consider the variety and quality of the food. Its a good deal and the selection is fantastic. I did the buffet every morning and highly recommend it. But the service from the wait staff was mediocre at best. They where slow and no responsive to guest needs. At check out. I had an early flight. I tried to check out the night before. I was told at 12AM that I could not do that because system was in "audit" to do it in the morning, I tried at 5AM to check out. Again was told that they would charge all to my Credit Card on file. They could not take my cash because they where in Audit. I waited until 5:30AM and almost missed my flight. I had to leave there without being able to pay in cash and they charged my Credit Card. This is not fair as I intended to pay in cash. If this where like any other Intercontinental in the US. This would of never happened. Hotel is in a great location and right on the ocean. If you get a good deal on hotwire or priceline then I guess its ok. But DO NOT pay the rates on intecontinental.com. You will be sorry !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RubenV76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night of a 7night stay in Puerto Rico for my Anniversary. I can tell you it was amazing!!! I loved this hotel and the staff was extremely friendly and the resort was beautiful and elegant. They upgraded me to a ocean view and I have been to a few hotel resorts in Puerto Rico and my recommendations is this one hands down so far. I also reccomend Embassy Suites, Condado Plaza and Radison as a lower classs than most others but fairly good. I loved the Intercontiental it was gourgeous and my best hotel stay ever in Puerto Rico. I can tell you they are friendly, want to ensure you have a pleasant stay and ensure you get the quality you come to expect from a hotel with their star level.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Maedog
Reviews.Content: When we went to check-in, the very nice desk clerk upgraded my husband & I to an ocean view room due to low occupancy (low season in P.R.). The room itself was lovely and very clean (the view was gorgeous!). Every staff member we encountered was very helpful and polite. Several restaurants are located within the Intercontinental but we did not try them due to lack of time. The small bar downstairs is adequate for drinks & the casino is nice if you like to gamble. The bar food is laughably overpriced and if you are remotely adventurous, hoof it to the Taco Bell for some late night food (about 2 blocks down on Isla Verde Avenue). There are also two Walgreens on Isla Verde Avenue, so you can easily pick up water etc. on your trip. If you drive, the parking lot is across the street for $16 dollars a day. Make sure you ask the desk clerk for the paper pass to put in your car.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: CrazySammi
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent our first vacation in a city view room at the Intercontinental. I have no serious complaints! The first night I got there, I didn't really like the area, as there are a FEW abandoned businesses around. By the second night, the area had intoxicated me! It's so charming, clean (you could go barefoot) and everyone is so pleasant. ***Hotel PROS & CONS*** I can't even think of any serious complaints. The restaurants were pricey? But the food was delish. We booked trips through the hotel, they cleaned our room as long as we left the sign on the door, the AC was comfortable, there was a mini-fridge, cofeemaker...Ok, yeah the TV sucked but we weren't really on vacation to watch TV! Balcony was small, but we weren/t on vacation to stay on our balcony either. ***Beach PROS &CONS*** PROS: -not a ton of annoying noisy kids around, but there are more at the pool -water is turquoise(but not crystal clear) -water is calm -parasailing and jet skis activities available CONS: -some may be annoyed by the airplanes (I only noticed them 2 or 3x during our 4 day stay, and we spent hoursssssss on the beach[and I am sensitive to noise) Restaurants we went to: Mi Casita: is right across the street and the food was DELICOUS, even though the service was a little slow. A meal there will run you about $30-$50 Platos: A little more pricey. They serve a Paella that can feed at least SIX grown men for $45. I think it's a recurrign theme for relaxed Islands like PR- the service was a little slow. Lupis: DISGUSTING! The meal came out to just over $50, yet made Taco Bell look like a freaken' gourmet restaurant. Def. a tourist trap. For daytime fun: We booked a day catamaran trip through our hotel for $88? per person. Pros: (for day trip) -Our first stop was at Icacos, an AMAZING deserted island whose waters were crystal clear. Seriously, you could see like every grain of sand on the ocean floor -Yummy food -Energetic staff Cons: -Catamaran shelter leaked when it started raining -we didnt' spend nearly enough time at Icacos, but spent more time on Culebra (?) whose waters had more interesting fish but murkier water -Catamaran bathroom was nasty, no airfreshner, and sinks with no running water. The area had a Walgreens which was 4 minutes away. Whatever we ran out of or needed, was a 4 minute walk away at Walgreens If you want to save money, get some $3 coolers from there and get some water and cold cuts. You can get the same souveniers they sell in the souvenir shops for less than half the price. Next time we may rent a car so we can explore a bit more, but there are so many amazing things to do in that area.

Reviews.Title: “TOP NOTCH RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Pamela07435
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the resort. Excellent service, beautiful beach, pool and amenities. The hotel food is expensive but there are plenty of places to eat off the resort.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good trip ..”
Reviews.Author: Sarah475
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for 5 nights and we really did not have any problems. I know there are some awful reviews on here, but we had a mostly good experience. Hotel: We were given a room when we arrived and there was no waiting. It was next to the elevator and we asked to be moved, which we were immediately and the receptionist was really nice about it. We were moved to a bigger room with a couch and table, large fridge and comfy bed. It was clean! And the maid service was great - we always had clean towels. We also had no problems with the elevators being slow, never once did we have to wait long for one. One morning there was some banging when something was being fixed, but it didnt start until 9.30 am and wasn't a problem. Your not going to PR to hang out in your room! Ours faced the street which was also quite nice, you get a view of the city. Restaurants: The food at the hotel is great - yes it is a bit pricey but if you're looking for a budget holiday you should stay elsewhere. All the restaurants in the hotel were very good, as was the poolside bar and grill. Drinks are the same price as any hotel on a beach ($10 - 12) - and they tasted good! There is the strip of shops across the road, but the food was so so. Theres a subway and several fast food places. Mi casita and Gelo were ok for breakfast, but a warning, you end up smelling of the grill if you go to these places, it is very strong, so dont wear your best outfits there. The coffee ar Mi casita was probably the worst cup I have ever had - just to warn you. PR coffee is amazing but try it elsewhere. We also tried outback steakhouse down the road and it was below par, not up to the usual standards. Ruth Chris's in the hotel is very very good, my favorite. Alfredos is also good - the breakfast buffet was very nice ($22 each). Beach and Pool: This is what you go to San Juan for!! The beach was beautiful and clean - as was the pool. Lovely blue water. A fantastic place to relax. There are always loads of chairs to choose from, never full. And plenty of unbrellas. If they start packing up the beach at 5.30 pm you can just move over to the pool, its 5 feet away. You get wrist bands too and security seemed very good. You can hire an umbrella on the beach for $5 and a guy sets it up for you. The sun is very strong so wear sunblock! There's a walgreens up the street with everything you need and we got drinks and snacks here too. We had 5 minutes of rain for the whole week - weather was fantastic. Surounding area: The area around the hotels is a bit sad and run down. It is NOT a resort outside the hotel, so if you are looking for that, I suggest you stay elsewhere. Old San Juan is lovely, really worth the trip and we ate at Barrachina which was wonderful. The sangria and pina coladas were so so good. There are lots of cute stores and beautiful buldings. Cab costs $21 to get there. It was very hot in San Juan, so we went later in the day and it was better. Many stores close at 5.30pm but the restaurants are open much later. This hotel is near the airport - so you see and hear some planes. It did not bother us at all and was not loud. Again if this bothers you - stay on another part of the island. Cab from the airport is $14. Casinos: This is not vegas, nor should it be. There are slots and tables, plenty in each hotel if you want to gamble a bit. The machines are on the older side, but it was fun. The hotel next door - El san Juan has a larger casino, but I thought that hotel was tacky and somewhat creepy. The lobby has lots of bars and there is a starbucks there if you need one. All in all we had a great vacation - but make sure you have the right expectations. This is a place to relax, get a suntan and lay on the beach. If you're looking for a glitzy activity packed vacation you'll probably be a bit disappointed here. But we loved relaxing and found this hotel to be pretty good. I would go back, but perhaps would try another part of the island. The Intercontinental is the best hotel in this area from what we saw - so I would recommend it. It may not be as good as some other intercontinentals but it gets a B+ from me. I have definitely had some bad hotel experiences in the past, but lucky for us, this was not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at The InterContinental San Juan - Not worth the money.....”
Reviews.Author: GAPCHPANTHER
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Intercontinental San Juan Resort and was thoroughly disappointed. I am familiar with the hotel brand and expected alot more from the hotel. I arrived at 5pm on 08/02/08. My room was not ready. My room was not available until after 8pm. My reservation was for a Laguna View and was made back on May 3. I received a regular room with no explanation. Upon entering the room, I noticed the bathroom was filthy. The bath tub was dirty and the bath mats were dirty as well. The refrigerator was molded and stained. The comforter was stained. I dropped a pen beside the bed and night table. When I leaned down to pick it up, there were old cookies in the floor that apparently had never been cleaned up. I was thoroughly disgusted. I didn't even unpack. I immediately went downstairs and asked for a manager. The front desk told me there was no manager available. I explained to her the situation and told her if that was best your hotel could offer at your prices I would rather find another hotel. She just stood there looking at me like I was crazy. She then told me I would have to pay for a night stay and a 100.00 penalty even though I received none of what I paid for. We stayed and our stay continued to get worse. Housekeeping left one towel an one washcloth for two people. We asked for extra towels for the next day. When they cleaned they took the extra towels we requested. The towels left were stained. While we were on the beach a worker comes over to us and tells us they start collecting the beach chairs at 5:30. The sun is still up and if you are paying $200 plus a night you should be able to stay until sunset at least. I will never stay there again. I previously stayed at the Howard Johnson and Embassy Suite much better rates, cleaner, and better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I dreamed it could be!”
Reviews.Author: tropicsnme
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days at this beautiful hotel with my family. The entire experience was relaxing, pampering and very classy. Every employee we encountered was polite and helpful; restaurants are amazing, pool and beach are pristine; spa services were spectacular. Had great weather days and an excursion to sail and snorkel was awesome. The negative reviews I had read before the trip must have come from people who weren't prepared to act and spend like a four diamond guest at a four diamond hotel--you get what you pay for and everything was worth it. Sure, you can save some money eating across the street at the fast food joints; but while on vacation, why not experience the new? The bus ride to Senor Frogs was dicey but spend the money on the cab--you'll get there faster and with less stress. There is never a wait for pool/beach chairs, restaurants, taxis. The drinks are a little pricey and weak but if you stick to the 32 ouncers, (like the voodoo!) you get your money's worth. Restaurants have an amazing wine/specialty drink menu. Take the leap and make this your next vacation spot--you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice, both for 4-5 day getaways. It's super convenient to the airport (5 minutes away) and San Juan is easy to get to from the east coast. Perfect for a quick beach trip. This hotel, in my opinion is an excellent choice for just such a vacation. Staff is friendly, helpful, and responsive. We had a very good experience in all of our interactions with them. The facility is very well maintained with the feel of an upscale beach resort. Casino is decent sized and has a good variety of tables and machines. It's not Vegas of course but it will fit the bill if you are looking to gamble. I was generally able to find a spot at a $5 blackjack table. The rooms are spacious and well decorated. However, I concur with the other reviewers that the walls can be kind of thin, hopefully you get good neighbors. The bed was comfortable and our room was cleaned well daily, no problems with maid service. Hotel restaurants are good, Ruth's Chris makes a mouth watering steak and the breakfast buffet, while not cheap, was well done. The beach is great, spacious and uncrowded. We loved it! The pool here is top notch, plenty of space and chairs both shady and sunny. The bar also makes good drinks (although really pricey). The hotel has efficient and plentiful security. The neighborhood of Isla Verde is fine to walk around in both the days and evenings. There isn't a ton of stuff around though. If you are looking for a neighborhood with more restaurants and nightlife you might be better off going to the Condado area of San Juan. Overall, I would return and recommend this as a quality place to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Enjoyed It!!!”
Reviews.Author: brownsugamd
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been planning our wonderful romantic get a way about 4 months in advance, after much reviews from tripadvisor, travelocity and everything else i could find we finally decided to travel to San Juan. It was a quick flight for both of us and we knew we wanted to stay somewhere fun and yet romantic at the same time. We choose to stay in Isla Verde and Im glad we did. All the beaches in P.R. are public and this particular beach, is lined with a strip of hotels. Upon arrival to intercontinental we were greeted by HELPFUL, sweet and really nice bell hops and service guys. We arrived early before check in which is 4 pm. They took our bags, allowed us to check in, and use their facilities while we waited for our room to get ready. We strolled the hotel, which is beautiful. It has an amazing pool and jacuzzi, a spa, 24 gym, and the beach is right in the backyard. There are many restaurants to eat at. Now at Intercontinental, im sure you can book the cheapest room and have the same experience. We purchased a laguna room and we face the front of the city towards san juan. You can see the city lights and sky at night from our balcony. This time of year seems to be tropical rainy season, which we had for the first 2-3 days but it doesnt last long, usually at night, and even if it kinda ruin your plans for the day, your room and the hotel is a great place to stay. We didnt eat much here at the hotel because we know it is expensive, but this ave is a strip full of hotels and shopping area. Right across the street there is a little center. There is ponderosa food (which is kinda like a buffet salad bar, finger food type place), lins chinese which is excellent, and this puerto rican home cooked style place called Mi Casita, which my bf and I particular loved, the food is great and the price is reaaaallllyyy cheap. We had breakfast 1 morning, and it was only $12 for the both of us, they give you really good food and the right portion. They are open from 7am-10pm, most places here close @ 11pm so make sure you eat according to time. There is also wendy's, burger king, a little supermarket, a walgreens a few blocks down, (make a right when you exit the hotel in front entrance). For night life, we went from hotel to hotel. Intercontinental is classy and sophisticated, but if you need a dj, bar, lounges and music, head to El San Juan Hotel, which is left from intercontinental. They have a huge hotel lobby which is fun and exciting, the dj plays music and there is also a house band for a more local experience. There is also lounges and alot of bars, dress to impress at these places. To the right of intercontinental, at the water club approx 2-3 blocks down, then a sharp right.. there is a restaurant called Tangerine/ Liquid. And a roof top sushi bar on the 17th foor, open roof that overlooks the ocean. Prices are ok. There is also local shops, bars, grills and other places on this avenue. For a Local experience, head to old san juan. We took the bus, it was just like a NYC bus. 0.75 cents to the last stop takes you to the bus terminal downtown. Be prepared to walk. We walked the tourist area where the cruise ships dock and also made our way to the historic sites, by the forts which was $3.00 per person to enter, definitely worth it because it was fun and you get a great view of San Juan. El Yunque Rainforest is a must. There is a half day trip from 9:30am-3pm. Its $57.00 a person through the hotel. The tour guide picks you up, gives you a tour while driving, a cave trip, history of P.R., rainforest info, and waterfall treats. This rainforest is about a 1.5 hr trip. Alot of walking, defintiely a cardiovascular workout, uphill and downhill through the forest, very beautiful and romantic .. a must see.. we stopped for lunch at a local place right by the rainforest for what i thought was some of the best P.R. food ever, definitely try the beans and rice with fried chicken and sweet plaintains, ($1.00 items -$6.00) other packages include 3 trips, the rainforest, beach and a nite rafting trip, supposedly the water illuminates in the nite while you boat near the forest. Food on the Hotel: we ate by the beach, at Splash , mostly wraps, finger foods, salads.. good food. drinks and food from $12. other than that, we didnt do much, the casino is not as big as some other hotels but if you dont like to gamble much like me, its ok. You can hotel hop, and no one I.D.'s you , you can enjoy the facilities everywhere. overall this was a great experience and i hope if others are like me, i hope this helped. I thought the service was great, the customer service was excellent, we never had a problem and if we did they were more than happy to help us, very friendly and CLEAN.. our rooms were cleaned everyday with new towels and linens. coffee maker, ice bucket, fridge, safe, iron, alarm clock (ipod home) and cable t.v. in room. official website and pics are accurate.. a beautiful experience!! and complimentary wireless internet from every room which i am submitting this review since we are leaving tomorrow :) we didnt rent a car but if you feel you need too, the hotel has an avis hook up in the lobby where you can get , if you need to or change your mind 24hr rental for about $40 .

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: NortonBNorton
Reviews.Content: I used trip advisor review as a major part of my decision to stay at the Intercontinental, as well as a friends recommendation. We had stayed at the Ritz previously. I booked an ocean view rm and the price at the time of my stay was approx 400+ dollars plus the daily resort fee. We arrived around 1 pm and did have to wait for the normal check in time. Our room was gorgeous and had a great view. However, the walls were literally paper thin. Every day I would go up to the room around noon and there were children in the room directly next to us, they were singing and jumping on the beds, throwing objects against the wall and so on. This would go on until early evening, I never saw them, or an adult. I found that very strange. The beach was very nice but you had to reserve and pay for an umbrella. The pool area was nice, just small. The weather was very hot and very bright, no complaints. I think the one thing that really really surprised me was the cost of food there. Make no mistake, it might as well be Hawaii or the caribbean. Lunch at the beach restaurant for two daily was over $50 and we are talking pizza or salads. I was very disappointed in the housekeeping, very hit or miss. Some days I had to call after 4pm as they had not been there and we really needed at least more towels so we could get ready for dinner. We ate at Ruth Chris as well as the Palm and the food was very good but very very expensive. The hotel Italian restaurant was very good, very very expensive. I would guess each meal was close to $200 for two. The elevators were very hit and miss as well and as I read reviews today, I wonder why that problem cannot be fixed.some days only one elevator and it is a long wait. So I guess I would end my review by saying this hotel never lived up to my expectations, perhaps I had set them too high?The casino was very sad, very few machines and it seems there are no rules as to dress and behavior. I saw many many people eating food they had obviously brought from home -it just did not add to a resort atmosphere. Did gamble at the El San Juan, just lovely and what a beautiful lobby and bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BlessedV
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip for a very great rate on jetblue.com. Its about a 10 minute drive from the airport & next to all the best places to eat. You can rent a car from AVIS in the hotel looby. The staff is very friendly and helpful. You have to rent a carr for a day or so to go ride ATV's & to see some of the other beaches. We took the bus to Old San Juan, which to me was a waste - but you may like it so give it a try. The Bacardi Factory was nice. Our fave local restaurants are Mi Casita (across the street in strip mall) & Gelo (strip mall a few stores past Mi Casita) Gelo's breakfast is a lot better than Mis Casita in my opinion. If there is rain in the forecast it only means it will rain for about 10 mins...The casino is cool esp black jack. The resort is beautiful & well maintained. Drinks could have been better. Walgreens is walking distance & so is Denny's which is open 24hrs When you walk out the back of the hotel there is a pool area, and the most beautiful beach right behind it...both of which are open 24hrs. Great hotel...no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Staff Is Awesome! IBar staff Rocks! Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: MomOf2Atlanta
Reviews.Content: What an amazing vacation!! Puerto Rico is wonderful! The people were very friendly and happy. They really seemed to be proud of their home. Living in such a beautiful place , I can understand why. The Intercontinental is a beautiful hotel. It's not far from the airport, so you can start your vacation immediately and stay until the last possible minute. The beach was gorgeous. The staff at the hotel were all extremely helpful and friendly. The staff at the IBar were especially great. David, one of the bartenders, is terrific! I was on a girls trip with my friend (no husbands or kids) and the staff really made us feel welcomed and at ease. The excursion to the Rainforest was wonderful. Make sure to ask for Hector's tour. He was very knowledgeable and fun too. The snorkeling trip to Culebra was awesome too. The concierge booked everything for us. It was a wonderful, worry free vacation. I will be back as soon as I can. I enjoyed every minute of it! Marsha -Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “Superior service”
Reviews.Author: downunder1975
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. The wonderful experience started from the first minute we pulled up in the taxi. We were met with some of the friendliest and most helpful staff we have experienced in all our travels. Everyone we interacted with (front desk, conceirge, door staff, bell staff, pool people, waiters, etc.) treated us extremely well and really made the experience. Even Socorro at the Avis counter in the hotel was extremely helpful! Our Club Intercontinental room was right by the pool, gym and spa. We apprecited the additional privacy and ability to walk right out to the pool area and the beach. The furnishings were a tasteful Caribbean motif (no over the top sea foam green and flamingo pink) with a lot of tropical wood. The only"issues" were that the sliding glass door was hard to open and close, the walls were a little on the thin side if you have really loud talkers (we have those neighbors for one day) and the ceiling in the bathroom was a little low. We used the gym. It was one of the nicest hotel gyms we have ever used. Everything was new. We did have our last lunch at the hotel's Japanese offering, Momoyama. The Pepper Tuna appetizer was amazing. The rest of the sushi was good, but nothing spectular. The staff was, again, extremely friendly. We loved this hotel and will definitely stay there the next time we are in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Review: Great Choice for All”
Reviews.Author: caribe_chic
Reviews.Content: I'll make this short and sweet. The Intercontinental is perfect for couples, friends, families, and kids. The pool area is great, the beach, though public, is beautiful, and the food is outstanding. Know that the price adds up, as not much is included in the room rate, but for a quick getaway, its perfect. The room was small, standard, but the bed was SO comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel to all planning to visit the Isla Verde area. Contact me for any futher details.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: jloatx
Reviews.Content: Coming from St. Croix our flight was delayed in San Juan and we decided to stay a few days. The InterContinental was suggested by the gate agents and we are glad they did. The hotel was magnificent and our ocean view room was amazing. Since we had no prior plans to stay here we checked with the concierge and he gave us an excellent plan of attack. We saw Old San Juan and the castillos and also drove over to the rainforest. The pool area was spacious and had plenty of chairs to pick from. The swim up bar closed just was we were there which was disappointing. The beach was beautiful and lovely for walking along. I even found a live sand dollar! The casino was small and it hard to find a machine in the evening. We dined at Alfredo's and the food was delicious. My favorite part of the room was the bed/bedding. I hope to be able to contact them to try and find out what brand(s) it was. We asked with the front desk on check-out but they said to contact housekeeping. Overall an excellent "extended" vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip for little kids”
Reviews.Author: andytevez
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just returned from a late June one week stay. Kids are 3 and 5. Pool is great for kids that age and pool very nice, clean and accessible. No seaweed anywhere and I'm assuming that when it does accumulate it's after a storm and the hotel would clean it up promptly. Service was great except for the concierge and we had no problems with housekeeping. And yes we got the free upgrade but I think that was possible because there were available rooms and it was low season - I wouldn't count on it at different times of the year. We booked the trip through Costco - all very smooth and the breakfast special they get you is great. If you have kids go to El Morro in Old San Juan on a cloudy day and fly kites for a day - easiest kite flying conditions you'll ever have due to the wind -- and you can buy kites there for $3-$4. Also, the hotel based Avis lady gave me a great tip on where to eat near Luquillo Beach --> try the Kiosko #2 La Parilla if you like seafood ! That beach is about 45 minutes away and is beautiful to be sure but extremely hot hot hot and zero wave action. The hotel and facilities were great and I'd recommend the place to somebody with little kids but to help you manage your expectations I've listed some negatives below. Negatives: 1) the 3 elevators servicing 16 floors were unreliable and kind of a pain but most of the guests took it well so it was a running joke. 2) the concierge(s) were useless and actually gave bad information. For example, I told them that I'd be taking the kids to Old San Juan and asked them if it would be easy to find some simple food for them there -- like a pizza. They said there were no such choices and instead directed me to an Italian sit down restaurant and a Caribean themed restaurant. When I went anyway and went to the center of town - the Plaza de Armas - I found myself surrounded by familiar kids places - mcdonalds, wendy's, burger king, etc. This would lead me to conclude that the concierges get compensated for directing people to specific places. They also gave me misinformation about the trip to Culebra Island. The concierge you see in hotel website video must have retired or something. 3) if you read reviews about the local, nearby restaurants be forewarned. The Mi Casita restaurant is close and may be good but it's always packed for dinner so don't expect to just walk over. Also, the Fast Food places near the hotel are the slowest I've ever experienced - the Burger King was stunning in it's tortoise pace, and we left after waiting for 15 minutes in a line that didn't move. The Wendy's was slightly faster. The workers were nice enough but totally inefficient. So dinners are a problem unless you drive elsewhere. Avoid: Rain forest excursion - It's 1 hour there, 1 hour back and then 90 minutes in a bus through the forest with a little 20 minutes walk. Total waste of time and I wish I had driven there myself and walked around on my own. I guess if you can't walk or are drunk from a cruise the excursion might make sense but otherwise it's a waste.

Reviews.Title: “All in All a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: blueridgeVirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental from 7/8 through 7/12. I had a package that included the breakfast buffet and a tour of the rain forest. I was travelling with my husband, two young kids and my father - so clearly it was mixed company. However, all of us had a great time there. The overall experience was sublime. So here are my thoughts: 1) Hotel Beach and pool: The Pool is fabulous ..it has a swim up bar, jacuzzi, and several waterfalls. The water is as deep as as 61/2 feet and as shallow as 3. I would just sit under the waterfall and get a water massage. There were plenty of seats/cabanas at the pool. The beach too is nice. There was a bit ofseaweed but nothing out of control. You can rent an umbrella for the beach but we just found a palm tree and moved our seats under it. The waves can be a bit rough at times so those with small children should be careful but my 9 and 7 year had way too much fun. 2) Food: We had our very first meal there at Mi Casita across the street. Very friendly and reasonably priced. I did try the mofongo. The filling was fabulous but the mofongo itself is a quite bland (not the reataurants fault ..just the way it is). I found the food to be pricey in PR overall not too many mid priced choices. We did eat at Ruth's Chris in the hotel one day which was wonderful. As for my other favorite place it was Tantra in OSJ. We ate at Barrachina in Isla Verde as it came so highly recommended by everyone. Maybe we did not order the right things or the one in OSJ is better..but this was my only really bad food experience. It just was not that special compared to what you were paying. I had ordered a Nacho Platter and it was the worst I have had and I really cant imagine messing that up. As I mentioned we did the breakfast buffet. It was great and the all the wait staff is so nice. 3) Transportation: We rented a car one day ..to go to the Bio bay. The driving wasn't too bad you just have to be a bit more vigilant and the road signage is not the greatest. But we dont have any horror stories to report there. We rented the car from the Avis right in the hotel and it was easy to be able to pick up and return the car right there. We also used the bus one day. Not bad, takes you through some bad areas but you are not going there so who cares. The bus is clean and air conditioned and only cost 75 cents to OSJ. One thing no one told us is they take exact change only..no bills allowed. 4) Sites we visited: El Yunque, fascinating but it was my least favorite. Bio Bay (vieques) we used East Wind Cats. Loved that though the time in the water was too short. El Morro, loved that too its an amazing structure a must see. OSJ is wonderful ..the most charming architecture and cute shops. My only "issue" at the hotel was that we originally did not get a room with a king bed though our reservation stated that. However the hotel upgraded us to an ocean view room with a king bed. Everyone in the hotel and PR was so nice, I was sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: noahbrain
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my girlfriend and I because it was close to the airport and close to San Juan. I made a good choice. I rented a car at the airport for $20 per day and drove to the hotel. We jumped in the ocean asap and was surprised that it was better than the reviews I had read. The beach was not outstanding, but it was warm and not crowded. The pool was nice, but smaller than I expected. The room was nice, eventhough we had a supersaver deal and they put us on a lower floor.The food was expensive, so the car came in handy to search out nice restauants. We drove to San Juan almost every night. San Juan has alot to offer, it was not a disappointment. All in all this was not a world class hotel, but it met my expectations. I would probably go back , given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Incidential Fees $100 per Day! No Warning”
Reviews.Author: PRPrincess_8
Reviews.Content: I went on a family vacation, the hotel was nice, employees were nice, housekeeping came everyday, beach was beautiful, pool was pretty. Casino was small but when you can get a waitress they will gvie you free drinks and a hot sandwich! I had a city room over looking the main entrance. Comfortable beds, large towels, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, shower cap, shoe shine cloth, soap. Iron, hair dryer, fridgem coffee machine. In room safe, cable TV.Only thing missing was a microwave. However, you are not told when you book the room that they will charge a hold on your credit card $100.00 incidential fee for each day that you stay. I had 2 rooms so that was $800.00! they put on hold. I tried to argue with them stating that they were tying up $$ that I was planing on using during my stay. I told them that I had booked it directly from Intercontential and there was no mention of this fee only the 22% tax and resort fee on top of your room fee. They went on to explain that that's what all the hotels do and there was nothing that they could do because when they put through you credit card it automatically adds the $100 a day. Needless to say my credit card was short a couple of hundred so it was not approved and I had to give them another credit card or cash for the difference or they could not give me the room! As I was checking out 4 young ladies were checking in and to their dismay they were being told about the $100/day inc. fee, they too had to scrabble for the extra cash or else they could not get the room. I will be calling the hotel's main office to put in a formal complaint regarding this practice. It should be disclosed so that customers know that they will need extra money to be floating in a hold until your trip is over. We had 2 blackouts while we were there, one that was pre- scheduled by the power company between 10 am -2pm. And another one unanounced at about 8 am and lasted an hour. I was disappointed with the area in general. I am of Puerto Rican descent and it pains me to see such an unkept area. The streets needed repairs, there were abandon buildings in the area, your local homeless people, only one authentic puerto rician restaurant in the area. No Puerto Rican bakeries, or Pastellio /Alcapuria places in the area. With all the five star hotels in the areas you would think that they would invest in the surrounding community so that more people would come back not only for their hotel but for the culture itself. Tip: When you get to the aiport look for the tourism kisko, they wear orange shirts and they will make you a ticket for a cab to take you to the hotel they give you a fair price from the airport. However you have to watch some of the cab drivers, some just charge you $1 per checked luggage and some will charge you for every piece of luggage or carry on baggage. Same about of bags, I paid $4.00 extra coming and $8.00 going. Overall, the hotel was nice, staff was nice, the beach was awesome- clear water, some waves (watch small children-waves are sometime rough), it was warm, no fish just some sand dollars, no shells in the water most days. Go early to get a free beach chair, once they are gone they rent chairs for $4.00 a day, but they take them back at 6 pm. , so be prepared to sit on the sand if you want to stay pas 6 pm. Pool has plenty of chairs and cabanas, water fall is cute, goes up to 6 '6". Several sections to hang out in. Use lots of sunscreen, sun doesn't feel that hot but you will get burned fast! Go to Mi Casita for Puerto Rican food, range $8.00-$24 for dinner. Go to Walgreens for water, soda, snacks, coffee, slurppies. Pueblo supermarket is behind Embassy Suite hotel about a 8 minute walk. Fast food, Church's Chicken is pretty good, there's a Pizza Hut that is good and clean. Burger King, Wendy's, KFC is also there. The mini mart across the street is not well stock but for an emergency they'll do. This is still mi Isla Bonita, they just need to spruce it up a bit. with the help of the surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal401
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for a long weekend at the end of April/beginning of May with a friend for a winter weather getaway. Chose this hotel because the beach was supposed to be pleasant--it was. Pricey, but on the beach and private. The hotel will give you a wristband every day and you can get towels, neckrolls, or on the beach pay $10 for an umbrella and chairs. This keeps the beach in front of the hotel relatively limited to guests. Overall ambiance is quiet--not too many families and not too many spring breaker-types. Most seemed 20s and 30s on holiday. Rooms are very pleasant, comfy beds. The view was fantastic--over the hotel pool and gardens and full-on ocean view. I was disappointed there was no chairs/patio set, although we had a balcony. Only complaint with the rooms was housekeeping. They did not seem to replenish the towels (had to call several days) and the linens did not get changed on the 4th day as stated. We had to call for this too. Housekeeping was very prompt to respond to all calls. You can hear your neighbors if they are noisy. There are some good cheap options for breakfast across the street in the strip mall, including a bakery with fantastic PR coffee (a new obsession). Spa was small but nice. Had a massages and a pedicure. They have both a steam room and sauna you can use after spa treatments. Rained some during our stay which meant the rainforest was closed. Rain lasted longer than I expected for a location his far south.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Well Maintained, and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ohiomichigangal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited in mid-June for our honeymoon. I chose the Intercontinental over several hotels in the same area, and we are so glad we did! We were upgraded to an ocean view room upon arrival. The ocean view is SPECTACULAR! You can see the neat, tropical pool area too. We were offered early check-in, pretty much as soon as we arrived from the airport. The room was the perfect size for a couple, chicly decorated, and although they did miss a day or two of cleaning it, housekeeping responded promptly to all of our requests. Pluses: Beautiful hotel, very clean, wonderful service from bell boys to housekeeping to concierge, several on-site restaurants and bars, great TVs in rooms, near a couple cute places like Lupis down the street, and fun/large pool area Minuses: Sub-par food at all the restaurants including room service food, WAY OVERPRICED food and drink (just don't plan to eat and drink within the hotel unless you like $15 made-from-frozen hamburgers and $10 vodka-cranberries), not the most glamorous or convenient location (cost us $22 minimum to take a cab anywhere we wanted to go - there just isn't much to do in this part of San Juan) Overall we had a romantic, lovely time, felt like we got a relatively good deal (paid $2300 total for the two of us for 4 nights/5 days - included airfare, hotel, food/drink while there, cab rides, and a kayaking trip), and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: texasscouser
Reviews.Content: Rooms very nice we booked 2 laguna views but for $40 more a night per room we were upgraded to 10th and 11th floor ocean views. The featherbed pillow tops were so comfy that we ordered 2 when we got home. The free wireless internet is very fast I was getting download speeds of 220 kbs. The free in room safe was huge big enough for a laptop. and an empty fridge was very useful. The first day we stocked up with lots of beer softdrinks and liquor from the supermarket across the road. The casino has waitresses providing free alcoholic drinks and sandwiches which are gorgeous we loved their pina coladas. We play video poker machines and we were a bit dissapointed that the machines here only pay out 5 credits for 2 pair this can make a huge difference to play time as vegas machines pay out 10 credits for 2 pair this together with the wait times for the elevators were the only negatives for this hotel. We had to push both up and down on the elevators and go along for the ride just to get on else you could be standing there for many minutes. The ocean was the nicest I have ever been in very warm and clean and with a very welcome constant breeze. We ate once in the breakfast buffet it was very nice but about $5 overpriced. Also we ate once in Alfredos italian. the prices for the food are not to bad but the wine list is very overpriced the cheapest was $40. For 4 with wine was $230. We went to mi Casita for breakfast very reasonable but extremely slow. It took 10 minutes to bring a menu 20 minutes for coffee and 30 minutes for the food to arrive. We also ate at Lupis, Metropol and the Ranch all excellent. If you go at the end of june you may see this guy in the photo walking the beach he comes every year and entertains the ladies. The cab fare is $15.50 from the airport for 4 with 4 bags and $21 to old san juan try to get dropped off at the castillo san felipe del morro as the walk through old san juan is then mostly down hill. The liquor laws seem very loose here as they served my 16 year old daughter without question. Also the duty free in the airport allows purchases to the US. All in All an excellent vacation which I give 8 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach and pool, poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: lilypookie
Reviews.Content: Negatives: -Stayed at San Juan Isla Verde arrived around 1p, not accommodated w/ early check in until 4p by that time kids were cranky and tired. -House keeping horrible, dirty comforter was set aside to be changed instead they used the same comforter, flipped it around. Did not come daily, had to call to get room made. -Bathroom is small. -Cafe by pool and Italian place included tip charges even for take out. -Business center charges a fee for internet services. Positives: -Hotel decorated nicely...most of staff very friendly -kids love the pool and beach, beach entrance closes early. -taxi convenient located outside the hotel --mini mall w/ food restaurants across the street (starbucks next hotel over), brand name pharmacy walking distance -provides towels and beach chairs for beach -mini Refrigerator, iHome radio, made in Paris hair shampoo/cond, comfortable bed -small casino open 12n-4am....can use casino comp towards food and room -Restaurants in hotel: Cafe by pool - good freshly made pizza, Jap restaurant - great habachi, Ruth Chris...do not recommend Italian restaurant -rent a car available Taxi cost (not including tips)...beats paying for gas and looking for parking: -To and from hotel: $10.5-11.00 each way -To and from Plaza las Americas mall: $18 each way (supposedly biggest in carribean - typical american malls) -To and from Old San Juan: $19 each way (lots of souvenir shops, stores are small and do not accommodate strollers, food costly esp authentic puerto rican food).

Reviews.Title: “Tough to Leave Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tinkwannabe
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to San Juan for a girls' weekend and to celebrate her birthday...there were great surprises from the beginning! The concierge upgraded us to a garden/pool view from a city view and had a cake waiting for my friend upon our arrival along with a personal message for her. Even the person checking us in wished her a happy birthday. The hotel is older but very clean and well-maintained and the pool is absolutely sublime! The waterfall gives an excellent massage...and the hot tub is the perfect temperature. The only complaint either of us had was the length of time we had to wait on the best pina coladas ever by the pool. The music was fun and the towels plentiful by the pool...and the attendants by the beach were glad to set up a beach chair immediately. The only place we dined onsite was the Japanese steakhouse...very good and the maitre'd was delightful but the restaurant was incredibly warm. We walked to restaurants in the area and there is a Starbucks in the lobby next door! I will definitely return...beach was fabulous and clean, iPod alarm clock for your own paradise playlists, taxis are always easily accessible, every request is met with a smile, service was expedient and the beds heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Feesh85
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through Costco Travel, which only has a limited number of hotels in Puerto Rico to choose from. I was reading mixed reviews here so I was a little nervous. Turns out the people bashing this hotel are either crazy or working for competing hotels. It truly is a four-star hotel. The location, rooms, grounds, staff, restaurants, etc. are all great. Every room has a balcony, and although my booking said I was getting a "Garden/Pool" view, I also had a view of the ocean (and no, I didn't have to stand sideways and lean over to see it!). The room was a really good size: I had even a desk and "living room area" with a couch and chair. The bathroom was fine, not anything spectacular but certainly better than average. I went to the Momoyama restaurant the first night, and ate at the Italian one for breakfast buffet every day since it was included in my package. Of course it's overpriced, but you're in a luxury tourist hotel and you either deal with it or you don't. There are plenty of fast food and "regular" places around to eat if you choose. I love Ruth's Chris (also in the hotel) but I figured I can eat that at home so I didn't check it out. The concierge staff could not have been more helpful. You sometimes are in for a wait to talk to them, but that's because they go out of their way to take their time with each person. They provided valuable tips such as to take the public bus to Old San Juan. Although I was a woman travelling alone, they assured me that it would be fine. They were right: it goes through "the projects" at some point, but it got me there just the same and I paid $1.50 round trip instead of $40 by taxi! I visited the spa also, which was very nicely appointed and very modern. I felt rushed during my massage (not their fault--long story) but the facial was amazing! With the exception of the waiter at the pool (had to practically stalk him to get a cocktail), every staff member was really friendly and top notch. Unless you're the Queen of England or something, I can't figure out who would find this hotel anything less than outstanding. The only complaint I'd really have is that the walls and doors are a bit too thin. Unfortunately toward the end of my stay, I had a particularly amorous couple next to me...I called the front desk and they explained that it's a common complaint and the next time it happened, they'd send security up to knock on the door and tell them to quiet down. I never had to (I later came out of my door at the same time as the guy, and gave him such a look that he was completely mortified!), but the hotel was ready to take care of it and that was much appreciated. I would highly recommend this hotel. It's luxury that's not too "full of itself", and I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “B- Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Well_Traveled_01
Reviews.Content: Overall, the room was just okay..nothing spectacular. Upon arrival the bathroom was disgusting. We called down and they sent someone up right away to clean it so they get an A for responsiveness. The workout room was slightly below average and several of the machines were broken. The pool was great and they had two different venues to dine at. Beware of the concierge staff...I would only deal with Nestor the others were not helpful or as knowledgeable. I would recommend booking excursions in advance since they fill up quickly. I can highly recommend www.acampapr.com. They are wonderful! DO NOT USE Adventuras! They are unreliable and have bad business practices. I have traveled all over the world and I have never been more appalled then with this tour operator. We asked around with the locals an apparently many others have had the same experience. Besides Acampa picks you up and drops you off at your hotel, provides lunch, and ensures that a portion of the money they receive goes back into the local community whereas Adventuras does none of the above!
