You have to find your own way to a local mtg place, bring your own food and we've been told by the locals that they do not reinvest in the community. To top it off their staff is rude and there is no customer service. (If you are American beware if you call and converse with someone who only speaks spanish. They use that as an excuse to say that there must have been a misunderstanding.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with many amenities”
Reviews.Author: vacationerBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. We were upgraded from a city view to a garden view room, which was on the 6th floor so you could see the ocean too. The room was a good size with a flat screen TV, separate couch/sitting area, fridge , plenty of counter space in the bathroom, and a small balcony. The bed was really comfortable. The AC unit like most everywhere I've stayed kicked on an off all night. There was no noise by the pool at night (I had been concerned about this) and very quiet in the halls, no noise from other rooms. Check in-our room wasn't ready until after 3, which was a pain b/c we got there at 10:30, not the hotel's fault by any stretch and they did offer us the hospitality suite if we wanted to change. One recommendation I would have would be for the hotel to invest in a couple of inexpensive chairs to fit on the balconies, it would really increase the experience to be able sit outside with coffee in the AM, or 'apre beach' to watch the sunset. The hotel surprised us with a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a lovely note from Irene, the guest relations manager whom I corresponded with prior to our visit. That was a really nice touch. The beach was great. I think the umbrellas should just be included in the cost of the room. For us they were a must as we are not used to the hot hot sun. Sometimes they would run out of towels if you went down late afternoon. But no rush to get chairs etc. The pool area was beautiful, we didn't use the pools though, as we like the beach better. The beach could get windy sometimes to the point of being sandblasted. The water was beautifully warm, and no seaweed. The beach was clean and it was great to have the little cafe/bar right there, though expensive!! Sticker shock even though I was warned. It gives one pause to ordering a bunch of frozen drinks all day! Nice mellow bar with friendly staff. We only ate at the cafe (an OK pizza), and Al Fredo for an appetizer of prosciutto and melon. Breakfast was really only the expensive buffet, we sat at the bar for a couple of coffees that ran $10. If you get "off campus" we ate at Metropol twice, great down home Cuban/Puerto Rican food. Mi Casita for breakfast once, OK, but not great service from our waitress who insisted on giving us American coffee when we wanted it Puerto Rican style. We also ate Mexican at Lupi's, it was OK. Taxi's as others have said expensive, $25 w/tip to Old San Juan. Did not use the spa. Gambled a bit, small casino, but you can get a $5 blackjack table and not as "intimidating" as some of the larger casinos if you're not a big gambler. I guess if I'm not sounding overly enthused it is because I discovered I really like smaller hotels. We also didn't rent a car, so while everything you really need is right at the hotel, it can cost a small fortune. For a family vacation I don't see how it could be affordable if you only stayed "on campus". The area outside the hotel is urban. We walked around a bit to check out some of the other hotels. The Walgreens only had two aisles open, the supermarket seemed like it was ready to close down too. The "mall" is definitely not a mall, just a few stores-not that we were looking for a mall, but in case someone is! Overall I found it a perfectly acceptable nice place to stay, nice lobby area, gorgeous pools, beach, restaurants, spa, casino, bar. A pretty mellow 'scene', unlike the El San Juan which was very glitzy. But I would stay in a different area next time. Oh and the planes nearby were no problem.

Reviews.Title: “This was great”
Reviews.Author: Krgl420
Reviews.Content: I initially booked my vacation to stay at the El San Juan, and after reading the horrible reviews, I decided to switch over to the Intercontinental. I was so relieved I did that. My friend and I got there at around 10am, we were checked in, and we hung out by the pool for about an hour and a half. They called me on my cell and we got a city view room on the top floor wiht a balcony, and the view really isn't as bad as it sounds. The room was extremely spacious, with enough closet space and a generous bathroom, big enough for two girls to get ready for the night and not be in each other's way. There were plenty of clean towels always on hand, the cleaning people were great and cleaned our room every day. My only complaint is that the water pressure wasn't that great, but maybe I'm just used to my shower at home. The room was basic but modern, and the beds are really comfortable, maybe a little too soft for me, but thats just my opinion. There is a Walgreens down the block, we stocked up on waters and chips to snack on at night, and there is plenty of space in the room's refridgerator for big bottles of water and stuff. It was perfect, actually. The pool area was very clean and very beautiful. We stayed on the beach every day though because it's just my preference. I liked the breeze on the beach and I rented an umbrella for &10 a day (which is worth every penny). The sun is extremely brutal in PR and both my friend and I who never burned got red, so make sure to wear sunscreen! The little cafe on the beach of the hotel was good, it was nothing to really write home about, but the prices were definitely very reasonable, and they make great drinks! The pina coladas and their Jungle Fever drink were always by myside. They have a waitress walking around the beach to bring you drinks and what not. Coming from the NYC area, these drinks are definitely reasonably priced. As for food, to me, nothing was terribly overpriced. The first night we went to the El San Juan to the Palm restaurant. That to me, was just overpriced Italian food, even though it was really good, it's just like home cooking to me so the prices were a little high. The second night we went to Ruth's Chris steakhouse in the hotel - PHENOMENAL!!! The steaks are pricey (but typical for steakhouses in the NorhtEast), but my friend and I saw a special they were having - $99 for two people, and we each got a salad, choice of meat (we chose the petite filets and they were to die for!! Like butter!) a side dish and dessert. Dessert wasn't so great, but then again, we were soooooo stuffed with our meal Id on't think our stomachs could have fit the dessert anyway. The last night we went to the hibachi restaurant in the hotel. Not my favorite place, but I was definitely pleasantly surprised at how tasty the food was. Plus we met this great couple that was on their honeymoon. She is a native of PR and told us about some places to go out for drinks and whatnot. We did go into Old San Juan one day. I love Old San Juan, way better than San Juan, and we heard that the night life out there is great, we just never made it out at night. The cab fare is $20 each way, but def worth it considering all the traffic and the congestion, that driving there yourself would not be fun. We went to the restaurant where they invented the Pina Colada, Barrachina or something like that. It's around the corner fromt he Burberry outlet, and it was AMAZING. so were the Pina coladas! I would def go back there. We didn't get to really experience the true nightlife as we were there during the week, and we were told by all the locals that nothing really got going until Thursday. We went over to the bar at the El San Juan, and I felt out of place, like I was too young to be there (I'm 26). Also, the drinks weren't made that great, and the staff at the El San Juan weren't as attentive or friendly, although I do believe that the pool area at the El San Juan was a little nicer and more modern, with more modern music playing. But as far as the rooms and the rest of the service, I can't say. You should def check out the Water Club. It's a 8-10 minute walk from the hotel, and it has a really cool rooftop lounge. Its def worth checking out. The concierge was very helpful and they have a list of excursions to take if you feel the need. We didn't, but looking back, I wish we had. We did go jetskiing, which was really fun. They're stationed on the beach right outside the El San Juan. 30 minutes was $70, which is a lot, but it was sooo fun. Some people complained about the seaweed - some days the water was chopier than others, but the seaweed tends to gather right on the shore, if you walk into the water a little further its completely gone and very clean. Overall my experience at the Intercontinental was great. I def would go back to PR, just not to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!! Don't listen to bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: melj18
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Puerto Rico, San Juan with my boyfirend and an aother couple and we had a great time! Intercontinental was a great resort. We loved how tropical the resort was, others hotels I looked at didn't have anything tropical. The room we stayed in was on the 14th floor, ocean view (1420)! The view was so beautiful, the ocean, palms trees, pool and everything! The pool area was great, the staff was great and attentive and very nice. My only suggestion is in Puerto Rico things are expensive, the first day we arrived we got lunch in the hotel grill outside by the pool, and we ordered four sandwiches and four drinks and it cost us $100.00, and taxi are about $25 each way to go to Old San Juan. So if your on a budget, go to places to eat outside the hotel. There are plenty of places to go and eat that are good and around the corner. We went on great tourists trips like, snorkling, going to the rain forest, going to old san juan and went to Flamenco beach. Flamenco beach is was voted one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. I loved everything about the resort and Puerto Rico. Don't listen to bad reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Treat”
Reviews.Author: jeni_gsu
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the Intercontinental was above Par. The only issue I had with the hotel were the terribly slow elevators and the paper thin walls/doors. We had a wonderful city view room (it's not as bad as it sounds, I actually preferred it over an ocean view). The room was a connector to the room next door and you could pretty much carry on a coversation with people next to you without even raising your voice. The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff were excellent. The only place we experieced bad service on the entire island was at the Burger King across the street. The food at the Intercon is overrated and too pricey. We did dine at Alfredo the first night and the bill was around $84. It was medicore. We did have room service breakfast for two mornings and it was excellent. We both split the $24 power breakfast and it was enough food for 2 people. I do not recommend purchasing beverages at the outdoor bars. They are terribly watered down and isn't worth the $10 you pay. Go across the street to the supermarket and get a cooler and take that with you to the beach. I saw one traveler mention a rental car. I DO NOT recommend doing that. We thought it would be a great idea to drive to Ponce in a rental car and ended up in a wreck 100 miles from San Juan. The drivers in Puerto Rico are absolutely crazy. The roads are not clearly marked and you can get confused very easily. We immediately returned the car upon our arrival to San Juan and relied on taxi's to take us around. Yes it is about $20 to go to Old San Juan from the hotel, but because of the wreck and trying to find our way around we wasted pretty much an entire day of our short trip. As far as restuarants are concerned we did dine at Mark's at the Melia in Ponce (it was OK, better than the Intercon), Mi Casita (very good, service was not that slow), Barrichina (in Old San Juan, WONDERFUL), the Taco Maker (Tex-Mex type). We did cave in and go to Burger King and Pizza Hut. Beans and plantains get old after a while. Overall it was a great experience. Even though the hotel is right by the airport you grow used to the planes (you can only see them from the city view rooms anyway). Any please do not rent a car, if you do, be sure to get insurance and a very good map.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: vstylin215
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about this hotel after going through many of the reviews here. Many have complained about the service, and I must say, we only had but amazing service when we went. There were 4 families that stayed in that hotel for a wedding and non of us had any issues with the hotel. Service was impeccable. FRONT DESK: here is where I thought I would run into issues. However, they proved me wrong and were more than helpful with checking in and any other questions I had for them. In fact, I had originally booked just a city-view room and they were kind enough to upgrade me and my parents-in-law to a beautiful and immensely big ocean view room. If you have any questions about restaurants and such, the concierge is very knowledgable and capable of guiding anyone to the right direction. ROOMS: the ocean-view room was amazing. HUGE. We had a king size bed that was beyond comfortable, a love seat, a one-seater, coffee table, and an office table. Needless to say, this room had plenty of space. The closet fit all of our clothes comfortably and there is a small space outside the bathroom for a vanity area where there is great lighting for prepping to go out and applying makeup. The bathroom is also quite spacious and has one of the most powerful showers I have ever experienced in my life. Showering at this hotel was fast and amazing. It was a massage and a shower in one! Lastly, everything was clean! A great plus for a germaphobe like myself. POOL: pretty large and very clean. Never any straws or any nasty things floating. There were many zones ranging from 3 feet to 6 feet. A couple of waterfalls for a nice hydro massage. They start giving the towels poolside at about 8am. This help curbing the habit of people "saving" the chairs too early. If you go early enough, before 9 froom what I have noticed, they even give you a neckroll along with the towel. They will give you a bracelet when you check these items out and upon returning them, do not forget to ask them to cut those pesky bracelets off. BEACH: We never laid out in the pool and stayed on the beach our entire stay. To us, nothing beats the sound of the ocean and the amazing breeze that puts us both to sleep quicker than we ever anticipate. The beach was clean. Not much seaweed. Out of the 4 days we were there, only once did I see a lot of seaweed. And they were quickly taken away by the staff. For those that love the calm beach, it all depends on the day. Our first day there, it was VERY rough. The waves were huge and intimidating. Each day thereafter, the waves and the ocean slowly calmed down; and our trip ended with very calm waters by the 4th day. I don't know if it is dependent on the weather on some other factor, but there was no consistency as far as how rough or calm the water was that day. There were plenty of beach chairs, so there was no need to get up early and "save" a chair. They also have umbrellas available for a fee (I think $10) and there is a staff member that will assist you in putting it in. RESTAURANTS: this is one aspect of the hotel I cannot be of any help. Sorry, but I did not eat at any of the restaurants after reading all the reviews about the prices they charge. However, my hubby did eat at Alfredo's, the Italian restaurant, for breakfast and he said the omelet was big and delicious. After I found out the price ($14), delicious should have been the least of what that omelet was! My parents-in-law ordered a pizza for room service and I remember them saying it was not memorable whatsoever. MISCELLANEOUS: The elevators were a bit on the slow side of things. Press "LL" on elevator if you want to bypass the lobby to go to the pool. The casino was fairly small at this place. Drinks at the bar were mostly around $10 to $14. We ate at the restaurant across the street for breakfast called Mi Casita. Service is beyond slow, but the price is just right. Most of the breakfast items were $5 give or take. I ordered the eggs, homefries, and toast for $4.95. The homefries has a different and addictive flavor that I've never tasted in any homefries before! There is also a convenience store next to Mi Casita. I highly suggest buying bottled water and juices here. I think the hotel charged $8 for the big Fiji water and $3.50 for the small bottles. A six pack of water bottles cost us about $3.50. Save your money and walk across the street and hang right for about a 1/2 a block. They are all there in that little strip mall. Within that strip mall is also a burger king and a ponderosa. In fact, there are so many American food restaurants that I was a bit disappointed of the location. Nonetheless, it is convenient for those who like them. Pamela's had amazing food...expensive, but worth every penny! La Pascaderia Atlantica had the best seafood ever! I'm salivating just thinking about it again. Definetly save room for the tres leches for dessert. Ridiculously delicious! Any of the bakeries around the area always had great bread and sandwiches. There is Reposteria Espana not too far from the hotel. For those needing Starbucks fix, right next door to our hotel is the El San Juan. There, you will find two Starbucks! Also great shopping at this hotel. It's very lively at night. Great band by the bars. Dress to impress if you go at night to party. But definitely a great place to hang out. Huge casino. The Intercontinental looks like a dot next to there's. We went to Old San Juan our last day since we had a 5:45 PM flight out of Puerto Rico. They tell you to be at the airpot 2 hours before departure. If you want a late check-out, the hotel charges about $75. Check out is at 12PM, but they were kind enough to give us till 1PM. Ask for the courtesy room if you don't want the $75 charge. I think they give you 30 minutes to use it. We checked out at 1 and gave our luggage to the bellhop and walked around Old San Juan for a couple hours. Taxi there is about $19 per way and takes between 10-15 minutes. Beautiful buildings and cobble-stone roads. La Bombanera had the best food! Ask for la mallorca (pronounced la mayorca). Goes wonderfully with coffee. Renting a car would be advisable. Taxis are very expensive there. Cost $7 to go down 2 hotels. If I didn't have the long dress on (on our way to the wedding) I would have walked that way! Intercontinental charges $16 for parking (self-park) across the street. Valet parking costs $22 per day. If your going to Old San Juan, parking is horrible! We took a taxi and were glad we did! Always ask for the price before you go in to avoid getting ripped-off! Have fun! Puerto Rico was a blast! email me for any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pool and Beach”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTanJan
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. My only disappointment is in Puerto Rico itself. 1. Hotel location-I was disappointed in the area around this hotel.Lots of American fast food places to eat at and no feel that you were in a different country. Might as well have been in Florida. Fast food joints were great for cheap lunches on the beach. 2.Pool/Beach-Whoever designed this pool did a fantastic job. The large waterfalls drown out any noise from the pool bar, pool restaurant and noisy people. There is a great mix of shade and sun. The towel people will only give you 1 towel each and 1 pillow each. The pillow was great.. They always gave us 4 large towels in the room for 2 people, so we just brought extra towels down with us to the bool/beach to compensate for the 1 towel per person allotment at the pool. The beach is large enough to really spread out and not be on top of others. Chaise lounge chairs were free but the umbrella was $10. You rent them from the pool/towel hut. The umbrellas are a little on the small side. My husband had a hard time getting completely under it. There was always something sticking out. Out of the 6 days we were there the water was calm 2 days, and rough 4 days. By rough I mean you could not relax and carry on a conversation in the water. You had to be very alert or get wiped out by a wave. Eventually, I just when in up to my knees. 3.Food/restaurants- Do yourself a favor and bring a collapsible cooler. Go to Walgreens..buy alot of water and pop. Fill your cooler with ice (provided at the hotel ice machine) and enjoy your cheap drinks on the beach. We also bought beer at the grocery store accross the street ($7 for 6 cans) and had our own cheap happy hour. The first day of arrival my husband and I split a cheeseburger/fries and he had a beer. The bill from the beachside restaurant came to $25 including tip. So needless to say that was the last day we ate hotel/beach food. My husband took the walk accross the street to fast food heaven and bought us Burger King or Taco Bell for lunch. Everytime he came back through the lobby with our lunch food, a Manager advised him he would not be allowed to eat it at the pool. Since we were on the beach this was not an issue. Just very annoying. For dinner we avoided the extremely pricey restaurants at the hotel and opted for Lupis (just past the El San Juan). They had what might be the best steak fajitas I have ever had. ($13,I think) and $3 Medella beers. Also ate 1 night at Outback(at Embassy Suites). At first the prices seem comparable to home until you realize they do not include the salad, like at home. Good meal. Just costs more than home. Hotel room- Got upgraded to an oceanview room. Slept every night with the door open to hear the waves. The room had a ceiling fan, so that kept us cool enough at night even with the door open. The room also had a lighted make-up mirror. The refrigerator is stocked with overpriced hotel beverages but, there is still alot of room to put your own beverages or leftover dinner. Car rental-We rented an intermediate for $30 a day including tax from Dollar rent a car at the Holiday Inn(1 block from Intercontinental). They do close at 5pm so unless you want to pay $16 to park it at the Intercontinental make sure you get going in the morning so that you can return it by 5pm. We drove to El Yunque and were able to hike to the waterfall, stop for lunch and shop Belz outlet mall. The drive to El Yunque takes longer than you think it will. Lots of stop lights made it take 1 1/2 hours. Hotel rate- I booked at Interline Travel.com. This website is for Airline employee discounted rates. We paid $208 per night for a lagoon view room. Their rates are a real deal when you realize the 22% taxes are included. I bought the AmbassadorClub membership ($150) from Intercontinental.com which gives you a one category room upgrade at check in. We would have been upgraded to Pool view but, since they didn't have any available ...we got upgraded to oceanview. Casinos-The El San Juan casino was our favorite. A good amount of 1 cent machines. This casino does get crowded on Wednesday and Thursdays with locals. (They must have some promotion for them because they were allover the penny machines.) We did not like the Intercontinental casino, at all. Not enough penny machines. And the ones they did have wouldn't take your bills or vouchers. They just kept rejecting anything you tried to put in them. The Embassy Suites casino was very small. Hope this helps you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great!”
Reviews.Author: 2nvno1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The pool very nice and the beach was ok. The tide was a little ruff. The cafe was small but the food was excellent. Fair prices considering your at a resort. The waitresses and waiters was all friendly and courteous. The Pina Colada's were excellent.......Waleska made the best. The hotel was a little to quite for me and the casino was small and had out dated slot machines. We stayed in a suite which was nice and clean, but small compared to many suites I have seen. There was no tub, which in my opinion is not a suite. All the suites only had a city view with a very small balcony not big enogh for a small table or chair. And with having a city view suite there is not much privacy because you are on the front entrance side of the hotel and there is alot of traffic in and out of the hotel. There are plenty of places outside the resort to get food at a great price. Not sure of the exact name but I believe it's called Misa Casa ( great food /great price) which is in th shopping center across the street from resort. There is also a nice small sushi bar about a block up the street that served excellent sushi and the miso soup was to die for. I visited a few other hotels in the immediate area and found the El San Juan was the place to be to hang out on the weekends. All in all it was a good stay, I will return to Puerto Rico but probably will choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: serenity317
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel for a relaxing getaway. The pool was very nice. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but there are some nice ones nearby. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Not so Nice Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Travel2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Intercontinental. Stayed from April 25th until May 1st. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 am. Check in time is at 4:00 pm, but the person checking us in (the concierge manager, who was incredibly kind, and very helpful), got us checked in early. Our room was oceanfront and worth every penny. The beds face the ocean so you can actually see the ocean immediately when you wake up. Rooms were kept incredibly clean every day. Housekeeping was very attentive. Complimentary shampoos, soaps, and lotions smelled very nice and were good quality. The balcony was standing room only. The pool area was nice. There were some cabanas that were first come, first serve. They were taken every day we were there except one day when we got to the pool by 9 am and snagged one finally! Security guards kept non guests from using the pool. I only wish they would have a designated smoking area; there were a LOT of smokers. Not pleasant for non smokers like me. Beach area was okay. Pretty scenery, but way too much seaweed. As you're standing in the water, all the seaweed gets intertwined within your legs and you feel like you're being swallowed by the stuff. There weren't a lot of people in the water, and I'm guessing the seaweed is the reason. But if you decide to go on the beach, the beach chairs are free, but the umbrellas cost $10 (which I thought was worth it instead of roasting in the sun.) Mediterranean Cafe has very good sandwiches. Frommer's recommended them and I can see why. I tried the lamb pita, my husband had the cuban sandwich. Sodas, a small paper cup at $3 each, do not come with free refills. Alfredo's (the inventor of Fettuccine Alfredo opened this chain) was also very good. I had, of course, Fettuccine Alfredo, and the chocolate molten cake. High class service, without the pretentiousness. Directly across the street there's a supermarket where you can get snacks and drinks. There's also a restaurant called MiCasitas that claims it has the best Mofongos on the island. They were very busy and had a line out the door. My husband and I both tried the beef Mofongos. If you're not so brave, there's also Subway, Domino's Pizza, Church's Chicken, Baskin Robbins, and Burger King in that same shopping complex. Be careful about taking taxi's around town. ALWAYS ask how much it costs to go somewhere BEFORE getting in the cab. They're supposed to work in zones, but we discovered that some drivers are dishonest to tourists because they don't think they know any better. I found this part to be very frustrating. There's an AVIS rental car service right in the hotel lobby. We rented a car for two days to go to El Yunque and Ponce the next day. Cost for two days, plus insurance cost $165. Self parking per day at the hotel costs $16. Parking lot is located across the street. Day of departure we used their hospitality room. It is available on a first come, first serve basis from 12 pm to 6 pm. We went at 4:45 and saw that no one had even used it all day; I don't think anyone knows about this service that they offer since they don't advertise it. It's free but it's only for 30 minutes. Overall stay was quite pleasant. We booked through priceline, so we got a great deal. I would never have payed full price for this resort. For the price I paid, I feel like I got a great resort. It was farther than I would've hoped for from Old San Juan; it was a 15 minute cab ride. The doors were paper thin, and had no buffer between the bottom of the door to the floor so you could hear every single door SLAM SHUT at night and all morning. You could hear the planes fly by, since the airport is only a 5 minute cab ride away, but if you ignored them, they really didn't bother you after a while. And lastly, even though the concierge manager guy (who was not even Puerto Rican which might explain it) was very nice, every single other person working at the concierge desk and the check in desk was incredibly curt and rude to my husband and me. I read a lot of reviews about how the staff was very rude, but until you live it, you don't realize how rude they actually really are.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MN_Sesame
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Intercontinental primarily based on the reviews in trip advisor. We found this hotel to be exactly what we were looking for (beautiful-relaxing pool, nice beach, great service, modern rooms with a balcony, warm weather) and recommend this place without hesitation. Further details provided below: Room: We debated between an ocean view room and a pool view in the club wing and chose the club wing for about $350/night AAA rate. The club wing is a 2 story building that is perpendicular to the ocean with all rooms facing the pool. The rooms are supposed to be slightly larger than the main building and each room has a balcony with chairs (see pictures). Each room in the main building had a balcony, but not big enough for chairs. None of the club rooms had a very good view of the ocean but the pool is stunning enough. With the club, you get free continental breakfast (bagels, fruit, hard boiled eggs, etc) until 10am and appetizers along with pour your own cocktails between 5pm and 7pm. The only thing that I did not like about the club was they did not let you take any food or drinks out of the common area, and I would have preferred to sit out on my balcony with a cocktail while watching the sunset. When we checked in, they upgraded us for free (without asking and without a priority club number) to a suite which was essentially two connecting regular rooms with a whirlpool and walk in closet (see pictures). From reading other comments, I think their policy is to upgrade if available, so off-peak times have a good chance of upgrades. Hotel: This is a 4 star hotel with a beautiful pool well described by others. All of the employees were very nice and treated us like royalty. There was one lady who did not like to give out more than one towel at the pool but everyone else was magnificent. The fitness center overlooked the ocean with modern equipment (included in daily resort fee). They had a small spa that I would rate at 3/5 stars. Food and drinks at the pool were expensive, but nothing more than any other beach front resort that we have been to. However, a mini-mart, grocery store, and numerous chain restaurants (Subway, Churchâ€™s chicken, etc.) are across the street from the hotel. There are 3 dinner restaurants on site that were priced what you would expect for a resort ($20/plate at the Italian, $30/plate at the Japanese, $40/plate at Ruthâ€™s Chris). We went to the Italian which was very good, great service, and it was nice to sit outside with the chirping frogs. We also went to the Japanese (hibachi - cook in front of you) which we loved. We did not go to Ruthâ€™s Chris, but went to BLT Steak at the Ritz Carlton and it was very similar to a Ruthâ€™s Chris in terms of quality and price. The Ritz was more of a 5 star property (i.e. Tiffany Co on site, etc.) but most of the rooms did not have a balcony and it was about twice the cost of the Intercontinental; after looking at both properties, we would stay at the Intercontinental again. The El San Juan Hotel next door was much more of a spring break atmosphere which was nice to visit, but we enjoyed retreating to our peaceful and relaxing hotel. Restaurants: Within walking distance from the hotel, we went to BLT Steak (described above), Metropol (good quality local fare at very reasonable prices), and Mi Casita which we did not have a good experience at although you get a lot of food at a cheap cost. We also ate at Aquaviva in Old San Juan which had great seafood although expensive. Activities: The rain forest was great. Some recommend renting a car but we did the guided tour ($57/person through the concierge) which was well worth it. We saw some people who rented a car and had no idea where to go or what to see and were essentially trying to follow our guide in their cars. Deep sea fishing out of old San Juan was a lot of fun (caught a 30lb Mahi Mahi through Grand Illusion Charter and they filleted for you if you want). We also enjoyed walking around Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “fun, relax and explore”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRms
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Purto Rico, and for our first stay we couldn't have chosen a more perfect place. The rooms were big, with a balcony and quite comfortable, and always kept clean. The staff were all very friendly but we found the concierge desk at all times to be very outgoing and helpful. One of the tours they recommended was the Catch a Dream Ranch, which was a 90 minute horse back riding experience like we will never forget thru the foothills of the rainforest and a run on the Rio Mar beach with a beautifull view of the El yungque rainforest in the background. We found the restaurant on the beach very nice along with several of the local area restaurants. Cabs are plentiful and the rates are set so regardless of the traffic situation your assured of the cost which we found quite reasonable and more relaxing than trying to rent a car and deal with the local traffic ourselves. Over all we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: NesserG
Reviews.Content: 11 of us girls stayed at the InterContinental Hotel for a bachelorette weekend. We all enjoyed our stay except for dealing with one of their employees, Barbara, who works at the Concierge desk. Stay away from her! She was NOT helpful, was extremely RUDE, and had a major attitude problem towards us as a few of the girls tried to check in (their vouchers were left at the Concierge desk as a few of the girls checked in a day or 2 later). We complained to the manager explaining how rude, and unhelpful she was; we are their hotel guests and spending A LOT of money to stay there; there was no need to deal with this kind of service! Jhazil, at the Concierge desk, was extremely helpful and recommended great clubs, restaurants, and bars to go to in Old San Juan (OSJ). Look for her to help you! Overall, our stay at the hotel was good. Small, comfy beds, and clean rooms and bathrooms. We asked for a late check out for 4pm and they gave it to us for free of charge (normally $75 for late afternoon check-out)! The cafe on the beach was great too - order the chicken tortilla wrap; it's delicious! The hotel is close to Walgreens, an ATM, ESJ Hotel, and the Ritz. Too bad it's far away from OSJ, but it's a close drive at least. We can't wait to go back to PR next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yankee42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental about 6 or 7 times. I always get a ocean view room on a high floor. The view is great and the room is clean. The balconies are very small. The staff is very polite and helpful. The hotel is situated on the best beach for visitors to P.R. My problem is with the corporation. For all my stays at this location never did I recieve any discounts for future stays. Not much to do in the area compared to old San Juan and Condado. Cabs are twent dollars to Old San Juan. I do recomend this hotel for first timers to Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Great...once again!!”
Reviews.Author: hpeter
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Intercontinental. My family and I stayed there last year. I wrote a positive review about the first time there and things have not changed. We had first planned on staying at the El San Juan this time, but thankfully changed our plans. On our return to the Intercontinental, we saw familiar faces...Bellmen, doormen, front desk, concierge, bar tenders, security, waiters and waitresses and a few managers. They are still friendly, courteous, helpful and pleasant. Ivan the doorman, Andy the bellman, Pablo the front desk manager--all awesome. They remembered us from last year and because of them we will return. The buffet breakfast is delicious and fresh. The rooms are clean and the pool is clean and beautiful. Pool staff are helpful. The airplanes are not a big deal. If the pool bar is a little weak with their drinks, just ask for another one. If you let them know they won't be offended. The only thing I did not like is how certain guests were treated a little more special by management. A lot of brown nosing going on. Its probably the best Hotel in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: essense93
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental San Juan Resort is a great place to stay. Although I would not recommend to spent your whole vacation there because in PR there is plenty to see. They have a great gym, wonderful spa - ( I actually had the best massage of my life there) and a good steakhouse. It's not far from Old San Juan or the airport. The rooms are clean and the staff is very helpful. I have not complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Overall, but no great value”
Reviews.Author: ellyA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for an extended weekend as part of a conference/vacation. The pool and grounds were lovely, and the rooms clean and pleasant (if a little small). We were treated well by the staff overall, though some were a little young and inattentive. The pool is gorgeous -- great for kids who enjoy swimming. The beach is lovely as well, and security is quite good. We felt that we could relax and enjoy our time there. We only ate at the restaurant near the beach. The snacks were overpriced and only so-so, though the meals were pretty good and not too expensive. The drinks were expensive and weak, and even the bottled water and sodas were overpriced. Once the conference ended, we felt a bit isolated from shopping -- the shelves at the store across the street were 1/2 empty, and there were only a few fastfood places otherwise. I would recommend going 2 blocks, past the SJ Hotel and Casino, to Gelato Piu for meals and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Schmintercontinental”
Reviews.Author: alg188
Reviews.Content: Subject: San Juan Location: San Juan, Puerto Rico, Caribbean, North America Title: Intercontinental, Schmintercontinental - don't deal with them! ID#: 14870951 We didn't actually stay there, but had a problem with a cancelled reservation. They've been giving me the run around for a couple of months and have charged my credit card nearly $900 for three rooms. They give me a song-and-dance, then don't follow through. They don't return phone calls, and pass the buck to another manager. I will be contacting corporate next, then if that doesn't work, the Better Business Bureau, and other consumer advocates, along with the tourism bureaus in San Juan. I will not stay at that particular hotel at any cost. If corporates don't help me, I will swear off any Intercontinental hotels, or any hotels affiliated with them. Too many other very nice hotels, large and small, to recommend this place that won't even try to resolve a matter without threats. Go somewhere else!!! If you stay and have a problem, I would venture to say it would not be resolved by their local management!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: ISternlicht
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is phenomenal. Every time you call and ask for something (e.g. extra shampoo, toothpaste, etc.) they not only bring it right up, they call your room to make sure you received the item and it is exactly what you wanted. I was very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Relaxed Vacation”
Reviews.Author: anukfdo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the InterContinental from 4/1/08 to 4/6/08 and had the best time. We got a room on the 5th floor facing the pool and it was great. We were not too concerned about the room location since we were not planning on staying in the room all day. We arrived at the hotel around 1:30pm and were checked in right away even though check-in is usually at 4pm. The bell boy brought up the bags promptly and we were off to the beach and pool almost immediately. The pool and beach is excellent at this hotel. You have to get a wrist band in order to get towels & pillows and it also identifies you as a guest of the hotel when on the beach. The pool area has tents with chairs that can be reserved a day earlier or taken on a first come first serve basis. All the hotel staff was very courteous and helpful throughout our stay and we had no complaints at all. The concierge at the hotel was very helpful in providing us with directions and recommendations during our stay there. The restaurants on site were expensive and so was room service. Prior to visiting Puerto Rico my wife and I decided to only consume local cuisine so we didnâ€™t ever eat at the hotel. The hotel itself has a Steak House, an Italian Restaurant & a Japanese Restaurant. The pool side bar and the beach front cafe were also pretty expensive. Please note that the beach front cafe is cheaper than the pool side bar even though they are only a few feet away from each other. I basically went to the small supermarket directly in front of the hotel and grabbed some Medalla Light (local) beer and brought it to the room and put it in the fridge. I then took it down to the pool and beach in a plastic cup. The same beer 10oz costs $4 at the hotel while the super market sells it for $1.25. The security at the hotel was very good and the pool and beach guard (Mike) is very friendly. We rented a car for our stay from Alamo and I chose to use the self parking option. Since parking is scarce in the area, all hotels charge for parking. At the InterContinental they charge $16 for self parking and $22 for valet. The self parking lot is across the street from the hotel but itâ€™s not a problem at all to use. Some people have mentioned concern about crossing the street. We live in the NJ/NY area and crossing the streets in our areas is pretty similar so it wasnâ€™t a big deal for us. If you want to have some local fare walk over to Mi Casita directly in front of the hotel. Itâ€™s a small place with a small menu but the food is excellent. Another restaurant in walking distance is Metropol. They have Puerto Rican and Cuban food and is excellent as well. We went to Metropol twice during our stay. We went to Old San Juan a few times (for meals and sightseeing). It was convenient to have a car. I used my blackberry and Google maps (gps) to help me with the directions. All road signs are in Spanish so a GPS will really help. Some restaurants that we tried in Old San Juan are, Tantra (Indo-Latino fusion), Dragonfly (Latino-Asian Fusion) and Cafeteria Mallorca (located on Calle San Francisco in Old San Juan) typical local restaurant - they have some really good rice dishes and a chicken soup that local crave for. Another must visit restaurant is Ajili Mojili (1006, Ashford Avenue San Juan, PR 00907 Puerto Rico). Itâ€™s located in Condado (between Isle Verde and Old San Juan). They have the best Mofongo and Asapao (local delicacies). Day trips we did: El Yunque Rain Forest - I even took a dip under the water fall after the 30 min hike. ATV tours at Hacienda Carabali - Ask the concierge for the directions to this place. We did the 2 hour ATV tour and it was awesome. They even stopped at a river and we were able to jump in. They are located between the El Yunque Rain Forest and Luquillo Beach. Luquillo Beach - One of the best beaches in PR. Itâ€™s located a miles past the road to the El Yunque Rain Forest towards Fajardo. Try out some local food at the Luquillo Beach food kiosks. If you are going to the above mentioned 3 places I recommend that you take the 187 road. This is the most scenic way towards Fajardo. You will also pass some unique local kiosks with food and drinks (try some coco - coconut water). Old San Juan - Takes about a full day to view the whole town and all the fortresses, etc. We will definitely go back to PR and stay at the InterContinental San Juan Resort, Spa & Casino. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Not so great location”
Reviews.Author: stasiakay
Reviews.Content: We paid full price so value wasn't there for us. One night precruise. Beach and pool area were quite beautiful. Service was outstanding. Security at the beach was great. Food a bit overpriced but very enjoyable so thats ok. wound up spending $777 for one night stay with two lunches for family. There is one thing you really really need to know. Since I am a priority club member got a beautiful ocean front room. However, El San Juan next door has an outdoor club with full blown Dj playing way into the late night hours. Was ok for the one night precruise. Didn't get to sleep until about 2. Mean while airport is on other side of hotel. I wouldn't want to go through a week there. Ask if it is every night or just on Sat.

Reviews.Title: “perfect start to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: trekker954
Reviews.Content: booked one night pre cruise, great deal thru priceline. arrived by noon on saturday (cruise not until 10 pm. sunday). (Taxi was about $25 for two of us (four pieces of luggage) Hotel offered to store luggage while we changed into bathing suits and got two chairs by the pool. (chairs are difficult to find on a busy weekend). we had lunch poolside, very expensive, but we knew that before we decided to eat there). our room was ready by 3, we tossed our things there and headed to the beach. the room was very nice and overlooking the ocean and pool. I was surprized considering our price we paid thru priceline. there is everything in walking distance, walgreens, supermarket, resturants, outback, all the fast food places, a couple of breakfast places across the street. We walked to a wonderful italian rooftop resturant ontop of howard johnsons. the area does get seedy down in that part of town. if you are a priority member they let you stay in your room until 2. which was great for us. once you leave your room either at noon or 2, you can get a hospitality suite for 30 minutes in order to clean up should you want to spend the entire day at the hotel/beach. they give you a wrist band each day for use of the pool/beach and towels, etc. i would highly recommend it. oh and the el san juan is right next door which has an active nightclub. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: murphyIowa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for 6 nights with 2 teenage kids. I would recommend the hotel. The beach was great, soft sand and a long beach perfect for walks. The pool was also very nice but we spent most of our time on the beach. All of the staff were very nice and helpful. Ate at the beachfront rest almost every day and was good beach/pool food. Also ate at Ruth Chris steak house and was best steak we had ever had. Only rest we did not eat at was the Japanese rest. All were good. We went do El Yunque rainforest on day and hiked the waterfall trail and then went to Luquillo beach, would highly recommend both. Also spent one afternoon in Old San Juan and went to El Morro and walked around downtown, was also a great exp. Stayed on the 14th floor, great ocean view, newly ren room, flat screen, ect., bathroom was a little small but can't have everything. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spring break getaway for family”
Reviews.Author: akersjr
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be "just what the doctor ordered"...our trip away from cold Ky. was much needed! The staff was fabulous - from our first moment of getting out of the taxi, until the moment we got back in a taxi to the airport. In fact - at check in, we were upgraded to an ocean view room - when we had booked a garden view room. We were booked for a Triple A room rate, too. I didn't even ask for the upgrade, it was just offered to us. My one thought was - at the time of booking I thought to enter my "Priority Membership Card" since the Intercontinenal is part of that family of hotels. I'm not in it for the points, but I've heard that sometimes you can get upgraded to a better floor or get some better amenities with just being a member (and membership is free). So...maybe just having that member number on the reservation helped. Who knows. Anyway - the view was GREAT. Pool was FABULOUS. Our 7 year old couldn't get enough! Food at hotel IS expensive. However - if you want to splurge - the Japanese restaurant is good and a hit with kids. The Ruth's Chris steakhouse is also excellent. There is a bakery across the street that has cheap breakfast - like bagels and pancakes. Also , Mi Casita, a Puerto Rican restaurant across the street, is a nice alternative. Not totally cheap - but better priced than the hotel. Go to Walgreens down the street for snacks/groceries. You can put stuff in the in-room fridge for b'fast (we did). There's a subway across the street - and Domino's pizza. Pizza Hut is nearby as is Wendy's. We HIGHLY recommend a tour to the Rain Forest. We booked it through the concierge the day before - and it was well worth it. Again - the hotel was wonderful for our needs. Room was clean, not totally fashionable - but beds were comfy. All other parts of the hotel were beautiful. I felt extremely safe - and felt comfortable with my 7 year old running around the pool. The staff could not have been nicer. We plan to return to Puerto Rico, and if we return to the San Juan - we would definitely stay at the Intercontinental again. Flight note: if you fly Delta - we found out you can change your flight time on the same day for just $50 per ticket if you call within 3 hours of the flight you would like to take (if there is space). We were able to take an earlier flight from home and get an extra half day in the sun. By doing this we didn't have to pay a full ticket change fee or pay new charges on a new ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Nany14
Reviews.Content: Overall the intercontinental was an excellent choice. I feel it was in the best location and one of the nicest hotels on Isla Verde. It was within walking distance to many restaurants outside of the hotel. La Casita is across the street in a shopping center that has a subway, burger king and Ponderosa steak house. La Casita has 2 eggs, bacon, ham or sausage, home style potatoes and toast for $3.50, the orange juice is $2.00. We thought the breakfast in La Casita was great considering the breakfast in the hotel is 22.00 per person. There is also metropol which has Spanish food for dinner and Lupis is a delicious Mexican restaurant just down the street also. The casino gives you complimentary food and drinks. The cocktail servers do not offer it but if you ask they will tell you what they have available. They have a poor point system for casino players. The pool area is excellent. The employees are very friendly and hospitable, especially Rosi. The only negative is that you could hear the planes taking off about every 10 minutes, but this happens in every hotel on Isla Verde so it us unavoidable. The rooms were very nice. We had an ocean view room and the view was breath taking. The rooms were above average in size. There was a king bed an office area and a pullout love seat in our room. There are a few restaurants to pick from in the hotel. The only one we tried was the Italian restaurant, it was excellent, I recommend the fettichini and lasagna, they were both delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pupdog224
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great stay at the Intercontinental (March 25 - 28). I used this website extensively when I planned this trip and was nervous based on some of the reviews. Our stay was just perfect. I was traveling with my husband and two teenage sons. We had a beautiful ocean view room on the 10th floor. The room was nice, spacious, and clean. The view from the small balcony was great. We ate at Alfredo's in the hotel one night and the food was very good and same price as you would pay at any nice restaurant. The pool are was beautiful, and the beach was great. The area around the hotel is safe and there are many other dining options nearby. Don't hesitate to stay at this beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DDDBS5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. There is no aspect of this hotel that you will be disappointed in. Exceptional service, great cushy beds, great pool and lounge chairs, great restaurants, beautiful beach etc. I loved this place. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at this Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Isanabel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Intercontinental for our vacation and were very happy with the hotel. I highly recommend this resort because the location is excellent, the beach beautiful and the staff excellent. First, the hotel is in a terrific location for a peaceful and relaxing beach resort experience away from the crowds of the Condado. It's a $11 (plus tip) quick cab ride from the airport and taxis arrive within a moment of being called by the bell boy staff (truly they're lined up just outside of the entrance to the hotel ). There are many restaurants just across the street (Burger King, Church's Chicken, Subway, Ponderosa , Bagel place, etc, however, we opted for Mi Casita, a wonderful little local restaurant serving typical Puerto Rican meals where you can enjoy breakfast, lunch and dinner in a casual luncheonette-type atmosphere with its own special charm. If you're looking for fine dining and ambiance try another restaurant. There's also a small grocery store in the shopping center and a Walgreen's within about a ten minute walk. We requested early check-in and had to wait for our room. We booked an oceanview room and stayed on the 9th floor. The view was magnificent as we overlooked the tops of the palm trees and had a broad view of the ocean. If possible, I recommend a room in the center of the building and not on the far ends to avoid a view of roof tops along with the ocean. All rooms are advertised to have flat screen TVs. Ours did not and although we considered changing to a room that did, none were available on the first night and it wasn't worth the effort to move on the next day. But, if that is important to you, I suggest that you ask about it before your room is assigned. The room was nicely renovated, not as fancy and luxurious as others I've stayed in, but certainly comfortable and nice enough. We had a refrigerator, little sitting area, king size bed (which was comfortable). The terrace is too small to sit out on and there are no chairs out there, so you just stand and marvel at the view instead. The pool and beach are beautiful and very clean. We had to ask for help finding lounge chairs because apparently people put their towels down early in the day and leave the area. The pool staff delivered two lounge chairs to us after removing towels from lounge chairs after confirming that they had been abandoned hours before. The hotel provides you with nice fluffy towels as you enter the pool area, which is very convenient. The hotel was clean and the staff could not be more pleasant and attentive. I read several reviews where the writers did not find the staff to be accommodating, but our experience was exactly the opposite; the staff was outstanding at all times. Drinks and okay food are pricey at the beach restaurant and pool bar, but in my opinion, it was worth the splurge to sit so near to the beach (or in the pool). You can go across the street and stock up on drinks, etc., and bring them down to the beach if you want to save a lot of money. We didn't eat in any of the hotel restaurants other than at the outdoor cafe. The pizza there was $14, probably enough for two people. The food was really okay, but the main event was those views! Check out is at 12:00, but if you wish to spend the day enjoying the amenities, you can store your bags at the bell station until you're ready to shower and change and ask the front desk for the use of a "Hospitality Suite," where you'll be given a guest room room to use for 1/2 hour. We thought that this was quite a special service for the hotel to offer its guests; unlike having to use a common cabana area or other alternative as in other hotels. I spent a good deal of time researching and reading Trip Advisor reviews (which I hold in high regard) to decide which San Juan hotel best suited our needs in terms of location, comfort, amenities, attentiveness of staff, etc., before deciding on the InterContinental in Isla Verde. I would not hesitate to stay here again. The service was phenomenal, as was the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Juice is Not Worth the Squeeze”
Reviews.Author: rdurbin
Reviews.Content: First, If you book through hotwire or one of the like and get a discount rate, you will get a discount room with a discount view. We booked an ocean view and can barely see it. What we can see is the ugly roof of the lobby. Pleasant. The management staff is horrible. Not helpful when you have a problem. We had a problem with the in room movies and when they sent tecs to look at it they could not speak english. We called the manager and asked them to send someone that did. They sent someone else but his english was so limited he could only speak a few words of english. I understand we are in puerto rico but this is supposed to be a world class hotel. The manager got upset when i called him back and said "what do you expect, we speak spanish here." Wow, thats insightful. The restaurants are way way way over priced. Ruth Chris' is ok but you can get a better steak at any of the restaurants in Old San Juan. The bar charges 11.00 for a scotch and water. The pool side restaurant charges more for a sandwich. Overall we loved puerto rico but wish we would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: JM3074
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for a bachelorette party for the weekend of March 14th. We picked this hotel because of the great reviews. I know everyoneâ€™s experiences are different, so I thought I should share mine. The Intercontinental was overall an okay looking hotel, nothing special. The service on the other hand was terrible. From the moment we got there to check in at the front desk we were given attitude, especially by Barbara (who we always some how had to deal) She seemed bothered by everything and looked at us as if we were asking her for stuff that didnâ€™t have to do with her job! One of the worst things about the hotel, are the elevators. You could hear everyone who were staying at the hotel complain constantly about how long they took! 15-20 minutes to just go up to your room is unacceptable.. and when they finally did arrive, they would be so packed with guests that you had to squeeze in.. People in the elevator always tried to make room because there was an understanding that no one wanted to wait another 20 minutes for the next elevator! Something to note.. Check out is at 12pm.. and although they donâ€™t tell you this till after.. they will deactivate your keys at 12pm sharp.. even if you have requested a late check out. So something to be aware of. The Pool area was definitely the highlight of this hotel. There were always chairs available and the pool wait staff was great, thanks especially to Javier & Wilmer! When I go away, even if its for a long weekend.. its because I want to relax and feel calm. Anytime we had to deal with the hotel employees, they were rude, abrupt and unhelpful or just took forever to do anything. I believe they need to be retrained in Customer Service. So.. in my opinion, the Intercontinental Hotel chain tends to mean you are getting a good quality hotel with great service.. Donâ€™t be fooled by the nameâ€¦ The San Juan Intercontinental is not like any of the other Intercontinentalâ€™s I have ever stayed at. For the price.. I recommend going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LIVE_LAUGH_LOVE_0410
Reviews.Content: We just returned on Wednesday from an amazing stay in Puerto Rico. We booked our stay at the Intercontinental for 8 people through Hotwire. We had two, double bed rooms on the 5th and 6th floor. Not the best views but who cared we were out on the beach most of the time. It was only a 10 minute drive from the airport!!! We arrived on Friday and the hotel was packed with people checking in. They only had two people checking people into their rooms so the wait was very long. On top of that we were told our rooms were not ready. So we left our bags with the bellman and went to lunch. The man checking us in said he would call us in an hour. It was about two hours later that we returned when he did not call us. We were extremely tired from traveling so we just went straight to him and demanded our rooms although he had not called yet. He somehow made it work when one member of our group got a little agressive and refused to wait any longer. I must say that was the only hiccup we faced. The rooms were very clean, comfortable beds, and were overall a great size. The one thing I enjoyed most was the in-room safes that you didn't have to pay extra for or put a deposit for. Matter of fact, all you had to do was create a 4 digit code and reset it every couple of days- NO keys...I loved it. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Always carrying conversations and catering to our every need. We didn't eat much at the hotel itself because it was expensive for the portions. We had the buffet breakfast one day and ate at the Alfredo restaurant which was excellent also once. The drinks served at the Mediterrean cafe by the pool is overly priced for VERY watered down drinks. So we went to the grocery store across the street and bought drinks and juice and would mix it in our room and take it with us to the beach and pool. Some food recommendations: Mi Casita, Gelo's Bakery- both across the street. Lupis next door had the worest food. Of course they also have Subway, Burger King, Wendy's etc... The grounds by the way are gorgous. Wonderful pool area and beach. Nice and clean and they provide towels. If you're up for it there's a kiosk on the beach that sell jet ski, parasailing etc... We all did the Banana Boat....the BEST expereince. It was soo fun. Try it! Nightlife was a little dim in Puerto Rico. We enjoyed Brava the most- located inside the El San Juan, which had the best bars and chill spots. **Side Note: We rented a car from the Avis in the lobby and drove to El Yunque Rainforest (35 minute drive), to the Bacardi Factory, to Ocean Park Beach, Luquillo Beach and Old San Juan rather than taking a taxi and paying so much more.** Have Fun on your trip to Puerto Rico!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous beach front Resort”
Reviews.Author: jessika14
Reviews.Content: My stay and interaction with the Intercontinental was one of business. I had the task of researching for a place to hold my company's convention. I found the Intercontinental. I was flown down there, all expenses paid, for 3 nights to take a look at the property. I then also stayed there for another 3 nights during our convention. I was there on business for the first trip so I was treated like royalty. Meals prepared from the Head Chef, one of their nicer rooms, a private dinner on the beach along the boardwalk, complimentary trips off the property, meeting with management etc... Everyone there was beyond nice and professional. Now I know this is not the treatment most people will get, but it is certainly a reflection on how they treat their customers and the pride that they take in their property. Top notch employees all around. My room on this trip was in the "club" house. It overlooked the pool area (which was still a good view cause the pool is awesome). The room was great. The marbled bathroom, the large fluffy bed, the sitting area, the deck. This area also has a private dining space for the club members. Breakfast is served here as well as appetizers from 5pm-7pm. My second stay was more normal with no special treatment. My room was a regular room in the hotel. I did get beach views, which was gorgeous. The room itself is your standard hotel room. It is very clean however. The property is amazing. It sits right on the beach. The beach is public, but they do have people that make sure not just anybody wanders onto the property. The pool area is great too. Palm trees, and a swim up bar, another regular bar, a huge hot tub. There is a "rock wall" type thing in the pool with a waterfall coming down. It definately sets that tropical feel and makes your stay all the more relaxing. The staff for the pool area are also awesome and extremely nice. The steps out of the hotel leading to the pool are a grand staircase that makes you feel like you are Scarlet O'Hara at the beach making your grand entrance. I am not much for gambling and didn't spend tons of time in the casino. I can't really compare it to any other casino cause I have never really been! But it had slot machines, black jack, poker tables etc... and all the bright, flashing lights you would expect. The whole hotel is very nice. Marble everywhere. It just has presence. There are several hotels on the property including a Ruth Chris, an Italian restaurant that just opened when I was there. It was a top notch high end restaurant. We met the Chef as her personally came out to our table. A great meal. One of the best I have ever had. The also have a Japanese restaurant on the premise. All of them are pretty expensive, but the food reflects that price. If your company is planning a convention or retreat I would highly recommend this location. I would also recommend it for your next PR vacation.

Reviews.Title: “INTERCONTINENTAL SAN JUAN,PUERTO RICO”
Reviews.Author: browniiz62257
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for our honeymoon in May 2007for 10 days and it was absoluteley beautiful and gorgeous with excellent service and it was clean.We will go again every year because we know what we will look forward to when we go.Everything was to our liking,the views overlooking the pool and ocean were breathtaking and we enjoyed ourselves so much we didnt even go off grounds except to try differnt restaurants outside as well as on the premises., which were very good also. You will not be disappointed. The only thing that was a drawback were the tiny flys they have but if you use the off spray you were fine. As a whole it is a great place to be and return to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort.....Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: tmitola
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research on mytripadvisor...so I feel strongly about sharing our experience. The Intercontinental is wonderful...on par with a Ritz Carlton. Our room had a beautiful ocean view and new furnishings. Service and staff were excellent. Property grounds are meticulously kept ...pool area is beautiful and lush. The beach is great with just enough surf to keep kids interested. Casino on the property is lackluster...but if you want the glintz of Vegas the El San Juan is right next store. We actually preferred the relaxed, island feel of the Intercontinental though. We used the pool restaurants for lunch...they were very good and resort priced. We had breakfast across the street at Mi casita....very reasonable and good. Breakfast for four is around $30...compared to $22 per person at the hotel. We dined outside the resort for dinner...Barachino's is about a fifteen minute walk...excellent island food VERY friendly staff. We also tried Aijji Modito in Condado despite good reviews the food was OK...we found out after they changed management about a month ago. By far the best Puerto Rican fare was at Raices in Old San Juan....large portions...delicious. Plus, the atmosphere is fun all the staff dresses in traditional island costume. We also dined at The Parrot Club in Old San Juan which was very good...The Dragon Fly ,which is run by the same owner, is asian infused...but is more of a tapis bar than restaurant. Plates are small and to share. Its a good option if you want to eat lighter...island fare can be heavy. Try the duck nachos... In terms of siteseeing, we loved the location of the hotel....being 15 to the airport was great. We went to Old San Juan every night...we rented a car...about a 15 min drive. Parking lots were accessible and a mere $3 for the day. The forts are interesting with beautiful vistas. We went to Baccardi by car...but wouldn't waste your time...you do NOT tour the actual factory anymore...its a short movie and some displays. The Rain Forest is a great trip for kids....loved swimming in the falls. While there we also went to Luquillo Beach which is a beautiful beach, but if your staying in Isle Verde, the hotel beach is nicer with more amenties..so you might want to skip it. We did eat lunch at the kioskis...its their version of road side fast food... alot of fried fritter type food. The people of PR were wonderful and friendly. If you are a staying more than three days definitely rent a car. One word of caution, the drivers in PR are typical city drivers no worse than any New Yorker . But the roadways are not easy to navigate as their road signs are mininal/missing...none of the major atttractions had road signs!!!! The conceirge will give you printed directions..but often they were vague or inaccurate. If you get lost ,and you will, you can call the Conceirge for help. Be sure you have a charged cellphone. We loved the Intercontinenal and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Beach, Pool and Casino”
Reviews.Author: ABIGAIL6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short taxi ride from the airport. It is not far from the airport, but that should not be a concern at all. The beach at the hotel is great as is the pool and hot tub. The pool is beautiful and the hot tub is huge. You can get a drink while swimming in the pool. The outside cafÃ© is great for lunch. The Japanese restaurant is great for great reasonable sushi. The people in the sushi restaurant are very nice too. The excursions you can book at the concierge are over priced. The exercise room is great if you want to work out. There is an Avis rent a car facility located in the lobby. Rented a car for one day for $50.00. The Avis rent a car lady was very helpful. We used the car rental to go to the rain forest and then drove to a beautiful beach where we went snorkeling. The casino is nice, HINT: go to the casino during the day and afternoon for $5.00 blackjack tables, otherwise you will never get a $5.00 blackjack table. In the evening there are mostly $10.00 and $25.00 tables. Only complaint was the soft bed, but I must admit the fresh air in Puerto Rico exhausted me so I had no trouble sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: LMMBATAVIA
Reviews.Content: Loved the Intercontinental. Traveled with friends and we had a great time. The restaurants and drinks by the pool are expensive, but there are other options. Plenty of great restaurants nearby (Metropol-really good) and a grocery across the street. With refrigerators in the room it was easy to buy and bring back to the hotel. People could not have been nicer. The only problem we had (4 star instead of 5) was that we were told that there was a hospitality suite we could use since our flight was not until 6, but they never told us until we got the key that you only have 30 min. For one person fine but for all of us it was a little rushed. I get it but they should have warned us and we could have split up. Will definitely return to San Juan and would stay at the Intercontinental again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: rtm18
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for business quite often over the past few years (and a few times for pleasure) and finally had to write a review. This place has definitely made some great improvements. While the service has always been excellent, the facilities are now up to par for an Intercontinental. As others have noted, the hotel has gone through some major renovations and is now a top-notch resort. Again, the service here has always been excellent. I feel like I'm walking into "Cheers" every time I step through the front door (OK, I stay here very often). There are too many names to mention but Lorna Mendez has always taken good care of me! This is a great hotel for business travelers as it is very close to the airport (it is not that loud) and has every amenity a business traveler could want, including a nice business center and fitness center. I have also taken my family here a few times for pleasure and was never disappointed. The last time I took my wife here a few months ago and we had a great time - so great that she wants to come back for her big XXth birthday. I told her she could go anywhere (within reason) but she wanted to come back here. The grounds are fabulous and it is right on a beautiful beach. Yes, food and drink may be a bit pricey but you are at a very nice resort and the food is excellent. If you are on a tight budget there is always Motel 6. I would rather splurge on a single stay here than a couple of stays at a budget motel. There are plenty of reasonable dining options within a short walk or ride. Nearby is Lupis, Mi Casita, Metropol, Outback and a Chiliâ€™s is opening soon. Old San Juan is loaded with fabulous restaurants (Aguaviva â€“ best ceviche!, Parrot Club, Dragonfly, Tamarind, Tantra) as well as shops, historical sights, etc. There are also some great restaurants between the hotel and Old San Juan. Some of my favorites are Ropa Vieja, Pamelaâ€™s (tables on the beach!), Ajili Mojili, Cheâ€™s, Atlantica, Steak & Co. and Casa Dante to name a few. Also you must try Soleil Beach Club in Pinones, an open-air place right on the water with fabulously fresh seafood. An overall great hotel for business and pleasure and great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: KevinOleary
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Intercontinental for my father in law's 60th birthday party. We asked for an upgrade for the birthday boy and they gave us a Suite for no extra cost. The staff was really friendly, starting with the lady at the front desk and throughout the rest of the property. The rooms were nice and well kept, the beach was the cleanest of all the beach spots around. I liked the Casino at the El San Juan better than the IC but the dealers were friendlier at the IC. In all we had a great time and will def return for another stay. Tip...the El San Juan next door has a really nice nightclub, get there early on a Sat night and they have a cool roof top bar as well.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyCalvin
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews we read were right on: Hotel: Only a 5-10 minute cab ride from the airport ($11 fare). The lobby and pool are very nice. The beach is nice, but the water did have some seaweed so if that bothers you might consider a different area/island. Never had a problem getting a lounge chair at the pool or beach. The walls are thin and the doors to each room tend to slam when they close. The sound of the airplanes didn't bother us. We thought the concierge people were friendly and very helpful. The casino is small but still enjoyable. Food: Ma Casita was good, reasonably priced breakfast and dinner food. We were not impressed with the breakfast at Alfredo's (in the hotel), especially at $22 per person. The Japenese restaurant at the hotel was okay. We went into Old San Juan twice (we loved it there; $19 cab fare each way - hint: you can share a cab with other hotel guests who are going into Old San Juan to save a little money) and ate at the Puerto Rico Cafe - a cheesy name but very good authentic Puerto Rican food. We went next door to the El San Juan Hotel for dinner and gambling one night - we ate at The Ranch at the top of the hotel - very good food and great views of San Juan and the water. Local attractions: El San Juan hotel has a "Vegas" atmosphere whereas the Intercontinental was quiet and relaxed (which we appreciated). We rented a car through the hotel (about $35 for the day) and went to Loquillo Beach one afternoon - much larger beach and calmer water but we recommend going during the week if you can (apparently gets crowded during the weekends). Taco Stand #2 at Loquillo is FANTASTIC - it was recommended to us by our concierge. That morning, we went to El Yunque Rainforest and did some hiking - very good waterfall, scenic views, etc. All in all a very pleasant and relaxing trip. There are definitely nicer places/beaches to visit in the Carribean, so we might not be back to Puerto Rico for some time but we're glad we checked it out.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience Once Again”
Reviews.Author: Ducksoop
Reviews.Content: We treat ourselves to a stay at this hotel every year after we take a cruise and once again it did not disappoint. This is a four star hotel that is flawlessly maintained with good service and large, elegantly decorated guest rooms. This was the first time the front desk did not give us an upgrade to an ocean view, but the city view was lovely (see photo) so don't be hesitant to book these rooms if you want to save the extra money. There is very little street noise when the balcony door is open, and no noise at all when it is closed. We found the service to be excellent. For example, we arrived from our cruise much too early for check in, but Ray did an especially nice job of taking care of our mountain of luggage. He stored them until our room was ready then delivered them to our room very quickly. He also kept an eye out for friends we'd met on the cruise who came by to have drinks with us by the pool and personally led them all the way to the bar at the rear of the property to meet us. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The beds have down mattress pads, down comforters, and down pillows. The bathrooms are small but elegantly decorated, and the toiletries offered were so great that I brought all the leftovers home. The pool area and grounds are our favorite parts of the hotel. The landscaping can only be described as "lush and abundant" and the pool is gorgeous.
