There is a waterfall in the pool and plenty of lounge chairs so you can choose to lie in the sun or find a shady spot, and the beach is literally steps away from the pool. There are plenty of beach umbrellas and lounge chairs there and waiters to bring beverages. The only thing I might mention is that the food and drink at the hotel are quite expensive so keep that in mind when ordering at any of the poolside bars. A mojito in a fairly small plastic cup was $8 and beers were not much less. The restaurants on the first floor of the hotel are very pricey as well but there are other dining choices close by you will enjoy. We particularly enjoy Yerba Buena which is a $10 cab ride away which serves good food and the option of dining in unique outdoor "swinging tables".

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Hotel - Horrid Guests”
Reviews.Author: Berks1970
Reviews.Content: We chose the San Juan Intercontinental for the last four days of our 10-day trip to Puerto Rico. The rest of the trip was spent at serene, out-of -the-way sort of places in Puerto Rico, so we were thoroughly rested and recharged when we arrived at this hotel. The people at the front desk are very well-trained and polite. We were a tad early and our room wasn't ready, so the bellman took our bags and we went out to the beach-side deck for burgers. When we got to our room an hour later, it was lovely. We had a 12th floor room with an ocean view. Outstanding! My only complaint was that the double beds seemed small for two people. There would have been enough room for slightly larger beds, I think. All the other room amenities were very nice. This otherwise lovely property was overrun by rude, arrogant, loud people from a certain East Coast major metropolitan area for the long MLK holiday weekend. They were their usual loud, pushy, obnoxious selves all weekend. Those people were on their Blackberrys and cell phones constantly, everywhere you went, including the pool area, so it was really difficult to relax. I could just feel my blood pressure going up. Several men even smoked cigars by the pool. I was disgusted by this. Who wants to smell that instead of the fresh sea breeze?It was really hard to move to another lounge chair, too, since it was extremely crowded and difficult to find a seat in the first place. Then, when I did find another seat that appeared free, some jerk pushed all my stuff on to the ground while I was swimming. Complaints to the staff elicited little more than shrugs. Later that evening, I went out on my hotel balcony, only to find a man on the balcony below and to the right completely nude and showing himself off to a cheering woman on the patio below. Revolting and low class (more of our countrymen from a certain major East Coast city). The pool is really nice (except they allow smoking anywhere), the beach was nice, too, but the water was full of seaweed. The food and drinks are very high-priced, but I knew this going in, so I sucked it up. I paid $23 for a very tasty quesadilla and Diet Coke. They add the 15% tip right into the bill, so just be aware. We had a rental car and know our way around San Juan pretty well, so we chose to take most of our meals off the property. The valet men were quick and efficient. No problems there. The other thing they get you with is one of those stupid "resort charges" of about $50 per night, so make sure you add that (and about another $50 in taxes) to whatever room rate you find online. Do not be fooled!!! This hotel is very close to the airport. This is good and bad. Good because it takes no time at all to get your rental car returned at to the airport, but bad because you can hear jets taking off all day. Not that big a deal, just something to know before you go. All in all, this was a lovely property with friendly staff, but I doubt we will ever go back. It's perfect for the loud, obnoxious city types requiring every luxury and used to paying exorbitant prices for everything, or for people who want to go to Puerto Rico but are too scared (which is silly) to venture outside of a resort. We'll be looking for something much less crowded, where quiet and solitude are more possible on our next trip. Lastly, we are Priority Club members, but we had no idea that Intercontinental hotels pay Priority Club points at a much lower rate than standard Holidays Inns. We actually received more points for a short stay in a Holiday Inn in Ponce than for our longer, far more expensive stay at the Intercontinental. Frankly, we felt a little ripped off about that.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fran000
Reviews.Content: We just came back for a three night stay during the San Sebastian festival. Every hotel room was booked. We originally were booked in the El San Juan Hotel and CAsino through a Jet Blue Package. Jet Blue called us two days before we were ready to leave to say that the hotel overbooked and we had no room. WE were desperate. We spent 5 hours calling every hotel. We lucked out and booked two rooms, oceanfront at the Intercontinental and were very happy with the hotel. The location was great, the rooms were very nice and clean. The casino was good. All the staff were so very friendly and helpful. Even though all the rooms were booked the hotel did not seem crowded. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would return. The only small problem was that there was not much choice for breakfast. There was only one restuarant for breakfast. Also, the hotel is not lively, very quiet with a nice lobby bar and band.

Reviews.Title: “Paid a fee to leave”
Reviews.Author: plainngang4
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on Intercontinental name and reviews online. The room was dirty, the bed was uncomfortable and the bathroom was small and very dated. It just wasn't what I have come to expect from an intercontinental. I have had nicer rooms at Hampton Inns. The only restaurant at the hotel that I would reccommend was the Ruth Chris. We were suppose to stay 4 nights but left after 2 and checked into a different hotel. They charged and extra fee of $100 to leave early. That should have been a red flag that the hotel was not up to par. I will be contacting the Intercontinental chain to complain also. They should be ashamed to put their name on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: mdmny1
Reviews.Content: overall a great hotel. the location was great, physical property is in good shape and the staff was great. the beach was nice and pool area equally good. its a solid 4 star hotel that we would not only reccommend, but stay at again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: NicB70
Reviews.Content: Chose the Intercontinental for a post-Christmas trip (we got a last-minute air and hotel package via AmericanExpress.com) and were very happy with the hotel--I highly recommend it if you're headed to SJ and it's within your budget. (We probably wouldn't have stayed here if paying full price...but for the price we got online it was phenomenal!) First--the hotel's in a fabulous location. It's a $12 cab ride to the airport, and $19 to Old San Juan. Taxis are readily available. There are a few restaurants across the street (Burger King, Church's Chicken, Subway, and La Casita for Mexican food), as well as a small grocery store. There's a Walgreen's within about a ten minute walk. Check-in was speedy. On arrival, we asked if any oceanview rooms were available and were told it'd be an extra $80/night (when we'd checked online before leaving home, it'd been higher.) We paid for the upgrade and were VERY happy with the room...14th floor with a great view of the pool, ocean, etc. The pool and beach are very clean, and we had no trouble finding lounge chairs. The hotel provides you with nice fluffy towels just as you're entering the pool area, which is very convenient. In our room, the beds were only mediocre, but everything else was so good it wasn't a big deal. There was even better-than-expected toiletries and the water pressure in the shower was great. The hotel was clean and the staff very attentive. We had to wait a couple times for the concierge, but she was helpful and informative about day trips, restaurants, etc. They have a computer next to the concierge desk that allows hotel guests to search for restaurants, activities, etc. all over Puerto Rico. It was very handy...even lets you see restaurant menus. We booked an all-day excursion via the concierge desk that took us to El Yunque, Luquillo Beach, and on a nighttime kayak ride to the bioluminescent bay in Fajardo. It was pricey, but well worth every penny. (The kayak ride in particular was phenomenal!) I was worried the kids (ages 6 and 9) wouldn't be able to go all day, and that the kayak might be too much, but they did fine and would do it all again. The tour guide the hotel uses, Joey, was fabulous and pointed out all kinds of things to the kids (even found them a coqui!) and made food suggestions to keep them happy. I also splurged and got a massage at the spa at the Intercontinental--VERY good massage, though not cheap! If you want to save $$, do NOT order at the pool bar. Drinks are very, very pricey. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants other than at the outdoor cafe. A pizza there is $14. It looks like it's for one, but it's probably enough for two people (we had a LOT left over...could have saved $$$.) The food was very good, however, so no regrets! If you can book the Intercontinental the way we did (on a last minute deal) and save $$$, do it! The service was phenomenal, as was the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cabindan
Reviews.Content: We just returned and spent x-mass there the staff was the nicest we have ever seen the food, accommodation's we excellent. The Pool and beach we tremendous. If you are on any kind of budget then do not eat pool side or drink pool side. Cokes $4.00 I ordered a Vodka & tonic at the swim up bar $15.00 + tip WOW!!! Plenty of good eats close by and buy your waters etc..across the street at the local store. Very easy to get to only 1 mile from airport.

Reviews.Title: “My Ocean View ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: amberwithwings
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: i'm 25 and a newlywed, so half the thrill of my vacation is being away with my husband of seven months, and I would be happy if I were to arrive at a much less classy hotel, as long as I have my bikini, a book, and the beach. I'm traveling with my husband and his parents and his brother and wife, so I didn't book the trip and I'm not paying for anything. So I won't talk about the prices much. I do know that it is expensive, though. My in-laws are, well, wealthy, and this is their 5th time here. They come for Christmas every year (the place is filled with Jews from Long Island and New Jersey this time of year, which is funny. We flew all this way, and it's like being back home. They spotted a friend from Temple at the pool!) That said, this place is gorgeous! They upgraded us to an ocean view, and I love it; the view is breathtaking. The room is really clean and modern, and they have JUST put in brand-new flat screen TVs. They participate in a water saving program, so the sheets are not washed every day, which I appreciate as a green-thinking person. The food is excellent at the poolside bar, but crappy at the restaurant closer to the beach. They're about 50 feet away from each other, but the difference in quality is astounding. The staff is super friendly and the pool-side service is great. They have a cozy jacuzzi and the pool is nice although once the sun goes behind the hotel (around 3 pm) it is unbearably cold! The beach access is convenient, and such a treat. I prefer to go sunbathe all the way to the left, where the locals are hanging out. (To get there, you have to wade through the el San Juan hotel guests... and they are snobby). The wi-fi is spotty, which is making us crazy as both me and the hubby are laptop toting people. there is NO drawer space in here, just three measly drawers that I took, and a closet. Hubbs is living out of his suitcase. Other than that, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kristen412
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to a cruise out of San Juan and the only reason we stayed here is because we have the Priority Club membership and we redeemed 40,000 points to stay for free for one night. The hotel overall was very nice, clean, and the staff was nice. Everything was very overpriced though so we did not do anything at the hotel after we realized how overpriced it was. When we got there and checked in we were starving so we ordered room service and got a small ceaser salad and chicken quesedilla's which were $35, and they have a mini bar in the room where a bottle of water is $5. Right across the street is a mini mart which sells a gallon of water for $1 so we went across the street and bought that. We also ate dinner at a local restaurant down the street. The property had a pool and jacuzzi and was right on the beach. Overall it was nice but I probably wouldn't stay there again. We talked to a couple who said they sat down at the bar in the main lobby of the hotel and ordered 2 drinks and it cost them $40! Also a cab ride anywhere from this resort will run you at least $20 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick and affordable getaway”
Reviews.Author: nyc_digitaldad
Reviews.Content: Got a tremendous deal for a quick four-nighter with my wife. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor we decided upon the Intercontinental and knew to pay just a bit extra to be guaranteed an ocean-front room, which makes all the difference. Rooms were fairly small but just fine for two people, and the king bed faces out to the ocean, which makes for great morning wake-ups. At times, San Juan felt like a sister city of NYC given how many people have emigrated to NYC from PR. Seemed like everyone we talked to had a relative or friend in NYC, or had been there themselves. Pros: - Great pool - Not too crowded even when full - Good buffet breakfast that didn't get tiring after 4 days - 5 minutes from airport - Just like home: we have many puerto rican acquaintances given that we're from New York City - Neighboring hotels are fun to visit but we were always happy that we were sleeping at the Intercontinental ' Cons: - Definitely urban feel, miami beach-like. - Depending on the tides, the ocean and sand may be overcome with seaweed 2 of of our 4 days were like this. Tip: Go to Pamela's on the Beach restaurant at the Numero Uno Guest House for a truly memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great times at Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: NLODanvers_MA_
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days at Intercontinental- we had a wonderful time. Everything was excellent- beautiful pool and beach, great rooms, lovely lobby and bars and a warm, friendly staff. The only restaurant we ate at was the beach cafe- food was good and average priced. The other restaurants at the hotel were very expensive for our tastes. Luckily, the hotel is located within walking distance to many other restaurants. We ate at Lupis, Mi Casita and Outback and they were fine. Walking around felt safe and confortable. We would recommend the tour to the Rain Forest. We loved it, though the walk back from the waterfall is a bit steep and my legs ached the next few days! Took a taxi to Old San Juan and ate at Barachina's- they invented the Pina Colada and they were delicious! We would definitely go back to Intercontinental! Convenient to airport ; you do hear airplanes but was not irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jlee73
Reviews.Content: Loved it !!! The outside is a little drab from the street but once you enter the resort, it is a different story. The lobby is somewhat small, but ample, the front desk staff are excellent, Katrina (I think was her name) was extremely helpful. We arrived on Saturday morning around 12pm but our room was not ready. We had lunch at the beach side cafe, pizza, burgers and stuff. the price was reflective of a higher end resort, but not too bad. Once we got in the room, it was huge in comparison to most other resorts I looked into. This is a resort to relax in, the one benefit for me was that there were not many, if at all children running around everywhere screaming. Mostly adults just lounging by the pool. The hotel also has it's own private beach area where the porter will place a lounge chair and umbrella where ever you would like. Nice touch. We also loved dealing with Hector at the concierge desk. He booked the Bio Bay tour in Farajdo (spelling?). This is a must if you are there and there is a new moon. This is a once in a life time experience, just be prepared, you have to kayak a good distance to the lagoon. But well worth the exercise. The pool area is great, a decent balance of sun and shaded areas. The pool never seemed over crowded, and chairs were amble. We had lunch at the pool (swim up) bar. I thought it was very reasonable considering it is the Intercontinental. I had the shrimp skewers and it was only $10 bucks. Now a waring, every soda refill cost. I was not used to this considering in the continental US, refills are usually free. Also I had a cocktail and was averaged price for a beach resort. What surprises me, is to read the other reviews and have people thinking that hotels are cheap. If you want cheap, stay at the Holiday Inn. You get what you pay for, and this resort is worth it. While we were there, we also look at other resorts to see about the competition. The property next door, the San Juan Resort and Casino, it is newer and glitzier, but the room are small. I would rather have a large room and comfortable bed than a shinny lobby. In conclusion, I would highly recommend this resort. The Manager Pablo personally introduced himself to us and asked how are stay was going. When was the last time a manager asked, or even cared.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: lorilou88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way way overrated and overpriced. The bathroom was dated and was in need of a serious facelit. The bathtub was old and shabby looking. Considering what it cost to stay here, so not worth it! We paid for an upgraded, ocean view room and what a disapointment. The view of the ocean was great - if you could take standing out on the the little "veranda" to enjoy it - which was only about three feet wide! The chairs are placed sideways because they can't fit facing the water! The pool area is nice (though rather small) and looks fairly new. They need to spend some money on the rooms. They were clean but nothing to rave about, again considering the price to stay here. Forget eating or drinking at this hotel. $4 for a small cup of cofee is insane! Thankfully, my husband is from the island so we know where - and where not - to go! If you are a true urbanite, then this is the place to stay. It's on a bustling city street with a lot of people and noise. If not, go elsewhere on the island! Honestly, we would not stay here again - just not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!! They catered to your every need”
Reviews.Author: AlissaFalco
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just got back from a 3 night stay for my sister's 30th birthday. We all loved the hotel. It is beautiful, located right on the beach. It is a 5 minute ride from the airport and a 15 minute ride from Old San Juan. They had great service wherever we went. They greated you at the entrance. There was always someone there to open the door for you and get you cab if needed. Everyone was so helpful also. We need some information as to where to go out at night and the consierge called about 5 different places for us to see if they had dancing and which place was the best for us. They had a great sushi restaurant in the hotel too. It has everything, the beach, amazing pool, great restaurants, casino and live music in the lobby at night which was fun too. We were 4 girls in a room so we were a little worried about being cramped, but we weren't at all. The room was very spacious and clean. They also have a swim up bar and restaurant on the beach. We also like very much that they were very strict with only letting patrons in the pool area. We saw them tell many differnt people at different times to leave because they were not patrons. I didn't have my bracelet on at one time and they came right up to me ans asked if I was staying there. We were all glad that they had such strictness because this kept the riff raff and starngers from comind into the pool area. This hotel is also located right next to the el San Juan Resort & Casino which was a cool place too. They had a great lobby and club too that we went too. We loved the hotel and definitely go back. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: Relaxin80
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. food and drinks very expensive. Found myself running accross the street to Burger King a few times. View from room was great. Nice pool. Concierge was very helpful. The walls seemed a little thin. I could hear what my neighbors were talking about without any effort. The restaurant downstairs is a bit odd. In the morning its a walk in buffet and in the evening its a restaurant with a dress code and its very expensive. I may have bought into that and paid for an outrageously overpriced dinner if i hadn't just eaten bacon and eggs at the same table just a few hours earlier in my bathing suit. Overall I would say it was ok. very nice to look at but once i was there a few days you start to notice the imperfections. $15.00 for a drink at the swim up bar. Muy expensivo my friends. Can't say i didnt enjoy myself but i wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: misseattle
Reviews.Content: Location and rooms were the best part about this hotel. I don't think it was as high end looking as I thought it would be. The casino was small, but the pool and the access to the beach were wonderful. Restaurant and room service prices were outrageous! I paid $19 for a basket of popcorn and a molten lava cake. There is a grocery store, Baskin Robbins, Burger King and Church's Chicken directly across the street. The service was very good with the bellman and check in, but check out took forever and I don't think the recepetionist knew how to count money. Right next door is a fantastic nightclub at the El San Juan Resort and Casino, it's called Club Brava. On a Saturday night it was $16 for men, $11 for ladies. Drinks were $7 for a small cup. Expensive, but definitely the place to be for both locals and tourists. You have to dress to impress there and word to the wise, once you get in, don't go out and try to get back--the line was so long and there was no organization for in/out. Also dress to impress!

Reviews.Title: “Both Bad and Good to Say”
Reviews.Author: jjb415
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Intercontinental Hotel San Juan was for 2 nights on September 14, 2007, for a pre-cruise stay. I arrrived into San Juan in the late afternoon, took the fixed rate taxi to the hotel, and was greeted warmly by the bell staff as they did each and every time I entered or departed the hotel. I was effeciently and pleasantly checked into my room #1123 by the front desk clerk. This very nice service is what I had remembered from a previous stay at another San Juan hotel, but, unfortunately this is where the friendly service ended at the Intercontinental San Juan. My room, although small, was cheerfully decorated and the bed was fluffy and comfortable with the bottom sheet completely covering the matress. The small balcony overlooked the street area and airport landing traffic (no problem with noise). I immediately noticed that the room contained nice bathroom amenities and plenty of towels, but, none of the usual Room Service Menu/Service Directory/Writing Paper portfolio. The room also had an ironing board but no iron. In calling for these items, I was told that the iron would be sent up but I would have to call the Business Center for the portfolio. Okay fine. Business Center says call Housekeeping, each time being asked, "Anything else I can do for you?" To me, this is the most frustrating situation with Customer Service. If you haven't been able to fullfill my request, don't ask if you can do anything else. I decided it was not that important to get the portfolio. As it turned out the iron was broken, but, was replaced quickly the next day. After a very long trip, I went to bed early but was awakened by loud voices in the hallway, mistaken phone calls and knocking at the door. After falling asleep again, I was awakened again by the 3 false fire alarms mentioned by a previous review. The next night did go much better with no alarms! My room was made up the second day very promptly after leaving for lunch and the Housekeeping department was quiet and unobtrusive. As mentioned in previous reviews,the beach at the Intercontinental is very nice and the hotel has great service for guests who wish to be served while in the sun. The pool is also very nice and security is tight, making it difficult for anyone who is not a regestered guess to be admitted. The gym is well-equipped, adequately air conditioned,and has a nice view of the beach, and is open 24-hours. The ice machine on my floor worked well and always had plenty of ice. As I stay in hotels about 12 nights a month, I have to say that the young lady at check out gets the award for the worst in the world. She was curt, rude, and did not even offer to show me a list of my charges prior to charging my card. She had no change in cash to accommodate my request for small bills acting as if this was a strange request for a hotel cashier. No thank you's or offers of assistance with bags from her. All of this after waiting 5 minutes for other clerk on duty to finish her personal conversation with a co-worker. All in all, this hotel is quite a blast from the past. I fully expected to see Lucy, Ethel, Fred and Ricky pass through the lobby while on their "Puerto Rican Adventure." Truely a place where my Mom and Dad would have spent their honeymoon. Not a bad thing if staff could be brought up-to-date on current standards of service in the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Island thing to do”
Reviews.Author: Jeolive
Reviews.Content: I am an experienced PR frequenter. (is that a word) Nice older hotel in main strip of Isla Verde San Juan. Direct access to nicer beach on island and nice (older) designer pool. Staff attentive. Check in was ok although I had a jerk and stone faced fool who checked me in at first and told me rom would be ready in 3 hours. I came back 5 minutes later and was helpfully attended by a female clerk who check me in 3 hours before the fool said I could. $10 to airport and cross street from Charlies car Rental. Nice rooms. again older, but clean and SMALL terraces. Casino and small lounge for evening drinks. NOT A PARTY HOTEL. More reserved. Next door at the El San Juan is where the party gets jumping with a club and live music lounge. I hear the service there is bad though, so stay here and walk there for night life. American and Latino Restaurants and small mall across street for all that you forgot back home. Decent cigar shop in mall too. Best Night Club on Island: Next door at El San Juan. Favorite eatery/hangout spot: LUPIS two blocks towards airport. Live bands (top 40 and rock) cheaper booze and food. lots happening through out week and then some. Must do in PR. Visit historical places. MUST do Old San Juan. Castles, Shops, El Convento by nice church and beautiful cooper stone street leading to the door of san Juan. Nice trendy restaurants all over 2 square miles. BEST IS DRAGON FLY. Packed. ASK FOR CEASAR. Tell him Elias sent ya. Other things: For nicer beaches, golf and great hotels to visit PLUS good eats visit FAJARDO. Half hour away but totaly different sceen. Not to mention the famous rain forest near by. Easy car ride away BUT drive with eyes behind your head. BAD drivers all over. FOR THE ADVENTURERS AND ISLAND CURIOUS: Rent a car. Travel towards the east coast line pass Pinones to Canovanas then towards Fajardo. You have rainforest and Luquillo beach here. Visit all in between (beaches and eaterys)and take a boat over to Vieges or other small island from ferry landing in Fajardo and see what a beach should be. Come back and go to Ponce historical city with beautiful buildings, famous fire house and such. Travel west to Aquadilla. boat and beach town. take a short drive from there and visit LARES' center city for a look at the older ways and good ice cream of 100 different flavors. In between on main rode to Lares visit the hidin Caves of Camuey. Drive back east and stop at Arecibo and take a view from the highest point on island. Work your way back east and visit the Bacardi rum factory. Drive to old San Juan and do the walking sites mentioned above. This would take a full day if you skip the ferry to islands. Two days with the ferry to island included. Good luck and enjoy the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort on isle verde”
Reviews.Author: GOBOLTS_1
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort! Had a great vacation. The intercontinental in our opinion was the best in the area. We walked to ESJ and the Ritz and we were happy we chose the intercontinental! Great pool area and beach. Like other reviews have stated food is very expensive at the resorts. We only ate once at the resort and we chose the japanese rest. ($100 for the two of us) It was just average in my opinion. One tip bring your own drinks to the pool area, they charged us $3 for a small cup of coke and $3 for a cup of water. Booked a snorkel trip on the Barefoot cat. in Fajardo and had a great day! When we return to San Juan we will definitly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “shameful”
Reviews.Author: era21_21
Reviews.Content: I was embarrassed by security on my 3rd day there in the main lobby questioning whether I was a guest or not. Personally I feel as though I was profiled as being a local and just wanting to use the facilities, and not being a guest since I am hispanic. When i advised the concierge of this no concern or empathy was shown or given. This may not affect anyone's decision about this hotel but be weary of there practices.

Reviews.Title: “Less then stellar”
Reviews.Author: cjh3
Reviews.Content: Expensive for what you get. Could not check into until after 4 pm, had to sit in lobby until then and then I still had to go to concierge in order to obtain room. Rooms are small, bathroom is tight, had 3 shampoos on counter when checking in no other products until 3rd day. Cleaning staff left dirty towels in room. did not vacum daily. Air conditioner leaked, but hotel did fix quickly Prices at bar ridiculous 15 dollars for a martini? Unable to rent movies on tv, channel was too fuzzy.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: kat069
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and I just loved this resort. It was immaculate, the staff were superb. Its hard to say what my favorite part was, because it was all so wonderful, the pool area is amazing, like a little village. the beach was very clean, and we had a wonderful ocean view, they upgraded us with no problem. I miss it there, and I am planning on returning again. we stayed a week, and i wanted to stay longer. any rquest, i.e. robes, chairs, extra coffee, they would do asap. i would suggest that everyone try this place, and getting the ocean view is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Would go Again”
Reviews.Author: Mr G
Reviews.Content: I was there just before Hurricane Dean with two children (14 and 11) A really nice place to stay with just a few problems â€“ mostly with certain staff. Would I go back? Yes. I really liked it. Pool: Not too big, but full of nooks and crannies for the children to explore. Anyone thinking of swimming laps should go to the beach. Several rocky waterfalls and small pools. Lots of deck chairs with large fluffy towels. Could use more umbrellas â€“ the sun in Puerto Rico is HOT! Beach: Very close to the hotel. White sand, relatively clear warm water with a little sea weed form time to time. Small waves with not very much current. Nice beach. Restaurants Having read that the hotel food was expensive, I always ate outside. But I did notice that the priced menus weren't available before going into the restaurant. Always a sign of high prices. Also, poolside drinks were expensive, but many people brought their own drinks to the pool. Location: Great location. On the beach with numerous cheap or moderately priced restaurants nearby. We liked the Metropole best (a five minute walk) and for lunch the Mi Casita across the road. In the same strip mall as Mi Casita was a Chinese restaurant that was acceptable and a bakery for breakfast. Also across the road are many fast food places, if you can handle that. Also a small grocery across the road. The was airport noise, but we got used to it. Wasn't very loud in the rooms. Front Desk: A mixed bag. The men were usually very helpful and polite. They normally took the time to ask questions to find out what you really needed and offered solutions or alternatives â€“ always resulting is a satisfactory end. The women could use sensitivity training. The ladies were very business-like and while eventually helpful, not that friendly. I don't remember any of them saying good morning or please or thank you. When checking in at 13:00, I was reminded that check in is a 16:00. I asked for a room on a high floor and was advised that she couldn't guarantee anything until the rooms were clean (RIGHT!) Then having read in Trip Advisor about some rooms that were poorly air-conditioned, I asked about those undesirable rooms and asked her not to give me something that was the subject of complaints. She indicated that if there is a problem to call maintenance and they would fix it. (RIGHT!) She worked on her keyboard and suddenly a room was available on the 15th floor (GREAT!) Strange it wasn't available 2 minutes before. She suggested that I check back later to see if it was ready. When we did, it was ready at 14:00 (GREAT!) While I wouldn't seek this young lady again for help, in fairness, she was efficient â€“ but being friendly and polite would have given her high marks. Another engagement with the female front desk was over asking for change for a $50 bill. With a great rolling of the eyes she made sure that I knew how inconvenient it was for her. Pulled out different folders and consulted her colleges. At the end she gave me change. But really â€“ how difficult is it to break a 50? The hotel has a casino, after all. Concierge: The concierge had an A team and a B team. The A team was a man who was very helpful and polite. The B team was a woman who, although polite, was very useful. I was very upset with her one night when my son went downstairs to ask for some matches for a candle, the concierge sent him to the front desk, which sent him into a bar. She sent my 14 year old into a bar! The bar apparently couldn't help him either. So I confronted the concierge and finally a manager gave me some matches. Strangely, the next day I innocently asked the concierge, front desk and bar for matches and they found them right away. Housekeeping. Missed a few things upon occasion, but kept the room very clean. Extra towels were always there and she turned down the beds. Also cleaned the room at the time requested. Curb staff: The bell hops, bag handlers, cab callers were very professional and always helpful. Mostly young guys, the always looked happy, held open doors, greeted gusts. One of the best groups I have seen. Business Centre: Nice facility with reasonable charges. The lady managing the facility was very helpful and made several good suggestions. She knew her stuff. She was also very lovely and I went back several times to use the centre just to talk to her. Room Nice and spacious, but needed to be refreshed. Small balcony that we didn't use. The walls were a bit thin and some nights we could hear people next door or the TV. Normally turning on the air conditioning drowned out the noise. There was a space under the door of the thickness of a bic pen. As a result, all the hallway noise came into the room. I don't know why hotels have these spaces and its one of my pet peeves. TV didn't have all the channels that you would expect this type of hotel to have. Also, there wasn't a listing of the channels available. That would have been helpful

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms may not be as expensive as you think.”
Reviews.Author: banoffee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in both the regular and Club Intercontinental rooms at this property, and I can testify that paying the higher tariff for a Club room is a solid investment. The Club rooms are more spacious (except for the cramped bathrooms) and more recently refubshed than the main rooms and have more spacious balconies overlooking the pool area. Perhaps the greatest benefit and money-saver is the fact that a really fine buffet breakfast is included in the morning, as well as an excellent hors d'oeuvres buffet and open bar in the evening. Just the breakast and cocktail hour make the higher rate sensible, and that doesn't even include the fact that the Club is open all day long for soft drinks and snacks and the level of personal service by the concierge and her staff is superb. Go for it and you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: grumpy611
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter stayed at this wonderful hotel from 8/12/07-8/17/07. It was our first vacation in San Juan Puerto Rico, and we absolutely cannot wait to go back! The hotel was everything we had hoped for and more. It's a short cab ride from the airport and we got to the hotel at 2pm. We were immediately greated warmly by several doorman, who unloaded our luggage. You'll never have to open the door to the hotel, both in and out! We originally had booked a room with a garden-view, but it was upgraded to an ocean-view on the 9th floor. The room was nice, with a small balcony. The view at night was awesome, although you did had to get use to the sounds of the many coqui's(tree frogs). At this point any stress you may have just simply melted away. The pool, swim-up bar, and jacuzzi was nice, as well as the many small waterfalls around the pool. It was never crowded, and lounge chairs were plentiful. The beach is right off the resort, and you can have someone assist you with setting up lounge chairs and umbrella. Another person came around and took orders for food and drinks-another great amenity. The food is expensive, but we decided to splurge anyway. We had ate at the resort's Japanese steakhouse, and Alfredo's(opened one week earlier). Again, it is expensive, but the food and service was excellent. We went on two excursion's-the rain forest and horseback riding on the beach. The tour guide on the rain forest was fantastic-his name was Hector, and he took us on side tours on his own. He talked to us on the mic the whole way, giving us a history lesson on Puerto Rico and its people and customs. We visited the Bacardi Rum factory also. We took a cab ride($19)to the ferry in Old San Juan, took the ferry across(I think it was $1.50 round trip), then another cab ride($3) to the distillery. The tour there was for free, and each adult received two tickets to sample free drinks. We went into Old San Juan twice. Calle Fortaleza is the main street where you can find many shops and restaurants. The architect of the old buildings and cobblestone streets takes you back in time. We ate at the Parrot Club, which was recommended by a Cigar shop merchant. You can take a cab to Plaza Colon($19)from the hotel and walk up Calle Fortaleza to Plaza de Armas. There's an area here that you can feed the hundred's of pigeons-it was amazing. An old woman was selling feed for $1, and the pigeons are walking around your feet, waiting to be fed. Lots of folks from the cruise ships frequent the area around Plaza de Armas. You can find the outlet stores here(Coach,etc.), which is located on Calle Cristo street(make a right off Calle Fortaleza)Further up a hill on Calle Cristo(past the Coach outlet store), you will find the El Morro Fortress to the left. For $5 you can visit this fort as well as the San CristÃ³bal Fort, which is located behind Plaza Colon. It takes a few hours of exploring one fort. The difference between the two is that El Morro is much higher. All in all, the trip was great(can you tell?), the hotel was super, the people were very nice. We cannot wait to go back! I hope this review helps any future vacationers to this great resort and island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: mrsjmichel
Reviews.Content: This was a family vacation for my husband, 13 year and 6 year old girls, and I. It was a nice trip and the hotel was nice. If you are not a picky person then I would recommend this to you. The beach, pool, room service and rooms were nice. We didn't splurge on the room because we never planned on being there very much. If you get a room with a city view, don't plan on sitting on the balcony. You will be lucky to get one person out there. We were so tired everynight that we never noticed the planes. They did come clean our room everyday and we were there for 5 days. Very nice towels. The staff is helpful but don't count on getting an upgrade to a room. You have to be very lucky and it does not matter how much you tip. The food is high and so so. Your best bet is to walk across the street and chose something from there. Make sure you learn spanish. 4 places that we ate they couldn't understand us, because they didn't know english. MUST DO's El Morro Castle, great history and very cheap trip, Old San Juan was great and lots of great shops. Be prepared to do alot of walking. TAKE A CAB!!!. We went to El Morro & Old San Juan on the same day and we took a cab there and back. Yes it cost $19.00 each way. It only took us 15 minutes to get there and back. There was a nice place to eat at in Old San Juan and great view. It was called Cafe Amapola. Great beans and rice! If you like to really shop then go to the Plaza Del Americus shopping mall. Again it will cost you $19.00 each way and it took us 10-15 minutes to get there. It is worth it unless you have alot of time and patience for a 45minute or longer bus ride. Be prepared to walk. It is 3 levels and I love to shop, but I never seen the 3rd level because I was sick of shopping. You will get lost there. MORE MUST DO'S ---scubba diving, my husband loves it and has been several times. He booked it with CoQui Dive and it was well worth the money and he got 2 dives at 2 different places in the same trip/day. He said it was the best he had ever done or seen. If you want to see the most breathtaking beach you must do the snorkling trip that you can book through the hotel. It is $105.00 per person. REALLY WORTH IT!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool and the beach”
Reviews.Author: DMascott
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the airport, but it has a great pool and beach. The staff was very helpful and the room was clean and nice. The down side is the hotel is not conveniently located to tourist attractions. Old San Juan is a 45-minute public bus ride away, although at 75 cents, the trip is a bargain. Any side trips require advanced planning. The food at the hotel, and all the other hotels nearby, is very expensive. If pays to walk around the neighborhood and find other restaurants. Golden Bagel across the street is an excellent alternative to the hotel's way overpriced breakfast. Lupi's down the street offers Mexican cuisine at a reasonable price. Still, the pool and beach provide a terrific and relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: AVeryPickyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the day before and the day after a cruise I took out of San Juan. During the first stay, they upgraded me to a suite right next to the pool that was a room of the quality you would see on MTV Cribs! This was amazing! I suspect they did this because it was my first stay at an Intercontinental Resort and Holiday Inn wanted me to keep coming back. However, on the second stay, I was in a typical room ... which was nothing special. The hotel has one of the nicest pools with beach entry that you will find on the beachy section of Puerto Rico. There is a nice bar area in the middle where you can sit and have one of the weakest $9 drinks you will ever get. However there are plenty of lounge chairs to lay out on and a nice (but crowded pool.) The hotel room (I am reviewing the standard room here ... if you have the money to get a pool side suite, you will thank yourself as the suite was one of the nicest hotel rooms I've stayed in anywhere) ... had yellowish stucco walls and medditeranian style furniture. It didn't really make me feel comfortable being in there for some reason. There was a balcony that overlooked the street (they were booked up and could not move me to one that overlooked the ocean in the back). The bed was comfortable but the room just lacked style. It felt like one of those cheap Florida condos. The bathroom was small and cheap looking. The location is good if you want to be on the beach. It isn't very glamorous. It reminds me a little of Atlantic City. The casino inside the hotel is small and there are a few good (but very overpriced restaurants). There is a Palm Steakhouse and a Japanese Hibachi style restaurant. The area around the hotel is pretty run down ... if you want to go to Old San Juan where the cruise ships dock, it will cost you about $15 for a cab there. It is several miles away. The weird thing is that the airport is only 1 or 2 miles away from the hotel yet because Puerto Rico charges cabfare by the zone, you will still pay $15 to get there. The hotel overall is kept up pretty nicely. If you can talk yourself into the club lounge (Priority Club) they have great hors d'erves and an open bar! The lobby area and casino area of the hotel are fairly classy and it does feel a little upscale. However, I wouldn't be comfortable paying more than $150 - $175 a night for the hotel based on what you get. If you are looking for nightlife and the real old side of San Juan instead of the beach/pool scene ... this is not the place for you. Stay in the heart of the old city if this is what you want as this is more of a beach resort.

Reviews.Title: “Can not wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: creolegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for a one day post cruise stay. All that I can say is that the hotel is amazing. The pool area is great with a large adjacent beach area. We were able to drop off our luggage and pick up towels to hang around the pool until our room was ready. We booked a city view room, but upgraded to an oceanview room. It was well worth the upgrade as we were on the 16th floor. The view was AMAZING! The room itself was fine, I would just say that it needs more up to date bedspread's. Other than that everything was great. There is also a Japanese Steakhouse as well as a Ruth Chris' Steakhouse in the hotel. We will be returning with our entire family next year. The value that we paid can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but food and drink too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Mitchmon
Reviews.Content: The Intercon was a great hotel, for the most part. We stayed 6 nights. The entire hotel was exceptionally clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful with the exception of one female concierge who was a bit cranky and condescending. At one point we asked her about the Metropol restaurant recommended by the cabbie. She turned up her nose and said 'no way'. We went anyway and it was the best meal of the trip. The location close to the airport was not a problem. You could hear the planes take off and land, but not obtrusively so. The hotel is in a fairly busy area of town, so if you want total island seclusion this is not the place. It's definitely worth paying the extra price for upper floor, ocean view. The lower floor views are blocked by palm trees, and the view on the non-ocean side is bleak at best. My main complaint with the hotel is the lack of affordable restaurants and bars. The beach restaurant was the cheapest but had a very limited menu. They don't post the prices on the drinks and we were surprised to find on our bill some of the drinks were $14. Non-alcoholic slushees for the girls were $6 each. The hotel restaurants (Ruth's Chris and Momoyama {Japanese}) were in the $$$$ category. The third restaurant (ultra-high end Italian) was under renovation. We simply could not afford to eat at the hotel as a family of 4 without breaking the bank. At the hotel bar, a single shot of Don Q Crystal at $8. I could go across the street and buy a full pint for $4. There was not option for breakfast other than room service and the $17/person buffet. We ended up going to the store and buying cereal and milk to eat in the room. All in all, for our first trip to Puerto Rico, this was a great hotel even considering my 'complaints'. We hated to leave, and would go back to Puerto Rico in a minute, but perhaps to the southwest corner of the island: somewhere away from the hustle and bustle of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: divinamujer
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel. The pool is awsome, with a swim up bar and on the beach. Is located next to the San Juan Hotel, so we were able to walk next door and go to the clubs located there. Great service. Would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Son-of-Poochmas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in July- paid $180/night for a partial beach view. Pros: 1. On the beach - a 5minute walk from the Ritz-Carlton 2. Very nice pool grounds + jacuzzi, but not at all on the same level as the Ritz 3. A bigger/better weight lifting room than the Ritz 4. Ruth's-Criss is excellent - much better than the ones in CA and Fla 5. Very clean, hallways and room so/so furnishings 6. 5 minutes from airport ($10.00) Cons: 1. Breakfast "al fresco" - the bugs were trying to dig the salmon 2. Smaller TV .. not a big deal

Reviews.Title: “Very thin walls with lots of noise from other rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stevennelida
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times in the past and have never experienced the problems of my recent stay. The hotel is kept up very well and the staff is friendly and helpful for the most part. The pool is the highlight and is often filled since the beach area is only average so most opt for the pool. In regards to the noise, I stayed on the 12th floor and for both nights of my visit I had been awakened by guests on either side of my room by only normal voices. It was almost as if there was no barrier between the rooms. I would normally immeidately knock or call the room next door but since it was pretty obvious they weren't yelling, I let it go for an hour or so before calling them to let them know of the extremely thin walls and asked if they minded keeping their conversations to a minimum since I could hear every word they were saying including their breathing inbetween their words. To my amazement, my kids slept through it yet my wife and I had two sleepless nights. I would definately think twice before booking a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeet88
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at the resort during fourth of July and it was great. This was our first time to Puerto Rico and will be returning very soon and staying at the InterContinental Resort again. The pool area and beach are just like the pictures. I loved lounging by the pool. The only negative thing I have to say about the resort are the food and drink prices. Everything in the resort is over priced. But the food is not half-bad. The frozen drinks are great. However, there is a place right across the street next to the grocery store and the food there is AMAZING and CHEAP! The Casino in the hotel is a little dull, but we just walked next door to the El San Juan which has a better night-atmosphere. The security in the resort is GREAT - and if you stay here, you will know what I mean the first ten minutes of your stay! Visiting Puerto Rico - The Rainforest is a must see! Hector, our tour guide, was amazing!!! Also, check out Old San Juan, it is so beautiful. I would recommend taking a taxi - it's about a 15-20 minute ride and will cost $19. However, you could always split a taxi. That's what we did because people from the resort were always going to Old San Juan, so why not share a taxi. I didn't like the bus, it only cost 75 cents but it takes an hour to get there, it's VERY crowded and it doesn't drop you off right in the heart of old san juan. I just didn't like the bus ride. Eat at cafe puerto rico and try the shrimp mofongo - one of the best meals I have ever had in my life!!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Glamorous”
Reviews.Author: ellzebeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental in San Juan just this past weekend, and I cannot say that I was impressed. We traveled with a group of 14, all of which booked rooms here. The rooms are of decent size, but the hotel itself lacks the 'glamour' I would expect of an Intercontinental property. On several occassions throughout our stay, we came into contact with the front desk staff, and not only were they unpleasant, they were abrupt and appeared to be bothered to have to answer questions. Very few times did we see service with a smile, and for what we were paying to stay there, I certainly expected at least that much. The hotel also lacks some curbside appeal, but that seemed to be the case for many of the hotels in that Isla Verde hotel zone. If we were to return to Puerto Rico again, I would not stay at this property, nor would I point anyone in the direction of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: GaFranco
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Puerto Rico, stayed 7 nights at the Intercontinental. Excellent pool, comfortable rooms, beautiful beach view, nice lobby and entry way. The best thing about this hotel is the pool. it's well shadded if you get too mych sun, but there is also plenty of sun if that's what you want. Attentive staff, beatiful landscaping, good food. The restaurant at the end of the pool, on the beach, is not managed by the hotel and the food is overpriced and inferior. Stick with ordering from the hotel. You won't be dissapointed. Drinks are extremly weak. If you want something cool and tropical, order it without alcohol and save half price. They barely put any rum in thier drinks. If you want alcohol, stick to beers, at least you know what you're getting. Beers run about $7 each, mixed drinks are $13. Main lobby is small, not too crazy, so nice to hang out without too much of the local chaos. There is a small restaurant in the Plazoleta de Isla Verde called La Casita. It serves great, cheap breakfast for less than $5 including coffe. If you stay at the Hotel for breakfast, be prepared to pay at least $20. Did not eat at the hotel restaurants. Opted for local restaurants instead. Will need to take a taxi for most of your excersions, including Dinner. There are a few nice restaurants at the Ritz and El San Juan Hotel, other than that, you'll need a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: getarounds
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good though by my standards it fell a bit short of great. The room was comfortable enogh and large. We had a great view of the ocean and slept with the curtains open so we could wake up to the view. I guess what fell a bit short of great was the service and some cleanliness issues with the bathroom. Not huge but it could be improved a bit. The one great thing was the beach! It was so wonderful we rarely used the pool. Just stayed in the sand. We did some sightseeing in Old San Juan and enjoyed that. Found the greatest place to eat tapas. It is in The Old Convento Hotel. Fantastic!!!!! A real must!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, way too pricey”
Reviews.Author: 1snappleltommy
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Intercontinental as I am writing this...the beach and pool area are very nice, I reiterate, very nice! My room is very nice, overlooking the pool...no complaints there... However, this hotel charges 7dollars for a small box of cereal, 10 -12 dollars for drinks that I think are weak, 3 dollar bottles of water and 3 dollar cups of coffee... One of the hotel restaurants, Ciao Mediterrean, got a good write up by Frommers. This write up must be outdated! The restaurant is on the beach, which is nice, but the food is gross bar food and pricey. The 3 of us had nachos, a few drinks, a couple of sandwiches and quesadillas for 140 dollars! The manager has an attitude but our waitress was very nice. This hotel is directly next door to the El San Juan hotel and we had breakfast across the street at a strip mall everyday. The 3 of us had breakfast for 13 including tip. I am not cheap, but I just do not like being taken advantage of, which I felt I was at the hotel. As mentioned, the pool area(which would not let us bring our own drinks and wants us to buy their overpriced drinks) and the private beach are very nice. I just felt like I was getting soaked everytime I turned around!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Intercontinental Hotel. I have been going to Puerto Rico all of my life and have stayed through various changes of brand at the location of the Intercontinental Hotel. I have always had great service and the decor of the public areas of the hotel and the rooms were always in great shape. The Intercontinental continues to provide great service and I felt that the grounds were kept up very well. The beach is gorgeous and clean and so is the pool area. The location is great as the hotel is surrounded by many other resorts, restaurants and shops that are all in walking distance. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant so I cannot comment on that, but there are several great little local places nearby. There is a great place for breakfast or lunch called Piu Bella. It is probably a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and the prices are very reasonable. For dinner I would highly recommend the Metropol restaurant. The cuisine is Cuban/Puerto Rican and is definitely a place you do not want to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time!”
Reviews.Author: Melkazar
Reviews.Content: Me and my new hubby came here for our honeymoon just last week!! We had a great time,,, after reading recent reviews I was very nervous about what to expect.. But the hotel was nice pleasant workers esp concierge,, And I believe it was Fernando at the front desk that gave us a FREE ocean view upgrade for our honeymoon, which saved us $80 a night!! The pool was nice, the food was good at the cafe/bar outside,, try a cuban sandwich, Its pricey so we only are there twice. The drinks are pricey also. To eat outside the hotel there are local fast food places and small eateries just across the street., Try Mi Casita across the street for PR food, my husband is PR and he loved it. Parking- we did the self park a lot cheaper than valet and the parking lot is right across the small road, (be careful ppl arent to worried about practically running over the tourists and the cross walk). Casino is small, next door and the El San Juan is a bit bigger. They seemed to have DJ's at their pool in the evening myay try that hotel next time. The hotel will give you directions to the rainforest, The largest mall in the Carribean, the bacardi factory and Old San Juan (we had a rental car) The direction arent very exact , need more of exits and landmarks to get you some places. the rainforest is nice but go early the trails are apart from each other and you need to drive up the mountian to them. But there is no big park sign like you would think to find it.. its right up a small Pr town street that you may pass right up, but dont worry youre going the right way. Its just a little diff then what you would look for at home. Also things close at 6pm, the rainforest, shops of Old San Juan, the forts in Old San Juan, the bacrardi factory,, (watch that exit also). So go early if you can, I spent my morning sun bathing and swimming. The ocean is beautiful!!! Also try Lupis to the left of the hotel its a mexican rest with some Pr flare to it. They have burgers also , cute bar and restaurant. We ate at Ruth Chris steak house at the hotel, its expensive but the steak was awesome!! Ive never had steak without steak sauce. But its about $30-50 a steak and all sides and salads are extra so be prepared. This hotel is literally a few miles from the hotel it took us 6 mins to get there and back for our flight- car rental was also so simple if you decide to do that. But driving is CRAZY!!!!! It seems theres no organization at ALL and the highways get very backed up so if youre rushing somewhere give yourself time to get there. They dont use turn signals and will cut you off like its nothing so watch ALL LANES while you drive!! Have fun, I wish I could have stayed longer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jets24c
Reviews.Content: A very beautiful hotel.. the rooms were very clean and the staff was so nice and helpful. The resturants in the hotel are delicious yet a little pricey. The beach is very clean, i had the best time taking in the sun and swimming in the ocean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to go back! The only bad thing i can say about my whole experience is be specfic when ordering room service, they tend to mix up orders. So all in all its one of the bet!

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update”
Reviews.Author: travellover58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacationed at the Intercontinental the week before Memorial Day Weekend. Let me preface this by saying that the staff at the hotel couldn't be nicer. They were polite, helpful and friendly. The room, (we had a standard) could definitely use an overhaul. The size was generous, but the furnishings were tired looking. The couch was saggy, and the bed had the same tired looking bedspread that weighed a ton. I don't understand why a hotel in the tropics would not opt for lighter, more attractive bedding to enhance the appearance of the room. The bathroom ,again generous in size, had poor lighting. Ths shower was almost dungeon like. There was no magnifying make-up mirror, so ladies, if you need that to primp, you may want to bring your own. Due to the poor lighting, I had to purchase a mirror and apply my make-up at the the desk. The pleasantness came to a streaking halt as the Friday of Memorial Day weekend was upon us. Hello Coney Island! The guests that came at that point were loud, played radios on the beach, and left their garbage strewn all over the place. I felt sorry for the staff . At that point, I was happy to be leaving the following day. That same night, our neighbors were blasting music at midnight and proceeded to deny it to the security staff that I had to call. I would go back, during a quiet week. If you are looking to relax without the NY/NJ crowd, make sure you do not going during a busy time. ( I am a New Yorker by the way) You may definitely want to try some of the local restaurnats as the hotel food is quite expensive. The nightlife at the El San Juan was a lot more lively on Friday and Saturday nights, so we found ourselves walking there in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the InterContinental!!”
Reviews.Author: cfed
Reviews.Content: What a classy resort! I think their biggest attribute/selling point is their employees, so I will begin on that topic. The staff here is wonderful, from the concierge to housekeeping, they always had a smile on their face and really wanted to make you feel welcome at their resort! I cant say enough about the service here, it was TOP NOTCH!! We barely had to lift a finger here, they did it all for us!! We ended up at this resort because we originally booked at the Marriott and left after a hellish firt night there. Because of our last minute change, we couldnt get into our room for a couple of hours, but they offered us a hospitality room to get situated in and change for the beach. When our room was ready, they brought our luggage up for us and even stored my husband's golf bags for us in their storage area (not at our request) so we wouldnt be inconvenienced with having them in the room with us! Our room was nicely appointed and comfortable. Bathroom was a bit on the smaller side, but it never was an issue for us. Over all we were quite comfortable in our room. The grounds here are beautiful, we LOVED the pool (it was huge)and we were even more enthralled with the beautiful BEACH!! Spots at the pool were definitely a hot commodity; I got up at 7 am one morning to jog on the beach and guests were already saving spots!! They have awesome cabana like set ups at the pool, but only about 5 of them and they were almost always taken, especially over the weekend. The pool has a great swim up bar with flat screen tvs and bartenders that are ready to serve you!! The beach is equally beautiful - the only downfall here is that you have to pay 10 bucks to rent an umbrella. But, its worth it. The sand is so soft and the water is so warm. There is also a beach bar/restaurant that serves great food and drinks...try the salads here, they are WONDERFUL!! Also, try to get Katherine as your server...she is prompt, friendly, and always smiling! We loved her!! We had breakfast in the restaurant thats on the lower level (cant remember the name) but it was delicious. They also have a cheaper, more continental like spread in the main lobby that came in extra handy with tons of fresh fruit and bagels - yum! Overall we especially enjoyed our stay here and would return again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: StephanieG
Reviews.Content: We had come for a wedding and got a decent rate of 185 a night. Puerto Rico in general if you stay in San Juan I dont think is a very luxurious vacation. The water is not crystal clear blue and the sand is not white like some other islands in the carribean. The drinks were priced outrageously. Lunch for 2 was 50 bucks a day. They were doing construction on the elevators so be prepared to wait. The restaurants are nothing special. There is a japanese restaurant that is very casual and small and as for Ruth Chris, you can eat that any time in the States. The pool area is clean and pretty. The service is pretty good. Its close to the El San Juan which is where I recommend going to at night. Its right next door and is a fun place to hang w/a large casino, shops and good eats. There are tons of airline staff staying here and business people which is who i think they cater to. Overall, it was not a bad stay just nothing special. I would recommend the EL san juan next door which or a different island altogether. And bring bug spray. I got bit up really bad on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xxlaaventureraxx
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews posted by other participants of this site I was a little worried about what I was getting myself into... However, upon arrival to our hotel we were cordially greeted by staff who held our hands as we got out the cab and took our luggage to our rooms in no time... Check-in was super easy and fast and the receptionist who took care of us was extremely nice and energetic.. The hotel has an amazing entrance... The Pool area is amazing... It's big and crystal clear... At night it's soothing to hear the Coqui's singing their tune. The jacuzzi is a tad bit too hot, but after a few minutes your body adjusts to it... I travelled during the Memorial Day Weekend with a 3 other friends... we're between the ages of 24-26.. So tanning is on our list.. Finding a chair to lay on was never an issue during our 6 day stay.. there were plenty to choose from both on the pool and at the beach... The food was a little pricey, but that's nothing new or different from any other hotel. There are tons of cheap place to eat at walking distance from Intercontinental (i.e. Burger King, Mi Casita, Wendy's, Pizza Hut, Taquito).. A great restaurant to try is Barrachina, great food! The bus is a few buildings down from the hotel and it takes you to Old San Juan for 75 cents. Or you can take a cab for $19, but you'll miss out on a lot. The Casino is great has a variety of slot machines to choose from, along with free drinks, regardless of what your playing. The airport is about 5 minutes from the hotel, but they airplanes can be barely heard. It's actually cool to see them landing. Overall this hotel was amazing and I wouldn't hesitate to go again. Enjoy the pics.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Beds, Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: IN_Travel
Reviews.Content: I am fortunate enough to work for a company that allows me to stay at the InterContinental while there for work. While I agree that this hotel is pricey, the rooms are wonderful and everything is spotless. The staff is always courtesy and friendly. Let me tell you...the beds are SUBLIME!! I can't wait to crawl into bed at the end of the day because I know I will get an amazing night of sleep. The bathrooms are clean and the showers have great water pressure. The pool area is beautiful and very relaxing. There are a number of restaurants in the hotel but expect to pay a premium to eat. Breakfast is expensive but the spread is amazing. While I don't get to enjoy the InterContinental as a resort, it is very relaxing and rejuvenating at the end of a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself to something better...”
Reviews.Author: morevacation
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Ritz on business (which is actually a pretty nice place), but got stuck here. 1) Location: right next to the airport. I mean right next to it. You can taxi in to old town, or use this as a base camp to see other parts of PR. Doesn't feel very tropical? I am not sure why so many hotels hug the airport....strange location to me. 2) Staff: indifferent at best. Only the folks working the bar seemed sociable, friendly. Check-in was mechanical, no one smiled. 3) Facilities: nice pool area and beach bar. Beach is fine, just seems small to me. Basically everything outside is OK, everything inside has a wierd "sleeze" appeal. The casino (like most all casinos in PR) is depressing. Jockey early for beach chairs. 4) Rooms: smelled of mildew. Temperature control was difficult' I layed on top of my comforter to sleep because with the lights on I noticed that the underneath was dirty...hairs, spots. Gross! Please, I beg managment to invest in new bed stuff! Bathroom was OK, 3 star set-up. Shower had plenty of pressure and the water was warm. As far as a tropical tourist destination folks tell me that PR can do the trick, but one needs to get away from San Juan and the airport to enjoy its beauty. This place was just a necessary stop for me, so if you can avoid it...please treat yourself to something a little more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: kace55
Reviews.Content: my room was pretty nice (especially the view and the bathroom), but i think i expected a lot more considering the price we paid. the staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Series of Unfortunate Events”
Reviews.Author: citygirl716
Reviews.Content: After reading all of these reviews, we went to the IC San Juan with pretty low expectations knowing that it wasn't going to blow us away but it would be a great place just to get away for four nights and get some sun and relaxation. But from the moment arrived, it was one problem after another. We got to the hotel at 12:30pm on Thursday and being Ambassador Members, we are able to check in early if the room is ready. The room wasn't ready but the snide front desk man told us it would be ready no later than 4:00pm but to check in with him around 3:00pm. We grabbed some lunch but didn't want to change into our suits because we figured it wouldn't take too long to get to our room. So, we wasted time, got some groceries across the street, and checked back at 2:50pm. He said the room wasn't ready yet and to check back in another half hour. 3:30pm we went back and he gave my boyfriend some very different news. The front desk admitted to him that our room had been taken by a flight crew and since their flight was delayed out of San Juan, they got the room until it was ready for them to head back to the airport. They told us it would be no later than 6:30pm. Yes, 6:30pm. So, after a morning of flying, three hours of wasting time, they now tell us that it would be another 3 hours until we were able to check in. My boyfriend came outside with this news to me and I went back in to talk to the manager. She was the most unapologetic manager I had ever encountered. She kept telling me that she had another room for us, but it was lower than the room class we reserved and we didn't want that room. We wanted the room class that had been promised to us when we checked in that afternoon. She offered nothing more than "There's nothing else I can do for you, you're going to have to wait until these people leave your room". After five minutes of this conversation that got nowhere, I finally told her that I was frustrated with her customer service and that usually in circumstances like this, you say "Let me give you breakfast or here some gambling vouchers, I'm sorry this has been hard but I'm trying to make it up to you." She replied "Well, I didn't know if you liked breakfast. What are you looking for?" I told her that since she saw our reservation the next night at Ruth Chris, she should pick up the bill as a sign of good-will. She put a cap of $200 on the bill and then further added "That $200 is for food only. You will pay for liquor and taxes and tip.â€� We finally changed into our suits and sat around until 6:30pm. The room still wasn't ready. We got into our room at 7:30pm that night. Our TV wasn't working when we finally got to our room. We called and they sent someone up to reprogram it. That wasted another 15 minutes. We called it a night and went to bed. Friday was a good day other than the fact that they didn't put down "couple's massage" for the $360 massage package we got and they led us into separate rooms. I spoke up and they took us back to the waiting room to wait ten minutes until the couple's room was set up. We got back to the room after the massage to sleep and 5 minutes later, the fire alarm went off. We walked down the 8 flights just to be told at the bottom that it was just a drill and to go back upstairs. Sunday morning we pulled the tv out on the tv tray to watch from bed and (I kid you not) the tv wasn't screwed into the tray so this tv came tumbling down to the ground smashing on the floor. We had to call downstairs, they sent up security, then an insurance guy to take pictures, and then we had to sit and wait until another tv came up. He said it was all set. When we went to try it, the remote didn't work and we had to call again to have someone reprogram the tv. We finally checked out on Monday and they had charged us for a movie we never watched. We very nicely disputed it but she kept the charge on there. Finally I asked for a print out of the movies and she said "Oh, well, you are spending a lot of money here. I'll just take the $14 off the bill." Oh and also, we had to get our keys reprogrammed every day because they kept getting demagnetized. This trip really was a series of unfortunate events. We were able to laugh at a lot of it just to keep our sanity and our vacation mode going, but to be put through all of that hassle and pay so much money was just truly disappointing. Especially where we are Ambassador members and have spent over $10,000 at IC hotels. Honestly, we really are not hard to please. We take most things in stride. But to be lied twice at check-in? That's something we couldn't take. The hotel was in good shape, the pool was nice, the food at Ruth Chris and the Palm were awesome, and the hotel was in a good location. But we'll never go back there again. Sorry this was so long!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: kazimoto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ICH Isla Verde April 20-22 for a business event. Weather forecast called for scattered t-storms everyday (30-50% chance of rain) but weather was great. Sunny for the most part with some clouds and very little rain - so the first thing I will say is...ignore what you see on the weather websites; chances are, weather will be just fine. Now for the property itself... THINGS THAT I LIKED Nice, big pool, lots of chairs and cabanas and pool is surrounded by lush palm trees and lots of greenery....beach was pretty good too, water wasn't nearly as clear as other beaches on the carribean, but still a decent beach - perfect for a morning walk or jog...adjoining casino seemed like a fun place to hang out although I'm not a gambler myself...staff was very nice and helpful...all rooms have a balcony (albeit small)...dining options included a Ruth Chris's Steak House (I'm a big fan) and a Japanese restaurant, in addition to the standard, overpriced and not-so-tasty poolside fare. COMPLAINTS Hotel is located at the beach-side Carolina area - which is great, but the best place to truly explore is Old San Juan, a $19 cab ride from the hotel....hotel itself is located pretty close to the airport so there are a lot of planes flying over, which can be somewhat noisy...breakfast at the open-air restaurant can be a challenge as you find yourself defending your food from the little birds that try to steal your grub Overall, this is a place that I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 4 star, but decent enough.”
Reviews.Author: DruidHillsGuy
Reviews.Content: Reading the Trip Advisor reviews prior to going helped to set my level of expectation. Most of the reviewers are right on the money. The hotel is not perfect, but for the price, just fine by me. Traveling with my wife and two kids, we had plenty to do and see. Positives: I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Our housekeeper was friendly and kept us supplied with extra towels. Tipped her well my last day. Location is good. $20 bucks via taxi to Old San Juan, great mom and pop restaurant across the street, Mi Casita. Negatives: The cabanas are being reserved at 5:00 in the morning. I'm not kidding. Went down one morning at 6:15 (the Starbucks is at the hotel next door) and all of the cabanas were taken. Be prepared if you want to hang at the pool all day. Speaking of the pool, the water could have been a touch clearer. If you don't have a pool you probably won't notice it. Something that could be readily addressed. Food and drinks around the pool area are offensively priced. 2 drinks, 2 sandwiches, $50 bucks. One other thing, just to be aware of. The hotel casino is open until 4:00 am. That means doors are slamming shut in the hallways around 4:15....everyday. There really not a whole lot that can be done, other than to ask folks to not let it slam shut. Oh well. All in all a pretty decent trip for the buck. Like I said, this is not a 4 star in my opinion.....a high 3 star trying hard to move into the 4 range. I'd go back, if the price was right. So, temper your expectations, read the other reviews, and enjoy yourself, you're on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway at Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: shell346
