Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Intercontinental. We received an ocean view top floor room upgrade which was amazing. The pool and beach are both really nice. Service overall was very accomodating and friendly. The free wireless service was also great. The work out facilities (only 2 treadmills) do need improved facilities. Easy cab ride to airport, restaurants and main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billpcti
Reviews.Content: Just spent five days at the Intercontinental and had an excellent experience. Hotel itself is 3.5-4 stars, staff is excellent, food is over priced but where isn't it on an island. Be clear this is not a Four Seasons or a Ritz; but it provides an enjoyable vacation complete with the amenities which most of us expect. Beach is pretty but seaweed is a problem near the shoreline; venture out a bit and it goes away. Pools are very nice and well kept. Expect the beach to be pristine and beautiful as can be and you're setting yourself up for disappointment. Restaurants are good, location is central to other activites. I'd recommend renting a car for sightseeing. Price is right; enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience & perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: writingiseasy
Reviews.Content: The airlines put me up at the Intercontinental after a missed connection so - obviously - I had not planned to stay at this hotel, nor in San Juan at all. Lucky for me, the 24 hrs I spent at this hotel turned out to be the of my larger Caribbean vacation. The staff was wonderful, polite and accomodating. The pool was beautiful and well-maintained and there was someone ready to set out a chaise on the beach for me when I wanted to soak in the ocean instead. There is construction near the pool but you can avoid being distracted by it by setting up camp near the waterfall (drowns the noise) or on the other side of the pool. Not a big deal. I lunched at the poolside bar and the waitress was so warm and welcoming that I never wanted lunch to end. The concierge even gave me match-vouchers to use at the blackjack tables just because I mentioned that I was excited abt the casino. I heard that the casino next door at the El San Juan is nicer, but I had such a good time during my unexpected stay that I never considered leaving the premises for a second, until I had to return to the airport the next night for my re-booked flight. I will definitely go back for a weekend away. It's two seconds from the airport and the perfect spot to get some sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: felixdacat
Reviews.Content: I really thought the service here was great. We were able to check in at 10am in the morning! granted we had a room that faced the airplanes landing... Nothing the hotel can do abotu that. I thought that the pool area was great. Lots of shade if you need it. The beach, for a city beach, was pretty nice. The concierge, bellhops, etc were all very friendly. As well as the business center. loved the free wireless. Negatives: Not for the hotel itself, but the chairhogs were worse than on the cruises we have done! 7am and 50% of the chairs were already taken, if you can believe that. Note that we did go spring break week. The area around the hotel is just ok. Doesnt have the charm of OSJ or even the restaurants of condado. We did find a few places though. The room is pretty decent, no moldy smells or anything, but with hotels these days going for the upgraded bedding, they probably need to do that here as well. I used my priority points to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Dirty Dirty”
Reviews.Author: springNewYork
Reviews.Content: San Juan Intercontinental is Nothing like the pictures on their website!!! Room had crumbs on carpet when we checked in and they were still there when we left...watched the maid clean and she used the vaccuum cleaner to prop open the door and never turned it on for two weeks!!!! Hotel is also under construction which we discovered when we checked in...only 2 restaurants open in the evening despite what website info said. Area around hotel was not safe to walk around at night. American Express has not addressed my complaints and we will never use them again as they offer no complaint line or way to fix the complaint while you are in the hotel. Spoke to management and they shrugged it off. Beach full of seaweed. four armed and kevlar vested policemen patrolled pool area daily as well as hotel security...Hmmmm that says alot about area! Avoid this hotel and area!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Chic_04
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying here! The hotel is what "made" my vacation... I never would've had as great a time had I stayed somewhere else. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. They even gave us little tricks on saving money (like taking the ferry from the Bacardi factory to Old San Juan instead of a taxi). They always made sure we were safe and answered any questions we had. They also upgraded our room from a city-view to an oceanview because ours wasn't ready yet! Also, we lost our hotel voucher, so they called AA Vacations and got another copy for us, with no hassle at all. It definitely lived up to its great reputation. While not everyone has a great experience everywhere, all of the time, this hotel was much better than some of the reviews on this site would lead you to believe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone & everyone, and would only return to San Juan if I could stay at the Intercontinental!!

Reviews.Title: “Reservations PROBLEMS”
Reviews.Author: azuel
Reviews.Content: I have been trying for the entire day to find information on group rates. We were constantly being disconnected. Their customer serivce gives an indication of what to expect. I am very disappointed because I had friends recommend this hotel due to location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, they do a nice job!”
Reviews.Author: Ihave2kids
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the intercontinental. The staff was excellent and very helpful. The rooms were clean and modern, with free wireless, albeit a bit small. The pool was nice with all the towels you would like. The beach was nice although they charged 10$ an umbrella. Breakfast buffet was a RIP OFF - 20$ if you wanted anything warm, 15$ for fruit and bagels. Across the street was a diner, subway, small dingy supermarket and burgerking which were very useful for a quick cheap bite. RUTH CHRIS steakhouse was terrific and right there. 19$ cab ride to old san juan wasn't cheap but DON'T take the bus- they said it would take 40 minutes and it took 1.2 hours! Casino was very nice.... Minibar a rip off as expected. Few people with kids looked like they were having a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, nice staff, great location, beautiful beach.”
Reviews.Author: wasif20
Reviews.Content: The lobby was very impressive. Staff was wonderful. Access to the beach was free, there were always plenty of chairs and towels (also free) and it was never overcrowded. The beach bar had some nice appetizers. It was nice to sit there, eat and relax. A jet ski rental place was a 2 minute walk down the beach. Driving was very easy in Puerto Rico, no different than the Continental US and the concierge was excellent with directions and recommendations for restaurants and things to do. The Japanese restaurant was pretty good - hibachi grill style. Reasonable prices - around $30 per person. Parking was extra, about $11 a night, including in and out. Not too easy to find a spot, especially at night when the Casino crowd rolled in. We got a junior suite that was very clean and spacious but surprisingly no bathtub, only a small cramped shower.

Reviews.Title: “A great time in PR”
Reviews.Author: tnova
Reviews.Content: Not sure where the negative people stayed but I know I stayed at the InterContinental San Juan Resort, Spa & Casino. It would be really helpful if people rated a hotel, service and their overall stay with a little more objectivity. We just returned from 8 days and 7 nights at the IC and had a wonderful time. Here's my objective ratings based upon numerous stays at hotels ranging from the Four Seasons to Holiday Inn Express. The InterContinental San Juan Resort, Spa & Casino is not a Four Seasons but then again I did not pay Four Seasons rates. It also not a Holiday inn Express - the IC is much better. The reasons people go to the Caribbean - sun and fun! Weather 4.5 stars - rained one day with a few showers on two other days (no big deal). Other than that the weather was outstanding - not too hot just right. Pool - 5 stars - 99.5% complete with a little grout sealing being performed, however, it was not intrusive at all. We had as many towels as we wanted and the chairs were very comfortable and clean. Drinks and food at the pool and beach were very good. Nice place to seat after dark if you like the sound of the surf as you have an after dinner cocktail. Beach - 4 stars - there was a lot of seaweed in the water for about 25 feet. The beach was clean but there were a few sand fleas. The hotel provided "bug" spray. The water was warn and clear once you waded past the seaweed. The restaurant was a nice place to sit after dark if you like the sound of the surf as you have an after dinner cocktail. Hotel staff service - 5 stars. Everyone was attentive and very helpful. Hotel property in general 3.5 stars - public areas clean and well maintained. Rating was impacted down a little due to the quality of the rooms (see below). Hotel rooms 3 stars - adequate (how much do you really stay in the room). Need to be spruced up. Bathrooms adequate but really needs to be updated. Not sure how they can be since they are small and there is no room to expand. Food at the hotel (beach) - 4 stars (again this is at the beach not a 4 star restaurant like the Palm's - need to but everything into perspective). Concierge - 5 stars - all recommendations for dinner were excellent! Overall 4.5 stars! Hope this helps. JAT

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation spot...”
Reviews.Author: stace516
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental was great. Staff was very nice and the beach and bar grill is the best on the beach for good cocktails. Not cheap but what is when you are vacationing? Room was clean. Nothing negative to say...even the casino was cleaner than the others. Already wanting to book again soon!

Reviews.Title: “second visit just as good”
Reviews.Author: fp new jersey
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the San Juan Intercontinental. Both visits were great. The first time, last April our children were with us. This visit, just my husband and I were vacationing. While the rooms are very average, the ocean view(this stay) was much better than the garden view (accepatible). We were on the tenth floor and you definately had a much broader, pretty view. The pool area, recently re-done (tile work) was just as pretty. THe staff works very hard. They are constantly bending over picking up vacationers junk and throwing it away- shame on the tourists- pick up your own garbage. I have to say, there were families there who were definetly there for their own pleasure. They let their children scream by the pool all day. I actually watched 1 family wake up about 10 vacationers sleeping by the pool around 4 pm one afternoon - unacceptable, not because of the hotel but because of parents with no manners. The staff was very good, the concierge great. The front desk and the doormen wonderful. The strip mall across the street has one of the best breakfast places ever - Mi Casita, wonderful food, very reasonable. This visit we ate at a great little, casual (first night) restaurant named Lupi's. Great fajitas, burritos and margaritas at a very reasonable price. Our weather was absolutely perfect which does make a vacation great. I think the Intercontinental (one of the cleanest beaches on Isle Verde) is a great choice. Only complaint was the price of the food!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were back at the San Juan IC right now ! !”
Reviews.Author: Skydog1030
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from our second visit to the SJIC. What a great place. We stayed there from January 6--9th, 2007 to celebrate our anniversary. Our first visit was in January 2001. I can only agree wholeheartedly with the positive reviews this hotel has received. Our experiences both on this trip and in 2001 were first rate. Let me start by saying that I am VERY particular and I pay attention to detail. In fact , I think of myself as an unpaid AAA hotel critic, with lots of experience but no salary. We booked an ocean view room at $350 per night, including breakfast. Not cheap, but all of the top places in San Juan that I checked also seemed very expensive. They also charge the very annoying add-on â€œresort feeâ€� (as do many other hotels.) which can cause some sticker shock when checking out. Nevertheless, we decided to splurgeâ€”and are very glad we did. The hotel staff learned we were celebrating our anniversary and boy did they roll out the red carpet. I couldnâ€™t believe their generosity and thoughtfulness. They upgraded us to a huge suite in the club areaâ€”just beautiful and extremely comfortable. And not only did they give us complimentary fruit and chocolate covered strawberries, they also sent us bottle of champagne that was listed at $100 on the room service menu. Wow--did we feel like VIPs. Just for future reference, I walked around the hotel and checked out the standard rooms. The rooms were clean and in good shape, and the hallways were also in good condition. The rooms are average comfortable size, though the bathrooms are somewhat small, and each room has a small balcony. The balconies are really nice to have instead of the typical sealed up room. You can open your door in the morning and let in the balmy Puerto Rican breezes. Wish I was there right now with a cup of Joe. The breakfast buffet was open air, which we prefer in the tropics, with lots of choices including an omelet /egg station. The hotel has a casual restaurant / bar right smack dab on the beach, with some tables actually in the sand. Fabulous location and worth a visit. The food was OK, but pricy, e.g., chicken burger about $13, but unbeatable atmosphere. There is an Italian restaurant, although it was closed for renovation. We didnâ€™t try the on-site Ruth Chriss Steak House. We tried the casino, but didnâ€™t have much luck. The lobby is quite stylish and up-to-date, with lots of activity. The pool area was beautiful, with a cool swim-up bar, poolside restaurant with an outdoor bar-b-q chef on duty, which was a great idea. Apparently the entire pool area had just been renovated. When we were there we had no problems finding a place to sit or swim as some prior reviews mentioned. The multiple pool areas and hot tub are big and beautifully landscaped. One of the best restaurants we ate at on the trip was the Metropole, which is a very popular localâ€™s institution. Itâ€™s just a five minute walk from the hotel. The place gets quite crowded but worth the wait. They serve terrific (and very inexpensive) Cuban/Puerto Rican food. Turn left out of the hotel, cross the street and the restaurant is just past the cockfighting stadium (we didnâ€™t stop in there.) The hotel concierge, Jossell, couldnâ€™t have been more helpful. (In fact, the service at the hotel was terrific from everyone we encountered.) Jossell recommended a kayak outing to the bioluminescent bay (only at night), which was a great experience, even though we had never been kayaking before. I think the best time to go, if your timing is right, is on a moonless night. There really is a so much to see and do in San Juan and Puerto Rico, we hope to stay longer on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: KMG410
Reviews.Content: The basics: Very clean, large room, but nothing out of the ordinary. Very accomodating staff, booked our snorkeling and bioluminescent bay kayaking trip (highly recommended!) with no problems. Ruth's Chris steakhouse is in the hotel, which was great - when we arrived, they said they had no record of our reservation, which was made by the hotel, but quickly sat us anyways even though they were quite busy. We stayed here in mid-August, which was VERY quiet, definitely the beginning of the off-season. The hotel is located on the beach next to a strip of hotels, including the El San Juan (great casino). Across the street is Wendy's, Pizza Hut and a bakery, which is good for a cheap breakfast but be prepared to wait a long time for your bagel - they are very slow. Also check out the Palm restaurant at the El San Juan. The only drawback is if you are into the outdoorsy kind of activities, stay in Fajardo instead. We went on two trips and both of them involved 1+ hour trips to Fajardo by car. Overall, a good experience, there are so many fun things to do in Puerto Rico to keep busy!

Reviews.Title: “great beach, great property”
Reviews.Author: chimmoi
Reviews.Content: This was our pre-cruise stay. We paid $220 after taxes for Saturday night stay. Our cruise was delayed by one day so we had to stay an extra night and guess how much they want ?... $380 for the extra night ! ouch ! It was unexpected, so we pretty much shelled out the money to avoid further hassle. The hotel room itself is a little on the small side but clean. The lobby, pools and the surrounding property are kept up well. There is a hut near the pool area where they provide you with towels and bottle waters daily. The beach is just steps away in the back with umbrellas and beach lounges that you can rent for $15. The beach is beautiful. Our favorite was the beach-side cafe where you can get hamburgers, pizzas, mixed drinks for reasonable prices. The setting is just second to none. You can get a table in the shades under palm trees or under the straw huts next to the beach. No matter where you sit, enjoy the ocean breeze with their famous drink - the Mudslide. The only complain I have is the check-in process. It's rather very slow. We arrived at 1:00pm and could not check into the room until 4:30pm. Not only the rooms are not cleaned fast enough, the paper work at the check-in desk is slow too. Seems like everything is hand-written on paper. Overall, it was a very enjoyable stay. You can easily walk across the street and find fast food restaurants like BK, KFC,...

Reviews.Title: “Los Banditos”
Reviews.Author: bklyn550
Reviews.Content: Serves me right for planing a trip spur of the moment. My GF and I decided to take a last minute trip to escape the NYC cold. The El San Juan was booked up and I do not think the Ritz is worth the money due to the fact that San Juan has a foul smelling beach. I am not sure where other reviewers get their opinion of the water here but trust me as I have seen some nice beaches THIS is NOT ONE OF THEM. It is filled with seaweed and smells like bad fish. Our experience began with American Airlines canceling our 6 am flight to San Juan and taking the liberty to rebook us on a 9PM flight. Our travel agent was able to get that taken care of. Once we arrived at the airport we discovered that the flight was severely over booked. terrible turbulence and a great deal of screaming children later we finally arrived at the lovely hotel. After tipping the girl at the front desk we waited only about ten minutes for a room. We were rewarded with one of the highest non smoking ocean view rooms in the place. Lucky us it was on the fourth floor overlooking the main roof of the building. I am sure if the palm trees, the bars, the pool side cafe, the vines, and jungle all fell down there would be a nice ocean view but i Could not see it from my vantage point. One quick trip to the front desk and we were changed to a smoking room on the eighth floor. The hallways smelled of cigars but the room was not at all smoky. My thoughts on the rooms are as follows : The bathroom is too small. The ceiling in the shower is so low that you cant really move around. The door swings open into the space and doe not allow for you to move around in the bathroom. All of the outlets were old and did not even hold onto some plugs. The bed was an old fashioned box spring mattress that had definitely taken a few beatings in its life time. To its is pointed in the direction of the balcony ( so small it should be called a ledge) I think its this was because there is no room to position it other wise. The rooms has a lovely alarm clock CD player that will keep you up at night due to the fact it searches for CD tracks even though the cd is off and nothing is in it. There is a fridge so stock up on water at the supermarket because you may tend to think its free being that the Intercontinental left no price list for items in the fridge. Also there are no prices on the spa menu either. I must say that they do offer a continental breakfast. I think they should call it the Intercontinental Breakfast because they charge for everything so whats the point? I understand that looking at the room service that the going rate for a 1 muffin + I yogurt + two eggs + coffee and juice is now $19 + $ Service fee + 19% gratuity. So these few kinks had me a little annoyed but its was nothing we could not deal with. Having been up since early morning we decided to go by the pool. The pool is lovely the water is a bit cool for some but i loved it. The food pool side is however over priced and not of the quality they should serve given the money the charge. $15 dollar nachos were among my favorite along with the $13 cheese burger that had more chunks of crap in it than anything. They do have a nice BBQ at poolside that has a man with a chef hat doing something. Except when you order your food from the "grill" menu it comes from inside. The frozen drinks were nice but beware they constantly offer a little extra rum etc which they do charge you for. Also the hotel has taken the liberty of adding their own gratuity onto the bill and then putting a line for additional gratuity. That being said just as i fell asleep poolside i was woken by a lovely woman speaking on here phone about the Barry Manilow Concert she had just attended at a volume not fit for vacation. The worst thing ever done was not making a PR a place where you must pay for roaming. The catch phrase poolside was " Call me its free" I am sure this is because everyone wants to hear people chatting it up poolside with their friends back home. There were also a huge number of kids. I love the little ones but there were just so many that they took over the pool. There was hot tub but so many people were in it that I feel it was dirty. Also children were constantly in it even though it specifically says no kids. On the other hand there were a lot of over tanned fat people. When i say fat I am not trying to be mean but the obesity that surrounded this pool made it look like a lake in the Serengeti where hippos would wash. Our first night we had dinner at the Palm which was good if not for the drunken rowdy business people. Take note that from my observation the Intercontinental caters only to business people being that they have a special club for them. They also in my eyes write allot of the reviews here. Hey I would like the place too if my boss was paying. But since I am the boss I think its a huge rip off. The following was so funny I could not bear the get mad that it happened. At 1 am the fire system had a false alarm. Which sent me jumping from my bed like a madman. This alarm system they have is more like an air raid signal. I was convinced we were under attack. It subsided after about a minute. I put my head back down on the lumpy pillow and fell right to sleep. Despite the fact the air conditioner is directly over the bed. Which is nice because cold air does drop down and give you the chills who wouldn't want cold air pumping on their body all night. As i reached my third dream the Air raid signal came on again. This time its was followed with a please evacuate the building warning. Which was lovely and I must say that if you think these hotties look good by the pool (yuck) you should see them in their night things. After walking down the eight flights of stairs and through the back of house we arrived at the pool and were instructed to wait there by a man who then left for a half hour. Finally one of the tourists decided it was safe to go back in the building and we all lined up for the elevator. Since only tow of the three were working for the trip we opted for the stairs. So now that they got false alarm number two out of the way we headed back to go to sleep. I felt that we were owed some type of reimbursement for our troubles. The hotel felt differently. But Assuming it was a false alarm the first time the fire system should have been put on test. That being said we were allowed to sleep in for the rest of the trip. Although since the wooden doors only close when you slam them expect to be woken by people going out to reserve spots by the pool. Also spots on the beach that they hold while they are at the pool or at wendys across the street while they buy themselves some nice treats. Overall the pool is crowded with "taken" chairs which never materialize any real people. I decided that since Sunday was our last day we would got to Condado to shop at Cartier Louis V etc. So we asked the concierge to see if everything was open. She assured us it was and we hopped in a cab and took the 5 minute ride to Condado to discover that everything was closed. So we took and round trip ride that cost $30 and produced nothing. The Casino is like a nightmare. I have seem better gaming in the back of bars here in NYC. The machines are mostly broken. Or maybe they shut them down if they pay out? Not sure but beware the El San Juan is just a minute away and their Casino is nice. Perhaps they will set up a shell game or three card monty in the lobby because thats the level of gaming to expect from this hotel. Overall I cant say anything bad about the people that work there. The bellmen and the staff are really sweet people working for a living. The hotel chain is horrible. They do nothing for their guests. I love the option of paying for turn down service as well every other thing real hotels do as a courtesy for their guests. Being the people who work there recommend other hotels I guess its fair to saw we have been duped by the intercontinental. Next time I will stay in Fajardo or the El San Juan. I feel truly sorry for all those who were not informed the pool was closed but it seems par for the course from this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “this is the best part of san juan”
Reviews.Author: chuckiepool
Reviews.Content: the rest of the city I am not too crazy about especially after just been to aruba. we stayed at the club floor which is the lobby level. one benefit is that you avoid waiting for elevator that some people complained about. the balcony faces the garden and pool and very restricted view of the sea, it is bigger than the regular balcony, it can fit in a round table. the garden and pool are beautiful and plenty of lounge chairs. the chairs on the beach are free. the club floor has a nice club room with free continental breakfast and free cocktail hour from 5-7 with all you can drink and snacks. We ventured to OSJ one day, took the bus in front of the hotel all the way to the end, saw part of the city on the way ( taxi would go on freeway). at the pier, there are two free trolley buses you can take. you can get off any time and reboard and see most of OSJ with minimal effort . we had a nice lunch at Il perugino In OSJ.fontana di roma in howard johnson has good food and frienly family style dining. Pikoya in the museum is high end, the food is very good. Atlantica has the best fried calamali but the other items were not so good. we were not impressed with miro and BLT. the pool restaurant at the hotel is excellent for lunch, we ate hot dog and hamburger there three times. Although the hotel is excellent, we don't like SJ that much to warrant a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: trip4bizandfun
Reviews.Content: I guess I was expecting the service at this hotel to match the amenities. I was wrong. The property itself was quite nice, well-located and well-maintained. It's on a nice stretch of very pretty beach. But the service certainly left a lot to be desired and made our stay less than enjoyable. Enough so that I would recommend staying elsewhere (perhaps the El San Juan next door?). We stayed in the Club wing - the section for the Intercontinental's Ambassadors members. The woman in charge of this section should not work with customers; she was actually MEAN to guests - many of those in our party compared notes on the ways she insulted or mistreated us. Her behavior colored all the rest of our experiences at the property. As a result, we found that none of the staff were particularly friendly or warm. Perhaps if she had been nicer, we might not have noticed the lack of graciousness in general, since we didn't have any particularly bad experiences - but we NEVER encountered even one staff member who went out of their way for any of us. (With the exception of the women in the hair salon - they were very nice.) Another recommendation: bring an extra beach towel - there's absolutely NO way they're going to give you a second towel to use at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Davidmejia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a lovely stay at the Intercontinental in Puerto Rico and we had the most lovely and beautiful stay in years. The service was excellent, the concierges were wonderful and booked three amazing trips into the island. The food at the restaurants was tasty and full of flavor. The pool has just been renovated and it's beautiful. The local restaurant across the street prepares a great Mufongo. The staff at the pool bar was owesome. The room was fine and had a nice view to the bay of the city. Definetaly we'll be back in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: gunner27
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Intercontinental and we LOVED it! When we got there (before check in) we were upgraded to an oceanfront room on the 14th floor and we were so excited. The room was very clean (no smell). The noise from the airport wasn't an issue. The hotel staff was very friendly. The bell captains out front work their butts off and are very helpful. I thought it was worth every penny and I don't usually splurge on hotel rooms. My only complaint would be the elevators were a little slow and the bartendars didn't go out of their way to engage in conversion ,but nothing that would keep me away, they weren't rude by any means. I would definitely return. It is pricey, but so are alot of the hotels. The pool are is amazing! There are many fast food places within walking distance. Isla Verde beach is very nice. Everyone in the hotel speaks english and that was my experience throughout the island. I'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Rip-Off”
Reviews.Author: shawsh23
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i went over the summer. When I called to make a reservation I was told that the Garden/Executive Suite were worth the extra money b/c they have private gardens. Since the price was not much more and it included continental bkfast, I agreed. When we were taken to our room, we were overwhelmed by the smell of mold. Unfortunately all of the garden rooms except maybe for one or two do not get much sunlight. The room and the hallway smelled like a moldy basement. When we complained we were moved to an ocean view room, which they tried to charge us more for. They claimed that since we booked so far in advance the rates had gone up. We negotiated to stay at the same price we were paying for the Executive Suite. SO basically we got ripped off. And then to top it off there is a resort fee which I believe was $30 a day, this was not mentioned at anytime prior to our trip.The ocean view room had a nice view, but it was outdated and the patios are so small you cant really sit comfortably on the patio. The pool although looks nice, is overcrowded and to small for the number of people it accomodates. the place is filled with children, and the Jacuzzi was luke warm and also had a foul smell to it (it too is in the shade most of the day. The concierge was no help either. We asked for a reccomendation for a restaurant in Old San Juan. When we arrived we were diappointed to find that we were the only people in the restaurant and the restaurant also smelled like mildew. Needless to say, we were disappointed. I do not reccomend this hotel. If you cant afford to stay at the Ritz (neither could we), try the El san hotel, which is in the same price range as the intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkShutterbug
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel several years ago, I was disappointed at how it has been allowed to deteriorate. Our room smelled of mold, the paint in the bathroom was peeling and the door was cracked and warped. The hot tub by the pool was a dirty green during the first two days of our stay, and it was only after repeated complaints that the water was drained and changed. There was a limit of one beach towel per person until several complaints were made by guests, which resulted in two towels being given. It was also galling to have to pay extra to rent a beach umbrella. One would have expected a four star hotel to provide one as a part of the service. The food was expensive and mediocre and my daughter became ill from eating the quesadillas at the beachfront bar. On the other hand, the oceanview was a dream and the friendliness of the staff was wonderful. However, the cost and the four star rating certainly did not add up to the reality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: jgarcia421
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental San Juan for our honeymoon in San Juan and had a great time. Isla Verde beach, where the hotel is located, is very nice. There was very little seaweed in the water (other reviews made it seem as if the the seaweed was a problem) and the beach is very clean. The pool was great...swim-up bar was still closed...looked like it was nearing completion though. The room was pretty nice. The bed was very comfortable. The furniture could possibly use some updating, but it is not terrible. The bathroom is good, but nothing special. The ocean view rooms are great. We stayed on the 10th floor and had a great view. Anything below that might not be quite as good of a view. The balcony is pretty small...but who hangs out on the balcony very much anyways? The sliding glass door to the balcony is big enough to be able to open and enjoy the balcony from inside the room anyways. The concierge was very helpful. Helpful tip (which he will tell you if you ask): don't take the $70 tour to Old San Juan, the Forts...take the bus there for 75 cents, and take the taxi back (about $20) cause you will probably be tired after spending the day there. Overall the Intercontinental San Juan was great. As others have said as well, the worst thing is the prices! There is a fridge in the room though, so we opted to save a few bucks for a few meals and just gets some food from the supermarket across the street. Other than that, everything is great and we had a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Wiz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Intercontinental. Unlike the prior reviewer, we arrived very early (off of a cruise ship) and they got us into a room within an hour (about 12:30). The room was nice and well appointed. We did not have a "view" - but honestly didn't expect one since I had booked my companies "contract rate" - which is extremely reasonable. The new pool is lovely. We had fabulous service at the Terraz restaurant (outside by the pool) for both lunch and breakfast - but it is pricey! The breakfast buffet ends up at about $25 with tax and tip. It is good though! We had dinner at Ruth Chris which was very good but expensive - but it is expensive everywhere. On balance, we had a nice, restful visit to San Juan and enjoyed our stay at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-But.....”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbella
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a destination wedding at The Intercontinental. Overall the service was excellent. However, check in is at 4:00pm, so unless you have a real nice desk attendant you may have to wait for your room. The first desk clerk told me that my room would not be ready until 4:00, so I went to the clerk that my friends checked in with and she got me a room in a minute. The wedding was absolutely lovely, the hotel does cater to weddings and do a beautiful job. The housekeeping is excellent, they even have turn down service.A service fee (tip) for the room is charged.. The only draw back is that they are stlll doing construction in the pool area and tend to drill about 6:00 in the AM. The pool is now open, but the swim up bar is still under construction. The drinks run from 8.00 to 10.00 for a frozen drink. They have beach chairs on the beach but the beach warden collects them at 5.00pm PROMPT. Try not to buy any sundries or soft drinks in the gift shop, everything is double the price. I paid 6.00 for a bag of "Black Bean Chips". Go the the grocery store acrros the street to stock up on your soda and beer. There is a small fridge in the room. The casino is small but fun, if you want real action go next door to the El San Juan. There are 2 4 star restaurants in the hotel. I went to Ruth Chris Steakhouse, really pricey ...I'm from NY and have eaten at the best steakhouses, I was not impressed. If anyone has any other questions I will be more than happy to oblige.

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential, But Needs MUCH Improvement”
Reviews.Author: TheThreeOfUs
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs some work. A lot of work, actually. It's obvious they are trying to do just that, but in the meantime, the rooms are very, very outdated. The furnishings and amenities are way behind what we've come to expect in a hotel at $400/night. The doors, trim, air conditioning vents, balcony railing and plumbing fixtures are all in really awful, outdated condition. They should have been updated 10 years ago -- they are *well* beyond their prime. If you are accustomed to seeing flat panel TV's, contemporary furniture and duvets on the beds, this is definitely not the hotel for you. On the plus side, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are spacious and nicely arranged (other than the bathroom, which is the smallest hotel bathroom I've seen in years.) The beach access is fantastic and the beach itself is very nice. The view from the oceanview rooms is not going to be beat. There are a few restaurants (ie: other hotel restaurants) within walking distance, which is a nice plus, and the restaurants in the hotel (with the exception of the downstairs breakfast restaurant) are nice. The worst part of this hotel is that they had our email address since the day I made the reservation several months ago and we were never notified about the pool renovations. That is really an unacceptable oversight. (And I am probably being generous in calling this an 'oversight.') I cannot even begin to imagine the disappointment this would have created had my stay there been a family vacation! Until the pool is complete, I would be not recommend this hotel, unless you do not mind staying in an outdated room at a resort with no pool. Even when the pool is complete, I would personally not stay here again unless the entire hotel were fully renovated. We debated between this hotel and the Ritz-Carlton, and there is no question that next time, that will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Holiday Way below Intercontinental Quality”
Reviews.Author: GoHerd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK at best. It does have a couple of high points but is in need of much work. Here is my breakdown after spending a week at the hotel. Rooms: The rooms are in pretty run down condition. They are old and outdated and not very clean. Probably the worst part of the entire hotel is the rooms. They need a lot of work. All rooms ending in 05 such as 1405 are very small because of the stairwell. Stay away from these rooms. The city view side is not bad it does face the airport a couple of blocks away but the windows are fairly well insulated. You do have a distant view of the bay. Casino: The casino is very run down compared to the neighboring hotels the Ritz, El San Juan and Courtyard. We did not win any money at the IC but did well at all the other casinos. It is very smoky, full of rowdy locals and many of the machines do not work. Beach: The beach is nice for a fairly poputated stretch ot sand. Water and sand are both clean. Warm water in November probably around 80 degrees. There are reefs right off the beach here but not recommended to snorkel due to motor boats and jet skis. The beach is a big plus. Chairs from the IC and umbrellas are free. Pool: Was closed and has been closed for a couple of months they keep backing up the reopening date from early OCt to late to mid of November. The current condition is probably reflective of a December opening. It looks like it is nice but not open. Many checking in were very upset and we witnesses many confrontations with management because they were not disclosing this if you already had reservations. It is in very small print on their website. Surroundings: It is San Juan. Probably not the safest of cities. But we felt safe walking at night in the immediate 10 blocks of the hotel. There were a lot of police patroling the streets. You just have to be smart you do not want to be walking around by your self or with all your money on you. But it appeared Carolina where the hotel is was a better area of Puerto Rico. Hope this helps. We would go back to San Juan however we would look for new accomodations next.

Reviews.Title: “Grrr-They returned our wedding favors !!”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsEWR
Reviews.Content: Our wedding was September 2006 at this hotel. We (bride and groom) arrived one week earlier to meet with our wedding planner, dj, minister, etc. With the increase in airport security at the time, we had many items shipped to the hotel directly including our wedding favors, cake knife/server, etc. to avoid any problems with the airlines. We almost shipped the gown and suit as well. Whew !! Glad we didn't. All boxes arrived... but the hotel returned them because the bride's name was not in the computer !!! Only the groom was registered. How can the bride and groom not be registered in the hotel? Who was the groom marrying after all? How is it the hotel staff is not aware that there is an event and become familiar with the names of the events? The bride's family was registered. Couldn't they have contacted one of them with the same last name and ask if the packages belonged to them? Once this error was discovered, it was not until the bride and groom threw a temper tantrum that any efforts were made to recover the items. Basically, we were told, "I'm sorry, but she was not registered and the packages were returned" They did not want to initate any inquiries and try to get the boxes back until we made a big stink about it. Needless to say, we are very disappointed in the hotel and the way the staff just brushed off our issue. Feel free to contact us for a more intense description of our miserable experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Relaxing Environment but still Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SDSTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our three day visit started Oct. 22. The Intercontinental San Juan Spa and Resort is probably one of the nicer hotels along the Isla Verde beach front. However, compared to hotel spa and resorts found on the mainland particularly in Las Vegas it would only rank as average. The pool was being remodeled therefore it was unavailable to guests. This didn't present a problem for me because I enjoyed the beach and ocean which had easy access from the hotel. We reserved a city view room but we told we had been upgraded to a deluxe city view. The difference was simply that the deluxe city view was on a higher floor (5 and above) instead of (2 - 4). Our view was actually very nice. We could see the airplanes as they landed and when there were no planes you actually had a distance (very distance) ocean view. The hotel is only 10 minutes from the airport but the noise of the planes didn't bother us. Others have written that the walls of the hotel rooms are thin, that is correct. The noise didn't really bother me as much as it bothered by roommate. One thing that annoyed us both was the television speaker in the bathroom. It was loud and intrusive. We actually had the maintenance staff cut it off. Instructions should have been left for the guests so we could have cut it off ourselves. The Intercontinental was nice but I think very much overpriced. San Juan for tourists probably has seen better days. I think passing through San Juan before going on a cruise is fine but as a final destination youâ€™re better off going to St. Thomas or Aruba.

Reviews.Title: “What is up at IC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nosmothj
Reviews.Content: Regrettably I was not able to stay at IC. I have been watching for a month and a half , concerned about the work on the pool area. IC kept moving the date out by 2 weeks. Last week called on 23 advised will open 30 or 31. Called 27 now changed to Nov 15. Finally got my TA to call the hotel and they say not even the end of No likely. Now all hotels are pretty well filled up. In my opinion they would have been better to say pool closed indefinitely. At least that would be more honest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DJACKS
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal for this trip to PR through Liberty Travel. My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental from 10/11 - 10/15. We arrived in San Juan at 11am on Wednesday and the hotel allowed us to check in that early. We were booked for a city view room but were upgraded to a ocean view on the 16th floor. We also had complimentary breakfast each morning which was great. The food will definitely fill you up for the whole day. We were still disappointed about the pool being closed. I called before my arrival to see when it would be open and was told it would be open by 10/15. When I got there they said the end of the month. You can use the pool at the Holiday Inn as an accomodation, however, the one day we planned on using it, the hotel was having an event and we couldn't go. The hotel staff is VERY PLEASANT. They address you by name every time you call and if you need anything, they are there in a minute and even call to make sure everything was taken care of afterwards. Outside the hotel, the people were no where near as friendly, and I wasn't impressed with the rest of San Juan. But if you want to go somewhere to relax on a nice beach, this is the place. Too bad the pool was closed. The pictures looked beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Word of caution”
Reviews.Author: TPF1122
Reviews.Content: While I did not have problems while at the hotel, I have been struggling for the past month to have my eyeglasses returned. My first call to the hotel, I was told they had been turned in and would be sent to me straight away. It has been over a month and numerous phone calls, including a call to the manager, and I still do not have my glasses. No one will return my phone calls. This was my first stay at an Intercontinental property, and I am not inclined to ever stay again due to their unresponsiveness.

Reviews.Title: “Looked nice, too bad the pool was closed”
Reviews.Author: TCBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had booked on-line. A friend recommended the hotel because of the beautiful pool and swim up bar. When we arrived, we were informed that we should have been told when we booked (we weren't) that the pool was closed for renovations and instead we could take a shuttle bus to the Holiday Inn's pool. We were offered our choice of a few amenities - casino credits, free breakfast, a 30 min massage, etc. Since the reason we had booked there was the pool, we decided to go elsewhere and ended up at the beautiful El San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely paradise..perfect in evry way!!”
Reviews.Author: Herk_Driver
Reviews.Content: What a paradise, stayed there while on business with the military, govt rate of 195. Right on the water with its own beach and casino. The rooms had couch and coffee table, rooms from the 10th floor up have a great view of the ocean. Food and drinks are expensive, 8-10 bucks for a rum and coke. Grocery store across street. Eat at Lupi's a few blocks down, mexican sports bar-great fajitas.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return to the InterContinental San Juan Resort In A Minute!”
Reviews.Author: Linda820
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental in San Juan Puerto Rico from August 21 - 26, 2006. The reviews I read on Trip Advisor prior to going are very accurate. I cannot say enough about this Hotel and about Puerto Rico. This was my first trip to Puerto Rico, accompanied by my kids, 19 & 17 and my mom. The most extraordinary thing about this hotel, as others have raved, is the service. I have stayed in many five star hotels and the service at this hotel exceeded all of them. The reason this hotel probably gets the four star rating is because the rooms could definitely use a little updating. Instead of two full size mattresses, they should splurge and get queens. This is one of my two complaints from this trip (I will share the second complaint later)! Our check-in was very quick and being the hotel is five minutes from the airport, our flight landed at 1 pm and we were in our room by 1:45pm. We had a problem with our in-room safe and within 2 minutes someone came to fix it. We also did not have enough towels and within 2 minutes of calling the front desk, the towels were delivered clean & hot right out of the dryer. The front desk even called one minute after receiving the towels to make sure that they arrived. Every single employee in this hotel was friendly and helpful. A room with a view of the ocean is a must!!! The extra money spent for this was worth it. We were overlooking the ocean and the pool - definitely heaven on earth! We ate at Momoyama/Japanese, which was okay. However, Pasaggio/Italian should not be missed. We ate the breakfast buffet at La Terrazza, which was pricey and just okay. The restaurant by the beach - Meditteranian was one of our favorites for lunch with a view to die for and excellent salads. The pool area was beautiful and clean. My second complaint about this hotel was definitely the prices of the drinks. It cost $8.00 for a beer by the pool, which was the same as a mixed drink. I think this was the most I ever paid for a beer. It is recommended to go across the street to the supermarket and purchase snacks and your beer there, where you will pay $8.00 for a six pack. Some of the local places to make note of was Platos for local food, which was excellent (a few blocks from the El San Juan hotel) and Piu Bello for coffee and ice cream (also a few blocks from the El San Juan - make a left out of the InterContinental). The bakery across the street that others have raved about in the reviews has great food, but unfortunately we had terrible service - it is probably best to order your food at the counter. We went to Mi Casita Restaurant - next to the bakery for breakfast one morning and the service and food were horrible - everything was ice cold. Being New Yorkers - I guess we are not used to the slow, very laid back service. STAY AWAY FROM THE PONDEROSA STEAKHOUSE FOR BREAKFAST - we found out the hard way. On our trip we visited the El Yunque Rainforest , which was great. We spent an afternoon in Old San Juan, which was fantastic - great shopping, however, the stores close too early - around 6 pm. We ate in a great restaurant in Old San Juan - Barrachina, which claims to be the home of the original Pina Colada - and they were the greatest! This trip was really enjoyable and I would go back to Puerto Rico and stay in the InterContinental again - I could not have asked for better!

Reviews.Title: “nice place lousy location”
Reviews.Author: JR911421
Reviews.Content: I checked in on August 24th and waited about 20 minutes in line to be checked in. room was on 5th floor overlooking street. casino is lousy i reccomend going to the el san juan or ritz. food is great but overpriced. gym has great steam room and suana. good beach access. not a pedestrian freindly neighborhood. i would reccomend renting a car to be able to see the rest of the island. overall i think the place has had better times. maybe back in th sixties when it was built. next time i'm going back to the marriott or hilton.

Reviews.Title: “It was really great!”
Reviews.Author: dror
Reviews.Content: We stay at the hotel for 7 nights from 8/18/06 to 8/25/06, we choose the hotel based on reviews on this site. It was really nice, the whole time, the stuff is extremely nice, the place is very clean, the location is right in the middle of everything in walking distance. I will not repeat all the good things other people talked about already, just add that they will go out of the way to satisfy you, on our first day, the room was ready 15 min later than 4pm, which was really not a big deal, I did not even said anything, sure enough, they apologize and gave us a free breakfast for the following day ($60 for 3), then, on our forth day, we got wrong info about a place we went to, again, we did not ask for anything, they took off our bill all the parking charges (3 days) for the rental car we had. Also, there is an Avis rental car desk in the lobby, Maria, the supervisor was also very helpful and extremely nice. We already planning to go there again, we enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn, but all of the amenities”
Reviews.Author: misodiva
Reviews.Content: From the pictures and description on the web site I was expecting more luxurious accomidations. The walls were very thin, the furniture a bit worn. The bathroom was small. It had a nice balcony for city view. I was on 5th floor and didn't hear much traffic with door closed. Service was very nice, and really enjoyed the tours booked with the hotel. The bed was quite comfortable, mini-bar was a bit sparce for selections. Free Wireless access was nice. The room service food and the Yokahama restaurant were both excellent.

Reviews.Title: “we didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: kiplill
Reviews.Content: We would recomend this resort to anyone looking for a relaxing and enjoyable time. While it is true that the food and drinks in the resort are more expensive than most, the service and attention to detail from the staff could not be beat. Great accomodations...clean and well maintained with much ambiance. Beautiful pool and direct access to the beach with water sports. Complimentary beach chairs and towels are provided by staff. We were provided with a complimentary upgrade before we even asked!! We were also offered a late check out with use of full facilites and a hospitality room to change prior to our late departure flight in the early evening. We recommend the beachside and swim up bars.....gotta try the Voodoo Juice....it wil be a "bucket of fun". For breakfast, we would recommend eating at Mi Casita across the street. It is great food at reasonable prices. Lupi's Sports Bar and Grill...just down the street is another good place for a relaxing, casual dinner. There is also a supermarket within easy walking distance to buy your bottled water, sodas and snacks, because it was extremely expensive in the resort...i.e $3.00 for a small bottle of water. Expect to give a $300 deposit on a credit card upon registration for incidental room charges....which works out great for the bars as you don't need to carry cash. Overall, we had a wonderful time and cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Usufruct
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before selecting a resort for our honeymoon, and I'm very glad I did. I chose the IC San Juan because of its location, and the positive reviews I read here. I booked through Orbitz, and the website didn't tell me what the rooms actually were (city view, ocean view, etc.) so I chose the most expensive, assuming that it would be an Ocean View - it was. We arrived after a very short $10 cab ride from the Airport, and the porters took our bags immediately. We checked in (Rm. 1022), and we had hardly walked into the room before someone called asking if it was ok to bring the bags up now. About 2 minutes later our bags arrived. The room was great, just what I expected. The king size bed was very comfortable, the safe and fridge worked, and the AC was quiet and very cold. The balcony was admittedly small, but adequate. The sliding glass doors block out most of the outdoor noise, including the occasional plane taking off or landing. Contrary to what some others have said, I did not have any problem with noise. I could occasionally hear doors slam, or hear a muffled conversation from next door, but it certainly didn't keep me up at night, or bother me in the slightest. The beach was nice and clean, and not crowded. The pool, while we did not use it, looked amazing, and all the gardens and the trees really made us feel like we were in a tropical paradise. In the hotel, we ate at Momoyama (Japanese), Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, and Ciao Mediterranean Cuisine (right on the beach). We also ate at the Palm and Sunny's Ocean Terrace restaurant, both a short walk down the beach. Most of the food was expectedly expensive, but it was all good. I especially recommend lunch at the Ciao Mediterranean place, their lunch is very fairly priced and the food was excellent. Try the Cuban Sandwich! For cheap food, just head right across the road. There's a plaza with a Supermarket, Subway, Burger King, Church's Chicken, a great bakery, etc., and right down the road there are even more fast food options (KFC, Taco Bell etc.), if you want to save some money. The casino was nice, a little smoky, but we had fun regardless. Nestor, at the Concierge desk filled us in about travel to and from Old San Juan. The bus stops about 1/10th of a mile from the IC San Juan every 20 minutes, and costs .75 per person, exact change. It takes about 30 minutes (depending on traffic) to make it from there to the end of the line, which is just below Old San Juan, where the cruise ships dock. You can take a trolley from there. A cab ride to or from Old San Juan is around $20. Nestor also booked us for a kayak trip in Fajardo, at night, to see the bioluminescent bay there. It was such an incredible experience, we'll never forget it. We also visited El Yunque rain forest (via Rico Suntours through Orbitz). There are lots of trails to explore, and really amazing sights. Everyone we came in contact with in Puerto Rico (and especially at the Intercontinental San Juan) was very polite and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel/resort to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable, friendly and conveniently located place to stay near San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: my3ds
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Intercontinental. This was our first trip to PR and this is one of the best trips ever! The hotel was beautiful and the staff, no matter where, were very accommodating! We met so many nice people from all over the U.S. We were complimentary upgraded to an oceanfront room on the 15th floor so the view was breathtaking! The bed faces the window so waking up to the view each morning was more than I could ask for! Yes, the Intercontinental is a little expensive -for drinks mainly but we went to the store and bought our own and kept it in the room. Dinners were great - we ate at the Momoyama and the cost was no more than what we pay back home to go to dinner. We went across the street to the little strip mall to have breakfast which was very good also. One day we ate breakfast at the Ponderosa which was surprisingly good too! We took the Old San Juan tour and the Bacardi tour and they were both fun - not enough time in Old San Juan but we went back the next night and it was just wonderful!! Outside vendors, music and dancing in the streets, outdoor cafes, etc. We did not take the bus to town since we didn't want to be on it for over an hour for a 15 min. ride by taxi - there were four of us so we split the cost - it was much more convenient. This is a fabulous place - I can't wait to return!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Intercontential Hotel good & bad............”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My expectations were not what I was expecting. I was upgraded because of my club membership. Unfortunately, My room was located on the city side. I felt like I was not away from home since I come from the city. At night I could hear the planes go by for landing. The A.C. was making noise too. The next day, I asked to change my room to the beach side. Of course they wanted more money. I refuse to pay. I told them I cannot sleep at night and I was not spending another night there. I finaly asked to speak to the Mgr. I was given another room with a pool view. I was downgraded to one room but the room was sunny and had a nice view and I felt like I was on vacation. I inspected the room first before I decided to accept. The pool was big and nice. The ocean is the Atlantic ocean, so it isn't beautiful and clear like the Carribean. The beach is big compare to other beaches in P.R. The hotel is old but clean. The staff are alright. The resturants are good but expensive. If you venture out get ready for the hassles of waiting .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a great beach”
Reviews.Author: alerick
Reviews.Content: Stayed: June 29-July 5 2006. The goods are: The hotel is located right next to the San Juan Hotel and you can just walk over and enjoy the Club "Brava"(mix) and lounge (Spanish Band) that they have. Has one of the best pools of all of the Hotels in Isla Verde. Great rooms extremely nice beach (they have servers on the beach). Jet Skis, Banana Boat, etc. Avail. Bads: Expensive drinks and food (avg. drink $10) **You must try their frozen drinks "Margartita" Pool closes at 10pm, Pool Bar at 6pm (However, there is another pool bar open) Thin walls (Try to get the room at the end of the hallway) Recommendations: Try not asking the locals for directions; they are not good with directions (you will see)stick to the police officers/taxis/visitor center. Do not take the Bus to Old San Juan. You will hear that it is better. However, is time sonsuming and can get crowed. It took us 45 min. to catch it and a whole hour and 10 min to get there. The same thing happen coming back. Do not be afraid to rent a car and wonder out with a map. There is a supermarket down the street that stays open 24 hrs (not the one directly across from the hotel) and buy water bottles some snacks and a bottle of your favorite liquor. This will save you a lot of $$ MUST GO TO PINONES. Is a long strip about a 10 min drive E from Hotel. They have a lot of fish and food and music. Some suvernier shops too. (cheap)**try Pinonos,bacalaito, alcapurrias There is a Walgreen within walking distance where you can get Cash Back (avoid ATM fees) By the way, they are call ATH (A Toda Hora) not ATM

Reviews.Title: “So So Resort”
Reviews.Author: crisn11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 day 4 night stay at the Intercontinental San Juan. I must say, that the concierge Jossell Velasquez was so warm and welcoming as well as efficient at his job. He made all of our dinner reservations and suggested many things to do. As a matter of fact they upgraded our room to ocean view free of charge. The entire staff was professional and exceeded our expectations, but thats about it. Aside from the staff we would have to say that our room even with the ocean view was small and just like many others have posted before the walls are paper thin. We could hear everything from the hallway. The japanese restaurant Momoyama and Ruth's Chris were both outstanding. Overall we had a great time because we ventured out to Old San Juan and to the Ritz Carlton which is superior in everyway. If you are going to be in the San Juan area a dinner at Prime 787 at the Ritz is a must. Very expensive but worth every penny. Hope this was helpful didn't mean to drag on. Oh pool at the Intercontinenatal was ok, we much preferred the beach where the sand was soft and so was the water.

Reviews.Title: “Here right now!”
Reviews.Author: omegaspring95
Reviews.Content: We're in PR as we speak and I just had to post! Don't believe the negative reviews! It's great at the IC. Hotel provides more than adequate accommadations in a GREAT location. We are active. . .Walked the entire beach daily, went into the RITZ (beautiful but snobby), El San Juan (live salsa at night, great for people watching-- have to see lobby, right next door), The Water Club (roof top bar, sushi, great!) and more. Driving is aggressive but not bad. Got a car yesterday and did the rainforest, Laquillo and Old San Juan. WHEW! Great new Italian restaurant (Sofia, owned by Parrot Club guy, Marco at bar A+!!) Had so much fun, we'r keeping the car today too! Online getting more info form foruns to decide where to go next! Friendly people here. A retired woman just struck up conversation with us yesterday in Old San Juan. She told us about the history of the buildings, La Princesa (the old prison) and the military buildings! It was great. Mind the pigeons~ You have to explore this great island! Book the IC! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tpersis777
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Intercontinental from June 26th to 30th. We had a GREAT time. Everyone says the Intercontinental is pricey, but we got a really good package deal with a garden/pool view, and none of these "hidden" fees people keep talking about . We ended up on the 6th floor and you could still see the ocean. Definitely get an oceanview room if you stay, like everyone says. We had a hospitality room when we arrived on the city side. No comparison. Also when we left we received a hospitality room on the 16th floor ocean view...WOW! I see why its the "higher" the better. You could see the whole beach and beyond from this room. It was just gorgeous. I saw nothing wrong with the lobby, I thought the hotel was very nice and clean, and the grounds were beautiful. The pool was really nice (and clean) too, although we are beach people and never went in! Food is what everyone says, expensive at the hotel (but good!), and so many ways to work around this. We went to Mi Casita for many inexpensive meals and thought it was great. Metropol (for cuban) is also just a short walk away. The location of this hotel was excellent. On one of the days we rented a car and drove ourselves to Old San Juan, defintely worth the short trip to this beautiful city. Then we drove to Fajardo and did the kayak bio bay tour. Also DEFINTITELY worth it, a once in a lifetime experience. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and a trip to Puerto RIco. The staff of the hotel and the people of Puerto Rico in general were all very nice and helpful. The only complaint we have is that the hotel's beach had quite a bit of debris on it. Straws from drinks and people just not picking up after themselves (so we would!). The beachside drink service was nice if you want to splurge for it, and so is the beach chair service, but perhaps they should have someone cleaning up the beach periodically as well. Any other questions feel free to email me, thanks, Tracy

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the InterContinental for 5 days. Our experience was great, and as a result we enjoyed San Juan more than we expected. People comment about the lobby- who cares? The beach was great as was the pool. The staff will issue you a wristband and deliver your chair to the beach. You feel secure at the hotel and pool, and there is an in room safe for your valuables. I would not recommend eating at the hotel- why go to Ruth Chris when you are in Puerto Rico? Buy your breakfast and lunch stuff at the store right across the street and use the in-room fridge. I would consider buying your alcohol there too- the drinks at the hotel are pricey and not that good. Save your money and go to the excellent restaurants in the evening (Pikayo, Lemongrass, or some good ones on OSJ like Parrot Club). The room was not fancy but very comfortable. Clean, quiet at night and unlike many hotels in San Juan half the rooms face the ocean. Get one with an ocean view. Service was excellent, fast check in and great follow up with any requests. There were plenty of taxis and a very helpful valet staff. Far superior to the other similar prices hotels in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Loripie21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Jun 22- 25 and had a great time. The hotel was extremely clean and the staff very polite. The pool area was very nice and there were lots of chairs in either sunny spots or shade spots. The Isle Verde Beach was great for walking and people watching and always had lots going on i.e. jet skis, banana boats, etc. We ate dinner at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and were blown away by the quality of the food and the service- both spectacular (worth the price). We also walked over one night to the Hotel El San Juan to see what everyone was talking about and were stunned. The hotel lobby is one of the most beautiful i had ever seen- take the advice stay at the Intercontinental but go have a drink at the Hotel El San Juan. The only complaint i have is the "resort prices". A beer at the pool at the IC was, with tip, $9.00 USD WOW- we live in St. John in the USVI and that is the biggest "resort price" rip off we have ever seen. A small martini at the Hotel ESJ was $12.00 USD- YIKES! Luckily there is a store across the street and at the IC they will allow you to bring drinks, snacks, whatever and use the minifridge in the room. Also -after having lunch by the pool one day and paying $83.00 USD for chicken wings, a hamburger, a small pepperoni pizza, 2 beers, and 2 pina coladas we decided to walk across the street where you will also find an assortment of fast food and local restaurants for much much cheaper and that will also taste good!!! I give the hotel and the location and A. We will for sure be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: mia1972
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Puerto Rico for 5 days. We stayed at 3 different hotels during our stay, and the IC was the last hotel for one night. The location is good because it is right on Isla Verde Beach as it is hard to park a car in this part of town just to use the beach. The water here is very clean and blue-green, not clear as it is on other islands in the Caribbean. It is very calm unlike the wild waves in Pinones, where most of the locals go to swim or in Rio Grande. The only good thing about the hotel is the beach. Otherwise, it is just ok. The lobby is small and not as grand as you would expect it to be. It feels cramped with its low ceilings. The hotel, El San Juan, next door has a lobby and shopping gallery, which makes it feel 5 times bigger than the IC. On Friday evening the IC was very dead compared to El San Juan as it has no disco and just a tame jazz band playing near the bar. The room itself looks very outdated and has very unappealing decor. Not tropical or even modern at all. Could have been any room at a 4 star hotel in Ohio. We did eat at one of the restaurants, Chris Ruth Steakhouse, which always has excellent service and steaks. This is the 2nd trip we have made to Puerto Rico and the 2nd time we ate there, and it has always been exemplary and each time we see Latino celebrities. This being our second trip, we decided instead of spending 5 days straight at Isla Verde like we did the first time that we would hotel hop. It is a great idea to rent a car and drive from place to place instead of being stuck at Isla Verde and taxiing into San Juan. There is not much to do or see if you walk around Isla Verde. There are no chic shops or boutiques as you would expect. We also stayed 2 days at the Westin Rio Mar resort near El Yunque Rain Forest, which was an excellent resort that has what you expect for a 4 to 5 star hotel, not like the IC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Intercontinental San Juan June 8th-12th for my 30th birthday. Growing up my family had an apartment in the ESJ towers and I have been to San Juan several times. We have also been to other parts of the Caribbean, Mexico, Europe, etc., and I cannot really complain about this hotel. We stayed on the 15th floor with an ocean view. (Definitely worth it) The rooms were very nice and we did not hear any noise at all. The staff was very friendly and though we only ate lunch at the restaurant by the pool it was very good, yes it was expensive but you are paying for the convenience of sitting in your bathing suit and not having to leave the grounds. The only complaint I have and it wasn't even that bad was the pool could have been cleaner. I am not talking about leaves, etc., but the actual pool walls seemed dirty and it made the pool look murky. Not a big deal though. We had drinks and walked around El San Juan next door. Really fun on Saturday night. The lobby is beautiful, you could make a whole night out of relaxing by the bar and people watching. They have a live band and everyone dances. The prices are actually cheaper there than at the lobby bar at the IC. ($16 for a shot of Patrone) Starting that Friday there was a culinary food festival going on in Old San Juan. Perfect for us foodies! Instead of just going to one restaurant we got a chance to sample a few. They had tables set up all along Calle Fortalezza and several live bands. We had an appetizer of blackened seared tuna in a Thai peanut sauce at Tantra that was out of this world. We also ate at Dragonfly, Aquaviva, and the Parrot Club. The halibut at the Parrot club was excellent. We had planned and usually do go to more traditional restaurants while on vacation but ended up at these places and I am not complaining. It started off the first night when we ended up strolling into the water club near the IC and ate at Tangerine, One cevicehe appetizer later and we were hooked to the modern/fusion restaurants. We did go down the street from the IC to the Metropol for the black bean soup, it was yummy, just as I remembered. One more thing, the IC does hit you with a hefty occupancy tax/resort service charge, (about $66 a day on weekdays, $80 on weekends) I believe they tell you that when you actually book the room, I suppose I overlooked it and was a bit shocked upon checking out. Regardless, I would stay at the IC again. It is in a great location and Isla Verde beach is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Bad spa & Stolen Items”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 7 days spent with my huge family of 30+guests and three of us had things stolen from our rooms (jewelry). It was very upseting to all of us. Also, the nail and hair salon was very small and had bad service and cheap nail polish and wax. Their techniques were very bad as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 14 month old son went to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Intercontinental over the Memorial Day weekend. It was not the best trip weâ€™ve taken though weâ€™ve traveled to the Olympics this winter in Italy and with a far younger baby to Mexico and other parts of the US. So here are a few reasons why we would probably not recommend traveling to Puerto Rico. The Intercontinental Hotel itself is very nice. It has a beautiful lobby with marble floors, and dark wood accents. But the walls are EXTREMELY thin. The hotel was hosting various proms, Jr. proms and weddings during our stay and had many teenage guests. Theyâ€™d get into their rooms at 3:00 or 4:00 am and have the parties continue in their rooms and all the while it seemed like someone had just stepped into our very own room. I could clearly hear their conversations, the steps they took across their room, and even what they were watching on TV. These events woke us up 3 out of the 5 nights we stayed. Also, the hotel is located in a tourist area with various other hotels, however once you walk across the street you feel like you are stepping into an impoverished urban area with drunk men and scantily clad women on the street. The food throughout Puerto Rico was very hit and miss. Yes, the hotel has three restaurants (none that we visited) but the day we did venture to get something to eat in their poolside restaurant we had an $85 tab for a very plain green salad and a sandwich. Far too expensive for what we actually received. I was much more satisfied when I walked across the street to get some far tastier Puerto Rican food for about $8 a dish. I recommend the Asopao de Pollo (Chicken Gumbo). My baby and husband really enjoyed that. All in all I think we received the best food and service on our second night there when we went to the shopping center across the street for some (of all things) Chinese food. We went sightseeing as part of the hotelâ€™s tours to the Bacardi Rum Distillery (you get two free drinks and a very well put together tour of the distillery and Bacardiâ€™s history), Camuy caves (interesting), the Arecibo Observatory, and to old San Juan. We also visited the Fort of San Cristobal and the El Moro Fort, on an alternate day when we decided to go back to Old San Juan on our own. Taxi fair to â€œViejo San Juanâ€� was about $20 each way. One of our tour guides advised us to request a receipt from the taxis as a method of keeping them honest. We had several incidents that really tested our patience while on this trip. On one occasion I asked the hotelâ€™s concierge to direct me to a restaurant where I could see the sunset but she thought I wanted to have dinner on the actual beach. After going back and forth with her about what I wanted she directed me to a restaurant down the street from the hotel that was nowhere near the beach and was completely empty when we showed up. We ended up walking to a restaurant that sat on the pier which had the worst food and service weâ€™ve ever received. It also seemed like I was at Spring Break central with loud reggaeton music and all the young people getting ready to start their partying. Not a place for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: County95
Reviews.Content: Just went to San Juan for a long weekend May 4-7th. Loved the Intercontinental. Great Hotel, friendly staff. We had an Ocean View room 9th Floor and it was awesome to wake up to every morning. Weather was perfect. Breakfast was included in our rate and the buffet which runs about $20.00/person was great. New choices every morning. Also in Old San Juan go check out Old Harbor Brewery. Some good selections of Beers and cool dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
