Reviews.Content: Before my trip I read several on-line reviews and like always, I was sceptical. We arrived in at the Intercontinental Saturday May 13th approx 2:30 P.M. , after a nice smooth filght. Check in was quick and staff very courtious. We left our luggage with them and went on our way, straight to the beach side grill. The food was good, but very expensive, $12.00 for a hot dog/fries and a hamburger was the same--just add $2.00 for a slice of cheese. The view is beautiful tropical folliage, white powdery sand, and aqua ocean on one side and a lush tropical landscaped grounds with pool/pool bar. Of course you always have to have that pina colada floating or sitting at the pool bar-I just love that whole idea! But again very expensive, $20.00 for two. Only and hour has pasted and we're going up to the room. The room is pretty large, well cleaned and maintained with a king size bed, stocked mini bar, dresser, and tv. Inbetween the main room and the bath room is a nice vanity area to put on make up. Then the bathroom, very clean, nice marble tile , full tub/shower (excelllent water pressure), a hair dryer, iron/board, and even a scale (not that I got on it) I'm on vacation. Our room over looked the front of the resort, that was kinda cool to watch the planes come in and see what was around the area. The bed was comfortable, we didn't mind the sounds out the planes taking off and the sound was muffeled with the sliding doors closed. We're used to noise at night living close to railroad tracks here at home. I only mention this because several reviews stated the the noise was unbarable at times--we didn't find that to be the case. For our 1st breakfast we just went down stairs --again, the food was good, but pricy ($44.00 for 2). Now that we know how expensive it is we went off the property for our meals. You are surrounded by all kinds or fast food (churches chicken, pizza hut, wendy's, taco bell, taco maker), etc. we found the Pondarosa to have a good breakfast--there is even an OutBack restaurant around the corner (definately somethng for everyone). We didn't take any tours, but rented a car (off property cheaper) and explored on our own. Map of island is easy to navigate, exits maked, highways are kinda rough. We went to the rain forest and spent the day (breath-taking) hard hiking if your not fit. Drove around to several beaches, I loved them all and none were over crowded. Took a ride to the caves--that was too cool, it's amazing to be so deep into the ground and stand inside this huge, cool, dark dome with enough light to see what's around, giant stalagtites and stalagmites protruding from the ground and ceiling of the cave. We saw some bats flying around one section and one right infront of me hanging upside down with one wing open . That is the coolest picture I took. We also went to the center of the island and visited with some of my husbands family--the ride was beautiful with water falls that you see after taking a hair pin turn traveling up the mountain. We're not much for night life so all we really did is go out for dinner and stop on the way back to the casino. I liked the one in the El San Juan better than the others and that was only because of the appearance--the others weren't very elabrate for being a casino, well not what I'm used to anyway. We left every night with a little more than what we spent, but then again we're not big gamlers. I would definately stay at the Intercontinental again---When you look at it from the front you would never know that there was a tropical paradise waiting for you on the other side! The island people were very friendly and the weather was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Questionable Guests”
Reviews.Author: ajs0522
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the San Juan Intercontinental over Memorial Day weekend. I was worried about a difficult check-in, tiny rooms, thin walls, etc. I was pleased that everything in those areas turned out ok. Though our room was not ready upon arrival, it was not a problem because we were given a hospitality room to change. I was not feeling well from the flight, so they allowed us extra time in the room. The room was adequate in size... and was very very clean. We were on the 16th (top) floor, and the view was lovely. I didn't hear our neighbors, but did hear doors in the hall closing- not a big deal at all. In general, the accomodations were nice. Not spectacular, but certainly nice enough. The pool was lovely... but overcrowded with loud guests. We stayed on the beach most of the time, and heard "boom boxes" playing loudly. I think many of the island people vacation there for a night or two over the Memorial Day weekend. I felt as if it were more a spring break atmosphere... not what you'd expect for $300+ a night, and in May. Tuesday after Memorial Day was the best day. The beach was also nice. Definitely a people watching beach! Ocean water was nice as well. Not crystal clear, but still clean and warm. The conceirge was great- though they recommend you take the bus to Old San Juan for 75 cents as opposed to a taxi- $19 one way. DO NOT take the bus if you want to feel secure and comfortable. Very shady characters. My husband and I could not understand why the concierge would recommend doing so. All in all a nice place- not a great weekend in terms of the occupants there, but we enjoyed ourselves at the Intercontinental anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jules1212
Reviews.Content: The hotel's staff is so incredible. They treat you like royalty. My husband and I celebrated our 10 year ann and stayed there in May 2006. We were upgraded to an ocean view room, the view was fabulous. The room was nicely decorated, everything worked fine. It was nice to have a safe in the room. There's also a small fridge, and a market across the street. Two great breakfast places were across the street, by the market, Mi Casita, and the bakery. Mi Casita has $2.50 bfast special everyday. Subway and some other fast food restaurants are also across the street. The hotel food is way overpriced. Breakfast was like $14 min. We didn't eat at the hotel except for Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, which, of course, was the best steak ever. There's also a casino in the hotel, nickel slots are were it's at! I had a few good nights in "Biddyville," as my husband called it. (There were lots of older women playing the nickel slots) The guy in the gift shop even went to another hotel to get my size in a shirt I wanted. Free towels and bottled water at the pool everyday. The pool needs a review all on its own. That was the most fabulous pool I have been to, and I've been to a lot. Rock formations, water falls, bridge, swim up bar, it is sooo nice! I do not recommend renting a car, unless you have terrific navagational skills. The streets seem very difficult to navigate. The taxi was well worth it. The bus was less expensive by far, but took like half an hour to wait on, then twice as long to get there as a taxi. This website helped me choose our vacation, so I hope my review has helped you. I highly recommend the Intercontinental Hotel and Casino in San Juan. We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: back115
Reviews.Content: The Inetercontinental Hotel and Casino in SanJuan , Puerto Rico was better than expected. It is a 4 star hotel in the Isle Verde section of San Juan. The cleanliness of the room,and friendliness of the staff was beyond our expectations. Whether we needed concierge assistance, or a question answered at the front desk, our needs were met promptly. The food and drinks at the hotel were expensive, but not more so than the El SanJuan next door. We had an oceanview room with a magnificent view, and our room was spacious enough to accomodate the 3 people in our party. I would definitely stay at this hotel if I returned to San Juan, and would recommend it to anyone planning an upcoming trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: isletraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. It was clean, the rooms were nice, the grounds kept very well, and service from all staff (from bellman to housekeeping) was top notch. The food at the Splash Bar (pool bar) and at the Mediterranian Cafe (beach front) was so-so. The breakfast in the mornings at the hotel restaurant was very good, and the Japanese restaurant was excellent. Isla Verde seemed to be a very nice area of Puerto Rico. My husband had stayed prior to my arrival for a meeting at the Westin Resort...probalby 40-45 minutes away from Isla Verde. He said he liked this better. This was maybe a 5min cab ride to the airport, and about 15min cab ride to Old San Juan. Old San Juan was interesting, but it's really hot and most of the shops sell the same things. Go to see the history and have lunch...go back to your hotel for nightlife. Right next door to the Intercontinental is the El San Juan. Go to their rooftop restaurants (one Mexican food, one Ranch Style)...the views are great and the atmosphere is good. They also have a club, but we didn't stay long enough to really get the feel for it. I'm sure if you're in the mood for dancing and a 'clubby' atmosphere it would be just fine! All in all, I'd recommend the Intercontinental over other hotels we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but get your wallet ready....”
Reviews.Author: CeCeArlington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 3 night, 4 day trip to San Juan Puerto Rico. I am starting a new job next week so I was really excited about getting in a (much deserved) vacation. I searched and searched for the perfect spot to go and wound up booking at the Intercontinental Resort and Casino. We had never been to PR so we had no idea what to expect. We arrived and took a quick $15 cab ride from the airport to the hotel, $15 for a 5 minute cab ride seemed excessive but what the heck...we were in Puerto Rico! We checked in and found our "Garden View" room overlooked the roof of the restuarant but beyond that was a beautiful blue ocean so I got over it. We headed down to lunch and found that the cheapest thing on the menu was a veggie wrap for $10. This was about the time we realized this was not going to be a cheap trip. I will spare you the play by play but the moral of this story is that Puerto Rico (the Intercontinental specifically) is very expensive. The Intercontinental is a nice hotel...I say nice, not great, and far from fabulous compared to several other Intercontinental's that I have stayed at in the past. It is far away from any other restaurants or shopping so if you want to get a meal outside of the hotel, get ready to pay AT LEAST $40 roundtrip to get anywhere else, same goes for shopping. The casino was okay, but very small and very smokey. The pool is very nice...this is where I spent the majority of my stay. The spa is nice but the doors to the rooms are very thin. Throughout my 55 minute massage I heard a little kid who had been dropped off in the reception area crying for her mother while she recieved a massage in the room next to me. I will close with the fact that the hotel was nice and the service was great but I would not reccomend this to anyone who plans to explore anything outside of the hotel. My reccomendation is to stay in the Old San Juan area. It is chock full of restuarants, bars, and shops (The Parrot Club is a must!). I was told that this was the "ghetto" area but quite honestly the whole of San Juan that I saw resembles the ghetto and Old Town was the most fun. P.S. If you are thinking of booking a trip to PR within the next month or two, talk to the tourism commission. The PR gov't is having a bit of a economic setback at the moment and all public employees (schools, hospitals, gov't agencies, etc.) are unemployeed due to the current elected party. We heard several different versions from those who felt one way or the other about the govenor in office but nonetheless there was a lot of unrest and demostrating going on while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting service - No comparison to other Intercontinental's”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in no way up to par with other Intercontinental's in Latin America/worldwide. Service in EVERY respect is terrible, from the housekeeping that does not show up until 5:00 PM despite repeated requests for service to the absolute zero service in the casino. I was playing $25 blackjack tables for HOURS and not one drink order. Finally complained to management and even the blackjack dealer was literally screaming for a waiter to take orders wihtout success. The bathroom is tiny, the shampoo/amenities sorely lacking and the bed is worn out. Nasty hot tub with brown water and absolute dirty bed linens/bedspread shows this property in desperate need of repair. For $300 a night, stay elsewhere. Never again will I stay here. Nasty nasty nasty is all I can say about this hotel. Oh, the Ruth's Chris restaurant/service is excellent, but stay elsewhere and go there to eat. The Intercontinental is nothing more than a rundown Holiday Inn. I agree with the previous post...this place is dangerous for familie and children as well. The bathroom at the beach was used by non-guests and very dirty. I had my towel actually stolen at the beach when I went to the room for 30 mins. to check email! Not safe and dirty in general!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Empanada
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is good--close to the airport on a beautiful beach (but the taxis rip you off charging you $10.50 for a five minute ride!). The room was spacious and the beds are very comfortable. Our room had a beach view that was beautiful and the hotel provides complimentary plush beach towels, chairs, and umbrellas. But be prepared to listen to your neighbors because the walls are extra thin. We could hear people coming in and out of their rooms all night long. The rooms were very clean and we didn't have any problems checking in. The hotel is close to other hotels and shops, so dining was easy. The neighboring El San Juan Hotel has an amazing salsa club with live music on many nights. We stayed away from the casino because we're not gamblers and we've been to Vegas. We'd recommend skipping breakfast in the hotels and walking across the street to the mini-mall that has breakfast places (e.g., a bakery) for less than $5 per person. There's also a great homestyle Puerto Rican (Criollo) restaurant across the street-their asopao de pollo (chicken soup) was delicious and inexpensive. We'd recommend skipping the hotel restaurants unless you'd like to really pay a lot for a nice meal. Be forewarned, this hotel is not near Old San Juan--if you plan to go to Old San Juan, it's a pretty costly taxi ride ($20 one way). But we took the public bus instead (75 cents per person) and it gave us a great tour of the city and it stops right in Old San Juan at the bus terminal. The bus was clean and operated very efficiently but take exact change. Just ask the concierge about travel in and around Old San Juan-he was very helpful. Note: We did not pay for our stay at the hotel (business trip with extended stay for vacation). But we felt the price of the hotel was reasonable considering the convenience of its location to the beach, restaurants, casinos, and nearby hotels. If you're planning on catching more culture and nightlife in Old San Juan, we'd recommend staying in Old San Juan. The Intercontinental is good for a relaxing time on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weeklong trip staying at the Intercon Hotel in Isla Verde area. We had a decent sized room (king bed, sofa) facing the ocean. It does make a big difference when you get that view and open your sliding door for a nice breeze off the ocean. The higher your floor the better the view. People have complained about the walls being very thin and hearing everybody else but honestly it depends who is staying next to you. It's pretty much luck of the draw. Tell the front desk if your neighbors are too loud. They'll handle it for you. The hotel is very very close to the airport so that's good but also bad in some respects. Only an $11 cab ride (5 min) away but you can hear the boom of the planes arriving and departing close by. Bewteen 11 pm and 7 am the airport has very minimal activity. The pool area is very spacious with plenty of comfy chairs to claim. The staff is very attentive and accommodating to help you enjoy your stay there. There are two bars/restaurants at the pool area, one closer to the beach and one has a swim up bar. The "Splash" swim up bar makes their drinks better than the Ciao restaurant. Definitely important when your paying $8 per drink plus tipping. Food at both places is your typical bar food. Pricier because of the convenience of eating right there at the poolside/beachsisde. You can walk right across the street to a few places for cheaper breakfast/lunch food (i.e. Subway). The beach outside the hotel is decent but the ocean water surprisingly has lots of seaweed. They have water activities such as jet skiing, parasailing, banana boat. Isla Verde beach area allows you to take nice walks up and down the coast. The hotel offers you chairs and umbrellas for the beach as a guest, free of charge, just throw a few $ tip to the guys busting their butts hauling them out for you. They have a decent gym overlooking the ocean close to the beach. It's included in your stay. The hotel has a few different restaurants- sushi, steak, italian, breakfast buffet. Did all of them except for the italian. Enjoyed all of them, little pricier but that's expected for hotel standards. The casino is pretty good, open every day from 10am-4am. Guy sells cigars in front of it during the evening. Little bar in the lobby area with salsa playing music in the evenings. If you plan on hanging in the lobby area during the evening bring a sweatshirt, it's cold in there! People actually hang out in there because it's nice. The concierge desk was very helpful to us in planning dinners and various other activities. Highly recommend Nestor or Joselle. All in all it was a very nice place and the weather in PR was great, obviously the reason people go to the island for vacationing. Would stay there again if we visited PR again. El San Juan hotel next door is pretty sweet with a cool lobby/ bar area but it's also much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Had an awesome vacation!”
Reviews.Author: luvtolaf62
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back (yesterday) from our 5 night vacation at the Intercontinental. We had a great time with very few complaints about the hotel. I would have to say the only real problem was the thin walls (as previous reviewers have stated). If you're unlucky to have inconsiderate neighbors, you'll hear doors slamming and conversations in the hallway and the rooms next door. At 3:00 AM, this was not an ideal situation. Fortunately, it didn't happen every night. We had a city view on the 11th floor and although the balcony is small with only one chair, we were able to bring the room chair outside and be very comfortable having morning coffee or an evening cocktail. The room itself was clean but nothing special. However, this was just fine since we didn't spend a whole lot of time there. The maid service was excellent. The pool and beach areas couldn't be better. You can rent an umbrella ($10) at the towel stand and there's plenty of plush towels and free water. There are also plenty of waiters on the beach if you'd like to have drinks or food brought to you. The gym was just OK. There were four treadmills, one stairmaster, two recumbent bikes and plenty of weights. The spa area is small but sufficient and everybody is really very nice. If you're looking for some salsa dancing, go next door to the El San Juan. The bands were great! Overall, we had a great vacation and would definitely stay at the Intercontinental again. I would be happy to answer any questions if you'd like to contact me. This was my fourth time to Puerto Rico and last year, I stayed at the Wyndham El San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental March 24th, 2006 for 3 days following at sailboat charter in the BVI. It was great to have such a nice hotel to look forward to after "roughing it" for a week! We loved this place! Everyone was so friendly, rooms clean, pool area great-plenty of chairs, beach location excellent. We had a top floor room facing the ocean and could hear the waves all night when we left our door open! The casino was fun-small, but we're not big gamblers. By the way, they don't adhere to the dress code in the casino that they tell you. (Which was good for us because we didn't have room to pack nice clothes and extra shoes other than sandals on the boat. They do make you wear shoes and shirts in the lobby). There are so many helpful personnel standing around everywhere. The concierge was especially helpful in getting us around San Juan and trying out restaurants. Our ONLY gripe was our room not being ready when we arrived, but we just went down and had a drink at the beach bar, so it wasn't really a big problem. We would love to go back to San Juan, as 3 days was not enough time, and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....Here are a few tips”
Reviews.Author: spbge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental in March and on the whole we were very pleased. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They upgraded our room at no extra charge. The pool was lovely and the beaches sufficient. We really appreciated security ever present and that staff was waiting with towels and water after a morning run. The location is great. Close enough to the ESJ for a night of fun and some great food but far enough away for peace and quiet and minutes from the airport. Our room was lovely. Our two complaints would be the doors are very loud. On Saturday night we heard doors slamming all nigh. Not very restful. Try to request a room at the end of the hall. The shampoo is horrible. Fortunately there was a walgreens right down the street and the problem was solved with a $1.25. If you are not a big breakfast eater, we highly recommend the bakery in the strip mall across the street. Great baked goods, ham egg & cheese sandwiches, and a mean cup of coffee. The owner is very nice and remembers how you like your coffee after one day. Another food tip...walk to the end of the beach (to the right) there is a little dive hotel (not the bar hanging over the edge) at the end. Walk through the motel and you will see an amazing view of the ocean, have a great burger, a cold beer, all for a few bucks. Great find! We loved Puerto Rico. There is as much or as little as you want to do. One last warning!!! Check over your bill before check out. We were charged for things we did not eat and were charged for parking a car we never had. Once pointed out, they corrected it without a fuss. We would recommend this hotel. Clean, friendly staff, and decent amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quick getaway!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights in March and loved it. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were fine (not luxurious, but more than adequate) and the pool and beach were great. Despite there being 2 conferences at the hotel while we were there, it never felt overcrowded. The food was good and the drinks hit the spot. We loved how easy it was to get to from the aiport and took advantage a great little coffee shop across the street and a small grocery store to save $ on breakfast. All in all, my friend and I would both definitely return, either with our families or for another girls' weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: hoskikar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the IC on March 16 - 18th. Four ladies and two rooms. Arrived at IC at 5:00pm and one of our rooms wasn't ready until 6:00pm. Was given a complimentary drink at the bar while two of us had to wait for our room to be cleaned.Public areas are very pretty. The rooms are absoultly no more than average. They seem worn. Caulk in the bathroom was old, not well done and yellowish. The beds were fine. The balcony VERY tiny but at least for the most part a beatiful ocean view (it also overlooked lots of roof tops that were not pleasing to look at).If we hadn't paid so much for the room it would be one thing but to pay these prices I expect alot more for the money. Staff was friendly but slow at checkin. Pool was GREAT! Big, clean fun to be at! Beach was very nice. I did appreciate the security they had around the hotel. I would probably not stay here again as I think we could have gotten a better place to stay for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, beautiful hotel, a great option.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Intercontinental for 5 days and 4 nights. We are 28 & 29 yrs old and we were looking for something other than a spring break place, but we also didn't want to stay in a 'honeymoon type' resort. The Intercontinental proved to be a great selection. The staff is extremely pleasant & helpful, always greeting you with a smile. The beach is great, with a cool little beach bar/cantina run by the hotel where you can enjoy a cocktail or some lunch while just steps from your beach chair. The pool is also very attractive and is great for a quick swim, but we're more beach people. The lobby bar and restaurants are totally sufficient if not exceptional. However, the El San Juan, known for it's fantastic nightlife(& mediocre rooms) is literally right next door. We also had dinner and drinks at the Water Club, Isla Verde's new trendy 'boutique' hotel & it was also within walking distance. We had a very nice oceanview room on the 12th floor with a tremendous view. All in all, we had a great time at the Intercontinital and we would recommend it to any of our friends. I can't say enough about the staff and how nice they were.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Phantom03
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers and have been to several Caribbean destinations. We don't cruise, so our experiences have not been limited to port areas or 1 night stays either. That being said, we are totally enchanted with the island of Puerto Rico! We just returned from our 5 night stay at the Intercontinental Hotel there and couldn't be happier with the service and accomodations received. I know the details below are long winded, feel free to skim, but I'd rather give too much info than too little. We are all unique and what means something to one doesn't always mean the same to others. Bottom line is, Puerto Rico and the Intercontinental are both tops in our book! Location - The hotel is a short $11US taxi ride from the airport. It is very close to the airport, but so are ALL the hotels in the Isle Verde/Carolina section. Airplane noise was noticable out by the pool during peak times, so keep that in mind if you are sensitive to it and maybe look for a hotel away from the airport. Definitely no fault of this hotel and to be honest, we didn't notice any airport noise from inside our room (facing the ocean, not the city). Pool - The pool is in a class by itself! The combination swim up/walk up bar is partially covered to provide shade most of the day for people who want to park there and drink without becoming a lobster. The pool bar has 3 tv's and plenty of name brand alcohol. Everything can be charged to your room, no need to bring cash to the pool area. There is also a small footbridge, several shallow ledges for in-pool suning, and (best of all) a multi-waterfall simulated rock formation with all kinds of places to sit/stand under them. A small section of the pool gets 6'+ deep and is clearly marked by bouy lines. The rest is generally between 3' and 5'+. Hot tub is huge and connected to the pool for easy in/out between the two. Plenty of areas to get shade and sun around the pool. Thick cushioned loungers with lots of tables and umbrellas are usually able to be had with not too much trouble. Towels are easy to get and plentiful as is all the FREE bottled water you can drink. Drink service was almost always at hand and not bothersome if you didn't want it. If you are a pool person, this is your place to be. Beach - Soft, beige sand is perfect for long, barefoot walks. Not too crowded. Surf is just rough enough to be interesting, perfect for the body surfer. Lots of watersports options nearby. Beaches are public but not overrun by pushy vendors (we saw very few at all). Only knock was the above average amount of seaweed in the first 10-15 yards of surf. Most hotels on the beach issue their guests daily ID braclets to get back in. Room - The shower is the best we have ever, and I mean EVER, had! It is what all showers in the world should be designed after! Holds the temperature, gets as hot as you want (or not), easy to operate and the water pressure is like a small fire hose. Did I mention we liked the shower? A small refrigerator is in the room stocked with a couple beers, a couple waters, some soda... any of which will be charged to your room if consumed. The great part about it is there are no sensors inside, so you can move things around and use the ample extra space for your own perishables. The king bed was very comfortable, pillows were just OK, plenty of blankets if you want them. Enough drawer and closet space for 2 people on an average stay. Large desk and sofa in the sitting area. Balcony was too small, but better than none at all. Sliding glass door lets the Caribbean air wash right into the room. A/C works really, really well (too well sometimes) and sound is on the level of white noise. TV gets several popular US & PR channels. Iron & ironing board. In-room safe with self-program code and lots of room inside. Plenty of mirrors and lights around them to see what you're doing. Like most hotels, you can probably hear through the walls if you really try (like say putting your ear up to it), but just sitting in the room we heard nothing on either side of us. One big problem we had was being right outside the elevator and several exuberant guests seemed to think nothing of shouting down halls and slamming doors at all hours. No matter where you are, please remember if you're in the hallway everyone can hear you. Food - Pool & beach bars offered some great lunch type food which ranged from the native (Puerto Rican specialties) to the ordinary (Burgers & Pizza). All were very good with no lingering effects. La Terraza was also very good. Room service at breakfast was prompt, accurate and the food was delcious. We did not try the other restaurants at the hotel since there were so many other options on Isle Verde and Old San Juan. One night we ate at Metropol with mixed results. My pork was way too fatty, but her beef dish was very good. Our best food experience was at Dragonfly in Old San Juan. Simply to die for. Slightly larger than Tapas style portions designed to mix and share. Get the mongolian beef, it's sublime! Parrot Club was great too. El San Juan hotel next door has several restaurants of which we tried two. The Italian one (next to Palms) was excellent. The Mexican one... wasn't. But I digress, back to the hotel. Casino/Lobby Bar - Casino is a decent size, never really too crowded. The one and only $5 min Blackjack table fills up quickly at night with the $10 min table right behind it. Minimums don't change with the time of day. There is a dress code after 6, somewhat enforced. Slots range from 1 cent to $25, most are 5 cents. One Roulette wheel, a couple craps tables (usually only 1 going), a few poker tables and some other misc tables (let it ride, caribbean stud, etc.). Drink service at at the casino was spotty. My advice is have a back up plan for entertainment because the house seemed to have some uncanny streaks of good luck. The lobby bar seemed quite nice to lightly mix and mingle or listen to some music, but to "see and be seen" the place to go seemed to be next door at El San Juan. Spa - I had a Swedish massage, 55 min for $85 plus gratuity. Nice clean facilities and the staff are very friendly. As for the massage, I've had better and I've had worse. Sorry I can't be of more help than that. Service - Exceptional. Upgraded at check in. Housekeeping did a great job throughout the stay (1 day it could have been a little quicker). The lobby was always full of hotel personnel ready to answer any questions. There was an "Instant Service" button on the room phone which immediately connected to someone who greated us by name and addressed any issues we had immediately, then followed up to ensure we were satisfied. Tour desk people were extremely helpful and the tour guides we had were simply the best. The service at this hotel was among the best of any we've stayed at in the Caribbean. No surprises at check out either. Misc Stuff - You can do as little or as much as you like at this hotel and in Puerto Rico in general. We took the rainforest tour with Castillo Tours, ask for Conzavos (a.k.a. Papa Lion), the 2nd best tour guide in Puerto Rico (he'll explain why). We also did the Old San Juan & Bacardi Rum tour with Antonio who went above and beyond to help us. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expactations, too”
Reviews.Author: Globo4368
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in its previous lives, Americana, Sands, etc. and there was always something not right. This time everything was perfect, from the staff to the facilities. The WiFI worked wonderfully in the rooms and the lobby, and it was free. As I was there on business, I was very pleased with that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Start”
Reviews.Author: spotman1314
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at the intercontinental for a few days before going on a cruise. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The pool and beach areas were above average although very crowded (School vacation week). My one issue was the service staff. Although they always smiled they seemed to have a difficult time getting things done and done right. For example every day we were there they would run out of complimentary coffee in the cafe and could never seem to get anyone to refill them. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous trip and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: jkap
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Intercontinental in San Juan abd I highly recommend this hotel. It's one of the nicest we've ever stayed at. However, I want to emphasize the benefit of staying on the ocean front side. We stayed on both (ocean and city) and found the experiences to be like night and day! Facing the ocean you feel like you are on a Caribbean island. You have a beautiful view (the higher the better) of the ocean and pool. It's great having the sliding glass doors open and getting the ocean sound and breeze. Across the hall, you feel like you are at an airport hotel. It is loud from the airport and city noises and you don't want the curtains open. The pool was terriffic with waterfalls and a swim up bar. The beach was very nice. The staff was exceptionally pleasant; from the pool attendants to the waiters and especially the front desk staff. The Japanesse restaurant was one of the best we've ever dined at. Much better than the one at the El San Juan. The food at the pool was great, but huge portions. We learned to order 2 meals for 4 people. The restaurant on the beach is nice, but allow plenty of time to wait. They have a small pizza oven and many orders. The Ranch restaurant at the El San Juan was fun for kids and had great atmosphere. Renting a car was easy - right in the hotel. Maria and Hector (Avis desk) were very helpful. Loved the Rain Forest. Had a great Italian meal in Old San Juan at Sophia's. The nice part about staying at the Intercontinental is that you are in they City and can access other restaurants and sight seeing, but you don't have to leave the hotel to experience a great, relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & pool, but rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The very goods for our experience here last week; concierge, almost all of the staff was very attentive, welcoming, and friendly; pool is very nice, beach is expansive and great for walking; we ate at the less expensive places at the hotel and found the food to be pretty good overall; there are also a couple of local places nearby particularly for breakfast and the next door hotel offers rooftop dining with a great view. The issue with the hotel revolved around the rooms for us; the room was large enough but we had noise issues with rooftop ventilation from outside and random noises throughout the night that sounded like someone dragging their chair across the floor. Also, door and bathroom sink were chipped/dreary. For the rate we paid for the room these things are really not acceptable. When I called the front desk to ask around a different room assignment because of the roof ventilation noise, they said they would send an "engineer" up to check out the noise but we waited for a while and no one showed up or followed up at all. Seems like they probably get lots of complaints about the rooms and don't take them too seriously. Overall, the positive staff attitude and pool area really made this a very good vacation for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: twoplustwo
Reviews.Content: My family of four (two daughters, ages 9 and 13) just stayed at the InterContinental from Feb. 18-25, and had a wonderful time. Some info/impressions, in no particular order: -- Great pool. Really great pool. Waterfalls, a little footbridge to swim under, beautifully landscaped, great upkeep. --The lounges around the pool go early. I got out there by 8 to secure 3 in the shade. But.... --The chaises by the beach (which the staff will set up for you) seem to be available all day. I've heard that you have to get there early-ish for an umbrella, though. --The beach is really nice -- nice for long walks, really good for sand castle building. The water was warmer than the pool! Some seaweed, but there was only one day when it was TOO much seaweed. Soft sand; no water shoes needed. --On the beach, walk to the right (toward the El San Juan) for boating activities. My kids and husband went parasailing (they were each harnessed in with him, so he went up twice) and that was a definite highlight of the week for them. Costs about $60 each. The banana boat ride was more.....um....exciting than we thought it would be, judging from how it looks from the shore. Don't bring your glasses or camera, because you WILL be tossed off the boat at some point. You'll either think that's fun, or not. One of my daughters loved it; the other sobbed. --Unbelievably great, friendly service. Without exception. The concierge service is particularly wonderful, particularly Nestor. --One complaint: The walls of the room are thin. This is no problem unless you have really loud neighbors. There was only one point during the week when we were bothered, when our neighbor started blasting loud rap at 5:30 a.m. I called downstairs, and security came right up and knocked on their door (and knocked and knocked, until they finally turned off the music....but then we could hear what the music was drowning out: "Oh baby.....OH BABY BABY! OH OH OH!"). --We had a "garden/pool view" room, which was facing the ocean...in fact, we could see the ocean just fine! All this means is that it's on a lower floor (we were on 6). So I wouldn't pay extra for ocean view, unless you spend lots of time on the balcony. (The balconies are small -- just one chair and a small table.) -- Food: We had two TERRIFIC meals at Ruth Chris's steakhouse, and a really nice meal at Passagio, the italian place. (That has a dress code: no flip flops or shorts.) Nice breakfast each day at the buffet. Dinner one night at the restaurant down on the beach (Ciao Mediterranean--get the pizza!). -- We had dinner one night at Metropol, which is within walking distance, and has nice authentic local food. Fun place. Had dinner one night at Tequila Grill, which is on the 10th floor of El San Juan (rude hostess--that's the only rudeness I encountered all week). Great view, okay Mexican food. There's also a place called The Ranch on that floor. Both casual. --El Morro is a wonderful trip. --Old San Juan: I had a great time wandering around on my own. If you're not going to do a tour, have the cabbie drop you at El Convento hotel, wander up and down that hill (has outlet stores, if you're into that, but also nice historical things: San Juan Cathedral, San Juan Gate one block west (? toward the water)), then walk down to San Francisco or the street directly after that (LaFortenza, or something) and turn left for some nice local shops. Got some very nice stuff at Puerto Rico Arts and Crafts, which is on LaFortenza (or whatever). I ran into a funeral procession, complete with singing and drums, and masked dancers. An amazing sight. --The casino's nothing special, if you're into that. We're not, so didn't matter. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel -- we'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Travelchicks Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelChicks05
Reviews.Content: Two girlfriends and I stayed at the Intercontinental San Juan the first week in February. We travel often, have visited many Caribbean islands, and truly enjoyed our experience. The Intercontinental is an excellent choice, location is great, facilities are very good, and the staff and service is high quality. We really enjoyed the pool area. A big plus are the very cushy and comfortable beach loungers, of "Ritz" quality, and the unlimited spa-thick beach towels. We never had a problem finding three chairs together, and the staff comes around on a regular basis to take food and drink orders. Excellent pool experience all around. The food at the beach/pool restaurant is very good, and we ate lunch there often. Drinks were also great, and prices were what any regular traveler would assume to spend. The IC is very close to the airport so you will hear loud plane noise occasionally, (not at night). It was actually great being so close, as we gained almost two extra vacation days since it only takes 5 minutes to get to the airport. Old San Juan is also very close, about 15 minutes by cab (note, it's almost an HOUR by bus! Avoid the bus unless you want to experience a cramped, bumpy ride. True, it only costs 75 cents, but I would never do it again). The old town is very quaint and has many scenic vistas. I loved taking in the Spanish influenced architecture, walking the hilly streets, and taking photos. Traveling with two other women, we also felt very safe. I went into Old San Juan one day by myself and I was perfectly fine. The town is very small and walkable. While in Old San Juan, the El Convento Hotel is a nice place for a Tapas lunch. We also highly recommend the restaurant Baru, located on St. Sebastian Street, for dinner. Nestor, the concierge at IC, is very helpful and recommended Baru. It's worth the trip. We considered staying at The Ritz, but were happy with our decision on the IC. The IC is in a slightly better location, less "stuffy", and has a bit more going on. Right next door is the El San Juan Hotel (with the big "ESJ" on the side), which offers more night life and action than the IC, but the entire lobby/restaurant/first floor mall area is enclosed with no windows, and reeks of smoke. It reminded me of a bad Las Vegas resort. The IC had live music every night at the small lobby bar, and sometimes another band inside the casino. The rooms are nicely appointed, kept very clean, and everything was quite new and modern. The only issue I had was with the noise level; I am a very light sleeper, and my room had an adjoining door that was not sound-proofed. The next room had a crying baby. After one bad night, the hotel was very accommodating and moved me to another room. We would definitely visit San Juan again, and stay at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, for half the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Intercontinental San Juan. I have never felt the need to write anything but a positive review for hotels. Don't get me wrong. This is a nice hotel and the doormen are very friendly. However we have traveled quite a bit in the Carribean and for the price I would not stay at the IC again. The front desk are almost rude as well as some of the other staff. For $200-$300 a night this would be a great hotel but it is definately NOT a four star resort. The rooms are small and noisy and the sad part is that management at the hotel seemed to be bothered when issues were brought up. For $439 a night plus tax and a $48 hotel service charge we expected much more. A lesson learned I guess.

Reviews.Title: “3 star Hotel, tiny rooms, tiny bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: booyakid
Reviews.Content: wow. The BAD: I paid $400 a night and this room was tiny. The bathroom is cruise ship small. The layout of the hotel is confusing. The food is crazy expensive/bad. The service is ok. The gym is ok. The Good: Wonderful, shaded pool. If you want sun go to the beach. Nice sand, warm water. Casino was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: umich3
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Wyndham El San Juan Hotel and Casino for over ten years we decided to try the Intercontinental next door. We had an ocean front room with a king size bed. The room itself was narrow and quite smallas was the bathroom. The balcony had room for only one chair and a small table. There were two connecting doors on either side of the room, allowing us to hear every word our neighbors were saying. We spoke with the manager and were told every room was the same size. I found the service to be fantastic everywhere in this hotel. Unfortunately I would not stay here again because of the room size. When paying top dollar for an ocean front room there are other hotels offerring more for the money. Next try will be the Westin, where the rooms appear to be much larger.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love the InterContinental, had to settle for the Holiday Inn instead”
Reviews.Author: Jannaqq
Reviews.Content: I selected the IC based on a good bit of research, including reviews at TripAdvisor. We made our reservation back in October for our Feb 3 stay....but sadly, did not get a chance to stay there. IC called me 3 days prior to arrival to let me know that they could not honor my reservation because a 'large group' was staying there. While this was never quite explained to me, the IC was kind enough to 1) give me advance notice 2) book us into the their sister hotel (Holiday Inn San Juan) and 3) comp our first night's stay there. So, while I was disappointed with the change (there is no reasonable way to compensate for switching to a 2-star hotel 2 blocks off the beach from a 4-star hotel on the beach), the IC did work with me to make it as right. We had a smooth check-in at the Holiday Inn SJ, a great room, and use of the IC grounds as though we were guests. All detailed in a letter sent to me by the IC's revenue manager (maybe that explains it?).

Reviews.Title: “Spendid experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3 nights stay - great experience. Nestor (concierge) and Irene Perez (hostess) very helpful and professional. Service workers throughout friendly, helpful. 2 good theme restaurants for steak and Asian cross-over. (Didn't try the Italian spot b/c the Italian restaurant next store in the El San Juan is probably the best food in PR). Recommend Metropole (3 blocks) for authentic PR food and Parrot Club in Old SJ for same. Walked the streets, took local busses -- interesting and safe. Good market across the street for in-room fridge supplies. Beach and pool outstanding. If you don't like this experience, either stay home or be prepared to pay 2 - 3 times for some chic place in Hawaii. (Also drove to Rincon - spectacularly beautiful shore-line, surf and the real deal for surfers.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but bad service/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: rinaldino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental from 01/27/06 until 02/03/06. In short: a very good location but a very low average level of the hotel's guests, no controls and no appropriate interventions from hotel's officers and a very bad service/price ratio. A few examples. At the swimming pool, pool attendants, except those who hand over the towels but don't make anything else (I have unsuccessfully asked to be helped on with the placing of an umbrella ),are nonexistent; still at the pool, where chairs are extremely close each other, one day ny four neighbours had lunch with cans and foods picked up at a nearby supermarket, thus disseminating all around stinks and garbage, but evidently the hotel management allows it; inside there is one bar only, unbelievably noisy due to the music always kept at full volume,but with no alternatives; the waitresses of the bar are very "uncultured" and one of them didn't know the existence of something called "sherry"; many of the hotel's guests wear baseball caps and Stetson in the evening even in the bar and the restaurants and have a behaviour which would be very indulgent to define as coarse; the hotel's shop has only a couple of local and of American newspapers, and that's all;etc. Obviously my complaints would be of little importance, if any, should I refer to a third class hotel, but I am talking about an Intercontinental with room rates justifiable only for a high class hotel. In conclusion, the excellent location of the Intercontinental in Portorico, just on the beach and very close to the airport, is surely a positive aspect but absolutely insufficient to compensate all the negative ones ( and I have mentioned only a few of them ).

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: ruben900
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights in late January 2006 here. We go to San Juan 2-3 times per year and usually stay at the Marriott Resort in the Condado. We wanted to try the Isla Verde area for something different this trip. So, much of this review will be comparing this resort to the Marriott. First off, if you are new to Puerto Rico, you have to understand that an "upscale" hotel there will not be as nice as what you'll find in the States. They are made of concrete, so there's more noise. The furnishings are not as nice. Rooms are often musty due to being seaside. The staff is on an "island" schedule, so you have to be patient. Second, I have to commend the professionalism of the staff at the Intercontinental....better than any other place we've stayed. In a nutshell, this hotel would be good if it were less expensive. It is in many respects very similar to the Marriott Condado, just more pricey. The rooms are similar, but noisier (doors slam more loudly and the airplanes fly much closer to it with the airport nearby). The rooms were like an Omni, a Courtyard or Marriott in the States....not elegant by any stretch. The casino is okay, but no better than Marriott's and not as nice as the El San Juan nearby or El Convento in Old San Juan. The neighborhood is certainly not one where you want to walk after dark. There are grocery stores and fast food places nearby for during the daytime. No boutiques, cafes or nicer souvenir places like in the Condado. The gym is so-so, as most are down there. The pool area can't compare with Marriott's or with others I've seen. The stretch of beach it's on was quite dirty, partly due to wintertime when winds stir up more seaweed. However, it was nice to be able to jog on the beach for 1.5 or 2 miles thru Isla Verde....in front of all the hotels, etc. Fun to "people watch" there, too. Stay here if you can get a good deal on it, but not if it's more than $200 per night on-season.

Reviews.Title: “Management failed us”
Reviews.Author: RedRyderMyrtleBeach
Reviews.Content: We flew in to San Juan a day early for our Cruise and stayed one night at "The Intercontinental". We paid $300 for a city view. Not a very nice view, we looked out on dirty hotels and fast food restaurants. Pool area is nice and beach is nice, but be aware beer is $6 a bottle. Bellman was nice helping us with bags and info. Main problem we had with hotel was that a week after we stayed there, we get off cruise @ 8:30am and flight didn't leave until 5:20pm, we go to airport and try to get flight moved up and we can't and they wouldn't let us check in until after 1pm and there's not even a place to sit at airport, the only place we had to turn was "The Intercontinental" where we had stayed 1 night the week before, so we take a taxi and asked the management if we could just store our luggage and get an armband to be able to use the pool area and use a towel, and their reply was because they were full they couldn't let us. There was only my wife and myself, and we were talking only a few hrs, people were checking out and for those checking in, that time is 4pm, they turned us away. They could have done the right thing and maybe had a repeat customer but next time we'll go next door to the "El San Juan", and we'll get an ocean view. If you're looking for a party you won't find it at "The Intercontinental" It was dead the Fri. night we were there, but had a blast next door at "The El San Juan".

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got back from from PR last week and had an awesome time! We stayed at the Intercontinental and hit the beach and local restaurants. We loved having the best of both worlds - we had the beach on one side and the city on the other. The IC has clean rooms, a friendly staff, and a beautiful pool and beach area.The concierge was very helpful in directing us to outside restaurants and sightseeing. The rest of the staff was very accomodating to any other requests we had. The IC is expensive but you get what you pay for. It is next door the the Wydnam Casino which is known for the night life. It is also local to a lot of restaurants. The staff at the IC was great for recommending restaurants in the area. The cuisine at the IC was expensive as to be expected at any resort, but there were so many places to go to eat that were right outside the resort - literally a 2 minute walk. Anyway, my husband said that this is where he wants to go again next year. Although the IC was expensive, I think it was worth it. We had lunch at the resort only because it was convenient to the beach, but we saved $$ on breakfast and dinner by taking a walk off the resort. The IC wasn't overcrowded and the staff was very friendly and the rooms were great. Oh yeah - it's a 5 minute taxi ride from the airport and a 10-minute taxi ride to historic Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Swim Up BAR!”
Reviews.Author: SweetRoadTrip
Reviews.Content: POSTIVES-Isla Verde is a great location. The Intercontinental had a great beach and pool area and the staff was very friendly and a SWIM UP BAR NEGATIVES--Casino is dumpy, Restaurants expensive. The area- the hotel is right next door to the El San Juan with its gorgeous lobby bar and great "scene." Across the street from the Intercontinental is a little strip mall with a tiny supermarket where we picked up bottle water and room necessities. There is also a bunch of fast food places and a small diner which has very good Mofongo (if you are in PR you must try it). Its only a short walk to the Water Club Hotel with its cool roof top bar and great tapas-like restaurant Tangerine.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: commscholar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with great service. The beach and pool area are beautiful. Restaurants and bars expensive. However, there's a grocery store and lots of reasonable restaurants literally right accross the street. They sent us a free bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries to our room. We still don't know why. My one complaint is that the king bed rooms were really tiny. We were in a two-double bed room the first night, which was spacious and nice, but we wanted a king bed after that. The king room was not that nice and really small. I thought the veiws were nice from the cityview rooms as well as the others. I don't think it's worth paying for the supposedly better view, unless you're getting the top floor oceanview rooms. All balconies are small, only fit one small chair. The staff was so helpful they were really wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms. Amazing service. Lovely beach. A tad expensive.”
Reviews.Author: code7700
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the InterContinental San Juan Resort & Casino was perfect in every way. From the second we arrived, we were treated like royalty. The entire staff (valet parking drivers, doormen, bellman, and even housekeeping) were unbelievably friendly and helpful. Speaking of valet parking, if you do rent a car (and I suggest you do), I highly suggest you "invest" in valet parking (unless you plan on checking in to the hotel and not leaving). At $20 per night it is only $6 more than the ($14) self-parking and about 10 times more convenient. Especially when it is raining. The self-parking is not only across the (busy) street, but getting out of the self-parking lot was reported to be total chaos. Two people we spoke with said they moved their car to valet parking because each time they wanted to use their car, it was a 25-minute process of getting to their car, followed by sitting in exit line (to pay the cashier). With valet parking, you can call down from your room and your car will be waiting for you by the time you step off the elevator. Unlike the self-parking lot, the hotel was anything but chaos. It was well run and the entire week we were there, I swear that I did not open a single door or push a single elevator button (other than on my actual hotel room floor). There were bellmen, hotel security, and guest service people (most dressed in suits) everywhere. Not "everywhere" in a bad way, but in the "if you ever need anything, someone will be right there" sort of way. I've stayed at some very nice hotels before and while the InterContinental isn't exactly a Ritz-Carlton, you wouldn't have known because the level of service was excellent. Anyhow, when we checked in, I was told that there were no non-smoking rooms available in the class of room we booked ("City View Room") and that the hotel staff had automatically upgraded us to an "Ocean View Room", the next class up. Normally, when I'm told, "We don't have any non-smoking rooms", I have to ask for an upgrade, but the InterContinental staff didn't even give me the chance to ask, they fixed the problem before I arrived. While the rooms were not the largest I'd ever seen at an InterContinental, they were very nice. Everything looked new and was in good condition. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. We spent very little time in the room (which is why I had originally booked the slightly less expensive "City View Room"), though I must admit that the view of the ocean was a nice perk. Would I have paid the extra $50 to $100 per night for this view? Probably not. The grounds of the hotel were fabulous. The pool area was great, food and drinks were always available, and we met some cool people. The beach itself is on public property (just a few steps beyond the pool area), but you would have thought it was a private beach based on the level of service (food, drinks, chairs, towels, etc.) When you pick up your pool (beach) towel, you're given an arm band (so they can identify you as a hotel guest). All you need to do is show the "beach chair guy" your arm band and he'll bring a pool (beach) chair to any part of the beach you want. Usually standing next to the "chair guy" is the "security guy", his job twofold: (1) Make sure that non-guests don't get on hotel property and (2) ensure that hotel guests aren't bothered by vendors on the beach. Some others on TripAdvisor site have said beach vendors were a major problem, but the entire week we were there, we only saw about 5 people trying to sell things, and each time the "security guy" made sure they weren't bothering guests. Truth be told, 3 of the 5 vendors simply set up a little kiosks, and didn't bother anyone. The other two were kindly redirected to other parts of the beach by the hotel staff. Just because it is a public beach doesn't mean you can annoy people, right? The beach itself was nice. The water was warm and the sand was soft. If there was any complaint I had, it was the huge amounts of seaweed, both on the shore and in the surf. Some days the seaweed was heavy, other days it was nonexistent. You really can't blame the hotel for this; it was Mother Nature. But the beach (seaweed and trash) was thoroughly cleaned every morning (which explained the numerous tire tracks on the beach). Speaking of stuff on the beach, there was a little restaurant and bar (Ciao Mediterranean CafÃ©) that sat on the edge of the hotel property (so both people at the pool and beach could get food and drinks). The food quality was reasonable (remember, this is bar food) but a little on the expensive side considering the very small portions. Other than the occasional drink or snack from beach cafÃ©, we did not really dine at the hotel. For one, the prices were quite high (a simple breakfast for two, with coffee and orange juice was over $30). And more importantly, there were so many good restaurants in the area that we had to go out and sample the local flavor. As far as I'm concerned, hotel food is hotel food, no matter how you look at it. So we chose to dine out. This is where a car becomes quite important. With a car, Old San Juan is only 15 minutes away. A small price to pay for the charm (and food) found there. Here are a few of the places we liked in and around the area: * Ambrosia Restaurant, 250 Calle Cristo, San Juan, PR 00901. * Chef Pillai Tantra, 356 Calle Fortaleza, San Juan, PR 00901 * Che's, 35 Calle Caoba, San Juan, PR 00913 (5-minutes from InterContinental). * La Terraza, Marginal C-1, Dorado, PR 00646 (Not to be confused with the InterContinental lobby restaurant of the same name). * Mojito's, 323 Recinto Sur, San Juan, PR 00901 While we did spend much of our time relaxing at the hotel's beach and pool, we used the car at least twice a day for sightseeing, finding cool places for lunch or dinner, and rum runs to the grocery store. We frequented the hotel bar numerous times (live music, people watching, etc.) it did get expensive. For the cost of 2 drinks in the hotel bar, you can buy a 1-liter bottle of rum and a 2-liter bottle of Coke. The supermarket (Supermercados Grande) is less than 1-mile from the hotel. While some of the supermarket staff didn't speak English (thought most people in Puerto Rico do), about 90% of the products do. Having had to grocery shop in foreign counties (like Korea), it is always nice to be able to recognize what your buying. Ditto with the nearby Walgreens, which carried a multitude of sunscreen and bug spray (both of which you'll need). In the end, we very much enjoyed the InterContinental. Truth be told, between Old San Juan and the area near the InterContinental (Isla Verde), you've got everything you need for a good vacation. We did manage to explore other parts of the island (Arecibo, the Bacardi distillery, Dorado, Ponce, and some other areas) but did not find them as interesting. However, it was nice to explore the island and see the people, places, and things that made up the rest of Puerto Rico. If I had anything to grumble about, it would be the relatively high cost of the hotel room (and even higher costs of the food there [which we ate little of]). I would not say it was astronomical, just expensive. And while there is no sales tax in Puerto Rico, there is a 10% hotel tax (20% if it is a resort, like the InterContinental). So for every $1,000 you spend, you'll have to cough up an extra $200 in taxes. Ouch. Add to that $20 a day for valet parking and $10 per drink, and it can start adding up. However, we did have a great time on our trip, and the quality of the InterContinental contributed greatly to our level of comfort and satisfaction. In the end, if given the chance to repeat my stay, I would definitely do so.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My darling husband and I have been looking forward to our 30th wedding anniversary and celebrating with a special trip just to relax in the sun because the anniversary is on January 10th. After much research and looking at all possibilities I decided on the Intercontinental Hotel in San Juan. Hawaii was too expensive for us this year and we were not interested in a long flight. Darling husband was not into a cruise, it's been a busy year and we both just wanted to veg. The Intercontinental is everything we expected and more. The property is beautiful and kept meticulously clean. The pool area is as wonderful as everyone else has been saying on this site and I lived out there all week. The beach is ok but there were little "noseeums" biting me out there so I was very happy to enjoy the pool area. Also, the water had a lot of seaweed washing up. Husband was happy as long as his drink was cold! We stayed the entire week on priority club points and they upgraded our room after the first night and the view was amazing. We felt like we were sitting in the top of the palm trees with a view of the ocean. I went shopping in Old San Juan and really enjoyed browsing there. The Coach and Dooney and Burke outlets have great prices. Ruth's Chris was excellent as always and we went twice, Passiagio's was ok - mediocre - we went twice also. The ElSanJuan next door is incredible and we had dinner at The Palm for our anniversary and were treated very special. The "club" concierge had Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in our room when we arrived as a surprise because it was our anniversary. This hotel has fabulous service, couldn't be nicer or more helpful. We have traveled a lot and stayed at Ritz Carlton and many Marriott Renaissance Hotels but this was probably the best service even than the cruise ships. The staff at this hotel will help you with anything and do it with a smile, they are always asking if everything is ok. We won a few dollars in the casino although it's annoying how long it takes to get paid when you win. My only criticism of this hotel is that they need to upgrade the bed linens and the beds. We slept fine but after the Ritz Carlton and Marriott Renaissance and even Crowne Plaza, I expected the linens to be a little nicer but this is a small complaint, our room was great. We will definitely go again to this property and if you go please give Frances at the Splash Pool Bar a big hello for us!! (great poolside food)

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental made my dream come true”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I always dreamed of taking my family on a dream vacation to the land of my parents birth. The Intercontinental was the host for my quest.The service was impecable and they made us all feel safe and secure.I have never had the opportunity to be waited over from the minute we arrived to the day we left.I was really sad to leave and when I returned home I was already checking for availability to return.I anxiously await, as does my family, my return to Puerto Rico and a stay at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Isla Verde !”
Reviews.Author: FunSeekinRican
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Intercontinental (1/4 - 1/10). I was curious as to what my trip was going to be like since me & my bf were so young (we are 20) but we had a fantastic time! For young people isla verde is a great place to go to relax, chill by the beach and pool, and have fun. The drinking age in PR is 18 and alcohol is in no short supply although it can be expensive through the hotel. The Good It's a beautiful hotel with nice green plant life and a nice lobby & outside. immediately getting out of the cab we were greeted and helped by the staff outside and it was like that the whole vacation. The hotel staff was amazing in service and hospitality. They always held the door when we were walking in and out of the hotel and always greeted us and chatted with us when we saw them around the hotel. The pool was very nice and large. It has two small waterfalls and a lil cove in the middle of the two that you can sit in. Theres a swim up bar and a nice sized hot tub that was great to relax in. Security was pretty tight with the pool. You have to get a new colored wrist band everyday to get towels and complimentary water bottles. I guess because we were young we got checked a lot by security to make sure we were guests but it wasnt that bad. They dont want anyone sneaking into the pool. I also got ID'ed a few times at the casino and they are strict with not allowing any kids in there. Theres also shady canopies and umbrellas if ur not a big fan of the sun. there was no short supply of pool chairs. The beach was enjoyable and the hotel provided each guest with chairs brought to the location of your choice. The rooms were medium sized but cozy. At night in the lounge they have singers that sing different spanish music and some people get up and dance making a really nice atmosphere. the food in momoyama was awesome. the hot tub was open till 10pm for a nice late nite dip. There is a game room with a few decent games for the kiddies. The beach was amazing at sunset and at night. The water was warm and the sand was white & nice. Overall the stay was great and the food was good! The Bad The maids were not the best. The pool was beautiful - but FREEZING. everyone had trouble getting in it. I'm usually a big pool person but I couldn't bring myself to go in more than one time. The beach was warmer than the pool. The beach was nice, one of the nicest in the metro area but during christmas time the ocean cleans itself which means loads and loads of sea weed. The beach was covered with sea weed making it really hard to jump in. Once you got past a certain point it wasn't as bad but it was pretty gross. However, it does go away (the sea weed was completely gone on our last day). We asked the staff to recommend better beaches and we got a bunch of great beaches to visit. The one we went to was escambrones (its on the map given at the hotel). It was gorgeous and the water was clear & you could walk out 15 ft and still stand. I'd definitely reccomend it. The airport was also annoying and you heard every airplane that landed but you heard it practically everywhere on isla verde practically. The gift shop in the hotel was very overpriced & the tour desk was very sloppy. I reserved the biobay with castillo tours before I got there and when i confirmed they had no idea what I was talking about. I'd recommend going through Nestor at the concierge. Also the biobay tour we went on was in the van of some guy named Ishmael and it was horrible. I think tours through actual companys are better but i dont know who or why castillo tours put us with this guy. Avoid Ishmael. Last but not least do NOT rely on cabs. The taxi situation is ridiculous there. Its 20 USD one way to go into old san juan. We had no car which made it difficult to go out at times. The better clubs and food was in old san juan but we couldnt enjoy it as much because it was so pricey to get there. There is a bus thats only 75 cents but it took really long and I didn't feel that comfortable. If you speak spanish and dont mind locals the bus might be a good solution. The area around the hotel isnt the greatest but I wouldn't call it seedy. Take the bus and your definition of seedy might change. im from a city so I felt fine walking along the street but I wouldnt stray too far from the hotel. Food I thought the restaurants in the hotel were over priced so we went out searching for cheaper, local food. We ate a lot at Mi Casita in the shopping center across the street. They have good mofongos if ur into that. the food was good but the service was bad. We also ate at Metropol down the street. they had the best vanilla flan I have tasted in a long time. Once again the service wasnt great but food was very good. Across the street from Metropol is the isla verde mall that has a dennys if you want a cheap breakfast rather than the expensive breakfast in the hotel. There is a Walgreens if you walk in the san juan direction along with Burger King, Wendys, Churchs, Pizza Hut, Dominos, Subway & other little restaurants. In San Juan we loved Barra China. the service & food were great (their pina coladas were amazing). We ate at Ostra Cosa as well but we didnt enjoy it. If you are walking and you see a guy pushing a cart get some coco or another flavor. its only a dollar and they are very yummy. If you ask the hotel staff they will recommend good food for whatever you are looking for. There are definitely ways to eat good food for less if you are on a budget and know what you are doing. Overall for the price i thought Isla verde & the Intercontinental were great. its not a 5 star hotel but then again you arent really paying 5 star prices. if you want that pay a lot more and go to el san juan hotel. We had a great time and cant wait to go back! You will have an amazing time if you go knowing what you are in for. enjoy! Buen Viaje!

Reviews.Title: “Solid if not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: johnpw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two children (12 & 15) Dec 25-31. I was a little concerned about what I would find based on some of the previous reviews, but overall ended up quite satisfied. We had an ocean side "deluxe" room (#710), which had a great view and was relatively quiet (didn't hear our neighbors plus we made sure to get a room away from the elevators). In terms of the room, this is NOT a 5-star hotel - it's a solid 3.5 in my book, but I came in with this expectation and was not disappointed. Beds were fine, basic amenities fine, bathroom small but functional. If you're looking for a 4 or 5-star type experience, you'd have to look elsewhere (Ritz or El San Juan?). Otherwise, the pool area is really nice, the lobby is good, and the staff are friendly and helpful. We've gone to Florida the last 3 Christmases and got fed up with the spotty weather. So we decided to pay the extra price for better weather and were glad we did. Otherwise, in terms of room, beach and pool, this is not much different from the place we last stayed at in Boca Raton (I can't remember the name!) and the clientele is very similar. The beach is nice but not spectacular, but perhaps I'm a bit of a beach snob, having been to some of the best in the Carribean. For GREAT beaches in Puerto Rico, you have to take a short boat trip to one of the islands (Icacos or Culebra) off the East coast. In fact, I would highly recommend the East Wind catamaran sailing & snorkeling trip, although there aren't many comfortable or shaded seats on board, so be prepared to rough it a little and bring lots of sun protection. I grew up in cities and some rough areas, so had no problems wandering around at night, but the fact of the matter is that - outside the nice resorts - the Isla Verda area (and greater San Juan as far as I could tell) is very run-down and seedy. I knew this coming in and it didn't bother me, but for those of you who like to wander around discovering charming little shops and restaurants, you'll be disappointed! Perhaps Old San Juan is better for this, but my wife came away unimpressed from her half-day trip there (I didn't go). I would consider going back because: 1) the trip in and out is so easy, 2) the hotel, pool & beach are pretty nice, 3) the weather is better than Florida, and 4) some great beaches and snorkeling are an easy day-trip away.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: tmsweet772
Reviews.Content: Things I loved: pool, lobby, nice and attractive staff, beach, atmosphere Things I didn't like: Small gift shop, breakfast If you are looking for a hotel that has a beautiful lobby, gorgeous pool(s) and breathtaking beach this is the hotel for you. This hotel was a breath of fresh air for my friend and I. There were no screaming children, the staff was very attentive, and the overall atmosphere was laid back. I really liked that there wasn't pool games going on where the pool staff yells at you to participate. The room was nice and accomodating no complaints. Though we did complain a few times about the TV not working. The location wasn't bad. There was a gorcery store down the street, along with a Subway and a few other American fast food places. I wasn't too thrilled with breakfast at the hotel. There was only one restaurant that served it and it wasn't too good. Can't comment of Casino. I don't gamble.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: Dalew
Reviews.Content: Best beach near the City. Great Ocean view rooms--way better than Ritz or Wyndham nearby. Nice staff inside and outside. Pace is slow, like everywhere in PR. Leave your Impatience at home! Local Dance presentation outdoor Sunday Brunch by the pool at 1pm--a must see Casino on site is nice--others nearby. Weekends are very lively--weekdays more mellow

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, bad room”
Reviews.Author: KimbaKiara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inter-Continental San Juan Resort for two nights in mid-December 2005. The hotel is located right on the beach (public beach) in Isla Verde near the airport. The gardens at the front and back of the hotel were very nice. The main lobby was also quite nice, with live music in the evenings. Swimming pool in the back is large. The staff was superb, from the front desk to the hotel security to the tour coordinator. Friendly, polite, and efficient. The rooms however are really showing their age and require renovations (someone posted in their review that the hotel was recently renovated... I think that only meant the main lobby... or perhaps renovation has yet to be carried out for the floor we stayed on !?). Sound insulation was very poor. Walking in the hallway, I can hear kids talking in the rooms. When in our room at night, I can clearly hear the TV in the next room. The airplanes were also very loud, but that's what you get for staying close to the airport. We also found two small cockroaches in our room... There aren't a lot to see around the hotel, although there are a few restaurants and a supermarket across the street. If we paid the hotel advertised $200US/night rate, I would've been quite disappointed with our stay. However we got a deal at $100 US/night which made the stay more worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “ice cold pool”
Reviews.Author: ma2181
Reviews.Content: I just spent about three nights here 12-7 to 12-10 and found the staff very attentive with one exception. while at the pool area i was never approached by any of the waitress' to see whether i wanted something to drink. at one point a lady next to me was asked if she wanted something from the bar and the waitress did not even look my way. other than the pool waitress' everyone else was great especially the valet parking staff. i would highly recommend this hotel. room was clean and neat.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it and will probably be back...”
