Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Traveled here for a week with our 2 year old. We would recommend this resort, with a couple of minor issues. Plusses: This is by far the easiest destination in the Caribbean for travel. Non-stop flight, no customs hassles, hotel 10 minutes from airport. Within an hour of the plane landing we were hanging at the pool. For this reason we will be back again next time. Nice room-- pay up for the ocean view its worth it. Somehow we got booked on the top floor in what seemed to be an upgraded suite. We were glad to have the included breakfast package since there was a variety of good food (especially the omelette & waffle station) & they didn't charge us for our kid's food. The pool and beach are both very nice. Our child loved playing with the other toddlers in the wading area. The surrounding bars and restaurants were convenient when out in the sun. The ocean water was really warm and the waves weren't too huge. If you like to snorkle I'd recommend Caymans or Cozumel instead. The staff was very attentive. I liked having the fast food restaurants nearby...though the few hundred dollars they saved us was spent in the casino. Also contrary to some of the other reviews we found the area around the main street in front of the hotel to be fine, even at night. We live in the city & I'm far more concerned about walking around at night at home! Minuses: Room had thin walls so a few nights we were kept up by loud neighbors TVs and conversations. I'm sure they had the same complaint about our loud child early in the morning. My usual trick, turning up the fan on the thermostat to drown out noise, only works for like 10 minutes then the fan turns off. The pool is not heated and was too cold for our child to go swimming, though it seemed fine for the older kids. El San Juan casino next door was nicer & seemed to have better payouts. All in all we'd come back but I think we'll try the Ritz next time (which seems awful close to the airport...)

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with family from NYC from Nov 24th to Dec 2nd. I had read quite few reviews on the property, so I was a lttle bit unsure of what I was going into. The hotel staff, especially Juan from Avis Rent a Car and Nestor the Concierge could not have been more helpful. The overall staff were pleasant and helpful. Most times when leaving and entering the hotel, someone was always quick to hold the door open for you. The pool, beach and ocean were just delightful. There were plenty of chairs and the kids just loved the waterfalls in the pool area. Food in the hotel was OK, if you go for the breakfast package prepaid be sure that you are a big eater in order to get true value. The food at the buffet was fair at best, but you can only do so much with eggs, bagels and cereal. Ruth Chris and the resteraunts in the ESJ were outstanding. Go for the upgrade to the ocean view rooms (10th floor or higher, worth the extra $) Just a spectacular view. Mini fridge in room so stock up at one of the local stores within walking distance (day time hours only) Unsafe at night. When people talk about the surrounding area/streets as being seedy/dumpy they are right on the money. What a shame to have such beautiful beachfront hotels surrounded by such unsavory characters and trash. Let's get Trump or Wynn down here and do it right. The hotels advertise casino gaming. I guess if you've never seen Vegas or AC these pocket casino's might work. The slot machines did not pay at all in the whole time I was there, not that I was looking to hit it big, but at least give you a little tickle once in a while. If your looking to get a free drink when your on the slots, think again, because it just does not happen. I spent about $500 over a few nights on the slots, and was never offered a drink. Another reason to bring in the Donald. Side trips to Old San Juan, Rain Forest and the Caves are a must if you have the time. Don't be fooled into going over to Ponce, nothing there to speak of. Overall if you can get by the crazy drivers, seedy main drag, poverty in most area's and poor excuse for a casino and just enjoy the hotel, sun, pool and beach for what they are (very nice), you will not be sorry for staying at the Intercontinental, the folks seem to try hard at the hotel and are sincere in doing the best they can, but Puerto Rico is what it is. If you want true 4 or 5 style luxury and surroundings go to another Island.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thegyp62
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Intercontinental Hotel in San Juan. I chose this hotel partly because of the reviews on this site. Unfortuneatly, my experience at the hotel was not a very good one. My biggest problem with the property was that it is rated 5 stars, and is no way even close. I would rate it 3 stars, at best. When you book a 5 star hotel you have certain expectations. None of my expectations were met.First of all, the Intercontinental is the old Sands Hotel. In places it looks just as dated as the Sands. The rooms have been renovated and were relatively clean but not like other Intercontinental Hotels, they have no style or warmth. We had booked a Jr. Suite. When we arrived we found out at the front desk that all Jr. Suites only face the city,(which really was not a problem) and all of them are located between the elevators. It was nosy all the time, but not unbearble. The room was not at all decorated, it had the necessaities but nothing else. Housekeepping was horrible. Everyday they never left toiletries, so no matter what time we got back to our room we had to call for toiletries. After 6 days, that gets old. They never made the king size bed, they put the bedspread on top of the TV and left it there. When we checked into the room there were no bathrobes, the toliet paper holder was off the wall, so the tissue sat on the floor and the hair blower was broken. I realize this may not seem like a big deal but when you want the service of a 5 star hotel, and pay for it, it is really dissappointing when you do not receive it. Management is a joke. When I went to check out my bill indicated that I had not paid anything and that was incorrect because I had pre-paid. In addition, the nightly rate was 40.00 more per night that I was quotad and paid for. When I questioned the front desk, they told me the 40.00 extra per night was for the third person in my room. I had no idea there was a fee, my reservation was always for three people and they never mentioned it. Plus no one ever did anything for the third person. My husband and I had to make up the sofa bed every night ourselves. As far as the prepayment, he told me according to him there was no prepayment. When I asked him to try and look deeper into the reservation he told me to call my credit card company and check my charges. By the way none of his responses were given in a pleasant way. At this point I wanted to speak to the manager.I called and received someone at the front desk who claimed he was the front desk manager.I wanted the hotel manager. I was told there was no hotel manager on staff this particular night. I know that was a lie because while I was waiting for the elevator approx. 20 minutes prior, I saw the hotel manager with another guest who was furious. I will not go into that problem because I did not witness it. Anyway, I knew the hotel manager was somewhere in the hotel but I decided to respect what this person told me and proceeded to tell him the problems with my bill. He tells me that he needs to look at all the records and he will call me back.....I am still waiting to hear from him and I have been home two days already. In fairness to the hotel, the food was very good, the grounds are well kept and very pretty, and they have a good beach. Service was good and the staff, (most of them) were friendly. The only problem was that they were always nice and pleasant, they just didn't always do what you asked for. I have been to San Juan many times and I think if you really want the service of a 5 star hotel maybe you should consider the Ritz Carlton. I have not stayed there so I cannot say so for certain. However, I can say the Intercontinental is NO way a 5 Star Hotel in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rwright1127
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go there to celebrate our anniversary. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted like royalty. The concierge upgraded our room to an ocean view upon learning of the reason for our trip. He was extremely kind and friendly. Our room was nice and clean, and the view was georgeous. Complimentary beaches chairs, towels and tables were provided for us to layout on the beach. Bar service was provided at the beach, which was a nice addition. The food and the pool bar was excellent as well as the staff, who did their upmost to make our stay memorable. The lobby, pool area and surrounding areas was very nice and clean. The casino was nice as well. At night the lobby was a nice play to just take it down, enjoy a drink and music. The location was great in that you were able to walk around and eat and drink at the local spots. A huge 24 hr Walgreens Pharmacy was located down the street, which was nice if you needed any toiletries etc. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to come to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't love it ....”
Reviews.Author: Gracie99uk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the IC San Juan for a three night stay as part of the honeymoon. I have to start this review off with a brief moan about first impressions of Puerto Rico. We had quite a bit of luggage due to our wedding and being on holiday for nearly four weeks. At the airport we paid for a luggage cart (surely all airports should provide this as a matter of courtesy?!?) only to find out that we were only allowed to wheel it to the other side of security and not outside to ground transportation - fat lot of help the luggage cart turned out to be. Airport staff were also really miserable (with the exception of the slightly mad immigration officer!). Anyway moan over ... my first impressions of the IC weren't overly positive. Whilst the staff were very welcoming and friendly I felt the room was a little small (King Bed Ocean View) and the view of the ocean can only be described as laughable given that the predominant view was of the roof of the restaurant below!!!! Other reviewers are spot on when they say that the balcony is very small - ours had a small table and one chair - not ideal for honeymooners wanting to share a romantic moment! The room was smaller than other hotels we've stayed in although I did like the separate dressing table area just outside the bathroom. Bathroom light fittings were damaged and the bathroom was very small. On the plus side the bed was very comfortable! We set off to explore the rest of the hotel. The pool is nice (the water is cold!) and there are plenty of sun loungers with very comfy cushions. The only negative thing about the pool area, in my opinion, is that it gets quite shady early on in the afternoon so not good for sunbathing. We had lunch at the restaurant at the cafe at the back - standard fare (pizza and burgers) but tasty with good service. The beach is nice and IC guests also have use of sun loungers. Ocean is warmer than the pool but beware my husband was stung by a jelly fish! The staff at the hotel were able to offer assistance with this to ease the stinging!!! We used valet parking whilst we were there and the car was always available when we got outside - valets were friendly and helpful. We ate at Ruth Chris Steakhouse (twice) - delicious! We also visited Old San Juan - there's parking right at the top by El Morro in an underground lot (v.convenient) and the Barcardi Factory. I agree with a previous review that you don't actually learn much about the process of rum making and the guided tours are herded through quite quickly not giving enough time to listen (it's an audio tour) to all the information. My husband enjoyed it as he had his two free drinks as well as mine!!! One evening we wandered over to El San Juan - hotel was busy and there seemed to be a good atmosphere. Not sure I would pay the price to stay here when it's only a five minute stroll from the IC and you can still enjoy all it has to offer. All in all I'm not sure I would hurry back to Puerto Rico even though I did enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and prime location”
Reviews.Author: blossom1022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (ages 34 and 32) just returned from a 5 night stay at the InterContinental. Weâ€™ve been on many tropical vacations before (Mexico, Aruba, Jamaica, St. Marten). Our trip to P.R. was a last-minute decision. We were looking to travel to a beach destination during the Thanksgiving week that was a short flight from the N.Y. area airports. We wanted a location that had a beach, nightlife & an area we could explore independently. SUMMARY: Overall we were satisfied with our stay at the IC and I would rate it 3 out of 5 stars. ROOM: We booked and received a city-view room with a king size bed. The room was clean and functional, albeit smaller than I thought for the price and the carpet slightly worn. SERVICE: This is where the IC shines. Every employee we encountered was super friendly, attentive & eager to help. CONCIERGE and FRONT DESK: While friendly, I must note that some of the advice/suggestions given by the concierges were off the mark. For example: 2 of them recommended a trendy restaurant in Old San Juan, AquaViva. We asked for an upscale seafood restaurant. Well AquaViva is really a 2-star restaurant charging 5-star prices in my opinion. We found it to be overpriced, overhyped and overcooked (my dinner that is). The total bill was over $120 for 2, which included 2 drinks, appetizers & dinner for 2 people. Add on about $40 for the cab ride from the hotel and back, and we spent over $140. We donâ€™t mind spending the $$ but when the place looks like a diner painted blue with seashells as the dÃ©cor and we arrive dressed to impress it was disappointing, especially since the food was overcooked and the bill was about the same as we spent at some much higher-end restaurants we dined at during our stay. We did enjoy La Piccola at the El San Juan & Ruth's Chris steakhouse. We chalked it up as a â€œLost in Translationâ€� episode. What we consider upscale may differ from others since we eat out regularly at some great New York City restaurants. For those looking for restaurant suggestions in Old San Juan, I highly recommend simply taking a cab to Fortaleza street (restaurant row) and walking around yourselves and deciding. We saw more appealings choices when we went on our own strolling through Old San Juan. Also, on a number of occasions, we had difficulty speaking with the concierge or someone at the front desk. Either there was no one manned at the desk for extended periods of time, or a few times when I called the concierge desk no one answered the phone. This wasnâ€™t anything to ruin our trip, but these are issues that keep the IC firmly as a 3-star hotel in my opinion. POOL/BEACH area: Everything was well maintained. Food and service at the restaurants near the pool and beach were great. Also, the hotel does provide free towels & beach chairs. You simply go to the pool hut and provide your room number. ACTIVITIES: We rented a car for a day with AVIS and went to Old San Juan and we also hopped on the ferry to go to the Bacardi Factory. The ferry to the Bacardi Factory was only 50 cents pp and then a quick shuttle ride to the Bacardi Factory. Personally, I would just skip the factory visit, itâ€™s more like a looong Bacardi commercial. They donâ€™t really go into depth with the process of rum making. We were just glad that we didnâ€™t pay the tour package price to go there!! We also visited the bio-bay arranged right at the hotel for $150. This was a surreal experience. Make sure you wear your bathing suit and donâ€™t wear anything that you donâ€™t want to get wet. Youâ€™re basically paddling your way in water in a kayak at 10 pm in pitch black so be prepared. Itâ€™s not for the faint of heart or for small children in my opinion. THANKSGIVING: The hotel had a special Thanksgiving buffet for about $35pp which included mimosas and dessert. Given the price, we thought it was a good value and the turkey was delicious. We noticed the resort had a lot more guests check in the day before Thanksgiving and we were glad we were leaving the next day to avoid the crowds. Would we go back? Possibly, but Iâ€™d be more likely to consider the El San Juan next door if I find out that theyâ€™ve updated their hotel rooms more. El San Juan had a lot more ambience and was a lot livelier at night. Iâ€™d certainly recommend the IC for families or groups looking for a decent place to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: strizek88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband from Nov. 19-24. Arrived at 3:30, but room wasn't ready. Went to the pool bar for a drink and to take in the scene. Beach and pool were fairly crowded (it was a Saturday). We were able to check in at 4:00 and headed to our ocean view room on the 7th floor. Room was just okay, but the balcony was a joke. There is only one chair on each balcony and there is barely enough room for that! Bathroom is small with a very low ceiling. Beach immediately outside the hotel had a ton of seagrass. Not sure if this changes due to tides, but it made me not want to go in the water. Also, if you're looking for gorgeous water, this is not the place to be. We ended up spending time at the pool instead. Very nice pool area, ample chairs, free bottled water and grea drinks from Ciao (don't do the frozen ones, try the Rum Island Tea). We didn't try any of the hotel restaurants as nothing interested us (why go to Ruth's Chris when you can go at home?). There aren't a ton of great choices within walking distance, so we had to cab it to Old San Juan a few nights. We did have an excellent dinner at Tangerine at The Water Club - what a cool hotel! All in all, the property was sufficient for our short trip. The concierges were very friendly and helpful, as were the other employees. However, I would not stay here if ever to return to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for a Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Intercontinental 11/13-11/17/2005 and enjoyed our stay. Arrived at 2pm but room not ready..was able to check in by 3pm. Check in is listed at 4pm. Had a city view room, asked for an upgrade but was denied because Hotel was booked. Asked next day, advised room avail if we wanted to pay $40 extra per day. Worth the money for an ocean view/city view not the most appealing. Very close to airport can see & hear planes from hotel room/Some buildings in the city look very run down. There were some really nice rooms that had patios that were steps from the pool and beach. If I ever stay again I would book that. Taxi from airport $9 going to hotel but $11 from hotel which we found strange!!! Quick easy access to & from airport which is a plus for those on a short trip. I was very concerned about the weather since the weather reports showed rain with a dark cloud every day. It was rainy and overcast the entire 1st day so we spent the night enjoying the casino (just played nickel slots which were alot of fun but not very loose)def not VEGAS...lol/won & lost, basically broke even but had lots of fun. Got free drinks at the casino while playing but had to look for a waitress since we were only playing nickels..lol. My husband does not play the slots but was happy watching the game on a HUGE TV located in the casino. We did eat at the Japanese Steak House inside the hotel which was alot of fun , got to meet some other people at our table. Price ok approx $50 for the two of us. Prayed that night for sun and the next three days were sunny (YIPEE!!)..did have periods of quick showers. Jumped in the Jacuzzi during brief showers, nice & hot/bubbly or lounged in nice padded chair under tent or umbrella because rain usually didn't last long. It does get overcast at times so be sure to use sunblock as you can burn very fast . Beach was nice...golden sand not white but was raked every morning. Look closly when walking on beach to observe little clams being washed ashore/little lizards running around grounds of hotel. If you order a drink from the beach it has a surcharge...paid $9+tip for a mudslide from Splash Bar but it was VERY GOOD. Snorkeling/Fishing and other tours can be booked at pool hut. Plenty of clean towels and free bottled water. Snorkeling canceled due to rough water. Had alot of wind. Spent 2 lazy days on beach and at pool. Took local bus A-5 to Old San Juan .25 cents/nice shops>note: Bus gets very crowded had to stand up during 1/2 the trip on the way back (apprx 50-60 min ride to Old San Juan on bus) If you dont like crowds can take taxi for approx $16 each way(see Conciere before going to San Juan for good info/map) Took ferry (.50 cent pp)from Old San Juan from Pier 2 and then taxi ($3 pp) to take free tour of Bacardi Factory which included 2 free drinks per person. Good deals there on all kinds of Rum. Oh...the breakfast at hotel is expensive unless included in hotel price...we enjoyed Mi Casita restaurant for breakfast. A short walk to the right of the hotel/a very small place but had great coffee. Area also has grocery/liquor store..dominos pizza, ponderosa, burger king. Another shopping area w/a Dennys to the left of the hotel. Overall, Hotel staff was nice...best service was at the beach where staff will place beach chair for you. Security always on duty..felt very safe. One last thing...rooms were small and the balcony is for one person only. Rooms were clean/did not see any bugs or anything like that. If you prefer a more polished luxury hotel with alot of night life then you may want to stay next door at the Wyndam. Intercontinental is an overall good deal for the money. BEST FEATURE: POOL/BEACH

Reviews.Title: “Not one complaint!!”
Reviews.Author: NjBeachgoer
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The service was as good as a Ritz Carlton. The staff was on top of everything! This hotel is a $10.00 cab ride from the airport. We paid approx. $200 per night ocean view and it included their buffet breakfast(which was excellent). We did have to wait until 4:00 to check-in...The pool was clean and plenty of places to sit with cushioned chairs, don't forget to pick up your free bottled water at the towel stand! Wait service at the pool was excellent! Yogas classes Tue. and Sat.at the samll clean Gym. Beach was nice and always someone there to bring chairs to your favorite spot. Would definately recommend Ruth Chris steakhouse. Walk to El San Juan Hotel for drinks and casino. Take the local bus for.25 to Old San Juan (30-45Min.) Lots of security at the hotel, always felt safe!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation & Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My vacation was from Nov 9-15. Note that this review is from a 25 year old (female) and traveled with my friend- same age. I was overall very happy with this hotel. The hotel is a five minute drive from the airport, which was great. This also means you will hear the planes -this did not bother us. We had arrived early, about 2 hrs prior to check in time, but we were given our room right away, no waiting, which was great. The room was nice, we had a city view- this was not a big deal as i didnt plan to spend my vacation in my room. My first impression was that all the staff were extremely helpful and very nice. The beach was clean, warm water- not crystal clear as compared to other islands, but still very nice. The pool was nice although we mostly stayed at the beach. The food / drinks at the hotel were a bit pricey( although good). Head across the street where you can pick up drinks/snacks at the supermarket, and there are plenty of american chains for a cheap breakfast/lunch. Also, Mi Casita is very reasonable although plan to wait for a while- service was a bit slow but food was still good. For dinner we mostly ate away from the hotel because we wanted to try as many local restaurants as possible. I highly recommend Ajili Mojili ( sp?) Food was excellent- definetly the best that I had while in PR. As far as nightlife at the hotel, there is a small bar in the lobby ( nice spot to get a drink and hang out- low key) and there is a casino. The casino in the hotel was ok for my purposes, Im not a big gambler so I really cant comment. Nightclubs- We went to Babylon - at the El san juan ( their lobby on the weekend was packed - in comparison to IC). We also went to senor frogs,Pool Palace and Lazer- there are alot of clubs & bars in the area- depending on what kind of music you like. Concierge & staff in the hotel were helpful in giving us some ideas. As far as the weather, prior to leaving I checked the forecast which said rain every day, I was a little worried, but if it rained, it was for about 10 minutes then it cleared up. We did not lose any days due to the rain. I would definetly recommend taking the tour to El Yunque ( bring an umbrella), tour was great, rainforest & waterfalls were beautiful. Old San Juan has alot of great shopping and plenty of restaurants. You can take the bus for .25 ( but the last bus out of Old San Juan was 9pm- so we always took a taxi). Overall we had a great time in PR and at the Intercontinental. I would definetly recommend this hotel and would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: cindas_mommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental in San Juan for a weekend getaway in mid-September. We paid about $120 per night and was impressed with the hotel, staff, and service. The room faced the street and was not very large, but we didn't stay in the room much so it didn't matter. The meal at Ruth's Chris was delicious, the pool was beautiful, and although my French Toast from Room Service was not hot, it was very good. The only problem arose when workmen began repairing something, somewhere, banging on whatever they were fixing, at 7:30am. I called the front desk and the banging stopped with 5 minutes of the call (and five minutes is probably much longer than it really took). I was promptly brought pillows when I requested them and the concierge was very helpful when advising us of activities during our very short stay, including taking into account that I was 6 months pregnant and couldn't participate in certain activities. The hotel was perfect - close to the beach, airport, and a not-so-short bus ride through a rough part of San Juan to Old San Juan. That didn't bother me much - I'm from Chicago - however, others might want to bypass the bus and go with a cab, especially at night. Oh, and I won $100 from a $1.00 bet at the slots in the casino, which featured a non-smoking section that was kept that way by security guards. We will definitely return to the Intercontinental San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and outstanding pool area, great restaurants, exceptional service provided by a very friendly staff, extremely clean. Lobby is adequate, but small. Casino is small but the staff is very pleasant. Little night life, but you can go next door to the El San Juan. I was quite surprised by this hotel. Good value for the dollar, from rooms to facilities to food & beverages to health club to the beach. Being a frequent traveler to San Juan, and having stayed at all of the major hotels, the Intercontinental is the nicest overall beach front hotel in San Juan. Can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Saved by the Club”
Reviews.Author: nccoffeequeen
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for my job and needed to get away for a nice quiet vacation with my husband. Booked a quick trip after reading some reviews to the IC in San Juan. When we got there the San Juan area had a huge DC Summit convention arrive that took over most of the hotel Zone. It was a zoo. People everywhere. I was horrified by the all night partying, drug smoking in their rooms, half naked people (in the lobby's) and Sex on the beach (literally not the drink). We had upgraded to an oceanview room which was fantastic but then due to the crowd couldn't sleep so the hotel went out of there way to accomodate us, treated us to a romantic dinner and moved us to the club level due to my loyatly over the years to them. They were really fantastic to us and saved our trip from a nightmare to a memorable trip. My negatvie is San Juan isn't the nicest of areas to visit. A bit dirty and not a lot of extra things to do other than go to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, generally good experience”
Reviews.Author: gjPRtrip
Reviews.Content: We were at San Juan from August 23 - 27, and had a pleasant experience at the intercontinental. We booked a city-view room through travelocity at a very decent price, and asked for an upgrade to an ocean view room when we got there. staff was very helpful and offered an ocean view double-bed room (ran out of king/queen bed rooms), but the beds were big so that didn't matter. Ask for high floors - very beautiful view from the balcony (balcony very tiny, though) bathrooms are quite small, but generally clean and well kept. Rooms are also very decent sized. Nothing much to complain about. Beach access was very convenient - free beach chairs and umbrellas brought out by staff whenever you request - couldn't ask for a more convenient location if you like to go on th beach every morning! a side note, though - the ESJ (another hotel we were trying to decide) really had a gorgeous, breathtaking casino and lobby. if that's what you're looking for, ESJ may be a better option. Not sure about the room conditions. Overall a great bargain - good price, good rooms, good beach access. We liked it alot. Just wanted to offer my experience since the reviews on this list have really shaped my Puerto Rico experience.

Reviews.Title: “One Week in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: andrabell
Reviews.Content: Who: Me, (now) 36 Dear Husband, 38 When: September 17th thru September 24th. Why: A beach holiday to relax and to celebrate my birthday. Where: Hotel InterContinental Resort and Casino, San Juan Details: We were greeted warmly and were checked-in quickly. We were automatically upgraded to ocean view (room 1424), as my husband is a platinum member of the Priority Club. We stayed four nights on points and paid for three nights, it was a steal. We went to have a look at our room and I phoned guest services to request that our mini-bar be cleared out so we could have use of the fridge. Our every request was immediately and graciously taken care of. I think the fellow was knocking on the door before I hung up the phone. One can never get tired of hearing, "Right away, Madam!" and "Consider it done." We were a bit worried at first as our room was right across from the elevators but we heard nothing the whole week, not a footstep, voices, air traffic, plumbing. We slept like babies in the king bed, which was soft and had lots of fluffy pillows. We had an amazing view and the room very clean with everything looking spanking fresh and new. The bathroom could have been bigger, but it was clean with excellent water pressure in both the hopper and the shower. The room came with a room safe that was well used, a cd/soundmaker alarm clock that was used a couple of times and an ironing board and iron that was never used. The pool area was the best I've ever encountered. Plenty of comfy lounge chairs, lots of umbrellas and shady palm trees and the pool itself is enormous and well maintained with lovely waterfalls and a very hot Jacuzzi, which we used quite a bit. The pool towels were nice and big and we exchanged them for dry ones whenever we wanted. The complimentary ice-cold water was also an excellent amenity that we really enjoyed. The stretch of beach that the hotel sits on is beautiful, we walked on the beach and swam a couple of times, but not even the beach could eclipse the resortâ€™s pool area and amenities. The concierge staff was warm and friendly. We got great recommendations, excellent advice and fabulous service. The housekeeping staff was very thorough and offered us turndown service nightly. The wake-up calls were accurate and always had a follow up call to make sure we got the initial wake up call. Hotel dining: Splash: Our lunch was brought to us at our lounge chairs. Totally overpriced for what it was, but the service was good and the setting could not be beat. Drinks by the pool were a bit overpriced but that wasn't a shock. The Voodoo Juice for two at $14 initially and then $10 for refills (for two) turned out to be a decent value for a delicious drink. La Terraza: We had the buffet breakfast on the day before we left for home. I had the full breakfast and my Dear Husband had the continental buffet. It was well worth the money to do once, we're not big breakfast eaters and most days just had coffee and biscuits in the room. The quality of food and service was excellent. The condiments for the hot oatmeal were mouthwatering and the cheese blintzes, well I'm still dreaming of them. Oh, did I mention that Puerto Rico has the best coffee EVER? I actually took it black with a bit of sweetener and I never take my coffee with less than half cream. Momoyama: We started with the sushi pizza and then had the teppanyaki meal. The sushi pizza is a must. ORDER IT! The rest of the food was good and it was fun to watch the chef do his thing. But beware, do not order the sangria. One small glass was $10, I was shocked and annoyed. We paid less for a rather large half-pitcher of amazing sangria at Metropol. Passaggio: This is the Italian restaurant on the lower level of the hotel. We dined here on my birthday; we were too tired to go anywhere as we had visited the rainforest that morning. We were totally surprised at how good this meal was. Our waiter was top notch. It was really dim with soft Italian music in the background. It was a bit musty, but soon there was delicious smells floating around. The Spanish Garlic soup was divine as was the baked mozzarella appetizer with the balsamic reduction and sweet tomato ragout. The pasta was slightly softer than I'm used to, but better than most. The pink vodka sauce was yummy. We didn't have dessert as my husband bought me a fortune in Godiva at the mall and we had that with coffee in our room. Ruth's Chris Steak House: Where do I begin? Our first meal was so good we chose it for our last night's meal as well. From the service to the wine to the filet to the dessert, our meals here were excellent and worth every penny. I really enjoyed the laid back feel of this place. The service is highly professional but the atmosphere is fairly relaxing and fitting with a beach holiday. The Ravenswood Zin matched perfectly with my silky buttery filet. Save room for crÃ¨me brulee. Other dining: We ate lunch at Barrachina in Old San Juan. The mofongo was wonderful and the very cold air conditioning was manna on a wicked hot day. We ate dinner at Metropol twice with great food for cheap money; you can't beat it with a stick. Order the sangria and the tres leches cake (just not together.) There is a really sweet cafe that serves gelato, we had dessert there after Metropol one evening and it was lovely. To Do: We visited Old San Juan, Bacardi, El Yunque, Luquillo Beach and Plaza del Americas. All well worth the time. We rented a car one day, took the bus once and the rest of the time cabbed it. The mall is huge and beautiful. I never saw so many shoes. The concierge gave us a little card to present at the information booth for a free gift as well as a thick coupon book. We didn't use any of the coupons but I got two pretty souvenir key chains as the gift. We went to the market across the street from the hotel and bought gallons of water to keep in our fridge. We stopped at a supermarket in Rio Grande on the way back from El Yunque to have a look and ended up getting lots of Alto Grande and Cafe Crema coffee for way cheaper than anywhere else. Also, the prices for rum and other spirits at the airport cannot be beat. We stocked up for the holidays and saved a fortune. To Don't: The bus. Just...no. Final Thoughts: The weather was extremely hot and humid and that can be really tiring. We drank lots of water and sought shade whenever we could. The pool was always an oasis waiting for us and we spent three of our days totally relaxed by it, though my husband made a couple of passing complaints that the music was a bit loud for his tastes. I didn't mind at all. I highly recommend the InterContinental San Juan. My husband and I didn't want to leave, we wanted to rip up our return tickets and use them as coasters just like in the Corona advertisement. I hope this review was helpful. I wish you safe and delicious travels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IC In Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the InterContinental in Isla Verde, Puerto Rico, in the San Juan area 9/18-9/24. This hotel was a wonderful experience and met all my expectations and more. I used the reviews on the tripadvisor website as a guide when I booked this trip and I'm happy I picked this hotel. The hotel was perfect!!!!!!!! The hotel grounds are in excellent condition. The beach on this strip is public, but the hotel security insures nobody from the outside gains access to the IC pool or hotel. It was never to crowded, the food was delicious and the service very friendly...ate in all of them (Ruth Chris, Momoyama (japense rest.), the Italina one (can't remember its name) and ordered food from the pool area. Everything was good. The drinks were also yummy and the swim up bar was a treat. The concierge was pleasant. And they have live entertainment at the bar and the casino. I recommend a room with a view of the city. Ocean view is nice, but San Juan is beautiful at night. Having family from PR I've never experienced the island as a tourist. And staying at the InterContinental was all the worthwhile. I have no complaints about this stay. FYI they also have a gym and Spa onsite. My husband and I highly recommend staying at InterContinental. Especially if your traveling with your honey or the family. A must if you visit PR is El Morro, El Yunque Rainforest, Old San Juan, and Paseo la Princessa - beautiful at night. Who am I kidding there is so much to see a week just wasn't enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is better than what the reviews indicate!! The people were so nice. The room was spectacular. Make sure you upgrade to an ocean-view, it's cheap and well worth it($40). The pool was the best I've ever seen in many years of traveling. The casino was lots of fun, we played craps for several hours and received free drinks and even sandwiches. All the people at this hotel were extremely friendly and will go out of their way to help you with anything needed. You will not regret staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: marie1082
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental was great. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean, the beach and the pool were very nice everything was wonderful. I would definately reccomend this place if you want to stay somewhere nice and have great service while you're in San Juan. I saw the review that said you have to pay for the pool and beach that is not true at all I didn't pay one single penny for the pool or the beach it was all free access to anyone staying at the hotel This hotel is wonderful I am definately going back to intercontinental next time I visit San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Checco
Reviews.Content: got a great deal on priceline. . the room is very nice, . the pool is amazing . bars and restaurant really nice . the staff is good the only problem is the 12 USD parking fee for self parking The beach is nice itself but the sea is not the kind of sea you expect in PR. Other beaches offer much nicer sea and sand.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: nishnish2000
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. My second time in Puerto Rico, stayed at the San Juan Sheraton the first time and hated it there. THe intercontinental had awesome service. We asked to be upgraded but they were unable to do so. The staff was extremely courteous - our luggage was sent upstairs, we didn't have to worry about dragging it to the elevator. The rooms were nice, had a safe, mini fridge, every room has a balcony. A pool view or ocean view room would have been nice, but even the front of the hotel is pretty nice, has a waterfall. Complaints - bathroom is pretty small, shower is really small, i didn't care for it. the bathroom was pretty though and there is a vanity outside the bathroom. Room service wasn't that great, the cleaning lady didn't even bother changing our glasses. This was a very convenient hotel to stay at considering the beach was right outside the hotel and the pool area was just gorgeous. the mediterranean restaurant around the pool area is a bit pricy, the drinks are at least. you are better off buying a drink elsewhere and going to the pool area. Beach is absolutely beautiful, whtie sand, blue skies and clear blue water - what more can you ask for? This hotel is paradise, and i got a great deal on it, perhaps why i wasn't upgraded. The casino and lounge area aren't that great in the hotel. There is a spa though and a salon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location. Great Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to San Juan for her 40th birthday(Aug. 12 - Aug.16). Our travel agent recommended the IC & she was absolutely right in saying it was a great hotel. It is only a 5-8 minute taxi ride to the IC from the airport. Upon checking in, we were offered an upgrade from a city view to a beautiful ocean view. Check-in was a breeze and our person (Orlando) checking us in made it very simple for first time visitors to the hotel property. Room was clean & very nice. We ate most of our meals within walking distance from the IC. You can find all of the "American" food chains within a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Old San Juan is a must for those who visit Puerto Rico(my wife is still raving about the affordable shopping). Even though the casino is smaller than the ones I am used to visiting in Vegas, it is still a lot of fun--the dealers are very nice & personable. One of the best things the IC offered was $5.00 Blackjack with very liberal rules(doubling on any 2 cards, doubling after splitting, etc.)--try finding that in Vegas. For the price we paid on this trip, we came out way ahead(especially if we had stayed at one of the more expensive properties). In conclusion, if you have an upcoming trip to San Juan, I do not think you can go wrong with the IC. I think my wife will always remember the great time she had on her 40th.

Reviews.Title: “loved PR & IC!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bear in mind, this trip consisted of 3 female college students. Going in early august, we were well aware that the resort would not have guests our age visiting; however, the hotel was still completely booked for the weekend (our guess is, by families). Pool & Beach: the pool area is excellent! as a previous guest had written, the hot tub can get a little too hot; but the pool water itself is relaxing all in its own. even though the hotel was fully booked -- we had no problem finding chairs by the pool, nor at the beach! the shoreline can get a little murky, but coming from NY -- this was simply paradise with my two best friends! the water also allows a great breeze even on those especially hot days! service: great! when we first checked in, we were told that we had $50 to spend on anything the hotel offers (we took this into consideration and used it to buy drinks at the pool bar and the beach!) -- MUST try their incredible hulk! restaurants: do not try the mofongo at mi casita! We even had a lady that was eating there come by and tell us not to let mi casita's mofongos deter us away from the island's most popular food. We also ate at Dragonfly, and although we have heard rave reviews about this place, it was probably one of the worst dining experiences ever. The service was horrendous, the neighborhood was going through major water piping -- so we were served on PLASTIC plates & cups...and overall, just not a pleasant experience. Next door is "TANTRA", an indo-latino restaurant. That was our best meal of the vacation. Wonderful chicken tikka, and the service was amazing. Our waiter was very amiable & we miss him! On another night we ate at metropol, which wasn't bad either. They give large portions for a very reasonable price. nightlife: Babylon, which is located in the El San Juan next door is a great place for ladies our age. We also took into consideration that such an ambiance also let us feel safer, rather than roaming the streets of downtown san juan. Bear in mind, that its location is FANTASTIC! One of the girls stayed at the Hilton Caribe last year, and she preferred the IC because it was far more convenient. There is a small shopping strip located less than 5 minutes walking from the resort...which was great to pick up small snacks, dominos, or even for a great breakfast at the bagel store! We hope you all have a great stay at the intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: first i want to thank trip advisor - very informative in all my travel decisions. my family and myself just arrived home from our trip to the intercontinental in san juan....first of all, the staff is very, very nice and helpful with everything. as a matter of fact they will definitely go out of there way for the quests....i had two adjoining rooms which i requested with a view of the ocean...wonderful. the rooms were very clean and roomy. the pool is spacious with a great swim up bar - restaurant, also the beach has a bar and restaurant. the hotel staff will carry beach chairs to where ever you want. we ate at ruths chris steakhouse, very nice and pricey. also enjoyed the japanese restaurant, the food was great. we met wonderful people in the lounge, listened to great music and played the slots in the casino...i would recommend the intercontintenal to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Been there 5 times - going back for more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i'm new to tripadvisor, so i am posting some reviews of great experiences i've had. We've been to PR and stayed here at least 5 times -- bottom line, there is no better deal in PR than the InterContinental. First, staying in Isla Verde is literally 10 minute cab from the airport -- a huge deal when you are dealing with a quick trip. Second, the rates at the hotel are very reasonable, all classes of rooms. Third, it's right next door -- 2 minute walk -- to one of the best hotel lobbies in Carribeann, the El San Juan (now owned by Wyndham). it is the place to be on the island on weekend nights, with great bars and people watching and a casino i always describe as "James Bond-esque". The big deal at the IC is staying in the Club Intercontinental. request a 1st floor room. it is adjacent to the pool system and you get you're own patio and chaise lounges and umbrella, etc. a great place to set up camp by just opening your sliding glass door. and the beach is a short walk from the pool. having easy access to my room is always a big deal for us on beach-type vacations. I can't handle an afternoon frying on the beach/pool. The rooms also have mini-fridges, and we always load up with drinks and snacks at the nearby grocery store when we arrive. Cuts down on that bill. You get a nice room, right next door to the El San Juan for half the price. one last tip -- go to Fortaleza street in Old San Juan for dinner. it's a $15 cab ride, but the old city is beautiful and there are 6 or 7 truly top-notch, non-national chain restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back this morning from a five day stay at the Intercontinental. I went with two friends for a last-minute weekend getaway, and we had an absolutely wonderful time there. We were upgraded to an ocean view room (all we did was ask for it) and had a gorgeous view of the pool and the ocean. The room was clean and had all the amenities that we needed. The pool was extremely refreshing, and the beach was private and clean with clear water and good security. My friends and I keep kosher, which means that we had to bring our food and couldn't eat at the restaurants, so I can't comment on that. The casino was small but fun, if you want a larger casino and/or a nightclub you can go next door to the Wyndham. We went to the Wyndham one night but enjoyed ourselves more at the casino in the Intercontinental. Having visited (but not stayed at) the Wyndham, I am extremely relieved that we went with the Intercontinental. The Wyndham feels more like a casino than a hotel, and the Intercontinental has too many qualities to stay anywhere else. The staff in general was wonderful - they were extremely nice, helpful, and cheerful. Nestor the concierge was terrific, he took care of everything we needed. All in all, we had a fabulous experience and would go back in a heartbeat. I have told all my friends that the Intercontinental is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Puerto Rico (June 27th), we stayed at the Intercontinental the day prior to leaving for a cruise and for one day after returning from the cruise. My husband and I are "beach goers", but this hotel actually had us sunning by the pool. Service: The service by the pool was fantastic. Friendly staff and available each time we wanted to order. Pool: Pool was smaller than others we have seen in Mexico, but still very refreshing. The swim up bar provided a little shade and great service and drinks. Dancing and music provided great entertainment by the pool; however, the music was a bit loud, but did not play continuously. There were plenty of sunning chairs and shaded chairs by the pool absolutely no problem finding a chair Beach: The beaches in Puerto Rico are open to the public so it was a bit different than being in Mexico - pretty crowded on the second night. Still beautiful and clean. No huts to sit under like in Mexico, and chairs must be rented. I prefer some shade while my husband likes full sun so we stuck with the pool except for short swims in the ocean and a stroll. Bathrooms by the beach were clean. Room: The room was available for checkin early. Very clean. We had to have a safe installed the first day, and the wireless keyboard was jacked so we checked out at the desk. I'm pretty picky when it comes to the room and I felt it was nice and clean. Casino: My husband is the gambler and he said the casino was just "ok". If I'm not mistaken it is collared shirts and slacks while gambling in the evening. Food: We did not dine at the hotel, there is a Ruth Chris steakhouse and a Japanese grill. I believe there is also an Italian restraunt. We were trying to conserve after being on the cruise, so we crossed the street to Subway where there is also KFC, Wendy's, Taco bell. We walked down the street one night and had dinner on the patio of a Mexican restraunt/bar. The food there was fantastic. We paid 170 each night, but I believe for the money we stayed at one of the nicer hotels there without exceeding $200 dollars. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Isla Verde Resorts.”
Reviews.Author: dsnarl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Intercontiental several 3 times over 3 different winters. Despite the Hotel being full almost every time we stayed there, it never felt uncomfortable. The rooms were always well furnished and cleaner than the average carribean hotel. Last time we stayed on the club area, which is a separate building on the right side of the pool. The club level was nice, but the club level is not catered towards travellers with children. The pool area is very nice, although I really wish they'd heat the pool. We've eaten at Momoyama (Japanese) which was good, Ruth's Chris which was surprisingly a hit with my 7 year old - (Very good meal). La Terraza and Ciao Mediteranean were good standbys. However, there are dozens of decent restaruants all within walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Generally positive”
Reviews.Author: Indian91
Reviews.Content: Nearly everything was very good at the Intercontinental. The pool is great, the staff is universally friendly and attentive and the overall property is well-maintained and clean. The casino is OK, but the ESJ casino next door is much better - better blackjack dealers, better drink service. My only complaint is that the place turned into a frat house on the weekends. Many rooms near us were filled with loud, drunk college kids. Fortunately, hotel security was responsive and quieted them on the multiple occasions that we complained about the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Intercontinental. Upgraded our rooms when we checked in to a beautiful room 1st floor where you could walk out your patio and into pool area. Rained the whole time, only 2 days, but hotel had wonderful service and great gym too. Right on the beach! Had a wonderful time and they gave us great recommendations for dinner. Can't wait to go back to see it in the sun because it sure was awesome even in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Just giving back what was freely given to me[ reviews]”
Reviews.Author: deejay48720
Reviews.Content: HI, from the moment we arrived we were upgraded to a oceanview room, got into our room by 11..00 am , hit the beach guess what , no charge for the beach chairs, free water when you get your towel, everyone was very helpful , the gym i thought was great best 1 i have been to in a hotel , everything i needed for a workout, room were very nice pleny of space , clean , little balcony. safe , fridge, i got more then i thought i was going to get . casino was small but had a ball gambled every day. ocean nice no rocks or shells. i would stay away from the pricey hotel food for dinner , didnt mind spending the money just did,nt think it was worth it , except breakfast and lunch at the hotel was good , walk over to metropol for dinner nice reasonable priced worth trying. so i will send a few pictures also hope i was able to help someone . RICK

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: jg17
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay here after reading some of the reviews. I am happy to report no negative feedback. We had a great stay, with an extremely helpful staff. Good security in the lobby as well as near the beach to ensure no pool crashers. The bathroom was starting to show it's age, but the rooms were large and came with ironing boards, mini bar, and safes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff, on the beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental May 13-15 for a weekend get-away. The staff are very nice, helpful, and really seem happy that you're there, genuinely polite. Hotel and the rooms are beautiful with a great view of either the city or the beach. The casino was nice. Very polite security personnel throughout the hotel and grounds. Taxis were readily available and resonably priced. However, we were disappointed with a couple of things. We didn't know that May is apparently the rainy season and it rained every day, and the Weather Channel predicted rain every day for the following week. Also, we were promised white sand and good snorkeling right off the beach. Nuh-uh. The sand was nice and soft, but the regular golden color, and you couldn't see anything while snorkeling. Not sure if this was because of there being so much rain lately, or if the waves kept everything churned up and murky. Also, the bathroom door was broken and didn't shut very easily, but we didn't complain about it (I just hope they don't think we broke it and charge our credit card!) The restaurants in the hotel are pricey, but there are plenty of fast food restaurants across the street from the hotel, plus a good restaurant with affordable local cuisine just down the street called the Metropol. Mainly because of the staff, we'd return to the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: lodes
Reviews.Content: Rooms: My husband and I stayed here with friends in April and had a great time. Our room was immaculate and the bathroom fresh and clean. We had a beautiful ocean view with a small balcony. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. Service: The most striking thing about this hotel is the service. Everyone from housekeeping to management greets you with a smile. Nestor the concierge was wonderful. He even promised it would stop raining and it did! Beach: There was a huge storm hanging over the island when we arrived. Fortunately it blew out the next day. The storm did, however, churn up the water making it very murky and depositing a lot of seaweed on the beach. The IC was the ONLY hotel on the strip that had the beach raked clean the next day! The ocean was warm and calm. My only compaint for the entire stay is that there is a $10 charge for beach umbrellas that are not even in great shape. It seems at this level of hotel the umbrellas should be provided without an additional charge. Pool: After the storms the water was quite cool but did warm up in the next day or so. The pool is large and beautiful. There were plenty of chairs available even though the hotel was sold out. The pool service was outstanding and the pool bar was very good but a bit pricey ($9 per typical drink). Nightlife: They have a very nice, intimate lobby bar with a singer on most nights. A great place to start or end your evening. The guys liked the casino but none of us are big time gamblers. It was a bit too bright and cold for me. Definately the best place to be at night is next door at the Wyndham. Lots of local atmosphere and enertainment. Also check out the Waterclub down the street. The rooftop bar has a beautiful night view of Isla Verde. Its open air with a trendy atmosphere. The elevator ride alone is worth the 2 block walk. Food: The breakfast buffet at the IC is phenomenal. All the usual plus homemade waffles, bagels and lox, cheese blintzes and more. We purchased the breakfast built into our room rate which was the best way to go. We had lunch twice at the Ciao Mediterranean restaurant that is directly between the beach and pool area. Great place to enjoy the beach view and have lunch. La Piccola Fontana at the Wyndham was our best dinner there. Fine Northern Italian cuisine with excellent service. We also loved Dragonfly in Old San Juan. This is not for everyone though. Very dark atmosphere and funky menu. All dishes are served for the whole table and shared. My favorite was the Peking Duck Nachos. Overall we had a great experience and I would return to the InterContinetal again. San Juan is not a remote tropical get-away but a great place for having fun with lots of nightlife and activities. If you are reading this because you are planning a trip I am very jealous!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental from April 29 through May 1. Had a great room with a small balcony overlooking the ocean. We were not expecting a first class hotel since we were there for a meeting but we really were pleasantly surprised by the great service, wonderful staff and beautiful facilities. It was well priced and really well maintained! Nestor, the concierge, made great dinner reservations for us at fabulous restaurants. We were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First I want to make clear that this trip consisted of 8 girls aged 21-23. We were looking for sun, pretty beach, a nice pool scene and a good party! Weather was beautiful. Although its hot, its not US hot. There is a cool breeze from the ocean which makes the heat bearable. Beach was okay. I am from Jersey which means just about any beach is better than ours, but it wasn't fabulous. Noisy but good for laying out with friends. Pool at the IC was nice. We had no problem finding beach chairs at any time of the day. It was always clean. There was a swim up bar, but we never used it. The hot tub was nice, but can get a little to hot!! Party scene was awesome. We were right next door to Babylon in the El San Jaun Wyndham. Although we tried other places, we always ended up finishing off our nigths at the Babylon. NYC type club, but a far different crowd. Full of PR locals and well as tourist. We went to Senor Frogs one night too, it was an okay time, but on the empty side.. The IC also has a little gym. By little, I mean very little! 3 treadmills and some weight machines. I went there about everyday, but only got to use the treadmill onces. It over looks the ocean, which is breathtaking, but only if you get a treadmill! Food was okay. We went to the mexican restuartant in the El San Juan Wyndham one night. It was good food at a reasonable cost. Other nights we just did the typical college diet which includes Burger king (which is across the street), Taco Bell, Pizza Hut etc. All within walking distance. We went to the rainforest as well. It is beautiful but not recommended after a night of extensive partying. The trip leaves pretty early and there is a lot of walking to do in the rainforest. Bacardi factory was a waste of time. Tour is very boring. Like going to a museum in 2nd grade. $6 for a bottle of Bacaradi there, but its $4 at the airport. Safe yourself the hassle. The rooms were good. Clean and served the purpose. Although the last night, our hallway carpeting was soaking wet. No idea why, but our rooms where fine. Best part of the room was that there was a fully lighted mirror outside the bathroom as well as inside. ( I know all you girls understand the need for that!) All in all, it was a great trip. Language barrier was not a problem. Most ppl speak english and our spanish wasn't bad. Counting the days to go back..

Reviews.Title: “A Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: paulap70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the IC for one night preceeding and two nights following a cruise. The hotel is absolutely fantastic! We were able to upgrade to ocean view from city view rooms for a $40 upcharge each night. We definitely wanted to have the ocean view! We ate dinner one night at Metropol as we have on previous trips. The restaurant isn't much for atmosphere, but the food is good and inexpensive. Another night, we ate at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, located on hotel grounds. Excellent food! Our waiter, Alejandro, was great and gave us some excellent site-seeing tips! A traveler's tip: don't consume the items in the hotel mini-bar. It's very easy to simply walk across the street to the Isla Verde Fresh Food market and get all of the pop, beer, water, and snacks you could want. For example, hotel mini-bar charges $5 for a can of Medalla Light beer. A six-pack is $5.99 at the store! There's also a Walgreen's a few blocks to the west, in case you need a necessity or simply want photos developed. San Juan is a great place to vacation and the IC is excellent. If you're going on a Royal Caribbean cruise departing San Juan, go over to the Pan American terminal around noon (the cruise line will tell you boarding begins at 4 PM for 10 PM sail). You'll get right on and be able to enjoy the ship earlier!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time”
Reviews.Author: FishManRichie
Reviews.Content: Husband, daughter & I arrived on April 6th for 4nites. Fabulous hotel, Concierge terrific. Room & bath always very clean; room service prompt. Only downfall was cost of drinks poolside, and food prices at outdoor poolside cafe. Wyndham Condado prices MUCH cheaper for food & drinks. Weather was terrific, ocean so warm you didn't need the pool, which was beautiful. Met great couple from Chicago while there, wish them well. Overall the Intercontinental is a great place to stay, especially since it's so close to the airport, you get more time to vacation before your departing flight back home :)

Reviews.Title: “Long review of short stay”
Reviews.Author: Chardo
Reviews.Content: Wife and I (the kids stayed home) stayed for long weekend 3/31 to 4/3. Overall, everything was excellent. BOOKING: Used AAVacations, as we have done before. Best prices, very easy to use, no surprises. Well, one surprise which I'll get to later. ARRIVAL: Quick luggage retrieval at SJU. No customs at all, just walked out of the airport. I know PR is a US territory, but I still expected some sort of customs check. We were told to bring proof of citizenship, but we never needed it. Outside the terminal was a taxi stand with one person ahead of us. About 2 minute wait for taxi, followed by 5 minute ride to hotel ($8 plus .50 per suitcase). Can't get any easier. CHECK-IN: We reserved a "super saver" room. When I know a hotel will not be crowded (off season, week after holiday, etc.), I usually book the cheapest room upfront and then haggle for an upgrade at the desk. Our desk clerk started his pitch for us to join Intercontinental's rewards program. For $150, we would get an upgrade during this and all other stays at IC hotels for one year, plus other perks. We really didn't need the perks, and we don't plan on staying at any other IC hotels this year, so I wasn't too excited about the deal. The desk clerk then took us on a special tour. He wanted to show us the room we booked and the upgraded room. The booked room turned out to be a 7th floor junior suite overlooking the city. Very nice room, but the view was not exactly tropical. Then he showed us the upgraded room. It was 12 floor overlooking the pool and ocean. Great view, but the room (non-suite) was actually smaller than the other. I figured we don't spend much time in the room, so the ocean view would be nicer. But, I didn't want to pay $150 for it. We went back down to the front desk. I told him I like the ocean room better, but I'll pass on the deal. Unless he could give me the ocean room anyway....which is exactly what he did. Like I said, you can usually schmooze a free upgrade if the hotel isn't crowded. Anyway, I gave him a nice tip just in case he lost out on some commission by not selling me the plan. Other than setting us back some time for this "tour", it was a pleasant check-in. He even said that our reservation includes breakfast every day, which was news to me. My reservation documents specifically said no meals. I figured we're gonna eat anyway, so I'll either get a bill at checkout or a nice surprise. ROOMS: I didn't pay very close attention to the city-view junior suite (considered their standard room), but it was large and very nice. Our oceanview room was smaller, though not too small by any means. King bed, sitting area, very small balcony (chair can only fit sideways). Bathroom a little small (crowded with two people), but nicely appointed. Overall luxury on par with Hyatt, Marriott, etc. POOL: A primary reason for staying here. Beautiful lagoon freeform pool with waterfall, surrounded by lots of palm trees. Very clean, nice temp, not crowded. Plenty of lounge chairs. BEACH: Clean, soft sand. Very large beach, so it never seems crowded. Waves churn up the sand at the shoreline, so the water gets murky. Looks great from the room, though. Very short walk to vendors for jetski, parasail, and banana boat. Hotel employees place your lounge chair where you want, and waiters take drink and food orders right on the beach (and at the pool). CASINO: Disappointing to me, but I guess that's the impression you get when you lose. Small compared to most US casinos, but not uncomfortable. For comparison, bigger than Caribe Hilton, but smaller than El San Juan. Most of the island casinos have just one craps table and a few blackjack tables in use. This craps table had a drain at the bottom that just sucked my chips in all the time. We actually did much better (and therefore enjoyed) the casino at Ritz Carlton. Not impressed with El San Juan's casino (next door to IC), though the rest of that hotel is special. NIGHTLIFE: None to speak of, besides casino. There's a lobby bar with a singer at night, but usually a small crowd gathered there. El San Juan next door has much more activity. DINING: Breakfast buffet every day is very good. Not only do they make omelets to order (like most good buffets), but they also make the french toast and waffles right there. Takes a little longer, but much better than mass-cooked french toast sitting in a chafing dish. Breakfast is $18.95. Big price, but in line with other resorts. Also, we ate so much that we didn't want lunch. Add it up and it's not a bad deal. If cost is a concern, there are several options across the street for "desayuno", including almost every American fast food chain. We did not eat at any other restaurants at this hotel. Our first night, we went to La Casona. It was our anniversary, so we wanted upscale. Very fancy restaurant about 10 minute ride away from hotel. We had been there before and it was worth the repeat visit. Very expensive. Dinner for 2 with a moderate bottle of wine was over $150. Their wine list is very impressive, and can easily add hundreds to the tab if you want to really splurge. Second night we went to Metropol, which is about a half mile walk from the hotel. Place had all the atmosphere of a local coffee shop, but excellent food. Even with a pitcher of (very good) sangria, check was about $60. Best bargain of the trip--I highly recommend going. Third night we ate at Mi Casita, which is directly across the street from IC. Similar to Metropol (good food, no atmosphere, similar prices), though they serve mainly Puerto Rican food as opposed to Metropol's Cuban food. Honestly, the two cuisines are about as different as Chinese and Japanese. Kinda different yet similar. I recommend both restaurants. CHECKOUT: Always the saddest part of the trip, but here was the surprise. My extras bill totalled $18. Just tips at breakfast and a drink by the pool. No charge for breakfast. AAVacations was wrong, I guess. AIRPORT: Be aware that the American Airlines terminal has almost nothing to eat. Not even a Starbucks or Dunkin, which are usually all over the place. We had to wait 40 minutes at some concession stand for instant coffee at about $2 a cup. I'm not making this up. Make sure you have your coffee and breakfast before you head to the airport. Let me know if you have any questions--rich(at)rannigilbert.com

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort! One of our best vacations!”
Reviews.Author: dreamvac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed this resort from the moment the bellman greeted us at the door. The staff was very warm and truly working towards our enjoying our stay. Check in was an ease and they graciously upgraded our room to an oceanfront room. Our bags were promptly brought up for us. The hotel is lobby is beautiful, but the true gem is the gorgeous pool area and beach. The property was so enjoyable, we did not want to leave it! We went into Old San Juan only one day of the 5 nights we stayed and just enjoyed the warm pool, vigorous jacuzzi, relaxing beach, excellent drinks and food by the pool and pool cafe... The pool bar staff were very attentive and made outstanding drinks. There is a spa where I endulged in a 80 minute deep tissue massage that was perfect. There are excellent inexpensive restaurants in walking distance--Luipis a sports bar, mexican grill and Metropole a cuban, puerto rican restauran. One night we ate at the restauarant near the La Playa Hotel that is right on the water that specializes in seafood and ribs and has a breathtaking view of San Juan at night. I will return to Puerto Rico and the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Winter Getaway...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Hotel is located right next door to the El San Juan Hotel in Puerto Rico but why leave ? This hotel has all the amenities; beautiful grounds with winding pool, hot jacuzzi that fits 30 people, salon, 2 poolside restaurants- one overlooks the beach and ocean with gentle breezes and ultra friendly service. The food is good; salads with chicken, cubano and club sandwiches, etc. You can order from your comfortable lounge chair by the pool or on the beach without missing a beat. I recommend the "Club Level" rooms which are a little more expensive, but so worth the location; 10 steps from the pool/beach/food. No elevators or long hallways, open the sliders and you've arrived. The bed is comfortable, a small couch and desk ($10 internet access via ether cable) are just inside the glass doors. The Club Level also includes a club lounge mainly for business travelers that is set up 3 times a day with an abundane of "on the go" type meals and drinks. (bagels, fruit, coffee, cheese/crackers, wine, liquor, etc.) Access the beach through tall iron gates which are locked at 6pm promptly every night. (Try to be inside the gates after dark, wristband required for re-entry) The pool water was a little chilly so we venterd into the warm ocean one day. The waves were a little rough being on the Atlantic side of the island, but it's glorious when the east coast of US is in a deep freeze. Ruth Chris steakhouse is on the property, outstanding, need I say more. There are two other restaurants and a small casino on the property, just enough of a variety without being crowded. Room service is 24 hrs. One night we went nex door to the El San Juan, it was nice to see the beautiful lobby, but unless you're a serious gambler, don't bother. For a quick getaway full of sun and relaxation, Intercontinental is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful pool and beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is going to be quick and dirty -- Beach is awesome, great site seeing and people watching. Water is fantastic. Did not get hassled on the beach from vendors which is unusual for the Carribbean. Pool facilities are great -- plenty of pool for all guests. The pool bar was closed during my stay, but it looks like it will be great when it opens up again. Casino -- the worst I've ever been to. BUT, you are right next door to one of the nicer ones in the Carribean at the El San Juan. Hotel Rooms - fine - better than I expected. Little CD player in room - bring CDs. Hotel Dining is great -- the breakfast buffet fit the bill, the menu and food at the Ciao Medditereneo are not to be missed - look to get tables overlooking the beach. Check in can be slow, so US travellers be prepared to wait. The staff is courteous (not so much with the Casino staff / Casino wait staff). If someone dumped $1MM into this hotel it could stand alongside the El San Juan as a premier location. I'd put all of the money into the lobby / Casino - dump the Casino staff and start fresh. The Intercontinental has an amazing location alongside the nicest hotels in SJ, they should do a better job taking advantage of the opportunity. Truly, this hotel's promixity to the PR gem, the Wyndam El San Juan is why you would want to stay here. ESJ has great nightlife from salsa dancing to a very nice casino and amazing bar, you really can't go wrong at the ESJ any night of the week.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from the Inter-Continental a couple of days ago. We stayed from March 9-13 and had a WONDERFUL time. As a matter of fact, I went through a minor depression period before we had to leave :) From the moment we got there to the moment we left, we were treated wonderfully by the entire staff. We originally had a street view room and when we got there we asked to be upgrated to oceanview. They were happy to accomodate us with a beautiful and large oceanview room. The balcony is a bit small, but it was not a big deal in the slightest. The rooms are a bit musty and feel wet, but that did not stop us from enjoying every other aspect of the gorgeous hotel. The pool area is absolutely beautiful with palm treas, waterfalls, and very clean water. We had so many things planned to do during our stay and did not end up doing any of it because we were so happy, pleased, and had such a great time just hanging out on the grounds of the beautiful hotel. The wrist bands (which everyone complains about) are not troublesome in any way. The food on the grounds is very good. We live in NYC and are used to eating out a lot, and even to us the food was exceptional. You must try Passagio, which is located in the hotel because it's wonderful. We had dinner there 2 times but do not get the Chef's Sampler dessert because it's way too small a portion for $10. Ciao's Medditaranean Cafe (located by the pool area) is a wonderful and convinient place to grab lunch. Also, the Splash swim-up bar is awesome. Don't forget to try the Mojito's and the frozen Rum Runners (prepared by Danny the bartender) they are awesome!! We went right before spring break and it was not crowded at all, so make sure when you book your stay it is not during times when it's crowded because that can ruin the experience. El San Juan is literally right next door and also has some wonderful restaurants. Try La Picolla Fontana if you're looking for great Italian. I highly recomend this hotel to everyone. We had a wonderful experience and would return any time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just got back - already making plans to return!”
Reviews.Author: annabelle32
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! The location is perfect - 10 minute drive from the airport. Our room was lovely - oceanview, 15th floor. The hotel is right across the street from a strip mall. In the mall there is a little grocery store, bakery and diner. Everything you need is in the grocery store (make sure you stock up on water - a 1 liter bottle of spring water is $1.69 compared to a pint at $4.00 in the hotel). The bakery has bagels and coffee for $2.75 and the diner serves bacon and eggs for $2.99. We only visited from Thurs to Mon but, had such a wonderful time - we were discussing our return trip on the flight home. Our room was just off the elevators and at first I was worried the elevator noise would bother us. We didn't hear a thing. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We asked the pool bar server for a resturant suggestion and he was more than happy to help us out. The hotel resturant: Ruth's Chris was fantastic - in fact we ate there two nights out of the 4. The casino is fun but, small. The lobby bar was hoping on Friday and Saturday night. And the Pool ....oh the pool. It was perfect, my husband is not a sun worshiper and I am so he sat under the umbrella (which are plentiful) and I sat in the sun. It was the best of both worlds. All and all...I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Not the Best Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
