Reviews.Content: I thought that the hotel was very nice, although you can get a lot more value for money in other countries (ie Dominican Republic, Cuba or Mexico). I felt very safe while in the vicinity of the hotel, security was posted at all entrances. This hotel is extremly convenient to the airport - I'd even consider walking to and from there if there were any sidewalks there (FYI - there isn't).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peekaboo2you
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful vacation at the InterContinential Resort & Casino. My stay was from 3/3 to 3/7 & everyday I had a great time. From the minute my friends & I walked into the hotel the staff was very friendly & helpful. The concierge, Nestor, was a great help by recommending restaurants & making reservations for us. There is a Ruth Chris steak house in the resort that you definitely must go to for dinner. Another fantastic restaurant which is only about 8 blocks from the hotel is La Fontana & is located on the top floor of the Howard Johnsons. They have excellent Italian food! Coming from a very Italian neighbor hood in New York I was very impressed. You feel as if you were eatting in a Little Italy Manhattan restaurant. The pool area is very nice with small waterfalls coming into the pool area. The beach is very clean & relaxing. There are workers who will get you chairs & set you up anywhere you would like to sit. Everytime you come in & out of the hotel someone is there to open the door for you. The only one negative about the hotel is the breakfast prices. $18.95 a person for a buffet breakfast is a little expensive to me so it is not something you would want to do every morning. Other then that, you will have a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough resort”
Reviews.Author: wise2374
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here only one night after our flight to NYC was cancelled. Hotel's best feature is its lobby area, which is sharp and attractive. There's a nice lobby bar and an active and lively casino right off of the lobby. The hotel's beach - being on Isla Verde - is very nice for the San Juan area, although generally not as nice as non-San Juan areas or other more secluded Caribbean areas. The pool area has plenty of chairs but feels a little cramped - slightly more reminiscent of the community pool than a pool at a beach resort. The rooms were niced sized and had a decent small balcony but surprisingly musty/mildew-y - additionally, our TV remote didn't work. The location is nicer for the beach than the Condado or Old San Juan areas, as there's less activity in general in the area. However, that also means that there are more nightlife and restaurant options closer to both Condado and Old San Juan than here. Between the nearby Wyndham, Water Club and this hotel, there are a number of good restaurants and bars to be had, but they're mostly chic clubby-types (Tangerine at Water Club) or high end steakhouses (Ruth's Chris and I believe the Palm at IC and Wyndham). There aren't as many good local options - unless you're willing to pay the $12 to cab it to those other areas, which frankly isn't a big deal. So, on the Condado/Old San Juan vs. Isla Verde question, it depends what you're looking for. Quieter and marginally nicer beach? Isla Verde. More activity with a more bustling beach? Condado/Old San Juan. Overall, the next time I'm in Puerto Rico, I'm unlikely to stay here. I'd either choose a true beach resort (such as the Westin Rio Mar, which is very nice but a 40-min ride from San Juan) or a Condado resort with a good enough beach, but a little closer to the other restaurants & activities.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Divide”
Reviews.Author: mapmaster23
Reviews.Content: When is (near) perfection so uninspired?... when one visits The Intercontinental. By typical hotel evaluation parameters, I'd be hard-pressed to state a negative word....every hotel employee was unfailingly friendly and sought to be helpful. The pool area was visually appealing and large enough to accommodate a sold-out hotel. The room was clean, well appointed, and comfortable. The only possible complaints (and minor, to be sure) were the vest-pocket sized casino, and the ineffectiveness of a seemingly well intentioned concierge ...I would be advised that a particular restaurant was unavailable, and then be offered his "recommendation"as an alternative, only to find that the establishment that I wished to dine at was indeed available...hmmm. What the hotel lacks is a specific personality, any sort of distinctiveness. By comparison, the lobby of the El San Juan on Friday evening fullfilled my fantasies of 1957 Havana, with lusty Latin music playing, and happy dancers crowding the dance floor. The Ritz Carlton "announces" your arrival with the smell of flowers even before you've finished your turn in their revolving door..The Intercontinental?...It's the Admiral's Club Lounge at the airport...clean, quiet, comfortable, functional in every possible way....yet unceasingly bland. Staying at The Intercontinental is similar to going to a premium ice cream parlor, and ordering vanilla. It may just be the finest vanilla ice cream in the world, but it is unmistakingly vanilla. For some, this will be more than sufficient, for others, not at all.

Reviews.Title: “Will try somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2/12-15/05 Older facility on average beach. Food OK but not memorable; food service ranged from very bad to very good. Given "garden view" room that roared hotel exhaust into balcony. Only evening entertainment was the casino. Disappointed that the Intercontinental website dropped room prices from the time the reservation was booked until we arrived (and would not even honor their own claim of "matching" the lowest web price). Area very close to bus, airport, and alternative restaurants. Pool was nice but too cold to use. Staff friendly and spoke English well. Tight security. OK but will take business somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: positive: - friendly staff - free wireless internet connection Negatives : - food swimming pool very mediocre; french fries not tasty; plastic fork and knife in a 4 star hotel ??? - only hotel in the world I have visited where a litre of mineral water ($8) is more expensive than 2 half-litre bottles (2 x $3). - bathrooms very small and look like have not been re-done since hotel was built (40 years ago?) - rooms were not well cleaned and/or vacumed every day - noisy, with location close to airport - way too expensive, we paid $ 309 per day excl taxes (another $ 60), excl breakfast. To compare we looked at the Hilton in Ponce, which is much better value at $ 225 per night and superior facilities. Summary : We made a mistake and will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “good ,but el conquistador is best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: terrible service in the casino.half hour wait for attentdant to refill an empty slot machine that owed us only $8.restaurants are good but way overpriced.found some local spots that the natives go to(better food at half the price).hotel is clean and the staff is friendly.the el conquistador in fajardo is a much better resort

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: CNam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in November. Nothing to complain about, great views of planes coming in to land from one side hotel (cannot hear them though), view of beach and sea from other. Concierge was great, chased a few things up for us. On bus route to Old San Juan, supermarkets, restaurants and bars near by. Lovely pool and easy access to beach. IT system being upgraded when checked in but professional staff handled it well. Probably stay there again if we got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 4 days at the Intercontinental San Juan from 1/7 - 1/10/05. As much as I travel on business, I can tell you that I've never stayed anywhere that offered the level of personal service that we received here. We did not stay in the 'tower', but instead upgraded to one of the suites next to the pool. We literally walked out of our room and into the tropical pool area. The first night we dined at Ruth's Chris, which, if you've ever eaten there in other cities, you know that they make the greatest steaks around. We were not disappointed. On Saturday, my wife "demanded" that I go play golf somewhere while she laid by the pool and did absolutely nothing. Unfortunately for both of us, it rained on and off that entire day but it was still very relaxing for her, and I got to play a nice course (Rio Mar at the Westin Resort). That night we ate at Passagio's, their Italian restaurant on site. We were not that impressed, as our waiter was nowhere to be found most of the time, and spoke unintelligible English. On Sunday, with weather forecasts for skattered showers, we rented a car (through the concierge) and drove up Rt 187 which runs along the ocean. Very nice drive and you can even drive right up onto the beach and park for awhile. Sunday night we ate at Fontana De Roma, an Italian restaurant on top of the Howard Johnson's Hotel, about 8 blocks form the Intercontinental. Very nice place, 10th floor over looking everything, and the food was Excellent and the quantities were huge. Loved it. Sure enough, on Monday the sun came out without a cloud in the sky but we had some shopping to do for the kids so we couldn't really enjoy the great weather. Arrive at least 90-minutes before your flight because of their unusual way of checking bags. Not a big deal; just takes a long time. If you have the opportunity to work with Rosie at the Concierge, consider yourself fortunate. She is AWESOME. There's nothing she can't do for you. Also, look for Jose Rivera out front for taxi's and other advice...great guy. All in all, a wonderful stay and we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Cruise Ship Guests”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Refrigerator so you can shop across the street and eat breakfast and lunch in your room. Too many cruise ships use this hotel as a shore tour. Hotel guests have to reserve their pool chaises early or you will not get one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Great and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family recently returned from a 7-day stay at the Intercontinental over the holidays. Initally, a little apprehensive about the trip as we had never visited Puerto Rico. We were pleasantly surprised as the Intercontinental staff are very attentive and friendly. Initially, our room was not ready so we could not check in until 4:00 p.m. This gave us an opportunity to explore our surroundings. Rooms are small but clean. There were 3 of us (2 adults and 1 8-year old). They recommended a room with double beds which we later found out it would have been better to request a king size bed as those rooms come with a sleeper sofa. We stayed in an ocean view room which was nice, however, the mini suites are much nicer and do not cost that much more (we asked to see the mini and executive suites). We dined at Ruth Chris' and also had the breakfast buffet. Ruth Chris was excellent and the buffet was just ok-not worth a repeat. Pool area is very clean and was not crowded. Beach is nice, however, waves have lots of sand and water is very cloudy. We were told it was due to the time of year. Casino is small, however, we felt it was just enough and the staff in the casino were again friendly. All in all, we intend to return as the pace is slow, hotel is clean and people extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: grab18
Reviews.Content: We took our 3 children, 2 girls 17 and a 15 year old son for a week to the Intercontinental. We basically chose this hotel because the rates were more reasonable than the El San Juan and Ritz. We booked late and still caught a special where we got our second room at half price. We were extremely nervous about the property because the reviews on this web site were not encouraging. When we arrived, we were pleasantly suprised. The rooms were fine, clean, served the purpose. One night, the air conditioning made some noise. The Hotel staff was fixed the problem and then left a fruit basket in the room, for our troubles. The staff was extremley pleasant and accomodating. The food at the pool was o.k. and service a bit slow but it was very crowded, being Christmas week. Overall, I would not be afraid to book this hotel. The Ritz facility was much nicer but we were paying $200 a night less. The El San Juan was too much of a scene, but the kids liked to go at night. All in all , it was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BridgeSF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IC over the holidays because of the location, pool, and amenities. We were a bit nervous since there were some bad reviews about service. We only experienced great service. When we had one problem (very late room service) they not only gave us the room service for free but also gave us free lunch. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The rooms are attractive and clean. The view, beach, pool and bars are great. The food is what you would expect from a resort hotel. If you're a foodie go into old san juan for dinner. We thought the casino was nice because it was small and peaceful. This is a perfect hotel for just relaxing at the beach and pool yet conveniently located for taking a taxi into a town or a car to the rain forest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our six day Christmas trip in San Juan. We were nervous about the hotel, but very pleased. It is old, but has been redone in the last few years. It has local flavor which we liked. We found the hotel simple, yet very comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and always helpful. You are very near the airport and can hear the planes, but this did not bother us. A safe and mini fridge are in all rooms. We loved being close to a grocery and pharmacy for American basics. We walked all over and rented a car for a couple of days for fishing, diving and the rain forest. They were all incredible. The original walled Old San Juan and it's forts were amazing. Be patient the traffic to and from this tight area is heavy all the time. The cruise ships come in this area at times it becomes congested. The beach and pool area at the IC were perfect. The beach chairs and towels are free and they charge for umbrellas. We took our three children that are in college and they loved it. The casino is not good, but we were not interested and never even went inside. There is a wonderful bar and live music at the Old San Juan next door or try the Ritz two blocks down. Their pools and beach areas are nice but smaller. We will go back and maybe explore diving on the other side of the island. Everything moves at a slower pace there, be patient and enjoy. The only rude people we saw were other tourists. A great trip... many adventures or just sit and read by the pool or beach....Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marysue724
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I) just returned from the IC On Nov. 20th from a 7 day stay and I can truly say everything was wonderful. The staff are exceptional and the hotel is kept up morning, noon and night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying in a affordable, beautiful hotel right on the beach with anything u could possibly ask for. Rooms are large with a balcony and the grounds are the cleanest I've encountered any where. The Italian restaurant Passagio is fantastic. They have two other restaurants also a Ruth Chris' steak house and a japenese steakhouse. All I can say is that if you stay in the Intercontinental you will not be disappointed, we weren't!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: Bubbala
Reviews.Content: Everything was great here. Staff is excellent, very friendly and professional. Great service. Beach and pool areas are great. No complaints. Would stay here again. You should rent a car if you want to travel alot. It's a $16 taxi ride into Old San Juan. $10 from airport. Taxis are okay if you are planning to go into Old San Juan once or twice, but if you want to go frequently (like every night for dinner), rent a car. There are other places to go and visit nearby where you don't need a car, such as The Westin and other hotels closeby where there are bars, clubs and restaurants, if you want to go somewhere different than InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “relaxed at the intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: MITIJ
Reviews.Content: Jin, the front desk clerk,did everything to get us a very nice room with a very nice view. he succeeded. the beach was glorious and the staff was very pleasant and friendly, tho' my husband noted that once a staff member was not at their job, they were not very friendly, as opposed to what we find at other caribbean destinations, where smiles and hi are the norm. but at their posts they are a very friendly staff. the rooms are very nice, clean and modern, but very much a typical hotel room. our view from the 14th floor was awesome. we had breakfasts and lunches at the intercontinental. dinners we went next door to the el san juan. the italian restaurant was fabulous-we ate there 3 nights, lobster risotto was out of this world. the mexican restaurant was very good also-10th floor-and with thunder and lightening that night-we were graced with a fabulous light show. we also ate at metropol-a very good puerto rican restaurant. i would have gone back again, but we never had a chance. great island-but san juan proper wouldn't be my first choice with children. this was just a vacation for my husband and me-1st week in november

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Trude
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at the IC and can not understand what the previous post is talking about. Our vacation was great. We were never charged a mandatory bellman fee, have no idea what that is! The bellman were always at the door with a smile and friendly hello and always opened the door for us. Security, also, was not an issue for us. In fact, we ran the beach every morining and upon returning to the hotel, there was always a fresh towel and cold bottle of water waiting for us at the entrance from the beach. We were upgraded to an oceanview room (10th floor) and it was lovely. Balcony was a tad bit small but the view more than made up for it. Pool and beach were great. Drinks were a bit overpriced but really normal for any resort in the Carribean. Every meal we had there was delicious. We ate at several restaurants at the El San Juan and all were great. Staff at the IC were wonderful. ALways greeted you with a smile, and were more than willing to help in any way. Pool bar staff was great. Hi to Miguel and Danny and Rosie! I am sure that there are some people that have to find something to complain about no matter where they are. We found the whole experience to be great and look forward to our next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just don't get how anyone could write a bad review about this resort. Were we all at the same place? We stayed there Oct 24th-28th after a 7 day cruise. We thought it was so nice, much better than I expected after reading all the reviews. The only complaint I have is that the food is WAY overpriced and $5 for a beer is ridicules, other than that it was great. The pool and beach were beautiful and our room was much bigger than an average hotel room. It was a king ocean view room on the 12th floor - very nice. I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone going to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, horrible casino, HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental in San Juan was the worst experience I have ever had. About 30 of our friends all went down for a wedding and we all stayed at the hotel. You are charged a mandatory fee for bellmen that stand there chatting instead of opening the door for you. The casino is a JOKE. I dropped $1000 the first night there and had to BEG to get a drink. Then, they didn't want to give my wife a drink because she wasn't playing even though I was betting enough for both of us. The best thing was the dealers in the casino starting talking in spanish about us, and little did they know I speak spanish so I just sat and listened for a while. The security there will annoy the hell out of you. You can't leave your own hotel and come back in without being harrassed. If you go to the pool with one of there $5 can of cokes, they will make you throw it in the trash even though the rules poolside says NO GLASS, nothing about cans. Several of our friends were booked to stay there a week and paid a $250 fee to the airlines just so they could leave early. We will NEVER return there again. When we complained to the corp. office, we were told that they contacted the hotel and they "had no record" of any of this. How convenient. If you are looking for a HORRIBLE time, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: mringenoldus
Reviews.Content: I'm very confused by the previous review!! We just returned today from the Intercontinental. We found the hotel to be beautiful in all areas. The room was very large with a separate couch and chair sitting area. The pools looked wonderful and the grounds were well kempt. The beach was renting chairs for $3 but there were many nicely cushioned chaises around the pool and overlooking the beach at no cost. The hotels staff provided excellent service and, as I had prepaid, there were no additional charges to the excellent rate.

Reviews.Title: “loved the intercontinental and ive trvld all over the caribean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: to the travel agent above. what hotel did you stay at , i am an airline employee and i recived the same rate at this hotel 99.00per nght, and it was a 5 star hotel . the room that i stayed in was beautifully decorated , if anyone stayed at the westin in st.johns its the same rating. this hotel was top of the line......we loved it. just to let everyone know this was not even near motel 6 ,put it this way not even near a hilton.maybe you had an old room but our room was gorgeouse and the bathroom was magnificant. everything was spotless, we even had our sheets turned down for us before we went to bed by the maid...that stinks that you had to pay all that money and you didnt even like it,i thought it was worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The good news first. The pool area is wonderful with the palm trees, orchids, waterfall and security. I was disapointed with everything else! After requesting an early arrival (before 4:00 pm) and booking two double's with ocean view my elderly parents and I had to wait for three hours before they got my parents room ready. No ocean view and my room took another hour and a half. I requested a smoking room and received a non smoking, which was ok I could smoke on the terrace until the handle fell off the sliding glass door! The beds in both rooms on the 4th floor were old and the pillow's matched. The next morning my parents bathroom had water all over the marble floor. After almost an hour after reporting the problem I called the manager, Kayla. She gave them a king suite with an ocean view on the 11th floor and a free breakfast. (breakfast buffet for three was aprox. $60.00) She really tried to make it better; It waisted an entire day getting settled. I would definitely think twice before booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Terrible Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental in May 2004 for three days prior to our cruise that was departing San Juan on May12th. We had a "Club Level" poolside suite! It was no bigger than an average size hotel room. It had no bathtub, just a shower. The location of the room was great, but that was the only aspect of our stay that was great. On the first night, our A/C was not working, we called the front desk and they sent maintenance 2 hours later. He could not fix it, but he could not speak English either, we could not communicate with him, so we just showed him the door to please leave our room. We called back down to the desk and asked to be moved, they informed us in a very rude manner that the hotel was currently full. So, we suffered the heat for three nights, and made the best of our stay, we had no choice. The pool & beach were very nice areas. The beach had chairs and umbrellas that you could rent for $10 each. So $30 later, we were set up on the beach. Even though you pay extra for this service... We were still charged a $40 per day RESORT FEE at check out. I demanded to know what this covered, if it did not cover beach chairs or umbrellas. I was told that it was for security personnel b/c the resort was experiencing security problems. This was scary.... We ate at Ruth Chris', and it did not compare to any others we have eated at, the service was horrible, and food was no better than any other chain staekhouse. It was hard to eat lunch anywhere! The food places had very wierd operating hours. Lunch was terrible when we did find a place open, we ate the same cheeseburger three days in a row. There were no options!!! Overall, it was a very expensive, very over-priced, terrible, hot stay. I regret the day I ever booked this hotel. We are Platinum Priority Card holders and thought that this hotel chain was Holiday Inn's luxury hotel chain. But this was not the case. I have stayed at many other Holiday Inns that were so much better quality and a fraction of the cost. We had used a credit card to pay balance at check out. When I returned home, I did contested all charges, but the hotel would not credit anything back, even though our A/C did not work. I hoped that they would give me at the very least a partial credit for no A/C. I will never stay at an Intercontinental Hotel ever again, nor will I recommend it to friends and family. We travel 4 weeks a year to various places and have stayed in many hotels over the years, and this was by far was our worst stay ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: RKS
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Intercontinental Hotel the night before and the night following a cruise out of San Juan. I really enjoyed the pool/beach area and the Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. Very nice property!

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a great view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental from August 26 -30 my room had a view to die for pretty blue water and that's what you need living in New York City. Overall the staff was very helpful with the expection of the valet staff. (you would think that the people that greet you upon entering the hotel would be pleasant). My overall experience was great. I would recommend this hotel to all of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Experience at the InterContinental San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from an exceptional stay at the InterContinental San Juan (8/17-8/25). The hotel was lovely and very well maintained. It was worth it to forfeit the city view junior suite that was originally reserved for a room on the 14th floor with a magnificent ocean view. The pool area is beautiful and relaxing, with access to a pristine beach just steps away. Dining at the hotel is excellent. The breakfast buffet at La Terraza is wonderful and worth waking up for. For dinner, Passagio is highly recommended with a lobster ravioli entree that is outstanding. The entire staff is professional, courteous, and attentive to every detail. Elaine and Victor at the front desk are welcoming and accomodating to every need. Samantha, a server in the pool area is delightful. However, Miguel, the manager of La Terraza deserves the most recognition. He is amazingly kind and helpful and truly an asset to the hotel. Puerto Rico was absolutely beautiful and I would love to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great facilities, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: quovadismax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental from 8/21 to 8/24. On our arrival we received great service from the concierges on duty. Both of them helped in getting an excellent room for us. We began with Nestor who worked so hard to help us and were joined by his associate who did his utmost to help us out. We were pleased with all aspects of the hotel. Some are mentioned in previous reviews listed before. The lagoon like pool with the beach after is a real plus. All staff were attentive from security to the valet parking. We did not eat at the hotel as we were interested in local less expensive cuisine. There are many places in the area. One in particular run by people from San Juan was called Mi Casita. It is across the street from the hotel and offered breakfast specials for $ 2.50 and reasonably priced dinners in the afternoon. Open 7 am. - 4 p.m. If you choose to see more of Puerto Rico I would suggest renting a car and visiting Luquillo beach and El Yunque rain forest. About an hour or so on Route 26 East from the hotel area. We also made the drive south to Ponce on route 52. It took about 1 1/2 hours from San Juan. There is a free trolley tour that leaves every half hour or so from the Plaza Delicias in the center of old Ponce. The people there, as is true of most of Puerto Rico, were very friendly and proud of their city. On the trolley we met a retired policeman who enriched our trip by telling us so much about Ponce and its history. He wasn't a guide but rather taking the tour with his grandson. We met so many helpful people like him on the trip. While in San Juan you may want to take advantage of the ferry to Catano. It cost fifty cents. Not a bad price for a ride across San Juan Bay. Once you get to Catano you can take a cab for about two dollars per person to the Bacardi Rum plant for a free tour. Of course they promote it endlessly but at the end you get two free drinks and the tour is fun. The ferry leaves from Pier 2. This is the pier before the cruise ship terminal. There is a parking garage in back of the bus terminal nearby. I would not hesitate to return to San Juan, the hotel was great and the people were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disagree with Florida traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I also just returned from a vaction at the InterContinental hotel and it does not even compare with the El San juan. The pool at El San Juan is so beautiful compared to to the dirty pool at the Intercontinental. I too was very annoyed with staff members. The El San Juan is a very classy hotel that is why proper attire is required in order to enter the casino. At the Intercontinental you can gamble with your bikini on. Funny how 2 people have different reviews that stayed at the same place. Wonder why????????

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Lvega718
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just retruned from a 5 day stay at te Intercontinental. We were a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews but after our experience I would not only stay there again, I would recommend the hotel to anyone interested in staying in Isla Verde. The rooms are average size / decor but very clean. Terraces are very small but the the view was spectacular. The staff was extremely friendly (with the exception of one person by the pool who was INCREDIBLY rude!) and willing to help you with anything. The pool and beach were clean and beautiful. Security guards were constantly making rounds but they were also extremely friendly and not a nuisance at all. The dress code was a little strict but nothing to complain about. There is a lower level that will take you right to the pool which alleviates this problem. The drinks were great, you must try a Voodoo Juice (delicious!). Can't give much of an opinion about the food other than it was expensive. However, if you're looking to eat real Puerto Rican food like we were you'll probabably skip the hotel returants all together.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 night visit to San Juan . We stayed at the Intercontinential and overall it was a great experience. The resort itself was very nice and atmosphere was great. The pools were big and nice. I loved the rocks waterfall and the hot tub. It was just a big pool. There are no kiddy pool but the water was just 3'6" so it wasn't so bad. There were plenty of cushion chairs all over the swimming area. The beach was beautiful and clean. There was security which I thought was tight and a great idea. You had to wear a wrist band (which is a different color everyday) to go to the pool or beach. You also will need that to get towels. The service was great, especially the concierge. I got to meet Nester, which was a pleasure. He was very helpful and he's probably reading this (Hi Nester, I'm the lady that you helped on my birthday and told you about this website! by the way, Happy Belated Bday to you also!). Nestor was very helpful in helping me getting another room. I saw his name badge and told him how I heard about him and about this website. The other lady with the short brown hair and the chief concierge (which I didn't get names)were all very helpful and great with giving us directions. So I thought the concierge was exceptional! The bellman and the valet parking guys were great too. They opened the doors for you and made you feel like royalty. I had to kids with us and they were very nice about it. Although, I would say that this is definitely not a kid friendly hotel. My boy was playing in the lobby and the head security guy had to come get us to take him away. The pools close at 7pm which I thought was pretty early compare to the resorts in the US. It gets pretty dark early there also. The casino was small but had all the tables. There was also poker tournaments being held weekly (I think). I went during the day and the way they played blackjack is so different from casinos here. The dealer only get one card which he flips for us to see, but he doesn't get a second card until the entire table is done so it's so hard to win. My husband said at night they play the regular blackjack way..so I'm all confused. Oh the dealers do not smile or talk or even say hi to you. They are like a standing robot..no emotions at all!! The dealers that I had forgot to flip her cards a few tiimes and we had to remind her and they even hit for you not evening seeing if you want to hit or not. .it's an automatic thing.. how funny My only complaint is the rooms was on the small side especially the bathroom and the bedspread had fuzz balls all over it, so do not sleep on it! I'm not sure if it has ever been cleaned! There are many restaurants in walking distant: BK, pizza hut, wendy's, KFC, churches, dominos, ponderosa, and many others if you don't want to eat at the hotel. I must say if you are a wing lover like I am, try the "baseballl wings" at Lupis which is just past Wydham El San Juan hotel. It's really reasonalbe priced and good. A lot of people do not speak English so make sure you know what you're ordering and where you're going. We had trouble with the language barrier. Old San Juan is a must see..very beautiful but had problem parking. It's a pain to find parking space and the driving lane is BAD!!! so be careful. It's so tight and they are really bad drivers. The rainforest is also a must see.. make sure you have tennis and ready to walk. Overall, we will return one day again. The hotel was nice with exception the rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort was FANTASTIC! The place was just beautiful. People were so friendly and kind. They made you feel like one big family. We went to the Ritz Carlton to check it out and it wasn't as nice as the intercontinental. It was so stark in it's gardens. The outside was plain, MUCH smaller beach than ours. By far the intercontinental was much nicer. Always security around but you didn't notice them. I would go back in a heatbeat. I have been to MANY islands and this is on the top of my list. Much to see and do there. Great pool, restaurants. You MUST make this a place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Italianprincess85
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Puerto Rico and the Inter-Continental hotel. We had a shaky start to out visit when our toilet overflowed, but the hotel took care of that immediately and moved us to an even better room. The next day they brought my husband and I a tray of cheese and fruit with crackers and a bottle of wine for the trouble we had the day before. That was a very nice touch and really impressed us. All the grounds of the hotel are beautiful and clean. The pool and beach are wonderful and so was the spa where we got massages. Our only complaint was the entertainment in Puerto Rico. They don't play anything but Salsa and that can get boring after a while. We like all different kinds of music and just hearing salsa all the time really bored us. We also would have liked to have seen a show, but there are no shows of any kind in Puerto Rico. I asked and the only answer I was given was go next door to the El San Juan and watch the salsa contest. That was not what we wanted to see. I think all of Puerto Rico could benefit by adding some kind of shows to their hotels for the entertainment of guests because not everyone is a fan of salsa or wants to listen to it constantly. As for the restaurant MiCasita that I heard so many things about. Well my husband ordered the mofongo to try and it was just terrible. Even the octupus salad he ordered was terrible. Thank god I got shrimp because you can't ruin shrimp that much. I would not recommend Mi Casita to anyone we both thought it was terrible and my husband will eat anything and he didn't eat that mofongo. Stick to the restaurants in the hotel they are terrific. We ate at Passagio and the food was so good that you wanted to lick you plate. Just stay away from MiCasita across the street. Old San Juan was quaint and cute and we bought some jewelry and souveneirs there and enjoyed the history so that is a place to see. Sorry we couldn't be more positive about Puerto Rico and this has nothing to do with the hotel because it is first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the IC in late June. Hotel is very nice and is minutes from the airport. The airplanes are not that close to be noisy. Hotel has a Ruth Chris which we went to and was excellant. We also tried the Japanese restaurant for sushi which was also good. The pool is large and very nice with a swim up bar. The beach is right off the pool and is really nice. You can walk next door about 100 yards to the Wyndham El San Juan. They have 4 or 5 excellant restaurants including The Palm. Overall one of the nicest hotels we saw in PR. If I went back I would stay at the IC or El San Juan. Be carefull there are other Wyhdhams in PR, you want the El San Juan, not the Condado!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, pleasant place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2004. All around a very pleasant stay. Swim up bar and general pool area is clean and attractive. The beach is not the best, but that is due to the hotel's location in Isla Verde. The rooms are small but cozy, with nice looking furniture and a small terrace. The casino is small, but adequate for the hotel guests. Casino equipment is ill maintained, particularly the video poker machines, which are in short supply, and half of them don't work. There is food, ashes, cigarette butts, and some garbage on the machines and the surrounding area. Definitely need to clean up the casino. The staff is pleasant. My only complaint is the $75 hold put on my credit card per room in case I incurred any charges during my stay, that I would not have money with which to cover at the end of my stay. My credit card was close to max, and the pre-charge took me over the max, preventing me from making purchases on the card. Had I been forewarned, I would have taken another card. Beachside restaurant food was nice but a bit pricey (their $12, so-called 1/4 pound hamburger is closer to 1/8 of a pound). Also, too many mosquitos. If you rent a car, the parking for the hotel is across the street and it's $10 per day. Lots of inexpensive eating options in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Puerto Rico resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is best for those who are light sleepers (noisy given the airport), rise early, and spend most of the day at the pool, beach, or fitness center. These hotel attributes are wonderful, and the pool is one of the better ones I've encountered in my travels. The gym equipment is not exactly new, but the view of the beach compensates for their age. The room is standard with no frills, but that is fine if you are out at the pool or Old San Juan anyway. The staff is not rude, but they are also not generally friendly or accommodating (I have no complaints or general complements). I got a good rate, and, at a similar rate, would stay there again. Interesting note: An elderly couple staying at the Wyndham wished to see our room for a future stay in San Juan. They said the room was nice, and commented that the IC rooms are much newer than the rooms in the Wyndham. I have heard much about the need for the Wyndham next door to refurbish and modernize their room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I statyed at the Intercontinental with my family of 8 from June 19 through the 26th and we could not have had a more wonderful experience. Before we even arrived at the hotel, I contacted the hotel directly and requested rooms facing the ocean on the same floor and we received them. By calling the hotel directly, I was also able to get a terrific rate for one of their suites for me and my wife. I also spoke to the conceirge, Nestor, before we arrived and he was able to arrange for a van for us for the week (somethig I recommend if you paly golf-Dorado is 30 minutes west) or sight seeing ( The rain forest and old San Juan). The staff was great; the casino intimate; and the food good. Ruth Chis's was ok; the japanese place fun. I have four kids ages 18 through 22 who found the night life great in the Isla Verde section. The property is secure and safe; the rooms (we were on the 16th-top floor) clean and nicely decorated; the pool and beach area fantastic (plenty of chairs); and the fitness center, steam and suana more than adequate. Tip: Try the spa. Great thing about the hotel was it was across the street from a market so we saved money on soda etc; and were able to walk to nearby restraunts where the food was excellent. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “No major complaints here”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last summer. The positives seemed to outweigh the negatives for us. Negatives...the lobby furniture was rather worn, and needs to be updated. Food was just a little pricey, but not outrageous. The hotel is located near the airport, so you can hear the roar of plane engines as they take off. Neutral...the room was neither horrible, nor fantastic. It was an average room you might get at a Westin, Crown Plaza, Hilton, etc. Positives....beautiful pool area with swim-up bar. We found the beach to be immaculate when we were there, along with feeling safe. The food was pretty good (not spectacular, but not horrible either). We found the staff to be friendly. Overall, while the Wyndam also looked nice, we wouldn't hesitate to return here either.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. The staff was friendly and helpfull. Check in and check out was easy and quick. The rooms were clean and large, and the pool was awesome. I will defenitaly stay at this hotel next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disagree with Brooklyn reviewer”
Reviews.Author: dej
Reviews.Content: I have to disagree with the Brooklyn review. Were we staying at the same hotel??? We knew ahead of time that the taxes are 20%, something you should have asked prior to your reservations. They are not hidden charges if you do your homework and ask in advance. We thought the staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful. Infact, we kept saying thru out our stay how friendly everyone was that worked there. The concierge, Nestor, was the best. We used our Priority Points and were upgraded upon check in to Ocean front room. He gave us maps and directions to all of our sightseeing destinations. We had an extended check out also. We thought the pool was clean and the drink staff and security around the pool were very friendly. WE had a birthday dinner for my husband at Ruth's Chris was was astounding, food and service was excellent. There is also another good restaurant called Passagio and we were given VIP service. We walked over to the El San Juan and weren't too impressed with the decor, very dark. We weren't allowed into the casino because we were too casual??? We did eat at both restaurants on the 10th floor at the El San Juan, very good and casual. Drinks are expensive and so is food, but that comes with vacationing. I don't know why you think El San Juan is excellent, it seemed average to us. We thought the Intercontinental was by far the nicest hotel in Isla Verde and The Ritz was nice too. Funny how we had different reviews for the same hotel, same time. Wonder why?

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used Priority Club Points for a stay last week. We were pleasantly suprised by the quality of the hotel. Our checkin was smooth and wre were given a ocean front room on the 11th floor. The room was clean and nicely furnished with a King size bed and a fold out couch. Teh small balcony was large enough for one of us to sit. We spent most of our time on the beach and by the pool sipping rum runners and pina coladas. There was no fee for using the beach chairs or towells as someone reported earlier. We did not find the wristbands to be of any hindrance. In fact, we like dthe fact that they kept outsiders from wandering into the pool area. The beaches were clean and we were not hasseled by vendors, although there were plenty of folks offering drinks and other refreshements. Directly across the street from th ehotel is a small shopping center with all of the necessities, a supermarket, Subway, gift shop, and a nice cafe, Mi Casista, for an economical breakfast. I was able to but beer at teh supermarket and using a small cooler, drink it poolside or on the beach with no hassles. This was a great way to keep the spending down (Especially at $5/beer or $8-10 for a frozen cocktail). The pool waitresses were excellent, especially Rosie. We did not eat any meals at the hotel restraunts. We had a nice dinner at The Palm at the ESJ and anoth night ate at the Japanese Resturant at ESJ. Both were good though pricey. We also ate one night at Lupi's Mexican Place down the street and it was of good quality and we enjoyed the outdoor dining. We usually ate leftovers or Subway for lunch. Did not spend any time in the IC casino, but did manage to lose a few bucks at the ESJ casino. The ESJ is definitell more hapening at night and we would people watch in the lobby. At the sugestion of Jozell, the excellent consierge, we went on a kayaking trip to see the bioluminescent bay at Cabeza de San Juan. It was memorable experience and well worth the $70/person. The forts at Old San Juan were nice, but the area itself was too much like Charleston, Savanah, or new Orleans to be unique to us. We would definitely go back to San Juan and the Intercontintal again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Isla Verde Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissyf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental over Memorial Day weekend and it was great. The oceanfront/poolfront rooms are an adequate size, although the bathroom is tiny. The pool area is very nice - with both covered and sunny areas - perfect if you want to keep your kids in the shade while you catch some rays. Although not really advertised on their website, there is a decent oceanfront fitness area and a spa, where both my husband and I enjoyed our treatments. The only restaurants we tried were the Ciao Mediterrean Cafe and Momoyama (japanese). The service at the Ciao Cafe was horribly slow every single time we ate there, although the food was fine for poolside/beachside. It is especially nice to get a drink at the cafe (which is right on the beach) at sunset. The sushi from Momoyama was delicious, albeit pricey. We also tried Mi Casita across the street for very cheap breakfasts. The casino was smaller than the Wyndham El San Juan but perfect for light gamblers - and the slot machines at IC really do pay - I won $750 at the IC slots!! The Wyndham El San Juan is right next door and the Italian restaurant La Picola Fontina was terrific. The Wyndham El San Juan is quite a scene on the weekends and it was great fun to visit the lobby bar and people watch. But the weekend bar crowd at the El San Juan was a bit rowdy - with the partying going on all night and some people actually sleeping at the El San Juan pool area. We were very happy to retreat back to the IC after visiting the El San Juan scene. The security at IC was very effective and would not have allowed revelers to sleep overnight at the IC pool. We thought IC was a good choice for families even though it didn't really have a kiddie pool - only a very shallow end of the regular pool. No one charged us for towels or chairs and there did not seem to be any 8am rush to reserve pool chairs. There was ample supply of chairs. We had our nicest meal at Ramiro's in Condado where the food and service was the most fantasic I have had in a long while. The staff at Ramiro's was so accomodating it was incredible. We arrived at the restaurant and our 13 month old baby was sleeping and, of course, we had left our stroller in our hotel room. The host offered us a semi-private room and actually made a cushioned bed on the floor (with mutiple fine tableclothes) for the baby to sleep while we ate. When the baby woke up, the host brought a real highchair - not one of those wooden generic highchairs, but the type of high chair you'd have in your home. The waiters at Ramiro's were also excellent - suggesting many off-the-menu options and were amenable to all sorts of specific food requests (low salt/low carb/no dairy). If you visit San Juan, definitely stop in Ramiro's for an unforgettable meal. We also visited El Yunque (the rainforest) which was about an hour away. We rented a car and drove ourselves. It was very beautiful, but I would recommend sneakers or other shoes with great traction and absolutely no strollers - the whole hike was extremely slippery. We took the baby in a baby backpack carrier on the shortest hike to La Mina Falls - which was very scenic and about 35 mins down and 25 mins back up. Renting a car was a good choice for us as it can be $15 each way to Condado or Old San Juan, which adds up fast. The valet parking at IC was not cheap though - $16/night. The hotel boasts onsite Avis car rental, but the Avis station was really offsite - you had to take shuttle bus to rent a car so it was not as convenient as it sounded. Still, the concierge and staff at IC were very helpful. We will definitely return to IC.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental was a great vacation getaway. My husband and I just returned from our anniversary trip and we had a great time. The hotel was nice, clean, and had all of the amenities. We enjoyed the pool and beach areas. The casino was not as nice as we expected, but we played long enough to receive comps for most of the meals that we consumed during the trip. We walked next door to the Wyndham to party and gamble a few times because it was definitely more lively over there. However, we enjoyed our hotel when we just wanted to relax.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, so so beach front”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice, must visit old san juan, ruth's chris is expensive but worth every penny, beach had too many people selling things - got sick of saying "not interested" Taxi rides will blow your mind! Beach had a lot of washed up weed and wasn't as nice as Cancun. I never paid for towels, beach use or chair use??? We booked hotel and airfare for 350 a person for 3 nights from Maine on site59, great deal for the money, would go back for under 500 a person air/hotel. Food directly across the street is good and inexpensive, breakfast for 3-4 dollars, lunch 5-6 bucks. Hotel breakfast is 18+ each.
